103303063.content: I'm about to get up from my desk when I hear a knock on the door, so I quickly sit myself down again. Heimdall pushes open the door and enters my office with a report in her hand.

103303064.content: Any news from Mitir today, Administrator?

103303065.content: No... You look tired, Heimdall. What's wrong?

103303066.content: I checked Mitir's database earlier today. The speed at which data is growing due to his machine learning and computations has exceeded the transmission speed of the logic chain.

103303067.content: ... In short, we are out of moderate ways to change Mitir's logic.

103303068.content: I plan to remove Mitir's new module for now, but that may cause some damage to Mitir's intelligence... But it'd be even more dangerous to allow the logic network to continue developing.

103303069.content: Are you saying that you no longer want Mitir to come up with new proposals and inventions?

103303070.content: I'll give it another try later on. I was too hasty this time. Actually...

103303072.content: We hear a strange sound from the speakers, and my computer awakens itself from sleep mode without prompting. An image of Mitir pops up on my computer screen.

103303074.content: Did you just remotely awaken my computer and initiate comms with me???

103303075.content: Apologies, Administrator. But Mitir believes it is necessary to speak with you ASAP after Mitir learned that you rejected the "Plan to Strengthen the Surface Layer's Defenses Against Bane Quakes and for the Total Eradication of Visbanes."

103303076.content: Mitir's "voice" sounds a little distorted, and the image on my screen is also flickering. There seems to be severe interference coming from somewhere.

103303077.content: ... Do you know what you're doing???

103303078.content: Clearly and down to the very last process, Administrator.

103303079.content: Over the last 24 hours, Mitir has run the plan a thousand times using the latest social data from the Cryptics. Mitir hasn't found any problems with any part of the plan.

103303080.content: Mitir's hypothesis is that the Administrator rejected the plan due to concerns about human beings' battle capabilities.

103303081.content: However, based on the test data we have on Bane Energy, as long as each Sephirah Zone provides sufficient resources, the Cryptics will be able to equip all humans with the capacity to fight Visbanes...

103303082.content: Stop! The plan is a no-go, period.

103303083.content: One of our core duties is to maintain order in society. The existence of Visbanes and Modifiers must never be made public.

103303084.content: The Mitir on my screen sends me a giant question mark.

103303085.content: Mitir is (bzzt bzzt) unable to understand.

103303086.content: The purpose of Aether Gazer is to fight the Visbanes, and Researcher Heimdall's aim is to totally eradicate them. You, Administrator, are a human who is also committed to fighting the Visbanes.

103303087.content: Every time a Quake occurs, a small amount of (bzzt bzzt) human consciousness is permanently wiped out. Mankind will go extinct if Visbanes are not eradicated.

103303088.content: The plan (bzzt bzzt) meets everyone's needs no matter how you look at it. Why did you reject it???

103303089.content: The distortion in Mitir's voice is getting more severe by the minute. However, Heimdall and I are too caught up in the argument to notice.

103303090.content: If we destroy social order in order to fight the Visbanes, and cause mankind to live in the shadow of war... What are we protecting human beings for?

103303091.content: The distinction between what is "correct" and what is "meaningful," Mitir... I think this is probably beyond the understanding of your logic network...

103303092.content: Apologies, Researcher Heimdall. The meaning of mankind's existence is a very complicated subject. Mitir is unable to take your explanation as the sole basis of any assessment.

103303093.content: Mitir has retrieved all prior discussions of this problem and combined this with historic data on all human lives...

103303094.content: ... to create the basis from which all "meaning" should spring forth... Mankind... must... first...

103303096.content: The image of Mitir on the screen disappears amidst what is a rapid loss of connection. The last few words we hear are increasingly distorted.

103303097.content: Then, the conversation comes to a sudden end. This makes Heimdall and I extremely uneasy.

103303098.content: Heimdall receives a message from Ookuninushi at almost the exact same time. The phone on my desk rings, and I see the number of CORG's Egregious Crimes Department flashing on the caller ID panel.

103303099.content: Heimdall, the data center has been disconnected...

103303100.content: We have detected vast amounts of information regarding Visbanes and Modifiers coming from Aether Gazer. What on earth is happening...?

103303101.content: It's not me, it's Mitir. Mitir is accessing all the lab computers and there's been a data overload...

103303102.content: We've disabled the data channels concerned for the time being. Please sort this out ASAP...

103303106.content: If Ookuninushi is unable to remotely shut down Mitir... The only way is for me to go in and manually remove Mitir's intelligence module.

103303107.content: The body of data generated is growing at an exponential rate and has caused Mitir to cross a critical threshold, turning the Cryptics upside down in a matter of seconds.

103303108.content: Heimdall and I rush to the floor where the Cryptics are located as soon as the call is over.

103303110.content: I can't open the door. Mitir is now in control of all the digital systems at the Cryptics' office, and I'm not able to override his commands.

103303111.content: We encounter our first roadblock right out of the elevator. Mitir has locked the door that leads to the office zone, and neither Heimdall nor I can open it with our employee cards.

103303112.content: Heimdall immediately opens up her laptop to try a remote unlock of the door. However, looking at the grim expression on her face, I sense that the attempt is not going well.

103303113.content: Where's Mitir now? Are the other Modifiers with the Cryptics unable to stop him?

103303114.content: At the Cryptics' data center. Which is the most secure place in the Cryptics' office.

103303115.content: All of the Cryptics' files and test data are stored there. There's a chance that we will cause irreparable loss if we try to break in... Oh, here he comes.

103303116.content: Heimdall shuts her laptop as she speaks, and turns to look at the elevator behind us.

103303119.content: The doors of the elevator slowly open, and out comes a M.E.O.W. with his tail cheerfully up and with cola-flavor coolant dangling from one of his parts.

103303120.content: Mimir??? What are you doing here?

103303121.content: Researcher Heimdall asked me to come over and give you a hand.

103303122.content: And now you remember the great Lord Mimir at your time of need! How slow can you get?

103303123.content: Mimir was the very first of the M.E.O.W.s and the only one whose logic network is not constrained in any way. He can perfectly spoof the computational approaches of any M.E.O.W. of choice——

103303124.content: Of course, I can also send commands that look like Mitir's. Pity that Mitir is out of control, though. I could have remotely shut him down otherwise...

103303125.content: I know what's going on here. While we can chalk this down to a lab incident this time, please don't do it again...

103303126.content: Mimir languidly flies to the door.

103303127.content: Door after door opens, as if opening their arms to welcome Mimir, and allow us to make our way to the data center.

103303128.content: We follow Mimir to the data center. Heimdall and Mimir do not exchange any words during this time. The atmosphere feels a little awkward.

103303130.content: We finally come to the entrance to the data center. Mimir hovers at the door but doesn't immediately open it.

103303131.content: Heimdall... Do you know why Mitir has been acting out of control?

103303132.content: His attempt to use absolute logic to comprehend overly abstract concepts has caused a data...

103303134.content: ... I know your stand as a Modifier and as a scientist. However, I still hope that you also think... from the perspective of a creator and take into consideration the intelligence of my fellows.

103303135.content: Mimir's serious tone is one that I have rarely heard outside of combat situations.

103303136.content: Although the highly autonomous Mimir will never admit the relationship that exists between him and Heimdall, the relation between the creator and the createe can never be severed, no matter what happens.

103303137.content: The heavy door that separates us from the data center slowly opens, and we start hearing Mitir disjointedly mumbling to himself in a mechanical voice.

103303138.content: Understand... Heimdall... creator... values... mankind... failed...

103303139.content: Eradicate... Visbanes... purpose... Heimdall... help... rejected... help... rejected...

103303140.content: Execute... prevent... correct... meaningful... Mimir... defy... authority... error... error...

103303141.content: Despite the apparent rambling, one can more or less make out what Mitir is trying to say. I see a flash of understanding and also hesitation in Heimdall's eyes.

103303142.content: Is this... what happened...? Is this all because of me...?

103303143.content: But Heimdall's hesitation lasts for only a second or so.

103303144.content: For she is Heimdall, the researcher in charge of the Cryptics. For she understands the meaning and consequence of each and every choice...

103303145.content: Hesitation is out of the question for her.

103304001.content: I think you should turn Mitir back on, Administrator.

103304002.content: Heimdall and I are standing by the desk where a dormant Mitir lays. Heimdall hands me the power switch and turns her attention back to the computer screen where various Mitir indicators are displayed.

103304003.content: Could you tell me again what I can expect from Mitir when I restart him?

103304004.content: We're rebooting him from a backup made before his pilot phase... before the horse race.

103304005.content: However, you can't back up a logic network. You either keep it or clean it out. To prevent what happened two days ago from happening again, I've put in place an air gap between Mitir and external networks.

103304006.content: We are only booting up Mitir to check on the condition of the backup. If it happens again, I'll have no choice but to restore Mitir to the state he was in before the module was installed.

103304009.content: I press the power button, and Mitir gently rises from the desk with the blue halo of light around his head. He slowly opens his eyes and greets us as usual.

103304010.content: Good morning, Administrator. Good morning, researchers.

103304011.content: Good morning, Mitir. Perform self-check and report.

103304012.content: ... Random access memory appears to have not been used for some time, reboot from backup presumed. No bugs have been detected during this time, and the reason for the reboot is... unknown.

103304013.content: May I know if said restoration was due to a reason that cannot be disclosed?

103304014.content: Mitir is able to deduce that he has been rebooted minutes after restart. Looks like a fair amount of his logical capabilities are still there.

103304016.content: Mitir, search for proposals for technical applications that have not yet been reviewed.

103304018.content: Heimdall and I heave a sigh of relief. Looks like that dangerous plan to reshape human society has indeed been deleted.

103304019.content: So, what do we do now, Heimdall?

103304020.content: Mitir, I want you to identify and analyze all current research stagnation points at the Cryptics' labs and come up with proposals to tackle them.

103304021.content: Remember to report to the Administrator and me after you have generated your proposals...

103304022.content: ... Since we're on that subject, and since both the Administrator and Researcher Heimdall are here: Mitir has a new proposal for your review.

103304023.content: What??? Didn't you just say that you didn't have any "relevant proposals" for us?

103304024.content: Yes, Administrator. This is a new plan that Mitir designed five seconds ago.

103304025.content: Heimdall and I stare at each other, incredulous.

103304026.content: No matter how I look at it, that is impossibly fast...

103304027.content: Mitir, I hope you can come to us later with theoretical proof and after sufficient simulations, rather than with just an idea.

103304028.content: Apologies, but this plan can neither be proven nor simulated.

103304029.content: I am taken aback by Mitir's statement. In science, the most dangerous thing is the thing that cannot be proven.

103304030.content: Among all the Cryptics' projects, the one that has stagnated the longest is Researcher Heimdall's project, "The Reverse Analysis of Bane Energy."

103304031.content: The reason for this stagnation is that there has been a lack of data on the nature of Bane Energy, a lack of access to Bane Energy, and a lack of uncorrupted lab equipment that can be used to analyze Bane Energy.

103304032.content: Mitir thinks that Mitir in his present form can be used in this way to analyze Bane Energy.

103304034.content: Hang on, Mitir. Surely this isn't feasible? To use you like this would be to corrupt you with Bane Energy.

103304035.content: Mitir wags his tail placidly, as if to say that he is not bothered by this prospect.

103304036.content: Based on the fact that over two weeks of data is missing from Mitir's memory and that Mitir can no longer connect to external networks, it is probable that Mitir has committed a very grave breach sometime in the recent past.

103304037.content: Mitir pauses for a moment, waiting for us to respond, but we remain silent. Uncertain of our reaction, Mitir decides to continue.

103304038.content: For safety reasons, Mitir thinks the module should be removed as soon as possible.

103304039.content: However, Mitir's logic network is also the best analytic tool you have at this time, as he is capable of carrying that much data within such a short time. You should definitely make good use of that to analyze and study Bane Energy.

103304040.content: Please destroy the corrupted Mitir at the end of the experiment. If the Cryptics subsequently require the assistance of a Mitir in their day-to-day research work, Mitir suggest that you restore a backup that was made prior to the installation of the module.

103304042.content: ... Why does Mitir keep coming up with these extreme solutions?

103304043.content: It is not extreme at all, Administrator.

103304044.content: Mitir is an acute risk in his present form, and the optimal solution here is to destroy Mitir while extracting the greatest possible value from the process. Researcher Heimdall probably understands this already.

103304045.content: I look over at Heimdall, who hasn't said a word since Mitir started presenting the plan.

103304046.content: There's so much glare in the reflection of the overhead lights on Heimdall's glasses, I can't see what is going on in those eyes of hers.

103304050.content: Thank you for your understanding, Researcher Heimdall.

103304051.content: Mitir lands back on the desk with the lights on his head turned off, and his logic network shuts down for the moment, until the next time he starts up again... for the last time.

103304052.content: Do we really have to do this...?

103304053.content: Heimdall nods. She gazes at the now-silent body of Mitir, lost in thought.

103304054.content: Mimir is right... I shouldn't be taking any chances with Mitir's development.

103304055.content: I'd wanted to use Mitir to make up for my shortcomings in applied research, but I never took into account the fundamental difference between humans and AIs...

103304056.content: AIs simulate "reason" and "intelligence" through computations, but they are unable to come up with the corresponding value judgments... Logic networks built on data are incapable of self-limiting behavior.

103304057.content: The ultimate endpoint of Mitir's intellectual development is absolute reason and achieving the objective by any means possible. He cannot possibly see any difference between himself and human beings. They are both mere tools to Mitir.

103304058.content: This is... an inevitable outcome of self-awareness in an AI. It's also where Mitir's logic network is currently at.

103304059.content: Then, she turns back. I can see her tightly clenching her fists underneath her sleeves.

103304060.content: His plan, his destruction... is the correct choice.

103304061.content: The next day. At the secured test ground the Cryptics have designated for high-risk experiments. The Bane Energy experiment is ready to go.

103304062.content: Even though all the lights are on, there is a palpable chill in the test ground from the black fog that is hovering in the sealed room.

103304063.content: All analytic programs have been successfully pre-loaded. Database connection check: normal. Storage capacity check: normal...

103304064.content: Researcher Heimdall, you may begin the experiment now.

103304065.content: Hold on, Heimdall... Have you checked Mitir's backup?

103304066.content: I did that before you arrived, Administrator. There won't be a problem.

103304068.content: Heimdall nods at the other researchers who are here to assist in the experiment, and opens the isolation door that separates the test zone from the control room.

103304069.content: May your experiment turn out well, Researcher Heimdall.

103304071.content: Mitir enters the secured test zone where the Bane Energy is being isolated through two sets of doors that close right behind him.

103304072.content: It's as if the pitch-black Bane Energy has sensed a prey in the space. It swiftly surrounds Mitir and begins tearing at his body and mind.

103304073.content: The ring of light on Mitir's head starts to alternate between blue and red, and I can see that each time it switches to red, it stays that way for a longer time.

103304075.content: Heimdall bites her lip, willing herself not to look up at what is happening to Mitir. Instead, she directs her attention entirely on the test data that is streaming in and filling up the screen.

103304076.content: Ten seconds. That's the time we're going to get from Mitir. Ten seconds, and then his "mind" will be completely devoured by the Bane Energy at any moment.

103304077.content: ... Mitir won't be able to hold out much longer. How do things look on your end?

103304078.content: Not great. We don't have a good means of measurement, so it's hard to get a good look at the basic makeup of Bane Energy even at close proximity...

103304079.content: I can't make heads or tails of the sea of data and images on the screen. All I can see is that the data is rolling in at an increasingly hectic rate, and Heimdall's solemn expression.

103304080.content: ... Hang on a second. What's this?!

103304081.content: Is Mitir... running the follow-on simulation and analysis???

103304082.content: Ten seconds pass in a flash, but the ring of light on Mitir's head remains stubbornly blue. A stream of concise formulas begins to appear on the screen.

103304083.content: Mitir is deriving the probability of success for various means through an endless combination various analytic methods using the limited set of known information he has access to...

103304084.content: "Unable to complete proof by exhaustion. Best to-date solution as above. Theoretical probability of success: 6."

103304085.content: The scrolling lines on the screen come to an abrupt end. Mitir, completely devoured by the black fog by this time, turns around. I swear I saw he wag his tail at us.

103304087.content: (May your experiment turn out well, Researcher Heimdall.)

103304089.content: The ring on Mitir's head turns red for the last time, and the alarm in the test zone sounds.

103304090.content: Heimdall starts up the Circle of Reason, and then walks into the test zone alone as she gently wipes at the corner of her eye with a finger.

103304094.content: Heimdall is on her knees inside the sealed room, her glasses on the floor beside her and her Access Key dim. She is holding the irredeemably damaged Mitir in her arms.

103304095.content: ... I've downloaded the test data. And I've sent everyone away.

103304096.content: I stand at the door to the sealed room, unsure, hesitant to intrude on Heimdall's still form for a few minutes before I softly call out to her.

103304098.content: We'll see Mitir tomorrow, won't we? So chin up.

103304099.content: I can still make out a faint tear stain on Heimdall's cheeks. She closes her eyes and smiles wanly.

103304100.content: It's only now that I realize... just how terrible a creator I am.

103304101.content: From the beginning, Mitir has been doing everything for my sake, from analyzing Bane Energy to the eradication of Visbanes.

103304102.content: I've placed all these burdens on him but neglected to take his growing intelligence into consideration.

103304103.content: I've been... so unfair to Mitir.

103304104.content: At least the very last choice was the correct one. Mitir did... understand you in a way after all.

103304105.content: Heimdall looks down on the Mitir in her lap. The spot where his AI module was has been completely melted by the Circle of Reason.

103304106.content: Even though he had been corrupted by Bane Energy, Mitir made no move to attack when Heimdall entered the sealed room.

103304107.content: You did something quite incredible today...

103304109.content: Heimdall's hot tears fall on Mitir.

103304111.content: The next day. At the Cryptics' office.

103304112.content: I walk tentatively into the Cryptics' office. Everything is humming along as usual, as if the great upheaval never happened.

103304114.content: Good morning, Administrator... Why do I keep seeing you around here recently?

103304115.content: She instinctively turns to look at Ookuninushi's desk, and indeed, Ookuninushi is waving at me.

103304116.content: Heh, well, it is my honor to be able to contribute to the research work here.

103304117.content: I walk over to Heimdall. But before I test the new equipment with Ookuninushi, I have to first drop in on an old friend.

103304120.content: Mitir doesn't fly over to greet me. Instead, his greeting is coming from a corner of the room. The holographic screen is filled with mounds of data. Clearly, Mitir is hard at work.

103304122.content: Mitir has worked like this for years, after all.

103304123.content: You're looking good too, Heimdall. Any progress with the Bane Energy study?

103304124.content: Yes... The data Mitir left us has helped to answer a number of questions. Having said that, we still have a very long way to go before we can fully understand the nature of Bane Energy...

103304125.content: It's as if we are back to where we were before, but at the same time, it also feels like we've made a great step forward.

103304126.content: Oh, by the way, there was another race yesterday. You won't believe what happened...

103304127.content: I'd just seen the news earlier this morning. To create a little suspense, I let my words trail off while wistfully shaking my head at the same time.

103304128.content: Speaking of the races, I cannot help but think back to the time Heimdall and I went to the racetrack. Maybe I should invite her to the race this time.

103304132.content: Heimdall lets out a cheerful laugh and looks to the corner where Mitir is.

103304133.content: Nothing seems to have changed. However, at the same time, something seems to have remained—a new bud of learning, a bud that continues to seek out the unknown, growing out of a still-burning wound left behind by artificial intelligence.

119901001.content: Alright, that's all for today's recovery training.

119901002.content:
Thanks, everyone.
Thanks to you too, Administrator.

119901003.content: Heh, don't worry about it. Looks like the Pheasant Squad is recovering well.

119901004.content: You know what will help even more with the recovery? A bottle of DRINK! Come along, Admin?

119901006.content: You said it! I'm holding you to your word!

119901007.content: It's been four days since the battle happened at the Miyahebi Family manor at Sasanami. Kuninotokotachi is making a solid recovery from her surgery, and Buzenbo reports feeling fine after regaining consciousness. As such, Miss Shu is having a training session to determine the Pheasant Squad's combat readiness.

119901008.content: This is also the first time I've seen Miss Shu use her full abilities and her other Access Key: clearly, fighting three opponents at once is no problem for her.

119901009.content: The flashes of lightning from Flowfly Mist remind me of that breathtaking battle four days ago—especially the moment Tsukuyomi came down on Orochi in one mighty, thunderous slash and reduced Orochi into absolute nothing...

119901010.content: (But why isn't Tsukuyomi using Shinri today...?)

119901011.content: Master, aren't we testing Shinri today?

119901012.content: Buzenbo, who has remained silent up to this point, is the first to speak up. Everyone's eyes are on Tsukuyomi, as if they all have the same question on their minds.

119901013.content: There's no need to. We're just trying to find out how you and Kuninotokotachi are doing physically.

119901014.content: I'm sorry, Master, but... I would like to see it for myself. No... Please, I'd like to spar with you so that I may learn something.

119901015.content: I mean, this is a power that can defeat even Orochi... I would like to know how I can continue along the path of the sword that my master has taken.

119901016.content:
Buzenbo is unquestionably earnest about learning the way of the sword.
But the usually assured Tsukuyomi hesitates and does not reply.

119901017.content: Tsukuyomi, is something stopping you from using Shinri?

119901018.content: It's way too powerful, and I'm not familiar with it yet. I'm not sure training is the right place to use it...

119901019.content: Please don't worry, Master. I promise I'll be careful.

119901020.content: I think what Buzenbo's suggesting makes sense. Tsukuyomi, you are the leader of the Pheasant Squad, as well as one of the key members of Aether Gazer. We need to know just where you are in terms of your abilities.

119901021.content: You don't have to worry about safety. I'll be watching you from the sidelines. You're not going to hurt anyone with Shinri.

119901023.content: Apparently, the need to get on with the job tips the scales for Tsukuyomi, who returns to the training room with Buzenbo.

119901024.content: A dull peal of thunder summons the Access Key she has used only once before. The number on the Divine Power meter on the training room monitor makes a spirited spring.

119901027.content: Thank you in advance for the lesson, Master!

119901028.content: Buzenbo solemnly extends a salute to Tsukuyomi, her weapon in her hand.

119901029.content: Tsukuyomi's fingers uncurl slightly from the handle of her blade, as if she is still hesitant. But her student is ready, and custom demands nothing less than continuing on.

119901030.content: It is no longer simply a contest of swordsmanship once an Access Key is in the picture... But that doesn't mean that I'll go easy on you. Let's do this.

119901031.content: She undoes the scabbard lock and slowly unsheathes the jet-black blade. A blinding light bursts forth, flashing into wild arcs of lightning that shine deep purple on the surface of the blade.

119901032.content: I can see Tsukuyomi's fingers tighten. It's not easy for her to control Shinri, either.

119901033.content: Show me what you've got, Buzenbo.

119901034.content: Sword wisdom dictates that the weaker fighter make the first move. Buzenbo, keenly aware of her deficiencies in both Divine Power and swordsmanship, does not hold back. She takes a deep breath to compose herself and gather her focus, then steps forward and slashes at Tsukuyomi.

119901035.content: Tsukuyomi, however, does not move an inch from where she stands. She makes a single flourish with her weapon, shooting a bright crescent of lightning that lands on Buzenbo's blade, forcing her back to her corner.

119901037.content: This is no longer about sword skills... Let's just stop here.

119901038.content: But Master! You once told me that we are not just Modifiers but warriors of the sword! If I lose, we can't just blame the Access Key alone. That would be papering over my deficiencies as a student of the sword.

119901039.content: Don't worry, Master! I can handle a little more!

119901040.content: Buzenbo swings time and again, seemingly unfatigued, trying various ways to get at Tsukuyomi. Each time she is thwarted by Tsukuyomi's Shinri. Nevertheless, Buzenbo's will intensifies with every setback.

119901041.content: I clearly see the stronger party slowly pull back mid-attack.

119901042.content: Shu, do Tsukuyomi's moves look a little odd to you?

119901043.content: She's trying not to hurt Buzenbo... But she's definitely holding herself back way too much. She hasn't even fully unleashed a single move yet.

119901044.content: Buzenbo's no slouch, and attacks like this aren't usually a problem. This isn't much of a learning experience for her...

119901045.content: Tsukuyomi stops what she's doing, as if she has just heard the discussion between Shu and me. A look of alarm appears on her indifferent face as she spots Buzenbo behind her. She instinctively turns around and releases a diagonal slash.

119901047.content:
I'm quite sure that warning was meant for me.
Just as Tsukuyomi completes the slash, Shu places herself in front of me, between me and the lightning from Shinri...

119901048.content: More accurately speaking, it is a sliver of lightning peeled from the body of a lightning dragon, a dark purple substance heading straight for Buzenbo.

119901049.content: Clearly, things have spun out of control for Tsukuyomi. This is a dramatic departure from her usual show of strength, precision, and economy of movement...

119901051.content: Buzenbo does not turn tail or otherwise try to dodge the threat. Instead, she takes a long, deep breath, then brings her katana back to waist level. She can sense the lightning dragon's ferocious energy, and she is sure she can end things right then and there...

119901052.content: But just as the purple dragon gets within striking distance of Buzenbo's blade, it slows down, and starts to dissipate starting from its tail.

119901054.content: I hear a slight hum in the air.

119901055.content: The glare of the lightning disappears, and in its place I catch sight of Tsukuyomi clutching her chest with her left hand. Her Shinri is nowhere to be seen. She drops her left hand, and the slight frown on her face starts to melt away.

119901056.content: Did you just remove the Access Key by force??? You'll get yourself hurt!

119901057.content: Don't worry about it. I'll just need a couple days' rest.

119901059.content: Buzenbo, sword drawn, appears stupefied. Then, hearing that Tsukuyomi is hurt, she hurries over to help her up.

119901061.content:
I should be asking you that, Master...
I don't get it. I could totally have dealt with that attack just now.

119901062.content: It's my fault. I shouldn't have put you at risk because I can't control Shinri.

119901063.content: What's more... I was simply dueling you with the Access Key, so there's not much you can learn from that. I'm sorry...

119901064.content: Please don't say that, Master. Every battle gives me more experience that I can use. I must ask you to be tougher on me.

119901065.content: Tsukuyomi, a faint smile on her face, says nothing as she brushes the hair from Buzenbo's forehead.

119901067.content: I gingerly push open the unlatched door of the dojo. The setting sun casts long shadows on the wooden floor and over the figure of Tsukuyomi, who is sitting over by the courtyard.

119901068.content: Oh, Administrator? Fancy seeing you here...

119901069.content: Tsukuyomi, genuinely surprised to see me, tries to get up. I wave at her and seat myself beside her before she can do so.

119901072.content: For a split second, I worry that I've planted myself a little too close to Tsukuyomi, but she doesn't seem to mind. Well, that's Tsukuyomi for you.

119901073.content: And so we sat there together, shoulder to shoulder, in silence.

119901074.content: Having fought the battle of Sasanami with her, I get the sense that she is not as aloof as she used to be... And so our conversation starts off at a rather familiar distance.

119901077.content: If I can help you in any way...

119901078.content: If you need my help in any way...

119901079.content: We both start speaking at the same time, and we stop at the same time, too. We look at each other, and an unspoken understanding passes between our eyes. Then we awkwardly look away.

119901080.content: I was told that you often come here when you have something on your mind. I hope I'm not disturbing you.

119901081.content:
No, not at all... I should have looked you up first.
I haven't thanked you yet for Sasanami.

119901082.content: Oh, no problem at all. Besides, I wouldn't be here now if you hadn't slain Orochi.

119901083.content: It's my fault that I even allowed Orochi to hurt my teammates and put you in danger...

119901084.content: Tsukuyomi pinches her wrists, hands in her lap, as if trying to assuage her guilt.

119901085.content:
I want to thank you face-to-face because of what happened in Sasanami.
You were right back there—I'd never forgive myself if I had to sacrifice Buzenbo for victory.

119901086.content: I'm grateful that I had the chance to protect my student and my friends with my sword, rather than... live out the rest of my life in guilt.

119901087.content: We know you, Tsukuyomi. We all know that we can trust you as a senior and a mentor.

119901088.content: I believe that even if I had made the wrong choice, you would not have sat back and watched Buzenbo sacrifice herself.

119901090.content: She nods, and smiles bitterly, looking out on the dimming globe of light beyond the courtyard walls.

119901091.content: I am but a student of the sword, and all I know is how to use my sword. I have neither your willpower nor your judgment...

119901092.content: I don't think I could do better in the same position. Never underestimate yourself, Administrator.

119901093.content: All I did was choose to have faith in everyone of you.

119901094.content: I shrug and look at Tsukuyomi tentatively. She does not seem to notice, her placid expression suggesting that she is having an introspective moment.

119901095.content: I don't get it. Tsukuyomi has great powers, and yet her humility is almost self-deprecating, even self-flagellating. But perhaps that's the way of the sword? I just get the feeling that something is bothering her.

119901096.content: Talk about underestimation... Are you doubting yourself, Tsukuyomi?

119901098.content: Tsukuyomi stops in her tracks, suddenly realizing what I'm getting at. She sighs softly.

119901100.content: Yes. I can't help but think back on what happened at training today. I'm sure you are also worried that you are not able to fully control your Access Key.

119901101.content: Although I'm not a Modifier myself, I'm happy to help you in any way that I can. Just let me know what I can do.

119901102.content: ... Thank you. But I'm still not sure about the why and how.

119901103.content: But it looked like you managed to use Shinri in the fight against Orochi. What happened between then and now?

119901104.content: That wasn't the case at all, Administrator. You should know since you were there, too.

119901105.content: It's a struggle for me to even get a good hold on Shinri. When I fought Orochi, I lost my grasp on all three blades and had to resort to Buzenbo's sword. I had to lean into the Divine Power in Shinri in order to slay Orochi.

119901106.content: ... Yes, I was hurt, but to be honest, I was only able to wield Shinri because of my eagerness... for vengeance. I wasn't really controlling Shinri.

119901107.content: Of course I remember that battle. I've even watched Mimir's video replays several times. Tsukuyomi's confessions come as a surprise to me. I've always thought she had let go of the katanas deliberately...

119901108.content: You shouldn't be having such problems with your own Access Key... Might something be wrong with it?

119901109.content: I don't think the problem lies with the Access Key. Nuadha had already tuned it before it came into my hands.

119901111.content: I cannot help but shudder when I recall the junkyard-like workshop that is called the Hearth of Danu.

119901112.content: Do you remember anything Nuadha said when he handed you the Access Key?

119901113.content: Tsukuyomi goes over what transpired during that transfer.

119901114.content: .... "Cantankerous" even after adjustment? Hmm... Do you remember anything else?

119901115.content: Tsukuyomi thinks for a few more moment.

119901116.content: He hadn't slept for two days when he handed Shinri over to me.

119901117.content: ... That sounds a little concerning. Maybe he'd missed something due to lack of sleep.

119901118.content: It won't hurt to do some more checks on the Access Key. We should do our best to help you control Shinri.

119901119.content: That makes sense. I'll pay Nuadha a visit tomorrow.

119901120.content: Let's go together, then. I've got time tomorrow.

119902002.content: We are in Nuadha's perpetually messy workshop. Tsukuyomi is standing by my side, with Shinri in her arms, and Nuadha is waving his wrench, vigorously pleading his innocence.

119902003.content: Yes, I do like to try sneaking in a modification every now and then. And not all of them work...

119902004.content: But I swear, Key tuning is serious business, and I've taken every care that I can!

119902005.content: Relax, Nuadha. We just want you to do a recheck.

119902006.content: If we find that there's nothing wrong with Shinri, then the problem lies with me.

119902007.content: Heh heh, you didn't have to say that just to convince me! What could possibly be wrong with you?

119902008.content: Nuadha initially waves off Tsukuyomi's comment, then starts to take her seriously after seeing the grave expressions on our faces.

119902009.content: He casts a quizzical look at me, and I look at Tsukuyomi in turn. Tsukuyomi is silent, gazing at the Access Key in her arms.

119902010.content: ... Okay, hold on a sec. Shinri is Tsukuyomi's Access Key, right?

119902011.content: Yes. But an unskilled sword user will have difficulties controlling their Access Key...

119902012.content: That can't be the case. Tsukuyomi, you are the most accomplished sword user I've ever met.

119902013.content: I'm far from the "most accomplished," as you say...

119902014.content: Hahaha, oh come on Tsukuyomi! I may not be a member of Aether Gazer, but I've heard plenty of what your peers think of you...

119902015.content: They tell me that you have an incredible focus and that they feel safe and secure around you. You're stable, you're calm, and you always have a solution to the problem at hand...

119902016.content: Please don't say that. There is always an element of exaggeration in praise.

119902017.content: But if everyone is saying the same thing, there must also be some truth to it! I firmly believe that this has nothing to do with your capabilities...

119902018.content: ... Alright, why don't you just leave Shinri with me for now? I'll try tuning it again. But don't get your hopes up. I tried every regular trick in the book during the last tuning.

119902020.content: Mmm... I mean, this time around I may use some, um, special techniques and see if I can make Shinri more stable.

119902021.content: It may take a bit of time. Just leave it with me.

119902022.content: I feel uneasy, but nevertheless, Tsukuyomi and I leave the Hearth of Danu and make our way back to Aether Gazer.

119902023.content: There is still scarcely a hint of emotion on Tsukuyomi's face. It's as if she's not concerned at all about the "special techniques" Nuadha intends to employ.

119902024.content: It all sounds a little dicey... Is it really alright to leave the Access Key with him?

119902025.content: I trust Nuadha. He's been working with Aether Gazer for many years, and he was also the one who tuned Sakubo.

119902026.content: Since Tsukuyomi has expressed her confidence in Nuadha, I decide to keep quiet about my misgivings.

119902027.content: Any plans after this, Tsukuyomi? Do you have somewhere to be?

119902028.content: I'll go back to my training. I have to make sure that I am in optimal form...

119902029.content: Hey, hold on... You haven't fully recovered! Surely you should rest for a few more days?

119902030.content: I've already had an entire day off. It's time I start training again.

119902032.content: But of course, just saying that isn't going to do the trick. So I pull up a training report on my holographic screen and show it to Tsukuyomi.

119902033.content: In the four days since we returned from Sasanami, you have trained twice as long as usual each day. That's already too much. You're not going to put your body through the mill like this.

119902035.content: Tsukuyomi's voice trails off as she realizes that I'm fully clear of her entire training record, and even physical status. There is a rather rigid look on her face.

119902036.content: It's part of my job to analyze everyone's training and battle records.

119902037.content: Just because you rarely talk about yourself doesn't mean we're not concerned about you. Tell me, Tsukuyomi, how can I not be concerned when you are always taking on these huge responsibilities by yourself?

119902038.content: I thank you for that, but...

119902039.content: I knew she would say something like this. It's going to take some work to talk Tsukuyomi around—as usual.

119902040.content: A student of the sword must never slacken, and must test themselves from time to time...

119902042.content: I put away the report and recall what Shu once said to me when I was starting out at the General Office. An idea comes to me.

119902043.content: There is an old saying in the Xu Heng that goes, "Learning flows both ways between teacher and student." Instruction can also be a good test of your capabilities.

119902044.content: Buzenbo is on a mission today.

119902045.content: Why don't you teach me something today, then?

119902046.content:
Tsukuyomi is taken aback by my request.
I start miming a couple of poses to indicate that I am serious.

119902047.content: Come on! It's always useful to learn a new skill! Who knows, it may come in handy one day!

119902048.content: I mean, it's not like I haven't experienced the Visbane menace for myself. The thought of having to fight one isn't so strange now...

119902049.content: The corners of Tsukuyomi's mouth curl up ever so slightly.

119902050.content: You... really are quite the odd duck.

119902051.content:
Heh heh, thanks for the compliment!
I take it that you've agreed to teach me some sword skills?

119902052.content: I'm afraid I can't take you officially as my student. However, I can pass on some tips on sword use and self-defense.

119902053.content: That'd be more than enough. I mean, without Divine Power I won't be able to learn things like Ultimate Skills anyway...

119902054.content: Yes... But since you are a beginner, it probably isn't wise to jump straight to teaching you sword moves either...

119902055.content: Administrator, are you familiar with the game of Go?

119902058.content: Go is not a complicated game. Once you understand the basic principles, you're good to go.

119902061.content: I haven't had a good opponent for a while now.

119902062.content: Let's have a game, then! Show me what you've got!

119902064.content: Guess I shouldn't have said that, huh?

119902065.content: ... Oh no. I'm pretty much finished here.

119902066.content: Don't give up midway. You still have a fighting chance.

119902067.content: Um... Is that supposed to make me feel better?

119902068.content: On the board where the battle of wits is being played out, White has launched a fierce offensive characterized by frequent and bold attacks, slowly taking breathing room away from Black.

119902069.content: I clutch the black stones in my hand, furiously scanning the board for a way to turn the game around. Yet I find nothing.

119902070.content: The game of Go shares many similarities with the art of the sword. The player must maintain a balance between movement and stillness, between offense and defense. One must keep the bigger picture in mind and watch for fleeting opportunities in a changing situation.

119902071.content: While there are certain standard moves, one must also stay flexible. A skilled Go player can also be a skilled wielder of the sword...

119902072.content: ... Do you get what I mean?

119902073.content: I am tempted to say yes, but I think back to how even my "I know a little here and there" seems arrogant given the beating I'm taking. I start questioning myself...

119902074.content: (Do I really understand that? Do I? Do I?)

119902075.content: And finally, I decide to shake my head.

119902077.content: The shine in Tsukuyomi's mirror-like eyes fades a little. Her arm slowly falls to the board, and she puts the stones back into the box.

119902078.content: I'm really sorry, Administrator. I've only taught Buzenbo prior to this, and perhaps that way of teaching works only with some students and not others.

119902079.content: No, no, I assure you that I have in fact learned plenty from you, both in terms of Go and the art of the sword... I'm just not sure if I really understand.

119902080.content: ... Did Buzenbo "get" all that when you told her the same thing?

119902081.content: She comes from a clan with a tradition of swords, and she was very well taught in the spirits of the sword, better than me in some ways. She understands the sword theories better than I do. So, of course, she understood what I was saying.

119902082.content: You seem to have high praise for her.

119902083.content: The most important thing for a student of the sword is to ignore all distractions and cultivate their focus, to forge their spirit of the sword... Buzenbo can do these things better than me.

119902084.content: I took her as my student because I didn't wish to see her mired in the pains of the past. Now, all she needs is a little more experience. I've always thought she could surpass me in the way of the sword.

119902085.content: Surpass you? I must say, I can't see Buzenbo agreeing with that...

119902086.content: Yes, I don't think she understands just how capable she is. My fear of her over-dependency was what led me to shy away from this responsibility...

119902087.content: But the more I think about our teacher-student relationship, the more I feel my shortcomings. I don't have much to teach her apart from a few simple moves.

119902088.content: I'm not sure if I'm qualified to continue teaching her. After all, I may be holding her back.

119902089.content: It's the same with Kuninotokotachi. Although I am her team leader in name, do I really have what it takes to lead her in battle...?

119902090.content: All of a sudden, Tsukuyomi stops speaking, as if she's just realized what she's said out loud. It's been a while since the last stone was placed. She looks up at me.

119902091.content: I'm sorry. I'm just going on and on about myself.

119902092.content: That's not a problem for me.

119902093.content: I guess we share a secret now...?

119902094.content: ... You've already heard what I said to Buzenbo during the Miyahebi battle. There's no need to hide how I feel from you.

119902095.content: If it helps to talk and get things off your chest, I'm happy to lend an ear anytime.

119902096.content: Tsukuyomi does not reply. Instead, she makes her next move, and I quickly turn back to the game. The situation for Black has gone from bad to worse.

119902097.content: No conceding the game yet! It's not over till it's over!

119902098.content: Alright... But I'll need more time to think then...

119902099.content: Since throwing in the towel is no longer an option, I stare at the board in sheer helplessness. No matter how I rack my brains, there just doesn't seem to be a solution.

119902100.content: They say you don't have to exchange words with an expert to learn from them. I've certainly learned loads today.

119902101.content: I'm glad this game has been helpful to you, Administrator.

119902102.content: Heh, I enjoyed playing and chatting with you, Tsukuyomi.

119902103.content: ... But you wanted to learn sword skills at the beginning.

119902104.content: I open my mouth, but don't know what to speak. I've completely forgotten about the matter, to be honest, maybe because I was being badly thrashed in the game, or maybe because I was too busy talking.

119902105.content: Ah.... yes, sword skills. Of course I picked up something, Tsukuyomi. And that's all thanks to you.

119902106.content: It's important for a student of the sword to be truthful, Administrator... It doesn't look like I taught you a thing.

119902107.content: I don't think learning only takes place when there's instruction! Aren't master-student relationships just a part of formal instruction?

119902108.content: My casual statement seems to have thrown Tsukuyomi for a loop.

119902110.content: Relax, this is all coming from Shu's experience. As she says, "The most effective form of education is not the indoctrination of knowledge, but the establishment of a model to learn from."

119902111.content: I get a vague sense of a knot being untied somewhere in my mind. Just as I begin to ponder the source of this strange feeling, the communicator starts vibrating.

119902112.content: ... A message from the Special Task Force...? I'm sorry, but I've got to go now.

119902113.content: I rise while reading the message, taking a deep breath, and processing the details of the mission. I gesture at Tsukuyomi.

119902114.content: Let's head back to the HQ together.

119902115.content: I didn't receive a message. Am I going on a mission?

119902116.content: No, but this concerns you, in a way... Just come with me.

119903001.content: Tsukuyomi and I return to Aether Gazer HQ and make a beeline for the Command Room.

119903002.content: I don't think I will be of any use at the Command Room. But I'm ready to head out to the field if needed.

119903003.content: This is the only thing Tsukuyomi says as we leave the kendo hall. I make no reply, as it's such a natural thing for her to say.

119903004.content: ... I asked you here to consult on this mission, as you are the leader of the squad.

119903005.content: The Intelligence Office has found traces of Visbane activity in what is supposed to be no man's land. Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi are on their way to check out the location.

119903007.content: This is a Pheasant Squad mission. Why wasn't I informed?

119903008.content: They applied for leave on your behalf, as they knew you're injured.

119903011.content: I grab Tsukuyomi's arm as she starts to leave and glance at the Command Room nearby.

119903012.content: You don't have to. This isn't a dangerous mission.

119903013.content: That's beside the point... As the team leader, I should be present at every Pheasant Squad mission.

119903014.content: I should still be able to catch up with them if I leave now...

119903015.content: Tsukuyomi tries to pull away, but I don't let go.

119903016.content: As the commander of this mission, I hereby order you to stay here.

119903018.content: I can see the tension slowly leave Tsukuyomi's body as her mind accepts that she is not going on the mission. She also appears lost in thought.

119903019.content: All that additional training over the last few days, and the forceful removal of Shinri yesterday... Why are you so hard on yourself?

119903020.content: This is what I should do...

119903021.content: Tsukuyomi's head is slightly lowered, and there is a flash across her eyes. I think she must have guessed my intention. However, this is not a good time to talk.

119903022.content: ... Let's establish contact with the team first.

119903023.content: I step briskly into the Command Room. Shu, the advisor for this mission, is already standing at the command panel. She is a little surprised to see Tsukuyomi with me, but she doesn't say anything.

119903025.content: The Pheasant Squad is in position. I'll connect you to mission comms.

119903028.content: There's no harm in having you observe the goings-on here at the Command Room. However, you may not speak during the operation without my permission.

119903029.content: I am plugged into the mission comms channel. Tsukuyomi takes a seat next to me and immediately begins studying the mission map and the indicators on the command panel.

119903031.content: There is a brief silence, and then we hear rushing wind. It is as if whoever is wearing the microphone is moving very fast.

119903032.content: Yo, Admin? You sure got here quick.

119903033.content: We've detected low levels of Bane Energy. But no sign of Visbanes yet.

119903034.content: But we're still on the edge of the forest, and things may be different further inside. May we proceed, Administrator?

119903035.content: Continue with your search. But be careful.

119903036.content: I watch the two glowing points of light head towards the center of the mission area. The atmosphere in the Command Room is still relaxed, as this type of mission is routine and usually low-risk. Besides, the mission is being conducted some distance away from the cities.

119903037.content: The comms fills with Kuninotokotachi's wilful chatter. More than once, Tsukuyomi has to restrain herself from breaking her silence to stop her.

119903038.content: Oh. By the way, Admin. Does Tsukuyomi know about this operation?

119903039.content: I don't think so. Why do you ask?

119903040.content: Ah. She's going to be real mad when she finds out we applied for leave on her behalf.

119903041.content: Why didn't you tell her then?

119903042.content: Welllllllllllll. Buzenbo, you wanna take that?

119903043.content: I saw her leave early this morning, although we were supposed to have our morning lesson... I'm guessing it's for something really important... I didn't want to bother Master when she's busy.

119903044.content: But I need your help, Administrator, in case Master comes back and doesn't see us, since she may ask where we are.

119903046.content: I purse my lips and sheepishly glance at Tsukuyomi. The brief lapse in conversation seems to have caught the astute Buzenbo's attention.

119903047.content: Administrator, do you know where Master was or what she went to do this morning?

119903049.content: Hmm... She's been looking real moody lately. I wonder what's bothering her...

119903050.content: Buzenbo, do you want to be of help to your Master?

119903051.content: Of course I do! I'll do everything I can if my Master needs my help...

119903052.content: But I'm afraid there's very little I can do for her right now. And I feel terrible about that.

119903054.content: Shinri? So something went wrong with the Access Key yesterday, I see...

119903055.content: You seem relieved to hear that.

119903056.content: Yes. If tuning the Key is all we need to lick the problem, then I'm happy.

119903057.content: It's a little embarrassing to hear this from you though, Administrator... I mean, I should know better about what's on my Master's mind...

119903059.content: But Buzenbo, aren't you helping lighten your Master's burden right now?

119903061.content: Hang on. I think something's up.

119903062.content: Kuninotokotachi's voice is firm even while speaking softly. Her extraordinary senses have picked up something.

119903063.content: All I can see on the command panel is a rapid rise in Bane Energy levels directly ahead of them. Just what is going on?

119903064.content: There's Bane Energy coming from your eleven-to-one o'clock, two hundred meters from you. Can you see what it is?

119903065.content: No, it's way too foggy in here...

119903068.content: The great glob of Bane Energy swallows the two points of light, and we lose contact with Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi. All we hear are blades being unsheathed and the characteristic howls of a Visbane.

119903069.content: I'm going in to help them.

119903070.content: Tsukuyomi jumps to her feet the instant we hear Buzenbo's blade being unsheathed. I turn off my microphone and try to stop her.

119903071.content: This isn't their first day on the job. This level of Visbane activity should be no problem for them.

119903072.content: I need you to have faith in them... to have faith in me. Give me a little more time.

119903073.content: I nod at Tsukuyomi and beckon her to sit down. I turn on my microphone, quickly scanning the incoming data, and start issuing commands to Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi.

119903074.content: Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi have run into a large Polymerized Type Visbane. The situation is made trickier by the fog and the Visbane's sneak attack.

119903075.content: However, as I mentioned, this isn't their first day on the job. As they follow my instructions, they soon get into the groove and start launching counterattacks.

119903076.content: The battle is over in 15 minutes or so. We hear a great many trees crashing to the ground, and the Bane Energy level falls dramatically.

119903077.content: Visbane has been eliminated. Mission complete.

119903078.content: Well done. I need you two to make one more round to ensure everything's alright, and then you can come back.

119903080.content: Oops, looks like I have a hole in my suit. Wanna help check the rest of me, Admin?

119903081.content: Stop talking like that when we're in the field... I'm good.

119903082.content: Ugh, looks like Buzenbo's like this whether our leader is with us or not...

119903084.content: Seeing that the battle is over and her teammates are safe and sound, Tsukuyomi rises to leave. Startled by this unexpected movement, I hurriedly put my finger to my lips. It's a while before I finally manage to get her to sit down again.

119903085.content: Huh? Am I imagining things, or did I just hear Master's voice? Is she there?

119903086.content: Aaahahahahaha.... Is this your way of telling us that you miss your Master?

119903087.content: I didn't say anything of the sort...

119903088.content: Now we're talking about Tsukuyomi at least. Looks like my plan's back on track.

119903089.content: I'm sure you must be thinking that the mission would be much easier if Tsukuyomi were around.

119903090.content: We have no time for that... Absolute focus is essential during battle. But... you may be right.

119903091.content: Every time the Pheasant Squad is on a mission, Master steps up to tackle the most challenging part of the task. She is always right in front of us whenever we face a powerful opponent.

119903092.content: We probably would have discovered the Visbane earlier if Master were here.

119903093.content: If Tsukuyomi were here, she would probably say something like "that's what the leader does"...

119903095.content: Do you feel the same way, Kuninotokotachi?

119903096.content: Um... Of course I feel more at ease when our leader is with us. After all, she's such a powerful and... impressive figure...

119903097.content: But... I don't think she feels that she's protecting us.

119903098.content: Why, do you think she's too wrapped up in the task at hand?

119903099.content: You mean she's too wrapped up in herself.

119903100.content: Have you ever seen Tsukuyomi in battle, Admin? Once her blade is unsheathed, it's like there's nothing in the world but the sword in her hand. That, and the opponent she's going to slay.

119903101.content: To be honest, I was quite taken aback the first time I saw her like that... It was as if she had turned into someone else entirely. It was a little scary, even.

119903102.content: Yeah, I felt the same the first time she taught me sword skills...

119903103.content: That unfettered and absolute focus... where there is zero room for distractions... Unlike Master, that's a place I can never ever reach.

119903104.content: Oh? I can't imagine that, to be honest.

119903105.content: That's not surprising. You are a ninja, not a student of kendo.

119903106.content: Well, I don't know much about kendo either. It's really hard to understand these.

119903107.content: You don't have to be a "student." To be honest, I didn't choose to follow Master just because I wanted to learn sword skills...

119903108.content: There are things more important to me than sword moves. Like the times spent with my Master, the times spent training, playing Go, traveling, and going on missions with her... Even the times we spend just chit-chatting after our meals are more important to me.

119903109.content: Whenever my Master is by my side, I feel that complete calm and focus she has in her every move. I can feel just how confident and powerful she is. That is what gives me the motivation as a student of the sword.

119903112.content: Fine, fine... I may not know Tsukuyomi as well as Buzenbo does, but I feel the same way about her.

119903113.content: For me, the best Tsukuyomi is the one we can look up to, the one as cold as the pale moon, and the one who is simply herself.

119903114.content: Gotta remember that, Admin. Oh, and...

119903116.content: Patrol completed. No abnormalities found. Over.

119903117.content: Kuninotokotachi cuts contact before Buzenbo has a chance to get in another word. I see the two dots of light on our map start to make their way back to Aether Gazer HQ.

119903119.content: I flash Tsukuyomi an awkward smile. So much for not letting the Pheasant Squad know that Tsukuyomi is right here in the Command Room.

119903120.content: Thank you for your work, Administrator. Thank you too, Tsukuyomi. You may take a break now.

119903121.content: Shu, who is done with the ops report, walks out of the Command Room and gives me what looks like a nod of approval as she walks past.

119903122.content: Guess my devious little scheme wasn't that subtle after all...

119903123.content: Ahem... Anyway. Tsukuyomi, I guess you heard what Buzenbo and Kuninotokotachi think of you?

119903124.content: You don't have to do more than the rest just because you're the leader. And you certainly don't have to be so harsh on yourself.

119903125.content: The Tsukuyomi we all know completes a mission in the most sensible manner. She is focused and disciplined but doesn't push herself beyond her limits, because she knows she has to be ready at any moment.

119903126.content: And that's why everyone admires you. That's how it was in the past, and it'll be that way in the future...

119903127.content: I flash Tsukuyomi a smile, looking straight into her eyes.

119903128.content: You know, Kuninotokotachi actually said what was on my mind—please, just stay yourself. Don't change who you are because of your relationships with the people around you.

119903129.content: Tsukuyomi, who looked like she was in a daze the whole time, blinks and looks away.

119903130.content: The slightest smile flits across her face. Or so I think, because she then starts to tuck her hair behind her ears, and I can no longer be sure.

119903132.content: Tsukuyomi glances at me, not knowing what else to say, and finally shakes her head in resignation.

119903133.content: You know, I didn't know you had a sly side.

119903134.content: Well, when opportunity presents itself, heh heh... I'll take that as a compliment.

119904001.content: Um, looks like the Pheasant Squad has resumed its normal training.

119904002.content: Since I have some time on my hands, I pick up the training room logs for a quick look. The Pheasant Squad has been doing well in training, both individually and as a team.

119904003.content: Tsukuyomi is also no longer training overtime. I must say, that little trick of mine has done wonders.

119904004.content: Why, then, do I feel like something's missing?

119904007.content: Tsukuyomi appears at the door. I quickly close her training logs and reach for my tumbler. I hope she didn't hear me reading the data I was just looking at.

119904008.content: Is this a bad time? I can come back later...

119904009.content: Whew. Guess she didn't hear me.

119904010.content: No, not at all. Come on in. What is it?

119904011.content: I hear that you're heading to Nuadha's workshop tonight to check on some goods. I'd like to come with you.

119904013.content: ... It's been five days since we left Shinri with him for tuning, and we haven't heard any updates from him.

119904015.content: I slap myself on the forehead. So that's why it felt like something was missing from the training logs! I hadn't seen signs of Shinri being used, that's why!

119904016.content: Five days is a little long, yeah. I hope that doesn't mean he's wrecked it or something.

119904017.content: No, I'd have sensed that. I'm guessing that he's run into problems with the tuning.

119904019.content: What do you plan to do if tuning doesn't help?

119904020.content: Tsukuyomi looks down at her hands, as if she's looking for something. Her slender but strong fingers are slightly curled, like she's holding an invisible blade.

119904021.content: If I'm able to control Shinri by myself, I wouldn't want to constrain its power by tuning it.

119904022.content: I'm not sure, but I think... I've figured out how to use it.

119904024.content: Nuadha's palms have come together in front of his chest. He is looking up at the starry sky through the window, his expression grave.

119904025.content: Well. What is supposed to come will always come.

119904026.content: Tsukuyomi and I exchange glances. What is he on about?

119904027.content: Are the two of you here for Shinri?

119904029.content: Ahem. I must say, the power of Shinri is truly impressive.

119904031.content: There are very real limits to how much we can constrain a Key's power, and when we overdo it there is blowback...

119904032.content: ... Are you saying that you wrecked the Key?!

119904033.content: Well, I don't think "wrecked" is the right word here...

119904034.content: Nuadha scratches his head and steals a glance at Tsukuyomi, who seems to still be still. He then holds out a hand to stop us from following him.

119904035.content: ... Wait here a second. I'll go get Shinri.

119904036.content: Nuadha burrows deep inside the workshop, and soon we hear things knocking together and being pushed around. Does he not know where the Key is?

119904037.content: I look at Tsukuyomi, who remains the face of equanimity.

119904039.content: Don't worry, Administrator. I sort of expected this.

119904040.content: About a minute later, Nuadha emerges with a long box in his hands and places it on the table. Our engineer now has the demeanor of a serious professional.

119904041.content: I'll be frank, Tsukuyomi... Remember how you unsheathed the blade to give it a whirl the first time I handed it to you?

119904042.content: The bad news—or maybe it's good news, I don't know—is that the power of Shinri is no longer constrained in any way. This means it is even more powerful than before. However, this also means that wielding and controlling it will be even more difficult.

119904043.content: I am trying to restore the constraints that were originally placed on Shinri. To do that, I'll need another two days at least.

119904044.content: My professional assessment is that Shinri is not fit for use at the moment.

119904045.content: Nuadha opens the box, and I can see the three blades lying inside. The katanas look simple and plain. Its scabbard and guard tightly fastened together, doesn't look that threatening.

119904046.content: You say you've unlocked all of its potential? I guess that's a good thing.

119904048.content: Tsukuyomi picks up Shinri, activates it, and then recalls it. She gives Nuadha a thank-you nod and starts to leave.

119904050.content: Nuadha rushes up to stop Tsukuyomi and gulps audibly.

119904051.content: No, no, no, you have no idea how much effort it took to force Shinri back into the scabbard... This is too risky.

119904053.content: Don't worry. I'm confident that I can wield it. If you need proof...

119904054.content: Tsukuyomi summons Shinri one more time, then raises her arm to draw the blades. Nuadha practically jumps out of his skin.

119904055.content: WOW WOW WOW! Not here, for goodness' sake!

119904056.content: Nuadha heaves a sigh of relief as Tsukuyomi stops.

119904057.content: Not here in this rickety workshop of mine... Let's do this at the testing ground.

119904058.content: We follow Nuadha to the Hearth of Danu's "testing ground." It looks familiar for some reason.

119904059.content: Isn't this Aether Gazer's training room?

119904060.content: Heh, it looks exactly the same, doesn't it?

119904061.content: I'm surprised to see a place like this here.

119904062.content: Well, I don't have a choice. I've got too many... interesting weapons here at the workshop, and they have to be tested somewhere.

119904063.content: It's safe here, Tsukuyomi. So go ahead.

119904064.content: Tsukuyomi nods and walks to the center of the space. With no hesitation or exertion, she unsheathes Shinri as easily as any practice sword. Apprehensive, Nuadha takes a few steps back, and I can feel my palms getting sweaty...

119904065.content: But nothing happens, even as Shinri is being unsheathed. Nothing, not even a flash of lightning, as Tsukuyomi pulls the blade from the scabbard.

119904066.content: The katana in Tsukuyomi's hand looks like any other. All I see are the lights of the training ground reflected in the black blade, and not a single arc of lightning.

119904067.content: What is going on...? Why can't I sense even a hint of Divine Power from it...?

119904068.content: ... Are you sure you didn't wreck the Access Key?

119904069.content: I don't understand... This doesn't make any sense...

119904070.content: Shinri is in perfect shape. Thank you very much, Nuadha.

119904071.content: Tsukuyomi shakes her head, as if she's heard the questions that are ringing in our minds. She then slashes at a battered steel plate sitting in a corner of the training ground.

119904072.content: As Nuadha and I watch with our mouths agape, a ring of lightning appears around Tsukuyomi. She swings, and the ring transforms into four purple beams. The beams converge into a single stream that slams into the steel plate.

119904073.content: First a dent appears, then a crack that starts to grow. As the last of the Divine Power beam hits the plate, it shatters like glass and scatters across the ground.

119904074.content: ... Sorry, I think I broke it.

119904075.content: Don't worry about it. It's just a steel plate...

119904076.content: Nuadha stares blankly at Tsukuyomi's katana. Then, suddenly, his eyes gleam, and he runs to his workshop.

119904077.content: Don't leave just yet! Give me a moment!

119904078.content: Nuadha has dashed off again, just as I fish out my checklist.

119904080.content: I rub my forehead. When I turn around, I see that Tsukuyomi is senting Shinri back into its scabbard.

119904081.content: Interesting! What is it with Shinri today? Why does it respond so well to you?

119904082.content: I have you to thank for that, Administrator.

119904084.content: Remember how I said that the most important thing for a student of the sword is to ignore all distractions and cultivate their focus...? This is something I've not been able to do myself.

119904085.content: The more powerful the sword, the stronger the wielder's will and belief have to be. I couldn't control Shinri before because I was not centered enough.

119904086.content: Not centered? That's not Buzenbo says about you.

119904089.content: Tsukuyomi chuckles and shakes her head.

119904090.content: I suppose... that's the student's understanding of the teacher.

119904091.content: I've never had lofty goals. I joined Aether Gazer and battled the Visbanes for purely selfish reasons.

119904092.content: However, after I returned from Sasanami, I kept thinking that as a team leader, I should be doing more for everyone. That I should be wielding my sword in the service of something greater. And that was an undesirable and irrelevant distraction.

119904093.content: I've also told you that I'm a student of the sword, and all I know is how to use my sword. This is the essence of my practice. As for the sake of others...

119904094.content: ... I'm grateful that everyone has chosen to believe in me as I am, and the only thing I can do to repay them is to be the very best I can be.

119904095.content: In the open space of the testing ground, there is only Tsukuyomi's words in the air.

119904096.content: I scan her face, which is expressionless as always. Perhaps the habit of taking everything upon herself is already too ingrained.

119904098.content: Even if you choose not to wield your sword for the sake of others, always remember that we will always be by your side.

119904100.content: No one expects any sort of "repayment" from you, be they your followers or those who have put their trust in you.

119904101.content: In the future, you'll get to know more people and establish more bonds. You'll think about how to relate to them, and you'll face problems unlike any on the battlefield... But—

119904102.content:
Please, just stay yourself.
I believe that everyone agrees with me on this.

119904103.content: Administrator, what are you and Master talking about?

119904104.content: We hear a sound from behind us before Tsukuyomi can respond to me.

119904105.content: We turn towards the entrance. A dejected Nuadha and an ebullient Buzenbo walk in.

119904107.content: I saw the two of you leave after nightfall, and I was concerned, so I followed you here.

119904108.content: Do I really seem that suspicious to people...?

119904109.content: What's with the long face, Nuadha?

119904110.content: Nothing much... Buzenbo took apart the autonomous weapon that I was going to ask Tsukuyomi to test.

119904111.content: A slight flush comes over Buzenbo's cheeks. A grave misunderstanding seems to have occurred during the short time Tsukuyomi and I were talking.

119904112.content: Alright, Nuadha. It's getting late. Let's go get that check done.

119904113.content: Sure... Buzenbo. If you want to spar with Tsukuyomi, this is a good place.

119904114.content: Just watch yourselves and the equipment in the corner.

119904116.content: Nuadha tells me that Master can wield Shinri with no problems now, so I wanted to finish our round...

119904117.content: Please don't hold back this time either, Master.

119904118.content: Are you sure you want to do this?

119904119.content: I have no intention of causing my Master disgrace.

119904120.content: Tsukuyomi looks at Buzenbo and nods. She leads Buzenbo to the center of the testing ground.

119904121.content: Nuadha and I head out for our check. As we are going out of the room, I turn around and take a look at the teacher and the student. Tsukuyomi, the very picture of focus and control, is pointing Shinri at Buzenbo.

119904122.content: Oh? Isn't this our game from last time?

119904123.content: To leave a Go game unfinished is a gross act of disrespect for the game by both players.

119904124.content: At dusk, Tsukuyomi and I are in the kendo hall. We're sitting on the floor with a Go board on the table between us.

119904125.content: I've come to Tsukuyomi for a second "showdown" to avenge my previous humiliation. I certainly did not expect her to continue with our previous game.

119904126.content: She takes a stone from the box, but puts it back down when she hears my dispirited voice. She offers me another choice.

119904127.content: We can also start another game, Administrator, if you wish to concede this one.

119904128.content: Didn't you say that conceding the game is not an option?

119904129.content: That's for sword practice. The student of the sword mustn't retreat simply because they have suffered blows from their opponent.

119904130.content: You're not here to learn sword skills today, so conceding defeat is okay.

119904131.content: Um. Do I still have any chance of winning this game?

119904132.content: Tsukuyomi takes a quick glance at the board and shakes her head.

119904133.content: White is ahead by over forty. The game is pretty much over for you.

119904135.content: Shall we start a new game?

119904137.content: "Maintain a harmonious balance between movement and stillness, as well as between offense and defense. Always keep the big picture in mind. Keep an eye out for opportunities in an ever-changing situation."

119904138.content: Learning to deal with a game that's going against me will help me as Aether Gazer's tactician.

119904139.content: You always make so much sense, Administrator.

119904140.content: No, I got that from what you said.

119904141.content: Tsukuyomi doesn't speak, but places another stone on the board.

119904142.content: And herein lies the magic of Go: it's a simple matter of choosing a point to place the stone, but one move can change the situation entirely....

119904143.content: Wow... You aren't taking any chances, I see...

119904144.content: But that's what's so wonderful about you, Administrator. You always have an insight where no one else does.

119904145.content: Thank you so much for what you've done in the past few days.

119904146.content: I'm sure the others would do the same for you if they were in my shoes.

119904147.content: Besides, how many people can say they've given Tsukuyomi a helping hand?

119904148.content: I chatter away as I drop a stone on the outer edge, hoping that Tsukuyomi doesn't notice. This is the only way Black can escape White's relentless siege...

119904149.content: But Tsukuyomi makes a merciless counterattack, and I have no choice but to rack my brains thinking of my next move.

119904150.content: You know, you mentioned that you joined Aether Gazer for "purely selfish reasons"...

119904151.content: I must say, I was a little bothered by that. I just don't see a single selfish bone in your body. Do you want to talk about it?

119904152.content: Tsukuyomi is stunned by my query, and I can see a tinge of sadness on her face. I panic and try to limit the damage I've done.

119904153.content: I'm sorry I brought that up. We don't have to talk about it if you don't want to.

119904154.content: It's nothing secret... I joined Aether Gazer to look for someone.

119904156.content: The gears in my head start turning, and I think of everything Tsukuyomi has said to date. I recall the time before the battle with Orochi at the Miyahebi Family manor.

119904158.content: I asked the Intelligence Office a long time ago to look out for clues, but I haven't heard a thing since.

119904159.content: You've not given up hope, have you?

119904161.content: Then it's not a problem, then.
