119904162.content: I no longer care about the parts of the board that are already lost. Instead I eye the empty corner, wondering how I can get the better of Tsukuyomi in my remaining moves.

119904163.content: If you ever need help from me or any of us, just say the word. Don't take everything on your own shoulders again.

119904164.content: You can trust all of us here at Aether Gazer, no matter when or where. We will always be by your side.

119904165.content: I get the sense that when a problem arises, it will be an awfully tricky one...

119904166.content: Tsukuyomi must guess something, but she doesn't elaborate. Instead, I see a gentle smile on her face...

119904167.content: You'll have to become even better before then too, Administrator.

119904168.content: The game is up for Black just ten moves later.

119904170.content: Perhaps losing with grace will draw attention away from the utter devastation on the board...

119904171.content: Shall we have another game, if you have the time?

119905001.content: Sorry to bother you so late, Administrator.

119905002.content: That's all right, I'm a night owl. The night is still young. (Options)

119905004.content: I invite Tsukuyomi into my room and go to make some tea, not that I have much of anything in my hotel room to offer guests...

119905005.content: So, what brings you here all of a sudden? You train first thing in the morning, shouldn't you be getting some sleep?

119905006.content: Losing a few hours of sleep won't keep me from getting up and training...

119905007.content: Besides, it's not every day that work brings you to Sasanami, and it won't be long before you'll have to leave again. I really should have come to see you sooner.

119905008.content: No biggie, you've had your hands full as well. Still, I'm glad you were able to make time for a visit.

119905009.content: Oolong tea? It's just a complimentary tea bag from the hotel, but it seems decent enough.

119905010.content: Thank you... but I actually brought two cups of coffee, if that's okay...

119905011.content: Seeing Tsukuyomi pull out a paper bag from behind her, I awkwardly lick my lips and put the unused tea bag back where I found it.

119905012.content: The unique scent of Sasanami coffee beans suffuses the room. Our cups in hand, Tsukuyomi and I sit across from each other, separated by an open book on the table.

119905013.content: Were you reading this? "Reincarnating as the Child of Heav—"

119905014.content: Ahem, just some light reading. No need to read out the title so seriously...

119905015.content: I was just thinking that it looks familiar. The protagonist is reborn as the Child of Heaven, and gathers the ladies of the Sasanami Five to form an idol band that takes Sasanami by storm.

119905016.content:
That's right...
You've read it before?

119905017.content: I heard Kuninotokotachi and Buzenbo talking about it, so I went to a bookshop to take a look. It was actually quite interesting.

119905018.content: ...A team leader should know their teammate's hobbies and interests.

119905019.content: I'm pretty sure it's okay to just come out and say what your hobbies and interests are...

119905020.content: Some "visit." The most significant thing happening in this room seems to be the alternating fall of the waterlines in our cups.

119905021.content: I wouldn't be surprised if she got up to leave the second she reached the bottom of her cup. Fair enough, but it wouldn't sit right with me.

119905022.content: Speaking of which, I rarely see you do anything apart from train and play chess.

119905023.content: If you're interested in my personal life...

119905024.content: Just curious to know how the "idols" spend their time...

119905025.content: Sometimes I also do things like fish and play mahjong.

119905026.content: Why are some familiar names popping into my head... Somehow, I doubt you do those of your own initiative.

119905027.content: I like to read novels too. Sometimes getting lost in an interesting story makes for a nice change of pace.

119905028.content: But you find kendo more fulfilling.

119905029.content: Yes, that's true. Looks like you already know all there is to know about me.

119905030.content: Tsukuyomi puts down her coffee cup and sits up straight. Thinking she's getting up to leave, I straighten up too, only to discover that she's just taking out a tissue to dab her mouth.

119905031.content: Whether it's work or play, you need genuine enthusiasm to stick with something.

119905032.content: Like getting up at 6:00 AM to train after staying up late to see how far your willpower takes you?

119905033.content: You're energetic enough to adapt to a routine like that.

119905034.content: I was kidding... Even if I went to sleep now, I'm not sure I could wake up at 6:00 AM.

119905036.content: I freeze when Tsukuyomi says that. Catching a glimpse of her fingers gently squeezing the handle of her cup, it all dawns on me.

119905037.content: But if I can get up early, I could check out your morning training... How about I see if I can manage to crawl out of bed tomorrow?

119905039.content: Maybe some coffee will help if I'm really sleepy in the morning. You treated me today, so tomorrow it's my treat.

119905041.content: I never said I was definitely going back tomorrow. But if the dojo doesn't let me in, I'll just have to go back to Ain Soph and continue reading my book.

119905042.content: Of course they'll let you in... It would be great if you could make the time to come by.

119905043.content: Seeming surprised by my sudden change in tune and feeling a little uncomfortable at having her feelings read so easily, Tsukuyomi's eyes flit to one side. She gets up and gives me a quick bow.

119905044.content: I look forward to your feedback.

119905045.content: What feedback? Just think of me as a visitor.

119905046.content: There's no need to be humble. Whether it's training or combat, we're all eager to get your guidance and opinions.

119905048.content: It's a big deal for someone like Tsukuyomi to express her trust in me. I feel reassured knowing that I can take her words at face value.

119905049.content: Speaking of trust, you can always tell me what you're thinking, Tsukuyomi. There's no need to hold back.

119905051.content: Well then... Sleep well, Administrator. I'll see you tomorrow.

119905053.content: After seeing Tsukuyomi out, I look back at the half-read book on the table.

119905055.content: To make sure I can actually get out of bed at 6:00 AM tomorrow, this night owl resolves to end the night before it begins.

119905057.content: Morning, Tsukuyomi. I hope I haven't kept you waiting... (Yawn)...

119905058.content: Not at all, I came early to tidy up the dojo.

119905059.content: Only the two of us are at the dojo this early in the morning. Blearily taking the bamboo sword she passes me into my hands, I look less like an interloper now.

119905060.content: I put down the paper bag with the coffees in it. Despite being fully rested, my night owl's biological clock makes it impossible to keep from yawning.

119905061.content: Did you stay up late last night?

119905062.content: No. I was actually so excited to come here today that I couldn't sleep.

119905063.content: ...Since you're awake enough to make bad jokes, let's start warming up.

119905064.content: Huh?! I thought we agreed I was just here to observe?

119905065.content: You'll get bored if you just watch me train the whole time.

119905066.content: No way. I wouldn't have come if I thought I'd get bored. (Options)

119905067.content: Your training technique is a captivating mix of seriousness and elegance. Even to a layperson like me, it's beautiful!

119905068.content: ...Please don't say weird things out of nowhere like that.

119905069.content: Tsukuyomi awkwardly looks away, then walks to the center of the training area.

119905070.content: If you don't want to train, you could take a look around, or watch from the side...

119905072.content: I do what is likely a mediocre practice swing from memory. Tsukuyomi turns around in surprise, and we lock eyes for a few seconds. I swear I can see her fighting the urge to smile.

119905075.content: After my hundredth swing, the bamboo sword—which felt light when I first took hold of it—drops to the ground like a lead pole.

119905076.content: It is pretty fun... but... I'm a little tired...

119905077.content: Doing 100 reps in one set is already great for a novice.

119905078.content: The training's about to get more intense. You should probably rest a little bit first.

119905079.content: Tsukuyomi passes me a sports drink. I gulp it down, then sit on the wooden floor of the dojo with the empty bottle.

119905080.content: ...Thank you. Please, don't let me stop you.

119905082.content: Instantly, the air around Tsukuyomi seems to change. It's as if once lethargic electrons have started to collide and spin wildly around each other, about to create sparks at any moment.

119905084.content: Tsukuyomi may be holding an ordinary bamboo sword, but her momentum, speed, and eyes burning like two green flames take my breath away.

119905085.content: I can almost see the ghostly trajectory her sword cleaves through the air. At this point, I'm not even sure that the bamboo sword can handle it.

119905086.content: Despite exerting this degree of force, Tsukuyomi's movements are as beautiful and fluid as ever, like a snowshoe hare leaping in the moonlight.

119905087.content: (How lucky am I to get to see swordplay like this up close without even paying for a ticket...)

119905088.content: Thinking this, I can't help but sit up and straighten my back.

119905089.content: Administrator? Did I do something wrong?

119905090.content: Huh? Oh, no... I can sit a little farther back if I'm disturbing you.

119905091.content: No need, you won't disturb me by watching. I was just hoping to get your input today.

119905092.content: Is there any place you think my technique could be improved?

119905093.content: ...I don't think I'm qualified to say. Why do you ask?

119905094.content: I read in a book that the best way to deal with a bottleneck is to change tack. Warriors often get so mired in their own way of thinking that they can't see as clearly as an observer can.

119905095.content: Sounds like the books that Buzenbo collects... Don't overdo it, Tsukuyomi. You just need to clear your head a little.

119905096.content: I'll try any healthy approach. Besides, just because I read it in a novel doesn't mean it's completely unreasonable.

119905097.content: Any thoughts you have, even if it's just that you'd like to see a certain technique, you can tell me.

119905099.content: The scope of the question now broadened, all sorts of stupid jokes and strange ideas pop into my head. Including some bolder ones that would probably get me in trouble...

119905100.content: Since you read it in a book, maybe you could try committing to the bit a little more? Like, how warriors in books are always shouting out the name of their techniques as they attack.

119905101.content: ...Is that what you'd like to see?

119905103.content: Do I really have to shout?

119905104.content: Yep. Don't you think shouting would give your moves more oomph?

119905105.content: Oomph... That's it! Tsukuyomi, you're just missing a little oomph! Playing it cool is totally fine, but maybe you'll experience something new by getting riled up once in a while...

119905106.content: For some reason, seeing Tsukuyomi's somewhat distressed expression makes me double down and ramble on.

119905108.content: Clearly struggling, Tsukuyomi bites her lip and lowers her head. When she looks back up, her face shows only a warrior's resolve.

119905109.content: While I don't believe that one's efficacy in battle has anything to do with shouting, since you suggested it, maybe it really is an area I've overlooked.

119905110.content: (Sorry, I was just curious, that's all...)

119905111.content: Please observe me once more, Administrator—Here I go!

119905112.content: Even though it's just an ordinary practice sword, the moment Tsukuyomi raises it, her aura changes.

119905119.content: Just a few attempts later, Tsukuyomi is crouched down on the ground, panting and red-faced. I get the feeling this exertion isn't from swinging her sword... and that feeling of guilt finally returns.

119905120.content: Um, I could be totally wrong...

119905123.content: The name of a technique represents its creator's understanding of that technique. Shouting out the name is a way to get closer to its essence.

119905124.content: I was right to have you come and observe my training.

119905125.content: Um... I'm just glad I could help.

119905126.content: As thanks for now, I'll teach you a few practical training methods.

119905127.content: Have you ever seen students in Sasanami dojos shout a kiai as they charge at each other?

119905129.content: Before I can figure out whether Tsukuyomi is joking or not, she takes my hand and pulls me up to my feet.

119905131.content: Tsukuyomi's gaze is as clear as always, but am I seeing things, or do I detect a hint of retaliation in her eyes...?

119906002.content: Red-faced, I at last raise my practice sword and shout under Tsukuyomi's watchful gaze.

119906003.content: You've got the "oomph." Next, try using it to swing your sword forward. Remember to keep it vertical.

119906004.content: Could I ask you to stand across from me and act as my opponent, Tsukuyomi-sensei?

119906005.content: I could, but you should learn to walk before you run.

119906006.content: It's fine, isn't this the same as a practice swing? I think I've got the hang of that already.

119906007.content: ...I see. Okay, try and hit me with everything you've got. Don't worry, I'll be fine.

119906008.content: Seemingly convinced by my confidence, Tsukuyomi raises her sword and stands before me, revealing a slightly resigned smile.

119906009.content: (Who said I was gonna go easy on you? Hyah, hyah, hyah!!)

119906011.content: My face must be beet-red from the exertion as I charge forward.

119906012.content: Even though she's facing an amateur like me, Tsukuyomi solemnly raises her sword to block my attack. I swing with everything I've got, not at all concerned that I'll be able to hurt her.

119906016.content: I must have underestimated my own strength. My practice sword suddenly snaps upon striking Tsukuyomi's, causing me to immediately lose my balance and fall forward.

119906017.content: Owww, ow, ow... Huh? I'm... okay?

119906018.content: I instinctively close my eyes and cover my head, bracing myself for a painful landing. Instead, I sink into something soft. I slowly open my eyes.

119906021.content: I-I'm fine. Sorry for crashing into you...

119906022.content: It was nothing a Modifier couldn't handle. I'm sorry I ended up falling myself instead of catching you.

119906024.content: I feel even more embarrassed when I see the concern in Tsukuyomi's eyes. Bracing my hands on the floor, I push myself off of her. Still recovering from the shock, I look at my broken sword on the floor.

119906025.content: Are you sure you're okay? That was a powerful blow, I'm pretty sure I saw the sword bounce back and hit you.

119906026.content: What? I don't remember anything like that...

119906027.content: Seeing her shake her head and sigh like a doctor before a hopeless patient, I get a little nervous. I check myself over and find nothing amiss.

119906028.content: See? I'm completely fine, fit as a fiddle—Ow...!

119906029.content: Just as my range of motion increases and my smile widens, I suddenly feel a sharp pain in my arm. Sucking in air, I look down at my arm and see a bruise forming under my kendo clothes.

119906030.content: Unable to ignore an injury like this, Tsukuyomi checks me over. She furrows her brows slightly, but sighs with relief.

119906031.content: Let's end today's training here. You did well, Administrator.

119906033.content: I hold up the hilt of my broken practice sword in what probably looks like a comical salute.

119906034.content: Actually, if you have the time after this, I made a booking for you at an onsen.

119906036.content: In Sasanami, people usually soak in hot springs to treat fatigue, aches, and pains. Medicinal herbs are often added to the water as well.

119906037.content: You trained pretty hard today, and you hurt your arm. The onsen I booked for us is known for its healing properties.

119906038.content: The bruising should go away in no time, but my arm is killing me. I sure hope this hot spring's as amazing as you say. Besides...

119906039.content: I exhale. My breath rises into the air like a white wisp of cloud, obscuring Tsukuyomi's face. Walking alongside me down the street at night, she seems more relaxed than ever.

119906040.content: This kind of weather just makes you want to take a dip in a hot spring.

119906041.content: I faintly hear soft laughter coming from next to me.

119906042.content: Sasanami's hot spring season isn't for a little while. Still, winter does start earlier in Sasanami than in Ain Soph.

119906043.content: Hahaha... Maybe I'm just too sensitive to the cold.

119906044.content: I scratch my head, feeling a little bashful. I look up at the clouds, gathered densely overhead like clotted cream, and a thought suddenly occurs to me...

119906046.content: Based on the temperature and the weather forecast, the chance of snow is almost zero percent.

119906048.content: Tsukuyomi's cold analysis makes me feel a little crestfallen.

119906049.content: Still, it would be nice if it snowed tonight.

119906051.content: I can hear my heart start thumping in my chest. It's rare that I hear Tsukuyomi say anything so subtle, yet frank.

119906052.content: Watching the snow while soaking in a hot spring is one of the most beautiful scenes Sasanami's winter has to offer.

119906053.content: I bet... But like you said, it'll only get as low as five or six degrees Celsius tonight. Probably not cold enough for snow.

119906054.content: If you'd like to experience the hot springs in the snow, I suggest you come back in a month or two when it's colder.

119906055.content: But it'll be peak hot spring season by then. You'd need to book well in advance.

119906056.content: Ahaha, I wonder if I'll get the chance to come back to Sasanami that soon... Speaking of which, if I really am able to come back, will you go to the onsen with me?

119906057.content: Huh? You'd like me to come with you?

119906058.content: Tsukuyomi casts me a questioning sideways glance as we walk.

119906059.content: Oh, because, um, I'm not sure how the onsens in Sasanami work.

119906060.content: I've heard that Sasanami has its own onsen culture. If I go by myself, I'm afraid I'll embarrass myself or do something to offend other people there...

119906062.content: There's no need to be so concerned. I'll explain everything you'll need to know in advance.

119906063.content: If you're still worried that you'll do something wrong, we can go together.

119906064.content: I think you'll have to... Even if you do teach me how it all works, who knows how much I'll be able to remember...

119906065.content: Tsukuyomi is visibly stunned, probably because my excuses are too obvious. But she doesn't call me out on it. Instead, she responds in her usual calm, reassuring voice.

119906066.content: I understand. Leave it to me.

119906067.content: Not just this time—whenever you come to Sasanami to go to the hot springs in the future, I'll accompany you.

119906068.content: Thank you... With you there, I'll have nothing to worry about.

119906069.content: My worries return before long, however—When we arrive at the onsen, I'm as shook as if I were caught in a small Sasanami earthquake.

119906070.content: Right, I didn't know we'd be coming here today, so I don't have a bathing suit with me... Do they sell them here?

119906071.content: I look around the onsen courtyard. I can smell the lingering fragrance of water vapor and herbs even from here. For some reason, an old lady wearing a Sasanami dressing gown looks at me with smiling eyes.

119906073.content: In Sasanami, you don't wear a bathing suit in the hot springs.

119906076.content: Tsukuyomi's airy reply makes my jaw drop. I quickly pull myself back together, surely it's...

119906077.content: I get it, so everyone gets their own little bathing area.

119906078.content: No. There are different areas, but they're all communal.

119906080.content: Maybe I'm not ready for Sasanami onsens...

119906081.content: Seeing me about to turn tail and run, a sympathetic smile appears on Tsukuyomi's face.

119906082.content: Relax, Administrator. I thought you might struggle with communal bathing at first, so I booked a room with a private bathing area.

119906083.content: I never should have doubted you!

119906084.content: Fantastic, as long as I can soak by myself...

119906085.content: By yourself? But I only booked the one room.

119906087.content: The bath has more than enough room for two people. Like we agreed before, I'll accompany you.

119906088.content: I... I thought people soaked in the hot springs by themselves...

119906089.content: It's not uncommon for first-timers to faint from the heat. I wouldn't feel comfortable leaving you by yourself.

119906090.content: ...If you don't feel comfortable bathing together, I can watch you from the side.

119906091.content: It's not that I'd be uncomfortable, it's just that, um... this is all new for me. Well, you don't mind? Tsukuyomi?

119906092.content: In Sasanami, it's normal for family members to bathe together. When friends bathe together, it's a symbol of trust and closeness.

119906094.content: The one who stopped Buzenbo from doing something stupid and enabled me to swing my blade at Orochi without remorse...

119906095.content: The one who unraveled the tangles and knots in my heart so that I could truly master Shinri...

119906096.content: And today, the one willing to indulge me for an entire day and even get hurt for their trouble...

119906098.content: So, my answer to your earlier question is "No."

119906100.content: I think I also have an answer in my heart now.

119906102.content: I thought I'd mentally prepared myself for this moment, but when I open the door to the open-air private bath and see Tsukuyomi one step ahead of me...

119906104.content: I can't help but freeze in place...

119906105.content: In the light of the moon and stars, the hot spring vapor swirls through the air with a milky-white glow.

119906106.content: I feel as though I've strayed into some distant, other world and happened upon a fairy relaxing in a spring deep in the forest.

119906107.content: (It would be nice if it snowed... I don't think there could be anything more beautiful than Sasanami in the winter.)

119906108.content: I find myself mumbling a familiar line.

119906109.content: It isn't polite to stare at others' bodies in the hot spring, Administrator.

119906110.content: If Tsukuyomi hadn't spoken, who knows how long I would have stood there staring off into space.

119906112.content: It's okay. I haven't told you about Sasanami's hot spring etiquette yet, after all.

119906113.content: Um, about what you've already told me...

119906114.content: I remove my towel and step into the hot spring, its warmth permeating my entire being. To my surprise, I don't feel embarrassed, because...

119906115.content: Bathing together is a sign of trust and closeness, right...? So, I guess this means we're even better friends now...

119906116.content: My voice almost becomes a whisper by the time I finish speaking. Maybe she didn't hear me behind her, but Tsukuyomi doesn't respond. Instead, she tilts her head back to look up at the endless sky.

119906117.content: Neither full nor a crescent, it's just an ordinary-looking moon up there tonight.

119906118.content: The moon is so beautiful tonight. It would be nice...

119906119.content: Tsukuyomi's white breath lingers heavily in the mist. Following the echo of her voice, I almost instinctively open my mouth to say...

102401001.content: I go to Shu's office, just as I always do when missions are assigned.

102401002.content: As usual, folders fill Shu's computer screen. She locates the folder she needs with ease, then sends me the mission data to read.

102401003.content: A criminal case? Shouldn't the police handle this?

102401004.content: Normally, yes. However, bizarre cases that defy common sense often suggest Visbane involvement.

102401005.content: Aether Gazer and CORG signed an agreement saying that both parties would coordinate the investigation and Visbane elimination missions under such circumstances.

102401006.content: In that case, why am I the only one being sent on this mission? Shouldn't there also be some combat personnel?

102401008.content: Shu's brows are knit, as if several distressing thoughts are now crossing her mind.

102401009.content: After agreeing to cooperate, CORG published an administrative document requiring law enforcement to promptly report any such cases to the Egregious Crimes Department. Then CORG would undertake a joint investigation with Aether Gazer.

102401010.content: But many of these cases were simply the result of irresponsible police officers. They became unsolved cases and ended up as false alarms only after such mishandling—a waste of our time.

102401011.content: We now routinely send a clerical worker to discuss the case with an Egregious Crimes Department agent first. Once we confirm that there's Visbane activity involved, we then arrange for Modifiers to eradicate them.

102401013.content: However, there's another reason I chose you to do this.

102401015.content: The agent that the Egregious Crimes Department sent is quite... unsociable. You're the only one in Aether Gazer who's ever had any luck with him.

102401017.content: Seeing that stony-faced, tight-lipped guy again after so long reminds me of all the awkward moments we had when we were first getting to know each other.

102401018.content: Anubis, it's been a while... Remember me?

102401020.content: Looks like we'll be working together on a few cases.

102401022.content: Silence fills the air between us.

102401023.content: That said... I've never done anything like this before, but I'll try to help you in any way I can.

102401024.content: It's fine. I could complete the investigation even if I was on my own.

102401025.content: I requested permission from my superior to conduct the investigation alone. According to their response, however, our agreement with Aether Gazer stipulates that we must investigate jointly.

102401026.content: Respectfully, I don't need your help. I'm simply complying with this condition of the agreement.

102401027.content: When you say it like that, I feel like I'm persona non grata here...

102401029.content: Forget it. Why don't we just begin our investigation...

102401030.content: A sealed-off area takes up half of the bustling commercial street, like a boulder constricting a river. Passersby can be heard grumbling as they squeeze past.

102401031.content: Within the restricted area are the almost unrecognizable remains of a bank. Its floor-to-ceiling windows are all shattered and its main lobby is in utter shambles. It looks like it has just been wracked by a violent explosion.

102401032.content: A team of police officers is cleaning up the site while attempting to maintain order.

102401033.content: I'm an operative with the Egregious Crimes Department, identification number AN1024. We're here to investigate the case.

102401034.content: Phew, finally... This kid's been driving me nuts...

102401037.content: Before the young officer can finish getting the words out of his mouth, he's interrupted by a child's bellow. Anubis and I look past his shoulders and see a few officers trying to wrangle a mother and her son.

102401038.content: Judging from the clustered bite marks on the officers' shoulders, they've had their hands full with this kid indeed.

102401039.content: Anyhow, first things first—the case. It's open-and-shut, really. Someone blew open the vault, and the security guard on duty has gone missing—a classic inside job.

102401040.content: The thing is, even with all the surveillance resources in the city on the case, we just can't find the guy. That and our checks didn't turn up any records of financial market transactions involving the missing cash or gold.

102401041.content: The security guard's family is the only lead we've got. We found them skulking around the scene right after we sealed it off, like they'd been sent to spy on it. I arrested them on suspicion of being accomplices and will be taking them in for questioning shortly.

102401042.content: What're you talking about?! We're only here 'cause we're worried about my dad!

102401044.content: Ahem! You have the right to remain silent. Anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law!

102401045.content: The kid bites into the hand of an officer next to him, who yelps out in pain. I'm finding it hard to imagine a kid this young being an accomplice to a crime.

102401046.content: He's just a child. Is this really necessary?

102401047.content: I only planned to arrest the security guard's wife, but the kid insisted on coming with her.

102401048.content: What do you think we should do, Anubis?

102401049.content: ...Just hold the interrogation here. I have some questions for them as well.

102401051.content: Of course, no problem. Whatever you need.

102401052.content: Are you here to set up my dad too?

102401053.content: I'm here to gather necessary data. Where was your father last night?

102401054.content: Doing his shift at the bank. He wanted to work the night shift so he could make more money.

102401055.content: Do you know where your father is now?

102401056.content: How should I know? I thought finding him is the cops' job...

102401057.content: When did you and your mother get here?

102401058.content: We came as soon as we heard something happened at Dad's bank, but by the time we got here, it was already sealed off and Dad was gone...

102401059.content: Archie, that's enough! We'll... We'll cooperate with the investigation. We got here at... around 9 o'clock this morning.

102401061.content: I asked them all kinds of questions and that's all I got out of them as well. I think we'd have better luck doing this back at the station.

102401062.content: They were placed under arrest at 9 o'clock?

102401063.content: Yep. I realized they were family members of the security guard when I checked their information. They were also behaving suspiciously, so I arrested them.

102401064.content: Great. So, you admit that you arrested these two civilians without a warrant or probable cause.

102401065.content: The kid and I are stunned as we look at Anubis, who now has a piercing look in his eyes.

102401066.content: Sure, I admit it... Isn't there something called "temporary discretionary power?"

102401067.content: Indeed. The Ain Soph Police Department grants temporary discretionary power to the first officers arriving on the scene of a crime, permitting them to place persons they deem suspicious under immediate arrest.

102401068.content: The arresting officer then has two hours to gather sufficient evidence to prove their suspicions. If they succeed, a supplemental arrest warrant is issued and a formal arrest can be made.

102401070.content: I... I've been busy trying to maintain order around here! I... I just need to report their relationship to the suspect to police headquarters, and it'll prove my suspicion that they're his accomplices!

102401071.content: But you didn't, and you'd face serious charges for attempting to do so in excess of your time limit.

102401072.content: Fine... I'll let them go for now. I'll figure out another way to do it by the book later...

102401074.content: After the mother and her son are released, she rushes over to thank Anubis. He gives just a slight nod of his head in response, then heads into the bank. I hurriedly follow after him.

102401075.content: Nice tactic! Pretend to question the suspects, then turn it on the officer! I also want to thank you on that mother and son's behalf!

102401076.content: Why? Making presuppositions isn't conducive to the investigation.

102401077.content: Besides, I wasn't pretending to question them. I was meticulously extracting the required information. I just discovered a lapse on the officer's part, that's all.

102401079.content: Anubis carefully inspects the destroyed vault door and the lobby for clues left behind, wordlessly jotting down his observations.

102401080.content: Hey, uh, since I let them go, I won't get charged with anything now, right?

102401081.content: That's for the arrestees to decide.

102401082.content: Ah... Um, I'll make sure I apologize to them.

102401083.content: Anubis continues to inspect the crime scene, taking no notice of the young officer's change in tone.

102401084.content: Why did you initially want to report this case to the Egregious Crimes Department?

102401085.content: Because we just can't find the security guard, and our surveillance and cash flow checks didn't turn up any clues. It's like he vanished into thin air, it's bizarre.

102401086.content: When his family was discovered near the crime scene, I thought I'd found a new angle to crack the case from...

102401087.content: A suspect who plans a robbery well in advance would have no trouble evading surveillance. Moreover, a prudent criminal wouldn't make a purchase with gold and bank notes they had just stolen, so that's a dead end.

102401088.content: More illogical still would be to send your own immediate family to poke around the scene of the crime before the dust had even settled.

102401090.content: Since a human being is physically incapable of damaging the vault door like this, we can reasonably surmise that the perpetrator used explosives. Have you checked purchase records of demolition charges?

102401091.content: Demolition charges? We thought about looking into that at first, but that sort of thing gets sold on the black market too. It would take too long to investigate.

102401092.content: With such a serious incident happening in the heart of the downtown area, our superior's orders were to solve this case as soon as possible to avoid bad press...

102401093.content: The young officer shifts uncomfortably, not saying anything further, but his expression makes it easy for us to connect the dots regarding his radical decision.

102401094.content: Why didn't you invoke Investigation Regulation 12? Subjective factors must not impact the investigation strategy.

102401095.content: My superior would put me on desk duty for the rest of my life if I did something like that!

102401096.content: ...Put me on the phone with your superior.

102401098.content: Anubis takes the officer's phone and, in a clear, dispassionate voice, repeats the provision of the investigation regulation to the person at the other end. He waits a few moments, then returns the phone to the uneasy officer.

102401099.content: The new investigation strategy has been approved. Please proceed accordingly and contact me as soon as you make progress. This case is now nominally under the supervision of the Egregious Crimes Department.

102401101.content: Awesome! Case closed, just like that!

102401102.content: This case hasn't been solved yet.

102401104.content: The next case location is nearby, let's get moving.

102401105.content: After pedantically correcting my statement, Anubis immediately turns his focus to the next item on the agenda with the efficiency of a tightly wound clock.

102401106.content: But all of a sudden, one of this clock's hands is locked in a child's vise-like grip.

102401107.content: Hey, you seem way smarter than those other cops. You must know what really happened, right?

102401109.content: But Mom, I have something really important to ask him!

102401110.content: The boy named Archie clings stubbornly to Anubis' pant leg, not budging whatsoever. Anubis frowns slightly, but makes no attempt to extricate himself from the boy's grasp.

102401111.content: Is my dad... a bad guy?

102401112.content: ...I don't know, there isn't enough evidence.

102401113.content: The concern in the boy's eyes instantly gives way to joy.

102401114.content: Then, my dad isn't a bad guy!

102401115.content: ...I don't know, there isn't enough evidence.

102401116.content: Archie is taken aback, and the joy in his eyes reverts back to concern.

102401117.content: Anubis looks down at the unrelenting hands with a strained expression on his face. I quickly come to his rescue by pulling Archie away.

102401118.content: You're gonna have to be patient, okay, buddy? He's still investigating the case.

102401119.content: So... my dad's not a bad guy?

102401120.content: I can tell from the tears welling up in Archie's eyes that he needs an answer. But I can also tell that, much like his facial expression, Anubis' response isn't going to change.

102401122.content: His head hung low, the boy turns to his mother and throws himself into her arms. The two then leave together.

102401123.content: I feel like we should've reassured him a little...

102401124.content: Your answer was fine. Making baseless promises is the greatest dereliction of duty an agent can commit.

102401126.content: The boy pauses for a moment, then the concern in his eyes is at last replaced by determination.

102401127.content: Mom, let's go home and wait for Dad to come back!

102401128.content: I let out a sigh as I watch them leave.

102401130.content: Anubis' eyes follow them as they leave.

102401132.content: While I'm at a loss, Anubis remains steadfast. It seems that, to him, solving the case quickly is more important than dwelling on the family's feelings.

102402001.content: Amid a bustling crowd gathered at the entrance to a hospital, a few youths—though bandaged up—energetically recount the events of the previous night to the visitors, drawing cheers and applause.

102402002.content: An older police officer responsible for keeping order at the scene listens with interest. It's only when he notices Anubis approaching him that he remembers that he's on the clock.

102402003.content: I'm an operative with the Egregious Crimes Department, identification number...

102402004.content: Hello! I nearly forgot. I was just going to go back and organize the transcripts.

102402005.content: Please give me a brief summary of the case.

102402006.content: Long story short, our local heroes saved the day again!

102402007.content: Last night, some thug was going to take advantage of an intoxicated girl who fell by the side of the road. But then, his luck ran out when he bumped into these brave kids.

102402008.content: Still, that thug was no pushover. Those kids took a beating, but they managed to call the police and waited until we arrived.

102402009.content: When the officer finishes, the crowd erupts in cheers again.

102402010.content: They're amazing! I hope my little scamp takes a leaf out of their book.

102402011.content: They did it again. Sure enough, doctors are the real heroes.

102402012.content: I can't help but be in awe of these youths either. Anubis, on the other hand, is all business.

102402014.content: That's the thing... we can't find him anywhere. That's why we reported the case to the Egregious Crimes Department.

102402015.content: It's all very strange. The crime occurred in a surveillance blind spot, and we couldn't find the guy in any of the nearby surveillance footage. Not only that, we didn't find any suspicious DNA at the scene either...

102402016.content: ...How did you arrive at your description of the incident?

102402017.content: That was thanks to those kids. Despite their injuries, they hung in there all night to give me a detailed account of the incident.

102402018.content: It's nothing, we were just doing our part! The only thing I regret is letting the bastard get away.

102402019.content: This youth's injuries are the most severe, his arms and legs are completely bandaged up. But he still wears a look of shame on his face, like he didn't do enough.

102402020.content: That's right, the bastard's gotta be caught!

102402021.content: Officer, if there's anything we can do to help, just say the word!

102402022.content: Yeah, sounds like we'd better catch this guy pronto.

102402023.content: As the crowd grows agitated, Anubis asks a question that hasn't occurred to anyone else at the scene.

102402025.content: Her? Uh... still in the inpatient ward. She was out cold all night. Kids these days just don't know when to stop drinking...

102402027.content: We enter the quiet ward and see the girl lying on a bed. Her girl-next-door look hardly screams "all-night benders."

102402029.content: Just ordinary inebriation, I think. The doctor said her vital signs are stable, but she's out cold. So, they decided to admit her first for a period of observation. They'll conduct more a detailed examination when she wakes up.

102402031.content: I'd like to summon the four suspects.

102402032.content: There's no need to trouble yourself with pushing papers... Wait, suspects?

102402033.content: Anubis' placidly delivered decision leaves the officer and me stunned.

102402034.content: Surely you don't mean those four young men?

102402035.content: It's thanks to them that this girl was rescued unharmed. One of them is even a doctor. He risked injury to rush to her rescue, provided plenty of first-hand information, and quickly apprised the medics of the situation.

102402037.content: Anubis, where is this coming from all of a sudden?

102402038.content: The victim's clothes look clean, and no signs of a struggle are visible on her body. This is not consistent with the suspects' story that she was attacked.

102402039.content: Well, I believe they said that she was already passed out drunk by the time they got there.

102402040.content: Thus, the details of the case only reflect their side of the story and are not entirely credible.

102402041.content: After Anubis points out all the holes in the case, the officer finally accepts that it's indeed suspicious.

102402042.content: Without surveillance footage to exonerate them, they really are all suspects...

102402044.content: I'm... concerned that the optics of this will be bad.

102402045.content: Those young men are something of local heroes, they even received an award from our police station for their help catching a thief... And they were injured... They've earned the trust of everyone here, including me.

102402048.content: The officer trails off awkwardly, but I see the persistence in Anubis' eyes.

102402049.content: Anubis, why don't we wait until everyone outside leaves, then discreetly call the suspects over for questioning?

102402050.content: Otherwise, the police will have an angry mob on their hands. After all, as far as the public is concerned, the police still haven't caught the perpetrator. If they see the police taking their heroes into custody instead...

102402051.content: No. They're suspects, so they may still make a run for it. I can't allow that to happen.

102402052.content: If you oppose my decision, you may invoke a regulation vindicating your objection.

102402053.content: The officer and I exchange glances.

102402054.content: The hospital's main entrance area is still teeming with people. If the four youths, once treated as honored guests, were to suddenly be surrounded by a team of stern-looking officers, speculations would immediately run rampant.

102402055.content: According to the doctor's advice, it's too soon for them to leave the hospital anyway. We'll just have to hold the interrogation here.

102402056.content: You have the right to an attorney, but anything you say can and will be used against you in a court of law.

102402058.content: That bastard's still out there, and you want to interrogate us instead?

102402059.content: Perhaps due to his astonishment, the youth's voice gets louder as he speaks, catching the attention of everyone within earshot.

102402061.content: You're going after the heroes instead of the criminal?

102402062.content: The clamor intensifies, but Anubis is perfectly still. He sedately studies these four "heroes," his gaze becoming increasingly incisive.

102402063.content: Which of you is the doctor?

102402065.content: I... just started this year. Figures I already ended up being taken to the hospital on a stretcher myself...

102402066.content: According to the police report, you actively helped give first aid when medics arrived on the scene last night. In addition, you provided a first-hand account of the victim's physical condition. Is that correct?

102402068.content: I've just received the forensic report. She was rendered unconscious by a medical anesthetic. Why would you omit this fact and lead the medics to erroneously conclude that the victim was simply intoxicated?

102402069.content: Everyone falls silent. The officer and I are even more baffled, having no clue where Anubis' sudden accusation is coming from.

102402070.content: The young doctor, however, suddenly looks uneasy. Eventually, he gives an answer that no one sees coming.

102402071.content: An anesthetic... Ohhh! I remember now! I did notice an odd smell when I was giving her first aid. Now that I think about it... you're right, it must have been diethyl ether!

102402072.content: What a rookie mistake, I can't believe I confused it with the smell of alcohol! It's an inhalational anesthetic that I wouldn't normally smell, maybe that's why...

102402073.content: No wonder she didn't put up any kind of a fight when that bastard attacked her! He must have knocked her out first!

102402074.content: Anubis placidly regards the young doctor, his breathing only pausing slightly, as if in a sigh.

102402075.content: I didn't order a forensic examination of the victim, nor did I specify that the medical anesthetic used was diethyl ether or any other kind.

102402076.content: The surrounding officers and I look in shock at the young man. The implications of what he just said are self-evident.

102402078.content: What I just said... It must be the head injury I got in my fight with the thug talking...

102402079.content: You have the right to withdraw the statement you just made, of course. Even if we wait until the victim regains consciousness and run another toxicology test, it wouldn't detect a substance as volatile as diethyl ether.

102402080.content: From a legal standpoint, you could all have very well been exonerated. That is if the police were so convinced by your depositions initially that they didn't check the hospital's pharmacy records or look into your whereabouts prior to last night's incident.

102402081.content: Thus, staying up all night despite your injuries so that you could "reconstruct the events of the case" for the police was a matter of necessity.

102402082.content: The four young men stand frozen in place. It's clear they want to defend themselves, but they ultimately choose to remain silent.

102402083.content: I've recorded everything that was just said. Please use this as substantiating evidence to execute temporary discretionary power and formally arrest these four suspects.

102402084.content: Considering that they may have lied in their depositions, it's possible that the thug was fabricated. I would recommend reallocating police resources to investigate the two leads I mentioned earlier instead.

102402086.content: The seasoned officer quickly springs to action, arranging for officers to notify the medics, lock down the suspects, and call in patrol cars.

102402087.content: Shouts rise up from the encircling crowd of spectators. Having only heard the beginning of the confrontation and nothing of what followed, they're convinced that the police are unjustly arresting valiant young heroes.

102402088.content: As the one who initiated the interrogation, Anubis is immediately bombarded by a slew of hostile questions.

102402091.content: There's no need for them to be this cruel about it...

102402092.content: They'll understand once the investigation has been completed and the police make a public statement.

102402093.content: Anubis' composure remains completely unbroken. It's apparent that he isn't bothered by the situation in the least, but I still can't help but feel that he deserves better.

102402094.content: People with his prowess for ruthless argumentation and disdain for obsequious justifications are the most easily misunderstood.

102402095.content: I'm sorry for doubting you before in the hospital.

102402096.content: Your doubts came from a logical starting point. Why are you apologizing?

102402097.content: Because... of all people, your friends should be the ones who understand you, right?

102402098.content: At first, Anubis looks at me in confusion upon hearing this statement. Then, I catch the faintest of smiles flit across his face.

102402099.content: We should head to the location of the next case.

102402100.content: Already? Don't you ever take a break?

102402101.content: I will rest as required once the investigations are completed.

102403001.content: Under the midday sun in a once quiet corner of the park, a large crowd of murmuring onlookers has suddenly gathered around a gap in the surrounding wall.

102403002.content: Meanwhile, police officers are removing the hazard tape that was cordoning it off, seemingly signaling the resolution of the case.

102403003.content: Which officer is in charge here? I'm an operative with the Egregious Crimes Department, identification number...

102403004.content: Oh, this is embarrassing, I almost forgot!

102403005.content: It's all because a junior officer tried to weasel out of doing any work by insisting that a perfectly ordinary case was actually a "paranormal incident." They were the one who reported it to the Egregious Crimes Department.

102403006.content: After I took over the case, I asked around and it was immediately clear that this was just a case of vandalism. The perp's in police custody and we're wrapping up the case now. Unfortunately, you guys weren't informed in time.

102403007.content: It's not every day that someone willingly owns up to a mistake like that.

102403008.content: Not responding, Anubis' eyes fall on the gaping hole.

102403009.content: The ground around the hole is littered with masonry fragments. I can barely imagine how much force would be required to smash solid marble to smithereens like this.

102403010.content: How did the perpetrator destroy the wall?

102403011.content: Uh... with an explosive, apparently. It's still under investigation.

102403012.content: Clearly taking issue with the police chief's lax attitude, Anubis' usually even expression wrinkles to form a rare frown.

102403014.content: I'm embarrassed to say it, but it was just a school kid. When my guys went to the school to make the arrest, the kid wouldn't let go of a chair leg. They're all still there now.

102403015.content: It's tough dealing with little monsters like that. I'd planned to go over there myself once I wrapped everything up here.

102403016.content: How did you deduce that he's the perpetrator?

102403017.content: Don't get me started. Park security once caught the kid robbing tourists, and he kept going on and on about how he was gonna blow up the park wall. Everyone in the neighborhood heard about it.

102403018.content: After committing the crime, he went around bragging about it to his classmates. In the end, a teacher caught wind of it and immediately filed a police report. I looked into it, and sure enough, he was in the area last night.

102403019.content: Is there video evidence of it?

102403020.content: Strangely enough, all the security cameras around here are broken. It was probably that kid!

102403021.content: ...Seal off the crime scene and take me to him. This case isn't closed yet.

102403022.content: Huh? Surely there's no need to trouble yourself with the little reprobate.

102403024.content: I've never seen Anubis this adamant. The chief's attitude must have offended some deeply held principle of his.

102403025.content: Wouldn't it save us some trouble to get the case closed sooner than later?

102403026.content: Our mission is to investigate the case, not to close it.

102403027.content: Just as the police car we're riding in arrives at the school gates, we hear a racket coming from the school. The voice rattles me long before I finally get a look at who it belongs to.

102403028.content: The voice belongs to a boy with a striking hairdo. At some point, he snatched a pair of handcuffs from a police officer, then cuffed one of his wrists to a bar on the windowsill. It's clear he's not going down without a fight.

102403030.content: You think you can just arrest me? I'm ain't goin' nowhere!

102403031.content: See what you let happen? How did he get his hands on your handcuffs? And where are the kid's parents?

102403032.content: About that... His father's in prison, and his mother won't answer her phone.

102403033.content: They don't give a crap about me! Don't bother calling that hag!

102403034.content: Amid the hooligan's shouts, looks of disgust appear on the faces of the students that have been evacuated to the outside of the classroom.

102403036.content: Why aren't you doing anything? My phone's still in there!

102403037.content: Maybe you could try shooting him with a tranquilizer gun, Mr. Officer?

102403038.content: The students seem to be deliberately making no effort to lower their voices, and the hooligan hears everything.

102403039.content: Yeah, arrest me! If you have the guts!

102403040.content: Anubis gestures for the officers to stay back, then approaches the boy alone.

102403041.content: Under Law Enforcement Regulation 237, I'd like to ask you a few questions. Your cooperation would be appreciated.

102403043.content: The hooligan's provocative choice of words riles up everyone present. Only Anubis is unfazed.

102403044.content: Who destroyed the Ain Soph Central Park wall?

102403045.content: I blew it up! So? I said I would!

102403046.content: As the first witness to the scene of the crime, please answer the question truthfully. Who destroyed the park wall?

102403047.content: All the police officers present freeze upon hearing this.

102403048.content: The kid's a witness? What's he talking about?

102403049.content: A hushed discussion burgeons between the officers. Anubis' gaze, however, remains fixed on the young hooligan, like a blade that pierces through lies. The boy's arrogance has visibly given way to slight trepidation.

102403051.content: First: The distribution of the masonry fragments at the scene indicates that the wall was smashed into from the outside. No explosive could produce this effect, nor could someone of your physique, obviously.

102403052.content: Second: Those found wantonly spreading falsified case details are held civilly liable. Doing so won't win you the admiration of others either.

102403053.content: This clearly strikes a nerve. The young hooligan erupts in shame-tinged anger.

102403054.content: You want me to tell the truth? Even when I do, no one ever believes me anyway!

102403055.content: And they couldn't believe a burglar's son could possibly return stolen money, of course he's a pickpocket!

102403056.content: I didn't blow up the wall. But if I told you some psycho smashed through it headfirst, would you believe me?

102403057.content: Surprisingly, Anubis now takes out his notepad—

102403059.content: ...Right, this total psycho smashed through the wall headfirst. Go and see for yourselves!

102403060.content: Good. The Egregious Crimes Department will now be taking over this case. Please help ensure order is returned to the school without delay.

102403061.content: Is this your idea of a joke? The kid said some lunatic smashed through the wall with their head. You really believe that?

102403062.content: His testimony must undergo an investigation before its authenticity can be determined. But one thing is for certain: the crime was not his doing.

102403063.content: As per law enforcement regulations, regardless of whether he handcuffed himself, more than two hours would constitute unlawful detention. Please release him at once.

102403064.content: The crowd erupts in an uproar of cascading objections and questions. Anubis makes no attempt to respond as he waits for the police chief to implement his decision.

102403065.content: Looking at the lonely figure of Anubis, I suddenly realize that he's standing in opposition to an angry crowd yet again—but this time, his friend can do something to help.

102403067.content: I speak in a loud voice to ensure the officers can hear me over the clamoring of the crowd. Clearly intimidated by the title of "operative," the officers awkwardly cough a couple times to silence the noisy chatter.

102403068.content: You mean... another open-and-shut case is now an unsolved case? Plenty of us have been itching to book that kid... Fine, uncuff him!

102403069.content: One more thing. In light of his request to retract his previous confession, I'd like you to review the file on the theft case he was involved in and re-investigate it.

102403071.content: The once bellicose hooligan suddenly quiets down. He patiently waits for an officer to come uncuff him.

102403072.content: The onlooking students shoot Anubis resentful and puzzled looks. As usual, Anubis offers nothing to say in his defense.

102403073.content: After leaving the school, I pull Anubis over to a cafe.

102403074.content: What are we doing here? Investigation isn't finished yet.

102403075.content: I know, but I think our bodies and minds need a quick rest first. Two coffees, please!

102403077.content: This response to my good intentions renders me momentarily speechless.

102403078.content: However... Your previous statement did help stabilize the situation before it became more complicated.

102403079.content: Was that... a thank you? Is this how long I had to wait to hear one?

102403080.content: Anubis looks at me seriously, but there's a hint of embarrassment in his expression.

102403081.content: I don't excel at this sort of thing. If you require a formal statement of gratitude...

102403082.content: Ah, forget about it... It's just like in the movies—when people can't keep up with the genius detective, it's up to his loyal partner to stand up for him.

102403083.content: Don't worry about how others see things. You just investigate the case and leave the rest to me.

102403084.content: Perhaps loosened up by the cafe's relaxed ambiance, or maybe touched by my words, Anubis suddenly opens up.

102403085.content: I don't see myself as acting like a genius. I'm just putting what my father taught me when he was alive into practice.

102403086.content: He told me that the majority of people desire justice, just as many people are swayed by their emotions. Truth is a prerequisite for justice, and emotions are the enemy of truth.

102403088.content: I earned a degree in psychology so that I could enter the Egregious Crimes Department. It's not that I can't read bystanders' emotions or don't know how to elicit their praise.

102403089.content: I just think that there are more important things.

102403090.content: Looking at Anubis' clear yet determined gaze, I suddenly feel like I spoke presumptuously.

102403091.content: I thought I had to comfort you... Looks like there was no need for me to say all that stuff when I tried to help you out earlier.

102403092.content: That faint smile flickers across Anubis' face again.

102403093.content: As I said before, your statement did prevent the situation from becoming more complicated. Thank you.

102403094.content: Finally hearing Anubis' plain, but sincere "formal statement of gratitude" is like a salve to the emotional blow I suffered just before.

102403095.content: You're welcome... That reminds me, we're investigating the damage to the park wall next, right? Where do we find a nutjob capable of smashing headfirst through a wall?

102403096.content: Anubis frowns, seemingly unsure of how to investigate this particular lead.

102403098.content: A brusque shout interrupts Anubis' rumination—The young hooligan has appeared out of nowhere and is looking at Anubis bashfully.

102403099.content: Aren't you investigating the case? I... I have a clue.

102403100.content: Before either of us can respond, he slaps something onto the table, nearly knocking over the coffees the server just brought over.

102403101.content: Anubis' eyes immediately narrow in on the item before him—It's a police-issue flashlight typically carried by security personnel.

102403102.content: You were right, I was there last night. That psycho dropped this after headbutting through the wall, I grabbed it when no one was looking.

102403103.content: You should have produced this evidence earlier.

102403104.content: What good would that have done? They would have just said I stole it!

102403105.content: Whatever, anyway... You helped me, so I'm helping you. Now we're even!

102403106.content: With that, the young hooligan swaggers out of the cafe like a roving swordsman who doesn't suffer fools gladly.

102403108.content: Administrator, I believe break time is over.

102403109.content: Anubis stares at the flashlight with a grim look on his face.

102404001.content: What can I help you with?

102404002.content: Please fill me in on the aftermath of the case.

102404003.content: Oh, yes... After you left, I looked into the four suspects' whereabouts and discovered that they were near the nightclub that night. I also checked the hospital's pharmacy records, and it all matches up.

102404004.content: They were re-questioned and all of them confessed. I never would have thought that those boys could... could be habitual criminals. They'd hang around nightclubs waiting for loners, then make their move when the target is passed out drunk, or use a medical anesthetic if they were sober...

102404005.content: Afterward, the victim would have no memory of what happened. That's how they got away with it for so long... Plus, they were active members of the community and so passionate that we never dreamed of suspecting them.

102404006.content: I put in a request to revoke the award we gave them. Then, we'll go ahead with the official criminal proceedings. It's not looking good for them!

102404008.content: Well, they insist that they really were attacked by some thug, but I don't believe a word that comes out of their mouths now.

102404009.content: We've checked surveillance around the entire neighborhood and haven't found any suspicious characters. My guess is that they made him up, just like you speculated.

102404010.content: I'm thinking they must have given each other those wounds. There was only one girl, after all. I wouldn't be surprised if the bastards started fighting over her.

102404012.content: After ending the call, Anubis takes out a map and starts to carefully scrutinize it.

102404013.content: What made you want to contact the people in charge of the first two cases all of a sudden?

102404014.content: Administrator, if you think back carefully on the three cases we've handled today, it's not difficult to see a common thread.

102404016.content: In all three cases, the suspects could not be found due to a lack of surveillance footage.

102404017.content: As for the feedback from the other investigation... No anomalous demolition charge purchase records were found, which raises a new point of suspicion.

102404018.content: We know this about our suspect: surveillance equipment has failed in each place he's been, he was able to physically break open a vault door, he seriously injured four people despite being outnumbered, and he was able to smash through the park wall using his head.

102404020.content: For confidentiality reasons, the Quake Damage Control Department specifically modified Ain Soph's surveillance system to automatically delete any footage in which a Visbane is suspected to have been detected—This could explain a few things.

102404021.content: So, we really hit the jackpot this time...

102404022.content: Anubis unfolds his map and draws a line between the three case locations for me.

102404023.content: The incidents also occurred around similar times. Based on that, it's entirely possible that he broke into the bank vault first, went through the alley where that girl was attacked after that, then finally arrived at the park.

102404024.content: Once the three locations are connected, a direct line appears on the map that begins at the bank and terminates at the park we're in now.

102404025.content: There's another important piece of evidence as well...

102404026.content: I follow Anubis' gaze to the flashlight in his hand. I suddenly remember that boy we met at the bank, and my heart sinks into my stomach.

102404027.content: The only person that remains unaccounted for in these cases is the security guard, and according to the data from the research department, there is indeed a type of Visbane that can possess a human body.

102404028.content: Should I get in touch with Aether Gazer HQ?

102404029.content: Wait until we have more evidence. This is all just speculation at the moment. I've deduced that the suspect is still lurking somewhere in this park. We need to see him with our own eyes and confirm the theory first.

102404030.content: Anubis' gaze falls to the flashlight in his hand again. I see an apprehension similar to my own in his eyes.

102404031.content: Okay... But I'm coming with you. This is a joint investigation, remember.

102404032.content: Anubis pauses for a moment, then nods his head, seemingly acknowledging me as his "assistant detective."

102404033.content: As the sun sets in the west, the crowd that gathered in the park gradually disperses into the twilight.

102404034.content: Only the intermittent chirping of insects remains in the otherwise quiet park. As we hide in the grass, Anubis keeps a watchful eye on the nearby footpath while I stare at the Bane Energy signal detector in my hand.

102404035.content: Warning! Bane Energy signal source detected.

102404036.content: Almost exactly at the same time the Mimir system I brought with me emits its sudden warning, a humanoid figure bursts out from under the surface of the park's artificial lake. It then lets out a kind of pained, mournful howl.

102404038.content: The person—or perhaps he can no longer be called a "person"—is covered head-to-toe in the Visbanes' unique markings and his eyes are emitting a frightful red light. His security uniform, now threatening to burst at the seams, is the only indication of his former identity that remains.

102404039.content: Just when this half-man half-Visbane monster attempts to make its escape, Anubis has already blocked its path, but he does not attack.

102404040.content: I'm a CORG operative! Your cooperation is requested under special circumstances law enforcement regulations!

102404041.content: Hnnngh... Stay away... Archie... I'm sorry...

102404043.content: The target's Visbane corruption abruptly reaches its final conclusion. Then, it charges toward Anubis.

102404044.content: The exchange of blows ends just as suddenly as it begins. After taking precise strikes to its vitals, the Visbane collapses into a heap on the ground, then disintegrates into a cloud of data debris that dissipates into the night.

102404045.content: That was way too close for comfort! Why did you hesitate?

102404046.content: It's the duty of all operatives to do everything within their power to save the lives of civilians.

102404047.content: But you finished him off so quickly in the end...

102404048.content: That's... also the duty of all operatives.

102404049.content: Anubis carefully gathers up what remains of the security uniform, not saying another word. Though preferring as always to say nothing in his own defense, I can see in his eyes everything that's been left unsaid.

102404051.content: It's time to bring these cases to a close.

102404052.content: Right... What will we tell that mother and her son? Especially the son, when he learns that his father...

102404053.content: Wait! Aren't we bound to secrecy when it involves Visbanes? It's probably for the best that we can't tell him what really happened. This way, he can remember his father the way he was...

102404054.content: We'll omit the details related to the Visbane, but the family must be informed of the death.

102404056.content: Because "death" is a "truth" that can't be concealed!

102404057.content: Anubis looks at me so solemnly that I find myself unable to argue with him.

102404058.content: Leave notifying the family to me.

102404059.content: Anubis looks at the security uniform in his hands, then sighs softly.

102404060.content: The seal around the bank's perimeter has finally been removed, and renovation crews have begun entering the site. The mother and son, still keeping watch nearby, continue to wait for a resolution now out of their reach.

102404061.content: Anubis and I meet at the most suitable place to observe them from a distance.

102404062.content: I think our joint investigation has concluded.

102404063.content: I've been thinking about it, and I think I should be with you when you break the news to the family.

102404064.content: Are you worried that you'll need to run interference for me again?

102404065.content: The fact that you're even asking does kind of worry me.

102404066.content: Anubis noncommittally acquiesces to my accompanying him.

102404067.content: That reminds me, what did you say the father's cause of death was? An accident?

102404068.content: I didn't fabricate his cause of death. It was recorded truthfully in his death notice.

102404069.content: Surely you couldn't really say that he died after being corrupted by a Visbane?

102404070.content: I say this as I look at the death notice Anubis hands to me. What I see written in the "cause of death" column astonishes me: "Sacrificed himself to protect the lives and property of the citizens of Ain Soph."

102404072.content: Once definitive evidence of a Visbane appearance was provided, the Quake Damage Control Department accessed the concealed surveillance footage and released it to me as internal data.

102404073.content: That Visbane first entered the Surface Layer from within the vault. After it broke through the vault door, it was immediately met with stubborn resistance from the security guard, who it ultimately chose to corrupt.

102404074.content: I don't know what kind of willpower it took to retain that portion of his consciousness despite having his body taken over by the Visbane.

102404075.content: He was under the Visbane's control when he walked through the alley, but when he witnessed the crime taking place there, he subconsciously attacked the perpetrators. He then forced himself to flee from the scene before he hurt the girl.

102404076.content: By the time he was near the park, he was on the verge of losing his sanity. That's when he smashed through the wall and threw himself into the lake. He was attempting to take his own life, but he failed.

102404077.content: But he still suppressed the Visbane's instincts until the very end. He didn't hurt anyone else, and he didn't stop resisting until the park was empty. Then the Visbane corrupted him completely.

102404078.content: Never one for long-winded speeches previously, Anubis unexpectedly has a lot to say. It seems very important to him that this "truth" is preserved.

102404080.content: It's time we broke the news to the family.

102404082.content: I follow Anubis over to the mother and son and watch as he hands them the death notice. He does so as solemnly as if they were the family of a fallen soldier.

102404083.content: After she reads the contents of the death notice, the mother breaks into sobs. Archie forces back his tears.

102404084.content: My dad really was a hero, wasn't he?

102404085.content: Faced with this question once again, Anubis responds with his characteristic economy of expression.

102404087.content: Archie wipes the tears from the corners of his eyes. Then, supporting his mother with the maturity of a grown man, the two depart the way they came.

102404089.content: Oh, right... I guess this means our joint investigation's officially over. I wonder when we'll get to work together again.

102404090.content: Considering the rate at which various bizarre cases are piling up, I'd say very soon.

102404091.content: Anubis' smile is finally more apparent this time. Forgoing excessive formalities, he turns and leaves debonairly, like someone parting ways with an old friend.

108001001.content: Early this morning, I received a request for a leave of absence from Vidar of the Winter Squad.

108001003.content: Vidar has been out for over a week now, apparently she caught a cold. But with her Modifier's constitution, she should have recovered by now.

108001004.content: Sensing something amiss, I decide to pay her a visit.

108001006.content: After some time, the door to Vidar's room slowly opens and she pokes her head out. Apart from looking somewhat flushed, she seems okay.

108001008.content: I'm sorry, but I won't be able to rejoin the squad today. My cold seems to be getting worse.

108001009.content: I had to submit another sick leave request...

108001010.content: No need to apologize, your health is more important! I'm not here to make you go on a mission, I was just passing by and thought I'd drop in to check on you. Hope I'm not disturbing you.

108001011.content: No, no, not at all... Um... Wanna come in? I'm feeling a little dizzy...

108001012.content: Vidar's room is plain and unadorned. The most striking thing in here is a bucket full of ice on her desk.

108001013.content: Just as I'm wondering what she uses it for, Vidar walks over to it and, bending at the waist, buries her face in it.

108001015.content: I'm about to pull her out when I realize that the frigid air that usually surrounds her is gone, and her temperature seems a little high.

108001016.content: Vidar lifts her head. Water droplets cling to her eyebrows.

108001017.content: What is it, Admin? You seem panicked.

108001018.content: What were you just doing? And what's with the ice bucket?

108001019.content: I made it myself. I pour water in, stir it with my Access Key, and that's it.

108001020.content: Vidar looks at me sort of blankly.

108001021.content: What is it? Do... you want one too?

108001022.content: I'm not asking how you made it... I want to know why you're dunking your head in ice.

108001023.content: To cool my body down. It makes me feel a little better.

108001024.content: You don't do this when you have a cold?

108001026.content: Then... how do you get better?

108001027.content: Take medicine? Get a shot...? But first, I go see a doctor!

108001028.content: Sounds more complicated than my method...

108001029.content: But surely there are less crude ways to lower your body temperature...

108001032.content: And with that, Vidar plunges her face back into the ice bucket. She breathes a long, comfortable sigh.

108001034.content: Yanked from the bucket, Vidar looks at me bewildered, her brows slightly furrowed.

108001035.content: Vidar, your face is all red. Maybe you're having a fever... Have you already gone to the Medical Department?

108001036.content: It's nothing, just a little cold. I've already taken medicine for it.

108001038.content: Some stuff Leviathan gave me. She said I would be fine after I took it all.

108001039.content: Over here... I took this, this, and this.

108001040.content: I finished them a week ago now, but I don't seem to be getting any better.

108001041.content: Let me see—Cough suppressants, pain relievers, fever reducers, broad-spectrum antibiotics... You're not supposed to take these together, are you?

108001042.content: And the boxes are all empty... Don't tell me you took them all at once??

108001043.content: Huh? Isn't that what you're supposed to do? Don't you get better faster the more you take?

108001044.content: Uh... People usually read the instructions before taking any medication.

108001046.content: I take out the instructions from inside the box for Vidar to see. After reading through the active ingredients and dosage information together, Vidar nods, seemingly half-understanding.

108001047.content: So, you can't take different cold medicines together, and you can't take the whole box at once.

108001048.content: I see. I had no idea. I've never taken medicine before...

108001049.content: She seems at a loss, like she's done something wrong.

108001050.content: Don't worry about it. Anyway, why don't we go to the Medical Department for now?

108001051.content: Vidar sits upright on the hospital bed, dutifully listening to Mimtastic's diagnosis.

108001052.content: Vidar, you could have been in serious trouble if the Administrator hadn't brought you here in the nick of time.

108001053.content: The first thing a Modifier should do when they feel unwell is come to the Medical Department. That's what it says in the training manual, doesn't it?

108001055.content: I'm not blaming you. It's just that your situation is somewhat unique.

108001056.content: Administrator, to alleviate Vidar's symptoms, I need to bring this room down to below freezing. This might be detrimental to your health, so I'd advise you leave the room first.

108001057.content: I'd rest easier knowing that Vidar has company. Let me just stay a little while longer and keep an eye on her condition.

108001058.content: So, Mimtastic, what's... wrong with me?

108001059.content: Do you remember what happened when you first arrived at Aether Gazer?

108001060.content: Yes... I had a constant fever, I was weak, and I stayed in the Medical Department for a long time.

108001061.content: I'd just joined the team, but I couldn't go on any missions.

108001063.content: Administrator, have a read through Vidar's medical record from that time.

108001065.content: That's right. Vidar previously lived in the polar region for a long time. Since leaving the pole for Ain Soph, she's constantly been unwell.

108001066.content: I later discovered that her body is adapted to life in a freezing environment. If her temperature rises to that of an ordinary person, she'll get sick.

108001067.content: You wouldn't believe how much work it took for the Medical Department to figure this out. Anyway, then Shu tasked the Cryptics with making a temperature control chip for me.

108001068.content: After implanting the chip into my body, I was able to keep it at a lower temperature, and could finally live a normal life again.

108001069.content: So, this illness isn't a cold, but a syndrome of her hypothermic dependence?

108001070.content: Yes, which means her chip must be malfunctioning. I'll have to ask the Cryptics to help me extract and repair it.

108001072.content: Not to worry, Administrator. I arranged the surgery when I notified the Cryptics just now.

108001073.content: No need. I've already notified the Cryptics, they're on their way.

108001074.content: However, they did say that the chip can't be damaged that easily. It's possible that an overuse of Divine Power has compromised its temperature control.
