108001075.content: An overuse of Divine Power? You mean combat?

108001076.content: Vidar, I didn't mean to overload you with so many missions... I'm so sorry...

108001077.content: No, Administrator. It's my fault. I forgot what the Cryptics told me.

108001078.content: They did say something to me about not using too much Divine Power...

108001079.content: Good grief! What are you two apologizing to each other for? Enough already!

108001080.content: Anyway, Administrator, I'm going to go discuss the surgical plan with the Cryptics. Please stay here and look after Vidar, and keep an eye on your own condition as well.

108001081.content: And with that, Mimtastic is gone. The Medical AGI Mecha lays a blanket over Vidar's lap, then exits as well, leaving the two of us alone in the room.

108001082.content: It's so quiet that it feels like the air itself will freeze, and so cold that it feels like we're in the farthest reaches of the Pole.

108001083.content: Um... Administrator, I'm already feeling a lot better. I'm no longer dizzy, and my fever has gone away.

108001084.content: If you have something else you need to be doing right now...

108001085.content: Not at all. You'll be going into the operating room later, so I'll keep you company a little while longer.

108001086.content: Vidar wants to say something, but she hesitates for a while, seemingly not knowing how to put it into words.

108001089.content: Um... Do you need a blanket?

108001090.content: It's really cold in here. You have goosebumps.

108001091.content: Now that you mention it, it is a little chilly... ACHOO!

108001093.content: Wait a minute—Vidar, did you just laugh? I almost never see you laugh like that before.

108001094.content: Take this blanket, I don't need it. I'd feel bad if you caught a cold because of me.

108001095.content: Before I can respond, she's passed the blanket over to me. I can't refuse the slight warmth still lingering on it.

108001096.content: That reminds me, Vidar, did you not notice anything wrong with your chip?

108001097.content: No. Since it was put in, it's like it's not even there. I've never had a problem with it before either.

108001098.content: I thought I just had a normal cold and would get better after a little while. That's why I didn't go to the Medical Department.

108001099.content: I didn't realize it would cause this much trouble for everyone...

108001100.content: It hasn't been any trouble... But do you not normally see a doctor when you get sick?

108001101.content: Um... Back when I was around the Pole, if I had a fever or felt sick, I'd just bury myself in the snow for a while. Then I'd feel better.

108001102.content: But there's nowhere to do that in the dormitory, so I made my ice bucket instead. It works pretty well.

108001103.content: The first time I stayed in the Medical Department, they did something to cool my body down, too. Isn't it the same thing?

108001104.content: But they wouldn't have you put your head in ice...

108001105.content: Did I do something weird again?

108001106.content: No, no... But the next time something like this happens, you'd better go to the Medical Department for help.

108001108.content: Just as the two of us loosen up a bit through the talk, Mimtastic returns.

108001109.content: Administrator, we've done with the surgical plan! Vidar, you can get ready for the operation now.

108001111.content: Vidar looks at me, seemingly pondering what to say.

108001112.content: I'll wait for you here, Vidar. Don't worry, everything will be okay!

108001113.content: Vidar nods her head slightly. She doesn't say anything else, but the concern vanishes from her eyes.

108002002.content: As I open the door to the sick bay, a gush of cold air washes over my face. Even though I'm dressed for winter, I still can't help but shudder.

108002003.content: Oh, it's you, Administrator! Sorry... I thought it was Mimtastic.

108002004.content: Vidar is holding her Access Key. She appears to be in good health and spirits.

108002005.content: Mimtastic just told me that you woke up, so I came over to see you. Are you... training?

108002006.content: Training? Oh, right... I should put my Access Key away.

108002007.content: I wouldn't call it training. I'm just getting a little exercise.

108002008.content: My arms and legs are kinda numb from resting the last few days.

108002009.content: I see. Are you still feeling sick at all?

108002011.content: I wouldn't have recovered so soon if not for you, accompanying me to all those examinations... And I still haven't thanked you for that.

108002012.content: No need to thank me. It's my duty to care for the wellbeing of every Modifier.

108002014.content: Vidar mumbles something, then turns her eyes away. I wonder what she's thinking about.

108002015.content: ... Sorry, I spaced out all of a sudden.

108002016.content: Have a seat, Administrator. It's cold in here, isn't it? I'll go make you a cup of tea.

108002017.content: Vidar walks over to the water dispenser and tries to make some tea.

108002018.content: After staring for a while at the instructions on the box, she somewhat clumsily carries out the steps.

108002019.content: I heard that drinking something hot can warm you up. Wanna see if it works?

108002020.content: She hands me the tea. I reflexively blow on the surface before taking a small sip.

108002021.content: But instead of the warmth I was expecting, an icy chill glides down my throat...

108002023.content: Are you okay? Is the tea bad?

108002024.content: Did I make it wrong? I followed the directions...

108002025.content: No, no, it's nice. It reminds me of a drink that's gotten popular lately.

108002026.content: What drink? I just put in a regular tea bag.

108002027.content: It's called cold brew tea. Cold brewing can give the tea a sweeter, more refreshing taste.

108002028.content: Vidar's eyes glaze over for a few seconds. Then, she suddenly reaches over to feel the cup.

108002029.content: I knew it. The water was steaming when I poured it into the cup, but now it's cold already...

108002030.content: Looking defeated, Vidar stares motionlessly at the cup.

108002031.content: Just when things begin to get awkward, there's a knock at the door.

108002035.content: Hello! Oh, and the Administrator's here, too! I came to check in on Vidar. Are you feeling any better?

108002036.content: I took part in the Cryptics' and medical team's discussion as well. This is all because of my negligence. If I'd been paying closer attention to your Divine Power fluctuations in battle...

108002037.content: It's not your fault... I can take care of myself.

108002038.content: Poseidon blinks at the sudden interruption. After staring at Vidar for a while, she looks over at me.

108002039.content: Don't worry. Based on what the Cryptics said, the chip will be as good as new in two days.

108002041.content: Vidar's relieved tone catches Poseidon's attention.

108002042.content: What is it, Vidar? Do you not like it here?

108002044.content: Being stuck here can't be much fun.

108002045.content: I see, so you came to keep Vidar company so she doesn't get too bored?

108002047.content: Of course! How thoughtful of you, Administrator!

108002048.content: I'll keep an eye on the Cryptics' progress, so you just rest easy these next few days, Vidar. Once your chip is fixed, how about we go out and do something fun to unwind?

108002050.content: Why does it sound like you're accepting a mission... We're going out to have some fun! You'll make the arrangements, right, Administrator?

108002051.content: Of course! Is there anywhere you'd like to go, Vidar?

108002056.content: Not to worry! We'll come up with some ideas for you to choose from.

108002058.content: I've got it! A new polar exhibit was recently set up at the aquarium! I heard the organizers saying that they're just about ready to open it up to the public.

108002060.content: An exhibition area built to mimic a polar environment. It'll have lots of animals you don't normally get to see, like seals and penguins!

108002061.content: Penguins? Really? I haven't seen any penguins in Ain Soph.

108002062.content: Vidar's eyes light up and she suddenly seems invigorated.

108002064.content: Do you like penguins, Vidar? Would you like to go see some?

108002066.content: Vidar lived in the polar region for a long time, but hasn't returned even once since then. She must really miss it. Her excitement is written all over her face.

108002067.content: Is the exhibit already set up, Poseidon?

108002069.content: Well... I was thinking, would it be possible to go within the next two days?

108002070.content: Vidar's recovered now. She just needs to stay in a cold environment. And the polar exhibit should be just as cold as the real thing...

108002071.content: Yes... If penguins can live there, it must be very cold.

108002072.content: That's right, it would be perfect for Vidar right now.

108002073.content: It's too boring being stuck in a hospital room all the time. I even saw her waving around her Access Key by herself today!

108002074.content: Hahaha! I understand. Usually, visitors can only see the penguins from the other side of the glass, but I'll ask the organizers if they can make an exception.

108002075.content: At Poseidon's arrangement, the aquarium gave Vidar and me the chance to be the first to experience the penguins "up close and personal."

108002076.content: While I'm not sure what getting "up close and personal" with the penguins exactly means... Vidar and I arrive at the aquarium excited to find out.

108002078.content: Have you been here before, Vidar?

108002079.content: Never. Leviathan's always saying she wants to come, but I was afraid that it would be too many people...

108002080.content: Thankfully, the polar exhibit hasn't officially opened to the public today. Once it does, you can bet it'll be swarming with people.

108002081.content: Vidar's brow crinkles slightly. It seems like she's not a fan of crowded places.

108002082.content: Was the journey here alright? Are you feeling sick at all?

108002083.content: I'm fine. Your preparations were very thorough.

108002084.content: It's all thanks to Poseidon for helping us rent that special purpose vehicle. Apparently, it was used to transport the penguins as well...

108002085.content: The Medical Department also prepared a bunch of ice packs to ensure that Vidar's temperature didn't rise too much during the journey.

108002086.content: I was a little worried that Mimtastic wouldn't let us go at first.

108002087.content: But you said something and she agreed, just like that?

108002088.content: Not only that, she even approved of my reasoning: A healthy mind makes for a healthy body!

108002089.content: A staff member walks over to us, cutting our chitchat short.

108002090.content: Hey there! Are you two here for the "Penguins: Up Close and Personal" experience?

108002092.content: Great, welcome! The penguin enclosure is just up ahead. I'll show you.

108002093.content: We've prepared some fish for you over here. You can try feeding them to the penguins, I'll show you how.

108002094.content: After walking us through how to feed the penguins, the staff member begins demonstrating how to interact with them.

108002095.content: Penguins may look adorable, but they're actually ferocious carnivores, so be careful! I'll be over here if you need any help.

108002096.content: Don't worry about us. Vidar used to live around the Pole, so she's no stranger to penguin behavior.

108002097.content: That's right! Back then, I had to hunt to eat, so I was always dealing with animals.

108002099.content: Oh, don't worry. I never hunted penguins.

108002100.content: Usually just polar bears and seals.

108002102.content: Point is, there's nothing to worry about! We won't do anything to hurt the animals, and we'll be careful not to get hurt ourselves.

108002103.content: The staff hands me a pail full of fish, then quietly stands off to the side, not daring to leave.

108002104.content: Should I not have mentioned that...?

108002105.content: But there wasn't anything else to eat at the Pole. I had to hunt.

108002106.content: It's probably just hard for people who have never experienced that sort of thing to imagine what it was like. Did you always hunt alone?

108002107.content: Yes. Well, with my dog, Fenrir.

108002109.content: Not that tough if you're born into it.

108002110.content: Compared to that, it's more challenging for me to learn all sorts of things since coming here.

108002111.content: Vidar calls out to the penguins, draws a fish from the bucket in my hands, and tosses it to them.

108002112.content: One penguin cuts in front of its companions and snatches up the fish. I wouldn't believe such a stout body could be so agile if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes.

108002113.content: There's something so familiar about that call...

108002114.content: This place reminds me a lot of a snowfield I used to live on.

108002115.content: Vidar's memories seem to have been stirred by the familiarity of the environment. She stands transfixed for a moment, not saying another word.

108002116.content: Have you ever stayed in an igloo, Administrator?

108002117.content: Huh? An igloo? I don't think so.

108002118.content: An igloo is a house made from bricks of ice. Sounds really cold, right?

108002119.content: Well actually, it keeps the heat in...

108002121.content: ... Am I boring you with all this stuff, Administrator?

108002122.content: Not at all! I always learn something new and interesting when I hear about your old life.

108002124.content: She chucks a few more fish to the penguins with the finesse of a zookeeper.

108002125.content: Whoops, the fish are almost gone.

108002126.content: Don't you wanna try feeding the penguins too, Administrator?

108002127.content: Mimicking Vidar's motions to the best of my ability, I throw a fish over to the penguins and pray that she doesn't think I look too stupid.

108002128.content: Vidar cheers as the penguins catch the fish, offering up a gentle applause.

108002130.content: I wish I could be like you...

108002131.content: Huh? Just when I'm about to ask Vidar why she would say that, I suddenly hear a familiar voice—

108002133.content: Leviathan stands at the entrance with her hands on her hips and Fenrir at her side.

108002135.content: How could you go to the aquarium and not invite me? I'm... I'm so mad right now!!

108003001.content: Mimtastic said the Administrator took Master out to get some air, and here you are at the aquarium! Hmph!

108003002.content: I thought it's been a while since Master's seen Fenrir, so I brought him to the sick bay to see her! And who did I find there? Nobody!!

108003003.content: I'm sorry, I didn't know you were coming to see me today...

108003004.content: Vidar pats Leviathan's head, and the huffy Leviathan immediately seems calmer and even lowers her voice.

108003005.content: It-It's not your fault, Master. I didn't tell you I was coming.

108003006.content: I was just worried... You're not feeling sick at all, are you?

108003008.content: To prove it, Vidar extends her arms and spins around twice as if undergoing a security check.

108003009.content: Fine. But... are you sure you shouldn't be resting in the sick bay?

108003011.content: Vidar turns and gives me a pleading look.

108003012.content: Don't worry, Leviathan. We ran it by the Medical Department and got their permission first.

108003013.content: Besides, Vidar will tell us right away if anything doesn't feel quite right.

108003014.content: Really? Ah, but Master's very good at bottling things up.

108003017.content: Um... We just got here, can we stay a little bit longer?

108003018.content: I promise I'll tell you if I don't feel well.

108003019.content: Well... in that case... Fine. But not too much longer!

108003020.content: Just then, a penguin that had been swimming for a while leaps onto the bank.

108003022.content: Fenrir barks. He excitedly lunges forward to get a closer look, but is held back by a tug on his leash.

108003023.content: Shush, Fenrir. You can't be so loud in here.

108003024.content: Vidar crouches down to pet Fenrir, attempting to pacify him. Happy to finally see his owner again, his tongue hangs freely from his mouth.

108003025.content: But the bark resounding in the exhibit catches the attention of the nearby staff member.

108003026.content: Did I just hear a dog bark? Pets aren't allowed inside!

108003028.content: Vidar scrambles to hide Fenrir behind her, then points in a random direction.

108003030.content: Uh, right, it wasn't the Administrator.

108003031.content: And it wasn't...! Aw, forget it. It was me!

108003032.content: Is that so...? Alright, I'm gonna get more fish. Please don't do anything that might scare the penguins again.

108003033.content: Once the staff member is out of sight, Leviathan can't hold back any longer. She crouches down and gives Fenrir a noogie.

108003034.content: What's the big idea, making me take the fall like that?!

108003035.content: Obediently refraining from barking, Fenrir only lets out a pitiful whine.

108003037.content: Do you wanna feed the penguins, Leviathan? There's still some fish left.

108003038.content: I pass the pail to Leviathan, but she takes a few steps back.

108003039.content: Eeek! Nuh-uh, no way, not happening!

108003040.content: You don't have to get close to them, all you have to do is throw the fish over.

108003041.content: Leviathan warily eyes the leisurely penguins. Suddenly, one of them turns and looks at her.

108003045.content: Now several yards back, Leviathan continues to tug on the leash as Fenrir desperately clambers toward the penguins in a somewhat comical scene.

108003046.content: I don't really get it either, but she says she was bullied by penguins once.

108003047.content: Penguins look cute, but they're actually rude. I guess they bring up bad memories for her...?

108003048.content: There's no need to be afraid, Leviathan. These penguins are nice.

108003049.content: Look, just give them a fish, like this...

108003050.content: When Vidar's fish lands on the ground, several penguins rush at it, falling over each other to nab it.

108003052.content: You guys have fun, I'll wait for you outside!!

108003053.content: Leviathan puts Fenrir's leash in my hand, then disappears in a flash.

108003055.content: Fenrir growls at me resentfully, seemingly blaming me for standing between it and its coveted penguin pursuit.

108003056.content: Fenrir, shh! No growling at the Administrator!

108003057.content: Vidar tries to soothe him again. She says the words in a rather serious manner, but there's a hint of tenderness in her voice.

108003058.content: We're not at the Pole right now, even though it looks a lot like it...

108003059.content: These are the aquarium's penguins. No scaring them, okay?

108003060.content: You can't run after them like before, so you'll just have to make do with looking at them from a distance...

108003061.content: Vidar speaks to Fenrir with tremendous patience. Almost like she's... teaching a child??

108003064.content: Fenrir grew up around the Pole. There's a lot of stuff he doesn't understand.

108003067.content: For a long time, he was the only one at my side.

108003068.content: He was the only one there to hunt with, to talk to...

108003069.content: After hearing this, Fenrir seems even more adorable to me. I can't help but want to give his head a scratch.

108003071.content: Fenrir doesn't seem to like having its head touched, so I settle for its back. To my surprise, it quickly lies down on the ground and exposes the fluffy belly.

108003073.content: Vidar asks this while rubbing Fenrir's belly. Fenrir sticks out his tongue.

108003074.content: When will my chip be ready? Leviathan's been feeding him lately, but...

108003075.content: This kind of dog needs a lot of exercise, so I usually spend a lot of time walking him. But I can't keep asking Leviathan to do this for me.

108003076.content: Do you need some help? I could take him for walks.

108003077.content: Really? Fenrir's pretty hyper, so he can be a little hard to walk...

108003078.content: Taking a cute pup for a walk can't be any harder than fighting Visbanes, right?

108003080.content: Then don't worry about a thing. I can handle it!

108003081.content: Fenrir looks at me with his head tilted, oblivious to the changes of life that await him.

108003082.content: Well, if it's you, then I have nothing to worry about.

108003083.content: Thank you. Once I'm discharged, I'll be sure to repay you for your trouble.

108003084.content: Vidar, are you always this polite...?

108003086.content: There's nothing wrong with being polite, but we're friends. Friends help each other, don't they?

108003087.content: If I found myself in a tough situation, you'd help me without even being asked to, wouldn't you?

108003089.content: See? Then there's no need to be so polite.

108003090.content: Then you were looking after me this whole time... as a friend?

108003092.content: Because it's one of your duties?

108003094.content: But also because I care about you as a friend.

108003098.content: Are the penguins really that much fun? I'm bored out of my mind out here...

108003100.content: We should probably get going, Administrator.

108003101.content: Today... was fun. I'll leave Fenrir to you then...

108003102.content: All of a sudden, Leviathan leaps in.

108003103.content: You guys are taking forever... What are you talking about?

108003104.content: Why is the Administrator going to look after Fenrir? Aren't I the one taking care of him??

108003105.content: I'll be taking him for his walks. Wanna come with me, Leviathan?

108003106.content: Huh? But will Fenrir even listen to you, Admin?

108003107.content: Fenrir gleefully bounces up and down, then rolls over and shows me his belly.

108003108.content: Huh??? Fenrir! When did you and the Administrator become such good pals??

108003109.content: What's going on...? Do you not like me anymore?

108003110.content: Leviathan takes Fenrir in her arms, but Fenrir wriggles out of her overzealous embrace.

108003111.content: I'm just helping out. I'll still need you when I don't know what to do, Leviathan!

108003112.content: Acting like she doesn't hear me, Leviathan looks pitifully over at Vidar.

108003114.content: I cast Vidar a helpless look, only to discover that she's watching us with her mouth curved into a smile.

108003115.content: Um... What if you... help in shifts?

108004001.content: The Cryptics soon return the repaired chip to the Medical Department, and the re-implantation procedure is completed without a hitch.

108004002.content: While Vidar's recuperating, a new item is added to my daily agenda—dog walking.

108004005.content: Hearing the sound of the door, Fenrir immediately springs up from the corner, bounds over to me, and throws himself at my legs.

108004007.content: Someone's excited for a walk! Let's get your leash on first.

108004008.content: I attach the leash while dodging Fenrir's licking tongue. Then, I hear a familiar voice from behind me.

108004010.content: Vidar is standing in the hallway, smiling as she waves at me. Upon seeing his owner, Fenrir barks and leaps up on her. Vidar grabs his leash and embraces him.

108004011.content: Morning, Vidar! Were you discharged today?

108004012.content: Yes. Mimtastic said I could leave early.

108004013.content: They observed me for a few days. My temperature is stable and there have been no fluctuations in my Divine Power.

108004016.content: Thanks for taking him out every morning for me while I was recovering.

108004017.content: He didn't give you any trouble, did he?

108004018.content: No, he was a good boy.

108004021.content: Do you wanna go for a walk with us, Vidar? Fenrir's dying to go out, why don't we walk and chat?

108004023.content: The early morning air in the park is fresh and the sun is shining down on the grass—it's the perfect place for a dog walk.

108004024.content: Fenrir really does have quite a lot of stamina. Now I see why he needs longer walks than an average dog.

108004025.content: He grew up on a snowfield and his main source of exercise used to be hunting.

108004026.content: Even I have to jog to keep up with him, it's basically a workout...

108004027.content: He's a bit slow today though, isn't he?

108004030.content: When we first moved here, it wouldn't even let me put a leash on it.

108004031.content: And he would often frighten people, so I had to take him for his walks in the middle of the night...

108004032.content: Really? But he's so good now.

108004033.content: Dogs that move to the city after growing up in the wilderness need some time to adjust.

108004034.content: I trained him for a really long time...

108004035.content: Vidar looks at Fenrir, who's stopped in front of a tree. He sniffs around its roots, then excitedly digs into the ground.

108004036.content: Sometimes I wonder if he'd be happier if I'd left him at the Pole.

108004037.content: But wouldn't he get lonely there without you?

108004039.content: You raised Fenrir from when he was a puppy, right?

108004040.content: Yes. Though, I didn't take him in so much as he found me.

108004041.content: When I woke up, he was licking the ice off my face.

108004042.content: He was only this big then.

108004043.content: Vidar holds her arms out in a circle, as if hugging Fenrir as a puppy.

108004044.content: Something that small grew this big??

108004046.content: Maybe... it's not that he can't live without me, but that... I need him.

108004047.content: Fenrir suddenly looks up and starts barking.

108004049.content: It's fine. It's saying hi to its new friend.

108004051.content: Vidar's puzzled gaze follows my outstretched finger—a golden retriever is running up to Fenrir. The dogs immediately start playing together happily.

108004053.content: At the other end of the dog's leash, its owner waves to us.

108004055.content: Um... Administrator... do you know this man?

108004056.content: Sorta. That lawn over there is a doggy park that I've been bringing Fenrir to for the last few days. I've met him there a few times.

108004058.content: It's a fenced-in park where dogs can run around and play off-leash.

108004059.content: Oh... I often see a lot of dogs there, but I've never been before.

108004060.content: Shall we go walk around together then?

108004061.content: Vidar nods, evidently a bit curious. But why hasn't she ever gone before?

108004062.content: After we enter the dog park, this mystery is quickly unraveled.

108004063.content: Is this your dog? He's so cute! What's his name?

108004065.content: Such thick fur! Is he a sled dog? Can I pet him?

108004066.content: Overwhelmed in the face of small talk and questions from strangers, Vidar retreats a couple steps.

108004067.content: Hello... He's, um, Fenrir. Uh, I mean, that's his name...

108004068.content: He's from the Pole. I'm not sure what type of dog he is exactly, sorry...

108004069.content: You can pet him, but avoid his head. He doesn't like being pet there.

108004070.content: Having come here a few times already, Fenrir has already grown accustomed to spirited crowds like these and effortlessly mingles with the other dogs and visitors. Vidar wants to follow him, but is slightly apprehensive.

108004071.content: Vidar, just let him play on his own a little while. We can watch him from here, so there's no need to worry.

108004072.content: Vidar accepts my recommendation. We stand off to the side and watch as Fenrir rolls in the grass and chases and plays with the other dogs.

108004073.content: He seems to really like this place. Why didn't I bring him here before?

108004074.content: Well... it didn't go this smoothly at the start. At first, he was really wary and would growl at the other dogs. But he got better after making a few friends.

108004075.content: Fenrir grabs someone's frisbee and excitedly runs to bring it to Vidar. The owner of the frisbee waves to Vidar, and she quickly walks over to him to return it.

108004076.content: Luckily, he doesn't seem to mind. Seeing how much Fenrir likes it, he flings the frisbee over to him, who ecstatically darts off to retrieve it. After a couple of back and forth like this, the two start to play together.

108004077.content: ... It was like that for me too, when I first came here.

108004079.content: When I first arrived, I didn't get how anything worked...

108004080.content: But everyone helped me get train tickets, order food, buy things...

108004081.content: With your help, I eventually got used to this place. Just like Fenrir.

108004082.content: Is Fenrir used to the life here now?

108004084.content: But you still worry sometimes that you aren't doing enough?

108004085.content: Huh?! How did... you know that?

108004086.content: It's hard not to notice how anxious you can be. When that person throwing the frisbee tried to shake your hand, you avoided it.

108004087.content: I just thought that my hands would be too cold. Even the frisbee turned cold...

108004088.content: I get it, you worry about the things that make you different from others, right? But look, he didn't mind at all and kept on playing happily with Fenrir.

108004089.content: So... there's no need to sweat the small stuff like that.

108004091.content: This is a big city with a lot of people in it. And for exactly that reason, everyone's gonna have their own quirks and qualities.

108004092.content: That means it's perfectly normal to be a little different. And who knows, your differences might seem really cool to other people.

108004094.content: For sure. Take me for an example—I think your stories about life at the Pole are really interesting.

108004095.content: Remember that ice bucket? Maybe it'll come in handy some time, like when we're out in the wilderness and need to cool down from the summer heat...

108004097.content: Point is, don't worry about your hypothermic dependence, or about living your life differently from others...

108004098.content: It's all just part of what makes you unique. It's even quite cute at times.

108004100.content: Vidar doesn't say anything, and looks into the distance.

108004102.content: N... No. I'm good. Where did Fenrir go?

108004103.content: After searching for ages in the crowd, we finally find Fenrir snoozing in the shade of a tree. Vidar looks at him quietly without approaching, as if not wanting to disturb him.

108004104.content: We sit down there on the grass and savor this moment of contentment. A gentle breeze blows by, rustling the leaves of the tree.

108004106.content: Vidar speaks up softly. There's a long pause as she fiddles with the leash in her hands.

108004107.content: ... Today's weather has been really good.

108004110.content: In the future... could you keep taking Fenrir for walks sometimes?

108004111.content: Haha, of course. Will you join us too?

108004112.content: Vidar nods slightly. She doesn't say anything else, but she seems completely at ease now. She even starts to hum a melody I've never heard before.

108004113.content: I hope she can always feel this relaxed and carefree. But for now, it's time to discuss with the Cryptics the plan to upgrade her temperature control chip...

112302001.content: I'm getting a bad feeling from all those shipwrecked vessels on the island.

112302002.content: It's more than a feeling. Most likely they went missing at some point and washed up here on the tides.

112302003.content: The ship logs I've managed to scrounge from the wrecks tell of a very strange fate. There's a constant theme of the crew having a really wonderful time...

112302004.content: But, at that point, they should have already been caught in the storm. And were possibly being attacked by that Visbane.

112302005.content: Hmm... The sight of that Visbane would probably scare most people silly.

112302006.content: Anyway, forget about all that crazy stuff in the ship logs. We probably ran into the same problems, except of course that Snowflake 2 is a lot sturdier than whatever they were sailing.

112302007.content: So do you think there'll be any survivors?

112302009.content: Zenkibo looks like she wants to make a quip, but thinks better of it after noticing Verthandi's hopeful expression.

112302010.content: Who knows? All we can do is have a look around. Let's check for survivors while we're looking for those parts.

112302011.content: We should also collect a few things that might help us identify these shipwrecked vessels, and match them to the known missing ships. That'll be part of our mission handled, at the very least.

112302013.content: H-hold on a second! It's getting late. We should head back to camp and rest.

112302014.content: Just hold out a bit longer! Maybe we'll be the first team who finish the mission!

112302015.content: I was afraid you'd say that...

112302016.content: You know, Ver, I heard we're barbecuing tonight.

112302018.content: Why don't we have a good meal and rest up, then pick up where we left off tomorrow? We've probably covered more than half the island already. And tomorrow we'll be even faster.

112302019.content: Alright! Let's conserve our energy so we can keep on keeping on!

112312001.content: I think we've pretty much searched the whole island. The radar Skadi wanted us to find must be in that dense jungle.

112312002.content: I see it! It is over there in the jungle!

112312003.content: It's huge... Not going to be easy to bring back.

112312004.content: But that's fine. At least we're finally done for the day.

112312005.content: Zenkibo stretches in relief. However, she notices Verthandi staring off in silence.

112312007.content: We're really just going to stop here?

112312008.content: We've practically searched the entire island. Just a handful of places left.

112312009.content: But still no go with any survivors.

112312010.content: The latest ship log we found seems to show that these sailors were waylaid by that Visbane. It was after they were attacked that they started to fill their journals with all that... nonsense.

112312011.content: That Visbane was pretty hard work for a whole group of us Modifiers. I can't imagine what it would be like for ordinary people...

112312012.content: Zenkibo notices her sentiments seem to be making Verthandi even more depressed.

112312013.content: Um... At least we're not going back empty-handed.

112312014.content: Didn't we find some information on the ship owners? We can match it against the info Shu gave us. That'll at least give us something to write in the mission report...

112312015.content: Zenkibo, forever the oddball, seems to be genuinely having a hard time consoling her friend in anything more than a very clumsy manner. In the end, she decides to just stop talking.

112312016.content: However, Verthandi already seems to be bouncing back to her normally cheerful self. She makes a fist with a kind of determined excitement.

112312017.content: We can't let anything like this happen ever again. Let's head back to camp now and give the parts to Skadi.

112312018.content: Once the ship is fixed, we can sail around the area, find that Visbane, and beat it into pieces!

112312019.content: Verthandi doesn't waste a second. She grabs the radar and immediately starts heading back to camp.

112312021.content: I must've been nuts, thinking Ver of all people needed me to console her.

112312022.content: Zenkibo quickens her pace to match Verthandi's determined steps.

112322001.content: I can't stand these vines. You know I... I'd really like to burn the whole jungle down.

112322004.content: Sun's starting to set... I think we may have to head back to camp and pick this back up tomorrow.

112322005.content: Very well... But you know, there are quite a few things about all this that are bothering me.

112322006.content: Are you talking about those fish bones, Poseidon?

112322007.content: Fish fossils, to be precise. It's odd, really odd.

112322008.content: Fish fossils, on a remote island in the middle of the ocean? Seems fit to me.

112322009.content: It's not the fossils per se. It's how they came to be fossilized that gets me. These things look about two hundred years old at the most. Way too short for the natural fossilization process.

112322010.content: That begs the question: Where are they from? Fossilization is a result of extraordinary geological pressure over a long period of time. So, what pressure fossilized these fish bones?

112322011.content: In other words, what happened in this island's recent past?

112322012.content: Yeah... And also there's what Skadi mentioned earlier—she's no stranger to these waters. There shouldn't be islands here.

112322013.content: I wouldn't be at all surprised if some strange things have happened here. Probably all that Visbane's doing.

112322014.content: At any rate, our top priority right now is finding those missing parts.

112322016.content: I notice that Poseidon seems a little crestfallen when I redirect her attention back to the task at hand. I realize she was really curious about the mystery behind all this.

112322017.content: You're quite knowledgeable, Poseidon! I should add fossils to the list of topics to ask you about.

112322018.content: N-Not really... I mean, you can't really avoid the subject of ancient fossils when you read about the marine creatures...

112322019.content: Well, we'll definitely take the chance to study some of the island's fish fossils more once we resume our search for parts tomorrow.

112322020.content: Really? You don't think it's a waste of time?

112322021.content: I think the real waste of time would be denying yourself the chance to pursue a hobby when it coincides so well with the mission.

112322022.content: The impression of loss immediately vanishes from Poseidon's face.

604301003.content: What's something like this doing here?

604301004.content: I think we should probably pick up the pace, Admin.

604302001.content: And there's one here as well. How did this get here?

604302002.content: Is there something particularly interesting about these fish bones, Poseidon?

604302003.content: You really are into marine creatures, aren't you?

604303003.content: Only a couple of hundred years old. Strange. That's a very short time for fossilization.

604304003.content: Still not enough for a decent conclusion. I'd like to find some more, if possible.

112332001.content: We push past the next section of jungle and stumble upon the part we are looking for.

112332002.content: Ah, I found it! I remember Skadi said this is the "towed sensor."

112332003.content: Phew... Now that we've found it, we can finally head back and rest.

112332004.content: Although come to think of it... Do you wanna keep looking for fossils?

112332005.content: Maybe we should pick it up another time? I'm sure you're getting tired, Admin. Let's head back and rest for now.

112332006.content: I've gathered enough information on the fossils to come to a preliminary conclusion... Albeit, a bit of a strange one.

112332008.content: Well, I originally assumed the fish responsible for the fossils were swept onto the island with the tide. And only then underwent some sort of rapid fossilization.

112332009.content: But if you examine the actual species of the fish in question, it turns out most of them are deep sea fish. It just doesn't seem possible they'd be hanging around anywhere near the shoreline. My original hypothesis must be wrong.

112332010.content: So there's another possible explanation: These deep-sea fish were fossilized through the same process that formed the island.

112332011.content: The process that formed the island?

112332012.content: Yes. This island—no, these islands—may have been formed through some kind of powerful external force that essentially amalgamated the sand and mud from the ocean floor.

112332013.content: It's possible these deep-sea fish got caught up in the sand and mud, and were then exposed to the tremendous pressure that turned them into fossils.

112332014.content: You think that Visbane is powerful enough to make a bunch of islands like that?

112332015.content: If my hypothesis is correct, it also raises another troubling question: What happens when the pressure is released?

112332016.content: I go silent for a moment in response to Poseidon's eerie conjecture.

112332017.content: Oh. Sorry for weighing you down with these wild guesses, Admin. I'm just making everything up as I go along...

112332018.content: No, what you're saying makes a lot of sense.

112332019.content: But we don't really need to concern, right? We have Skadi and her ship, after all. And I think that she has what it takes to escort us to safety, even if we end up running into that Visbane again.

112332020.content: Our best bet is just to get the parts back to the ship ASAP.

112332023.content: Poseidon flashes me a smile which seems to melt away some of my worries. I decide to make myself useful and bend down to pick up the sensor device. I wouldn't want to force Poseidon to carry it all on her own, after all. But it's so heavy my legs nearly give way.

112332024.content: Admin! The sensor is very, very heavy! How about we carry it together?

604401001.content: This is a fully intact fossil!

604401002.content: From the bone structure it seems to be a... slickhead fish.

604401003.content: And slickhead fish live in deep waters...

604402001.content: There's really something atypical about these fossils.

604402002.content: It bears the hallmarks of a relatively quick formation following a huge amount of pressure.

604402004.content: Well, I don't want to weigh you down with a bunch of stones, Admin.

604402005.content: But I'm thinking there might be another possibility...

604403001.content: It's possible these strange fossils show us something behind the existence of the islands themselves.

604403002.content: Could the fossils be a byproduct of the same geological activity that formed the islands?

112342001.content: Only the soft sound of the sea wind breaks the jungle's deathly quiet. The voice returns again, carried somehow on the wind.

112342002.content: Please proceed forward to interaction range for identity verification.

112342003.content: Ha! Again? What are you even saying? Why are you following me?

112342004.content: Who are you? A jungle spirit? The ghost of a jellyfish?

112342005.content: Inaccurate descriptors. Information locked under Safe Mode. Identity verification required for revealing these information.

112342006.content: What a weird thing to say. It sounds just like an weird AI on some kind of Q&A websites. Ever curious, Leviathan presses onward.

112342007.content: If it's not a jungle spirit or ghost, then what is it?

112342008.content: I'll just take a quick peek...

112342009.content: Leviathan takes but a few steps when Vidar's voice echoes in her ears. She begins to get a strong feeling that she probably shouldn't be quite so curious about the strange voice.

112342010.content: No, no. I can't... I've still got a job to do. I can't disappoint Master.

112342011.content: You know what? I don't care who you are. My job is to find that buoy and get out of here. That's why I'm here. Not for you.

112342012.content: Now, if there's nothing else, I'll just be on my way.

112342013.content: Searching for item "Buoy"... Done. Nearby item scanned with a 90% or higher match to descriptor "Buoy."

112342014.content: Projection: Continued search for buoy will place Potential Candidate within interaction range. Outcome will not conflict with Potential Candidate's stated objectives.

112342015.content: Leviathan is immediately confused by the unseen entity's unnecessarily verbose language. Despite that, she's able to glean the most important message contained within.

112342016.content: Are you saying if I find you, I'll find the buoy?

112342018.content: Then I may as well take a look. For the good of the mission, of course!

112342019.content: Leviathan takes a deep breath, and with mixed feelings of hesitation and curiosity, moves in the direction indicated by the voice.

604501001.content: Potential Candidate detected. Interaction module active.

604501005.content: Path incorrect! Please proceed to the Anchor.

604502002.content: Dissipated Bane Energy impact on plant life confirmed.

604502003.content: Divine Power Core locked. Unable to dispel effects.

604503003.content: Detecting Modifier Divine Power signal... Target confirmed.

604504001.content: Performing scan. Access Key possessed by Modifier confirmed.

604504002.content: Data error! Access Key not assigned to current battle.

604504003.content: Hum! Have you got a problem with my Sacred Anchor?

604505001.content: Attempting to connect to Aether Gazer HQ...

604505003.content: Suspected cause: Battle still in phase 1.

604506002.content: Current area is not a simulated space. Anchor Polymer confirmed stable.

604507001.content: It would appear that these saplings grow quickly as a result of exposure to Bane Energy released after Visbanes are defeated.

604507002.content: Seems like they will eventually grow into impenetrable thickets.

604508001.content: The released Bane Energy has been absorbed by these saplings. They've grown thicker.

604508002.content: Avoid unnecessary combat and go through before they completely block the way.

112191001.content: The work of setting up camp begins in earnest once the necessary supplies are retrieved.

112191002.content: This stretch of beach is pretty spacious, actually, and right near our ship, to boot. Perfect location. Now—does everyone know the must-haves for a good beach campsite?

112191003.content: Everyone looks at each other and shakes their heads.

112191006.content: Ugh, I was so sure that you would, Skadi, being such a seasoned voyager.

112191007.content: Why does a voyager have to know survival techniques? Being a good voyager doesn't mean I hop from island to island like a rookie sculler.

112191008.content: I suggest we all just get started on making a camp in whatever way we think best. After all, many hands make light work. So do the ideas.

112191009.content: It seems my status as the so-called leader of our investigative team is finally having an effect. Everyone starts building their own version of a camp.

112191010.content: But it's clear they have no idea where to begin. It's starting to get disconcerting when I see those weird materials they are using.

112191012.content: A loud sound rings out from the forest. If I had to guess, I'd say it's a sword running through the center of a tree.

112191013.content: Verthandi, what exactly do you think you're doing?

112191014.content: Chopping some wood! You need wood to build a house!

112191015.content: We are actually talking about making a camp here, and there're differences between a house and a camp.

112191017.content: ...Maybe we should have a look at what the others are doing.

112191019.content: I dissuade Verthandi from her well-meaning but pointless endeavor and we both go over to Leviathan.

112191020.content: Ver! Admin! Hold on. I'm just about to finish Sand House 1.0!

112191022.content: Verthandi and I stare with one accord at Leviathan's "masterpiece" of engineering. It resembles a half-completed igloo, which is common in arctic weather, but this one is made out of sand.

112191023.content: Leviathan has been hard at work mixing sand with water to make and then arrange bricks in concentric circles around a base. But the angle of the structure looks frighteningly dangerous.

112191024.content: Wow! I think I've seen something like that on TV! It was a little house made out of bricks of ice.

112191025.content: But how do you know what works with ice will also work with sand?

112191026.content: Relax, Admin. Master taught me this technique herself. All I need to do is arrange each layer closer to the center, just so, and then when it gets to the top it will form a stable...

112191027.content: Suddenly, the entire "Sand House 1.0" comes falling down with a bang, as Leviathan put another sand brick onto it.

112191029.content: Leviathan is not the only one shocked by the collapse of the... house built on sand. Verthandi looks on with great consternation. I seem to be the only one mentally prepared for this disaster. I sigh inwardly.

112191030.content: I murmur something reassuring to Leviathan and Verthandi, and then we all go off together in search of Zenkibo. Hopefully the crafty prankster has managed to come up with something practical.

112191033.content: I'd actually be quite surprised if there's anything I can learn from her...

112191034.content: It looks like none of you came here with camp preparation experience. But rest assured, I've already found a very effective method. Ta-da!

112191035.content: Hey, Admin. A good leader should always trust their subordinates.

112191036.content: I totally agree. Except for the fact you're the one telling me that...

112191037.content: Hmph. We'll see. I've already figured out a really good method for a campsite—Presto!

112191038.content: Zenkibo reveals her efforts with a theatrical flourish. It actually looks like quite a decent tent formed out of a combination of sailing cloth from the ship and a few large wooden poles. The inside of the tent is even complete with a few fruits that Zenkibo must have presumably found time to gather.

112191039.content: Hmph! If only I'd been able to stabilize Sand House 1.0...

112191040.content: Very impressive! And I think it'll be a pretty comfortable stay! Oh no!

112191041.content: The hungry Verthandi can't resist the promise of fruit, but just as she grabs some, the whole tent suddenly collapses on her.

112191042.content: Ta-da! It will protect you from the sun, rain, and thieves! It has a built-in trap to stop anyone from stealing anything out of my tent without permission!

112191043.content: And then after it traps someone, where are you going to sleep at night?

112191044.content: We have no choice but to set our hopes on Poseidon. We set off in search of her after I help Verthandi untangle herself from the canvas.

112191045.content: Admin? I haven't finished setting up. But I should be ready to go after I collect a few more seashells.

112191046.content: Ah! You did it! It's beautiful!

112191047.content: Poseidon's tent appears not only finished, but also rather stable, with a beautiful exterior and strong foundation. She's also located a number of seashells with which to decorate the ground inside. At passing glance one might think it the home of a mermaid princess.

112191048.content: But I quickly identify a problem with hers as well...

112191049.content: It looks a lot like a tank at an aquarium... You think anyone's really going to lie on that bed of shells?

112191050.content: ...Let's just see what Skadi's up to.

112191051.content: We are still on our way to Skadi when we hear the roar of a motor starting up. It seems Skadi's decided to use the chainsaw from the ship.

112191054.content: Wait a minute. Just one more piece of wood.

112191055.content: Are you building a ship, Skadi?

112191056.content: We all look over Skadi's shoulder at the immense structure she's built. This is no tent. It looks more like the incomplete keel of a sailboat.

112191057.content: I'm building... Well, once it's flipped over, don't you think it'll make quite a good roof beam for a house?

112191058.content: Hehe. Is this what you're going for?

112191059.content: Zenkibo does her best to flip the ship's keel over topside, but ends up fatally twisting the wooden beam. It splinters apart.

112191060.content: NO! I hadn't put in the nails yet! Oh no my Snowflake 3!

112191061.content: So you were building a ship!?

112191062.content: Zenkibo runs off to evade Skadi's pursuit. And with her also go my last hopes of establishing a decent camp today.

112191064.content: Why don't you try giving us some suggestions, Admin?

112191065.content: I just assumed the rest of you would have better ideas than me.

112191066.content: We all have strengths and weaknesses. That's true for Modifiers just as much as for human beings. Also, Admin, don't forget that you're the leader of our mission.

112191067.content: Seeing Poseidon's encouraging smile, I decide that perhaps I should step up more as the group's leader.

112191069.content: I set about organizing a large collection of raw materials, doing my best to ignore some of the more immature behavior the others are engaging in on the beach. I then rack my brain for every scrap of knowledge even remotely related to campsites and wilderness survival. Finally, as evening approaches, I have something resembling a camp ready.

112191070.content: (Cough)... I decided to step up on the camp building project myself, seeing as the rest of you don't quite know much about this topic.

112191071.content: First, I made a point of selecting relatively dry ground not too close to water. And then, I used water-resistant canvas from the ship to make the tent. I plugged gaps in the canvas, where insects might come in, with a mix of sand and mud. I also made room for a bonfire downwind.

112191072.content: I finish my introduction and wait pensively for the others to evaluate my work.

112191073.content: Pretty standard but... it looks surprisingly stable.

112191075.content: If only I'd finished my Sand House 1.0... But at least yours doesn't look like it's going to fall in, Admin.

112191076.content: A tent beats sleeping on the open deck.

112191077.content: Thanks for your hard work, Admin.

112191078.content: Having gained the group's approval, I heave a sigh of relief. Looks like we've successfully completed part one of our extended island stay.

112191079.content: We still have to deal with the unknown threat waiting for us out at sea, not to mention all of the other dangers lurking in the jungle. But at least I was able to help the girls out with something before the next dangerous leg of our journey.

112201001.content: The group relaxes for a while under the warm sun until a strange sound alerts us all to a new issue.

112201003.content: Whoa, I think that's the Admin's stomach.

112201005.content: Admin, you must be super hungry!

112201006.content: Ah, I kind of miss the barbecue as well.

112201007.content: Come to think of it, it's been quite a while since you ate, right, Admin? I think it's time we got some food.

112201008.content: Um... You mean like last time?

112201009.content: Zenkibo just had to remind me of the awful porridge I'd been obligated to force down my gullet. My appetite immediately diminishes.

112201010.content: Can I side with Zenkibo for once?

112201012.content: I met a real professional chef on a cruise, once he told me that the only thing that matters when it comes to taste is ingredients! Ingredients, ingredients, ingredients!

112201013.content: If you've got the right ingredients, you can make a delicious meal anywhere!

112201014.content: Makes sense. Problem is, last time we went looking for food on the island, all we found were some edible roots.

112201015.content: The Administrator was starving! We had to grab anything we could.

112201016.content: We might be able to pick up something tastier from the ocean. Unfortunately, I'm still trying to fix Snowflake 2's trawling system.

112201017.content: Ah! My girl's just sitting there, waiting for me to fix her!

112201018.content: How about I go take care of that? And then the rest of you can head further into the jungle if you want. You might find something nice to eat!

112201019.content: You said all that just to tell us you're not going to come?

112201020.content: Fixing the ship is probably a lot more important. Let's not bother Skadi with foraging. So... who has experience with finding food?

112201021.content: An embarrassed silence descends on the group.

112201022.content: Well, as long as it's meat, anything should be okay, right?

112201023.content: That's assuming that we can find meat...

112201024.content: Yeah. I'm sure if we all put our heads together we can find some decent ingredients. We just need to try.

112201025.content: And I suppose I'm going to be the one testing whether the food is edible?

112201026.content: Stop! We can keep arguing all day, but then the Admin's going to starve to death. Let's just go!

112201027.content: Apparently sick of talking, they head excitedly into the jungle.

112201028.content: After traveling a short distance, the group decides to split ways in search of whatever strikes them as "edible."

112201029.content: Woohoo! This is great! Tonight... a mushroom banquet!

112201030.content: Zenkibo returns to the camp first, proudly displaying her trophy.

112201034.content: Don't worry. I remember reading a book about mushrooms once, and I remember specifically these are non-fatal. They can, however, cause hallucinations. Perfect for a prank!

112201035.content: How about we just agree now I'm not going to eat those?

112201036.content: Lame. Where's your sense of adventure, Admin? But never fear...

112201037.content: Saying this, Zenkibo immediately changes her tune and pulls a much less exciting-looking, gray-white mushroom from behind her back.

112201038.content: I can't have you starve to death on me, Admin—otherwise I'll lose the most perfect foil for some of my pranks!

112201039.content: Am I supposed to thank you for that?

112201040.content: I also found you some food, Admin!

112201041.content: Verthandi yells out to me from quite a distance. As she approaches, I can clearly make out the still jumping frogs that she's carrying in her hands.

112201043.content: Oh my... Aren't rainforest frogs even more dangerous than colorful mushrooms?

112201044.content: Are they? I mean, at least they're meat.

112201045.content: It's alright. Admin will know very quickly whether or not they're edible after trying them.

112201047.content: No worries. I'll try some for Admin.

112201049.content: C'mon! I've had plenty of them. They're delicious!

112201050.content: I carefully examine the frogs Verthandi has retrieved from the jungle. There's something a little bit disturbing about the intricately colored markings on their backs.

112201051.content: Maybe not... I really don't think that these are edible.

112201052.content: I hope Poseidon's brought back something a little bit more normal...

112201053.content: Almost as if she'd heard me say her name, Poseidon returns with her precious haul.

112201054.content: So you all found food as well? Guess I was a bit slow...

112201055.content: That's fine! Being slow means you took the time to find even better ingredients!

112201056.content: As we're talking, Poseidon presents her haul: Berries, wild vegetables, and some colorful flower stems—a really colorful assortment.

112201057.content: The ingredients all seem quite standard—a bit boring, even.

112201059.content: Do you think eating all of this would hold the Administrator over until tomorrow?

112201060.content: I suppose the best foods all have high caloric content, but...

112201061.content: I mean, I found some bird eggs too. But then I thought about how they must be waiting for their mom to come back, and so I thought...

112201065.content: Poseidon's apology made me inexplicably ashamed.

112201066.content: To tell you the truth, I feel like I'm just a burden on everyone. I can't just sit around and do nothing.

112201067.content: I should do it all myself—food, foraging, shelter, the works!

112201068.content: My newfound resolve takes an immediate hit as my stomach starts grumbling very loudly. The hunger pangs have become unbearable. I feel like I'm going to kneel over.

112201069.content: Don't push yourself too hard, Admin!

112201070.content: You can't send a tired and hungry human on a marathon, anyway.

112201071.content: Why are you on the ground, Admin?

112201072.content: I lift my head with some effort. Leviathan is back.

112201073.content: Unexpectedly, it turns out that Leviathan is the only one in our little group who actually managed to come through with the goods.

112201074.content: The "knapsack" over Leviathan's shoulder is filled to the brim with freshwater fish, crabs, and all kinds of fruits. I even recognize a couple of very ripe coconuts in there. In short, it's well enough for a banquet.

112201075.content: Where'd you find all this stuff, Leviathan?

112201076.content: The river, trees... everywhere basically. I just went over and grabbed them.

112201077.content: Why is it that Leviathan is the most capable of our entire group when it comes to finding food?

112201078.content: Why is that such a surprise? I've been learning a long time at the feet of my Master. And that knowledge doesn't just apply to the Arctic, but tropical rainforests too. The Administrator's not gonna starve on my watch!

112201079.content: Leviathan, truly... You've saved my life.

112201080.content: Leviathan goes slightly red in the face at this.

112201081.content: Don't say things like that with a straight face!

112201082.content: My food sourcing issue is finally resolved.

112201083.content: And I also learn an important lesson: Never underestimate anyone in the group.

112211001.content: The now slightly cold sea wind blows gently over the dark beach. As our bonfire crackles, the members of our group stare at the food, at each other, and then at the food again.

112211002.content: Come to think of it, I don't think anyone here knows how to cook, do they?

112211003.content: I mean, I know a little bit. But I've got hardly any strength left. I couldn't even carry a pot over to the fire.

112211004.content: Not to worry. Master taught me how to cook!

112211006.content: Master said that after you catch a seal, you've got to cut its stomach open, stuff it full of meat, and then bury it deep underground. And then, after a few days, you dig it up and eat it.

112211008.content: What is that—the world of food according to ice nomads?

112211009.content: You've got to cut open the seal's stomach?

112211010.content: You're all overthinking it. Cooking is actually quite easy.

112211011.content: Skadi pops up, rejoining us after finishing with the ship repairs. She still has her welding torch in hand.

112211012.content: She turns the welding torch on. A bright red tongue of fire appears.

112211013.content: Cooking is simply a combination of heat and meat!

112211014.content: Everyone looks with concern at the rather dangerous welding torch, and steps back.

112211015.content: Is that really necessary? Isn't it a bit dangerous?

112211016.content: Haven't you seen how the master chefs do it on TV, Admin? All you need to do is to give your ingredients a quick once-over with a hot flame, and ta-da! Gourmet food!

112211017.content: Well... Give it a try, I guess.

112211019.content: Skadi places a rather juicy-looking fish on a simple barbecue skewer, and then reactivates the welding torch...

112211020.content: The smell of burned flesh immediately hits my nostrils.

112211021.content: Hey! The fish is on fire!

112211022.content: So the fire is a bit strong, huh? Not to worry! I've got it under control.

112211023.content: Skadi turns off the welding torch and takes out a fire extinguisher. She uses it to hose down the barbecued fish, which is quickly turning black.

112211024.content: Displayed in front of us is a charred fish covered with fire foam.

112211026.content: Well. Are you going to try this specialty dish, Admin?

112211027.content: You know what? I'm not feeling very hungry anymore.

112211028.content: Okay, I did overcook it a bit... But I'm sure that I'll get the hang of this after a few more tries.

112211029.content: After a few more tries I think we're just going to have to get some more food.

112211030.content: I see our lack of supplies is hindering my culinary vision!

112211031.content: Just in case they don't turn out well, I think maybe we shouldn't attempt any more high-risk, high-reward cooking maneuvers today. The water in the pot is steaming hot. Why don't we start with the simplest cooking method: Boiling?

112211032.content: Heehee, I've got experience with that!

112211033.content: So saying, an enthusiastic Zenkibo chucks a few choice morsels of food into the boiling water and then follows up with some spices she's scrounged from the ship's galley. Finally, she places the lid on.

112211035.content: Next, we let it all boil for about three minutes, and then it should be ready to eat!

112211036.content: Zenkibo, you do realize that this is not the same as instant noodles?

112211037.content: I only have experience with instant noodles. But, I mean, the principal is the same, right?

112211039.content: If cooking was as easy as just throwing a bunch of ingredients and seasonings into a pot and boiling them for three minutes, the world's chefs would all be out of a job.

112211040.content: But it seems more like cooking than using a welding torch, at least. The meal might still be salvageable.

112211042.content: Well, sometimes I get hungry, and I'm too busy to go out. So I have cooked on occasion. It took a while, but I did manage to learn a bit.

112211044.content: Lemme think... I do know you've gotta constantly stir the food as it's boiling. Pluck out anything that doesn't seem to be cooking. And then add seasoning.

112211045.content: Verthandi works away steadily at Zenkibo's pot of random ingredients. And then, wonder of wonders, a pleasant aroma emerges. We all stare at her and the pot in amazement.

112211046.content: Oh yeah! We should add some mushrooms. That'll make the soup tastier.

112211047.content: With immense precision, Verthandi quickly chops up the nearby mushrooms and drops them in. It takes me a few seconds to register exactly what has happened.

112211049.content: Uh-oh. I think I forgot to separate the hallucinogenic mushrooms from the normal mushrooms. Oopsie.

112211051.content: Hehe, still want to take a sip, Admin? You may hallucinate a little bit, but at least it'll be tasty. How about it?

112211052.content: The soup actually does smell quite enticing. But my instincts tell me to refuse anything containing powerful hallucinogens.

112211053.content: My mind says no, but my stomach disagrees, grumbling at the delicious smell wafting from the soup. My body grows faint with hunger. And pretty soon my world fades to black again...

112211054.content: Once again I feel a breeze against my face and hear the loud crackling of a nearby fire... I catch a whiff of the delicious-smelling stew. I open my eyes again.

112211056.content: Zenkibo! Exactly how poisonous were those mushrooms. I think just the smell of them knocked the Administrator out.

112211057.content: Hum. The Administrator obviously fainted from hunger after smelling that delicious soup! If only we'd gotten some into the tummy... Well, Admin probably would've still passed out anyway, actually...

112211058.content: It's taking too long to cook! Why don't we go back to barbecuing!

112211059.content: Everyone but Poseidon starts arguing. She walks over to me and hands me a bowl of fish soup.

112211060.content: Have some while it's still hot, Admin.

112211062.content: Don't worry, it's not Zenkibo's soup. I redid the whole thing.

112211063.content: We're happy to help you out if you can't finish it, Admin.

112211064.content: That's right! You shouldn't waste food, you know!

112211066.content: Well, it certainly wasn't directed at me!

112211067.content: The fragrance coming off Poseidon's fish soup is so enticing, it's got everyone in the camp salivating.

112211068.content: You're such a great cook, Poseidon. Why didn't you say something before?

112211069.content: A great cook? Me? I-I wouldn't say that...

112211070.content: I mean, I have read a few cookbooks, but I've never attempted to actually cook before. Seeing as I'd be cooking for the Administrator... Well, I was afraid I'd make a mistake if I tried my hand.

112211071.content: But I felt I had no choice seeing you faint like that. So I gave it a shot and... I guess I got lucky.

112211072.content: Anyway, eat it while it's hot.

112211073.content: I taste a spoonful of the fish soup. The delicious food and the warm aroma immediately dispel the fatigue I've been battling all day.

112211074.content: I shouldn't be surprised that the most caring Poseidon also turned out to be the most reliable...

112221002.content: As the morning sun rises, a sea breeze brings an added layer of sticky heat to the campsite. I notice the usually enthusiastic Leviathan is not in good spirits today. She is hugging her knees under the shade of a tree.

112221004.content: Anyone in that arctic clothing would go crazy on such a hot tropical island.

112221005.content: That's strange. I thought that Leviathan's suit has an automatic temperature adjustment system?

112221006.content: Yes... I mean, it's still kind of relative.

112221008.content: Admin, think about it. Who does Leviathan always hang around with?

112221010.content: Bingo! Vidar is basically like a walking refrigerator. She generates the temperature around her.

112221011.content: So basically—put someone who's always hanging around Vidar on a hot tropical island, and even with a temperature adjustment system, they won't be able to stand the temperature on a psychological level.

112221012.content: She's not going to have a heatstroke, is she? We've gotta do something...

112221013.content: I have to call an emergency meeting on how to help Leviathan deal with heatstroke!

112221015.content: I call a meeting. The first session of the "Leviathan Heatstroke Prevention Council" comes to order.

112221016.content: Heatstroke? Can Modifiers even get heatstroke?

112221017.content: Modifier physiology isn't so different from that of an ordinary human being. Overheating could definitely be an issue.

112221018.content: Aren't we making mountains out of molehills here, Admin? Can't Leviathan just spend a bit more time in the shade?

112221019.content: Everyone takes a moment to glance over at Leviathan under her tree. She seems even more forlorn.

112221022.content: This is her first real mission away from Vidar. I don't know how I'd explain myself if something happened to her—either to Miss Shu or Vidar...

112221023.content: Don't worry, Admin. We're all here with you. We'll think of something!

112221025.content: How about... We could put Leviathan in the water for a while? It's colder there.

112221026.content: She probably wouldn't sink... I mean, she is "Leviathan," after all.

112221027.content: You need to sit down and think about the difference between the word "prank" and the word "help," Zenkibo.

112221028.content: Well, I mean, swimming can lower body temperature. But, looking at her now... I guess she probably doesn't have the energy for a swim.

112221029.content: Hey, didn't we save a few bottles of yogurt from the broken fridge when we were helping Skadi clear out the cabins yesterday?

112221030.content: I remember one time I had this super spicy soup. It felt like my tongue was actually on fire. But then, I drank a bottle of yogurt and it cooled it right down!

112221031.content: Cooling your body and cooling your tongue are two different things, Ver.

112221033.content: I would just forget about those bottles of yogurt. The fridge stopped working right when Snowflake 2 started taking on water. The yogurt's sure to have gone bad.

112221034.content: Even if it were to help cool her down, we'd have to contend with the more frightening after-effects of eating rotten food...

112221035.content: Oh yeah, I just remembered about the fridge...

112221036.content: Do you think that you could fix the fridge, Skadi? It'd be really nice to have some cold drinks around here.

112221037.content: Um, well… The only things I know how to fix are ships. I've got no clue how to fix a fridge.

112221038.content: But, you know, my Waverender has a built-in cooling weapon. With a few tweaks, it might just do the trick...

112221039.content: Hold on! We just want to cool Leviathan down. We don't need a fire extinguisher!

112221040.content: How can we know it won't work if we don't try?

112221041.content: The other members of the group try to restrain Skadi from making what looks to be some quite dangerous modifications to her cold-generating weapon. Poseidon returns at this moment. The sweet smell of fruit that comes with her distracts everyone from our argument.

112221042.content: Wow... What's that? It smells fantastic!

112221043.content: We all notice Poseidon has a large cup of fruit juice in her hands.

112221044.content: I made a beverage by mixing fruit juice with some spring water from deep in the jungle.

112221045.content: Actually, lowering body temperature is only one facet of preventing heatstroke. We also need to rebalance the ions within the body.

112221046.content: There are some special fruits that are particularly effective in that regard. Fortunately, I'd gathered some already.

112221047.content: I made enough for everybody. It's been getting hotter around here. We would all do well to take care of ourselves so we don't suffer from heatstroke.

112221048.content: You came through for everyone once again, Poseidon.

112221049.content: The group enjoys the lovely, cooling beverage. The sweet drinks really do seem to make the sweltering beach seem much cooler.

112221051.content: It's so sweet and refreshing... Thank you.

112221052.content: Leviathan's voice trails off into very light snoring... She has fallen asleep against the tree.

112221053.content: Maybe we were wrong about the heatstroke. Maybe she was just tired?

112221054.content: Exertion can also trigger a heatstroke episode. Leviathan searched an entire island on her own. She's been working herself very hard.

112221055.content: You don't think those jokes I made before really got to her?

112221056.content: We're not going to be outdone by Leviathan, are we? Let's try to finish searching the island we are in charge of tomorrow, Zenkibo!

112221057.content: I was afraid you'd say that.

112221058.content: Skadi, could you modify the schedules to lighten Leviathan's load?

112221059.content: If a captain changes their course on every whim, they'll never reach their destination. What's more, I trust our little arctic adventurer.

112221060.content: We all stare at Leviathan for a moment. And then, as if she can somehow feel the tension, she starts talking in her sleep.

112221061.content: I... don't... need any one's help...

112221062.content: I can do it on my own... I can do it even without Master here...

112221063.content: Oh dear. I think my jokes really did get to her.

112221064.content: With that, Zenkibo helps Verthandi carry Leviathan to a cooler area of the island out of the increasingly hot rays of the sun.

112231001.content: Attention! Everyone! I would like to formally announce that today Snowflake 2 has been fully restored!

112231002.content: So can we get out of here now?

112231003.content: Hold your horses. Haven't I been telling you not to be so hasty?

112231004.content: I may have fixed the flooded propulsion system, but I'm afraid the ship is not going to be much good against ocean currents and storms until we can locate those missing parts.

112231005.content: However, I'd like to invite everyone on a voyage to celebrate the restoration of Snowflake 2!

112231006.content: Skadi really does love that ship.

112231008.content: Weird... Skadi can fix a ship that big, but can't fix a fridge?

112231009.content: So is this celebration voyage just going to be a cruise around the islands?

112231010.content: Of course not! Snowflake 2 is nothing if not a diligent and hard-working lass. She would never tolerate such an egregious waste of fuel.

112231011.content: On one of my test voyages a few days ago, I discovered an area nearby absolutely teeming with fish. I think this presents an excellent opportunity to improve Admin's diet.

112231012.content: Therefore, I declare today's main event to be... fishing!

112231013.content: Skadi excitedly displays the prepped fishing rods for all of us to see.

112231014.content: So the conclusion of all this is we have to work more?

112231015.content: Snowflake 2's trawling equipment is currently being used elsewhere. Moreover, even if we did use the trawler, where would we put all the fish? I don't want it stinking up my deck.

112231016.content: It's a good thing I prepped a few fishing rods before we left. All we need is one decent fish to significantly improve our dining experience.

112231017.content: Finally! A chance to show off a skill I've practiced many times at the feet of my Master! I bet you I'm gonna catch the most fish!

112231019.content: Oh? Sounds like we've got ourselves a competition.

112231020.content: I don't like the way Zenkibo and Leviathan are glaring each other, and rush to intervene. As it turns out, Leviathan is actually quite interested in taking up Zenkibo's offer.

112231021.content: I don't mind a little competition. But we have to get the rules straight. It can't just be about the number of fish caught.

112231022.content: First of all, we need a judge—someone who knows about fish. Let's say Poseidon. Then we need to look at the total value of the fish caught based on two factors: Taste and rarity. Based on that, we can assign a score and ranking.

112231023.content: Pfft! I don't care how many rules you make. I'm still going to win!

112231024.content: And there are no special prizes for first place yet... How about a punishment instead? The loser has to prepare tonight's dinner.

112231025.content: Fine! Like I'm afraid of that!

112231027.content: I'll take any chance to share my love of all things sea-related.

112231028.content: I'd like to take part as well! Hold on. Let me set the ship on automatic mode.

112231029.content: I'm speechless. Zenkibo has actually suggested a group activity everybody likes.

112231031.content: I hear a loud "plunk" off the side of the ship. Skadi has already thrown her line into the water.

112231032.content: Shouldn't someone announce the start of the competition first?

112231033.content: The fish aren't gonna stay in one spot forever, Admin. You snooze, you lose!

112231034.content: That does make sense, I guess.

112231035.content: The referee has declared the game's started!

112231036.content: As we talk, everyone starts preparing. Zenkibo throws a bit more fuel on the fire by passing some bait to Leviathan herself.

112231037.content: Skadi is obviously quite the experienced fisher. There's a little nibble on her line and, before long, she's tensing her arms for a tug-of-war with her quarry.

112231038.content: Looks like I've caught a big one right out of the gate!? Whatevs. Fishing is an endurance game!

112231039.content: Skadi pulls on her line until a large fish emerges from the water and lands, still thrashing, onto the deck.

112231041.content: Wow! It's pretty big... Plenty of food for tonight!

112231044.content: While salmon is a very tasty fish, it's not particularly rare in these parts.

112231045.content: I thought that we were trying to find food here. Wasn't that the original point of the contest?

112231046.content: There's a difference between finding food and going fishing. What most important is that it's fun. Now watch this...
