112231047.content: It looks like Zenkibo herself has hooked a fish. A quick tug of her rod and a little fish emerges from the water.

112231048.content: What's that? It's so ugly! Hey—it's changing color!

112231049.content: Oh, a flounder? It's a deep-sea fish. I'm shocked you caught one in these shallow waters.

112231050.content: By virtue of its rarity alone, it deserves 6 points.

112231051.content: Geez... You mean I just barely passed?

112231052.content: Taste is more important than rarity. Hum, I'm not going to lose to Skadi...

112231053.content: At some point Verthandi also catches a bite. A new tug-of-war begins.

112231054.content: Wow! This looks like a real big one! Good work, Ver!

112231056.content: Verthandi forcefully hauls the heavy entity up. A multi-tentacled creature lands on the deck, arms writhing.

112231058.content: An octopus? How did you manage to catch an octopus?

112231060.content: Who cares about points? Barbecued octopus is delicious!

112231061.content: Everyone else manages to hook at least one sea creature. Finally, it's my turn.

112231063.content: I win the tug of war with whatever fish I've hooked. I pull it out of the water.

112231065.content: Is that rarer than my salmon!?

112231066.content: Is it tastier than my flounder?

112231067.content: You know, a whole sardine makes for a very nice roast.

112231069.content: You don't have to try and comfort me with that smile, Poseidon. I know that I'm coming last...

112231071.content: Zenkibo gestures at Leviathan. It's only then we notice Leviathan still hasn't caught anything.

112231072.content: What are you all looking at me for? I've saved the best for last. I'm going to use all Master has taught me about fishing to catch the rarest and tastiest fish of them all!

112231073.content: No sooner do the words come out of Leviathan's mouth than her line goes very taut. She pulls and swings around hard. We duck out of the way just in time.

112231075.content: Haha! C'mon, big boy! Don't worry. I... c-can do it on my own!

112231076.content: Leviathan reels in her catch as hard as she can. And then we finally get a glimpse of what she has caught from under the water.

112231077.content: A black circular object lands on the deck, which then bounces a few more times before falling over. It's a car tire.

112231078.content: No one says anything for a while.

112231079.content: Hmm... A tricky one to grade, that's for sure.

112231080.content: A tire? You can't roast a tire.

112231081.content: But I have to give Leviathan credit!

112231082.content: I think Leviathan has won when it comes to rarity. What are the chances of catching a tire out here in the middle of nowhere?

112231083.content: I don't understand... Master taught me all she knows about fishing!

112231084.content: Leviathan stares suspiciously at her hook and bait. Only then does she realize her "bait" is still on the hook, and there's something off about it. It's a rubber band, shaped to look like a grub.

112231085.content: The only thing that would wanna eat that... is a tire.

112231087.content: Leviathan waves her fishing rod around angrily as she takes off after Zenkibo. Everyone else can't help but smile.

112241001.content: Let the Evening of Ghost Stories commence!

112241002.content: Zenkibo takes great delight in casting sinister shadows across her face with a flashlight as our "Evening of Ghost Stories" begins.

112241003.content: I do like the idea of doing something to keep people entertained during the evening. But ghost stories? Really?

112241004.content: Well, I mean, this was Zenkibo's idea, after all...

112241005.content: To those small of courage and weak of heart: Feel free to head back to the tent.

112241006.content: Who are you calling small of courage? All I'm saying is I find ghost stories just as boring as doing nothing!

112241007.content: Well then, we don't have to waste time asking you to tell one, Leviathan. So who else would like to tell the first ghost story of the evening?

112241009.content: Verthandi raises her hand with the kind of enthusiasm and cheerfulness one would not normally expect during an "Evening of Ghost Stories."

112241010.content: No harm in letting Ver go first, I guess.

112241011.content: A long, long time ago there was a little girl who traveled all on her own to a mysterious, ancient castle. It was completely abandoned except for a large colony of bats that lived up in the roof.

112241012.content: Verthandi is off to a surprisingly strong start. It looks like she knows what she's doing. Leviathan is already anxiously coiled up.

112241013.content: In this castle, there also lived a ghost prince, who was also the girl's good friend. One day the girl went to the castle to play hide and seek with the ghost prince, as they had planned...

112241014.content: Wait... is this... a fairy tale?

112241015.content: What? It has ghosts in it, doesn't it?

112241016.content: Hum. Ghost stories are meant to be scary! That's what makes them ghost stories—not literally having ghosts in them!

112241017.content: Is there no one here capable of telling a decent ghost story?

112241018.content: Eh? I don't know if I could tell a scary story, but I enjoy listening to them. I wonder whether there's a ghost story that could frighten a captain.

112241019.content: Umm... Is it really such a good idea to go around frightening others?

112241020.content: Interesting. It's obvious bravery and empathy are not necessarily great qualities for a ghost storyteller. What about you, Admin?

112241021.content: I... (Cough)... Once upon a time, there was a ghost...

112241022.content: Stop. I can already tell this is not going to be scary at all.

112241023.content: It looks like it's up to me again, as usual.

112241024.content: Zenkibo turns her flashlight back on to project more eerie shadows across her face.

112241025.content: Once upon a time, there was a group of explorers. They suffered a terrible shipwreck, which stranded them on a deserted island. There they would have to remain, scrounging for supplies while they waited for rescue.

112241026.content: The explorers arrived with very little food. Rationing the food fairly became an urgent priority. They elected a captain to handle this duty.

112241027.content: The captain lived alone in a large tent, in which was also stored the entire team's supply of food. He swore a sacred duty to keep a careful eye on the food. He also promised he would not help himself to more than his fair share, no matter how hungry he got.

112241028.content: But one night, the captain suddenly heard soft whispers from outside the tent.

112241030.content: The voice the captain had heard was that of his younger sister, who had also ended up on the island with them. She had gone downhill fast. There just wasn't enough food to go around. It all became too much for the captain, her brother, to bear.

112241031.content: He decided to make an exception for his own dear sister, and secretly offered her a bit of extra food.

112241032.content: "It's so nice... Time to eat, brother!"

112241033.content: Hearing the sounds of her greedily munching on the food outside his tent, the captain was finally able to sleep soundly.

112241034.content: This happened again and again over the next several nights.

112241035.content: Eventually, it became obvious that something was happening to the group's rations. The other members questioned the captain about this.

112241036.content: There was really no way out of it for him. Eventually, he admitted he had been allowing his sister to have more than her fair share. Not only did the rest of the team not excuse this failure of duty, but they also revealed an incredible and shocking fact...

112241037.content: The captain's sister had never made it onto the island. She had been swept to the depths of the sea when their ship capsized. Her body—that is, her corpse—was never recovered.

112241038.content: Time and despair seemed to have wiped this horrific truth from the captain's memory.

112241039.content: The captain told them he had passed the food through the tent flap, and had never really gotten a good look at exactly who had taken it. He started to believe somebody had impersonated his sister to trick him out of the food.

112241040.content: No one bought his story. They decided to give him a thorough beating and confiscate all of his rations.

112241041.content: Even so, there was hardly enough food to last the group much longer. They decided to search for food on the other side of the island, but didn't allow the captain to join them. He would have to stay there. Whatever happened to him would happen.

112241042.content: As the captain languished in his tent on the verge of death, he heard a familiar voice outside the tent.

112241044.content: He leapt up and tore away the flap. He was so eager to see exactly who it was...

112241045.content: It was indeed his sister. But not at all as he had remembered her.

112241046.content: At some point in the story Zenkibo had stood up and quietly tiptoed around behind Leviathan, who had her eyes closed in sheer terror. Zenkibo whispered the end of the story into Leviathan's ear:

112241049.content: Stay back! Don't eat me! Ahhh!

112241050.content: Hahaaaa! Now that was a ghost story.

112241051.content: Umm... Something about that story made me hungry.

112241053.content: A shame they didn't have a better captain—if so, the ship never would've capsized in the first place.

112241054.content: We have an outstanding captain, but our ship still capsized.

112241055.content: Maybe everyone should go to bed. We've still got to keep searching the island tomorrow.

112241056.content: And thus, at Skadi's urging, the "Evening of Ghost Stories" comes to a close as everyone heads back to their tents to rest.

112241057.content: But there was something rather creepy about Zenkibo's ghost story. It casts a shadow over my thoughts, one that I can't quite shake off. And as I begin to doze off that evening, I can almost hear the voice of the captain's sister just outside my tent as well.

112241060.content: Hidden in the moist sea breeze, I detect a hint of something sinister...

112241061.content: I quickly realize I'm hearing a voice—not a voice from my dreams, but a real voice outside my tent. Any desire I have to sleep quickly vanishes.

112241062.content: What if other souls had perished on this island in a manner not unlike the poor souls in Zenkibo's story?

112241063.content: The strange voice is quickly followed by a scream from Leviathan.

112241064.content: Ahhh! No, don't eat me! Ahhh!

112241065.content: Put down that Access Key! Get a hold of yourself!

112241066.content: Everyone was outside their tents now, staring at Leviathan brandishing her Access Key—and Zenkibo doing her best to hide from the coming onslaught.

112241067.content: After we successfully get Leviathan under control, we realize Zenkibo's personal voice recorder is still playing the last creepy words from the ghost story. The pieces fall into place.

112241068.content: Was that ghost story just an elaborate set-up for this prank?

112241069.content: Any decent prank requires a setup—the more elaborate, the better. But it's not my fault she's overreacting!

112241070.content: I'm not overreacting! I thought we were under attack... Yes! Attack!

112241071.content: I should have hidden the recorder a bit further from the tent. Then I could have taken a photo of Leviathan's embarrassing reaction. Hahaha!

112241072.content: The camp's main source of light suddenly goes out just as the moon disappears behind a layer of dark clouds. The only light remaining comes from the soft embers still glowing in the long-extinguished bonfire. Darkness surrounds us.

112241073.content: Did Leviathan trip some wires while she was messing around? Stay put, everyone. I'll have a look.

112241075.content: What?! A ghost! A water ghost grabbed my feet!

112241076.content: Skadi turns on a light as we all look in the direction of the voice. Indeed, Zenkibo has tripped over some tree roots.

112241077.content: Interesting. It turns out that Zenkibo is just as capable of being scared by ghost stories as telling them.

112241078.content: Everyone is unique in their own, special way.

112241079.content: Psh, I'd never get spooked by a measly old tree branch.

112241080.content: Me, scared? As if! I wasn't frightened... I just tripped.

112241081.content: By the way, I just checked the charge on the battery. There's not a lot left. Let's try to avoid using it. I think we can start by turning off the artificial lighting tonight.

112241082.content: H-Hey! Is that really a good idea?

112241083.content: S-So, anybody wants to share a tent? You'll get to listen to more ghost stories, free of charge.

112241084.content: We exchange looks before we all head individually to our own tents and close the tent flaps.

112251001.content: It is nearly noon. The sunlight begins to irritate my eyes as I stand, buried up to my neck in sand, with only my head above ground. I contemplate the beautiful sky and reflect on the sad events that led to me being in this state.

112251003.content: A night of constant rain had started to blur the distinction between the sea and land in our minds. We were supposed to have explored more of the island today, but nobody felt up for it. We all just returned to the campsite instead. We look at each other.

112251004.content: Hey!? What are you all doing back here? You've already narrowed down the location of the missing parts to a fairly precise area. Today's our chance to retrieve them all!

112251005.content: Well… The shallow bridges between the islands have all been submerged by the tide. We can't get where we need to go.

112251006.content: Well then, let's hitch a ride on Skadi's ship!

112251007.content: That's a no go, I'm afraid. I'm still testing the equipment. Snowflake 2 also needs a bit of time to rest and recover. I don't want to damage her systems by taking her out prematurely.

112251008.content: It's that moment again when everybody looks my way with a sense of anticipation, anxiety, and helplessness... That moment when only I, as the official mission leader, can offer them a solution they will accept.

112251010.content: You know, we've been searching these islands for a few days now. We've all gotta be exhausted. Why don't we take a day to rest?

112251011.content: Rest? Why would we waste a day to rest?

112251012.content: Here we are on a little vacation at the company's expense. This is a rare opportunity. And it's time to make the most of it!

112251014.content: Admin? Shouldn't we have a rest?

112251015.content: Yes—assuming the others will actually rest, that is.

112251016.content: A gust of wind passes me by. I turn around to see Zenkibo running headlong down the beach to the ocean.

112251019.content: HEY! Give me back my Access Key!

112251020.content: (Sigh)... I don't think the group's in the mood to rest.

112251022.content: Until now I think the group's all pretty much viewed this mission as a kind of extended vacation. They want to have a good time.

112251023.content: I can understand not wanting to leave the island considering that once we get all those parts back, we're going to have to leave and fight that Visbane.

112251024.content: Poseidon's wistful sentiments trigger a half-formed idea in my mind. I call everyone away from their little fight back to my side.

112251025.content: If all goes according to plan, we should be able to leave the island tomorrow. But before we do, I think it'd be awesome if we could all do something to commemorate our time here.

112251026.content: And that will be a... Sand Sculpture Competition!

112251027.content: I confidently declare my great plan. The silence that follows is deafening.

112251028.content: And I will be asking Miss Shu to award a special commendation to whoever wins!

112251030.content: Special commendation? Master will be so proud of me!

112251031.content: If there's bonus money involved, all I would ask for is a really nice barbecue.

112251032.content: I can't reject such a kind offer...

112251033.content: The promise of a bounty was enough to motivate everyone to go off in search of sculpting-quality sand.

112251034.content: So, you want us to leave our mark on the island with sand sculptures? Not a bad idea, Admin.

112251036.content: I've been on my fair share of voyages. I had an inkling that you were going to suggest something like this.

112251037.content: Our lives are always filled with places we visit at one point or another, but never return to. And sometimes we should honor that fact. We'll regret it if we don't.

112251038.content: Exactly so. I said it was a competition, but my hope is it will help everyone remember our time here together...

112251039.content: I am searching for words with which to thank Skadi for her thoughts. A loud shout stops me in my tracks.

112251040.content: Heh! I may have lost the other competitions, but I'm not going to lose this one!

112251041.content: Skadi promptly disappears off in the direction of the sand sculpture zone. I gradually realize nobody really cares about the stated purpose of my competition.

112251042.content: Everyone has completed their masterpieces by around noon. I take out a camera, prepared for just such a moment, to memorialize our masterpieces on film.

112251043.content: (Cough) And now for the judging phase. First of all, Zenkibo's...

112251044.content: All I find near Zenkibo is a large block of sand. It looks like the base for another sculpture to come later.

112251045.content: Hahaha! You spent all that time just to make a brick, Zenkibo?

112251046.content: Oh, I get it. It's an abstract work of art, isn't it?

112251047.content: No! Gosh. It looks like nobody here is really capable of judging or appreciating my sculpture... All you see is the base itself, not the statue of Goki that's on the base! I guess Goki can only be seen by a judge of the very highest aesthetic caliber!

112251048.content: Emperor's new clothes? More like emperor's new sculpture. Hehe...

112251049.content: Only Poseidon and I, the more serious members of the group, refrain from commenting. We flash an awkward smile.

112251051.content: Leviathan's sculpture resembles Vidar at first glance, but the proportions seem a little... squished. It's more like a mini-Vidar.

112251052.content: For such a big figure in your life, isn't it strange you made her shorter than you?

112251053.content: Who are you calling short, Shorty? I'll have you know if sand were as stable as snow, my Master's sculpture would be a lot taller and more impressive!

112251054.content: Well, the details are certainly there. You've even rendered Vidar's hairpin down to the most minute detail. It turns out that you quite a keen eye, Leviathan.

112251055.content: Leviathan goes red in the face, but remains silent.

112251057.content: Verthandi's sculpture is relatively straightforward: Meat skewers on a dinner plate. The only thing that particularly stands out is the enormous size of both the plate and skewers. They're skewers for giants, really.

112251058.content: If I end up winning a cash prize, I'm going to my favorite barbecue place in Core City for a good feast.

112251059.content: I quickly move along to avoid triggering Verthandi's hunger pangs.

112251061.content: I'm as shocked as everyone else when I finally lay eye on Poseidon's masterpiece...

112251062.content: Poseidon's sculpture consists of three dolphins riding a wave. The base of the sculpture had been skillfully manipulated into the shape of a wave with the three dolphins half-submerged in the water.

112251063.content: One of my friends, who works at an aquarium, is also an accomplished sand sculptor. I learned a few tricks from her.

112251064.content: Unfortunately, try as I might, no sand sculpture could ever capture the cuteness of real dolphins.

112251065.content: Poseidon may not be entirely happy with her handiwork, but there's no denying that everyone else is thoroughly impressed.

112251066.content: Except for Skadi, who's been getting impatient...

112251067.content: I've saved the best until last! Don't worry, you will soon be relieved of anxiety about whether you have a chance. The reality is, the competition is already over!

112251068.content: We all look over to Skadi's sculpture to discover a large pile of sand covered with a canvas. Obviously, she doesn't want to give anything away until the big reveal.

112251069.content: Say hello to the most outstanding sand sculpture today!

112251070.content: Skadi reveals her sculpture to looks of astonishment, and then faded, and then helplessness.

112251071.content: It's a sculpture of a ship.

112251072.content: Say hello to Snowflake 3! Wait, why does no one look surprised?

112251073.content: Skadi is really into shipbuilding, you know. She even passed industry-level shipbuilding exams. Ever since, any time there's a chance to make something, she's bound to make a ship.

112251075.content: My Master is not losing to a sand sculpture of a ship—whether in size or looks!

112251076.content: It's time for you to declare a winner, Admin... I'm sure that your aesthetic sensibilities are top tier. And so I'm sure that you can see Goki, can't you?

112251077.content: The decision should obviously not be left up to a single person.

112251078.content: Here are the rules: Everyone will get two votes to cast for your two favorite sculptures. And you cannot vote for the same sculpture twice.

112251079.content: Huh? We can't vote for our own sculpture twice?

112251080.content: Looks like I'm not getting that barbecue...

112251081.content: I'm obviously going to win because I know how much everyone loves Master! Wait! No one can love my Master as much as I do! Wait... That sounds weird...

112251082.content: Only two votes? That's a bit unfortunate for whoever doesn't get those two votes...

112251083.content: Inevitably, the final vote-tally descends into petty bickering. And then at some point Skadi boards "Snowflake 3."

112251084.content: Put away your doubts and indecision everyone, and cast your vote for... Wah!

112251085.content: Skadi's aggressive vote-canvassing had the disastrous effect of toppling her sculpture, which was clearly not strong enough to support her weight. This causes all the sand to come crashing down... on me.

112251086.content: Just as Skadi had declared, her masterpiece did indeed close out the competition.

112251087.content: And so, all these thoughts run through my mind as I lay buried up to my head in sand. I sigh. My attempt to leave some precious memories behind on this island ended in miserable failure.

112251088.content: The sun's glaring rays soften a bit. Skadi appears, helping to shield my eyes from the harsh sunlight.

112251089.content: However, Skadi doesn't look the least bit remorseful for what she has done. Her beaming smile makes it seem more like she is basking in her chaotic achievement.

112251091.content: Happy about what? My plans to memorialize our brief stay here have quite literally crumbled into sand.

112251092.content: As opposed to what, Admin? The waves would have done that anyway, given time.

112251093.content: It is not the beginning or the end that makes a journey—it's all the stuff in between.

112251094.content: And, in that sense, don't you think we've done a pretty good job of memorializing our stay on the island?

112251095.content: I glance at my surroundings. The Modifiers seem to be having a jolly old time playing in the sand. It makes me wonder... They may not be exactly human, but in so many ways they embody some of the dearest qualities of life.

112251096.content: I get out of the sand and raise my camera to snap a long-awaited photo.

112251098.content: Zenkibo pauses whatever prank she's currently pulling, and Leviathan stops pouting at the loss of her masterpiece. Everyone turns to grin at me and the camera.

112251099.content: I quickly press the shutter, commemorating the precious moment.

112261001.content: I'm just basking in the happy fact that summer vacation has almost arrived when Shu calls me into her office. I can't help but feel a little nervous.

112261003.content: Of course. I should have known. But my summer vacation...

112261004.content: Division Nine is responsible for dealing with Quakes and other unpredictable events, Administrator.

112261005.content: As you know, sometimes our duties can be somewhat... untimely.

112261006.content: Of course. I'm well aware. So what exactly is the nature of our mission this time?

112261007.content: Have you ever heard of the Peripheral Sea?

112261008.content: Peripheral Sea? Are you talking about the border region on the edge of the Sephirah Zone?

112261009.content: Very good. In principle, the activities of the inhabitants of each major zone are limited to areas quite far from the Sephirah Zone borders.

112261010.content: In the unlikely event someone gets too close to a border zone, there is always the possibility that the true nature of Gaea might be revealed to a member of the general public. And that is why we have special blocking mechanisms in the Peripheral Sea.

112261011.content: Any ship that breaches this area will encounter storms that interfere with their GPS. And then, once a ship is properly confused about where they're going, they're safely guided back out of the Peripheral Sea.

112261012.content: Come to think of it, I do remember quite a few legends about spooky areas of the sea.

112261013.content: Notwithstanding our best efforts, there are ships that do make it into these border zones, from time-to-time. But we make sure any report that gets out is simply characterized as paranormal activity or some kind of unbelievable monster encounter. That ensures, at the end of the day, no one takes them seriously.

112261014.content: So what's the issue this time?

112261015.content: Shu looks at me with unusual intensity from behind her glasses.

112261016.content: We've had a few vessels find their way into Ain Soph's Peripheral Sea, but our attempts to safely guide the vessels out have, for some reason, failed. They've completely disappeared.

112261018.content: We didn't pick up any Quakes or anything of that nature at the time. However, the Cryptics think that this event may have something to do with Visbanes. And that means us, Administrator.

112261019.content: Now, this isn't the kind of thing that we want widely advertised. The zone's design and its existence should be kept strictly confidential. I would like you to lead a team of Modifiers to go and investigate.

112261020.content: I'm getting the impression Division Nine doesn't have much intel...

112261021.content: I don't think there's anything to worry about in that regard. The Cryptics have assigned a low probability of danger to this mission. As a result, you'll have the pleasure of leading several less experienced members.

112261022.content: You'll be surrounded by beautiful blue skies and fair seas on an excellent cruise ship. Let's say it turns out to be nothing... Well then, your team will have the luxury of a gorgeous vacation paid for at Aether Gazer's expense.

112261023.content: A vacation at Aether Gazer's expense...

112261024.content: I'll email you the list of mission personnel. Make sure they know when to meet you and where to board the ship. Lateness will not be tolerated.

112261025.content: There is something especially dazzling about the beautiful harbor of Core City today. Shu has wisely chosen the furthest and least conspicuous pier from which to embark on our voyage. It also places us far away from the clamoring crowds, where we can enjoy the peace and quiet of the seaside.

112261026.content: Disturbing this peace and quiet, however, is another sort of clamor.

112261027.content: Can you just check it again? More carefully? I don't understand. How come Master is not on the list?

112261028.content: I've checked it a million times already, Leviathan. The team for this mission is me, you, Verthandi, Poseidon, Zenkibo...

112261032.content: I got the Administrator to forward the list of names to all of you, and yet you still dragged Vidar all the way down here just to confirm what you'd already seen. It's not good to be so clingy, Leviathan.

112261033.content: Leviathan's antics have drawn Shu out too. Leviathan seems to shrink back under the air of powerful authority only the leader of Division Nine can project.

112261034.content: I'm afraid you're going to have to learn to be more self-reliant on this mission, Leviathan. Vidar has a lot of other important tasks to attend to.

112261035.content: I'm not clingy! I'm just... I'm just a lot more effective with Master!

112261036.content: We look at each other and shrug. It's all we can do in the face of Leviathan's continual stubbornness. Vidar walks over and looks Leviathan square in the face with the kind of stony expression suitable only for a genuine master.

112261037.content: Leviathan, the penguin that hides behind the pack always gets eaten by the seal.

112261039.content: I know... You've told me that many times, Master.

112261040.content: So, I will not be coming on this mission.

112261042.content: Look at the time. Get ready to depart, everyone.

112261043.content: That raises the question: Where is the ship that will take us all the way to the Peripheral Sea?

112261044.content: The most important question is not which ship will take you, but who will pilot it. In order to bring you to the target location, that person will have to navigate around some very strong ocean currents.

112261045.content: It's not a very common skillset. Luckily we have a professional in Division Nine. I've called her in.

112261047.content: Team member? Best call me Captain.

112261048.content: A booming voice catches everyone's attention. We all turn to look in its direction...

112261049.content: Lo and behold, a navy-blue ship is already docked at the pier. And the voice? It comes from a girl sitting on the bow railing.

112261050.content: She looks dressed for hot weather and utterly confident as she sits there with her legs crossed. I get a distinct impression we're going to be dealing with a very carefree, very unlady-like tomboy.

112261053.content: Administrator, this is Skadi, Division Nine's Maritime Field Specialist.

112261054.content: Skadi, the success of the mission is in your hands.

112261055.content: No problem! It's a hard place to get to, but I guarantee we won't leave anyone behind.

112261056.content: Oh yeah, and... Looking forward to working together, Administrator.

112271001.content: I can tell that the ship is nearing its destination from the menacing dark clouds over the horizon and the increasingly choppy waves.

112271002.content: Skadi seems to be the only one unfazed by the sight. Everyone else is gazing in amazement, pondering over the purpose of the mission.

112271003.content: Are we sailing into that? That's crazy...

112271004.content: It's nothing to be frightened of. I've seen arctic snowstorms that were way worse.

112271005.content: Who are you kidding? If a monster in that whirlpool wants to drag the ship down, none of us are getting out.

112271006.content: So why is it so important to investigate these missing ships again?

112271007.content: You could always try reading the mission brief Shu sent you.

112271008.content: The Peripheral Sea is meant to look scary. That's how they make sure ships don't sail in.

112271009.content: And if there's a captain crazy enough to sail in, the strong ocean currents are sure to spit their ship back out somewhere else. It's when they don't come back that there's a problem.

112271010.content: Sk—Captain, how do we get in?

112271011.content: Just call me Skadi. You've been on my ship for a few days now. You're practically crew.

112271013.content: Getting in won't be a problem for me and Snowflake 2. All we have to do is make sure we ride the right currents.

112271014.content: And why is it so important to ride the right currents?

112271015.content: Have you ever been on a water slide, Admin?

112271016.content: This already doesn't sound very safe to me.

112271017.content: Don't worry about it. I've sailed these waters plenty of times. Not sure what'll happen, but rest easy that the ship will not capsize with me here.

112271019.content: Captain Skadi isn't the least bit concerned with my fretting. Instead, she starts rubbing her hands together in excitement at the thought of all the fun adventures we're about to have.

112271020.content: A loud beeping from the navigation room suddenly draws our attention.

112271021.content: Snowflake 2's radar is picking something up.

112271022.content: Hmm... Seems like there really may be something strange lurking out there. But I've never run into anything like this before.

112271024.content: That signal says there's Bane Energy.

112271025.content: That we were able to pick up the signal through all the interference here means that this Visbane is powerful.

112271026.content: So this proves that those disappearances must have something to do with the Visbanes, right?

112271027.content: As expected, the storm is interfering with our radar. The signal is jumping all over the place. We'll have to get a bit closer to determine exactly where it is.

112271028.content: You're the captain, Skadi. I trust your judgement.

112271029.content: You're my favorite type of crewmate, Administrator.

604601002.content: Don't worry. I'll just take the ship up to the edge. I don't want us getting pulled in, either.

604601003.content: I've locked the ship's wheel. It should just take us around in circles. We won't get sucked in.

604601005.content: Once I get a fix on the proper heading, we should be able to escape the pull of the currents.

604601006.content: But these red crystals are kinda getting in the way. I don't remember seeing these here before.

604601007.content: Hmm... What if we take the ship at full speed along with the current and smash into them?

604602001.content: Hey! I think I see a container floating over there!

604602002.content: Could it be from one of the missing ships? But there's no way we can pick it up with that current in between.

604602003.content: Not a problem! Let me show off one of Snowflake 2's many useful contraptions.

604602004.content: Our underwater scanner is not going to be affected by the currents! Now... launch!

604603001.content: Something interesting showed up on the radar.

604603003.content: The Bane Energy from the Visbanes up ahead is affecting the nearby currents.

604603004.content: I can see it. One of the nearby ocean currents is radiating Bane Energy.

604603005.content: I've got an idea: Let's get rid of all those Visbanes first, and see if that might help to change the direction of the current!

112272001.content: The radar is saying the source of the signal should be right on top of us.

112272002.content: But there's nothing here except for the currents and dark clouds.

112272003.content: Oh... The signal is coming from underwater.

112272005.content: It's hard to gauge the size of objects underwater. The thing might be quite big. At any rate, it'll definitely be harder to deal with than the scurvy devils that crawled up on deck before.

112272006.content: I should use the sensor to gather a bit more data.

112272007.content: Are we talking about a Behemoth Type, like Bifrons? Zenkibo, Poseidon, and I managed to take one of those down!

112272008.content: What!? A Behemoth Type!? And here I was hoping that we could have a nice vacation.

112272009.content: This is not a low-risk mission at all! Let's just get back and report this to headquarters! And I'm lodging a complaint first thing when we get back!

112272010.content: What's the big deal, even if it turns out to be a Behemoth Type? I don't want to tell Master that I just abandoned my mission like that.

112272011.content: Well, maybe a report would convince HQ to upgrade the mission difficulty level and send Vidar out to help us.

112272014.content: I can deal with not having Master around, but working with Zenkibo!? Ugh...

112272015.content: I, for one, am glad to have Leviathan in my group. Hehe...

112272016.content: Leviathan instinctively grabs her weapon at the sight of Zenkibo's mischievous smile. It looks like I'm going to have to intervene to stop yet another extremely stupid argument from breaking out.

112272017.content: So, are we going to contact HQ or not?

112272018.content: Don't listen to Zenkibo's nonsense. This is not a vacation. It's a proper mission.

112272019.content: I could tell when I took on this mission that Miss Shu viewed it as an opportunity to train us. We can't just give up at the first sign of trouble.

112272020.content: As we're arguing, a deep rumbling sound from beneath the waves rocks the ship. Something big is coming out of the water.

112272022.content: I think the sensor attracted its attention...

112272023.content: Right when Skadi says this, the deck starts shaking again. A massive cloud of dark mist rushes up out of the water and envelops us. It's suddenly very dark.

112272024.content: A few bolts of lightning from the storm helpfully illuminate our adversary. There's a pure white, winged Visbane soaring over the surface of the water, dragging what look like waves in its wake. It emits an ear-splitting scream.

112272025.content: There's something rather slender and fragile about its figure—like an elegant bird of legend or perhaps an angel. Unfortunately, the dark clouds and lightning behind make it look far more like a devil.

112272027.content: It's nowhere near as large as Bifrons! But something tells me it's going to be a lot harder to deal with!

112272028.content: The Bane Energy went off the charts when it came out of the water! I-I have no idea what kind of Visbane this is!

112272030.content: Forget the mission, Admin! We need to retreat!

112272032.content: Hold on, everyone. We're about to sail very quickly. Whatever you do, do not throw up on Snowflake 2's deck!

604701001.content: The Bane Energy signal is so strong. This Visbane is insanely powerful!

604701003.content: It'll make another pass at any moment. We've got to get out of here—now.

604701004.content: I have to ride these currents like an absolute pro. Otherwise, they're going to send us straight into that Visbane!

604702002.content: It's so fast—almost like a living eye of the storm...

604702003.content: If this keeps up, we're gonna hit it sooner or later...

604702004.content: Constantly running isn't a viable strategy. We have to use this opportunity to collect as much data as we can! Like items from the missing ships, samples of Bane Energy, and so on...

604702005.content: Once we get a good idea of what we're dealing with, it'll be easier to throw it off!

604703001.content: We've got more than enough information!

604703002.content: I got Snowflake 2's central computer to work it out. There's somewhere we can maybe avoid the Visbane for a while.

604703003.content: And we're going to have to get there ASAP! Hold on!

112282001.content: Skadi drives Snowflake 2 into a space between two powerful ocean currents. The screech of the Visbane finally recedes off into the distance.

112282002.content: Whew... Is everyone alright? No one hurt?

112282003.content: I'm psychologically damaged. Does that count?

112282004.content: I'm sorry. My first aid training didn't cover psychological trauma.

112282005.content: This is no time for jokes, Zenkibo!

112282006.content: I know... So can we contact HQ now?

112282007.content: Not an option, I'm afraid. The Visbane seems to be affecting the local environment somehow. It's making the storm even more powerful. Our long-range communications can't get through.

112282008.content: It's even more dangerous than the most powerful Visbanes we've encountered. I'm pretty sure we can guess at what happened to those missing ships.

112282009.content: At least we threw it off. So doesn't that mean we're out of its sphere of influence?

112282010.content: Unfortunately, no. We've just reached what you could call a blind spot.

112282011.content: The radar shows the Visbane still hovering around where Snowflake 2 just was. It's not going to let us go.

112282012.content: I switched off the engines. The moment I switch them back on, it's going to notice.

112282014.content: So how about we take that "water slide" you mentioned? Let's just find a current and follow it wherever it goes before the Visbane notices us again.

112282015.content: This Visbane is doing something to mess with all of the nearby currents. I have no idea where we'll end up. They might just send us straight back to the Visbane.

112282017.content: The other option is to try and force our way past—even if it tries to stop us.

112282018.content: I'm a bit worried about those bubbles it's generating... But I think at least we should be able to pull off a fighting retreat!

112282019.content: Yeah. I... I'm not afraid of that monster!

112282020.content: Cool it! We just barely survived the two run-ins we had with it.

112282021.content: Hmm... Let's just see if we can fight out way past!

112282023.content: There's no point just sitting here twiddling our thumbs. I say we go full throttle.

112282024.content: Let's head straight for the edge of the Peripheral Sea. Once we reach an area outside of the ocean currents, I don't think that the Visbane will be able to follow us.

112282025.content: It's going to chase us, I think. But all we have to do is just keep it at bay long enough to reach our destination.

112282026.content: However, Snowflake 2 won't survive too many hits. I'd say... Three! Three more encounters, and we are doomed. We have to find our way out of the Peripheral Sea before then.

112282027.content: Skadi's brow furrows as she considers the new daring plan and what careful strategies may be required.

112282028.content: This is going to be pretty dangerous, Admin. But I promise to do whatever I can to get everyone out safely!

112282030.content: Skadi, what do you need our help with?

112282031.content: I'll leave the fighting to the rest of you. And I just have one request.

112282032.content: Whatever you do, DO NOT throw up on Snowflake 2!

604801001.content: Our destination couldn't be clearer—the only viable exit from the Peripheral Sea. I've restarted the engines. Full speed ahead!

604801002.content: Seems we're going to have to hit pause on the mission. We can't collect any more intel.

604801003.content: Trust in my navigation abilities, Administrator.

604801004.content: Feel free to collect more information and items along our route. It'll just be much more difficult.

604801005.content: Obviously, running for our lives is the highest priority!

112292001.content: The waves and dark clouds begin to recede in the distance. We get to bask in the warming rays of the sun once again.

112292003.content: Haha! Told you I could do it!

112292004.content: Hum... Just like the pirate ship ride at the theme park!

112292006.content: First time I've ever seen a ship move like that. I think I'm going to be sick...

112292007.content: H-Hey wait! I already told you all! No throwing up on Snowflake 2!

112292008.content: Hold on a second. I have an anti-nausea pill.

112292010.content: We should be able to once we open up a bit of distance. Let me just go and sort out the console.

112292011.content: Skadi quickly connects to Aether Gazer HQ's dedicated channel. There's a burst of static. Then, we hear a very familiar voice.

112292012.content: Why are you contacting me so soon on the direct line, Skadi? Have you already finished your investigation?

112292013.content: Listen to me, Miss Shu: The situation is much worse than we expected. There's a bird—no, a Visbane that looks like a bird. And it is...

112292015.content: Shu doesn't get a chance to finish. The interference comes back, stronger than ever before. The channel fades to static.

112292016.content: That's weird. We're quite far from the Peripheral Sea. There's no way the Visbane should be able to affect us out here.

112292017.content: An all-too-familiar Bane Energy signal pops back up on the radar screen. Unimaginably, it seems to be heading directly for the ship.

112292018.content: It's not coming from behind! It's under us!

112292019.content: Skadi cries out just as a giant, swelling whirlpool appears next to Snowflake 2 and pulls us down into the depths...

605101001.content:
Oh dear. We seem to have failed.
Listen up, rookie. You can't land on the same piece twice—or leave the board once the game starts.

605102001.content: You're halfway there! Now find the other clue.

605103001.content: The door's open. Why don't you go in, rookie?

605104001.content:
A more interesting game is afoot!
See those squares with pieces on them? Help me step on them within a limited number of moves to win.

605105001.content: This is the famous Madam Kawalis Museum. Its reputation and priceless artworks have drawn a constant stream of tourists since its opening.

605105002.content: But the real source of the museum's worldwide fame is the missing persons reports filed less than a year after it opened. The museum was closed on July 15, 2214, after a girl disappeared the day before.

605105003.content: The police and the girl's parents searched the museum top to bottom, but they found no trace of her. When the museum reopened the following day, another child went missing...

605106001.content:
The name of the missing girl was Kia Oscar.
Her parents stated that she had been fascinated by the exhibits and had been running around from room to room. Eventually, she ran out of their sight and disappeared.

605106002.content: Don't worry, Kia. I'll rescue you!

605107001.content: Where has Mel got to? Mel...?

605107002.content: If Mel doesn't turn up soon, I'm going to end up as lost as any of those children...

605201001.content:
Oooh... What an interesting game!
I really have to thank you, Madam Kawalis. Hehe...

605201002.content: I wonder if everyone else enjoys it as much as I do?

605202001.content: You're lost too, aren't you? Don't worry, I'm a good person...

605202002.content: What's your name? You're Kia, right? I heard about you... But I can't remember where...

605203001.content: Stay back! Curses. What are these statues?

605203002.content: Why are they getting up and attacking?

605301001.content: There's a statue of a knight that can walk and talk, and a planetarium where you can see star trails.

605301002.content: There are also bookcases filled with of forbidden books. What a wonderful place!

605302001.content: Ah... Whew... I finally lost them.

605302002.content: The knights chase and attack anyone they see, but I've noticed they stick to a fixed path. All I have to do is get out of range, and then they'll forget about me.

605302003.content: Hehe... I'm pretty good at this.

605303001.content: I'm so tired... I want to sleep... But I don't think these weirdos will let me go until I put all my pieces down...

605303002.content: Oh? You know chess, Kia? Very impressive...

605401001.content: Whew... all rested up. It's great you defeated that weirdo, Kia! Thank you!

605401002.content: That move is called castling, right? Amazing, Kia.

605402001.content: Who on earth made up this game... They must be a bit twisted!

605402002.content: I think I made a wrong turn... What should I do? I can't rescue anyone by getting lost. Then I'll need someone to save me!

605403001.content: Curiosity is one of the most attractive qualities in any person.

605403002.content: It leads people to buried treasures, forgotten constellations, and... hidden traps in the dark abyss.

605501001.content: Effie is tired... This sofa looks comfortable. What a nice place for a nap.

605501002.content: Are you saying you want to go for a walk, Kia? Don't get lost! Oh wait... we're already lost, aren't we?

605502002.content: Human greed, human arrogance, human regret, human despair—What fun! Such ecstatic fun!

605503001.content: I came to help, but it turns out I'm the one who needs rescuing... This will be so embarrassing if Effie finds out...

605503002.content: Are you Kia? Wonderful! Oh? Did you say Effie is here with you too?

710990101.content: Kuninotokotachi approaches the door to the training room, checks the time, then leans against the wall to rest.

710990102.content: A little while passes. When Kuninotokotachi opens her eyes, Tsukuyomi is making her way over.

710990103.content: Are you here to train? Then again... it doesn't look like you are.

710990104.content: I finished my training, I was just waiting for you. Wanna join me for a drink?

710990105.content: ...As I recall, I declined your invitation just the other day.

710990106.content: How about today? Change your mind yet?

710990107.content: I wouldn't just change my mind about something like that. Besides, alcohol would dull my—

710990108.content: Okay, okay, okay. You're scaring me.

710990109.content: Kuninotokotachi follows Tsukuyomi into the training room. Kuninotokotachi sits off to the side and watches Tsukuyomi practice.

710990111.content: Ahh... Nothing goes better with a moonlit night than a carafe of good sake!

710990112.content: Your form is flawless. Still, don't you think adding a teeny bit of passion would give it more power?

710990114.content: Sis, come on! I trained my butt off earlier, I just wanna have a drink and unwind with someone... Honestly, you're breaking my heart here!

710990115.content: Tsukuyomi drops her stance and turns to look at Kuninotokotachi.

710990116.content: Huh? You're not mad, are you?

710990117.content: Of course not. It's just that...

710990118.content: Reading between the lines, Kuninotokotachi readies her Chidori.

710990120.content: If you lose, you're joining me for drinks. No take-backs.

710990122.content: The figures of the white-haired ninja and the black-haired warrior cross in the training room, like moonlight against the light of a blade.

710990202.content: What is it, Ver? Whatever it is, you can just come out and say it.

710990203.content: I know you've been busy lately, so I didn't want to bother you, but... I was wondering if you could teach me some sword techniques!

710990204.content: I see. But surely my style is quite different from the one you usually use?

710990205.content: True. But Buzenbo's always talking about stuff I'd never heard of before, like "kendo" and "spiritual training."

710990206.content: It all sounds so cool and mysterious!

710990207.content: There's actually nothing mysterious about them, they're just different ways of training.

710990208.content: Really? I've also seen you and Buzenbo meditate together. Actually, I was kind of hoping to join you sometime...

710990209.content: Why don't you try with me now then?

710990211.content: Ver follows Tsukuyomi into the training room.

710990212.content: Empty your mind and relax your body with even breaths.

710990213.content: (Relax... Relax... Relax... Ack! I'm still so nervous. Dang it...)

710990216.content: It's okay, that's normal for your first time. Don't be nervous. One by one, cast the thoughts from your mind...

710990217.content: Cast the thoughts... from my mind...

710990301.content: Sometimes I wonder if I'm going about this the right way...

710990302.content: Relax, your disciple's doing well. You should be proud.

710990303.content: Buzenbo? What does she have to do with this?

710990304.content: You... aren't referring to your teaching methods?

710990305.content: No, I was talking about Kuninotokotachi. I'm always trying to get her to exercise more restraint, but I haven't had any success yet...

710990306.content: I'm not good at teaching. Whenever we meditate or train, she always ends up taking the reins somehow.

710990307.content: I'm sure you would have better luck than me.

710990308.content: To be honest... I've been having doubts about my own teaching methods lately.

710990309.content: Zenkibo recently put hot sauce in all the cafeteria food and used AGI Mecha to stir up mayhem. I was only away on business for two days!

710990310.content: I've tried confining her to her quarters or having her reflect on her behavior, but she's relentless...

710990311.content: Well, yesterday Kuninotokotachi got so inebriated that she nearly missed our squad training session...

710990314.content: Maybe you could start with her temperament?

710990315.content: Zenkibo does mean well, she just like to goof around with everyone.

710990316.content: As for Kuninotokotachi, if it's a discipline problem, perhaps you could try being more firm with her?

710990317.content: No... her negligence has never actually gotten in the way of our missions, it's just a matter of lifestyle.

710990318.content: In that case, indulging her a little should be fine.

710990319.content: The same goes for Zenkibo, I suppose. If her heart's in the right place, then all she needs is a bit more discipline.

710990320.content: Maybe we need to rethink how we discipline our problem pupils. I guess there's no harm in occasionally going along with Zenkibo's pranks... within reason, of course.

710990321.content: Agreed. I suppose I could also join Kuninotokotachi for a drink once in a while.

711990101.content: Okay, let's end today's training session there. My apologies, I lost track of the time.

711990102.content: Go get some rest. You can come a little later to tomorrow morning's training.

711990103.content: But... I still don't get how to do this move...

711990104.content: Regardless, getting enough rest takes priority. My... master taught me this as well.

711990106.content: That morning, Buzenbo arrives at the training room earlier than usual to work on yesterday's technique.

711990107.content: Master? What's the time? Isn't it only...

711990108.content: Buzenbo? It's not time for our training session yet. What brings you here so early?

711990109.content: It's because that move... No, wait a minute, what are you doing here so early, Master?

711990110.content: Ahem, well, I was thinking that maybe there was something wrong with the way I was teaching it to you, so I...

711990111.content: But Master, your master said that rest is important. Did you not listen to your master, Master?

711990112.content: You're making my head spin... Anyway, it's not time yet. Why don't you go back and get some more rest?

711990114.content: I just need to get there before Master does...! I'm an hour earlier than yesterday, surely Master isn't already...

711990115.content: Buzenbo? What are you doing here so early again?

711990119.content: The sun's not even up yet. This time, I'll definitely...

711990121.content: ...Just how early do you get here every day, Master...?

711990201.content: Nuadha, I have a request to make of you.

711990202.content: If it's within my power, I'm happy to help. What can I do you for?

711990203.content: Would you be able to make an autonomous weapon capable of mimicking Shinri's performance?

711990204.content: Shinri's performance... Let me think. It'll probably require a lot of power, but it should be feasible...

711990205.content: But what do you need it for?

711990206.content: I've been using Shinri for a while now. I want to determine the extent to which I've mastered it.

711990207.content: Oh, like, "you're your own worst enemy?" Figures you'd think of something like that...

711990208.content: I suppose so. But at the end of the day, this blade is my Access Key, so it's impossible for anyone else to wield.

711990209.content: So, I was thinking that perhaps it could be emulated mechanically... Only, I don't know whether that's possible.

711990210.content: I'll see what I can do.

711990212.content: I've input the data from your training sessions using Shinri into this autonomous weapon. It can emulate 30% of your behavior patterns.

711990213.content: Yes, just 30%, I'm afraid... The training data alone won't reflect the full extent of your abilities. Plus, I'm only capable of so much. Sorry...

711990214.content: Still, this weapon is a close approximation of Shinri.

711990215.content: Okay, I'll give it a try...

711990216.content: Tsukuyomi and the autonomous weapon fight several times, each ending in a draw. Before long, the weapon abruptly stops moving.

711990217.content: Before Tsukuyomi realizes what's happening, she instinctively seizes this opening and strikes.

711990219.content: Don't worry, I was prepared for this eventuality. But why did it suddenly stop working...?

711990220.content: I see. When the system analysis returned no chance of victory, it crashed...

711990221.content: I'm sorry, I feel like I'm always troubling you with something.

711990222.content: Not at all, I see it as a challenge! I'll work on debugging this now. If you could help me test it out again when I'm finished, that'd be great!

711990223.content: Um... Why does it feel like... we've reversed roles?

711990302.content: So, those people just now, are they your associates?

711990303.content: Who do you mean? The big one or the little one?

711990305.content: The big guy was just a local ruffian, boring as they come. The other one is my disciple, clever little guy. Neither could be called associates, though.

711990306.content: Not that I need associates with my abilities.

711990307.content: I see. Thank you for your help. I'm afraid I'm in a bit of rush though, so I'm not sure how I can return the favor.

711990308.content: Well, in that case, why don't you just stay here and chat with me a while? That's all the thanks I need.

711990310.content: Why? You're in a hurry, and time is a valuable commodity. I much prefer something like that to boring old money.

711990312.content: Funny you should say that. You know what my nickname "Ninkyoumon" means, right? As far as "strange" or "weird" goes, you're right on the money.

711990313.content: "Ninkyoumon?" I've heard Kuninotokotachi mention that name before.

711990315.content: She's in Aether Gazer's Pheasant Squad.

711990316.content: Ohhh, right, I remember now! She's that... that...

711990317.content: When she mentioned you, she was talking about wanting to recruit you to the squad.

711990318.content: I remember she was complaining to me that you disappeared after she agreed to help you make arrangements for that child. Since you're here now...

711990319.content: ...That reminds me, aren't you in a hurry? I won't keep you any longer!

711990320.content: Kuramitsuha immediately sprints off into the distance.

711990321.content: Didn't you just say you wanted me to stay and talk?

711990322.content: I was just doing my duty, no need to thank me! Later!

711480101.content: Zenkibo? Are you there? There's a new buffet downstairs... Ah!

711480102.content: Zenkibo! What's wrong? Zenkibo, wake up!

711480103.content: She's not breathing! Oh, please, don't be dead, Zenkibo...

711480105.content: Hello? Is this Medical? Zenkibo's hurt! ...She's in her room! ...No, she's not breathing! ...Okay, I'll check her pulse.

711480106.content: (Uh-oh. Time to bring out the big guns!)

711480107.content: While Verthandi isn't looking, Zenkibo swallows a capsule.

711480108.content: She doesn't have a pulse, either. What do I do? ...I know! Since no one's here yet, I'll try the emergency procedures in the manual.

711480109.content: Verthandi places her hands on Zenkibo's chest and starts doing compressions, following the instructions in the manual.

711480111.content: She's responding! CPR is working! Come on, Zenkibo!

711480112.content: Come on... Was that not enough pressure? I'll have to try harder. Hang in there, Zenkibo, I've got you!

711480113.content: Ahhh! Stop it! I'm not dead!

711480114.content: Oh, thank goodness, you're okay! It looks like the CPR worked.

711480116.content: It didn't?! Then we have to get you to Medical and find Mimtastic. I'll help you!

711480117.content: No, no! I mean, I'm fine! You win!

711480118.content: Are you sure you don't need to go to the Medical Department?

711480119.content: Ahh, I'm fine! It was just a prank! Do I have to spell it out for you?

711480121.content: Just drop it! Let's just go to the buffet—I'll even treat you!

711480201.content: Poseidon... when will we be done with this?

711480202.content: When we finish handing out all these flyers.

711480203.content: I'd rather be forced to write an essay...

711480204.content: Zenkibo, I know you just want to have fun, but you really do go too far sometimes.

711480205.content: If Pineapple hadn't ducked... I'm sorry... I didn't break your doll on purpose...

711480206.content: Fine, fine. I wasn't really mad. But a punishment is a punishment. I'll keep my eye on you.

711480208.content: Poseidon... It's so hot outside... We've almost handed all of them out, so can we just go?

711480212.content: Finally, we're done! I want to go home!

711480213.content: We still have to pass out the second batch.

711480215.content: Hurry up now. The sooner you finish, the sooner you can go.

711480220.content: Next time I'll make sure not to get caught...

710480101.content: Pineapple, did you see "The Pineapple Knight" play at the Valleyrand Theme Park? Wasn't the Pineapple Knight so dreamy?

710480102.content: You thought so, too? I guess even the best disguise can't hide my fiery glory!

710480105.content: I never thought I'd get to see "Super Toastman" play in the Ain Soph Plaza! Good thing I got the last ticket. I earned it!

710480106.content: Hey, Zenki! I need your help! The stage hands left, and I can't get this off!

710480110.content: I believe in you. Gotta run, bye!

710480112.content: There's something off about that Iron Can Man...

710480113.content: Let me bathe this battlefield in sunlight!

710480117.content: What do you want...? I've already seen so much of you.

710480118.content: You know, my fees have increased significantly recently.

710480119.content: Did you come here to brag about that?

710480120.content: Why would I do that? I know you've been sending my invoices for me.

710480121.content: What I mean is, I just received my payment, and I'd like to treat you to a meal, as a way of saying thanks.

710480122.content: Really? Then what are we waiting for?

711480301.content: Shu and Zenkibo sit at either end of a long desk, a single reading lamp their only source of light.

711480302.content: So are you responsible for the quadruped AGI Mecha rampage too?

711480303.content: It wasn't a quadruped AGI Mecha, it was a Super Dragon Warrior!

711480304.content: (Sigh) Did you or did you not open fire on the roof with a modded high-power water gun the other day?

711480305.content: No, Ms. Shu, that was Goki-2!

711480306.content: Two? You mean there's also a One?

711480307.content: What? No. I just thought Two sounded better.

711480308.content: Never mind, the name doesn't matter. This is the twelfth time you've caused trouble these past few days, and four of those times were with large-scale devices.

711480309.content: Where did you get the money for them?

711480310.content: Uh... I made those myself. I didn't spend any money...

711480311.content: That's an outright lie, and you're not fooling me with it. I won't put the blame on you. Now answer me: Where did you get the money?

711480315.content: I believe that you wouldn't actually do anything bad, but... if you don't tell me now, I will have to confiscate your box of horrors.

711480316.content: Okay, I'll tell you! People paid me to write their reports for them! I can write ten a day, and everyone says I do a good job.

711480317.content: I never thought that making you write essays would have the opposite result I wanted... Do I have devise a new way of teaching you?

711480318.content: Wait, you mean I don't have to write any more essays? Oh, thank you, Ms. Shu! Well, if that's all, I guess I'll be going!

711480319.content: ...I want a one-hundred-page essay from you, due three days from now.

711480320.content: But—I thought you said you wouldn't blame me!

711480401.content: Long time no see, Zenkibo! Where've you been these last few days?

711480402.content: Uh... Ms. Shu grounded me for my Happy Potion War.

711480403.content: Huh? But we gave everyone the Happy Potions. Why would only you be grounded?

711480404.content: Speaking of which, you were grounded for the Surprise Gift Box War and the Cloud Blowfish War before this, too. I wonder why...?

711480405.content: Forget about the details! Aren't we partners in spreading joy? It's a small price to pay!

711480406.content: Anyway, I've got a new idea, and I need your help!

711480407.content: Do you see these Refreshment Tablets I worked so hard to make? You just smash them on your face and you'll feel refreshed!

711480408.content: Our goal is to smash them on the faces of everyone in Division Nine! I call it the Great Reformation!

711480409.content: Why do we have to smash them? Can't we just hand them out?

711480410.content: It's not that simple! The tablets only take effect with a hard impact.

711480411.content: Hm. Something just doesn't seem right...

711480412.content: It's the celebration for our fiftieth war! After we're done, I'll take you out for fried chicken!

711480414.content: They reach the doorway, and before Zenkibo can even look around, Asura uses her access key to grab a Refreshment Tablet and send it flying.

711480415.content: Why's it so heavy? Whatever. We're one step closer to fried chicken.

711480416.content: Huh? Wait! You knocked the AGI Mecha's head off!

711480417.content: But I didn't even throw it that hard...

711480418.content: Stop! War's over! No friendly fire allowed!

711480419.content: Wait, what about my fried chicken?!

710480201.content: Why do you want me to go to this dance?

710480202.content: Oh, Captain. Not everyone from Division Nine is going this time.

710480203.content: So there's no need to go and buy evening wear... My battle gear should suffice.

710480204.content: No way! Captain, it's a formal event! And besides, we're already at the store.

710480205.content: (Sigh) It hurts to just look at these clothes.

710480206.content: Don't worry, I'll take care of it!

710480207.content: ...I'm not sure that's a good thing.

710480209.content: Zenkibo! The slit on this one goes all the way up the thigh!

710480210.content: Huh? But isn't all formal wear like that?

710480211.content: Well, get me another one, then!

710480212.content: Ugh, this hem is too long!

710480213.content: Hahaha! I've never seen you trip on flat ground like that before!

710480215.content: Haha... I mean—sorry, I was just coughing. Let's try another one, Captain.

710480217.content: I'm so tired... What about the one hanging over there? It looks just fine, and it appears to be easy to move in.

710480218.content: But... it has an open back. It'll show your scar...

710480219.content: Since when are you worried about that?

710480220.content: Haven't I told you before? This scar is my medal. I'm taking that one—now let's go!

710480223.content: Captain... I didn't get a chance to tell you before... but the dance has temporarily been canceled.

710480224.content: Why didn't you say so earlier? Come here—I've got something to show you.

710480225.content: Why are you laughing? You're scaring me! S-stay away!

710480301.content: I'm telling you, you're way too rough with Comet R4Y! You can't sit right on it. Now my scope is crooked!

710480302.content: It'll be more effective that way.

710480303.content: It should be honored that Miss Hel has sat upon it.

710480304.content: You're the one who should be honored if someone sat on you!

710480305.content: Not by you. I'd sooner jump in my own grave.

710480307.content: That's the proper attitude to have towards impertinent people like you.

710480309.content: Ha! You hear that? Shut up!

710480311.content: As for your gun... I'll accompany you to the Cryptics.

710480312.content: I don't need to go to the Cryptics. I can fix a small problem like that myself.

710480314.content: Of course. All the best marksmen can maintain their own guns. I modded that scope myself, after all! But let me see...

710480315.content: Wow... Even the mod is broken. I'll need quite a few Ain Soph coins for this.

710480317.content: A lot! Do you know how many reports I'll have to write to make this money back?!

710480319.content: The Undertaker Squad still has a lot of funds.

710480320.content: Well... Why don't you use that trick in our next battle?

710660101.content: Hodur! You're just in time. I need your help with an experiment.

710660102.content: What? Me? Alright, if it's something I can help with.

710660103.content: Have a seat and put on this helmet. It'll compress your nerves if you wear it too long, so take it off if you start to get dizzy.

710660104.content: Okay. Wooooow, that's a lot of bunnies. They're hopping everywhere!

710660105.content: Good, it's working. Now focus and try to count them.

710660106.content: Okay. One, two, three, four... There are seven all together.

710660108.content: Wait, maybe I missed one! Let me try again!

710660109.content: One, two, three... Sorry, there's still only seven.

710660110.content: I see. Now, fire an energy arrow at the wall seven times.

710660112.content: The BunBuns should come in many different colors. Tell me which one's your favorite.

710660113.content: But I only see black and white ones... Well, white, then.

710660115.content: Saying anything? Do they talk? Let me listen!

710660116.content: Next question: Are their ears long or short? And describe their expressions—are they smiling?

710660118.content: (Huff) Uhhh... I... I'm okay... Ask the next question.

710660119.content: No. Didn't I tell you to take the helmet off if you got dizzy?

710660120.content: But I want to help you as much as I can...

710660121.content: Huh? The experiment was to collect your access key data and use it to mod the BunBuns. The data gathering was finished after you shot the energy arrows.

710660122.content: Then what were all those questions for?

710660123.content: Just to satisfy my curiosity. They had nothing to do with the experiment. You can take that off now.

710660124.content: (Huff) So then... what was all that work for...?

710660201.content: Here are the Omorfies Tarot cards you wanted.

710660202.content: Thanks! We might be living in the information age, but stuff from Omorfies is still hard to get online.

710660203.content: This is a real rare opportunity. Why don't I give you a reading?

710660204.content: A Tarot reading? Uh... I don't really believe in that stuff.

710660205.content: There are lots of things in this world that can't be explained by science. The mystical isn't just a load of hot air.

710660207.content: Then let's begin. I just shuffled the cards. Draw one.

710660208.content: I'll draw the World, upright. It represents eternity and success—a good card.

710660209.content: What are you talking about? Hey... It is the World! Did you see it when I was shuffling? That doesn't count. Draw again.

710660210.content: You draw a card, then. If I'm not mistaken, I predict that you'll draw the Star, reversed.

710660211.content: It is the Star reversed... This can't be!

710660212.content: This is the part where you say, "I'm supposed to be reading for you."

710660213.content: I'm supposed to be reading for you!

710660215.content: That's why I said I don't believe in this stuff.

710660216.content: Maybe I should be giving you a reading. Hm... You should be careful with kids' toys. They can bring you bad luck.

710660217.content: Kids' toys? There aren't any kids' toys in my lab! Wait... How did you know I just bought a stuffed BunBun?

710660218.content: There are lots of things in this world that can't be explained by science... Am I right?

710660301.content: As you can see, my Gatling Hairdryer is performing well beyond expectations.

710660302.content: If we're just talking about functionality, then yes, it is.

710660306.content: The device has no practical applications. If you use it, you're just as likely to damage your spine as you are to dry your hair.

710660307.content: What about the BunBun Cannon? This is the invention of the century!

710660308.content: (Sigh) And of which century are we talking?

710660309.content: It maximizes Divine Power so you can both attack enemies and quickly transport personnel to their destination! Is that not enough for you?

710660310.content: By "transporting," do you mean "flinging"? I doubt more than one out of every ten would survive that trip. Denied.

710660311.content: I had such high hopes for these inventions... If they don't cut it, there's no way my third one will.

710660312.content: Let me hear about it, and then I'll make a decision.

710660313.content: Oh, forget it. It's just something I came up with five minutes before bed. It's nothing.

710660314.content: I've seen plenty of "nothing" already. Just show me.

710660315.content: Well, okay. But it's really silly—the BunBun Helmet. It scans the surrounding area for enemies and traces of Bane Energy.

710660316.content: Huh? Why didn't you show me that first?

710660317.content: It has a fatal flaw—due to technological limitations, I wasn't able to make it BunBun-shaped... It has the word "BunBun" in its name, but it doesn't look like one at all...

710660318.content: Stop those other two projects immediately. I want you focus your attention on the BunBun Helmet! I'll cover all of your expenses.

710660319.content: What? Why? How is this dumb little thing better than the BunBun Cannon and the Gatling Hairdryer?

710660320.content: I'm the one asking the questions here. And this invention is the one that's good.

710660401.content: What is it now? This isn't your key repair room.

710660402.content: Don't worry! I'm not asking you to fix a key this time.

710660403.content: Actually, you have an express package that someone else signed for, tracking number 114-072. I came to see if you had received it.

710660405.content: I brought it here yesterday afternoon. A box about the height of half a person.

710660406.content: The height of half a person? Hang on, could it be... that box?! How did I not see it before?!

710660407.content: You remember it now? You were in the lab, so I gave it to some Cryptic workers.

710660408.content: Couldn't you have just called me?

710660409.content: I didn't want to interrupt your experiment. Don't worry, I told them this package was yours. It's mostly lab equipment, so I told them to be careful with it.

710660410.content: The two girls enter the warehouse, where a large box has been carefully placed under a glass cover. The label on it says, "CHILDREN'S TOYS—PLUSH BUNBUNS."

710660411.content: Ah, good—it looks like they listened to my instructions.

710660413.content: Of course. It says "CHILDREN'S TOYS"—to be used in some sort of amazing new invention, I'm sure.

710660414.content: What sort of experiment uses plush BunBuns?!

710660415.content: You mean it's not lab equipment?

710660416.content: I don't use toys as lab equipment!

710660417.content: I was wondering why Heimdall and the others were looking at me funny today...

710660501.content: It's not often you seek my help.

710660502.content: This is an experiment I can't finish without the help of your theories.

710660503.content: This blueprint is... quite an undertaking.

710660504.content: I need 80% power supply and the help of all the Cryptics.

710660506.content: The entire system has passed with no errors. Phew... We can move on to the next stage.

710660507.content: This big project is about to end, too. We lost power quite a few times.

710660508.content: A few failures won't matter if this plan succeeds. We connect to the database now?

710660509.content: Use experiments to determine the complicated rules needed to control its AI routine... then connect it to the corresponding database module... Its specs will take a hit, but it'll be easier to control...

710660510.content: The BunBun Experimenter will be the cornerstone of our research from now on.

710660511.content: As long as it works, I don't care what it looks like. This BunBun AGI Mecha is a bit big, but it'll do.

710660512.content: Yep, I've already loaded our cooking database. I'll start the Experimenter now.

710660513.content: Wait—cooking database? Didn't you say this would become the cornerstone of our research?!

710660514.content: Well, yeah—that's what the BunBun Experimenter cooking robot is for. It's an evolution of the BunBun Laser Grill.

710660515.content: If you want to grill meat instantly, the laser output needs to be very high. To auto-cook meat better, I made the BunBun Experimenter out of the BunBun-3.

710660516.content: So we did all that work for a cooking robot?! That wasn't what was on the blueprint!

710660517.content: This is no ordinary cooking robot! If my calculations are correct, the BunBun Experimenter will be able to learn people's preferences and make their food accordingly!

710660518.content: In just one month's time, it'll surpass the head chefs of Omorfies. Why are you scowling like that?

710660519.content: I'm thinking about how we can salvage this. Reuse the chip, change the database, upgrade the system... It looks like it'll take another month of work.

710660602.content: Who broke the ventilation in here...?

710660604.content: It detects what you want using your brain waves and automatically adjusts the temperature to a comfortable level.

710660608.content: Good. This is the first time someone's used the BunBun HVAC.

710660609.content: Alright, I'm out. Take care with the BunBun HVAC. It's still in beta.

710660614.content: Aren't you cold?! The water's frozen!

710660615.content: I thought it was perfect. It feels just like the poles.

710660616.content: I didn't make a temperature adjuster so you could simulate the poles!

710280103.content: Shu? Is something the matter? I'm busy right now.

710280104.content: Why haven't you turned in the report for the last battle yet?

710280105.content: Um... R-really? Did I do that?

710280107.content: Could this wait until tomorrow? There's something I have to attend to now.

710280110.content: If that's really the case, I can give you one more day. But what is it? Do you need my help?

710280111.content: Ahahaha... No, no... I can handle it myself.

710280112.content: We're all friends here. Don't be afraid to ask for my help.

710280113.content: No, seriously, I'm good! ... I can take care of it myself. Trust me.

710280114.content: Thor's hands are moving around in a fit of excitement, and the coupons she was hiding behind her back fall to the ground as a result.

710280115.content: ... Would you explain to me what these coupons on the floor are?

710280116.content: I'm using these to buy the latest VR gaming device.

710280117.content: And that's the "urgent" matter you have to attend to now?

710280119.content: You're not leaving the office until you turn in that battle report.

710280201.content: The two captains run into each other just outside the detention room.

710280202.content: Are you here to collect someone, too?

710280204.content: I'm sorry... Zenkibo went too far with her prank.

710280205.content: I must say... Leviathan overreacted as well.

710280206.content: I'm going to give Zenkibo a good talking-to.
