115291007.content: Chloe nods her head in a kind of daze. Having no further questions, Athena hands Chloe back her backpack.

115291008.content: ...These were your personal belongings. Please check to ensure nothing is missing.

115291009.content: If you have no other questions, you may go. If we reach any new conclusions over the course of our investigation, the Knights of Convallaria will get in touch with you.

115291010.content: Um, about my participation in the Salon...

115291011.content: As if knowing that she's asking a pointless question, Chloe's voice gets quieter as she speaks. Still, she musters up the courage to look at Athena, hoping for a clear response.

115291012.content: I've made it clear—the Society of Fireworks will cover the damages as per their liability contract, and shall no longer vouch for or guarantee the ground fireworks.

115291013.content: As for you, you are not permitted to participate in any public art events until we conclude our investigation on the cause and effect of the accident.

115291014.content: But they were exactly the same as the fireworks I used in the rehearsal...

115291015.content: You don't believe me either, Commander Athena?

115291016.content: This is the decision of the organizer, and the people also require an explanation. With the attack on the Ardisis Ceremony still fresh in their minds, an incident like this is bound to put the public on edge.

115291017.content: Thankfully, no one was injured during the explosion. Otherwise, the Knights of Convallaria would need to place you under necessary supervision.

115291018.content: If you wish to continue studying ground fireworks, their safety issues must be resolved. If a similar incident occurs again, the penalty will not be so lenient.

115291019.content: Chloe purses her lips, knowing that there's nothing more she can say to argue. She bows slightly to Athena before taking a couple steps back.

115291020.content: I'm really sorry for all the trouble I've caused everyone.

115291021.content: While it's not my intention to put more pressure on you, I must remind you that public opinion ferments quickly and there will be unfriendly voices.

115291022.content: I understand... It's only natural for them to despise me after that happened...

115291023.content: The Knights of Convallaria will give this matter a fair and open verdict. If you are truly acquitted of guilt, I'm sure the public will come around eventually.

115291024.content: I suggest you keep a low profile until we conclude the case to avoid bringing unnecessary trouble upon yourself...

115291025.content: You still have the audacity to show your face at the Society of Fireworks? Get out, now!

115291026.content: The suitcase is hurled out the door. A somewhat frail figure comes stumbling through the door frame. Managing to grasp hold of the suitcase that was sliding towards the sidewalk, they exhale.

115291027.content: This busy neighborhood remains a raucous scene of revelry even late into the night, and the drizzle does anything but dampens people's desire to go out. A little scuffle in front of the Society of Fireworks doesn't draw much attention.

115291028.content: How could you toss fireworks out like that?!

115291029.content: Fireworks? Who the hell knows what you've made this time?!

115291030.content: Don't think that you can just pass the explosion off as an accident simply because the evidence was destroyed! These bombs should have been burried with the old man long ago.

115291031.content: A group of Fact-Finding Committee members has suddenly reassembled and blocked the Society of Fireworks entrance. Looks of mockery and disdain keep Chloe out of the hall's light.

115291032.content: Introverted at heart, Chloe is powerless to fight back against the verbal onslaught she's faced with.

115291033.content: Isn't this a little too far...? Are we really not doing anything? I heard in the Society's warehouse...

115291034.content: Chloe's basically their patsy, just go along with them... We don't need to make things any harder for ourselves.

115291035.content: Even though a few sympathize with Chloe's situation, it's difficult to stand up to the pressure.

115291036.content: President Galvani's here. We should move.

115291037.content: Ignoring the Society members' whispers, Quentin makes his way toward the crowd gathered at the door.

115291038.content: What's all this racket at my door? Get to your own business, all of you!

115291039.content: The Fact-Finding Committee members heed Quentin's order. They scatter in groups of three or five, but in a manner that is less than deferential to Quentin.

115291040.content: Isn't letting the younger generation kick up a fuss a good thing? Public opinion is currently in our favor. Now's the time to show our strength.

115291041.content: You think you have the upper hand now?

115291042.content: I believe you mean "we"... No one was hurt in the accident, which was less than ideal, but it's still fortunate nonetheless...

115291043.content: I'll reiterate: the Society of Fireworks has a cooperative relationship with you, nothing more. Don't push it.

115291044.content: ...What exactly are you referring to, President Galvani?

115291045.content: Everything relating to the Society of Fireworks' reputation. You think I'm unaware of you taking it upon yourselves to increase the gunpowder yield?

115291046.content: Hehehe, I didn't realize you had such a sense of humor, President Galvani...

115291047.content: Whatever the case, we thank you for your dedicated assistance.

115291048.content: This organizer of many Fact-Finding Committee events smirks and pats Quentin's shoulder, then leaves with his subordinates in tow.

115291049.content: Quentin frowns, but doesn't say anything. He begins to make his way outside to where Chloe is still standing by the door. But when he sees the raindrops coming down, he decides against crossing the threshold.

115291051.content: ...I want to know why my fireworks exploded.

115291052.content: Shouldn't you be asking yourself that?

115291053.content: I gave you a chance, but in the end, you deeply disappointed me. The ground fireworks were ruined, the fireworks show was a mess, and the Salon has been postponed...

115291055.content:
As long as you acknowledge your responsibility for it.
But this is also the result of my negligence—

115291056.content: Frame fireworks only permit the use of incendiary gunpowder, but Clement just had to add explosive charges... I was truly not in my right mind when I agreed to allow something so openly flying in the face of tradition on stage.

115291057.content: Tonight's incident has proven that ground fireworks pose an unavoidable risk. You've learned your lesson, now stop playing with fire and engage in an honest craft.

115291058.content: Quentin somberly waves Chloe away, seemingly reluctant to discuss the matter further.

115291059.content:
...But it was avoidable.
If only we'd made the improvement in time, I'm sure it wouldn't...

115291060.content: How are you STILL not dropping this?!

115291061.content: Quentin nearly growls this as a rare expression of rage appears on his face.

115291062.content: Do you even know how many losses the Society of Fireworks has suffered? I'd be well within my rights to make you accept partial fiscal responsibility, but I haven't done that, have I?

115291063.content: For the sake of my friendship with Clement, I shouldered a barrage of criticism to let you participate in the fireworks show. And even now that worst has come to worst, you still want to defy me?

115291064.content: Next time I see anything like this before me, I'll resist it with the force of the entire Society of Fireworks and Fact-Finding Committee behind me! Do you understand?!

115291065.content: Only a fool never learns from their mistakes!

115291066.content: Quentin forcefully slams the door shut with a thud that hurts Chloe's ears. This brightly lit building before her now seems like a mountain pass that she'll never be able to cross.

115291067.content: She lowers her head. Her vision loses focus between the dark spots left by raindrops meeting the ground.

115291068.content: Nightfall has engulfed the colors and her uncertainty muffles the sounds. The more mundane the despair, the less attention and stewing it requires.

115291069.content: It's so dark now, where else can I go...?

115291070.content: Even staying rooted to the same spot is too exhausting for her.

115291071.content: So, she begins to walk, becoming an inconspicuous, aimless face in the crowd.

115291072.content: "...Mr. Galvani has expressed his concerns regarding ground fireworks, stating that such unfettered liberty has led to tragedies in Omorfies' history, and the reformation mustn't become a springboard for speculators' resurgence..."

115291074.content: "...The art world should reflect on whether hidden dangers are lurking in the more shadowy vectors of this recent surge of 'emerging art.' Though not all as influential as ground fireworks, they nonetheless erode the people's aesthetic sensibilities and intelligence..."

115291076.content: "In an unrestrained creative environment, you're bound to have people who play to the gallery under the banner of 'innovation.' Without credible, authoritative standards, the public will be unable to recognize the vacuous, even pernicious core at the heart of these unestablished works..."

115291078.content: Chloe lowers her phone and looks around. She's already made her way to a completely unfamiliar neighborhood—unfamiliar, but somewhat comfortingly so.

115291079.content: Just as Athena said, public opinion simmered quickly, and it didn't stop at the accident itself. Many articles pointed to the accident as a jumping-off point to criticize the explosion of emerging art in the wake of the reformation.

115291081.content: Many of the articles blatantly carry the Fact-Finding Committee's label, and channels of public information are bombarded by a chorus of the loudest voices, all delivering lengthy speeches that echo one another.

115291082.content: Those seeking to subvert the definitive achieve their purpose when the definitive becomes controversial.

115291083.content: Not understanding any of this, Chloe simply feels the weight of being on the receiving end of arguments beyond the scope of her thinking.

115291084.content: Maybe they're right, maybe I really am using something dangerous to play to the gallery...

115291085.content: In a secluded corner of the neighborhood, Chloe sits down against a wall, hiding her face in the shadows of the streetlights. Her clothes soaked through, sitting down only increases the clinging, suffocating sensation she feels on her skin.

115291086.content: She thought she was used to a solitary life, but in this moment, she sharply feels the loneliness of having no one to turn to.

115291087.content: No one would ever trust her again.

115291089.content: She places her hand on the latch of her suitcase and slowly opens it.

115291090.content: She'll light this last firework in a corner where it won't disturb anyone. It'll have just ten seconds to bloom and fall—ten seconds to testify to its brief existence, then bring its unanticipated future to an end...

115291091.content: After tonight, a failure like "ground fireworks" won't stain Omorfies again...

115291093.content: The night is long and silent. The rain and darkness quiet the city, noiselessly taking in the sounds of each slight movement Chloe makes.

115291094.content: She reluctantly clenches her fists and chokes back a fainthearted cry.

115291097.content: The sudden call stops Chloe in the middle of opening the suitcase. Something is blocking the rain and light overhead.

115291098.content: Chloe looks up in confusion to see a winsome maid holding an umbrella before her.

115291100.content: I'm Leuce, a maid at the Society of Muses. Would you be Miss Chloe?

115291103.content: The petite maid named Leuce turns her back to Chloe and begins murmuring in a hushed voice.

115291104.content: (Lady Hera, I've found her... Understood, just leave it to me...)

115291106.content: Leuce turns back around to face Chloe, then bows to her with impeccable movements.

115291107.content: You are invited by Lady Hera to the Society of Muses to accompany her during a firework show. Are you available to attend?

115291108.content: Chloe stares blankly without responding. Leuce looks at the wet ground and nods, suddenly understanding. She fishes out an umbrella from somewhere and passes it to Chloe.

115301001.content: Lit neither by the moon nor lamps, the Society of Muses looms at the street corner like a silent castle. Only the flame of a single candle keeps watch in the night over the two people left awake.

115301002.content: The candlelight reflects Chloe's uneasy expression on the surface of her tea. Hera, sitting opposite her and leisurely holding a dainty-looking tea cup, glances at the untouched cup of black tea in front of Chloe.

115301003.content: It would be a discourtesy to leave a cup of tea untouched on the table.

115301005.content: Chloe hurriedly brings the teacup to her mouth and takes a big gulp.

115301006.content: It's delicious, thank you for your hospitality.

115301007.content: Chloe's extreme response takes Hera completely by surprise. Speechless, she sets her tea down and abandons the idea of correcting Chloe's etiquette.

115301008.content: Pray excuse me... but where are the fireworks you mentioned?

115301009.content: Having been invited here to watch fireworks, yet now finding herself only drinking tea at the table with Hera, Chloe can't help but inquire as she watches the hour hand on the wall clock tick into the latter half of the night.

115301010.content: Do you not have them there?

115301011.content:
Hera already knows what the hefty suitcase beside Chloe's seat contains.
But Chloe's eyes quickly dim upon hearing this question.

115301013.content: Judging from your words, you've made up your mind?

115301014.content: What other choice do I have...?

115301015.content: My ground fireworks ruined the Salon, and so many people hate them now...

115301016.content:
Stepping down after falling into others' disfavor?
That would be too feeble an excuse, don't you think?

115301017.content: Chloe looks at Hera incredulously, baffled that she could say something like that so matter-of-factly.

115301019.content: You expected your artistic path to be paved without tribulations?

115301020.content: But... but it's not what I'm talking about!

115301021.content: Chloe can't help but raise her voice. Despite trembling with each syllable, she just can't accept Hera's words.

115301022.content: "Ground fireworks are a mistake that won't be forgiven a second time," "something as dangerous as ground fireworks should be banned..."

115301023.content: That's what all the articles and comments online are saying, and now I'm banned from participating in the Salon. Everyone thinks my work is a dangerous disaster, how am I supposed to keep—

115301024.content: Squeezing tightly on her fingers, Chloe purses her lips and stops mid-sentence.

115301026.content: Though she thought she had made up her mind to give up, admitting it to someone else was more difficult than she'd imagined. It was as if just speaking the words would tip the scales to the point of no return...

115301027.content: ...How can I call ground fireworks "art" if all they do is disgust people?

115301028.content: But why does reaching a point of no return still bother her?

115301029.content: "My father was a renowned pyrotechnic designer. I want to carry on his art." That's what you told me during your first arrival at the Society of Muses.

115301030.content: Clement refused to give up after the accident, yet you sit here in safety and admit defeat. Are you to disavow your father's art on his behalf?

115301031.content: Unfazed by Chloe's sulking, Hera shakes her head, then pulls a folder out from a drawer.

115301032.content: ...Please don't make my failure about my father.

115301033.content: Also, if you didn't know my father, please don't comment on his mindset as if you did.

115301034.content: Say that to the people from the Fact-Finding Committee who wrote those articles.

115301036.content: I'm a critic, of course I keep an eye on what my disgraced peers are pouring out to debase the standards of our industry.

115301037.content: Even if they're just swimming with the current, they came out with those articles far too quickly. I have to assume that some people are in quite a hurry to assign presuppositions to an incident that's still under investigation...

115301038.content: Chloe purses her lips. Just the thought of those articles and comments makes it hard to breathe.

115301039.content: Lady Hera, if you just want to see the fireworks, they're yours now... just don't bring up ground fireworks again after this.

115301040.content: Chloe finishes the rest of her tea, then looks down at the suitcase beside her. Hesitating briefly, she does not touch it again. Instead, she stands to face Hera and bows slightly.

115301041.content: Thank you for your hospitality. I'll see myself out now.

115301043.content: Before Chloe can step away from her seat, Hera pushes a folder toward her.

115301044.content: Is this... another form I need to fill out or something?

115301046.content: Chloe opens the folder apprehensively. There's a stack of scattered papers inside.

115301047.content: Chloe flips through them, her confused expression giving way to shock as she flips through them with increasing alacrity.

115301048.content: Flame color stratification, reaction buffering... Is this... my father's handwriting?!

115301049.content: This is my father's improved ground fireworks design, I'm sure of it... So many of his ideas are the same as mine.

115301050.content: Eroded by the passage of many years, the ink on the yellow-edged papers has turned dry and sharp. The wild scrawl and fine, neat linework kept Chloe company through countless nights in the lamplight of her humble accommodation.

115301051.content: Even seeing it for the first time, Chloe would know this penmanship anywhere—the fragmentary concepts recorded on these sheets of paper were written by Clement's own hand.

115301052.content: What amazes Chloe even more is that, although their methods differ slightly, the outcomes of their enhancements are very similar. The contents of her suitcase are practically the manifestation of these concepts.

115301053.content: But... why do you have my father's manuscript? The Society of Muses doesn't accept fireworks...

115301054.content: Chloe inadvertently takes a step back and almost collides with her chair. She grips the folder tightly with both hands for fear she might lose it. Then, realizing in hindsight that her comment sounded like blame directed at Hera, she quickly stops talking.

115301055.content: Clement had it delivered over himself. As for the matter of whether we accept fireworks... Tell me, why did you take these as fireworks from the beginning?

115301057.content: The designs in this manuscript have never been of "fireworks," at least not from Clement's perspective.

115301058.content: But... these are clearly improved ground fireworks... What you're saying sounds like... like...

115301061.content: What if I told you that this is how Clement put it himself during our discussion?

115301063.content: "More room is to be had for emphasizing the colors, should we not limit the design to the parameters of a firework." This wasn't conjecture on my part, but rather Clement's experience talking.

115301064.content: As far as he was concerned, whether or not they were fireworks wasn't important, nor was the Society of Fireworks' certification. It didn't even matter to him whether or not these ideas would have a successor...

115301065.content: He simply thought that it would be a great pity if he couldn't bring his ideas to fruition.

115301066.content: There was nothing in Hera's words that felt unnatural or fabricated, and Chloe knows perfectly well that this proud artist has no reason to lie to her.

115301068.content: Chloe's expression wavers, and she's enveloped by a feeling of profound emptiness unlike anything she felt even when her firework exploded.

115301069.content: All that hard work to improve ground fireworks for the sake of their rehabilitation, all those lonely experiments... What was it all even for?

115301070.content: You're the successor to your father's craft, but what you didn't grasp was his artistic vision. Fortunately, although you're rather clumsy, you still know how to use your head.

115301071.content: I invited you here tonight because I recognize your artistic perception. Now it's time for you to answer my question.

115301072.content: Hera rises from her seat and comes around to the front of the table. She looks down at the visibly shaken Chloe.

115301073.content: Think again about your father's manuscript. Have you been seeking to restore your father's name all these years, or his art?

115301074.content: His name or his art...? I'm not sure I understand the difference...

115301075.content: Do you think they're interchangeable? Fine, I'll rephrase the question—

115301076.content: What are ground fireworks to you? Are they a tool for "acquiring recognition," or something you're passionate about?

115301077.content: Do you remember what you felt the first time you ever saw ground fireworks?

115301078.content: "Do you remember what you felt the first time?"

115301080.content: Of course she does, it's just been a long time since she last thought about it...

115301081.content: The firework rose in the night through the falling snow, forming a starry sky beneath the low wall that lit up the silvery-white courtyard. On tiptoes, she could almost touch it with her outstretched hands.

115301082.content: It was the first time Chloe saw colors that belonged to the sky descend to the earth.

115301084.content: When those fleeting seconds of light vanished from Chloe's eyes, the sorrow she felt was quickly replaced by that initial excitement and surprise.

115301086.content: Hahaha. So, what do you think? Not bad, eh?

115301087.content: Is this also a firework? It seems kinda different somehow...

115301088.content: Hmm, that's a good question... It doesn't have a name yet. Let me think of one.

115301089.content: If we're saying it's a firework, then technically it could be called a "raised detonation frame firework!" But that's a bit of a mouthful, so why don't we call it a "ground firework" for now?

115301090.content: Do you have any more, Father? I want to see another one.

115301091.content: I'm afraid not, Lo-Lo. This is just a test product I made when the inspiration struck, and you're its very first audience!

115301092.content: Its first? You mean more people are gonna get to see it too?!

115301093.content: Mm-hm, you betcha. I'll make sure lots more people get to see it.

115301094.content: After all, it's an artist's job to do all they can to share their creativity with others!

115301095.content: Chloe starts flipping back to the beginning of the manuscript. As if in a trance, she carefully looks over each sentence and picture.

115301096.content: Seemingly expecting to find treasure Clement left for her buried between the words and lines, all Chloe finds inside are designs. Focused and unadulterated, the pages freely extol the creator's vision.

115301097.content: I haven't seen my father's fireworks in such a long time, I almost forgot... How could I have almost forgotten something like that...?

115301098.content: What I felt the first time... I just felt that they were so bright, warm, and real...

115301099.content: Her childhood memories gradually come into focus—the smile on her face as she watched them, her small, outstretched hands, and the colors and excitement they left in her eyes and heart.

115301100.content: "To share their creativity with others..." That's what my father said.

115301101.content: Indeed. This mindset sounds simple, but it's the greatest an artist can have.

115301102.content: Hera nods, seeming to find the answer satisfactory. She steps lithely towards the window, then rests a hand on the windowsill.

115301103.content: Art is the means by which an artist conveys their creativity and interpretation of beauty. It's one's true convictions incarnate—beyond right and wrong or good and bad—as well as a manifestation of one's spirit, unbound by physicality.

115301104.content: The pursuit of art is an artist's self-reflection and improvement upon their aesthetic instincts. Unless one is without self-respect, no change to their creations will result in their ruin.

115301105.content: Failure? Rejection? This has long been the par for the course in Omorfies. Even today's so-called "traditions" began as puerile experimentation. How much ash was left in their wake before the first patina of brilliance was formed?

115301106.content: If you're certain you can surpass your past failed works, then why do you still care what anyone thinks of them? What you should be doing is using your next piece to innovate on your art and correct your mistakes.

115301107.content: Now do you understand what Clement's vision was? What an artist's vision is?

115301108.content: Starlight is faintly visible through the wispy clouds and mist above. Hera traces over the lingering trails left by raindrops on the other side of the windowpane with her finger, all the while looking at Chloe.

115301109.content: ...Now that you know, what is it that you really want?

115301110.content: Chloe gapes at Hera by the window. When Hera meets her gaze, Chloe sheepishly lowers her head with a smile that could be construed as either apologetic or relieved—it's not clear.

115301111.content: But the moment the corners of her mouth rise up, it's as if a bundle of long-compressed nerves is loosened. Though clearly smiling, the rims of her eyes quickly begin to glisten.

115301112.content: What's wrong with me...? I'm sorry...

115301113.content: After scrambling to wipe away her tears, Chloe closes the folder and gingerly lays it on the table.

115301114.content: Hahaha... I still don't entirely understand what an artist's practice is. You must think I'm really stupid...

115301115.content: But you're right. I was so worried about getting an association certification and the reputation of my fireworks that I almost forgot about when I'm happiest...

115301116.content: When she springs up in the middle of the night with a new idea to write down, when she spends the whole day perfecting a firework in the workshop, when she sees people's smiles brightened by the light of her fireworks...

115301117.content: Lady Hera, I've made a decision—

115301119.content: From now on, they won't be called "ground fireworks!"

115301120.content: Feeling as if her breath were taken away for a moment, Hera helplessly cups her forehead in her hand.

115301121.content: Whatever suits you. Now hurry back home since you've figured it out.

115301122.content: I will... Thank you, Lady Hera.

115301123.content: I'm going to carry on my father's art.

115301124.content: Chloe bows toward Hera, then turns and runs for the door.

115301125.content: Don't you want your suitcase? I certainly didn't agree to keep it.

115301126.content: Chloe screeches to a halt in front of the door, then runs back to retrieve her bulky suitcase.

115301127.content: Take your father's manuscript with you too.

115301128.content: Huh? Isn't it part of the Society of Muses' collection? Can I really take it with me?

115301129.content: It would be a waste to leave it with the Society of Muses. Besides, it's just a stack of papers, I wouldn't mind having them removed from our collection...

115301130.content: A thought seems to suddenly occur to Hera, and she abruptly trails off. Her eyes fall to the suitcase in Chloe's hands.

115301131.content: Huh? Is something wrong, Lady Hera?

115301132.content: ...Another option just occurred to me. Would you like to hear?

115301133.content:
She will see a guiding light in the darkness—

It was the light that she wished to see and hear.

It was the light she thought would be extinguished.

"...Lots more people will get to see it."

All this time, she had already gathered up the colors that the stars painted the earth in.

Radiance does not beget greatness, nor prosperity brilliance.

Covering up her wounds, she holds the glinting light in her hands. She still remembers light's form.

115301142.content: Two days later, on the eve of the opening night of the postponed Salon, the Fact-Finding Committee processions have grown with each assembly. Their march on the Salon has even drawn live media coverage.

115301143.content: The backlash to the ground fireworks accident still festering, anti-emerging art sentiment—far from being placated—has given rise to even more controversy around the reformation.

115301144.content: Penetrating the silent progression of the reformation, no one seems to know what impact this tumult will have on Omorfies.

115301145.content: Don't think about it, don't think about it...

115301146.content: Some crave disruption, others compromise. Some are self-important, others self-deprecating.

115301147.content: Should I check it again...? Hmm, I guess there isn't time.

115301148.content: But while the majority makes its silent decision, the outcome of doing the "right" thing is set long before the choice is made.

115301149.content: All right, this is it then...

115301150.content: Chloe gives her face a couple light buoying smacks, then lugs over her suitcase. Glancing over at the march in the distance, she breathes a sigh of relief.

115301152.content: The setting sun casting a long shadow behind her, she walks towards the Salon, chasing the light that refuses to fall—

115301153.content: You want to donate this to the Society of Muses? Are you certain?

115301154.content: ...I've thought it over, and the Society of Muses is the best place for it.

115301155.content: Quentin wants to protect the Galvani family name. Now that I've been branded a criminal, there's no way he'll see me.

115301156.content: ...The Society of Muses is not beyond the reach of the law.

115301157.content: Huh? Oh! Forgive me, that's not at all what I meant. Hahaha.

115301158.content: I just mean that I think what Quentin said makes sense. What I've made doesn't really have any business being called a "firework." But then it sounds a little bit like I'm starting my own sect.

115301159.content: Lots of people who come to the Society of Muses share this feeling.

115301160.content: Is that so? I guess if the old fogeys won't acknowledge it, you just have to acknowledge it yourself.

115301161.content: The moment I accepted the idea that I wasn't making fireworks, the inspiration just started surging. It's a shame I only had the time to write down this much...

115301162.content: That reminds me, should I go ahead and sign?

115301163.content: By signing, you consent to transfer this manuscript's jus disponendi to us. I don't have the élan to find another home for it.

115301164.content: If there's anyone else you can pass on your craft to, I'd advise you against signing.

115301165.content: Ah... There used to be once, but perhaps not anymore.

115301166.content: After all, ground fireworks have been forced to bear responsibility for the accident with me. That they haven't been banned outright is already very lenient. As for carrying it on... what will be will be.

115301167.content: Still, maybe someone else will think of it in a few years' time? Hahaha, I'm still confident in my ideas.

115301168.content: A crumpled-up ball of paper is thrown into the wastepaper basket. The word "Donation" can vaguely be made out on it.

115301169.content: If I'd told you then that the person to carry them on would be your daughter, would you have done anything differently?

115311002.content: Fireworks launched from opposite ends meet each other in the middle of the sky. A flaming tail resembling hanging orchids drops like a curtain, signaling the end of the fireworks show.

115311003.content: The sky a stage, quite a few people even in the streets beyond the venue had stopped to spectate. Now that this flawless performance is over, they too offer up applause.

115311004.content: Many thanks to the Society of Fireworks for tonight's opening show... The New Work Salon officially begins now!

115311005.content: Still opening with a fireworks show, the Salon is now underway as all the artists take out their pieces and find the best places to begin exhibiting them.

115311006.content: Not bad. The Society of Fireworks must have been well-prepared to be able to pull off another show after the incident last time.

115311007.content: Of course, they've put on hundreds of traditional fireworks shows like that one before. That's what they do best.

115311008.content: Still, being an ad hoc show, the creativity was lacking. Traditional fireworks shows haven't changed in over a decade.

115311009.content: True. I thought the ground fireworks would spice things up, but then there was that huge explosion and no one knows why.

115311010.content: What's Chloe going to do now? She's banned from participating in the Salon, and the Society of Fireworks is boycotting her as well. You don't think she'd just leave the art world now, do you?

115311011.content: The two fireworks enthusiasts who recognized Chloe at the Salon that day are back this time as well. Their stroll takes through the entrance to the square, but not into the venue.

115311012.content: As their conversation turns to Chloe, the two suddenly come to a stop, as if reading each other's mind.

115311013.content: "Stop the Salon from destroying artistic order!"

115311015.content: The Fact-Finding Committee march swarms the entrance, and the marchers chant out slogans one after another. The Knights of Convallaria hold them off as best they can, but the chaotic scene that's unfolded keeps many exhibitors and spectators from approaching.

115311016.content: But the farcical procession isn't what stopped the two fireworks enthusiasts in their tracks.

115311017.content: ...Did that person who just went by us look familiar to you?

115311018.content: The fireworks enthusiast's companion nods. The two turn to face the person behind them in unison. The passerby, seemingly thinking the same thing, also turns to face them.

115311020.content: Miss Chloe?! What are you doing here? I thought they kicked you out...

115311021.content: Hey, put a sock in it—

115311022.content: It's fine... It's true, they did.

115311023.content: Chloe laughs awkwardly. She's still dressed in her usual work clothes, but she doesn't have anything else with her.

115311024.content:
I'm not going in, I'm happy to just watch from out here.
Ugh... There's a lot of people from the Fact-Finding Committee here...

115311025.content: You could go in after they leave...

115311026.content: Their slogans keep getting blunter, they're pretty much waving a "no reformation" banner at this point. They're sure to pick a fight with you if you run into them.

115311027.content: Um... About the ground fireworks incident... Do you guys not blame me for what happened?

115311028.content: I mean, it was an accident. It's not like you wanted it to go that way, right? Artists don't just make jokes out of their own work.

115311029.content: Shrugging like the answer is obvious, the chipper youth's perspective seems completely unaffected by those internet articles.

115311030.content: I see... Thanks. Though, I wouldn't say I'm an artist yet...

115311031.content: But Miss Chloe, all you can do from outside the venue is see the work getting the most hype on the live broadcast. Why not just watch it all from home?

115311032.content: Did you come to the venue to see something in particular?

115311033.content: It's exceedingly difficult to see something on display from outside the venue. Even large-scale song and dance pieces can barely be heard over the hubbub of the art market-like event.

115311034.content: Entitled to freely judge the works on display, everyone is granted the opportunity to exercise their aesthetic sensibilities. Near the bookstalls, by an easel—heated discussions over one piece or another can be observed just about anywhere.

115311035.content: These discussions always draw spectators, especially when both sides are well-known figures in the art world. Public debates like these end up being more noteworthy than the artworks themselves.

115311036.content: You're saying this is the Society of Muses' featured exhibit? You must be joking! There wasn't anything like this in the Salon last time!

115311037.content: And this is clearly Chloe's suitcase, just what exactly is inside it?!

115311038.content: The Society of Muses received this piece within the last two days, and associations' featured exhibits only require provisional approval. Is there a problem?

115311039.content: Not even a minute after this debate between Quentin and Hera ignites, it's already being broadcast live as an encapsulation of the Fact-Finding Committee's challenge to the unrestraint engendered by the reformation.

115311040.content: What perplexes the onlookers, however, is that the focus of their debate is not some highfalutin artistic concept, but rather an unremarkable-looking suitcase.

115311041.content: I know that Clement went to the Society of Muses before he went to prison... If you think you can use the Society of Muses' reputation to absolve ground fireworks, you're absolutely mistaken!

115311042.content: Ground fireworks are dangerous, all of Omorfies can attest to that! Or is the safety of everyone in the Salon nothing but a joke to you?! The Society of Muses should show some restraint!

115311043.content:
Quentin deliberately raises his voice at "ground fireworks."
Recalling the incident two days earlier, the bystanders present now look uneasily at the suitcase.

115311044.content: If the person holding the suitcase weren't Hera, the Knights of Convallaria likely would have already expelled it from the venue...

115311045.content: Why, President Galvani, it's not like you to cast baseless aspersions. You wouldn't want to damage your own reputation.

115311046.content: Hmph, why don't you open the suitcase for everyone to see what's inside? Then we'll know whether my aspersions are baseless.

115311047.content: Quentin is completely confident in his judgment. The flammable contents symbol on the suitcase is as good as Chloe's signature. There's no reason for anything other than ground fireworks to be in the suitcase.

115311048.content: Hera, however, just glances over at him. Looking around at the growing crowd, she lays the suitcase flat on the ground.

115311049.content:
It wasn't in my mind that a piece of the Society of Muses' work would pique the president's curiosity.
Take a few steps back, if you'd like to see the contents.

115311051.content: Quentin walks to the edge of the crowd with his hands folded behind his back. As he watches Hera open the suitcase with leisurely, agile movements, he begins to suspect that something isn't right.

115311052.content: But once the suitcase is open, he immediately regains his confidence—inside is an elaborate mechanical device comprised of a staggered folding frame around a cylinder with a hole in it...

115311053.content: Are you still insisting this isn't a ground firework?! Knights of Convallaria—

115311054.content: You're causing a disturbance at the sight of a structure that resembles partially a device you've seen... Have you ever seen a ground firework this small before?

115311055.content: Indeed, without a separate launcher and explosion chamber, this contraption is almost half the size of the ground firework first seen in the Salon.

115311056.content: But this is far from enough to convince Quentin.

115311057.content: This obviously uses the technology and structure of a ground firework. Do you think everyone here is blind?!

115311058.content: Oh? I should have expected no less from the President of the Society of Fireworks. One look at the exterior is all you need to learn the full picture.

115311059.content: Except, it was you who claimed the design behind the contraption to have eluded you...

115311061.content: President Galvani, are you really qualified to evaluate anything beyond the scope of traditional fireworks?

115311062.content: Mind your attitude, Hera. Tradition is the foundation of all innovation, and its authority won't be put into question with vulgar grandstanding.

115311063.content: Quentin's features quickly harden into a cold, stern expression upon being challenged so bluntly. He turns his head to look at a spectator sporting the Fact-Finding Committee's insignia.

115311064.content: Get Chloe over here for me and have her say herself whether this is in fact her work.

115311066.content: The youth receiving the abrupt command is immediately confused. After shooting Quentin several imploring looks, he is at last forced to remind him.

115311067.content: Chloe was banned, President Galvani. She can't enter the venue...

115311068.content: The crowd bursts out in uproarious laughter. When they try to restrain themselves out of politeness, Quentin only bristles more. He shoots the Fact-Finding Committee member a glare so severe that he hastily shrinks back into the crowd in fear.

115311069.content: Hera doesn't react. As if taking no notice of the crowd's response, she continues on to say something that leaves everyone dumbfounded.

115311070.content: I shall save you the embarrassment. This is Chloe's work. I would have disclosed the work's creator even if it wasn't for your inquisitive attitude. The content, however, is not a ground firework, but her latest design.

115311071.content: What on earth are you talking about? Chloe only learned the basics from Clement. How could she have come up with something new in just two days?

115311072.content: It sounds like you know Chloe very well, President Galvani.

115311073.content: She's the daughter of an old friend, of course I know her well.

115311074.content: To my knowledge, you have yet to hold any discussion on fireworks with the girl. No instruction or examination, lest a word of criticism.

115311075.content: You're indifferent to her creations. How did you learn her insights through your apathy?

115311076.content: I don't understand this dubious device. Are you telling me you do? Are you really willing to make everyone present take that risk with you?

115311077.content: The Society of Muses presents this exhibit, and as such, the Society of Muses will also take responsibility and vouch for its safety...

115311078.content: Phantasmal Dawn is always at the ready, so even if something were to happen, time can immediately be stopped to resolve it... Since such a precaution can't be explicitly disclosed, a vague promise will have to do in its place.

115311079.content: Everyone is entitled to rational doubts. You are all free to leave.

115311080.content: Take responsibility? Nothing could be more irresponsible after what happened!

115311081.content: I gave Chloe a chance, and everyone witnessed the outcome. It's important to know when to learn your lesson... Everyone, don't come any closer if you value your life.

115311082.content: Quentin's statement is not wholly without merit. The spectators look at each other, some stepping back, but more electing to stay where they are...

115311083.content: You are not keeping your distance?

115311084.content: Why should I? Lady Hera's standing right next to it. What do I have to be afraid of?

115311085.content: This echoes the majority's rationale—considering the importance Hera places on appearances, it's hard to imagine that she'd risk being blown to bits for the sake of exhibiting something as "dangerous" as ground fireworks.

115311086.content: This meager response from the crowd clearly not to his liking, Quentin's face quivers. Unwilling to push his way out from the crowd, however, all he can do is awkwardly stay put.

115311087.content: You're right, one should know when to learn from their mistakes, lest they repeat them...

115311088.content: And what gives your the right to criticize others, President Galvani? What did your lessons teach you? Indifference? Fear? Or the legitimacy of the Fact-Finding Committee you've been holding in high regard?

115311089.content: The onlookers are instantly invigorated as the conversation steers toward the Fact-Finding Committee. Quentin is about to open his mouth in protest when he realizes that not a single Fact-Finding Committee member dares to stand out from the crowd.

115311091.content: Hey, you guys aren't about to start throwing your weight around, are you?

115311093.content: Vastly outnumbered in the crowd of hundreds gathered here, the handful of Fact-Finding Committee members don't make a peep. They can read the room.

115311094.content: To think the leader of an art society would be a stickler for convention and rank himself among the despicable Fact-Finding Committee members in suppressing creativity in Omorfies, all while dressing it up as "upholding artistic order..." Are you obtuse, or harboring an ulterior motive?

115311095.content: Artistic progress is the accumulation of inspiration and hard work over generations. A truth as clear as it was a century ago as it is today. Upon an endless flow of artistic invention we have established Omorfies' "artistic order."

115311096.content: Embracing these artworks, guiding them, standardizing concepts, and correcting mistakes—these are the responsibilities bestowed on art societies along with authority. A pity that some people seem to have let the duties slip their minds.

115311097.content: Innovation and failure always come hand in hand. But these failures are not crimes for which people should give up on art. They are the guidance to course-correct when blazing new trails.

115311098.content: "Guide the true path—" A slogan both inspiring and encouraging, only to be added a rich layer of irony when coming off the lips of those indulged in their past days. Isn't that so, President Galvani?

115311100.content: Having been filming the whole exchange on their phone and not wanting to stop now, the first spectator to call out can only clap the back of their other hand.

115311101.content: This unconventional effort to show support draws delighted laughter. Sporadic clapping amid the laughter gradually swells into a hearty applause that continues long after the laughter dies down.

115311102.content: President Galvani, your grandfather's fireworks once illuminated the darkness of Omorfies as well. Surely you wouldn't want the hundred-year glory of the Galvani family to become a cloud that blots out the future in a time of change?

115311103.content: Quentin's displeasure is apparent from his enduring scowl, but he only snorts icily in response.

115311104.content: Chloe's venture may not succeed, but the Society of Muses does not spurn bravely made attempts.

115311105.content: We selected it as our featured exhibit for no particular reason. We simply didn't receive much else of note this month.

115311106.content: After the reformation, the authority of association certifications was undermined by the ambition to take the public art stage by storm. The art society halls went cold and quiet as a result.

115311107.content: The younger artists smile knowingly at Hera's teasing. Reflecting on their ideals, each is uplifted, and the general atmosphere turns light-hearted and high-spirited.

115311108.content: That said, this work nevertheless represents an art society, and if significance is to be ascribed to it—

115311109.content: I hope that this cluster of light would illuminate the heart of every seeker of art—be they in the darkness or not—and enlighten them on self-expression.

115311111.content: On a street corner outside the venue, Chloe sits on a bench with her head down, watching the live broadcast on her phone. As the overflowing enthusiasm resounds through the screen, she can't help but applaud along with it.

115311112.content: Quickly remembering that she's not actually there in the venue, she looks around in a panic—thankfully, no one noticed her odd behavior.

115311113.content: When she looks back down at her phone, the screen suddenly goes black from a signal interruption.

115311114.content: Huh? What's going on, the show's about to start...

115311115.content: Chloe stares at her phone blankly. She gives it a shake, but when nothing happens, she quickly rises to her feet and looks toward the venue on tiptoes.

115311116.content: This is just a subconscious reaction—she doesn't actually know where Hera is, let alone where she should look—

115311117.content: But in the night sky, there is always starlight to show the way.

115311119.content: That cylinder... Is it one of those AGI Mecha levitators?

115311120.content: As the device floats noiselessly in the air, the outer frame unfolds to form a cross-shaped star.

115311121.content: The first tendrils of green flame, clinging to the innermost reaction layer, spread out to each point of the cross. The more restrained the light, the brighter it looks, making it appear at once embedded in the faraway celestial canopy and near enough to be plucked down by hand.

115311122.content: Then, golden streams of fire fly out, startling the spectators into falling back a few steps. When they regain their composure, they realize it was only fine ash being cast off from the device.

115311123.content: Then there's color—the flames dance across the entire color spectrum, then ripple and blend into layer upon layer of blazing—but not blinding—ribbons of light. Clearly defined at first, they then extend and collide to form overlapping streams of light.

115311124.content: The streams of light bloom outward along the frame of the cross star, like surging and receding waves at high tide. Rising and falling, diffusing and converging—each flame flourishes freely while coalescing around a central point with ordered elegance.

115311125.content: Then, the cross in the sky is blanketed in ever-changing colors. No longer in the shape of a single star, it now appears to hold in its embrace the cries of a myriad of stars echoing into the furthest reaches of the universe.

115311126.content: Amazing... This is a complete metamorphosis from ground fireworks...

115311127.content: C'mere and get a closer look! Don't worry, President Galvani's left!

115311128.content: Burning as warmly as a bonfire and as quietly as pages turning in a book, the vibrant flames assure the crowd that they are in no danger of an explosion.

115311129.content: Curiosity gradually draws more and more spectators in closer. Meanwhile, Hera walks to one side. Standing apart from the crowd, she looks up with her arms folded in front of her.

115311131.content: Almost thirty seconds later, the expanding wave of flames begins to recede, revealing the cross-shaped star structure once again. The combustible material in the inner reaction layers all burned up, all that remains is a silver star made of thin metal wires and upheld steadily in the air by a levitation device.

115311133.content: The light of the fire extinguishes in the distance, and Chloe can faintly hear the loud applause that immediately follows.

115311134.content: When Chloe finally relaxes, she realizes that a layer of nervous sweat has formed on her forehead.

115311135.content: Did it make the cut...? My... My own... debut.

115311136.content: Her back is turned to the light, but the extinguished flames seem to still be flickering in her eyes, reflecting clear, shining joy.

115311137.content: (But Lady Hera did say that it's people's curiosity that makes them like something they see for the first time. I'll have to keep working harder...)

115311138.content: (I... more people should see these colors... Yes... I can do it!)

115311139.content: Clenching her fists, Chloe smiles as if in self-encouragement, then looks toward the venue entrance. Discarding any bold thoughts of sneaking in to find and thank Hera, she turns to take her leave of the neighborhood.

115311140.content: Only to immediately collide with someone else.

115311142.content: Indeed, it's Athena. Spotting the team of well-armed Knights of Convallaria behind her, Chloe takes a conscious step to one side.

115311143.content: Chloe? What are you doing here?

115311144.content: I... I asked Lady Hera to exhibit my newest work, and wished to see it for myself...

115311146.content: Her cover blown, Chloe's guileless lips latch shut.

115311147.content: Rest at ease. Hera knows the rules. I trust she wouldn't do anything to put you at fault.

115311148.content: Since you're here, Chloe, I can now inform you that our investigation determined that you were not responsible for the accident in the fireworks field. The ban against you has been lifted.

115311150.content: It wasn't until a week later that Chloe fully grasps the meaning of Athena's statement. The understanding shocks her and leaves her with a lingering sense of fear.

115311151.content: Those people from the Fact-Finding Committee looked tough, but I really never imagined that they'd plan a revolt...

115311152.content: A revolt? You think too highly of them. To tamper with an artwork at the Salon for the sake of clout... What did they think the Knights of Convallaria are there for, decoration?

115311153.content: That band of imbeciles and their little weapons cache didn't manage to do a thing other than land themselves in prison. Disbanding the committee is lenient as far as punishments go.

115311154.content: Chloe originally came to collect her Salon award certificate, but she ends up receiving a lesson in tea tasting from a cheerful Hera. It would seem Chloe's gulping down her tea two days prior left Hera profoundly exasperated...

115311155.content: After the lesson concludes, the two discuss the events of the last few days with their freshly brewed tea in the warmth of the setting sun.

115311156.content: You seem to trust Commander Athena a lot, Lady Hera.

115311157.content: I was referring to the Knights of Convallaria. I didn't single Athena out for praise.

115311158.content: ...The Society of Fireworks supplied the Fact-Finding Committee with gunpowder. They deliberately sabotaged the Salon, and Quentin has been relieved of his post. You may count your lucky stars that you didn't join the Society of Fireworks, or you likely would have been implicated as well.

115311159.content: I heard that Quentin was given a lighter punishment as a whistle-blower. I'm sure he didn't want to see things turn out this way...

115311160.content: He practically threw you under the bus, and you're still giving him the benefit of the doubt?

115311161.content: It's all water under the bridge now. I'm not bothered by it...

115311162.content: Quentin actually used to be really nice. I don't know what made him want to do something like that...

115311163.content: He lamented his suffering as a sacrifice to the reformation, but all he had in mind was to rest on his laurels.

115311164.content: Bygone fame has all the substance of a sandcastle—it crumbles at the faintest touch. Either you see it and advance forward alongside Omorfies, or fail in doing so and end your artistic career here as the man did.

115311165.content: Hmm, I always have to think over what you say to understand what you mean, Lady Hera...

115311166.content: The creaking of a door turning on its hinges suddenly rings out in the empty, spacious hall. When the two look toward the source of the noise, they see a young man hesitating in the doorway.

115311167.content: Oh... It's the guy from the Fact-Finding Committee...

115311168.content: Chloe remembers him—his was one in the chorus of voices that called for Chloe's expulsion from the Society of Fireworks.

115311170.content: No... If he has something he wants to achieve, it would be a shame if he didn't get the opportunity to try!

115311171.content: Chloe grabs her backpack and stands up, opening up her seat for the new visitor.

115311173.content:
She leaves through the door and walks into the light of the setting sun—she'll traverse the dark night with the light in her hands.

She knows how to move forward now.

115311175.content:
People find their way toward the light in the darkness of night—

The sky winds and wanders, the earth meanders and stumbles.

The heart and starlight are forever, and the night is always dark.

May beauty and hope be guided and embraced.

Even if the night is long, dawn lies ahead.

116011001.content: Entering scouting range. High chances of encountering the target. All units get ready!

116011003.content: All other forces have failed to neutralize target 0704. It's up to us now.

116011004.content: Hushed murmurs swirl up into the stagnant air—

116011007.content: We'd have better odds if we can get our hands on its detailed reports.

116011008.content: Forget it, those are all S-Grade classified secrets.

116011009.content: Besides, I heard the Institute suffered heavy casualties when 0704 escaped...

116011010.content: I repeat, all combat gear must be properly equipped without exception, especially the masks you were just issued!

116011011.content: Yeah, yeah. The enemy's tough so we got to wear the masks. That's all the detailed reports for you. No wonder they aren't making any progress.

116011012.content: Report! Suspected sighting of the target up ahead. Advance Squad is clear to move at will!

116011013.content: Get to work! B-Squad, you head to the target location as well to intercept with Advance Squad!

116011016.content: 0704 isn't putting up a fight. Are they surrendering?

116011017.content: Report to headquarters. We've contained 0704. The mission is comple—

116011018.content: A gun fires unexpectedly, and the captain collapses in a pool of blood.

116011019.content: Sensing something awry, another member of the squad raised their weapon at their squad mate.

116011020.content: What the hell are you doing?! You... Where's your mask? Who said you could take it off?!

116011022.content: The "contained" 0704 has long since disappeared in the haze. Only two squad members remain, and these close comrades are now training their guns on each other.

116011025.content: In Ain Soph, Poseidon and Zenkibo are enjoying a normal day off in a restaurant.

116011026.content: Awww... Just when I was heading out the door, Shu said I must have company. Laaame!

116011027.content: And of all people, I had to get stuck with Poseidon? She's the hardest to pull off pranks on...

116011028.content: Now, now, it's for everyone's safety. Ain Soph hasn't been as peaceful as usual lately.

116011029.content: But this restaurant's full of people! Besides, only weak Modifiers get attacked. Not like me—I'm strong, VERY strong!

116011030.content: Poseidon shakes her head, then leans toward Zenkibo and lowers her voice.

116011031.content: "Attacks" vary in gravity, and as for the "attack" that's threatening us... Well, we'll definitely be in trouble if you don't start taking it seriously, Zenki.

116011032.content: What?! ...You're just trying to scare me, right?

116011033.content: Zenkibo's cry draws puzzled looks from all around her. She shrinks back apologetically.

116011034.content: Shu said the Modifiers didn't leave behind any sign of a struggle after being attacked, and their Access Keys were taken away too.

116011036.content: It's possible. Cognizant Visbanes could have done that, but before we know for certain, it's safest to travel together.

116011037.content: Hmph! Well, I'm not afraid! But... I'll escort you back to HQ anyway. You know, just to make sure you're safe.

116011039.content: Odin and Thor are back from Xu Heng because of this incident. With them here, we can all relax a bit...

116011040.content: That reminds me, isn't Thor your captain, Zenki? It must have been quite a while since the last time you saw each other.

116011041.content: Yup. Back when Captain Thor was around, our missions were always done in a whack. Now it's just me and Pineapple in the squad, and I can't slack off like I used to. Hmph.

116011042.content: Done in a "whack", huh...? Heh, I see.

116011043.content: I've been on missions with Thor before. She forgot all about tactics and knocked all our enemies out with that hammer of hers—a "whack", literally.

116011044.content: But Shu's still calling her reckless, even after she's proved her strength—like that's a bad thing. What's up with that?

116011045.content: Well, tactics might not be essential for every battle, but there's always problems that can't be solved with brute force alone. Shu's just worried that she'll run into trouble one day if she keeps charging straight ahead.

116011046.content: I dunno, honestly. Anyway, now that Captain Thor's back, things are looking up for Thunder Squad! Woo-hoo! I can slack off all I want again!

116011047.content: Poseidon smiles at Zenkibo, who is practically jumping for joy.

116011048.content: What kind of tough guy would be able to totally overpower a Modifier and take away their Access Key anyway?

116011049.content: Besides a Cognizant Visbane, what else would attack a Modifier? An AGI Mecha? A human? Ugh, I just don't get it...

116011050.content: They know the structure of Modifiers very well, that's for sure. All victims have been taken out in a single blow aimed at a vital point. AGI Mechas aren't that agile, and as for humans... An ordinary human is even less likely to have that knowledge.

116011051.content: But what if it's a human who's not ordinary?

116011053.content: Hrm, I dunno... Oh! Right, what about someone like the Admin? Doesn't the Admin know everything about Modifiers? Wait a minute...

116011054.content: You're letting your imagination run away with you, Zenki.

116011055.content: Yeah, forget it. There's no way our clumsy Admin could pull that off.

116011056.content: I believe the word should have been "trustful and upright"...

116011057.content: As they talk, Zenkibo takes Poseidon down a small alley.

116011058.content: I don't think I've been on this route before. Did we take a wrong turn, Zenki?

116011059.content: Nope, Goki found this shortcut. We can shave off loooads of time if we go back this way.

116011060.content: Zenkibo gives Poseidon a proud thumbs-up.

116011061.content: Well, the sooner we get back the better. Let's hurry on.

116011062.content: A breeze blows through and rustles the tree leaves, like a response whispered from the darkness.

116011065.content: As if compelled by something in the darkness, Poseidon abruptly stops and turns to look back—the sudden gust of wind is gone, as are the sounds of tree leaves, people, and even birds and insects. Everything is eerily silent.

116011066.content: We really have gone off the beaten path. Let's hurry.

116011067.content: G-Goki just said the same thing...

116011068.content: Then, a loud noise cuts across the silence, and the reverberation shatters their flimsy streak of luck.

116011069.content: Steel chains crisscross in the darkness, clanging like prison manacles and washing the alley in an inky blackness darker than the night itself.

116011072.content: Zenkibo reacts so quickly that her Access Key is already out when the ominous noise sounds—but the assailant doesn't attack Zenkibo directly. Instead, they go for her Access Key.

116011073.content: Reeling from the heavy impact, she falls to the ground. It's so dark that she can't even make out the assailant's form.

116011074.content: They're like a specter in the shadows, a phantom in the night.

116011077.content: The assailant leaps from somewhere up high and goes straight for Zenkibo's weak point. Even with Poseidon's power protecting her, Zenkibo is badly wounded.

116011079.content: Seeing this, the assailant shrugs their shoulders. Seemingly chiding themselves for not landing a fatal blow, they whirl around to face Poseidon.

116011081.content: The assailant shows no intention of speaking but fills the silence with the whooshing of the wind.

116011083.content: After quickly pausing to think, a clear torrent of water surges out from Tidal Song and rushes toward the source of the wind.

116011084.content: The tide advances some distance, then, seemingly crashing into a transparent wall, suddenly changes course like a waterfall and pours straight toward the ground.

116011085.content: Her hit misses, but it buys Poseidon enough time to save Zenkibo. As she's kneeling down to inspect Zenkibo's injuries, two cold steel chains hinge on Tidal Song like poisonous vipers. Shocked, she releases her grip, and her Access Key is snatched away from her.

116011087.content: Seems I have no other choice. Hang in there, Zenki.

116011088.content: After losing her Access Key, all Poseidon can do is muster up some Divine Power. She uses her remaining power to coalesce the mist around her, temporarily occluding the assailant's view.

116011089.content: Be strong, Zenki. We're getting out of here...

116011091.content: We... will be home. Both of us.

116021003.content: Shu strides into the medical center and asks the question burning in my throat as I follow behind her.

116021004.content: The treatment has just been administered. Only Poseidon has regained consciousness. If you must enter, please make your visit brief. The patients still need rest.

116021006.content: With that, we push open the big doors to the inpatient ward.

116021007.content: A lamp overhead lights up a vase of white flowers on the table. The light is cast over half of Poseidon's face, while the other half is shrouded in shadow. Her eyes are downcast, seemingly reflecting on some distant matter.

116021009.content: As Shu's voice announces our arrival, the girl with the sea-blue hair suddenly snaps back to attention. She gives a weary smile to her friends at the door.

116021012.content: Alright. I can't really use my right arm, but other than that, I'm fine.

116021013.content: Poseidon's arm is wrapped in layer upon layer of bandages. Apparently, it was wounded when the assailant took her Access Key. If she'd reacted even a second slower... there'd probably be nothing left to bandage.

116021014.content: But Zenki still hasn't come to yet...

116021015.content: I turn my gaze to Zenkibo on the other bed. Her eyes are squeezed shut beneath furrowed brows as delirious murmurs escape her lips. From her fragmented sentences, I can hear that it's not a good dream she's having.

116021016.content: Goki... Where are you taking me? Hngh, I don't wanna go there...

116021017.content: I don't... I don't wanna leave everyone...

116021018.content: Don't worry... Mimtastic said she's out of the woods now. Just needs a little while to regain consciousness.

116021019.content: If only I'd gotten there sooner...

116021020.content: We were lucky enough to have you there at all, Admin. If I'd fainted by the side of the road like that, the attacker definitely would have come for us a second time.

116021021.content: Did you get a good look at them?

116021022.content: No... It was like he was the night. All I know is that he attacks using chains.

116021023.content: Chains... No recorded Visbanes in the Cryptics' files use chains as a weapon...

116021025.content: Admin, Miss Shu, they have arrived. We better go and meet them now, in the conference room.

116021026.content: You two go ahead. I'm sure work has been piling up lately...

116021029.content: After leaving the ward, Shu and I make our way to the meeting room.

116021030.content: After the Modifier attack a few days ago, we received news that "those two" were coming back. Except that with everyone busy patrolling and searching for clues the last few days, we haven't had the chance to meet with each other.

116021031.content: After the sensor security door opens, we follow the red and gold carpet to the floor-to-ceiling windows, where we see two unfamiliar silhouettes at the huge desk—one sitting and the other standing.

116021033.content: Occupying the main chair in which Shu normally sits is a woman with silvery-blue hair wearing a finely tailored black suit. Seemingly speaking to the person beside her when we enter, the corners of her mouth are curved into a faint smile.

116021034.content: Noticing us arrive, her golden eyes languidly turn to meet ours. As she calmly acquiesces to my observation, those eyes likewise unabashedly size me up with interest.

116021035.content: The iciness she exudes is mellowed by the hint of an amiable smile on her face, as well as those captivating, whirlpool-like eyes. The contrast is enough to mire anyone in uncertainty.

116021036.content: Meanwhile, the red-headed girl sitting sideways on the edge of the table seems more like a blazing fire. Even now with her eyes narrowed drowsily, her ferocious, commanding presence still clearly signals that she is not to be trifled with.

116021037.content: Administrator, this is Odin, the founder of Aether Gazer.

116021038.content: And this is Thor from Thunder Squad. She's Apollo and Zenkibo's captain.

116021040.content: Ah, Apollo's mentioned you in his letters! Impressive, I gotta say, for a human to cope with the Mimir System this long.

116021042.content: I don't just mean your tactical capability—you seem to get along with that obnoxious butterball also, and that's a feat.

116021044.content: Huh, you don't seem to hide your pride at all... Well then, I look forward to seeing you on the next mission.

116021045.content: #{nickname}#, I've been longing for our meeting. As unfortunate as I was to be bound by my work in the past few days, it looks like my wish is granted...

116021047.content: Heh, no need for the formalities. Shu calls me by my name so you can do the same.

116021048.content: She extends her hand toward me. After being momentarily taken aback by this unexpectedly formal gesture, I reach out and shake her hand.

116021049.content: Her palm is neither cold nor warm, and the uneasy feeling that accompanies it seems to plunge me into a deep and boundless ocean. Her smile reflected in my eyes is the only goodwill being conveyed.

116021050.content: Let's keep the pleasantries to a minimum. The situation isn't looking good at the moment.

116021051.content: Haha, see how she's rushing me? We'll have to save the conversation for next time. For now, let's get down to business.

116021052.content: This is the third time we've had a case of assaulted Modifiers. We still don't know who's launching these attacks.

116021053.content: Can we not ascertain the attacker's area of operation based on the location of the scenes?

116021054.content: Yes, but the attacker moves quickly. Right now the range comprises nearly one-third of the city.

116021055.content: I recommend mobilizing between three and five search teams to comb the area for clues. This way we should be able to fully cover the target's movements.

116021057.content: But, that's the most we can allocate at the moment...

116021058.content: You misunderstand. I mean one team will suffice.

116021059.content: One? But how will one team cover...

116021060.content: Between Poseidon and Zenkibo, one is a veteran while the other is an official member of the Special Task Force. And yet even they were unable to get a visual on their attacker, and their Access Keys were taken without a fight... Dispatching more personnel in such a situation would be sending the prey into a hungry wolf's maw.

116021062.content: I understand your anxiety, but we can't lose sight of the bigger picture. The more dangerous things get, the more we need you to be calm and collected.

116021063.content: ...What do you have in mind then?

116021064.content: This search team will consist of me, Thor, and an appointed member. The rest will remain at HQ. I don't want anyone else in the organization coming to harm.

116021065.content: That's it? Won't that be like searching for a needle in a haystack?

116021066.content: Correct, that's why I need to pick an additional member for the team.

116021067.content: Who do you intend to have...? If it's technical support you need, Heimdall would fit the bill. But if you need someone quick on their feet... maybe we could ask Olympia Express to assign Hermes.

116021068.content: Odin leans back heavily in her seat. She picks up a pen from the table and twirls it on her fingertip, then points it at...

116021070.content: You want to take the Administrator with you?

116021071.content: I'm just as surprised as Shu is.

116021073.content: Not at all. Quite the opposite, in fact.

116021074.content: But the Administrator... #{nickname}# isn't suited to this type of job.

116021075.content: No, I think the Administrator is just the person for this job.

116021076.content: Odin and I would definitely struggle to catch someone this elusive in such a huge area by ourselves. But if the attacker brought themselves to our doorstep, that would be a different story.

116021077.content: Of course, that is, if the attacker is a Visbane.

116021078.content: You want to use the mark in the Administrator's body as bait...? That's too dangerous!

116021079.content: The presence of Modifiers suppresses the mark's effects. For this plan to work, wouldn't you have to leave the Administrator alone and in danger?

116021080.content: We'll keep comms open. I'll be there the second there's trouble.

116021082.content: That said, I'm not forcing anyone to do anything they don't like...

116021083.content: The silver-haired woman sets down the pen in her hands. She interlaces her fingers over her knee as she seems to await my answer with that enigmatic smile on her face.

116021084.content: You already know what I'd like you to do. Now the decision is yours to make.

116021086.content: Well, you see that, Shu? We have an administrator of volition here.

116021088.content: No, you're not. It's been a long time since I managed any work around here. We need you in Aether Gazer, or it'll be absolute chaos.

116021089.content: Trust us to take care of this.

116031001.content: Walking down the long, quiet street, the further into the gloom this winding path leads, the deeper the chill sets into my body.

116031002.content: This is the second day that Odin, Thor, and I have gone out searching for clues. Though a joint investigation in name, they've deliberately remained out of sight and only contact me through my earpiece.

116031003.content: Over the course of this operation, I've been attacked by Visbanes countless times, only to have been rescued—shaken, but unharmed—by them each time.

116031004.content: The most dangerous time was when Thor's massive hammer slammed to the ground in front of me without any warning—no sooner had the Visbane emerged than it was flattened, but my shoulder was nearly dislocated by the flying kicks that followed...

116031005.content: Another fruitless day, it would seem.

116031006.content: Odin seems to sigh, but her voice sounds more comforting than anything—she deliberately said what's on our minds at this moment.

116031007.content: Still, there weren't any new attacks. If our actions have served as a deterrent, I'd call it a small success.

116031009.content: She thought our teamwork was slowing her down, so she went off to search by herself two hours ago.

116031011.content: Don't worry. In terms of combat power alone, she's the strongest in Aether Gazer. If the enemy's too strong for even her to handle, then our added presence wouldn't be of any help.

116031012.content: You're saying Thor's even stronger than you?

116031013.content: Without a doubt. No one could take a direct hit from that big electrified hammer, wouldn't you agree?

116031014.content: I can't tell if Odin's kidding or being serious when she says this, but it alleviates my anxiety somewhat—even if the mental image it conjures does make me sweat.

116031015.content: Shu mentioned that you stopped overseeing Aether Gazer's affairs a few years back. After you passed the torch on to her, you went off...

116031016.content: ...Gallivanting around on my own and doing literally nothing?

116031018.content: Ha, no need to walk on eggshells. I don't mind.

116031019.content: You and Thor were in Xu Heng before, right? Were you fighting Visbanes there too?

116031020.content: I'll be honest with you—we did indeed encounter Visbanes in Xu Heng, but they weren't the reason we went there...

116031021.content: Then the purpose of your travels has been...

116031022.content: To gallivant around and do literally nothing.

116031024.content: Hehe... So, Administrator—you've been with Division Nine for a while now. What's the deepest impression the Visbanes have left on you?

116031025.content: Odin's sudden question takes me by surprise. Countless fragmented images immediately begin to surface in my mind—the Spealght revolt, the Snake God of Sasanami, the Quakes, the deep-sea Siren, and Novich and Ladon as well...

116031026.content: They appear out of nowhere, then drag people into the Source Layer and corrode their very existence...

116031027.content: They're consumed by a yearning to destroy all things, like they have a hatred for something that they can't understand or communicate. They seem to be plotting something, or have simply descended into madness...

116031028.content: You may not have been on the job long, but you have a lot of insight into it already.

116031029.content: As for me, Visbanes are my enemies, and the fight between Modifiers and Visbanes has gone on for too long. I've lived through all of it, but I can't see an end to this war...

116031030.content: They can't be killed. Destroy one, and two more pop out in its place. If that weren't bad enough, they keep getting stronger and evolving... Whether you win or lose by the battle's end, you're left feeling desperate and powerless, like a resolution will never be found.

116031031.content: Hm... Maybe that's why I packed it all in and left without a care? Everyone needs to... what's the expression again... "Yolo?"

116031033.content: The words had already left my mouth before I could think them through. For a moment, you could cut the atmosphere with a knife.

116031035.content: I mean... If you really didn't care, you wouldn't have come back from Xu Heng as soon as you heard about the Modifier attacks, right?

116031036.content: Hm... Hehe, you're right. Maybe I'm more reliable than I give myself credit for.

116031037.content: Odin's laughter diffuses the tension in the air. After walking half a block, it's starting to get dark.

116031038.content: Looks like my bait didn't work this time.

116031040.content: Hm, fair enough... You just can't have any luck with Thor around. She'd fall into a hunter's trap just walking through the park.

116031042.content: Administrator, what do you think our Modifier attacker wants?

116031044.content: Take our place... That's not what I expected to hear. Still, you remind me of a Xu Heng story I heard about. Two monkeys sprang out from a stone, fighting each other over who was the real one.

116031045.content: Do they think they could do a better job than the Modifiers? If that's the case, then taking their Access Keys—the source of their power—would make sense.
