116031046.content: A predator... Considering how the victims varied in identities and locations, it's hard to believe the attacker was driven by personal vendetta. Maybe they simply go out when they're hungry, then rest once they're satiated—like beasts.

116031047.content: If that's the case, wouldn't it make Access Keys their sustenance? Heh, an intriguing hypothesis.

116031048.content: Hey! Enough chitchat, you two! I just sent the coordinates to your terminals!

116031049.content: Thor's sudden interjection ends our speculative tangent.

116031051.content: Another victim! She was still breathing when I found her, but you'd better get over here quick!

116031053.content: Going after the attacker, of course!

116031054.content: If they think can jump Zenki and get away with it, they've made a goddamn mistake! Just wait and see what happens when I catch them!

116032001.content: Odin and I arrive simultaneously at a street corner not far from the position of the coordinates Thor sent.

116032002.content: We need to go deeper inside...

116032004.content: It's a dimly lit alley. Even during the daytime hustle and bustle, I doubt anyone would even cast a glance toward somewhere so unassuming.

116032005.content: It's not a broad path, but it splits off into several winding byways, like a secret labyrinth tucked away in this developed city. Without the coordinates guiding us, it's hard to say whether we could keep from losing our way after a few turns.

116032006.content: Knowing the urgency of the situation, Odin and I tacitly start to quicken our pace. Closing in on the coordinates, we go around a bend and see, in a corner where two walls meet—

116032007.content: The shape of a pale girl outlined by the brightly shining moon overhead.

116032008.content: Her body is covered in injuries, her brows are tightly knit, and each of her ragged breaths is consuming the fragile remnants of her life.

116032009.content: I crouch down to get a closer look at her wounds.

116032010.content: Hearing my movement, the girl's body subconsciously tenses up. Her long pink hair cascades over her skin like a fledgling bird's broken wings. She looks up at me, and I see a mixture of disbelief and amazement in her eyes.

116032011.content: —The pleasant surprise of realizing she's being rescued, I assume.

116032012.content: Just when I'm about to explain the situation to her, she speaks.

116032013.content: Thank goodness... it's you. (Cough)... (Cough)... I... I finally found you...

116032015.content: I finally found you... I'm so glad...

116032016.content: Oh, I can see you know each other. Good, that'll save us some trouble.

116032018.content: Huh? Then... could she have mistaken you for someone else?

116032019.content: I don't know, but this really is the first time I've ever seen her...

116032020.content: Now that you're here, we can go together...

116032021.content: As the girl speaks, her eyes slowly close and her words trail off into an indistinct mumble.

116032022.content: Still breathing. I think she's just lost consciousness for now. Let's take her back to HQ.

116032024.content: Just as the words leave my mouth, an athletic figure springs to the top of the wall. Her red hair tied into a long braid, the girl's expression is awash with vexation and resignation.

116032027.content: Let's go back to HQ for now. At least we've rescued the latest victim.

116032028.content: Tch. I guess we don't have much choice.

116032031.content: Odin looks at her comrade and travel companion from Xu Heng. She begins to open her mouth, but then brings her lips back together again, seemingly hesitating.

116041002.content: Odin doesn't answer, waiting instead for the medical AGI Mecha that has just finished its work to leave first.

116041003.content: Well, she's only recovered physically a little bit.

116041004.content: I follow Odin to the front of the girl's bed.

116041005.content: She's awake now and sitting up in the bed with her arms wrapped around her legs. Her eyes are fixed on the snow-white quilted surface before her.

116041006.content: She kept murmuring "Tantan" while she was unconscious. Sounds like someone's name. Also she hasn't answered any of our questions since she woke up.

116041007.content: As Odin speaks, the girl listens from the side without responding, as if the conversation has nothing to do with her.

116041008.content: The medical AGI Mecha checked her hearing and found nothing wrong. She didn't suffer any brain damage either.

116041010.content: I mean she just doesn't want to talk. What a pain.

116041011.content: However, she did appear to be reactive yesterday when you were present. Why don't you try talking to her?

116041013.content: Odin leans in close to me, the tip of her nose nearly making contact with my face. I don't dare look into her eyes—I'm afraid of falling into those unfathomably deep wells.

116041015.content: Satisfied with my answer, Odin smiles as she leaves the treatment room.

116041018.content: Her head slowly tilts up when she hears my voice, and the moment her gaze meets mine—I'm sure I'm not imagining it—small golden fires suddenly light up in her dim eyes.

116041022.content: She folds her hands helplessly in front of her, and the strange lights in her eyes are extinguished.

116041023.content: You're Tantan, aren't you? I wouldn't mistake you for someone else.

116041024.content: But you really do have the wrong person. My name is #{nickname}#, not Tantan.

116041025.content: It can't be, Tantan... Like the drum, that's what you told me.

116041026.content: Did you forget your own name? Don't worry... I'm pretty forgetful too.

116041027.content: (That's sweet, I guess, but I haven't actually forgotten anything...)

116041028.content: Um, we can talk about my name later. Do you remember what your name is?

116041032.content: The air in the room seems to freeze as we stare at each other.

116041033.content: Seeing her brow wrinkle slightly, I decide to ask her about something else for now.

116041034.content: Skuld, do you remember what happened last night?

116041035.content: Last night... I... was chased by someone, then I got hurt. Then I woke up and saw you, Tantan.

116041036.content: Is that all? All the key details are missing... Do you remember who attacked you?

116041038.content: Other than your name, do you remember anything else about yourself? Where you live, for example?

116041040.content: How about... where you were going last night? What did you go out to do?

116041042.content: Wincing, Skuld covers her forehead with her hand. I quickly reassure her that she doesn't need to remember everything right away.

116041043.content: It looks like you have amnesia. I'd better report the situation to Odin and the Cryptics first...

116041044.content: Just as I'm getting up to leave—

116041046.content: I feel a small, but forceful tug on my sleeve. When I turn to look, I see that Skuld's eyes are already brimming with tears.

116041049.content: I'll be back soon... I'm just going to take care of something.

116041051.content: Uh... Okay, I won't. I guess we'll just keep the chat a little longer then.

116041052.content: Since you remember the name, why don't we talk about this Tantan you know? What's Tantan like? Or do you not remember that either?

116041053.content: I could never forget about Tantan... A little careless, but also kind enough to be my friend every time...

116041054.content: Three traits that I can't see the connection between...

116041055.content: Besides that, any places you two have been to together? Or any deep impressions you have?

116041056.content: Yeah... We went shopping and ate together, and Tantan promised me we'd ride something called a Ferris wheel.

116041057.content: (Aren't these all things you'd do on a date...?)

116041058.content: Anything else? Did Tantan have anything to do with why you were there yesterday, perhaps?

116041059.content: I'm sorry... I can't actually remember everything. I guess I did forget some of them...

116041060.content: There's nothing to apologize for. Do you want to remember what happened before?

116041061.content: Skuld blinks at me, then reaches up to touch her forehead again.

116041062.content: It'll hurt a little... But if it's memories of being with you, then I want to remember.

116041063.content: Okay, then I'll try to work out something as well. I might have to go ask Odin and the Cryptics.

116041064.content: I stand up, and again I feel a tug on my clothing.

116041066.content: I spill it out without thinking. Skuld, seemingly frightened by my words, trembles slightly.

116041067.content: Sorry... What I mean is, anything else I can help you with?

116041068.content: She leans over and tries to reach for something on the bedside table.

116041069.content: I look over to the bedside table—the red camera that was around her neck is resting on top of it.

116041071.content: For some reason, the moment I touch the camera, I'm struck by a fleeting, familiar feeling—despite never having seen this model before.

116041074.content: Skuld takes the camera, then raises it in front of her face.

116041077.content: Tantan once said that if I was afraid of forgetting something important, I should use this to take a picture of it.

116041078.content: Things that make me happy, things I like... There are lots of things I want to remember later. This way, I won't forget them.

116051001.content: I fill Odin in on Skuld's memory loss.

116051002.content: I see... Not only was she attacked, she's even forgotten her own past.

116051003.content: Before they awaken, many Modifiers would forget about their own identities. But I've never heard of this happening after the fact.

116051004.content: All she can remember now is someone called "Tantan..."

116051005.content: Are you saying that even you can't do anything to help, Tantan?

116051008.content: Right now, her memory is the best clue we have on the attacker. We can't let go of it.

116051010.content: At least she has a few memories, albeit fragmented. Where she went, what she's done, what she's said—these are the "trails" we'll have to follow.

116051011.content: A straight line can be drawn between two points on a plane. With enough of a trail, we'll be able to piece together a confirmed "past."

116051012.content: She was attacked in Ain Soph, and clues must have been left behind.

116051013.content: But Ain Soph is huge. It'll be like trying to find a needle in a haystack.

116051014.content: You're not wrong. We've run into the same problem before, when we were investigating your background.

116051015.content: But Skuld's case is different—we have a lead, and it's right in front of us.

116051017.content: She said it herself, didn't she? If it's memories about this Tantan, she wants to remember them. Now, suppose that Tantan wants to take her down memory lane—I'm sure she wouldn't refuse.

116051019.content: Even if you aren't, it won't make any difference to our objective. We want to help her remember the attacker. Besides, you've lost your memory before, haven't you? How can you be so sure you aren't still forgetting something?

116051020.content: At least I remember my own name.

116051021.content: What if you remembered it wrong?

116051023.content: I hope I'll be hearing good news from you soon.

116051024.content: Odin wears that same, unchanging smile, as if there's some deeper meaning underlying that casually posited scenario.

116051025.content: After leaving the office, I knock on the treatment room door.

116051026.content: Hi, Skuld. Can I come in?

116051029.content: She hangs her head as if closely scrutinizing something on the futon. The corners of the futon are exactly as they were the day before, and slippers are neatly arranged under the bed—it doesn't look like she's left the bed once.

116051030.content: It's fine, if you're used to calling me Tantan, then you can just call me that.

116051031.content: Really? I'm so glad... Oh, right. This is for you.

116051033.content: Just as Skuld's feet touch the ground, she begins to fall straight forward, like a wooden staff released from someone's grasp.

116051035.content: Skuld falls into the crook of my arm. Frail her shape looks, and the unexpected weight I feel on my arm makes my face flush.

116051037.content: I-I'm fine... You've been sitting for so long. Suddenly standing up like that will make your feet go numb.

116051039.content: She moves back a few steps, then releases her hold on my arm, making sure that she can stand.

116051040.content: Numb... Is that like the tingling you feel when you get an electric shock? Because that's what I just felt... Oh no, what have I done?

116051041.content: Skuld looks at a wad of crumbled white paper in her right hand. It looks like it was once a paper airplane, but it met an unfortunate end in the crook of my arm.

116051042.content: It took me so long to finish... I wanted to give it to you, Tantan.

116051043.content: (I'm pretty sure paper airplanes don't take that long to make...)

116051044.content: My doubts aside, I accept the paper airplane. I flatten and fold it back into shape, blow a puff of air, and let it fly out the window.

116051046.content: You... threw the paper airplane away...

116051048.content: Tantan... you threw away... the gift I made you...

116051049.content: Her voice starts to tremble. Like flags beckoning rain, her eyes slowly well up with tears.

116061001.content: Why... Why did you throw away the gift I worked on so hard...?

116061002.content: Why...? Because paper airplanes are made to be flown.

116061003.content: Then, that red plane in the hall—will you throw that away one day too?

116061004.content: No way, Zenkibo would kill me.

116061005.content: The point is, you can think of paper airplanes like this—when you let them go, they'll take all your troubles and misfortune far, far away.

116061007.content: Uh... Well, it's hard to say.

116061008.content: Skuld lowers her head as if in thought.

116061010.content: You don't have to. When it comes to this sort of thing, all you have to do is feel it...

116061011.content: Feel it... I see. I'm really happy to be out spending time with you.

116061012.content: We're not out here just to hang out. You should pay attention to our surroundings and see if they remind you of anything. Generally speaking, revisiting familiar places is a good way to jog your memory.

116061013.content: I remember this street. It's where we first met, Tantan.

116061015.content: You wanted to buy some clothes then...

116061018.content: ...It's fine, I was rushing you a bit there. Let's walk around.

116061019.content: Do you have any photos in your camera, like, some photos of you together with Tantan?

116061020.content: They're gone. Some were lost, others disappeared...

116061023.content: Skuld suddenly pulls my hand and points at a newly-opened barbecue restaurant called "CharGrill."

116061024.content: (Funny... I just went there with Ver a few days ago.)

116061026.content: I don't know, I've never had it. But I'd like to give it a try.

116061028.content: At a nearby corner at the same time—

116061030.content: But Ver, didn't you just eat here with the Administrator a few days ago...?

116061031.content: Yeah, but it's barbecue! How can I ever get sick of it?

116061032.content: And not only can I not have any, I have to stand guard here and watch them gobble it all down? That's what I call abuse!

116061033.content: You know about the Administrator's constitution. It'd be dangerous if we don't have Modifiers nearby for too long—even more so right now with that Modifier attacker still on the loose.

116061034.content: Also, I hear this girl won't talk to anyone but the Administrator.

116061036.content: Ver, ever since Skuld pulled the Administrator's hand, you've been squeezing mine real tight. Ow...

116061037.content: Huh?! I'm so sorry, Lil' Osi, I didn't even realize! Sorry!!

116061038.content: Not so loud, Ver, I'm worried the Administrator's ears will—

116061039.content: (Thanks, Osiris, but my hurting ear says it's too late...)

116061041.content: Skuld looks up from her camera, which is currently pointed at the barbecued meat.

116061043.content: Smiling, I rest my hand on my right ear and discreetly lower the volume of my earbud.

116061044.content: After we finish eating, we leave the restaurant in a single file. It's been like this since this morning—maybe it's out of timidness, but she's always following behind me like a shadow.

116061045.content: The owner of the restaurant gave me this mascot charm. Here, you take it, Skuld.

116061046.content: You're giving this to me...? It's so cute... Thank you, Tantan!

116061047.content: Also, the barbecue was really tasty.

116061048.content: I'm glad you enjoyed it. Speaking of which, since you and Ver both like barbecue, I bet you could become good friends.

116061050.content: She's a friend of mine. If we get the chance, we could all go out for barbecue together next time.

116061053.content: Friend... Are we friends too, Tantan?

116061055.content: We are? I'm so glad...! Huh? Ahh—!

116061056.content: All of a sudden, a cat leaps out from the grass and runs straight into Skuld.

116061059.content: The small gift we just received from the barbecue restaurant now hangs from the mouth of the cat, which is now darting off into the distance.

116061060.content: What rotten luck... We'll just have to ask the owner for another one next time.

116061061.content: But you gave it to me, Tantan... No, we can't let the cat take it...

116061062.content: Skuld has barely finished speaking, and she's already after it.

116061064.content: I instinctively take off after them.

116061065.content: What's going on, Admin? Why is your position moving so fast?

116061066.content: Ver, could you help me get another charm from the barbecue restaurant? I'll meet you at the second intersection up ahead later.

116061068.content: That's not gonna work. I just asked the owner, and he said he already gave away the last charm.

116061069.content: Um?! Admin, did you hear her? There are no more charms left...

116061070.content: Hello? Can you hear me, Admin?

116061071.content: As I'm chasing after Skuld, I suddenly realize that my earbud must have fallen out somewhere along my mad dash.

116061072.content: When I finally spot Skuld, she's already caught up with the bolting cat.

116061073.content: Hah... Phew... Skuld, y-you're so fast...

116061074.content: Give it back... give me my charm...!

116061075.content: Breathless and exasperated, Skuld furiously rubs the cat's head. The little furball, however, doesn't seem to mind her at all.

116061076.content: Maybe it let go of the charm the moment it realized it wasn't food...

116061080.content: I-If you run into any danger, just yell out!

116061081.content: I sprint over to the appointed spot. Ver and Osiris are already there waiting for me.

116061083.content: Thank you, Ver! Sorry, my earbud fell out. I'll bring Skuld back to HQ in a little bit.

116061084.content: Ver smiles and waves at me as I leave, but... why does she look so tired?

116061085.content: Anyways, the clock's ticking. Better go back first.

116061086.content: I'm back! Sorry to make you wait.

116061087.content: Skuld is sitting on the ground looking helplessly at her empty hands, like an abandoned kitten.

116061088.content: It's only a charm. Why is she so upset...?

116061089.content: I curl both my hands into fists and extend them toward her.

116061091.content: Pick the right one for a gift.

116061092.content: A gift...? But Tantan, I just got one from you...

116061093.content: You can give a gift whenever you feel like it. It purely depends on my mood, and I'm in a good one.

116061094.content: Skuld clutches at her sleeves anxiously as her brows knit together. She carefully examines my hands several times, but still hasn't made a decision.

116061095.content: You don't have to... just pick one...

116061096.content: I can't. No gift for me if I pick the wrong one... I have to think this through.

116061097.content: You'd get it even if you picked wrong, trust me...

116061099.content: Skuld points to my right hand. I open it—inside is the charm I just got from Ver. For some reason, I also breathe a sigh of relief.

116061100.content: Well done, Skuld. You guessed right in one go.

116061101.content: No... I actually chose the wrong one the first time.

116061103.content: This was the charm that... Did you go get it back for me?

116061104.content: ...Yep, the cat dropped it in a flower bed.

116061105.content: No wonder... The charm looks way older now. Hmph, kittens...

116061106.content: Older? Didn't we just get it from the restaurant owner?

116061107.content: I think back to how Ver was all sweaty and out of breath just before...

116061108.content: ...Looks like I owe Ver a few rounds of barbecue.

116071001.content: Anyway, did you have fun today, Skuld?

116071002.content: Beaming, Skuld nods her head vigorously.

116071003.content: Glad to hear it. Though, it's a shame we haven't made any progress on your memory...

116071005.content: Don't be! It's not your fault. Sorry, I was just thinking about how other Modifiers are still in danger as long as the attacker is still out there.

116071006.content: If that makes you unhappy, Tantan, then I'll help too.

116071008.content: After comforting me, Skuld's eyes fall to an injury she got during the day on her right leg—it's a scrape from when she was chasing the cat. It didn't bleed, but it was still given some simple treatment.

116071011.content: You put it on me before, when I fell down.

116071012.content: Can you remember when this happened? Or where?

116071013.content: If I can confirm the time and place, maybe I'll be able to find out who Tantan is from the CCTV footage there.

116071014.content: A long time ago... More than a hundred days ago, in a place called "amusement park."

116071015.content: An amusement park? What was it like?

116071016.content: There were balloons and plushies everywhere. And... a huge chess piece.

116071017.content: A huge chess piece... Was it Valleyrand Theme Park? Funny, I was just there a couple days ago.

116071019.content: Then let's go there tomorrow. That way you can be sure.

116071020.content: Go to an amusement park with you...? Yeah, I'll be there.

116071021.content: Then I'll come to you tomorrow. For now, you need to rest.

116071023.content: Just as I'm about to leave, Skuld tugs on a corner of my clothing, just like last time.

116071024.content: Still afraid of being by yourself after the attack...?

116071025.content: You'd like to hear a story?

116071026.content: A story? You'll tell me one?

116071027.content: Yep. They say my stories are pretty good at putting people to sleep.

116071029.content: Hmm, but what are bedtime stories usually about...?

116071030.content: There was once a high tower that led straight up to the heavens...

116071031.content: That opening... I know this story. Is that the one you want to hear? I'm surprised you know it. Not a lot of people do.

116071032.content: Since the judge has made her decision, I begin telling the story without any qualms.

116071033.content:
Long, long ago, God created people, but these people had never seen their god.

One day, one of the people said: "I've never beheld the form of God. If I can't see God with my own eyes, then God doesn't exist!"

Right, "behold" means "to look at" or "to see."

116071037.content:
Someone else took issue with this reasoning—God resided high above in the heavens, and ordinary people couldn't just see God whenever they felt like it.

However, a great many people agreed that there was no God in this world.

But then, another person stood up and said: "Let's go to the heavens to see for ourselves then. It won't be easy, but I want to prove the existence of God."

116071039.content:
Hardly anyone followed this person at first. They all assumed this was just some drunken rant.

But, true to her word, she began to painstakingly design a tower tall enough to reach the heavens.

With the great possibility of "seeing God" now in front of them, more and more people joined her.

Days passed, then years, and from the moment she began her work on this Tower of Heaven, the devout believer's feet didn't touch the ground again once.

116071043.content: Whoa... Then did they get there in the end...?

116071044.content:
(Looks like she's getting sleepy.)

Yes. It's a story, so of course it has an idealistic end.

She saw God, just as she'd hoped to, and proved to the skeptics that the entity she worshipped day and night truly existed.

However, God was not as kind as she'd thought. Furious at this mortal's intrusion, God destroyed the believer along with her tower.

116071048.content: Hmm... Maybe that was for the best...

116071049.content: (She seems to be fast asleep. Still, I can't help but think this made for a strange bedtime story...)

116071050.content: I turn off the nightlight by the door and walk out of the treatment room, making my way back to my own room.

116071051.content: The bedtime story seemed to have an effect on me as well. That night, I had a bizarre dream.

116071052.content: I dreamt that the tall tower was destroyed over and over again, only to be rebuilt each time.

116071053.content: Standing atop the tower wasn't the devout believer, nor was it God's existence that she wished to prove.

116071054.content: She wanted to use this lofty tower to prove her own existence.

116081001.content: You want to go to an amusement park? You're not using this whole memory recovery thing as an excuse to travel around on our dime, are you?

116081003.content: Heh. Alright, enough kidding around. Going to Valleyrand Theme Park isn't the problem—do you know what is?

116081004.content: Valleyrand Theme Park officially opened last month, yet she says she went more than a hundred days ago.

116081005.content: Maybe she remembered the time wrong?

116081006.content: It would take some serious amnesia to confuse thirty with over a hundred.

116081007.content: The question is, does she really have amnesia? Or is she hiding something...

116081008.content: I'll keep my eyes and ears open.

116081009.content: Thor and I didn't have any success today either... We're counting on you now. Shu will assign Ver and Osiris to watch your backs.

116081010.content: The next day, I arrive at the treatment room at the time I promised to take Skuld out. Except—

116081013.content: Where is this coming from all of a sudden? You seemed excited to go yesterday. Are you... not feeling well?

116081015.content: Skuld wraps her arms around herself. She doesn't seem to want to answer.

116081016.content: I didn't mean to go back on what I said, Tantan. It's just that—

116081017.content: Don't worry about it, we can just go another day. We have an itinerary ready whenever we feel like it now.

116081019.content: Skuld squats down. She takes one crumpled ball of paper after another out from under the bed and lays them out in front of her.

116081020.content: No, wait—looking closely, they aren't just "paper balls"—they look more like failed laborious attempts to make origami.

116081021.content: I wanted to make what you were talking about, Tantan. Something that could carry troubles and misfortune far, far away.

116081022.content: (She's had this hard of a time just making a paper airplane? Still, her persistence is commendable...)

116081023.content: I quickly take a sheet of paper out from the drawer and place it in front of her.

116081024.content: They're not hard to make. Want me to teach you?

116081025.content: ...Yes. I spent so much time trying to make one, but all I ended up with was wrinkly paper.

116081026.content: Okay, then watch carefully! Here, this sheet is for you.

116081027.content: I take the smooth paper and press it to make several folds and creases.

116081028.content: Interconnected and interlocked, these folds and creases extend from the flat surface to form a three-dimensional shape.

116081030.content: Customarily, I give its tip my blessing breath before tossing the paper airplane. It flies in a semi-circle around the room, then nose-dives toward the headboard of the bed.

116081031.content: When I look back at Skuld, she's used my method to make a rudimentary paper airplane. But her imprecise workmanship has made the finished product look a little crude.

116081032.content: I can't do it like you did, Tantan...

116081033.content: You just have to take your time, that's all. Here, let's do it together.

116081034.content: Step by step, I guide Skuld through the folding process.

116081035.content: There! Your very own paper airplane, Skuld!

116081037.content: Following my example, Skuld breathes out a puff of air at her work. The force and angle of the throw are somewhat lacking, but the plane still pulls off a smooth flight.

116081039.content: It's all about experience! The more you practice, the better you'll get at it.

116081040.content: Practice... So that's what it is. I had to practice a lot before as well...

116081042.content: Closing my eyes, opening my eyes... then coming up with the correct answer as quickly as possible. I've always had to practice this...

116081043.content: But those answers never meant anything to me, I didn't like them... I just wanted to spend time with Tantan. Everyone else didn't like me, the Skuld who couldn't come up with the answer.

116081045.content: I forget what I want to ask when I see Skuld bring her hands to her head.

116081046.content: That reminds me, can we take a photo together today, Tantan? I planned to take one on the Ferris wheel, but... I'm sorry...

116081047.content: There's nothing to be sorry about. We have plenty of time, we can just go on a different day.

116081048.content: I raise up the camera and take a photo of the two of us.

116081049.content: As the photo gradually develops, I realize that I got the focus wrong—only the top of my head made it into the photo.

116081050.content: In the center of the picture, Skuld is smiling into the lens.

116081051.content: Seeing this "failed" photo, a disconcerted expression appears on her face.

116081053.content: Still, I don't get it. You're the one that first taught me to use this camera, Tantan.

116081054.content: Well, I'll definitely get the composition right this time... There, this one should be perfect!

116081055.content: Strange... I'm sure I pressed the shutter, why isn't the camera doing anything?

116081056.content: Let me see... Ah, it's out of photo paper.

116091001.content: With our amusement park plans canceled and me being restricted from going out, I slip into a deep sleep in the break room.

116091002.content: In my dream, that colossal, sky-reaching tower makes another appearance.

116091003.content: Only this time, a giant bird with black feathers and a golden right eye is perched atop the tower.

116091004.content: The bird looks down over the mortal realm below the tower. Its feathers, shifting like ink blots diffusing on paper, stretch down from the sky. It seems to be looking for something—

116091005.content: Then, the bird casts its gaze over the sea mist to meet mine.

116091006.content: Fierce winds, thunder, and lightning suddenly burst forth. The massive tower falls to the ground, shattering to pieces, and the giant bird takes off, slicing through the clouds with its wings...

116091007.content: At the foot of the tower cobbled together with despair and silt, all that remains is a looming mountain of bleached bones.

116091009.content: The moon and stars shining in the night sky beyond the window tell me I've slept away the whole afternoon. As I press my hand over my wildly beating heart, I can feel the sweat drenching my body through my shirt.

116091010.content: Is this because of that story about the tower...?

116091011.content: Administrator, you're finally awake! I trust you haven't forgotten it's time for the meeting!

116091013.content: As I push open the door, I run into Ver just as she's passing through.

116091014.content: Admin, did you get Miss Shu's message about the meeting as well?

116091015.content: Yeah, she said we have something to discuss.

116091016.content: I bet the Modifier attacker still being at large is really bothering Miss Shu and Odin. I'd better step up my game.

116091017.content: We walk a little further before I realize that all the big lights along the way are out, leaving the corridor unusually dark with only the small lamps lit.

116091018.content: Is something wrong with the medical center corridor?

116091020.content: The shrill beep of a communicator notification suddenly rings out.

116091021.content: It's coming from the meeting room, Administrator. Let's go take a look.

116091022.content: Tmp, tmp— Tmp, tmp, tmp, tmp—

116091023.content: It's a medium distance from here to the meeting room. It's obviously the time we were called to meet, yet we don't run into a single other person on our way there.

116091024.content: On average, one out of every four corridor lights we pass is broken and flickering. My eyes ache, and a feeling of unease starts to swell up from my chest.

116091026.content: When we reach the meeting room door, it's deathly quiet all around, like a nightmarish monster has swallowed up all the sounds and lights.

116091027.content: The fingerprint-reading padlocks the door tight without betraying a hint of what lies inside. It's as if Pandora's box would fling open the second a finger touched the lock.

116091028.content: We didn't see anyone else on our way here, we must be late! Miss Shu's gonna give it to us when it's over—

116091029.content: Wait a second, Ver. Something's not right here...

116091030.content: Hearing this, Ver quickly retracts her finger.

116091032.content: But the keen sensor has already read her fingerprint. The piercing chirping coming from the door as it unlocks drowns out our breathing. The sound plunges into the depths of the flickering corridor, then laps against our ears in waves of phantasmic echoes.

116091035.content: My brows furrow as I feel increasingly suffocated by the gloom. After Ver takes out her sword as ordered, I grip my gun with both hands, readying myself for an indoor firefight.

116091036.content: Seeing me get into a tactical position gives Ver a start. Sword in hand, she rushes ahead of me to the door and gets in front of me—

116091037.content: What unfolds before us next is a scene neither of us would have dared believe if we hadn't seen it with our own eyes.

116091039.content: The meeting room is in utter disarray and the walls are riddled with cracks and craters.

116091040.content: A length of exposed wire dangles from the fractured ceiling with a swaying lamp hanging from the end of it. The only active light source in the room, it's blindingly bright in the darkness.

116091041.content: Thor, her heavy hammer resting over her shoulder, doesn't acknowledge Ver. She just stands under the light, her head lowered, apparently fixated on something in the shadows before her.

116091043.content: A weakened murmur muffled by blood and froth comes from Thor's direction—it's a voice Ver and I are all too familiar with.

116091045.content: The swaying light sweeps through the shadows by the podium, illuminating a slumped figure on the floor.

116091046.content: Her clothes are tattered and disheveled, her cheek is covered in blood, and her grip on the lance in her hand is faltering. She looks badly wounded.

116091049.content: Too bewildered to hear Shu's words, Ver puts away her sword and rushes over to Shu's side.

116091050.content: You're hurt, bad! Hang in there, I'm calling the Medical Department!

116091051.content: I take in the gruesome signs of the battle that took place in this room. Never in my wildest dreams would I have imagined such a scene materializing in Aether Gazer.

116091052.content: Before us is a room laid to waste, behind us is a dead-silent corridor. Standing at the junction dividing these two scenes, I feel more dazed than terrified.

116091054.content: I look over at Thor. Then it hits me—Thor, completely uncharacteristically, hasn't reacted at all since we came into the room. It's only when I shout out her name that she turns her head to look at me—

116091055.content: There in her eyes, I can clearly see the pulsating of a strange, menacing light.

116091056.content: The moment our eyes meet, an immense pressure surges up that seems to clench tightly around my heart. As I reflexively raise my gun and aim it at Thor, I see the hand around the handle of her hammer stir...

116091058.content: At last coughing up the congealed blood lodged in her throat, Shu strains to squeeze out this single syllable.

116091061.content: Using up the last of her strength, Shu shoves Ver out of the way, then thrusts her lance at Thor's chest.

116091062.content: But with a weighty whoosh, Thor effortlessly sends the lance flying with her hammer. Shu, knocked into the podium by the tremendous force, expels a mouthful of blood.

116091064.content: Thor doesn't say a word, but searing lightning crackles about her hammer. Ver has just drawn her sword, but before she can react, she's smashed into the wall.

116091066.content: Thor again faces Shu, raising her hammer. Cold sweat drips from my forehead as I try as hard as I can to control my breathing. Without hesitating, I unload a full magazine of bullets at Thor.

116091067.content: This is the first time I've ever pulled my trigger at a Modifier, but... are you even still our comrade anymore, Thor?

116091068.content: Pale lightning immediately fans out and envelops Thor, blocking the bullets and grinding them into tiny shards of iron in a burst of flying sparks.

116091069.content: She stops, then her head turns mechanically toward me. Her eyes, utterly absent of emotion, lock onto me once again.

116091072.content: An intense, suffocating sensation comes over me again. Thor's icy gaze, regarding me like prey with nowhere left to run to, tears at my self-perceived tenacity like it's a flimsy sheet of paper...

116091073.content: My breathing grows rapid and my hands feel heavy like lead. The only conclusion I can draw at this moment is... we can't stay here.

116091074.content: Forget about Thor, we have to get Shu out of here!

116091075.content: I bellow at Ver while continuing to fire at Thor. Out of the corner of my eye, I see the fallen Shu's lance stir slightly.

116091076.content: From behind Thor, Shu strains to open her eyes, then shakes her head at us. She doesn't have the strength to speak, but I know what she wants to say...

116091078.content: A thunderbolt cracks in the room, and in the blink of an eye, the jet-black hammer head advances over thirty feet and is now rapidly expanding before my eyes.

116091079.content: I'm caught completely off guard—I know there's no evading this attack. All I see is Ver's back as she appears in front of me, then a tremendous force sends us both hurtling into the corridor.

116091080.content: I roll across the floor several times before coming to a stop. Gritting my teeth to shake off the dizziness, I force myself up. Thor, however, is not in pursuit.

116091082.content: Just as I raise my head, a gust of wind to the face forces my eyes to squint. In my narrowed vision, I make out Ver standing beside me, sword in hand. Then I see the room's door rapidly closing from the wind's pressure.

116091083.content: The final thing I see through the door before it shuts is a sea of lightning and blooming sparks, a lance being knocked away a second time, and Shu's right hand dropping inertly under the dim light...

116091086.content: The sound of heavy hammering beats rhythmically from behind the door, interspersed with the sounds of things being broken and shattered. Ver walks to the door in a stupor, her body and voice beginning to tremble uncontrollably.

116091087.content: Ignoring the pain in my body, I stand up, take her by the hand, then make a run for the other end of the corridor with everything I've got.

116091088.content: Administrator... We have to save Miss Shu!

116091089.content: We need helpers. We can't take on Thor by ourselves!

116091090.content:
The sound of a wall collapsing behind me rocks my already turbulent breathing rhythm.

I whip my head around, and see a girl with her hammer already raised high, like a blood moon halfway up into the night sky.

116101002.content: The sound of the heavy hammer being dragged resounds intermittently throughout the medical center corridor.

116101003.content: Ver and I try our best to keep our heartbeats and footfalls down as we proceed in the opposite direction of the screeching sounds, endeavoring to make our way to the exit to the other floors.

116101004.content: But the noises coming from Thor eat at our bones like gangrene. It's as if she could appear behind us at any moment.

116101005.content: Are we gonna keep running, Admin...?

116101006.content: We only have one chance to leave this floor. If we want to find the others, we have to take it.

116101007.content: (That said, why haven't these loud noises drawn anyone else's attention? What the hell is happening...)

116101008.content: I'll distract her. You go find the others.

116101009.content: It won't be that easy. Besides, how far can I get without you, Ver?

116101010.content: Thor's too powerful... and I don't want to see you face her on your own. For now, we have to avoid any direct confrontation.

116101013.content: With a great boom, the wall next to me is blasted apart. Ver quickly pulls me out of the way of the flying debris.

116101014.content: I can faintly make out the silhouette of Thor in the rising dust, as well as two points of flickering red light.

116101015.content: What traitors...? Thor! What the hell are you talking about?!

116101016.content: Shut up. You're getting what you deserve for colluding with the Visbanes.

116101017.content: To think Aether Gazer's fallen this low...

116101018.content: Suddenly, Thor's outline vanishes from the dust. Ver yanks me away, nearly dislocating my shoulder with the sudden acceleration, and once again we're propelled backward by a violent shock wave.

116101019.content: When I return to my senses, Thor's hammer has turned the ground where I once stood into a sunken crater with spiderweb-like cracks branching out towards my and Ver's feet.

116101021.content: I don't see any point reasoning with her...

116101022.content: I pull Ver with me as I make a frantic dash away from Thor. At the same time, I draw my gun and fire at Thor's head, hoping to stall her for even a second.

116101024.content: I understand at once what Ver means and fire my last remaining bullet into the circuit breaker on the wall.

116101025.content: The corridor is instantly plunged into darkness.

116101026.content: Running mechanically in the oppressive silence, Ver and I can only sense each other in the darkness. Somehow, not hearing the sound of Thor's pursuit is even more unsettling.

116101027.content: Where did Thor go...? Ver, we need to hide!

116101029.content: Ver touches the handle of a nearby door and pushes it down—it's unlocked.

116101030.content: We slip into the room and close the door behind us. All we hear in the lightless room is each other's breathing and heartbeats.

116101031.content: Remembering the floor plan in my mind and mapping out the direction and distance of our movements, I frown as something occurs to me.

116101032.content: I think we're in Zenkibo's ward... Why are all the lights off?

116101034.content: Administrator, I think I see something by the bed...

116101035.content: I turn on the small flashlight I have on me, letting a hazy stream of light pour into the room.

116101036.content: We're definitely in an inpatient ward, and Zenkibo's name card is next to the bed. The bed, however, is empty, and the covers and sheets have been tossed around and lie crumpled on top of it.

116101037.content: But our minds are no longer on Zenkibo's whereabouts.

116101039.content: Sitting stiffly at the edge of the bed like a stone statue, Apollo's head is hung low, his eyes are unfocused, and all the color is gone from his face.

116101040.content: And now I know where that strange scent was coming from—

116101042.content: The front of his shirt is soaked with a large crimson blotch. Still wet, the liquid drips down the belt around his waist to form a thin, winding stream of red extending toward a corner of the room.

116101043.content: The sight intensifies the effect of the scent. Forcing down the rising discomfort in my throat, I crouch down to check Apollo's life signs.

116101045.content: I shake my head at Ver.

116101046.content: Bullets have torn through his clothing in several places, one of which pierced straight through his heart, taking his life with it.

116101047.content: He was shot, which means Thor didn't do this... He isn't carrying a weapon, so this must have been a surprise attack.

116101048.content: I look back at the vacant hospital bed. Guessing that the situation might be even worse than I'd thought, my head starts to spin.

116101049.content: Let's go. It's not safe here either—

116101050.content: I turn off my flashlight. Just as I'm about to take Ver with me out of the room, the four corners of the door suddenly light up with radiant electricity.

116101051.content: The hinges all rupture at once, and the door sweeps a meter forward into the room with a shrill scraping sound before tilting backward and thudding to the floor.

116101053.content: Several lightning arcs pierce the ground by Thor's feet. All the lighting devices in the ward set to work, illuminating the room inside and out.

116101054.content: Oh? Seems you've had a dispute.

116101055.content: Thor's eyes sweep over the lifeless Apollo. Her hammer in hand, she enters the ward.

116101056.content: But no worries, you'll be joining him in no time.

116101057.content: Don't even think about it! You'll not touch the Administrator!

116101058.content: Ver takes out her sword and shield to meet Thor. With nowhere left to run behind us, determination gathers in her eyes again.

116101059.content: If we want to escape, Thor must be defeated, or at least beaten back...

116101060.content: But determination can't make up for the chasmic difference in strength. As the power gathering in the hammer climbs steadily, Thor shoots a glance at the incoming Ver, then airily swings her handle.

116101061.content: Trailing milky plasma, the hammer crashes into Ver's shield with unstoppable force. The shield, unable to sustain the impact, begins to crumble bit by bit while blood spills from the corners of Ver's mouth.

116101062.content: Disappointing. You ganged up with Visbanes for this?

116101063.content: What... the heck are you talking about?!

116101064.content: In a sudden switch from a press to a rapid lift, Thor flings Ver into the air with her hammer. She then looks back at me as I raise my gun.

116101065.content: My first impression of you wasn't too bad, actually. But you're a traitor, and that puts you on my list.

116101066.content: She trains the head of her hammer on me. There's nowhere else for me to run.

116101068.content: Ver stands up, supporting herself against the wall, then resumes a combat stance.

116101069.content: Thor tilts her head to look at her, then vanishes on the spot.

116101072.content: Like a ghostly apparition, the hammer's head suddenly appears embedded in the wall behind Ver—it missed.

116101073.content: Ver, seemingly anticipating this move from Thor, bent her knees and crouched down to avoid the hammer. She immediately draws her sword before Thor can retrieve it—

116101074.content: But her blade's target isn't Thor—it's the wall Thor shattered.

116101076.content: The wall, now veined with cracks, breaks apart as Ver slashes at it with all her might, revealing an opening large enough for a person to pass through.

116101077.content: What, another round of chasing game?

116101078.content: Thor retrieves her hammer. Without a second's hesitation, Verthandi lunges at her, taking the fight to a distance more favorable to her sword.

116101079.content: Go find Odin, she'll know what to do!

116101080.content: The sound of a weapon slicing through the air whips past my ear. The strained grunt Ver makes as she holds back the attack makes my blood run cold.

116101082.content: I'll be fine! Trust me! I'll hold her off until you get back!

116101083.content: The scene before me rapidly distorts before my eyes, like a photo warping as it's crumpled.

116101084.content: The blood in the room is burned into my mind's eye—first Apollo's, and now, gradually, Ver's too...

116101086.content: Like heck I will, you hot-headed jinx!!

116101087.content: I pull myself through the opening in the wall to the corridor on the other side on numb limbs.

116101088.content: Unable to feel my legs, I feel like the hallway is moving away from me. As I run deliriously toward the elevator, the sound of weapons colliding behind me grows further and further away...

116101089.content: Right... Odin—I just need to find Odin. She'll know how to stop Thor!

116111001.content: There don't seem to be any signs that Thor is in pursuit.

116111002.content: I take out my communicator from my bag and enter the number for Odin's office. With one disaster after another befalling us up until now, this is the first chance I've gotten to try and contact anyone else.

116111004.content: The more you want something, the more unattainable it becomes. The sound of my heavy footsteps only makes the wait seem longer, until finally all I receive in reply is a busy signal.

116111005.content: It's not just Odin—no one in HQ is picking up.

116111006.content: I'll just have to go to Odin's office. It's this way...

116111007.content: The thought of Ver still waiting for me back there seems to tear open a huge hole in my heart. I shake my head, trying as hard as I can to rein in my thoughts.

116111008.content: I have to hurry. I need to run faster, faster—

116111010.content: Of course I trip and fall now of all times. I seem to feel a dampness on my outer right thigh. I reach out to touch it, and my palm is coated in a sticky blood red.

116111011.content: I must have cut myself on something sharp when I escaped from the inpatient ward, but it's only now that I'm noticing any pain from it.

116111013.content: Calling on all my willpower, I force myself up to my feet. I scan my surroundings, then realize that I'd fallen right in front of the treatment room door.

116111015.content: Shu's limply falling hand, the bullet holes in Apollo's chest... These images suddenly flash through my mind.

116111016.content: No, it's too dangerous to leave her here by herself.

116111017.content: I drag myself to the door. Just as I reach out my hand to open it, someone opens it from the other side.

116111019.content: Skuld cautiously pokes her head halfway out from behind the door. Shocked to see that it's me, she immediately opens the door, then looks down at the blood on both the floor and my hand.

116111021.content: No time to explain. You can't stay here, come with me.

116111023.content: Anxious to resume my search for Odin, I pull Skuld by the hand, but a sharp pain in my right leg makes it buckle. Skuld catches me and props me up as my body involuntarily lurches downward.

116111024.content: You won't be able to walk like this... Here, let me help you.

116111025.content: She slings my arm over her shoulder, supporting my enervated body as we walk forward.

116111026.content: I'm sorry. I was supposed to be saving you, but now you're taking care of me instead.

116111027.content: There's nothing to apologize for, Tantan. Are we going this way?

116111028.content: Yeah, we need to find Odin—she was with me when we found you that day. She's the only one who can help us now.

116111029.content: I want Skuld to understand how dire our situation is, but I can't actually even say what's happened...

116111030.content: Okay. Whatever you want, Tantan, I'll help you in any way I can.

116111031.content: With Skuld supporting me, we walk down the passageway, not encountering Thor or anyone else along the way. Skuld doesn't say a word the entire time, and the bright lights only accentuate the oppressive silence.

116111033.content: The scale of the main entrance alone speaks to the office's imposing grandeur. Odin's nameplate hangs beside the door.

116111034.content: Just seeing her name makes me feel slightly more at ease. Just the presence of Odin, "the strongest Modifier," makes me feel like there's no situation that can't be resolved.

116111036.content: Disregarding our difference in status, I call out for her through her office door.

116111037.content:
But no one answers.
Yet again...

116111038.content: It's not locked. Should we go in...?

116111039.content: I don't suppose we have a choice.

116111040.content:
I'm not authorized to open Odin's office door, but there's no time to mull it over.
I draw my gun and fire off several rounds at the lock.

116111041.content: The door opens, and a faint dripping sound emanates from the other side.

116111042.content: The lights from the corridor cast our shadows into the office, where we see another figure sitting at the other end.

116111043.content: The clear moonlight shining into the room through the floor-to-ceiling windows allays the intrusion by the night's darkness.

116111045.content: I rush over to Odin, but my feet slowly come to a stop as I process the unfathomable scene before me.

116111047.content: I can't focus my eyes on anything, and I don't know whether to keep approaching or turn and run...

116111048.content: The bladed tip of a gun has pierced through her chest and out through the other side of the chair. Blood trickles down the groove along the side of the blade, then plummets to the floor drop after drop, like a reaper's ticking timepiece.

116111050.content: Skuld's shaky voice makes my ears ring.

116111051.content: Whether I'm willing to admit it or not, the person in the chair is Odin, the Modifier leader Ver and I pinned all our hopes on—

116111056.content: At this point, is there anyone left who can save us?

116111057.content: I shake my head in disbelief. It's like my very faith is being mercilessly ridiculed by this bleak night, like it will all come crumbling down with the lightest push.

116111058.content: Just who... are we up against?

116111059.content: My nerves numb, and my biological instincts take over, mechanically driving my muscles. By the time I come back around, I'm already far from this picture of despair.

116111060.content: Heavy footfalls sound from the distance. My will to resist overwhelmed by a profound sense of helplessness, I pull Skuld behind me before drawing my gun as a sort of unconscious reflex.

116111061.content: But as the sound of the footsteps grows nearer and clearer, something is familiar about them.

116111063.content: In the light appears a girl with a long sword in hand. Looking at her, I'm so overcome with surprise and joy at this unlikely rescue that it makes my head spin.

116121003.content: Hmm... It has a rich, balanced aroma and a striking flavor. Certainly some good tea.

116121004.content: The folks over at the Quad asked me to take care of something and sent me some tea leaves to try to get on my good side, saying they're the best in Xu Heng. Naturally, I brewed you the first cup.

116121005.content: Thank you. How has that task been going?

116121006.content: A little tricky, but I've made progress. Once everything is sorted out here, I'll see myself to Xu Heng one last time.

116121007.content: That aside, how's your own investigation...?

116121008.content: Mm... the flavor really is superb.

116121010.content: Heh, none... not even a single clue.

116121011.content: Then why stay in Xu Heng? Shouldn't you look elsewhere?

116121012.content: I spent a long time combing each Sephirah Zone. Each time I'd always find something, even if I didn't get as close as I did in Omorfies. Xu Heng is the first place that's left me completely empty-handed.

116121013.content: Is someone trying to keep something hidden?

116121014.content: Most likely. But the more they wipe away any trace of it, the more certain I am to find what I'm looking for there.

116121015.content: I've searched for this long already, and a little longer won't hurt. If they want to test my patience, I'll play along.

116121016.content: Do be careful. You can leave everything here to me.

116121017.content: Just one thing: Why have you asked the Medical Department to keep the results of that girl's examination confidential?

116121018.content: Publicizing it wouldn't make a difference, would it? But it would add to the confusion. Besides, I'm not keeping it a secret from everyone. Let's see what Heimdall and the others would say in their findings first.

116121019.content: ...So it's another plan you intend to keep me in the dark about?

116121020.content: It would just pain me to see you burdened with more chores. I can deal with this little matter myself.

116121021.content: That reminds me, don't you have a meeting with the kids coming up? We can't have their leader showing up late.

116121023.content: Shu shakes her head, then turns and leaves the office.

116121024.content: After walking through the passageway for a little while, she hears a scream coming from up ahead—

116121029.content: Rushing to the treatment room, Shu pushes open the door and enters it—only to see Skuld sitting by the bed, with nothing in the room looking amiss.

116121030.content: Were you calling for help just now?

116121031.content: Skuld lowers her head, her bangs drooping over her eyes.

116121034.content: Skuld closes her eyes and clenches her fists determinedly. When her eyes open again, a pale gold cross with a ring around it is shining in her left eye.

116121035.content: She raises her head and looks straight into Shu's eyes with an expressionless face.

116121037.content: The instant their eyes meet, Shu abruptly stops talking and mechanically releases her grip on her lance.

116121038.content: Skuld's posture relaxes. She reaches out and removes Shu's glasses. Then, focused on the crests in Shu's eyes identical to the ones in her own, she slowly begins to speak—

116121041.content: A number of strange things have been happening lately, so I've been forced to stay in the office a few hours longer.

116121042.content: After finally wrapping up the tasks at hand, I let out a yawn as I exit the office. Then, I notice something strange about my surroundings.

116121043.content: Is something wrong with the power supply? Those lights are out...

116121045.content: They're hard to make out in this lighting, but I see a figure stumbling towards me.

116121048.content: Once we're close enough to identify each other, both of us seem surprised to encounter the other here.

116121049.content: What are you doing here? And... why do you seem so flustered?

116121051.content: Skuld turns around to look at the deserted corridor. She quickly grabs my hand and runs ahead, pulling me with her.

116121053.content: Tentatively following Skuld's lead, I take out my phone to look at the time.

116121054.content: It's already pretty late, why don't we go out and do something tomorrow...? I'll walk you back to your room.

116121055.content: Skuld doesn't respond, she just keeps running forward with me in tow.

116121056.content: Hang on... Can't you at least tell me what's going on?

116121057.content: No. If we stop now, we'll be caught...

116121059.content: I'm not sure I understand... We're in the Aether Gazer building, and I haven't heard the intruder alarm or received any operational communication.

116121060.content: Before I know it, Skuld and I are almost at the stairwell. In the distance, I make out another familiar figure walking over from the hallway.

116121061.content: Shu? Perfect timing. Skuld, whatever's going on, you can just tell Shu...

116121063.content: Just as I'm about to greet Shu, Skuld mutters something to herself and stops. Her face goes white as a sheet, then she turns and yanks me in the other direction.

116121065.content: This bizarre scene brings some unthinkable speculations to mind. Seeking confirmation, I turn to look back at Shu.

116121066.content: Without warning, Skuld wraps her arms around me. With all the force she can muster, she topples me over and sends us both careening into a room adjoining the corridor.

116121068.content: I reflexively protected Skuld's head with my arms, but seemed to collide with something hard in the process that leaves my left arm numb and limp.

116121070.content: I let go of Skuld. Before I can say anything else, a flash of silver bisects my vision—

116121071.content: A lance pierces the corridor floor outside the door at an angle. An air-piercing whistling in the lance's wake swirls round and round outwards, blasting my chest with a shockwave that knocks me back to the ground.

116121074.content: The room is pitch-black. Skuld pulls me up and, seemingly familiar with the layout, leads me through a small door on the other side of the room to escape into the hallway.

116121075.content: Out of the corner of my eye, I see Shu standing by her lance, regarding us with a complicated expression.

116121076.content: Wait a minute, Skuld... Shu can't be doing this for no reason. There must be some kind of misunderstanding.

116121077.content: Shu, it's me, now if you would...

116121078.content: Are you also affected by her?

116121079.content: Affected? Hold on, I don't know what's going on here. Let's just—

116121083.content: Then it looks like I have no other choice.

116121084.content: I'm beyond suspecting—the results of Odin's investigation are crystal-clear, and the evidence is overwhelming...

116121085.content: ...There's nothing I can do to save you, Administrator, but the least I can do is put an end to your mistake.

116121086.content: I believe that the "real Administrator" would do the same thing.

116121087.content: The real me? What are you saying? I am the...

116121089.content: I watch as Shu pulls her lance from the floor. Skuld slams the door shut, then grabs me and continues running down the corridor.

116121090.content: I wrestle with the cryptic things Shu said in my mind. But this sudden turn of events has completely robbed me of the ability to think.

116121091.content: I was interacting and working with Shu as usual just a few hours ago, but now she's aiming her Access Key at me with no intention of holding back...

116121092.content: Something's off... This isn't like Shu at all.

116121093.content: Our constant route changes might be delaying Shu's next attack. But with the insurmountable power gap between Modifiers and ordinary humans, this game of hide-and-seek can only go on for so long.

116121095.content: I vaguely hear Skuld say a couple words, but I just don't have the mental bandwidth to try and interpret their meaning right now.

116121096.content: I fish out my communicator and enter a number I've never dialed before—Odin's.

116121097.content: If anyone will be able to save us now, it's her.

116121098.content: The thudding of our feet as we run only amplifies the torment wrought by each second no one answers. Meanwhile, the intense physical exertion is steadily slowing us down...

116121099.content: When I hear Shu's footsteps rapidly approaching from behind us, I know I can't keep waiting to hear Odin's voice.

116121102.content: Somehow, we end up back where we first encountered Shu—the only difference now is that Shu is behind us and no one is blocking the way to the stairs.

116121103.content: The stairs... Right, there's a landing pad past this flight of stairs...

116121104.content: I'm working out our escape route under my breath when I suddenly feel the air begin to converge into a wind stream blowing past us. Our pace immediately drops again as we walk against the wind.

116121106.content: Recalling a move Shu used before in training, I immediately push Skuld away, and the two of us fall to either side of the corridor.

116121107.content: Just when I reach out my hand, the wind pressure coming at us disappears. In its place, a tornado made of countless wind blades comes barreling toward us as Shu thrusts her lance forward.

116121108.content: I watch as one solid-looking wind blade after another passes between Skuld and me. The incoming tornado makes contact with my arm, instantly splitting open my arm from the skin down to the bone.

116121110.content: The whipping winds dissipate at the end of the corridor, and Shu's footfalls gradually grow louder behind us.

116121111.content: Skuld, completely ignoring our pursuer, runs back to my side. She frantically tears a strip of fabric from her clothing and wraps it around my arm in an attempt to stop the bleeding.

116121112.content: But blood continues to spurt from the wound, and the pain is so intense that I almost pass out... I clench my teeth to keep my consciousness from slipping away, at least until Skuld is safe...

116121113.content: We can't stop here. We have to go, now!

116121114.content: Haphazardly covering the wound in my right arm, I run into the stairwell with Skuld and push open the iron door in the corner.

116132001.content: Clouds drift across the sky, brushing over the moon above the expansive tarmac. The night breeze rushing against our faces dispels some of the panic of the chase.

116132002.content: That airship over there... Go get in.

116132003.content: I hobble over to the console at the end of the passageway and push Skuld toward the landing pad. As I'd anticipated, there's still a small aircraft parked there.

116132005.content: You go first. I'll try and start it up.

116132006.content: I press the button on the control panel, then clumsily bring my untrained left hand over to the virtual keyboard...

116132007.content: However, the screen does not light up as expected.

116132009.content: I press the "Start" button again, and still, the screen remains dark.

116132010.content: Why...? Is it the power supply system...?

116132011.content: As if by lightning, I'm struck by the realization of what the problem is... I should have noticed what was wrong the moment I stepped out of the office.

116132012.content: The iron door leading from the building to the landing pad should have also been controlled by an electromagnetic lock...

116132013.content: Remorse and despair assail my consciousness. Even when the friction from the edge of the button slices my fingertip, I refuse to stop. It's as if I can't feel pain anymore.

116132015.content: A pair of delicate hands clasp my arm. Skuld positions herself in front of me, ready to confront the gradually approaching figure in my stead.

116132017.content: Still standing against me? How long do you think you'll last without someone else fighting for you?

116132019.content: A short distance away, I hear the sound of the iron door closing. A frenzied wind rises under the night sky.

116132020.content: The girl before me opens her arms and, with eyes burning with rage, fearlessly stares down this far more powerful attacker.

116132021.content: For a split second, her figure suddenly staggers, splits, then overlaps. As I'm overcome with an inexplicable feeling of déjà vu, nothing I'm seeing before me seems real.

116132023.content: Almost without thinking, I pull her by the arm and shield her behind me. But none of it matters.

116132024.content: The next moment, the wind and lance pierce through our bodies.

116141001.content: Oh, Zenki. How could something like this have happened to you...?

116141002.content: If only I'd been there with you. My light would have dazzled the enemy blind...

116141003.content: Sitting beside the hospital bed and looking at the unconscious Zenkibo, Apollo slowly retracts his usual self-obsessed smile.

116141004.content: (Sigh)... It's even lonelier when my joke has no audience...

116141005.content: Someone pounds twice on the door from outside. Even as Apollo is turning to look, the visitor has already let themselves in.

116141007.content: I knew it was you from those spirited knocks, Captain. Are you here to see Zenki as well?

116141008.content: Shu's called everyone to a meeting. I just dropped by to check in on my way over. Are you coming or not?

116141009.content: Our wounded Zenki will definitely have nightmares if the sun isn't here to shine on her. I'll be staying here with her tonight, I've already run it by Shu.

116141010.content: Alright... You and Zenkibo are both reliable, trustworthy teammates. I hope she gets better soon.

116141013.content: No, nothing. That reminds me, it's been a while since the last time you and I saw each other. Since the meeting isn't starting for a while, why don't you stay here and chat with me for a little bit?

116141014.content: As long as it's not about your recent "glorious feats." Keep me clear of those stories.

116141015.content: Hahaha... Even I know a catch up is not the occasion to talk about myself.

116141016.content: Do you still remember the last mission, the one we did together before you went to Xu Heng, Captain?

116141017.content: Yeah... things went pretty out of hand, from what I remember!

116141018.content: Right. At the time, we said we would strike on the secret signal. But one of us forgot it, another got it wrong, and the other didn't wait for it at all.

116141019.content: Just a few little hiccups. I handled everything in the end, didn't I?

116141020.content: Speaking of which, do you remember what the secret signal was, Captain?

116141021.content: Why would I? That was ages ago...

116141024.content: Well, looks like your memory's better than you thought, Captain.

116141025.content: That's only because your secret signals are too lame to forget. Alright, I'd better get going to the meeting.

116141027.content: Apollo waves goodbye to Thor. Seeming not to notice, Thor hurriedly goes to leave the ward. But before she closes the door, she casts an impenetrable look back at Apollo.

116141028.content: Right, since you've decided to stay here and watch over Zenkibo, make sure you stay put today.

116141029.content: Apollo looks quizzically toward the door. He pauses to give this some thought, but remains just as confused.

116141030.content: Did the captain seem a little strange today?

116141031.content: "Stay put," isn't that just the same as saying, "Something's going to happen out there?"

116141032.content: Just then, there's another sharp knock on the door.

116141033.content: Hm? She's back again? No, wait...

116141034.content: There was clearly far less force behind this knock than Thor's.

116141035.content: Come in... Oh, well, aren't you just the picture of a morning glory at dawn, miss? I heard that the Administrator brought back a damsel in distress—that was you, I presume?

116141036.content: S-Sorry to intrude, but please listen to me—

116141038.content: Seeing the pink-haired girl rush to his side, Apollo promptly goes to fetch a stool for her.

116141039.content: But the moment he turns back to look at her, he notices that the color of her left eye seems to have changed.

116141040.content: Her eye radiates a resplendent gold, like flames or starlight.

116141042.content: After seeing Skuld out, Apollo tucks Zenkibo in under the blanket, draws the curtains, and turns out the lights. Then, with a flourish of his left arm, he unfurls the Glare...

116141043.content: Footsteps come to a stop outside of the ward. The hallway lights cast the silhouette of a hammer against the glass on the door.

116141044.content: The doors to the room are pushed open. In the dark room, a cluster of gleaming golden arrows of light is aimed at the figure outside the door.

116141045.content: Captain... I'm afraid I must ask you to stop there.

116141046.content: Oh? Is this how you greet your captain?

116141047.content: I repeat, stop where you are. Come no further.

116141048.content: Do you really think you can stop me with just a few pointy sticks?

116141049.content: Of course not... I know I'm no match for you, Captain. That's why I made a few preparations for our little talk.

116141050.content: Thor steps forward, sneering. Then, the Glare's bow and arrows light up at once, and dozens of arrows gather around Thor.

116141052.content: Just a few words of advice that confirmed the suspicions I already had, Captain.

116141053.content: I might have a healthy helping of self-regard, but after all the messes you've gotten us out of, not even I'd believe that Zenki and I are "reliable, trustworthy teammates."

116141054.content: It's been a while, maybe I'm just feeling a little sentimental.

116141055.content: Oh? Then what about that secret signal?

116141056.content: Did I get it wrong? That was such a long time ago. I muddled things up, that's it.

116141057.content: It's not a matter of misremembering. Now I'm certain that you're not yourself, Captain.

116141058.content: Our captain always charges straight ahead and wipes out our enemies. We've never used any secret signals!

116141059.content: Thor's eyes fly open when Apollo says this. But her expression quickly changes from shock to laughter.

116141060.content: I'm not myself... Heh... Hehehe... Ahahaha—!

116141061.content: As Thor snickers, lightning gathers around her hammer. Her eyes—overlayed with a ghostly crimson light—are filled with endless rage and hatred. One look is enough to make Apollo's hand tremble on his taut bowstring.

116141063.content: I thought you were still on our side, Apollo. I didn't expect... that you'd force my hand like this!

116141064.content: Thor ignores the Solar Arrows firing at her, even as their Divine Power pierces her skin. With enough power to shake the heavens, she swings her hammer at Apollo.

116141065.content: Ugh. I knew I won't be able to pull off an ambush like this in one blow. But no matter—I still have the advantage!

116142001.content: Thor lifts her lightning-exuding Access Key high above her head. But a moment later, the current disperses from her hammer, like a firework fizzling out in the night sky.

116142003.content: There might be nothing glorious about an ambush, but it was all I could come up with to face an opponent like you, Captain.

116142004.content: And now, if you'd be so kind as to come with me—

116142005.content: Apollo raises his bow at Thor, but doesn't immediately fire. And just then—

116142007.content: Zenkibo suddenly cries out from behind him.

116142009.content: All his attention raptly directed at Thor, Apollo doesn't turn his head. But his joy at his companion's return to consciousness is apparent in his voice.

116142010.content: Hah... I wish I could have a more splendid welcome-back party ready for you, but I have something to settle with the captain first.

116142011.content: Huh? Pineapple, what're you doing here? You never shut up, do you... And where's the captain you're talking about?

116142012.content: Zenki, if you're going to crack jokes, at least read the room first...

116142014.content: A gun fires, and Apollo wobbles unsteadily. He looks at the blood splotch blooming from his shoulder and smiles ruefully.

116142015.content: I see your aim hasn't recovered... It's fine, just don't miss the next one.

116142017.content: The force boring through his abdomen brings Apollo to his knees. His control over them now lost, the Solar Arrows filling the room dissipate as well.

116142018.content: This VR game is super realistic. So realistic that I... feel kinda guilty?

116142019.content: Hmph, whatever! I've had it up to here with you, Pineapple. That should make us even!

116142020.content: Zenkibo jumps down from the bed and walks past Thor, making her way toward the door. But it's as if Thor doesn't even see her.

116142021.content: Heh, the situation's even worse than I thought...

116142022.content: Kneeling on one knee, Apollo draws his bowstring with trembling hands and aims at Thor again. The arrow's light gradually brightens against the string—

116142023.content: But it's soon outshined by an even more powerful lightning bolt.

116142024.content: The brilliant golden light is quietly snuffed out as the sound of footsteps gradually recedes into the distance.

116151001.content: Outside a restaurant in District 4, two researchers are investigating a quiet street with devices in their hands.

116151002.content: A cold wind blows. It's been four hours since they started this operation. The smaller of the two girls is wearing an expression that makes no attempt to hide her displeasure.

116151003.content: Phase six of zonal information collection complete. Data parsing: 86% complete. Commencing Phase seven now.

116151004.content: We just completed Phase seven, Ookuninushi... The datum is recorded in real-time, so do pay it a little attention.

116151005.content: Oh... Correction, we just completed Phase seven.

116151007.content: I didn't think I'd go out with you today, Heimdall.

116151008.content: Well, we're on this job together for the time being, so I'd appreciate it if you kept your grievances to yourself.

116151009.content: That's not what I meant. My emphasis was on "out."

116151010.content: I drew an upright "Five of Swords" today. I had a hunch that something might happen and really wanted to stay home...

116151011.content: Is that so? Esoteric knowledge isn't my area of expertise. What does the Five of Swords represent?

116151013.content: But we haven't argued or anything.

116151014.content: I didn't say that we did...

116151015.content: The two walk over to an inconspicuous alleyway.

116151016.content: Back here again. Where Zenkibo and Poseidon were attacked...

116151018.content: Why do you always design your data collection AGI Mechas to look like this?

116151019.content: I didn't, I just equipped BunBun-0 with a data collection module.

116151020.content: BunBun-0 conducts a survey of the area, then hops back into Ookuninushi's hand.

116151021.content: Hmm... Mm-hm... Okay, I pretty much got it.

116151022.content: Phase eight is now complete. No Bane Energy was detected, so we can rule out a Visbane attack.

116151023.content: Agreed. Even a Cognizant Visbane would leave some trace behind.

116151024.content: All I'm picking up from the site is Divine Grace. Based on the residual quantity adjusted for time decay, we can extrapolate that Poseidon, Zenkibo, and a third Modifier were present.

116151025.content: After all these days of investigating, you're telling me this was the work of another Modifier...?

116151026.content: Are there any records of something like this in Mimir's files?

116151027.content: There have been clashes between Modifiers that haven't fully awakened. Targeted assaults like such, however, do not fall under the category.

116151028.content: All three of the attacks followed the same MO: Direct, decisive attacks on vital points followed by the theft of Access Keys.

116151029.content: Not only is the attacker incredibly strong, they're also deeply knowledgeable about Modifiers and know how important their Access Keys are to them.

116151030.content: But the Divine Power Detector should have sensed someone when they awakened, especially when they have been this active...

116151031.content: Three violent crimes is pretty "active," huh.
