116151032.content: The attacker can control Divine Grace, and the Divine Power Detector is a device that scans for Modifiers. These two facts, though logically inconsistent, perhaps unsurprisingly constitute a major breakthrough in our investigation.

116151034.content: Think about the Spealght case. If AGI Mechas can house Bane Energy, then why not another form of energy? It's possible that we simply don't understand this technology's full potential yet.

116151035.content: Speaking of which, remember that information Odin wanted us to keep hush-hush for now? About that Modifier they brought back a couple of days ago...

116151038.content: BunBun-0 leaps out from Ookuninushi's arms and spins around on the ground.

116151039.content: It looks scared, is something coming this way—

116151042.content: The sudden impact knocks BunBun-0 into the distance.

116151045.content: The attacker moves with strength and agility. In the blink of an eye, they appear before Heimdall and attempt to take her Access Key.

116151046.content: Going for the Circles of Reason first? This must be...

116151048.content: The Access Key emits a glow that instantly blankets the entire alley, briefly slowing down the attacker.

116151051.content: BunBun-3 charges at the attacker in the center of the glowing light. But then, the Circles of Reason's light suddenly shifts to Ookuninushi on the other side.

116151053.content: Heimdall doesn't respond. The high-energy rays converge and point directly at Ookuninushi in a deadly attack that will pierce through Ookuninushi at any moment—

116151055.content: A massive figure appears in front of Ookuninushi, shielding her.

116151056.content: That was a close one... Nice work, BunBun-3!

116151057.content: BunBun-3 blocks the lasers, but at the cost of its left arm. Seizing this window, Ookuninushi launches BunBun-1 at the attacker opposite her.

116151058.content: As if following the attacker's orders, Circles of Reason raises a protective force field just before BunBun strikes it at full throttle. The blow is so powerful that even the attacker in the shadows isn't left completely unscathed.

116151059.content: They frantically bolt out from the forcefield, drop the Circles of Reason, then immediately retreat into the shadows.

116151061.content: Ookuninushi turns around to discover that Heimdall is aiming a gun at her.

116151062.content: Heimdall, whaddya think you're doing?! And what was that back there...

116151063.content: BunBun-3 can't move anymore. If Heimdall really fires, I'll...

116151064.content: Heimdall's expression is cold as steel, as if she doesn't recognize Ookuninushi at all. But then she frowns and lowers the gun.

116151065.content: Ookuninushi, did you leak Aether Gazer's internal data?

116151066.content: Of course not. Why the heck would I leak my own research?!

116151067.content: Indeed, that's what I thought as well. How could someone who values invention more than her life compromise the stability of their own experimental environment, as well as collaborate with an unknown enemy... That would be too stupid.

116151068.content: Wait a minute... Who are you talking about?

116151069.content: You... The "you" in my mind. All those inexplicable things I just mentioned are genuinely imprinted into my memory.

116151070.content: In my mind, I personally witnessed you leak the data. You also told me yourself that you were leaving Aether Gazer.

116151071.content: When did I do any of that?! That's absurd!

116151072.content: I know, you wouldn't do anything like that. That's why I didn't fire at you.

116151073.content: Hmph, then who were the Circles of Reason aiming at just now?

116151075.content: If there's no error in my judgment and you're uninvolved, then the problem came from...

116151076.content: Heimdall ponders for a moment, then extends her index finger and slowly points at her temple.

116151078.content: You "remember" events that didn't happen at all... I think I get it now.

116151079.content: This is an important clue. The instantaneous onset of this misperception was likely a product of the attacker's ability.

116151080.content: So, it can create false memories... If that's the case, then it's no surprise that they could make quick work of so many Modifiers.

116151081.content: Not far away, footsteps can be heard approaching.

116151082.content: Huh? Thor? Why are you here? You were covering another search area.

116151083.content: Had you been here earlier, we might've been able to catch the attacker.

116151084.content: Wait a second... Something's not right—Ookuninushi, get away from her!

116151085.content: Before Heimdall can finish, Thor's hammer is already coming straight down.

116151087.content: A card drops from Ookuninushi's body.

116151089.content: Who is the victor holding the sword?

116152001.content: Mission complete... That's two traitors down.

116152002.content: Yeah, I'll keep a low profile. One move is all it'll take, and I won't let a single one get away.

116152003.content: Whoever's collaborating with the Visbanes, no matter who they are and how many there are, I'll deal with them.

116152004.content: I'll wipe Aether Gazer completely off the map if I have to.

116161001.content: Why does it have to be like this?

116161002.content: Tantan is going to die no matter what I do...

116161004.content: If Tantan dies, everything will be meaningless.

116161005.content: There must be a way, there must be...

116161006.content: After canceling our plans to go to the theme park (and it's not like we're allowed out anyway), I decide to go back to my room for a nap.

116161007.content: Just as I'm about to flop down on the snow-white linen...

116161008.content: Tantan, Tantan... Is this the room? Tantan, can you hear me?!

116161009.content: She calls to me frantically through the automatic door, which she can't open. There's only one person who calls me by that name.

116161012.content: Skuld enters the room, her lips pursed as though she's rehearsing what she's about to say.

116161013.content: I've thought about it, and I think we should still go to the theme park!

116161015.content: I notice droplets of sweat on her temples, and the hand resting on her chest is trembling slightly.

116161016.content: I mean, yeah we can do that, but... why?

116161017.content: I really want to go on the Ferris wheel!

116161019.content: Are you sure about that? Don't push yourself if you're not feeling well.

116161021.content: I can't refuse her when she makes those pleading puppy-dog eyes. And besides, this was the original plan after all...

116161022.content: Huh? Now you both wanna go out?

116161024.content: Alright... All good here! Lil' Osi and I are ready to go.

116161025.content: We're going to the new Valleyrand Theme Park? I think you went there with the Administrator the other day.

116161026.content: Yep. The haunted house is awesome! It's just a shame we had to leave before we could go on the rollercoaster.

116161027.content: Em... I'll give the haunted house a pass...

116161028.content: It's okay. Our mission is to protect the Administrator anyway—if they want to go in the haunted house, then I don't mind going with them alone.

116161030.content: And that's how Skuld and I (followed by Ver and Osiris) came to be at Valleyrand Theme Park.

116161031.content: It's still the park's soft launch period, but the inventive rides and beautiful grounds the Valleyrand family has invested in are already drawing the crowds.

116161033.content: Skuld's eyes widen like a little schoolgirl's in bewilderment at the sight of so many people.

116161034.content: Is this the first time you've been here?

116161035.content: No, there weren't this many people last time...

116161036.content: Well, it is the weekend. Right, what ride do you want to go on first?

116161037.content: You mean, go on with you? In that case... Hmm... No, can't let my guard down...

116161038.content: What do you mean? Isn't the whole point of coming to a theme park to lay everything else on your mind aside? That said, if you could remember something that'd be great.

116161039.content: A member of staff is handing out maps of the park nearby. I go over and get one, and give it to Skuld. She looks at me in confusion.

116161040.content: What are these... pretty lines and patterns?

116161041.content: You've been here before, right? Didn't you get a map?

116161042.content: Just point it in the right direction, and you'll be able to work out where you are. You'll also be able to see what rides are nearby.

116161043.content: See, right now we're at the main entrance. And if we go straight, we'll get to these rides...

116161044.content: I point to the pictures on the map, and show Skuld where they are in relation to where we're standing.

116161045.content: Skuld stares at the map in her hands, as though lost in thought. Her fingers dance across it as she traces a path through the entire park.

116161046.content: If you can't decide, we can just go to the carousel first if you want. It's not far, and it's along the route they recommend.

116161048.content: I lead us in the direction of the first ride. But we've only gone a few steps when...

116161051.content: Skuld, so full of joy just moments before, suddenly stumbles a few steps backward. Her hand grips her chest as if pain were tearing through her heart.

116161052.content: Tantan, we... Let's not go on the carousel, okay?

116161053.content: She begins to study the map again, although her eyes are also constantly darting to look around her.

116161054.content: (Why is she being so wary? Have Ver and Osiris been found out?)

116161055.content: I want to go on the pirate ship.

116161056.content: That's on the other side of the park from here... Are you sure? We can go on other rides on the way.

116161057.content: I know, it's just... I want to go on the pirate ship.

116161058.content: All right... Should we check our route on the map first? you seemed to be planning which way to go just now.

116161059.content: Skuld seems stunned by my words, and instantly withdraws her fingers from the map.

116171001.content: Meanwhile, a group of well-equipped personnel has gathered in a secluded corner of the Valleyrand Theme Park.

116171002.content: This is Squad 7, target 0704 is confirmed. He's inside Valleyrand Theme Park.

116171003.content: Good. Capture the target. We must have him at any cost.

116171004.content: Are we really not going to have the park evacuate the people here?

116171005.content: Don't worry, I'll handle any fallout. You do your job in guiding the tourists away while keeping your files low in your casual clothes. Don't attract any attention.

116171006.content: Roger. Okay everyone, goggles up. Move out!

116171008.content: I... I'm fine, I think. I'll be all right...

116171009.content: Was the pirate ship rocking too fast? But I didn't feel it at all...

116171010.content: Osiris rubs Ver's back in an attempt to make her feel better.

116171011.content: Thank you, Lil' Osi... I'm feeling better now. Where's the Admin?

116171012.content: They headed off toward the log flume.

116171014.content: Ver, I really think it's better for you to take a break!

116171015.content: Ugh... Huh? Wait, those people are—

116171016.content: Ver raises her head to see a group of people wearing familiar uniforms hurry past them.

116171017.content: Was that the CORG logo? What are they doing here?

116171018.content: The Administrator did tell us to look out for suspicious types. I think that counts! We should follow.

116171020.content: The water splashes up high on both sides like an impenetrable wall, or like a pair of wings.

116171021.content: But whether it's a wall separating us from the outside world, or wings to help us escape it, in the end it's just a splash. A splash that's brought right back down on our heads by gravity.

116171022.content: I look at Skuld, breathless from the excitement. Her hands grip the safety bar for dear life, and her exhilarated screams mix with those of the other people on the ride. To look at her, you'd think she was just an ordinary girl.

116171023.content: As though she can feel my gaze, she turns to look at me. Awkwardness descends at the sudden direct eye contact.

116171025.content: Her words are drowned out by another splash and more screams. I shift closer to her, and motion for her to repeat herself.

116171026.content: However, she just shakes her head with a grin.

116171027.content: How about staying in Aether Gazer after you get your memories back?

116171028.content: What? I can't hear you, Tantan!

116171030.content: An even bigger drop this time, making a splash so big that we get drenched, despite our ponchos.

116171031.content: It's fine, we'll be dry again in no time.

116181003.content: We disembark from the ride. Skuld takes out the map to check what the next ride is.

116181005.content: We had marked the route with a pen, but now that the map's wet, everything has been smudged.

116181006.content: Skuld scratches her head, and brings the map closer to try and make it out.

116181008.content: It's okay, I remember—next up it was the giant frisbee!

116181009.content: Giant frisbee... No, not that. I've already tried that one...

116181011.content: Let's just go straight to the Ferris wheel. Do you mind, Tantan?

116181012.content: She looks up at me, and my emotions become all jumbled.

116181013.content: Skuld, you're not... trying to hide from something, are you?

116181015.content: Are you constantly changing your mind because you're trying to keep off those CORG guys? You know they're looking for you.

116181016.content: You haven't lost all of your memories, have you? How would you know that you're their target otherwise?

116181017.content: No, Tantan... I just wanted to... Ungh... Argh...

116181018.content: Skuld is once again gripped by a sudden, sharp pain, except this time it seems so bad she can barely stand. She grasps me with a thin, frail hand.

116181020.content: Run, Tantan! We can't stay here!

116181021.content: Still holding my hand, she breaks off in a run.

116181022.content: She looks around, and suddenly we stop. I follow her gaze, but don't see anything.

116181023.content: The Ferris wheel is the safest. Let's give it a shot...

116181025.content: Tantan, we need to get to the Ferris wheel!

116181027.content: Skuld dashes off with no further explanation, leaving me with no choice but to follow her.

116181028.content: As I watch her, I suddenly realize something.

116181029.content: Wasn't it her left side that got drenched on the ride? And I remember she'd put the map in her inner pocket, before she put the poncho on.

116181030.content: Am I remembering wrongly? I can't be, it was only five or ten minutes ago...

116181031.content: A strange feeling washes over me like déjà vu.

116181032.content: Once we get on the Ferris wheel, I message Ver about the change in itinerary.

116181033.content: I wait but receive no answer. In fact, I haven't heard from her since she told me CORG agents are in the park.

116181034.content: Maybe my communicator also got wet on the log flume, and now it's not working properly...

116181035.content: I look out from our pod, and see figures in black and wearing goggles. They're shouting something at each other, but they're too far away for me to make out what they're saying.

116181036.content: I would guess it's something like, "We've lost the target. We're gonna have to report back."

116181037.content: I look at the young girl sitting across from me, and can no longer hold back all the doubts and discomfort in my mind.

116181038.content: Skuld, can you tell me what the heck's going on?

116191001.content: Skuld, can you tell me what the heck's going on?

116191002.content: The sun filters through the pod's windows, washing it in hazy yellow light.

116191003.content: As I wait for Skuld to answer me, I notice that she's still wearing her thick jacket, even though it's the middle of summer.

116191005.content: The Ferris wheel begins to move, and the light in the pod moves along with it.

116191006.content: Skuld holds out her hand, and watches as the light roves across her palm.

116191007.content: I didn’t get to see it much before, so I thought that if we went up really high, I'd be able to look at it from up close.

116191008.content: A Ferris wheel isn't going to make much difference. And besides, you can't look at the sun directly anyway.

116191009.content: You said that last time. And I won't, don't worry.

116191010.content: I'm happy just to sit here with you like this. Of course, it'd be better if we weren't being chased, haha...

116191013.content: She closes her palm and withdraws her hand, then shoots me a wry smile.

116191014.content: I've told you everything I know, but it didn't change anything. It just made things happen faster.

116191016.content: Yes I have... I have told you in that tall building. But that was no use either, so I had to come back here.

116191018.content: Skuld doesn't answer immediately. She stares down at the ground below but, just like on the pirate ship, she glances around from time to time.

116191019.content: After a while, she looks back up and her face relaxes slightly.

116191020.content: Would you come with me, Tantan?

116191021.content: What do you mean, come with you?

116191022.content: As in, leave everything else behind and go somewhere far, far away.

116191023.content: You mean like a holiday trip? Sure, once it's all settled of course I'd love to take a trip with you.

116191024.content: That's not what I meant... I mean abandon everything we have now and go somewhere no one will ever be able to find us.

116191025.content: Why? What are you running from?

116191026.content: I'm not. It's just, this is the only chance I'll get to save you...

116191028.content: Her eyes flicker and her gaze begins to wander. She brings her hands up to her chest and her lips move soundlessly.

116191029.content: Perhaps it's the glow of the sunlight or the gentle turning of the Ferris wheel, but for a moment I completely forget that we've got assailants trying to hunt us down.

116191031.content: The Ferris wheel comes to an abrupt stop. I look out of the window to the passengers in the other pods, who seem just as surprised as I am.

116191032.content: Do Ferris wheels normally stop as soon as you get to the top?

116191033.content: Not usually. And it's not like the other people on the ride are at the top...

116191036.content: All of a sudden, there's a flurry of movement outside and our pod begins to shake.

116191037.content: My eyes follow the movement upwards, but they refuse to believe what they see...

116191039.content: Once, twice, three times... The thuds reverberate through my entire body, each one louder and faster than the last, like a treasure hunter who knows they're close to unearthing the treasure.

116191041.content: The final bang strikes hard enough to break the roof of the pod in two, revealing an enormous black hammer.

116191042.content: Good morning, traitors! You led me on quite the goose chase, didn't you?

116191045.content: Amidst the crackle of electricity and the screech of tearing metal, the hammer swoops down through the hole and smashes into the chair I was just sitting on, reducing it to a mound of scrap iron.

116191046.content: Good reflexes! Or is it just because she warned you?

116191048.content: Why? I'm eliminating the traitors, of course! Hmm, weird. Why does it feel like I've said that before? Anyway, not important!

116191049.content: The sun comes streaming in through the hole in the roof, but is soon blotted out as the girl lifts her hammer again.

116191050.content: This is a bit like whack-a-mole. But an easier version where the moles only have two places to hide.

116191051.content: Just give up already. You're not the only ones on my list, you know...

116191052.content: Thor begins to gather her power. There's no outward sign, but I see her muscles begin to tense and pulse. I realize she's preparing a second strike—and this time at my head!

116191054.content: The last thing I see before everything goes black is Skuld raising her arms to protect me, like a baby bird trying to fight against lightning.

116191055.content: The noble yet inexplicable sacrifice burns to ashes like the tower.

116201001.content: Skuld doesn't seem to feel too well after the pirate ship.

116201002.content: She's doubled over and breathing hard. Did the ride make her feel sick?

116201003.content: Do you want to take a break?

116201004.content: Huff... Puff... I'm fine. Let's go to the next ride.

116201005.content: That'll be the log flume. It's one of the more popular rides, so we should get in line now.

116201006.content: No, we can't go that way...

116201007.content: She snatches the map away from me and scans it intently, like a military commander examining battlefield intelligence.

116201008.content: Let's go to the haunted house.

116201010.content: I ask but I'm used to it by now, and follow her with no further questions.

116201011.content: I saw some parade floats over there. We can go take a look on our way to the haunted house.

116201013.content: I look back in the direction of the log flume. The water spray, the screams, the cars clanking along the rail—it all feels like it's happening all around me.

116201014.content: Memories that never existed flash through my mind like a carousel. Getting wet on the log flume, then going up in the Ferris wheel, and then... the blinding sun, and a tower smashed by lightning.

116201017.content: The words slipped out without me thinking.

116201018.content: Skuld stops dead in her tracks and her cherry-colored eyes widen in surprise, anticipation, or maybe both.

116201019.content: Sorry, that was a weird thing to say. Ignore me.

116201022.content: Urgh... I-I'm fine. Pirate ships always get me.

116201023.content: It's over now. Let me handle the haunted house...

116201024.content: Lil' Osi, in a place like this, do you think Ausar will...

116201025.content: It's fine, we've talked. As long as I don't get scared, it'll be okay.

116201026.content: Speaking of which, I think the CORG guys went into the haunted house too. And they went in before the Administrator changed the plan, so it looks like maybe we're not their target.

116201027.content: Hmm... Could it just be some kind of team-building trip?

116201028.content: The tactical gear is a bit much for an away day, don't you think?

116201029.content: Forget I said anything. The Administrator's not here yet, so should we follow them for a bit and see what they're up to?

116201030.content: That must be one of the floats up ahead.

116201031.content: Although the expression "over the top" could be used to describe anything in this theme park, even that doesn't do justice to what we see before us.

116201032.content: Beautiful, unrestrained, menacing—even when the floats are just parked here, they still manifest their designer's pioneering ideas to the outside world.

116201033.content: I thought they'd have had more flowers.

116201034.content: Oh no, the floats here are different from the kinds you'll see anywhere else. If you want to take a photo, that's a pretty good angle over there...

116201035.content: But instead of getting her camera out, Skuld stops for a second, then instantly recovers and urgently tugs on my sleeve.

116201036.content: Let's go to the haunted house first.

116201037.content: I don't know why she's so insistent on going to the haunted house, but I said I'd spend the day in the park with her, so I guess that's what we'll do.

116201038.content: As we near it though, Skuld's forced smile is replaced by overt worry.

116201039.content: The floats disappear behind the trees on either side of us, and the path becomes practically deserted. The temperature seems to drop by a couple of degrees, and all sense of fun is gone.

116201040.content: Skuld senses something, and pulls me into a run.

116201042.content: Skuld mumbles to herself as she quickens her pace. I can't make out a word, yet somehow her soliloquy draws deeply buried memories out of my subconscious, and knits them into a cohesive whole.

116201043.content: In a daze, I get the feeling that I've lived this scene of running with her many times before.

116201044.content: (Tantan and I met a long time ago. We'd gone shopping together, gone for dinner together, and planned to visit the theme park together...)

116201045.content: Fragments of images collide with cryptic phrases Skuld once said, and an indescribable feeling fills my chest... which is suddenly interrupted by a voice shouting through my communicator.

116201046.content: Administrator, something's wrong. Stay away from the haunted house!

116201048.content: CORGs are here, and they just attacked us without any explanation! And Ver's...

116201049.content: Her voice cuts out and is replaced by a static hiss.

116201051.content: Instantly forgetting any attempt at stealth, I call Osiris's name again but get no response. I check the communicator: the signal is stable, but the connection's been cut...

116201053.content: Ver and Osiris also came here to protect us, but they just got to the haunted house and now I can't get through to them.

116201054.content: Oh no... Tantan, we can't go there.

116201055.content: Skuld takes my hand and tries to drag me in the opposite direction, but this time I don't accept her sudden change of mind.

116201056.content: Ver and Osiris might be in danger. I can't just leave them there. I'm sorry, Skuld, but I have to ask you to get back to HQ yourself.

116201057.content: Without even waiting to hear her answer, I tear free of her grasp and run to the ticket gate.

116201059.content: No, not yet... there's still a chance as long as "he" hasn't succeeded. I need to try and see as many "things" as possible...

116201060.content: Skuld purses her lips in contemplation, then hesitantly begins to walk toward the haunted house.

116201061.content: The light of the late afternoon sun mixed with the beginnings of twilight spills onto the forest path in front of me. I look in the direction of the haunted house. There's not another soul to be seen. Where has everyone gone?

116201063.content: The ticket gate is unmanned. Beyond, violent banging noises can be faintly heard coming from inside the structure.

116201064.content: Frowning, I slam the door open and go in. The sudden darkness only adds to my feelings of unease.

116201065.content: I keep heading toward the only source of sound I can hear—the sound of metal on metal... It's a sound I often heard in the Aether Gazer training room.

116201067.content: The sound of clashing weapons is very close now. I hasten my steps and call out.

116201068.content: Administrator? What are you doing here?!

116201069.content: As I turn a corner, I can make out a familiar figure in the darkness wielding a scythe that should be far too big for her. She's currently using it to defend herself against a barrage of attacks.

116201070.content: CORG picked up a fight again? Where's Ver?

116201071.content: It's not CORG. Administrator, you should...

116201072.content: Osiris takes a large leap toward me, as though evading a powerful attack.

116201073.content: Their blade slashing through the air, Osiris's opponent dashes after her without a second's hesitation, until they are both in a corner that has slightly more light. I meet the attacker's eyes.

116201074.content: I recognize this person, her appearance, her clothes. But what I don't recognize is the coldness in her eyes, as though she doesn't recognize me at all.

116211001.content: Ver doesn't let up for a second, putting every ounce of strength she has into each strike of her weapon. She's like a crazed animal.

116211002.content: In the narrow passageway, Skuld and I have no choice but to retreat with Osiris. I try to talk some reason into Ver, but she silently and tirelessly slashes with her weapon again and again.

116211003.content: When did Ver become like this?

116211004.content: Some black mist wafted into the room and surrounded her when we were fighting CORG. Then she turned on me...

116211008.content: I know there's nothing Ver loves more than barbecue, but the mention of it does nothing to calm her.

116211009.content: It's like she can't hear us... Osiris, you're going to have to think of a way to overpower her!

116211010.content: I can always rely on Ver to obey my commands during our drills, but this time nothing happens.

116211011.content: It's like she's been brainwashed... Osiris, you're going to have to think of a way to overpower her!

116211012.content: We need to find a way to stop her!

116211013.content: I notice Ver glancing my way.

116211014.content: A dreamlike image flashes in my mind. In it, Ver is swinging her sword at me instead of Osiris.

116211015.content: I gasp as a phantom pain strikes me in the chest. It's as if... this isn't the first time I've seen Ver like this.

116211016.content: Just knock her out. Can you do that?

116211018.content: Osiris forcibly knocks Ver's sword aside, then hops back and hurls her scythe, which hits the wall and spins behind Ver in a graceful arc.

116211019.content: Ver elects to ignore the attack coming from behind her, and desperately charges toward Osiris.

116211021.content: Divine Power suddenly bursts forth, and just as Ver's Runic Blade is about to slice into Osiris, the spinning scythe wheels into Ver's back with a thud and knocks her into the wall.

116211022.content: The force of the impact appears to have subdued Ver, and Osiris picks up her scythe with trembling hands.

116211023.content: We need to reach Miss Shu now...

116211024.content: She pulls out her communicator and wipes her cheeks. Her palms come away wet, although it's unclear whether it's sweat or tears.

116211025.content: Just as I step forward to make sure Ver's all right, Skuld comes running over from the direction of the entrance, panting heavily.

116211026.content: Get out of here, Tantan. He's almost here...

116211028.content: The one who tried to hurt you before... I-I can't remember who he is, but he's going to kill you!

116211029.content: Skuld clutches her head in pain, as though physically tormented by a memory. Seeing the desperation in her eyes, I agree to do as she asks.

116211031.content: As I turn to ask Osiris to take Ver back to Aether Gazer, I see a cloud of black mist slowly approaching her from behind.

116211034.content: The second she hears my warning, Osiris whips around with the Access Key in her hand.

116211035.content: Her scythe slices through the mist, causing it to spread out like a popped balloon and enveloping the haunted house in total darkness.

116211037.content: He's here. Am I too late again?

116211038.content: The black mist intensifies, and the world grows darker than I would have ever imagined possible. A primal fear is triggered within me, as if by touching this mist I will be tarnished by the same darkness.

116211039.content: Just as I begin to struggle for breath in the oppressive atmosphere, everything suddenly clears.

116211040.content: The mist has disappeared. Or, more accurately, it has condensed into the form of a young boy.

116211041.content: I've never seen this silver-haired teenager before. In his hand is a black baton, and he looks us up and down with great interest.

116211042.content: Long time no see... Oh, I see you're here too, Skuld.

116211043.content: The teenager ignores Osiris, who just attacked him, and instead turns his gaze to Skuld. A sickly smile spills across his handsome face like an oil slick.

116211044.content: I spot a row of blurred green numbers printed across his forearm—0704.

116211045.content: Huh? What's that look? Don't tell me you don't know who I am.

116211046.content: I remember. You're the one who's been chasing me and Tantan.

116211047.content: I mean, don't you remember any further back than that? Have your memories really gone so bad?

116211048.content: Looks like I'm going to have to re-introduce myself... I'm 0704, also known as Uld.

116211049.content: All those years in that false prison, all those years with boring code names... And what have you traded it for, 0705?

116211052.content: Sensing the newcomer's strength, Osiris chooses to stand back and defend Ver, although her body is poised to act in case he decides to attack me.

116211053.content: And where's Rata? Don't tell me you've forgotten Rata as well?

116211054.content: The anguish on Skuld's face seems to both irritate and amuse Uld, who shakes his head with an empty chuckle. He tucks the baton into his belt, and extends his hand to conjure up a scepter from the void.

116211055.content: Well, since you don't remember anything, I think we can dispense of the niceties.

116211056.content: Small, rippling fragments appear in the air surrounding the scepter, and they begin to coalesce as though moved by some invisible force... I've lost count of the number of times I've seen this.

116211057.content: It's what happens when a Modifier summons an Access Key.

116211060.content: Just as Skuld shouts this, Uld's right pupil bursts into a blaze of golden light, as though something is flowing in his eyes. I'm dazzled just looking at it.

116211061.content: I vaguely make out the boy pointing the scepter at Osiris as she raises her scythe, but Skuld's warning comes too late...

116211063.content: Osiris stands there, her head down and her scythe drooping limply at her side. She looks like a puppet with no one moving the strings.

116211064.content: What have you done to her?!

116211065.content: Hmm? A human... You're from Aether Gazer as well, I assume? Then you're qualified to entertain me.

116211066.content: Uld's eyes narrow and he turns to point his scepter at me.

116211067.content: Before I have the chance to register what's happening, a figure dashes out in front of me. It's Skuld.

116211068.content: Now, now. What do you think you're doing? You refused my offer, and you now think you're a real Modifier and want to play at defending humanity?

116211069.content: I don't remember who you are... But I'm not going to let you lay a finger on Tantan.

116211070.content: Bahahahaha! Oh, that's rich coming from you! You were like a marionette in that cage, but now you're saying you can't contain yourself after losing your memories?

116211071.content: You want to protect this person? Now it all makes sense... My plans keep failing thanks to your constant meddling.

116211072.content: You were stronger than me, 0705. We could have ascended together... But from the instant you rejected me, you were doomed.

116211073.content: Uld lowers his scepter and raises his hand instead. Osiris suddenly raises her head and begins to attack us with her scythe.

116211074.content: Her eyes are glazed over, just as Ver's were. I leap to snatch Skuld out of the way, and we both tumble to the floor.

116211075.content: The scythe crashes down and embeds itself into the ground where we were both just standing.

116211076.content: Don't worry, Administrator. I'll get you out of here...

116211077.content: Osiris's eyes are locked on Skuld, and they emit the same strange golden light as the boy's. However, anger and hostility are also burning there.

116211078.content: The pitiful soul who has been led astray by the evil witch can only break their curse by severing their lifeline with a giant sickle.

116211079.content: How do you like this little story I'm composing for you?

116211080.content: Osiris, stop! Skuld isn't the enemy!

116211081.content: But Osiris doesn't seem to hear me, and once again charges towards us, her scythe raised high.

116211082.content: It's no use. Her memory's been overwritten.

116211083.content: He has been using the same trick. He took control of your friends one by one, until you...

116211084.content: I don't have time to properly absorb what she's saying. We help each other off the ground and run back in the direction we came from before Osiris attacks again.

116221001.content: The way here didn't seem that long when we came, but now we're trying to leave, it seems to stretch into eternity.

116221002.content: The boy's voice floats down the corridor, like a voiceover in a movie.

116221003.content: The mentor's lackeys are little more than mindless robots, doomed to repeat their struggles until their time is out. Banality.

116221004.content: I much prefer the complexities of the human condition... The complicated emotions, the interweaving relationships, the constant struggles they endure between their preordained beginning and end. That, is art.

116221005.content: Captain, come in. We've found two of the traitors.

116221007.content: Our way is blocked by two CORG agents, their guns pointing right at us. They must have also had their memories altered like Osiris.

116221009.content: It's okay, Administrator. It'll all be over soon.

116221010.content: Osiris dashes towards me, her scythe glinting viciously as it swings downward. I feel a slight breeze as its edge cuts through the air and then... there's no pain.

116221012.content: You stupid girl! Are you betraying CORG too?

116221013.content: The two CORG Research Center sentries behind me drop to the ground instead.

116221016.content: Her scythe slowly disappears, and her body is lifted into the air by a violent surge of Divine Power that doesn't appear to belong to her.

116221017.content: Floating in the air, the girl stretches out her back before casting her indifferent red eyes over the three of us. A strange oppressive force causes the air between us and Uld to crackle.

116221018.content: Ten sword wings circle her waist, and she lifts her arm to point one of them at Uld and the other at Skuld.

116221019.content: Hey, Administrator of Aether Gazer. Mind explaining to me? Who are these two? Enemies?

116221020.content: Tsk, has the power worn off? Let's try that again...

116221021.content: Uld points his scepter at Ausar, and his right eye once again shines with golden light.

116221022.content: Ausar, watch out! He's trying to alter your memory!

116221024.content: Standing in front of you is your master, the lord you have sworn to serve with your life. Now slay the enemies behind you and perform your duty.

116221026.content: Ausar's eyes suddenly ignite with the same golden light, and the sword wing pointing at Uld drops soundlessly.

116221027.content: Very good. Now, atone for your foolishness and dispatch... Whoa!

116221028.content: Uld is interrupted by a blade slashing above his head.

116221029.content: What are you jabbering about? Did I give you permission to speak?

116221031.content: No, the last overwrite is still in effect. Then why...

116221032.content: Aha, I know—a dual personality, by any chance?

116221033.content: Administrator, you haven't answered my question.

116221034.content: Someone just bypassed my consciousness to tamper with Osiris's mind. Was it this kid with the walking stick?

116221036.content: All right. Now for my second question: who's the girl next to you?

116221037.content: I glance at Skuld, and see that she's staring at Ausar, dumbfounded... It's a pretty normal reaction when someone sees Osiris transform for the first time.

116221038.content: She's our friend. She's not the enemy.

116221039.content: You seem to have more and more friends every time I wake up.

116221040.content: Ausar, you must defeat Uld! He can manipulate other people's memory—if nobody stops him, we're all done for!

116221041.content: What? Have you forgotten your place? I only asked you to answer my questions, not give me orders.

116221043.content: That said, this little boy did just mess with the body I'm using, so I think it only fair he pays the price for it.

116221044.content: Ausar snorts in disdain and swoops down toward Uld, her sword wings extended.

116221046.content: Just as the blades are about to pierce through Uld, a powerful lightning bolt strikes the ground in front of him. But it looks like there's more than just electricity coming between Ausar and her target...

116221047.content: The sword wings strike something hard, creating a shower of sparks to illuminate Uld's savior.

116221049.content: Ausar wheels back into the air to regain her balance. Her wings are now visibly trembling.

116221050.content: Hmph, you really found my match, Administrator.

116221051.content: Her cloak still fluttering from the force of the lightning blast, Thor lifts her iconic hammer and stares at Ausar coldly.

116221052.content: Only one? Oh well, a traitor's a traitor, I guess.

116221053.content: Thor?! Oh no, are you under Uld's control too?

116221054.content: Control? Is this what Shu's been feeding you?

116221055.content: She took advantage of the time Odin and I were in Xu Heng to start working with the Visbanes. I should have known it.

116221056.content: What Thor is saying is so bizarre, I don't even know what I should argue against first.

116221057.content: Uld altered her memories a long time ago... There's no point talking to her about the past.

116221058.content: You're such a brainless pipsqueak. It's really no wonder he got the better of you.

116221059.content: I can't help but look over to see how Thor is reacting to Ausar's jibes.

116221060.content: Pipsqueak?! You're going to regret saying that when I smash your skull in with my hammer.

116221061.content: These two are forever destined to be at odds with each other. The tension noticeably ramps up a notch.

116221062.content: Ausar glances over at Uld standing in the dark, and her sword wings suddenly begin to glow a fluorescent green as she adopts a fighting position.

116221063.content: Come at me with her if you want, rat. I'm not afraid of those who hide behind others' power.

116221064.content: It is in the book that I will become the leader of all Modifiers. You were supposed to save this crumbling world with me, but instead you chose to betray your brethren.

116221065.content: Kings can declare an act of treason, but they don't execute the traitors themselves. Thor, I'll leave her to you.

116231001.content: Their first clash is impossible to call. Both are holding back, as though wary of the other's strength. Ausar turns to look at me and Skuld.

116231004.content: I mean, I won't mind if they want more fights. It's just that I don't think this place would be left standing afterward.

116231005.content: Before either of us realize what's happening, Ausar summons a gust of wind with her sword wings and carries Skuld and me into a pair of rollercoaster cars.

116231006.content: I'll get you two out first! Osiris's gonna be mad at me again if I don't save you.

116231007.content: Are you trying to run away before the battle's even over?!

116231008.content: Oh, does it bother you, because you know your stumpy legs wouldn't be able to keep up?

116231009.content: Four of the sword wings slam into the rear of the rollercoaster cars, and begin emitting a blue smoke as they accelerate us along the tracks.

116231010.content: ...Is this what riding a rollercoaster feels like?

116231011.content: Absolutely not! Ausar, slow us down!

116231012.content: Shut up and look behind you!

116231013.content: Ausar's words bring me back to my senses. I look behind us, and watch as the track collapses in a slew of lightning strikes.

116231015.content: See? Like that maniac's letting us go that easy!

116231016.content: Ausar rolls her eyes. The rollercoaster track suddenly shudders, and the unexpected force causes me to drop my communicator into the darkness below.

116231018.content: The communicator is the least of my worries though. The rollercoaster must be severely damaged, and it feels like our car is raised at an angle. I look up just as we're about to collide with a boulder.

116231020.content: The switch is busted so yell all you want! Now sit your butt tight!

116231021.content: Ausar holds on to the edge of the car, and all ten of her sword wings burst with blue light as they help push our car onto the track.

116231022.content: As Skuld and I both scream at the tops of our lungs, the rollercoaster car misses crashing into the boulder by a hair's breadth.

116231024.content: I told you, I'm only doing this or Osiris's gonna give me an earful.

116231025.content: Propelled by our blue rockets, Skuld and I are pressed back in our seats as the car accelerates faster to escape the collapsing track. The bright light of the exit comes hurtling toward us.

116241001.content: As we burst out of the haunted house, we're dazzled by the daylight.

116241002.content: It's a pity that the sun has already blessed the ground with its light, and can bring me no further salvation.

116241003.content: I think this as Thor crashes out through the haunted house wall just behind us.

116241004.content: We're never going to lose her like this! We need to find another way!

116241005.content: Easier said than done... She's quick for a pipsqueak! I'd be fine on my own, but you two are slowing me down!

116241006.content: None of us stop running as we exchange words.

116241007.content: I struggle to remember the map of the theme park, and a risky plan starts to form in my mind...

116241008.content: Looks like there's no other choice... Let's go this way!

116241009.content: I lead us across a meadow, through some bushes and into a garden.

116241011.content: One of Valleyrand Theme Park's most famous attractions is the enormous Omorfies-style garden maze.

116241012.content: All sudden turns and dead-ends have been decorated with ornate statues, pavilions and benches, so it never really feels like you're stuck in a maze...

116241013.content: If we want to lose Thor, what better place than a maze?

116241015.content: Roger that. Those traitors won't get away!

116241017.content: I'll handle them. Just keep away from the shrimp!

116241018.content: This would be so much easier if we had a map...

116241019.content: It's fine, I'll find the exit for us.

116241021.content: I promise I won't let anything happen to you.

116251001.content: When Skuld said she'd be able to find the exit for us, I thought she was saying it more to try and convince herself than me. But as we wind our way through the incredibly intricate maze, we don't hit a single dead-end.

116251002.content: Another fork in the path. The light seems stronger on the left...

116251004.content: Skuld decisively takes us down the path leading to the right. I don't question her, and her choice turns out to be correct.

116251005.content: But it's strange how many times she's guessed correctly so far... She hasn't hesitated at any of the forks we've come across, and with each decision she makes, the footsteps and sounds of fighting behind us seem to get a little further away.

116251006.content: Could it really just be pure luck?

116251007.content: You put it on me before, when I fell down.

116251008.content: I could never forget about Tantan... A little careless, but also kind enough to be my friend every time...

116251009.content: He has been using the same trick. He took control of your friends one by one, until you...

116251010.content: Words Skuld once said begin replaying in my mind, my memories overlapping with the girl walking in front of me.

116251011.content: At the top of the Ferris wheel.

116251014.content: Memories of situations that never actually existed, but that feel as real as though they'd only happened yesterday.

116251017.content: I blurt out what's on my mind without really thinking about how ridiculous it sounds. Skuld's eyes widen a fraction, but then she just smiles, shakes her head and leads me down another fork in the path.

116251018.content: So you noticed? That's strange... No one else has ever figured it out before.

116251019.content: But they're both too far-fetched, either of them... Have you ever met anyone who can do that, Tantan?

116251021.content: All Modifiers have powerful abilities, but nothing to that extent.

116251022.content: Well, then I think you already know my answer.

116251024.content: All I can do is experience the inevitable, and then record it down.

116251026.content: I can't see all that's possible, and I can't change what has already happened. I can only understand things that I can see with my own eyes...

116251027.content: In lots and lots of dreams.

116251029.content: We both perceive a sudden change in the air, and the sounds of weapons clashing come to an abrupt end. The fight must be over.

116251030.content: Ausar had already spent so much of her strength. If their duel has already come to an end, that could only mean the winner is...

116251031.content: Tantan, let's get out of here first, and then I'll tell you everything you want to know.

116251032.content: Don't worry, I promise... I won't let her get you.

116251033.content: As I meet Skuld's serious gaze, my heart feels like it's being compressed, and a strangely familiar pain courses through my body. Fragments of memories bubble to the surface of my consciousness, and drag my mind into their depths.

116251034.content: So she can't see into the future or go back in time, but she can predict what's going to happen...

116251035.content: (I simply remember everything that I've seen in my dreams...)

116251036.content: So how does she actually do it?

116251037.content: And what price does she pay for wielding so much power?

116251038.content: I mean, don't you remember any further back than that? Have your memories really gone so bad?

116251039.content: Did you forget your own name? Don't worry... I'm pretty forgetful too.

116251040.content: We should run, Tantan. Stay close behind me.

116261001.content: We manage to exit the maze before Thor can catch up with us.

116261002.content: In the meantime, CORG swat teams file in through the maze entrance. It doesn't take long for blasts and shouts to ring out from their location.

116261003.content: 0704 found at target location. Requesting backup! Requesting backup!

116261004.content: The Modifier "Thor" is confirmed as being under 0704's control. Prepare yourselves—we need to take her down at any cost!

116261005.content: This is so annoying! I'm trying to catch some traitors here! Get out of my way!

116261007.content: It's like being in the middle of a warzone. No one pays any attention to me and Skuld, and we rely on our memories of the map to make it to the edge of the theme park, where we're able to jump over the wall.

116261008.content: On the crowded street, our ears are suddenly assaulted by the sound of car horns and conversations. It all feels so surreal.

116261009.content: We... made it... That's the first time...

116261010.content: We did it, Tantan! We're saved!

116261011.content: I try to return her beaming smile, but I still feel burdened.

116261012.content: You told me that you can't see into the future. That everything you know has to be something you've experienced for yourself.

116261013.content: So the fact that we were able to outsmart Thor at every turn and lose her in that maze... Is that because you'd somehow traveled to a place where we went the wrong way?

116261014.content: You're close... But they're just dreams, so I can never really get hurt. My teacher preferred to call them "visions."

116261016.content: Yes, my teacher. You know, someone who can teach you lots of things.

116261017.content: She... Hmm... I'm sorry, I can't... really remember much about her.

116261019.content: Skuld had tried to downplay the impact her visions have on her. But now I'm thinking back to all those times she suddenly seemed to be in pain...

116261020.content: Yes, these visions might not cause her direct physical injury, but the pain from the memories where she acquired her information must still be there.

116261021.content: How many times did you have these visions in the theme park?

116261022.content: Well, I didn't know when we'd be out of danger so... It must have been around forty times.

116261023.content: She held up four fingers to demonstrate her point, as though it was a perfectly ordinary number.

116261024.content: How far in the future can you normally see in your visions?

116261025.content: I'm not sure. I guess I can keep going as far as I want, as long as I don't go back to the marker.

116261026.content: But as far as I can remember, either you or I died very quickly in those futures...

116261027.content: Are those the only two ways you can come out of a dream? Hitting a marker or dying?

116261028.content: I look into Skuld's cherry-colored eyes, which are brimming with happiness and unsullied by all this talk of death.

116261029.content: Is it because... she's used to it?

116261030.content: Do you know that Uld guy? He seemed to be the one CORG was after. I heard him call you 0705...

116261032.content: He told me that we were both artificial lifeforms, and that he wanted me to join with him so he could reach his full potential.

116261033.content: But I didn’t understand anything else he said other than that, and then he attacked me... I think I must have forgotten something about him.

116261034.content: Skuld hides her face in embarrassment, her sleeves sliding down as she does so. I can make out a faded line of numbers on her forearm, like paint that hasn't quite come off. 070...The missing number at the end must be a 5.

116261035.content: Tantan, I don't want to think about this anymore. Let's go far away from here, somewhere they'll never be able to catch us. It's the only way we can be safe.

116261036.content: Why are you trying so hard to save me?

116261037.content: Because you're nice to me. I don't want you to die.

116261038.content: But I don't remember anything about you. What if your memories are mixed up and you've got the wrong person?

116261039.content: No. You might not remember when we first met, but I do. I remember your kindness to me. I know I've got the right person.

116261040.content: Let's get out of here. Let's take a trip... Somewhere they'll never find us.

116261041.content: We can barbecue, fold paper airplanes, take photos, go on Ferris wheels... Every day will be paradise.

116261045.content: I fish out my wallet and hand her my ID card, credit card, and what little cash I have.

116261047.content: Go to the photon rail station and use this to buy a ticket to Omorfies. When you get there, go to a place called the Society of Muses and tell them you're a friend of Aether Gazer. They'll look after you.

116261049.content: Skuld's voice trails off. The setting sun casts a warm orange glow over the streets of Ain Soph, and makes her cherry-colored eyes even brighter.

116261050.content: Think about it, this was just a trip to a theme park. If we want to go somewhere further away, we'll need to bring a lot more stuff with us and I'll need more time to prepare.

116261051.content: Then why can't I just wait for you here?

116261052.content: There's no need. As an Aether Gazer Administrator, I have access to a special photon train. We can just meet up in Omorfies.

116261053.content: Don't you want to go on a Ferris wheel? There's an awesome theme park in Omorfies.

116261054.content: I've been on it. I saw you die there.

116261055.content: She says this in such a matter-of-fact way that I don't know how to respond.

116261056.content: Well... That doesn't count. You need to go when there's no one there to interrupt us.

116261059.content: She awkwardly holds out her little finger for a pinkie swear, then walks towards the zebra crossing with the stack of cards and cash I gave her.

116261060.content: Put the money in your pocket...

116261061.content: Skuld turns back to look at me every couple of steps, as if to make sure I'm still safe. I wave every time to reassure her.

116261062.content: Once she's finally disappeared from view, I breathe a long sigh of relief.

116261063.content: Of course, I'm not staying here to make preparations for our trip, and neither am I going to meet Skuld in Omorfies.

116261064.content: If Skuld had a vision that made her suddenly want to go to the theme park this morning, it must be because of something that will happen in Aether Gazer...

116261065.content: And if you think about it, if Uld can bring even Thor under his control, then there's not much he isn't capable of.

116261066.content: He said it himself in the haunted house—he wants to become the leader of the Modifiers.

116261067.content: And there's one place in Ain Soph where Modifiers tend to congregate...

116271001.content: I run out of the elevator and stop dead in my tracks. The lobby is in complete disarray. My head spins.

116271003.content: Is that true, rookie? Did this Uld seize control over the entirety of Aether Gazer?

116271004.content: Yes. I know it's hard to believe, but it's true. Lord Mimir, did you help me escape the surveillance system because you can also sense that something's wrong?

116271005.content: Yes, but I wasn't fast enough. It looks like I still got caught.

116271006.content: Shu has denied your access permissions. This is probably the last thing I'll be able to tell you. As you guessed, the person responsible for patrolling this area is...

116271007.content: Mimir's voice is lost in a sudden blast of static, before both sounds fizzle out like spent fireworks.

116271008.content: From my hiding place in the stairwell, I aim my pistol at the brown-haired woman who has just entered the lobby below.

116271010.content: Why don't you trust me? You're simply under the influence of corrupted data. I can wipe it out for you with my Access Key and you'll be good as new again!

116271011.content: (Making a hole in my chest with your blade is not nice at all...)

116271012.content: Not here? ...Very well, but I'll find you sooner or later and get you back to your old self!

116271014.content: As Ver turns round, I switch the BunBun Gun to Sleep mode and fire a bullet at her neck.

116271015.content: Thanks to my years of practice, I hit my mark and she slumps to the ground like a sack of potatoes.

116271017.content: I'm sorry, Ver. I had no choice.

116271018.content: I know I can't take the whole of Aether Gazer on my own. All I can do is pin my hopes on the chance that Uld hasn't managed to get control over all of the Modifiers yet.

116271019.content: As long as she's still on our side, there's a chance we can come out of this alive...

116271020.content: The building is swarming with CORG agents under Uld's control. Luckily, they're not familiar with the layout so I'm easily able to slip through the gaps in their patrols.

116271021.content: I dodge a couple of them, and make my way to Odin's office.

116271022.content: Mimir said Shu has been brainwashed too, meaning Odin is the only one left who'd be able to deal with the situation.

116271023.content: Forgoing the niceties, I shoot the lock out of the door and run in, but the scene that greets me shatters my last remnants of hope...

116271025.content: Odin, leader of Aether Gazer, who I was chatting with on patrol just a few days ago, is leaning back in her chair, her Access Key buried deep in her chest.

116271026.content: The blood from her wound has congealed and there's no trace of surprise or pain on her face. It's like she was calmly waiting for her death to come...

116271027.content: Who did this? Thor, or Uld?

116271028.content: But that's not important right now. My last hope to turn the situation around is gone. What can I do to take on Uld, when all of Aether Gazer is behind him?

116271030.content: Put your hands up! What are you doing trespassing in Captain Uld's base?

116271032.content: This is Captain Uld's headquarters, where is assembling a team of Modifiers to take on the Visbane threat. If you're not with us, then you're with the Visbanes!

116271033.content: So these are the fake memories he's feeding you?

116271034.content: I manage to fire some shots off and run out of the room before they can do anything.

116271035.content: Don't move! We've got you surrounded!

116271036.content: Captain Uld said that humans are worthless and should be shot on sight!

116271037.content: What a despicable order! I guess this is it...

116271040.content: I crouch instinctively when I hear her cry, as the sound of bullets hitting a shield ring out just above my head.

116271041.content: Vice Captain Verthandi, what are you doing?!

116271042.content: I'm not your vice captain—I'm the Administrator's partner!

116272001.content: Ver flings her shield to knock out the last CORG agent, and then turns to look at me with tears in her eyes.

116272002.content: I'm so sorry, Administrator... All that stuff before... That was this... voice in my head telling me that you'd be corrupted by a virus, and you were now a threat to Aether Gazer...

116272003.content: The voice told me to kill you, because that'd be the only way to purge the virus and restore you back to normal...

116272004.content: And I just... believed him without question. And I tried to kill you!

116272005.content: It's all right, Ver. You still saved me in the end.

116272006.content: She collapses into my arms and sobs. I stroke her hair to try and console her.

116272007.content: Wait, how comes you're back to normal? Was it because I shot you?

116272008.content: No. She helped correct my memory.

116272009.content: Ver steps aside as a pink-haired girl steps sheepishly out from the corner. Her left eye shines with rays of golden light that gather into a cross over her pupil.

116272010.content: She doesn't move quickly, but it still looks like she's running toward me with all her might.

116272011.content: When she reaches me, she breathlessly shoves a stack of cards and cash into my hands.

116272012.content: You lied to me, Tantan. You were never going to come...

116272013.content: This is probably the first time I've seen anger in her innocent eyes. But it doesn't last long, and she soon begins to smile.

116272014.content: Good thing I managed to catch up with you, huh?

116272015.content: I'm sorry, I just couldn't abandon Aether Gazer like that.

116272016.content: In the same way as I'm really important to you, the people of Aether Gazer took me in when I was at my most lost. I can't leave them to their fate when I know what danger they're in.

116272017.content: I understand. Since they're so important to you, Tantan, then I'll help you protect them.

116272018.content: Skuld nods her head, and I notice the golden cross in her eye has disappeared.

116272019.content: Now that I think about it, Uld's right eye also looked like that when he was using his powers.

116272020.content: Skuld, can you delete the alterations Uld has made to people's memories?

116272021.content: Yes, I can... And that's why he wanted my help when he first came to me.

116272022.content: What is it that he wants, exactly?

116272023.content: I didn't really understand... He just said something about how he could take the place of all the Modifiers. That he could become the true god of this world.

116272024.content: The arrogance of it... Is it puberty that's making him act like this?

116272025.content: But who cares what he wants? Administrator, we need to find the others—now we have Skuld with us, we stand a chance of waking them up.

116272027.content: Skuld, what we're about to do is very dangerous. This is mine and Ver's fight, so if you don't want to get involved...

116272028.content: I don't mind. If they're important to you, then they're important to me too.

116272029.content: And my visions will help you.

116272030.content: I... don't want you to use your visions anymore.

116272031.content: Haven't you noticed that the price of your visions is that you lose your own memories?

116281001.content: The two figures walk in perfect synch down the wide corridor between wards, seemingly oblivious to the broken walls, shattered glass, and occasional Access Keys scattered on the floor.

116281002.content: Pineapple, how much longer do we have to keep doing this?

116281003.content: You're always so impatient, Zenki, and Lord Uld wouldn't like that. Once he's finished writing his masterpiece, we'll get our chance to shine on stage.

116281004.content: But until then, it's our duty to safeguard the stage against the traitors and Visbanes who want to sabotage Lord Uld's work.

116281005.content: I wanna go outside and play... But since they're Lord Uld's orders...

116281006.content: Three pairs of footsteps can suddenly be heard coming down the corridor. Apollo and Zenki immediately draw their Access Keys, the muzzle pointing at the intruders' heads and the arrow at their hearts.

116281007.content: The coordination required for this display of tacit cooperation is far greater than their synchronized marching.

116281009.content: Oh, Ver. What are you doing here?

116281010.content: Did you deal with the traitors? Are you coming to report back to Lord Uld?

116281011.content: Ver doesn't reply, and instead scratches something on the wall with her Access Key.

116281013.content: Zenkibo and Apollo exchange a glance, then switch off their communicators.

116281014.content: We have bad guys in the building again?

116281016.content: Lord Uld has instructed me to lead you on a secret mission. We must find the traitors before they destroy everything.

116281019.content: Hold on... Who'll guard the stage here while we're gone?

116281020.content: Someone else is coming to take over from you. There are only medical bays on this floor and we have to take care of other places...

116281021.content: Upon hearing this answer, Apollo's face darkens and he swiftly aims his bow at Verthandi.

116281022.content: You dare say Lord Uld's chosen stage is a mere hospital! Are you disrespecting him?!

116281024.content: Oh yeah? Then why did you make that face when you called him "Lord" Uld?

116281025.content: What are you talking about?! Admin, what should I do?

116281026.content: Verthandi isn't quite sure how she should handle Apollo, whose voice and temper are now raised. Covering her earpiece, she mutters into the mic to ask for help.

116281028.content: She freezes, speechless. A split second later, she turns and runs.

116281029.content: Verthandi is also in cahoots with the enemy, Zenkibo. After her!

116282001.content: Say, "Someone else is coming to take over from you. There are only medical bays on this floor. There's somewhere else that needs protecting more..."

116282002.content: Stop, and then just walk off. The important thing is that they follow you, regardless...

116282003.content: Lying in wait next to the elevator, I pass Ver instructions over our communication devices in the hope she can lure Apollo and Zenkibo over.

116282004.content: Skuld is crouched behind me, poised to use her powers. However, things don't go according to plan...

116282005.content: I'd thought that would be a "safe" thing to say, and the last thing I expect is for Apollo to fly off the handle like this.

116282006.content: You dare say Lord Uld's chosen stage is a mere hospital! Are you disrespecting him?!

116282008.content: Oh yeah? Then why did you make that face when you called him "Lord" Uld?

116282012.content: Don't try to explain, he already suspects you. Just run!

116282013.content: Through the earpiece I can hear the sounds of arrows and bullets whistling past Ver, and the vibrations of the chase start to reach me through the floor. I gesture at Skuld to get ready.

116282016.content: From her hiding place, Skuld is looking in the direction of the fracas. As soon as she sees Ver sprinting down the corridor toward us, she slowly closes her eyes.

116282017.content: Ver turns in the air and blocks the bullets and arrows with her shield, allowing the impact of them to propel her further back toward the elevator.

116282018.content: Where do you think you're going? I'm not gonna let you ruin Lord Uld's masterpiece!

116282019.content: Apollo and Zenkibo continue their pursuit, but the archer's keen senses tell him that something's off. However, he's too late.

116282022.content: Skuld appears from behind them in the corridor. She opens her eyes slowly, and her left pupil blazes with a golden cross aimed directly at Apollo and Zenkibo.

116282023.content: The pair instinctively turn their weapons on her, but their hostility seems to dissipate instantly...

116282026.content: Zenkibo is stamping the ground angrily, and Apollo relaxes his trigger finger.

116282027.content: That tyrant Uld! You wait till I get my hands on him! I'm gonna pluck his hair off and use his face as a canvas!

116282028.content: And even the captain's under his control...

116282029.content: Yeah. It's going to be almost impossible for us to confront him head-on while he's got Thor... So we need to get her back.

116282030.content: But she's the captain! We're no match for her!

116282031.content: That's why Skuld needs to get you out of here first.

116282032.content: You're members of the Thunder Squad. You've been on plenty of missions with Thor. If anyone in Aether Gazer knows her, it's you guys.

116282033.content: And that's also why we know how powerful she can be...

116282034.content: Zenkibo and Apollo look at each other hopelessly. It's obvious they don't have a clue what we can do.

116282035.content: But it's not their fault—Thor's battle record speaks for itself. She has completed all her missions without hardly raising a finger, so it's hard to imagine her having any weaknesses we could exploit.

116282036.content: Before we try to think of something, why don't we go rescue someone else? The more brains we have, the better.

116282037.content: I press the elevator button to go up, but nothing happens.

116282038.content: I get a bad feeling of déjà vu, and look up at the speaker in the corner of the elevator.

116282039.content: As if responding to my gaze, the speaker suddenly begins blasting out a high-pitched alarm that seems to echo through the entire building.

116282041.content: Someone's activated the building lockdown system. Power to the elevators has been cut, and all major areas are locked down...

116291001.content: Oh no, we aren't gonna have to take on all of Aether Gazer, are we? That's like playing a game on Nightmare mode!

116291002.content: We make a run for the stairs. When sophisticated technology is no longer available to you, it's time to go back to the most primitive methods...

116291003.content: Of course, running down one hundred flights of stairs and escaping Aether Gazer isn't the best plan in the world. Zenkibo begins to pout as I bluntly lay out the facts of our situation.

116291004.content: We need to get out of this building, otherwise we'll find ourselves surrounded...

116291005.content: Tantan, the place where the airplanes are kept.

116291006.content: You mean the hangar on the roof?

116291007.content: Yes, there's a hangar nearby, and a passageway between the stairwells...

116291008.content: How does Skuld know the layout of the Aether Gazer building?

116291009.content: Another vision, this one clear as day. It's nighttime, and Skuld and I are supporting each other as we stumble from the stairs into a hangar...

116291011.content: We rush into the stairwell, and a red indicator light locks onto the electromagnetic lock of the door below. A laser fires, blasting the lock to pieces.

116291013.content: The Comet R4Y has got good firepower, but it's not enough to take on Thor...

116291014.content: Zenkibo is still muttering nervously to herself, but she dares not fall behind the rest of the group, and follows us to the hangar.

116291015.content: We suddenly emerge into the hangar, and my heart sinks.

116291016.content: What happened to the aircrafts here? Where are they?

116291017.content: The power's still on in here. I go and bring one over using the console.

116291018.content: Everyone rushes over to the console. I power it on, and soon my fingers are dancing across the keyboard.

116291019.content: ...There's an aircraft on the next level up that's big enough to carry all five of us.

116291020.content: I enter the final command, and the clanking of motors begins to sound from overhead.

116291021.content: The plane is conveyed outside of its hangar, and then rotated vertically so it can be brought down to us.

116291022.content: Phew... for a second there, I thought we were going to have to jump down.

116291023.content: Zenkibo lies on the floor and pokes her head off the top of the roof. The hundred-floor drop below makes her gulp.

116291024.content: Everyone is relieved upon seeing the plane, and we discuss what our next strategy should be as we walk over to the center of the hangar.

116291025.content: However, when the plane descends we all stop dead—because it's not just a plane that's been brought down.

116291028.content: Thor and Uld, still holding his scepter, jump lightly from the plane. Thor then smashes her hammer down on the nose of the plane, and it falls to one side like a spinning top.

116291029.content: She leans her hammer into the ground, activating her protective lightning cover, the surface of which begins to shimmer with golden ripples.

116291030.content: Thor looks at the shining gold light in Skuld's left eye with annoyance, seemingly unaffected by her power.

116291031.content: Pinky, I'm giving you one last chance to make the smart choice. Try to mess with my mind again, and you'll be the first person I kill.

116291032.content: Despite having three Modifiers on our side, Thor's threat sends a shiver down my spine. I shake my head at Skuld, who looks terrified, and step in front of her to shield her.

116291033.content: I'm bored of this cat-and-mouse game. Thor, deal with them.

116291034.content: Zenkibo, Apollo, leave this traitor and come back onto the team. I'll count to three.

116291035.content: Captain Thor! He cheated you—the Administrator isn't a traitor...

116291037.content: She shakes her head in disappointment at Zenkibo and Apollo's decision.

116291038.content: Come on then, let's get this over with.

116291039.content: Ver, Administrator, let Zenkibo and me lead the attack.

116291040.content: What?! Have you gone crazy, Pineapple?

116291041.content: Zenkibo, do you still remember our last operation in Shashvat?

116291042.content: Er... Do you mean that time I deployed the wrong explosives? You can't mean...

116291044.content: Apollo's face takes on an uncharacteristically serious expression, and he turns to look at me.

116291045.content: Administrator, there might be a way we can take down Thor, but there's no time to explain...

116291046.content: Zenkibo and I will find a way to lower her defenses, then you guys jump in and erase her false memories.

116291048.content: Haha, leave it to me and Zenki!

116291049.content: Huh? Odin and I haven't been away for that long and now you're cocky enough to challenge me?

116291050.content: I commend your bravery, Apollo, but this just isn't the time or place for it.

116291051.content: Apollo shrugs. His fingers curl around The Glare.

116291052.content: Do you remember back when Zenkibo and I first joined the Thunder Squad, captain? You thumped your chest and told us:

116291053.content: "As long as you two don't get in my way, the Thunder Squad will be invincible."

116291054.content: And why does that seem to inspire you with so much confidence?

116291055.content: Apollo looks straight into Thor's blank eyes and grins.

116291056.content: You're incredibly powerful, captain. Whenever you're involved in a mission, it gets wrapped up in record time before the rest of us can even do anything to help.

116291057.content: But it's just like you said—you're only invincible if Zenki and I don't get in your way. Well, guess what we're going to do now!

116291058.content: Apollo takes a deep breath and a look of calm determination comes to his face. Standing strong and proud, he aims a solar arrow at the speechless Thor.

116291059.content: I might be aiming my bow at you, but I still swear by the sun and the sky:

116291060.content: We have never betrayed you, Captain.

116291062.content: Thor does not appear to be as calm as her words would suggest. The setting sun extends her shadow all the way to our feet and I swear I can see it trembling, as though she is fighting against something.

116291063.content: But the glittering red light in her eyes compels her to raise her hammer anyway.

116291065.content: We don't have a hope of winning, but Goki and I will try our best anyway!

116291066.content: Come on, you have to say something better than that! Where's your fighting spirit?

116292003.content: Zenkibo skates circles around Thor, drawing her attention by spraying her with bullets as she goes. For a split second, Thor loses her balance—and Apollo has a solar arrow aimed straight at her head.

116292004.content: I'm the sun—and the sun never fails to blaze!

116292005.content: The charged solar arrow flies from Apollo's bow with a roar of wind, briefly illuminating the night sky. I hold my breath as I watch it sail straight for Thor. All of my hopes lie in this one arrow, and my heart stops beating. And then...

116292007.content: Thor didn't even have to dodge. The arrow brushes past her ear on a strange arcing trajectory, taking nothing more than a few strands of red hair with it.

116292009.content: Apollo, you said you won't miss!

116292011.content: As we stand there in shock, a creaking noise can be heard from up ahead.

116292012.content: The solar arrow had missed Thor and hit the antenna tower behind her instead. As it crumbles, it sways for a couple of seconds before starting to crash down toward Zenkibo.

116292015.content: Ver rushes forward with her sword drawn, but everything happens too quickly and she's too far away to save Zenkibo.

116292016.content: The tower crashes into the ground, sending up a plume of dust and debris in a deafening roar. We instinctively leap a few steps back.

116292018.content: You... idiot! You should have been able to dodge that!

116292020.content: Thor, what are you doing?! She's with that traitor Skuld! Your mission is to wipe them out!

116292021.content: It was you who said that the Thunder Squad were under Shu's spell, and if I could overpower them then there'd be a chance to make them change their minds!

116292022.content: Wha...? Dammit, I made the script too complicated and now there are holes in it!

116292023.content: Also, I don't know why but my body just moved like it was on autopilot. It was like... this had happened before.

116292024.content: Of course it has! How else would you explain that old back injury, Captain Invincible?

116292026.content:
Thor: "Are the explosives all in place? I'm going to lead the Visbanes here—when the time's right, you give the signal for Zenkibo to detonate, Apollo!"

Apollo & Zenkibo Tengu: "Understood!"

Thor: "Even though I'd be able to take them all out on my own, Shu said I need to give you guys a chance to actually put your training into practice, so that's what we're doing."

Thor: "Besides, it'll be good to prove to her and all the others that we've got brains as well as brawn!"

Zenkibo Tengu: "If you want to stop them with your brawn, I'm not going to complain..."

Thor: "Don't say that!"

116292032.content:
Thor: "I mean, it makes no difference to me, but do you really want people to think you guys are useless and just hide behind me on every op?"
