116421020.content: Anyway, you have my gratitude. Our partnership also—Hnngh!

116421022.content: A friendly reminder, Paracaesar—we are not partners. We are never on equal footing.

116421023.content: You're still breathing at the moment because I still have need of your little business. I can even allow you some room for your sideline that you've been dying to keep from me.

116421024.content: But you're a wise woman. A wise woman who knows where I draw my line.

116421025.content: Let... Let go of me... it's not... funny...

116421026.content: If you think I'm joking, feel free to have a try.

116421027.content: A shining, immaculate smile spreads across the silver-haired woman's face.

116421028.content: I... I understand... I won't... cross the line...

116421029.content: We have the same goal, I... I know that...

116421030.content: Do you... not want... to find her...?

116421032.content: I'm only joking, don't take it to heart. We're partners, after all.

116421033.content: Odin gently releases the researcher, letting her fall to the ground below.

116421035.content: As she watches Odin depart, Paracaesar relaxes slightly. Before coming to this meeting by herself, she'd prepared for the possibility that she might not return.

116421036.content: But she knew the consequences would be even worse if she didn't come.

116431002.content: According to your test results, you're fit as a fiddle, Administrator.

116431004.content: Why did you want a full-body examination all of a sudden? It hasn't been that long since your last physical. Are you feeling unwell at all?

116431005.content: No, I actually feel pretty normal.

116431006.content: It's just that... I've been having some strange dreams lately.

116431007.content: Maybe you're exhausted. Did you overdo it on your holiday with Ver and the others a few days back?

116431008.content: I heard you all went on a food and drink binge, and even went to that new amusement park afterward. Ah! Even I'm a little envious.

116431010.content: But if that's the reason, then shouldn't I be having fun, happy dreams instead?

116431011.content: These dreams, on the other hand...

116431012.content: Get back here, Zenki! Did you not finish a single one of the assignments I gave you before I left?!

116431013.content: I did, I really did! Have a li'l faith in me, Cap'!

116431014.content: Then why did you run off the second I said I wanted to check it? Dammit, how's Thunder Squad gonna be the strongest team if you're both always slacking off?!

116431015.content: Hey now, don't lump me in with her. I finished everything exactly as instructed!

116431016.content: Never mind, I must be overthinking it.

116431019.content: Relax, no need for the formalities. Didn't we already meet last night?

116431020.content: A lot's happened since I've been away from HQ. You and Shu have done well in my absence. Thank you.

116431022.content: I heard that the attacker was caught last night. Did the investigation reveal the assailant's identity?

116431023.content: Not yet. All we could confirm is that it was a rogue Modifier. The rest remains unknown.

116431024.content: Individuals this dangerous are more CORG's area of expertise, so I handed the case over to them. They'll keep us apprised of any developments.

116431027.content: I just can't shake the feeling that this is the calm before the storm... Still, I'm glad we caught him before he attacked anyone from Aether Gazer.

116431028.content: Indeed, perhaps there's a goddess of luck somewhere watching over us...

116431029.content: Is it really a goddess of luck who's been watching over us...?

116431030.content: Hm? What do you mean, Administrator?

116431031.content: N-Nothing. Sorry, maybe I really am a little tired. I'm gonna go to the canteen...

116431033.content: When I arrive at the canteen, Ver and Osiris are already there. They seem to be chatting about the events of our holiday.

116431034.content: While the news of the Modifier attacks came as a shock, because no one from Aether Gazer was hurt and the attacker was promptly captured, it didn't have a deep impact on anyone.

116431035.content: Yes! You were in really rough shape after the teacup ride, Admin.

116431036.content: Yeah, I was so dizzy I had to hold on to you for a while.

116431037.content: Huh? That's not what happened. You slunk off to a corner by yourself to recover.

116431038.content: How could you forget that already, Admin? That was just a few days ago.

116431039.content: I went off by myself...? Did I really misremember what happened?

116431040.content: It was too bad, really. We still had one more ride left...

116431041.content: Was the ride we didn't go on... the Ferris wheel...?

116431042.content: That's right. The soft opening for the rollercoaster was super busy, we couldn't even get a spot in line in the end—Huh? Are you okay, Admin?

116431045.content: Why... am I remembering things differently from everyone else? I keep getting... an image of someone else in my mind.

116431046.content: But I don't remember her at all. I don't even know her name.

116431047.content: But I just can't stop thinking about her—

116431048.content: It's like... we've already known each other for a long time.

116431049.content: Is this the way... to the amusement park...?

116431050.content: I feel like... we made plans to do something.

116431051.content: Do you want to save her?

116431053.content: The sudden voice rouses me from my thoughts, but the moment my head clears, I've been plunged into complete darkness.

116431054.content: Wasn't I just in the canteen? Where are Ver and Osiris? Where am I...?

116431055.content:
This is simply a quiet place partitioned out from a virtual data fortress.

I didn't want our meeting to be disturbed, and this is a solution I'm capable of executing.

116431057.content:
In a way. Everything in existence, including thoughts, appears as signals to me in the fortress.

I know you'd like to know my name and who I am, but I'm afraid that will all have to wait until we meet again in the real world.

Still, it's been a long, long time since we've been able to have a good talk like this. To celebrate the occasion, I have a gift for you.

Answer me this: Do you want to save her?

116431061.content: Save her... Do you know who she is?

116431062.content: I do. As I said, all things and thoughts in this world—even time and space—are visible to me here.

116431063.content: Can you help me remember those things?

116431066.content:
"Remember" refers to recalling things you've experienced.

Those images you're seeing never truly existed, nor do they belong to you. You simply happen to exist in them. That's why I can't help you remember them.

That said, I can tell you a little about her.

Like us, she was never meant to exist in this world.

But she opened Pandora's box, drawing from the well of her own past until she finally became a person "with no past, only a future."

116431071.content: Correct. And that future has everything to do with you.

116431072.content: Meanwhile, in the Aether Gazer director's office—

116431073.content: I hear there have been developments in your investigation in Xu Heng?

116431074.content: You could say that... But it's too soon to act.

116431075.content: Someone out there has been burying things and covering their tracks flawlessly—so flawlessly that I know something's amiss.

116431076.content: Like they say in Xu Heng: "The more you try to hide something, the more you expose it."

116431077.content: I've already been searching for this long, I can spare the time to play along with them...

116431078.content: There isn't much I can do to help, but you don't have to worry about things here at HQ while you're gone...

116431079.content: That's all I can ask for. If it weren't for you, I'd be drowning in endless administrative tasks and paperwork.

116431080.content: You'll return to Xu Heng in a few days, right? Will you be spending some time with the younger staff before you go? They haven't gotten to see much of you.

116431081.content: Heh... Of course. It's only a few days, but I also want to see how everyone—(Cough)!

116431085.content:
This "data" that never should have existed followed a beacon here to you before it dissipated. This is a highly unusual phenomenon.

As for why you became the beacon, I suppose it's because its contents were filled with you.

The gravitational force you exert overpowers even the rules of this world that normally govern the recycling of these impurities.

But these things are like drifting spring dandelion seeds that happen to land at your feet—

even without your intervention, in just a few steps, they'll float away all on their own without ever impacting you or this world.

116431091.content:
You can, but it won't be easy.

Too many wish her dead—

the one who made her, the one entrusted with the task, old friends who walk a different path, as well as those who don't want her existence to be discovered.

If you want to save her, it means you'll be setting yourself against all of them.

If you want to forge a way out amid that much desire to kill... Even I would only have one chance to get it right.

116431096.content: Do you remember who she is?

116431098.content: I don't remember her name and I can barely remember her face, let alone what exactly we experienced together.

116431099.content: And yet, you still want to save her?

116431101.content:
Wonderful. You haven't changed at all from before. I'm actually a little jealous.

That girl has already died.

Her body was destroyed two days ago. Not in the future or in a dream—she was erased from this world in the true sense of the word.

116431104.content:
The passing of life, the flow of time—all are bound by the rules of this world. So-called "visions" are nothing more than a limited form of resistance.

But we're different—we were once beings existing above this false world.

If you wish it, I will do it for you. If you dislike it, I can change it for you...

To that end, even reversing time is a minor undertaking.

116431109.content: It's not a vision, time itself is actually being affected... The only one capable of something like this is...

116431117.content: Lightning tears a golden rift in the dark, cloudy sky. All at once, rain pours down into the gloomy alley, like a stage being hosed clean for an imminent performance.

116431118.content: Fully-equipped squads armed with guns rush by. An electric current crackles in their ears, followed by the orders of their commander—

116431119.content: According to our latest report, escaped test subject 0705 has yet to be retrieved. All squads, comb the area. 0705 must be found tonight.

116431121.content: Huh? What's with this rain all of a sudden...

116431122.content: Odin, are you still going out in this downpour? Why don't I come with you?

116431124.content: No need. You head back to HQ, I can handle this myself.

116431125.content: The silver-haired woman reaches out to catch the raindrops falling into her palm. The moment each droplet lands on her glove, it's as if a tremor is sent through some thread of fate hanging in the underworld.

116431126.content: Though unable to pinpoint the source of this feeling of uneasiness, she silently breaks into a run for the deep alleyway.

116431127.content: As lightning flashes, a girl stares at the huge wheel without giving the slightest thought to avoiding the rain. She stumbles as she continues to run toward the uncertain scene lying on the other side of the exit.

116431128.content: Is this the way... to the amusement park...?

116431129.content: Yes, right, the Ferris wheel... We made plans... to go back there together...

116431130.content: Gleaming with neon lights, the cylindrical pods rise to their apex one by one, then slowly descend back down.

116431131.content: She runs towards the rays of light with a smile on her face. But then, a figure comes around a corner and blocks her path.

116431132.content: The two collide, and the girl, losing her balance, begins to fall—

116431133.content: She reaches out instinctively, and before she hits the ground, she feels the other person catch her firmly by her right hand.

116431135.content: Though supported by the other person, the girl, having already reached her limits, is unable to remain standing. She slumps limply to the rain-soaked asphalt, and her eyes slowly lose their focus and color.

116431136.content: I made a promise... a promise to ride the Ferris wheel with someone... Was that... you?

116431137.content: I don't remember your name either, so... I guess this must be our first time meeting.

116431139.content: We've never met before, but... can I ask you to trust me?

116431141.content: The girl's vision blurs—she sees the shadowy figure crouches down, quickly draws a short-barreled gun from the waist.

116431142.content: Then releases the safety, loads the gun, and aims it at her.

116431143.content: This is hard to explain right now, but lots of people are coming this way and we don't have a lot of time, so—Huh?

116431144.content: The girl moves, interrupting these urgent words. Her bruised, battered hands embrace me, and teardrops colder than the rain fall on my exposed neck.

116431146.content: I don't remember you, but I trust you.

116431147.content: Her words are so faint, it's as if I can clearly feel her frail life fading away—But at the same time, her voice carries a strong sense of delight and determination.

116431150.content: I take a long breath, then aim the muzzle at the temple of the girl in my arms.

116431154.content: Logistics, take care during the reclamation! This is important experimental material!

116431155.content: And remember to clean up the area when you're done. By dawn, it should look like nothing happened there at all!

116431156.content: We made it in time... Once I noticed that 0705 was missing, I had everyone search the entire city for her. We're lucky we found her before the end...

116431157.content: Speaking of which, surely there was no need for such brutality?

116431160.content: The situation was already like this when I arrived.

116431161.content: Ma'am! We've confirmed that these are the remains of artificial lifeform 0705. Except...

116431163.content: Except her central chip is missing... But it wouldn't be strange if something that small didn't survive such intense damage.

116431165.content: Strange. You didn't do this, nor did any of my people... Could she have been attacked by 0704 or a wandering Visbane?

116431167.content: Odin looks up at the now-clear night sky. The dark clouds have dispersed, and the moon and stars are faintly shining again.

116431169.content: As sudden as it was deliberate—to wash things off.

120011001.content: "In the beginning, all was dim. Then, the outlines of the profound truth grew increasingly clear, a profound truth that, though not perceptible through the senses, illuminates every inch of aether and makes all phenomena possible. An eye unmoored which sees the illusory sees truth itself..."

120011002.content: Odin's long, slender fingers, gloved in leather, brush against the yellowed spine of a thick book titled "The Emerald Microcosm." Closing the tome, her gaze shifts to the placid visage of the woman seated across from her.

120011003.content: ... You seem deep in thought. What's on your mind?

120011004.content: The woman with white hair shakes her head at Odin's question.

120011005.content: With a perfectly calm demeanor girded by a deep and unshakeable poise as well as steady gaze, she is holding her own just fine despite having the powerful Odin seated opposite her.

120011006.content: Surely tending to the business of Xu Heng is already keeping you busy all day long. How do you even find the time to read?

120011007.content: Reading broadens your horizons. I've read just about every book in the library.

120011008.content: You should take this with you if you're interested.

120011009.content: "An eye unmoored which sees the illusory sees truth itself." I guess that is, when an unattached mind perceives the most profound untruths, it is always exactly the reality.

120011010.content: Is it trying to tell me something about... the Visbanes? About Gaea? Or am I reading too much into this?

120011011.content: There's trouble everywhere now, and we haven't located the Source of the Visbanes. Worse, we're now seeing something called the Cognizant Visbane... I think I'll leave the reading until the Visbanes have been eradicated.

120011012.content: In the last few years, have we known more about the Source?

120011013.content: I've hit a dead end with the leads we found. I'm afraid that we won't get any further unless we find out who "that person" is.

120011014.content: Besides, the Cinders are my absolute priority right now.

120011016.content: I know. They might be the Source of the Cognizant Visbanes, or they might be just meaningless noises. Or maybe I'm trying to find something that isn't there to begin with... But I'll do everything I can to find out.

120011017.content: The data of Cinders and the Cognizant Visbanes share many similarities, suggesting that even if we're not looking at the source here, there's definitely a relationship between the two. That's why the Cinders are hidden in the Source Layer.

120011019.content: You know what's happened recently... in Neuhansa, in Sasanami, and in Omorfies. This era is running out of time.

120011020.content: The appearance of the Cognizant Visbanes is a very bad sign.

120011021.content: We Prime Modifiers aren't the only ones who have remained through the various Reboots, and we've failed to discern the true form of the enemy even at this stage. Things are just going to get worse...

120011022.content: Unlike the Visbanes, we can't afford to fail again and again. We don't have the luxury of time.

120011024.content: The worst situation you can imagine.

120011026.content: Of course, I didn't share the disturbing sights from my hazy visions with the others.

120011027.content: If there is a way out of this, I will find it. And if there isn't...

120011028.content: Odin casually drops "The Emerald Microcosm" on the table and shifts to a more comfortable position.

120011029.content: I will plan for the worst. We have to chase down whatever leads we have at this point.

120011030.content: Did Thor not come with you?

120011031.content: I told her to remain at Aether Gazer because of all that's going on in Ain Soph.

120011032.content: Something's not quite right. Maybe something's happened, something that even CORG and I aren't aware of...

120011034.content: Something to do with time, maybe? Memories? Or even... the Source?

120011035.content: You said that you hit a dead end with the leads we found.

120011036.content: But can you call something you don't know a "lead"? I'm just going based on instinct. Having said that, my hunches do tend to be right.

120011037.content: It all happened at CORG, and by the time I got there, it was over. There was nothing I could do.

120011038.content: Maybe CORG is in the dark too, or maybe they're hiding something... Tell me, do you still trust CORG after the Cloudsong Crisis?

120011039.content: We never heard from CORG despite the seriousness of what happened. That makes them unfit for purpose in my opinion.

120011040.content: To be honest, I've stopped expecting anything from CORG since the last era.

120011041.content: But the trouble is, someone inside CORG may be hatching something, thinking that they can pull a fast one. You know how dangerous that can be.

120011042.content: Well, with the agreement in place, we've no right to look into CORG's inner workings. And there's no need for us to, either...

120011043.content: The woman with an otherworldly elegance closes her eyes, gently exhales, and continues speaking.

120011044.content: I'll go with you to look for the Cinders.

120011045.content: Hmm? I didn't think you'd be interested in that.

120011046.content: This is in Xu Heng after all. And I'm happy to help with anything that may lead to eradicating the Visbanes.

120011047.content: So you know, I've been doing a little research since you returned to Ain Soph. I may have found some useful clues.

120011048.content: Also, dangers lurk everywhere in the Source Layer. It's not advisable for anyone to go there alone, not even you.

120011049.content: Someone's really taking the time to explain herself here. You must be really interested in this.

120011053.content: Like I've told you so many times, I need you alive. I need all of you alive. I'd be really mad if anything bad happens to you.

120011055.content: The sound of water flowing can be heard inside the superbly landscaped courtyard. The white-haired female looks at Odin with an air of equanimity. Odin starts to smile, then shakes her head.

120011057.content: I know what's on your mind, as you've come here yourself.

120011058.content: Heh. However you please. I'm a guest here after all.

120011059.content: ... Let's make a deal, then. Allow me to borrow something from Aether Gazer in exchange.

120011063.content: That's quite a "something" you're asking for.

120011064.content: Odin rises and exits the pavilion. As she does so, she smoothly pushes the copy of "The Emerald Microcosm" toward her companion.

120011065.content: Keep the book. It's time we get moving.

120011066.content: What's on my mind as I place my finger on the trigger?

120011067.content: What we call "consciousness" can only take us to the cusp of action. What follows from there is pure instinct: shooting, bracing yourself for the recoil, aiming again, emptying the magazine, reloading...

120011068.content: The only thing on my mind in that moment is...

120011069.content: The target I have in my crosshair.

120011070.content: There's an old saying in Xu Heng that goes: The gentleman only resorts to weapons when left with no other devices.

120011071.content: ... Being "left with no other devices" is really just another name for being powerless...

120011072.content: There's an old saying in Xu Heng that goes: Those who initiate wars use force as a means and seek political power as their purpose.

120011074.content: But either way, at the end of the day, in this world where justice may be carried out in an unjust way, someone has to pay the price for others.

120011077.content: I jerk forward involuntarily as someone gently pushes me from behind. After turning around, I see Ver with one hand on her head and looking at me rather quizzically.

120011078.content: I gaze back at her, and then look around with my mouth agape: the open streets here, though visibly older than those of Ain Soph in a classical sort of way, seem to suggest the existence of a more advanced technology. I find myself at a loss for words.

120011079.content: What's going on, Admin? Why are we stopping here?

120011080.content: Like a fallen leaf that has risen to the water's surface, I slowly become aware again of the hustle and bustle around me, and realize my mind has been wandering.

120011081.content: Sorry, I got a little distracted... Where are we?

120011082.content: Let me see... Oh, we've arrived!

120011083.content: We're on the shopping street at high noon, and the place is packed with vehicles and shoppers. I catch sight of the words "Pingkang" on a street sign, and then right behind it, a giant golden signboard hanging off the facade of a three-story commercial building.

120011084.content: Pingkang Street... Tian Lu Traders... We've arrived indeed. The Quad says someone called Jianbing will be meeting us...

120011085.content: I place my index finger on the new tactical headset I've brought with me.

120011086.content: Mimir, place a call to Ms. Odin, please.

120011087.content: ... Unable to connect. Signal source not found.

120011088.content: (Sighs) Looks like she's disappeared... after calling us here.

120011089.content: But Ms. Odin is always busy attending to something important, isn't she...?

120011090.content: And you know, it feels a little strange to hear the great Lord Mimir talk like that. In such a serious manner.

120011091.content: It's just an instance after all, which functions by calling a part of Lord Mimir's computing power.

120011092.content: I reach for the portable Mimir device hanging from my belt. It is the size of my fist and not heavy at all. The pale blue light shining around its head indicates that the device is working normally.

120011093.content: Hmm? Surely this tiny thing can't hold a candle to Mimir!

120011094.content: Heimdall said this is a prototype... Let's just trust the Cryptics on this one. Otherwise, we could consider this mission failed already.

120011095.content: Speaking of the mission... It's a really odd one, isn't it? I mean, they didn't say much except that you're to bring Mimir here to Xu Heng.

120011096.content: Are we really just here as Lord Mimir's bodyguards? That's rather... underwhelming.

120011097.content: I hear that this mission was assigned by Ms. Odin herself. So let's just trust her and do our job.

120011098.content: And let's find ourselves a place to sit while we wait for this Jianbing. Who knows, he may be running late.

120011099.content: Oh look, there's a noodle shop over there! I can smell it from here!

120011100.content: You've been eyeing it for a while, aren't ya?

120011101.content: No wonder Verthandi has noticed this joint. It's more packed than a street magic performance in Omorfies.

120011102.content: In fact, its business has even spilled out onto the street. Even as more customers arrive every minute, one can still hear the workers heartily calling out to the crowd.

120011103.content: Verthandi and I each order a bowl of noodles, and a jaunty young man even gives up his seat for us.

120011105.content: You're welcome. Besides, it wouldn't be nice of me to hog a table when I'm already done.

120011106.content: Is this your first time in Xu Heng? How long will you be taking in the sights here?

120011107.content: Huh? We're not here for fun.

120011109.content: Well, neither of you are dressed like merchants, and you don't look like you're here visiting family, either. If you aren't tourists... tell me, what is your business here in Xu Heng?

120011110.content: We're headed for the Tian Lu Traders.

120011111.content: The Tian Lu Traders, huh? Looks like your business is with the Quad.

120011112.content: I won't take up more of your time, then. Keep walking that way, then take a left turn at the third intersection. It's a tall building with a huge courtyard, so you won't miss it.

120011113.content: Ver and I share a look as we watch the young man leave.

120011114.content: That guy... seems to be really interested in us.

120011115.content: You know what they say: you never know who you're talking to in Xu Heng. We should definitely be more cautious as we go about our business here.

120011116.content: Our noodles are soon brought to our table, along with some tea.

120011117.content: Verthandi picks up her chopsticks, but soon stops mid-motion to stare at her beverage.

120011119.content: Incredible. There's no swaying or any other sign that we're actually hovering in the air...

120011120.content: There's nary a ripple on the surface of the tea. All I see are wisps of steam rising and drifting languidly, as time on this peaceful Xu Heng street passes by.

120011121.content: Then, as if on cue, Ver and I look up from the cup at the same time to observe the great machine in the sky. It's an extraordinary sight no matter how many times you look at it.

120011122.content: It is a massive creation, so large it could be a building, and yet it hovers in the air. Circles of rippling energy emanate from its shining core, pulsing rings of light that look like they've come from a beating heart.

120011123.content: This beating heart has created an invisible non-gravitational field in the sky, firmly tethering dozens of islands big and small to their respective positions in space.

120011124.content: You know, I didn't think much of this when I saw it on the screen before. But looking at it from here in Xu Heng is a completely different experience altogether.

120011125.content: This is the most advanced gravitational tech in existence today. Things like flying trains are nothing compared to this.

120011126.content: The Astral Engine... So the folks who invited us, the Quad, they're the ones who're in charge of this machine?

120011127.content: I was hoping to take a closer look at it, but according to our brief, the Astral Engine is the Quad's most tightly held secret. I wonder what's on it...

120011128.content: I did a bit of reading before coming to Xu Heng. Seems that an accident called the Cloudsong Crisis happened here nearly a hundred years ago. It was only ended thanks to the Astral Engine.

120011129.content: Better not to bring up the Astral Engine while we're at Tian Lu Traders. We're outsiders, after all.

120011130.content: Got it. I was just a little curious, that's all...

120011131.content: ... Eat up. The noodles will get soggy if you leave them sitting in the soup like that.

120011132.content: Mmm. I can see why this place is so popular. These noodles are really delicious.

120011133.content: Looks like there could be good food everywhere here. Do you think we can put in a request to stay here in Xu Heng for a few days longer, Admin?

120011134.content: I'm sure that's alright. A couple days' break after a field mission is pretty normal, I'd think.

120011135.content: And if anyone else in Aether Gazer is keen, like Lil' Osi or Poseidon, we could invite them, too!

120011136.content: Huh? Call the others...? Oh. I was actually hoping to...

120011137.content: Hmm? What were you hoping for?

120011139.content: Ver hastily picks up her cup of tea and takes a big gulp as she turns her head to scan the street outside.

120011140.content: Do you see anyone from the Quad, Admin?

120011141.content: Not yet. I've been keeping an eye out since we started eating. Since the Quad is an administrative institution, we should be able to recognize whoever they send pretty easily. Let's wait a while more.

120011143.content: The interjection comes as a surprise to Ver and I, and we both turn reflexively to see an aloof-looking young man.

120011144.content: He looks us up and down, as if he's studying our attire. Then, he waves at the shop owner to come over.

120011145.content: You can put their bill on my tab.

120011148.content: Yes, that's me. I've been instructed to escort the two of you to Tian Lu Traders.

120011149.content: Jianbing deftly signs for the bill and leads us out of the noodle shop. We walk straight ahead, then make a left at the third intersection... Just like the young man said to.

120011150.content: Jianbing doesn't say a word along the journey, which make Ver and I slightly uncomfortable with the silence.

120011151.content: Um... Mr. Jianbing, could you tell us what we're here for?

120011152.content: Don't ask those kind of questions out here.

120011153.content: About the job... We've got to keep it under wraps. Not a word of it can get out.

120011154.content: This is very important. I hope the two of you will be careful.

120011155.content: ... Since we're here at the Quad's request, we will abide by their plans, as long as they respect our principles.

120011157.content: After turning left at the intersection and crossing another street, we can already see the expansive compound. Somehow it blends pretty well into the city center.

120011159.content: Hmm? Why is she out here?

120011160.content: I see you're getting along well, huh?

120011161.content: This must be the "she" Jianbing was talking about.

120011162.content: I instantly recognize the girl from the business news channel. She's wearing a pair of old-fashioned round-rimmed glasses and playing with a copper coin. I see her waving at us from a distance.

120011163.content: Hi, I'm Luliang, CEO of the Tian Lu Traders.

120011164.content: And I'm #{nickname}#, Administrator of Aether Gazer Division Nine. This is Verthandi, of our Overture Squad.

120011165.content: This is your first visit to Xu Heng, isn't it? Like it so far?

120011167.content: Glad to hear that. Any guest of the Quad is a guest of ours, too. Make yourselves at home here, and let us know if you need anything.

120011168.content: I'd love to take you around Yu Jing, but I've got some business at hand now. Gotta take a rain check today, I guess.

120011169.content: Follow me. I'll take you to see your client.

120021002.content: What do you mean you could only shave off five points? And they want an exclusivity agreement, too? I told you to decline the offer if you couldn't get the price down to two-twenty-four a ton. What, do I have to do the math again for you?

120021003.content: They think they have the upper hand because they have goods in stock. Come on! We've got another two potential suppliers in Shashvat! A little extra transportation fee surely won't be a problem for us!

120021004.content: They can keep raising their prices all they want, but we don't have to take it. Twelve points less, that's our final offer. If they don't accept, so be it!

120021005.content: After we follow Luliang into the building, she turns her attention to an incoming call. I remember hearing a few admonitory talks of this sort in Shu's office as well...

120021006.content: Though speaking with a harsh tone, Luliang seems rather relaxed judging from her expression. As she ends the call, she turns to us and shrugs.

120021007.content: I still think you're too soft on them. They didn't do their jobs properly.

120021008.content: Good manners are good business. Scowling and shouting at them won't do any good.

120021009.content: Newbies don't have the gut to push back, you know, especially when they're negotiating with a more seasoned opponent. And then their boss has to step in and do their work for them.

120021010.content: What sort of business is the company engaged in, anyway?

120021011.content: We've got our fingers in a bunch of pies: tech, logistics, processing and manufacturing, advertising, business development, technical support... There's more, but I'm afraid I'll bore you.

120021012.content: That sounds a bit like Aether Gazer.

120021013.content: Yeah, that's what business looks like when you get to this scale.

120021014.content: But you know, unlike Aether Gazer, we usually deal with stuff that's more of a brick-and-mortar business, from gravitational Photon Rail technology to those snack carts you see all over town...

120021015.content: In fact, half the businesses you saw back there on Pingkang Street have received support from us at one time or another.

120021016.content: Support, you say? Do you mean investments?

120021017.content: Oh, come on! "Investments" sounds so transactional! We help each other out!

120021018.content: You know, I'm something of a business genius myself. It'd be such a waste to just use those talents for my own benefit... Here we are.

120021019.content: After walking through Tian Lu Traders for a while, we come to a door. It looks like it might lead to a clinic. We can make out the voices of people talking inside.

120021021.content: Our company does a fair bit of trucking business on the ground and across the Sephirah Zones. Some employees inevitably have health issues from all that traveling, so we need a place to take care of them.

120021022.content: It just so happens that your client is a physician who's rather passionate about her calling. That's why I've brought you here.

120021023.content: Luliang pushes open the door. I see a bed, but hardly any high-tech medical devices. A pleasant, calming fragrance is coming from an incense burner in the corner of the room.

120021024.content: Hey Lingguang, hey Linyu, how's it going?

120021027.content: A woman sitting by the bed turns to look at us. She nods to Jianbing and then, seeing Ver and I, her expression softens.

120021028.content: Oh, are you our guests from Aether Gazer? Just a moment, please. Linyu, I need you to write down the prescription.

120021030.content: Please continue. Don't worry about us.

120021031.content: Lingguang nods her head in acknowledgement and continues to check her patient's pulse. The young girl next to her watches us with great curiosity until Lingguang states her diagnosis, at which point she lowers her head and starts scribbling in earnest.

120021032.content: ... Alright, I've written it all down. Here's your prescription.

120021033.content: Nothing to worry about, though an inflamed wound can cause some really unpleasant symptoms. Just take your medicine as prescribed and you should be back to normal in a few days.

120021034.content:
Thank you...
How much do I owe you, Doctor?

120021035.content: Don't worry, I don't charge for my services. As for the medicine...

120021036.content: I'm running a little low now, but just get in touch with the Vermilion Wellness and they'll have your medicine sent to you immediately. You can pay for it at a later date.

120021037.content: Thank you so much! Um, also... About the attack on our factory... I honestly can't remember a thing...

120021038.content: That's alright. If you can't remember, don't force yourself.

120021039.content: Just focus on getting better for now. The Quad will get to the bottom of things, I'm sure...

120021040.content: Lingguang came to her diagnosis almost in a second, but neither the patient nor Linyu, the young girl beside her, doubted her at all. Instead, all I see in their eyes is nothing but the utmost trust and gratitude.

120021041.content: After settling her patient in, Lingguang leaves the ward with the young woman named Linyu, closes the door gently, and nods to Ver and myself.

120021042.content: We may be meeting for the first time, but you don't feel at all like strangers to me.

120021043.content: I'm Lingguang, the Quad's deputy of the South Isle. And this is Linyu, disciple of the deputy of the North Isle, Zhiming.

120021044.content: Good afternoon! On behalf of my master, I'll like to express my gratitude to you and to Aether Gazer!

120021045.content: I suppose you've already met Jianbing, deputy of the West Isle?

120021046.content: Yes. In fact, he's the one who brought us here.

120021047.content: Mmm. I apologize for any offense Jianbing may have caused you, then.

120021049.content: Without bothering to explain himself further, Jianbing simply walks nonchalantly to the elevator.

120021050.content: Right. Now that everyone's here, you can start your meeting or whatever, and I can get out of here.

120021051.content: Just come get me when it's time to leave.

120021052.content: Lingguang shakes her head and gives a sigh as she watches Jianbing exit.

120021053.content: That Jianbing just can't, or won't, sit still. Please don't mind h—Huh?

120021056.content: All of a sudden, Lingguang reaches for my hand and places two fingers on my wrist. Before I realize what's going on, she shuffles closer to me and runs her fingers over the side of my neck, my chest, my abdomen... and finally stops on my arm.

120021058.content: My heart suddenly starts beating faster, and I shake my head at Lingguang reflexively. She opens her mouth as if to say something, then lets go of my hand.

120021059.content: Your breathing shows clear signs of poor energy flow, but your pulse and heartbeat are perfectly normal... Tell me, do you feel any discomfort?

120021060.content: Huh? Are you feeling unwell, Admin?

120021062.content: Really? You should never lie to a doctor, you know.

120021063.content: I'm feeling right as rain. If anything, I've been feeling rather bored lately. I haven't gone anywhere outside of Aether Gazer HQ.

120021065.content: The scent of medicinal herbs around me slowly dissipates, and I awkwardly touch the place on my arm where her fingers were.

120021066.content: That's typical of Lingguang. She gets real concerned when she think she's spotted something wrong.

120021067.content: Alright, let's not stand in the hallway all day now. I have a room for you. Come with me.

120021069.content: We hear Linyu exclaim suddenly and immediately turn around to see what's happened. She must have fallen, for I see her being helped up by an elegant woman.

120021071.content: Are you alright? Is this yours?

120021072.content: I'm okay. It was my fault... My pouch!

120021073.content: The woman bends over and picks up a potpourri pouch from the ground, then hands it to Linyu. The girl hurriedly grabs for it before looking it over. After confirming it is all good and intact, she looks visibly relieved.

120021074.content: It seems rather important to you.

120021075.content: Yes, my sister made it for me...

120021077.content: So you're here, Miss Luliang! No wonder I didn't see you in the office... Oh look, Doctor Lingguang is here, too.

120021078.content: And are the two of you... guests of the company?

120021079.content:
Ah, they're our guests from Aether Gazer.
This is Lady Gremory, trade agent of a foreign mining company.

120021080.content: Aether Gazer? That's one of the biggest commercial entities in Ain Soph! What an honor to meet you.

120021081.content: The woman named Gremory seems rather enthused about Aether Gazer. For some reason, her gentle-looking gaze makes my head spin.

120021082.content: How's the patient doing, Doctor Lingguang?

120021084.content: Yes, he's an employee of ours.

120021085.content: Oh, not to worry. He should recover soon enough with treatment.

120021087.content: Is there something you want to discuss with me? We can do it in my office. I'll be over in five minutes.

120021088.content: Oh no, nothing of the sort. I'm just here to touch base on behalf of the other enterprises.

120021089.content: Since your company has been such a loyal partner of the Quad, I'm sure whatever you say will carry some weight over there...

120021090.content: What's on your mind? Speak up, we're all trustworthy partners here.

120021091.content: Well, there's nothing to hide indeed. We need some clarity on the attacks on the cargo transport and warehouse.

120021092.content: In the interest of discretion, I've been asked by the enterprises in other Sephirah Zones to look into the situation on their behalf.

120021093.content: We've been counting our losses, and many of our employees are still in hospital. We're not sure if the Xu Heng authorities fully grasp the seriousness of what's happening...

120021094.content: As you can imagine, if they are unable to do so, the companies like ours, and particularly the foreign ones, will have to reconsider our trade and business commitments here in Xu Heng.

120021095.content: Ms. Luliang... It's already been three days.

120021096.content: The Quad has already began investigating the matter. We all know that nothing is what it seems with these cases... and investigations take time.

120021097.content: But you're right to say that the Quad has to propose a satisfactory solution for commerce to resume as before. It's only in the Quad's best interests to do so, so please trust in our investigation for now.

120021098.content: I understand what you're saying, but for our businesses, the outcome is all that matters...

120021099.content: Please don't take this the wrong way, Ms. Luliang. I'm only here to convey a message from the business community. Please know that this is deeply unsettling for us.

120021100.content: I'll inquire with the Quad regarding the investigation. But I can't promise anything beyond that.

120021101.content: Besides, we're all in the same boat here. If things go south, our company will suffer nothing less than you do...

120021102.content: Luliang swiftly tosses the copper coin she's holding into the air and catches it again. Tails. She grimaces in resignation.

120021103.content: I'm gonna get the jerks who did this sooner or later!! Like to get between me and my money, huh? Well I'll make sure you lose everything, even the shirt off your back!

120021104.content: Ugh, what a pain. But I guess I really should check in on the businesses in the outer zone.

120021105.content: You can talk in this room. It's private, I assure you. I'll see you later!

120021106.content: My dear guests from Ain Soph, if you have any questions, just ask Lingguang... if you're interested, that is.

120021107.content: Luliang closes the door behind her, and a silence descends on the reception room. I think back to the peaceful scenes Ver and I witnessed in Xu Heng on our way here, wondering if I wasn't paying close enough attention then.

120021108.content: Just how bad is the situation?

120021110.content: These aren't your run-of-the-mill attacks... We found signs of Encroacher Type Visbane activity.

120021111.content: Since the five isles of Xu Heng hover in the air, we typically stay clear of the Visbanes.

120021112.content: It's been more than two decades since we've lost a human life in an incident. What's more, neither the Quad nor the Tian Lu Traders ever saw the Visbanes coming.

120021113.content: The more peaceful a place is, the more signs of disorder create panic. And once trust is lost, it's hard to restore it again.

120021114.content: Indeed. Mengzhang, deputy of the East Isle, is investigating the matter. I have confidence in him. He's a shrewd observer with a great analytical mind, plus he has CORG's help as well.

120021115.content: He was supposed to come along with us, but he decided that a Visbane intrusion was far too serious a matter for him to wait...

120021116.content: ... I'm sorry, I've gotten off topic. Please, take a seat.

120021117.content: We take our seats in the reception room. Things are starting to feel familiar again... It's as if I'm back in Aether Gazer's Command Room.

120021118.content: Deputy Lingguang, the purpose of our trip wasn't made clear to me, actually. And deputy Jianbing has warned us not to speak about it... What is the concern here, exactly?

120021119.content: It's a grave matter indeed, so please excuse us.

120021120.content: First, I should let you know that the request was initiated by the founder of the Quad, Gengchen, our chief.

120021121.content: Lingguang stops for a moment to organize her thoughts, then continues.

120021122.content: I suppose you saw the Astral Engine on your way here...?

120021123.content: The story goes that the Quad managed to end the Cloudsong Crisis by building the Astral Engine... but few know the heavy price that was paid.

120021124.content: Chief Gengchen is a Prime Modifier, and her power has been bound to the Astral Engine since then. It is this great personal sacrifice of hers that allows the Engine to continue running.

120021125.content: But nothing lasts forever. The Prime Power that keeps it going is breaking down after all these years.

120021126.content: I've been trying to find a way to repair her power, or to find a suitable replacement, but I've had no luck so far.

120021127.content: If I don't find a solution, not only will Gengchen's life be in danger, but when the Astral Engine stops working, Xu Heng will plunge into chaos.

120021128.content: Ver and I look at each other. Suffice to say, we're well and truly astounded.

120021129.content: So this concerns the very existence of Xu Heng... And I thought this mission was going to be a walk in the park...

120021130.content: I guess you're hoping the Mimir system can be of help, then?

120021131.content: Yes. I recall that when the Astral Engine was still on the drawing board, the designers came up with a part called the Heterocore. It didn't have much of an effect back then.

120021132.content: But last month, the chief suddenly told us that the Heterocore can be used to repair the Prime Power. The problem is, we have no idea where it is. All we have is a handful of broad parameters to identify it.

120021133.content: So, we invited you two here, hoping to use Mimir's computing power to help us collect and analyze data signals to locate the Heterocore.

120021135.content: This being such a serious matter, I could only tell you about it face to face. Please keep it to yourselves to avoid causing panic.

120021136.content: Most certainly. Anyway, we're bound to secrecy regarding all matters involving Modifiers.

120021137.content: Alright, where do I start then?

120021138.content: Lingguang takes out a data chip and stands up to hand it to me.

120021139.content: This is a data sample for the Heterocore.

120021140.content: Mimir, analyze the sample data, then screen for stray data signals and identify the respective sources.

120021141.content: I check the device and see from the indicator light that it's started working. Feeling assured, I place the device on the table.

120021142.content: Is this Mimir? It's so tiny, like a little kitten...

120021143.content: Oh, this is just a Mimir terminal. We were unable to bring Mimir himself outside Aether Gazer for technical reasons.

120021144.content: This tiny device does contain the Mimir system's computing framework. While it doesn't have Mimir's personality, its computing power should be similar to Mimir's.

120021145.content: It looks like a fully automatic device to me. So why is it I hear that you're the only one who can operate the Mimir system?

120021146.content: This thing is linked to my nervous system through these wristbands over here. I've been told that anyone else would not be able to withstand the system load. I don't feel a thing though, to be honest...

120021147.content: I hold up my hands to show her the pair of red and blue wristbands I'm wearing. These trinkets have become part of my signature look now.

120021148.content: I see... Standalone modules made possible by miniaturization technology! I definitely learned something new today.

120021150.content: Stray data signals filtered according to conditions provided. Unable to infer signal source location. Insufficient remaining signal samples. Sample exhaustion rate: 98.08%. Higher than the threshold for traceability.

120021151.content: The signal source may be too far away, or there is a high degree of random non-relation between the conditions provided. Please check the analysis parameters and try again.

120021154.content: It means that the signals are too weak and the Heterocore isn't in the air... Which makes sense, since the Quad would have found it already if it's on any of the five isles.

120021155.content: Looks like you'll have to start looking down below.

120021156.content: It does look that way... There's an engineering passage at Port Carp that leads to the ground. It's often used by our environmental surveyors, construction workers, and goods transports... Let's use that.

120021157.content: However, I must warn you that given Xu Heng's size, the search may take some time...

120021158.content: Well, we'll do the best we can anyway.

120021160.content: As soon as possible. In fact, we can leave now if there's nothing else you have to attend to.

120021162.content: I'll let Jianbing meet us at the port.

120021163.content: Linyu, do you have to head back to the Quad first?

120021164.content: Linyu confidently pats the tool pack on her waist, which gives a tinkling sound.

120021166.content: Zhiming and Mengzhang aren't with us, so I'll take care of any nasty machines that pop up!

120031001.content: We arrive at Port Carp and meet up with Jianbing, then take an elevator for the long trip down to ground level.

120031002.content: The heavy metal door slowly raises to the sounds of creaking gears, and I begin to take in the land before me.

120031004.content: This is Xu Heng's Old Town, where everyone used to live... We abandoned it after the Cloudsong Crisis.

120031005.content: Time has reclaimed what remains of civilization, with weeds and moss covering every inch of ground that humans once walked.

120031006.content: Massive cracks in the roads, broken bridges, collapsed buildings, and holes like scars in the ground... The devastation was so complete that these modest signs of life barely disguise it.

120031008.content: No one lives in the Old Town anymore, nor do wild animals, but we do spot Visbanes from time to time.

120031010.content: Maybe... The Visbane threat is ever-present. If we do find one hiding out deep in the ruins, we may not be able to get help in time.

120031011.content: You don't have to worry. Lingguang and I can take care of the Visbanes. As for Linyu...

120031013.content: Just don't pee your pants if we do run into one!

120031014.content: Please. I'm not afraid of the Visbanes...

120031015.content: As Jianbing and Linyu continue their bickering, Ver looks around for a little bit, then glances at the Mimir device hanging on my waist.

120031017.content: Not so easy, I'm afraid. Mimir's still working on it now.

120031018.content: The analysis is going well, but it'll take some time before the exact location is established... Unless it really is right here, in this part of the Old Town.

120031019.content: I don't mind waiting a day or two here if it works.

120031020.content: Tian Lu Traders has several safehouses in the Old Town for its cargo convoys to rest. Let's head for one of them.

120031021.content: In contrast to the high-tech buildings in Yu Jing, the buildings here in the Old Town are much older.

120031022.content: Collapsed brick walls and fallen pillars are the only witnesses of the past here.

120031023.content: This here used to be the main shopping street, and over there, under the boulder, that was a square. I used to practice martial arts there when I was kid.

120031024.content: You see this anvil over here? The ruins next to it was Boyang's blacksmith shop. Many of us still use the weapons he made over at the Quad.

120031025.content: And this alley here, the Guang'an Street, I have a couple stories to tell about it, too...

120031026.content: Deputy Jianbing... You seem to know this place pretty well.

120031027.content: I awakened quite early, and therefore had the opportunity to live in the Old Town for a few decades... Besides the CORG building, I know my way around here.

120031028.content: Yeah, CORG is really secretive. No visitors are allowed on their premises ever.

120031029.content: Oh, is it the same way in Ain Soph?

120031030.content: That place is as fortified as a prison. And it's never good news when we hear from them. Just a few days ago, they sent somebody to the Quad saying that they were gonna clear out Xu Heng. Ridiculous!

120031031.content: Huh? What do you mean by "clear out Xu Heng"?

120031032.content: It means what you think it means.

120031033.content: CORG does not believe that the Astral Engine could keep Xu Heng safe forever, so they've decided to relocate the people to other Sephirah Zones in batches.

120031034.content: How can they do that? Are they just going to abandon Xu Heng?

120031035.content: Well, they clearly think they're right. And that squad leader Khnum was just going on and on about "for the good of all Gaea"...

120031036.content: Chief got him to leave eventually. The CORG can say whatever they want, but they don't call the shots. We've got to wait for Zhiming to come back, at least.

120031037.content: Zhiming? Oh, that's Linyu's master, right? I remember she's the one who actually created the Astral Engine...

120031038.content: Yes. Rightfully, Zhiming should be the one in charge of this matter. However, Gengchen sent her to look into some serious issue in Shashvat, and it's been a month since we last heard from her.

120031039.content: Zhiming's much more than just a tech expert. She's also experienced in administration, and naturally, the best person for this job... Let's hope she returns soon.

120031040.content: As they discuss these happenings in Xu Heng, I somehow recall the recent string of dangerous encounters in other Sephirah Zones and begin to feel uneasy.

120031041.content: Despite knowing that the Quad and the Tian Lu Traders are protected by a lot of Modifiers, I can't help but worry.

120031042.content: Deputy Lingguang, is the person who built the Heterocore still alive today?

120031043.content: No. She was a Modifier, too. Her name was Zhu. I only met her two or three times at the Quad when she was alive.

120031044.content: She was good friends with Mengzhang, and had shared with him a part of her knowledge, but never the whereabouts of the Heterocore. All he knows is that Zhu had built several workshops out in the mountains...

120031045.content: Hmm. The core could be in one of those workshops, then.

120031047.content: ... I'm sorry, but there's something else I'm curious about.

120031048.content: Please feel free to ask. We're a team now.

120031049.content: If Heterocore was to be the heart of Astral Engine... why could it be used to treat injuries? I can't quite wrap my head around it...

120031050.content: I see Lingguang's eyes darkened with sorrow, and I stop myself. She smiles a little wanly at me.

120031051.content: As the Heterocore is designed to amplify computing power, it shall boost my Divine Power, too. Maybe then I can restore the powers to our chief.

120031052.content: To be honest, I have no idea if it'll work. I have no choice but to give it my best shot... even if that means giving all that I have.

120031054.content: I'm sorry... I was appointed deputy by Gengchen because of my paltry medical skills at the first place. This is what I meant to do.

120031055.content: I hope everything goes to plan.

120031056.content: Sample matching: normal. Sample throughput: normal. Cross-sectional test: pass. Time-reversed model created.

120031058.content: ... Performing regression. Expected time to completion: 13 hours.

120031060.content: Looks like we'll have to spend a night here.

120031061.content: That's alright. As long as we have a place to sleep.

120031062.content: The Tian Lu Traders always treats its people well. You'll like the safehouse. It's just up ahead.

120031063.content: We turn our eyes to the direction Jianbing is pointing. A freshly pained two-story building stands in stark contrast to its surroundings.

120031064.content: ... Wait, what are all those AGI Mechas doing around the compound wall?

120031066.content: Those are AGI Mechas created here in Xu Heng to handle tasks on the ground such as collecting supplies, surveying, mechanical repair, and road maintenance.

120031067.content: What's up with them? They keep running into the wall... Is there a system error? Let me take a closer look...

120031070.content: Watch out! There's something wrong with the mechas!

120032002.content: The bullets pierce the AGI Mechas' chassis, tear apart the Bane Energy protective layers, and shatter the cores.

120032003.content: It turns out that these mechas are nothing powerful. However, our skirmish ends in an even more unexpected way.

120032005.content: Behind us, Linyu lets out a sudden yell. I turn around to see her hurl something like a hand grenade at the mechas.

120032007.content: But there is no explosion, just a pulse of light and then... the AGI Mechas stop moving. It's as if all their joints have been frozen by some invisible force.

120032008.content: Huh, look at you. Not bad at all!

120032009.content: Hee hee. See? Told you I'd be of help to you all.

120032010.content: Ms. Zhiming gave me some handy tools before she left. I'm glad I had them with me.

120032011.content: I'm gonna take a look at the mechas' black boxes now.

120032014.content: That was impressive. Even at Aether Gazer, very few can fight in a graceful manner like you, deputy Lingguang.

120032015.content: It's nothing compared to you. I'm sure what they say about the Administrator is true now.

120032016.content: While courage is good, you must watch out for your own safety, too. It's too dangerous for a human like you to challenge the enemy head-on like that.

120032018.content: Jianbing tosses a lump of what used to be AGI Mecha cores onto the ground. Thanks to him, these mechas don't stand a chance of remaining in one piece.

120032019.content: AGI Mechas corrupted by Bane Energy... It's the first time I've seen so many at once. Strange... Is this because of the Quakes?

120032020.content: #{nickname}#, looks like you're more of a sharpshooter than you let on.

120032021.content: I've got to be ready to defend myself at a moment's notice.

120032022.content: Jianbing pats me on the shoulder, and the three of us gathered in a corner. Some distance away, Ver and Linyu are inspecting a mecha.

120032023.content: Did you find anything, Ver? Linyu?

120032024.content: Upon hearing their names, the two girls run over to me. Ver opens her fist to reveal a pale green crystalline stone.

120032025.content: Look, Admin! This is Cloudsong Ore. Look how pretty it is!

120032026.content: It's the only piece intact. Even the black boxes didn't withstand Jianbing's attack...

120032027.content: This kind of Cloudsong Ore bits in mechas were reactivated and cannot be controlled by the Astral Engine. Don't let go of it, or it could fly away.

120032028.content: So this is Cloudsong Ore... Hmm? Why isn't it hovering?

120032029.content: I fiddle with the crystal in Ver's hand a few times. It feels rather light, as if it's hollow inside. Another flip of the stone, however, and it hurtles out of Ver's hand and balances on the tip of my finger.

120032031.content: Feeling hardly any weight on my finger, I grab it and try to throw it at the ground.

120032032.content: The stone keeps dropping, dropping, as if it is sinking in water. Then, its descent slows to a stop in midair. It hovers there, unmoving.

120032033.content: But just as I try to grab hold of it again, it abruptly falls to the ground, like a puppet that's had its strings cut. The fragile-looking crystal lands on the ground without a scratch.

120032034.content: That's just how Cloudsong Ore is. Its gravity behavior is constantly changing, with high hardness and toughness, though.

120032035.content: Back in the day, Xu Heng was just like this little piece of Cloudsong Ore. At any given moment, no one knew what direction it might be heading.

120032036.content: Without the Astral Engine keeping the ore fixed in place, the five isles would have collided with each other long ago, and the peace we've enjoyed over the last few decades would have been destroyed in an instant.

120032037.content: Ver and I look up at the islands floating in the air above us, which cast long, colossal shadows on the land beneath.

120032038.content: There're huge green crystals peeking out from the bottom of each of these islands, and every single one of them is thousands times bigger than the piece we're looking at.

120032039.content: How could this happen in Gaea...

120032040.content: Please forgive me if I'm being rude, but does the Quad have a plan if it should happen that the Astral Engine does stop working?

120032041.content: We'll be able to save the people, but the city will be lost if that happens.

120032043.content: No need for the doom and gloom. It's the people of Xu Heng that make the city what it is. We can always start anew somewhere else.

120032045.content: There's an alarm system throughout the compound, so you can rest at ease here.

120032046.content: We make our way into the safehouse decorated in typical Xu Heng style. There are several bedrooms leading off of the living room.

120032047.content: The house is easily big enough for the five of us, with simply furnished yet tidy rooms. We each pick one.

120032048.content: There's some food inside this storeroom. Please help yourselves when you get hungry.

120032049.content: Lingguang points to the only closed door in the house.

120032050.content: The house's control room is in there, too. Jianbing and I have checked everything. All the devices are working just fine.

120032051.content: We should rest up now. In thirteen hours, at dawn, we move out again.

120041001.content: Late at night, I lean against the window and look up at the sky. It has a touch of magic that one simply can't find in Ain Soph. Thanks to the airport's navigational lights, I can trace the contours of the islands floating above.

120041002.content: The insects chirp and buzz among the overgrown grass of the Old Town. Maybe that's what woke me up. I gaze absentmindedly at the Mimir device for a while, hoping to fall asleep.

120041005.content: I quickly glance at the time. Everyone should be asleep by now.

120041006.content: I open the door and step into the living room. Only the doors to the storeroom and control room are slightly ajar. A slit of light pours out of it.

120041008.content: Even from the hallway, I can smell an unusual, refreshing fragrance drifting over from the storeroom.

120041009.content: I poke my head into the room, only to bump right into someone.

120041012.content: #{nickname}#? It's late, why aren't you in bed?

120041013.content: Oh, it's you... I can't seem to fall asleep. What is this? Mmm, it smells good.

120041014.content: Lingguang is holding a small lunchbox in her hands. She reflexively hid it behind her back when we bumped into each other, but shows it to me right away upon hearing my question.

120041015.content: Oh, this... I was thinking that we may not have time to prepare breakfast tomorrow morning.

120041016.content: The rations in the storeroom may be a little bland and dry, so I made some refreshments for us all.

120041018.content: Please don't expect too much. They're just meant to fill the stomach...

120041019.content: ... and to provide all the nutrients we need. That's what you call a proper breakfast.

120041020.content: #{nickname}#, I hear from Ver that you can get very busy at work. But remember that the busier you get, the more you need to take care of yourself.

120041021.content: Not just physically, but mentally as well...

120041022.content: Lingguang mentioned something about me having poor energy flow earlier. This must be what she's referring to now.

120041023.content: Although I'm confident in Lingguang's medical expertise and I understand her cares and worries, I have no idea what this "poor energy flow" is about.

120041024.content: Please don't worry. Ver can always keep me healthy and happy.

120041025.content: She likes to take me places during the holidays, look out for me during training, bring me snacks when I'm too busy to eat, and when I'm in trouble she's always there to cheer me on...

120041026.content: Sounds like the two of you are really close.

120041027.content: Well, Ver was the first friend I made when I joined Aether Gazer. And since I can't remember my past... she's my oldest friend now.

120041028.content: You mean... you lost your memories?

120041029.content: Heh, you can't tell, can you? Even the docs at Aether Gazer Medical Department have no idea how to help me.

120041030.content: I must have lost my memories after falling into the Source Layer. No one has any idea who I am or where I came from. Who knows if I'll ever recall my past...

120041031.content: It's okay. You don't have to worry too much about me...

120041032.content: Doesn't it feel odd, to have forgotten it all?

120041033.content: If I can't remember something, well, it's like it never happened to me. I still do perfectly fine now.

120041034.content: Besides, I may not have lost my memories for good. Who knows, maybe I'll just wake up one day with everything back in my head.

120041035.content: Lingguang's expression softens a little, with a mild resignation in her eyes. Maybe she doesn't want to burst my bubble of optimism.

120041036.content: Overly positive patients can be quite the headache for us physicians, you know.

120041037.content: Oh? You don't like me being optimistic in this?

120041038.content: Everything in moderation. It's not a good thing to put on a brave face and keep mum about a condition that needs treatment...

120041039.content: Anyway, prevention is always better than cure, isn't it?

120041040.content: Believe me, I honestly just feel fine right now.

120041041.content: I'm happy to have made all these friends at Aether Gazer, to help everyone out and fight the Visbanes together... Maybe I hadn't have the chance to experience all these things before I lost my memories.

120041042.content: Hmm. That isn't comforting at all.

120041043.content: What I want you to pay closer attention to... is not your "now."

120041045.content: People say that our memories are the proof that we've truly lived, and for that reason, they're worth treasuring. But I've seen someone who...

120041046.content: Recalling the past can be challenging in itself. All that happiness, pain, love, hate... Very often, the people we know as amnesiacs are people who've actually chosen to forget.

120041047.content: While the memories are your own, they may also be a burden. I hope that instead of not caring at all... you can be more honest with yourself about the gaps in your memory.

120041048.content: Remember that the past is the past, so no matter what you uncover, don't be too hard on yourself.

120041049.content: No matter what I uncover? Can I really not blame myself at that moment?

120041050.content: I don't know. I'm unable to make a promise of this sort to someone who cares about me. All I can do is flash Lingguang a smile.

120041051.content: Um, I hope I'm not out of line here, but I think the same can be said for you too, Lingguang.

120041053.content: In this world, there are things we can do something about, and there are things we can't.

120041054.content: Although I don't know Gengchen, I do know Odin somewhat. Since they're friends, they will definitely do something about Xu Heng. Who knows, they may already have a plan...

120041055.content: So, about Gengchen... You shouldn't be too hard on yourself, either.

120041056.content: I kind of blurt out that last sentence, recalling the tone of self-reproach in Lingguang's voice when she mentioned Gengchen earlier in the day.

120041057.content: Lingguang looks at me in mild surprise. Although she doesn't seem offended, the atmosphere seems to have taken on an odd tone.

120041058.content: Um... Do you think I could try one of these now? I'm a little hungry all of a sudden...

120041060.content: I take a piece of cake from the box. It looks like a mini-sandwich, and a little like a puff pastry, too. I take a bite, and a multitude of flavors explode on my tongue.

120041061.content: You call this "just for filling the stomach"...? What an understatement.

120041062.content: I'm glad you like it. I've only made this for the folks at the Quad before. Gengchen thought it was a little bland, and Zhiming said it was too salty...

120041063.content: Gengchen always loves rich flavors and is always saying how our meals need more seasonings. I keep reminding her that lighter-tasting meals are healthier, but it's been decades and I don't seem to have convinced her yet.

120041064.content: Heh. Sounds like your chief isn't someone who puts on airs with others.

120041065.content: To be honest, I thought I'd see her today. Unfortunately, she and Odin aren't back yet...

120041066.content: If you don't mind me asking, what is Gengchen like?

120041067.content: Lingguang thinks over my query for a second, then shakes her head with a smile.

120041068.content: Words won't do her justice. You'll find out when you meet her.

120041069.content: ... But there's one thing I know for sure.

120041070.content: All of us at the Quad follow our chief every step of the way.

120041071.content: At this hour, I think it wise not to over-indulge, and Lingguang and I return to our respective rooms. I lie on my bed. Getting to sleep is a little easier this time around.

120041072.content: But I'm soon awakened from my slumber.

120041074.content: I hear screaming and the sounds of breaking glass from outside my room, and almost immediately, the alarms start blaring.

120041075.content: Roused from my stupor, I quickly grab my gun, and charge out of the room. There's no time to dress myself.

120041076.content: I see that Ver, Jianbing, and Lingguang have rushed into the living room, too. They must have heard the same sounds.

120041077.content: We look at each other, and in half a second we understand the situation and charge into Linyu's room.

120041079.content: The curtains are flying wildly. Linyu is on the ground by her bed, her face pale. She has one hand pressing on a wound at her abdomen, and the other pointing towards the broken window.

120041081.content: AGI Mechas? As I look at the small, jagged hole in the window, I begin to feel a suffocating sense of anomaly.

120041082.content: You guys go after the mechas. I'll stay here and tend to Linyu's injuries.

120041083.content: Jianbing deftly vaults out of the window, and Ver and I follow close behind.

120041084.content: As the AGI Mechas speed past the compound's walls, the alarms also begin to decrease in volume. There is no doubt that these mechas are the culprits.

120041085.content: Dammit...! We've got to catch them!

120042002.content: Jianbing! Wait a second! We need one to—

120042003.content: Too late. A swift mid-air kick from Jianbing, an explosive flash of light, and soon all I hear is the noise of metal parts crashing into the ground and clattering among the ruins.

120042005.content: ... Fine. But I was hoping that we could use one of these to figure out where they came from.

120042006.content: I shake my head. There's no point investigating since the AGI Mechas have all been turned into scrap.

120042007.content: Are these the mechas that attacked Linyu? That's weird— None of us noticed them coming, and the alarms didn't go off either.

120042008.content: That was too careless of us. We should've taken turns at night watch duty...

120042009.content: Let's go back and see how Linyu's doing. And check the alarm system, too.

120042011.content: Jianbing stops me out of the blue and holds up a finger to his lips to shush me.

120042013.content: Jianbing pauses for a couple of seconds, then turns around in a sudden. I follow his gaze and see what looks like someone darting to a corner of a ruined building.

120042014.content: Jianbing's movement has clearly rattled our unsolicited company, who tries to scurry out of our sight. The footsteps, light and deft as they are, are crystal clear in the silence of the night.

120042016.content: Ver takes off after the mystery figure. I quickly follow.

120042017.content: Interestingly, our friend doesn't flee, but wait for us around the corner instead.

120042019.content: I ignore the words, immediately pull out my gun and point it at the shadowy figure.

120042020.content: Hey, hey, hey, no need to point that dangerous thing at me. Don't you recognize my voice? It's only been half a day since we last met!

120042021.content: Ver and I pause together. While I'm not letting my guard down just yet, this person's voice does sound kind of familiar...

120042022.content: Seriously, I didn't expect to see you here.

120042023.content: Our unsolicited company steps out of the shadows. It's the young man who made room for Ver and I at the noodle shop earlier in the day.

120042025.content: This is Mengzhang, deputy of the East Isle. You've met each other?

120042026.content: Just briefly. He was sitting where we were at the noodle shop before you came to pick us up.

120042027.content: So he's a deputy of the Quad! It's like you said, Admin: you never know who you're talking to in Xu Heng.

120042028.content: Haha, don't put it that way. I'm just like everyone else in Xu Heng.

120042029.content: A deputy serves the Quad and the people of Xu Heng, too. I have to act in an aboveboard and just manner at all times. There's nothing extraordinary or secretive about me.

120042030.content: Mengzhang remains his slightly sardonic tone during his little soapbox moment. Nevertheless, all this seems to make him a little more endearing.

120042031.content: But Jianbing clearly isn't buying any of it.

120042032.content: Come on, Jianbing. I know you recognized me at first glance, so why don't you tell your friend here? You wouldn't want me to get shot, would you?

120042033.content: Don't be cheeky. What are you doing here? Case investigation, huh? Tell me, did you have anything to do with that bunch of AGI Mechas just now?

120042034.content: Come on, we all work for the Quad. There's no need for this.

120042035.content: I'm on investigation indeed, which brought me here to the Old Town. I rushed over when I heard the alarms, but I sure didn't expect to run into you here...

120042036.content: I should be asking you: what are YOU doing here?

120042037.content: ... The Heterocore business. As you heard the other day.

120042038.content: Why didn't you come along with us anyway?

120042039.content: Well, surely you and Lingguang can find that thingy by yourselves, right? That reminds me. Where's Lingguang?

120042040.content: There was a bunch of AGI Mechas that somehow skirted our alarms... Linyu got hurt, and Lingguang is tending to her now.

120042042.content: That's not good, not good at all...

120042043.content: What are you on about? What's "not good"?

120042044.content: ... Nothing. I'll head back with you. I need to talk to Lingguang anyway.

120042045.content: No need to be paranoid, Jianbing. There're few problems that can't be solved when I'm around!

120042046.content: Mengzhang hooks an arm over Jianbing's neck, and the duo walk in the direction of the safehouse. Ver and I follow behind.

120042047.content: Now that the chaos is over and I'm walking beside Ver, I notice that she doesn't seem like her usual self.

120042049.content: I'm alright... It's just I dreamed that someone was telling me something, and I've been feeling so listless since I woke up...

120042051.content: I don't know. It's all a little fuzzy to me now. But the voice did seem sort of familiar...

120042052.content: Anyway, Admin, did you find those AGI Mechas a little odd?

120042054.content: Yeah. This isn't the first time we've fought corrupted mechas, but if I recall correctly...

120042055.content: We've never met mechas that actually fled from us.

120042056.content: Back at the safehouse, Lingguang and Linyu are sitting by the bed. Linyu's wounds have been treated. She looks fine, just a little pale.

120042057.content: Hey, Jianbing... Hmm? Is that you, Mengzhang?

120042059.content: Yeah, I'll be fine. Lingguang has been taking good care of me.

120042060.content: Mengzhang? What are you doing here?

120042061.content: I briefly tell Lingguang about how we ran into Mengzhang, then fill Mengzhang in on what's happened with us since we came to the Old Town.

120042062.content: What do you want with Lingguang? You can tell us now.

120042063.content: Oh. I wanted to ask about the companies who were attacked. Lingguang, I heard that you tended to the injured at Tian Lu Traders. Did you find anything unusual?

120042064.content: Nothing serious. But they'd all lost their memory of what happened, and therefore cannot provide any clues.

120042065.content: Huh. Interesting how most of those who died were lower-level employees, but the higher-ups survived. And there's also the loss of memory on the survivors' part...

120042066.content: Coincidences upon coincidences... If someone's behind this, they're smart, but not smart enough.

120042067.content: Did you and CORG find anything?

120042068.content: We did make a little headway, but...
