120441081.content: "After that, we head to the Museum of Science and Industry to learn the history of Xu Heng's scientific and industrial development, and to try out their anti-gravity experience..."

120441082.content: "Lunch is at Jinglin Restaurant that specializes in typical Xu Heng dishes. Their take on Sasanami cuisine is extremely popular, so we can give that a try..."

120441083.content: "In the afternoon it's the stunning vistas of Dragonridge Hill, which have inspired countless writers, painters and philosophers in the past. The floating inverted clock tower is entirely natural, and turns upside down once a day... Is this thing even real?"

120441084.content: Haha, so you don't believe it either? I don't see how something like that can be natural...

120441085.content: Hey, I'm just reading what you wrote down.

120441086.content: Oh whoops, looks like I accidentally typed out some of my own thoughts in there.

120441087.content: So, how does it all sound?

120441088.content: I'm just excited to be out and about. I would have been happy just strolling the streets...

120441089.content: I didn't realize there was so much cool stuff to do though!

120441090.content: We make good travel buddies. It feels just like going out in Ain Soph.

120441091.content: "Admin, there's a pond over there I think you can catch goldfish in!""Oh yeah! Excuse me, could you take a photo of us?"

120441092.content: After leaving our park tour guide, we go to the Museum of Science and Industry and head straight to the anti-gravity room.

120441093.content: "I'm flying! I'm really flying! Ooh ooh it feels weird, I shouldn't have let go so soon!""The universe is so big. Do you think we'll ever explore all of it?"

120441094.content: After our voyage through the stars, we go for lunch and then walk it off with a gentle climb up Dragonridge Hill.

120441095.content: "Dragonridge Hill is so named because its jade rocks look like scales and its peak is shaped like a dragon's back... Oh yeah, I can kinda see it.""Is this the inverted clock tower? It looks like a giant hourglass..."

120441096.content: The afternoon sun is warm on our cheeks, and there is a faint breeze blowing. We begin to feel sleepy.

120441097.content: It's actually quite a tiring climb. I'm going to rest for a bit...

120441098.content: Come and sit over here, Admin!

120441099.content: I lie down on the lush patch of grass Ver is sitting on. I put my hands behind my head, and look over at Ver, who is next to me with a big grin on her face.

120441103.content: It would have been the perfect day if you hadn't have spun me like a top in that anti-gravity room.

120441104.content: I'm sorry, I didn't realize it'd make you sick...

120441105.content: Well, thanks for finding a new weakness of mine...

120441107.content: The clouds are rolling high in the sky, casting their pale shadows on the hillside and occasionally floating over us.

120441108.content: We lie there side by side, all other plans of the day forgotten, all sense of time forgotten. We even forget that the sun sinking in the west means it's almost time for another day.

120441111.content: I look at Ver in surprise and see the same expression on her face, as though she wasn't even aware she was going to say those words.

120441112.content: ...I just realized that I've never properly thanked you.

120441113.content: You're starting to scare me, Ver. I haven't done anything recently that you need to thank me for.

120441114.content: That's not true. You've always been there for me, ever since I first joined...

120441115.content: That time you rescued me from those Visbanes, and fell into the Source Layer...

120441116.content: Oh, are you talking about the time before I lost my memory?

120441117.content: I only know I did those things because you told me about them. And you already took me out for barbecue to thank me, remember?

120441118.content: That wasn't properly planned or anything. I... just happened to really want barbecue that day, so I took you with me. And I remember you bought me the last mascot pendant they had in the restaurant.

120441119.content: I remember how happy you were...

120441120.content: Yeah... That was the first piece of merchandise I'd ever gotten from that restaurant, and I've still got it on display in my room.

120441121.content: It hadn't been long then since you'd woken up without knowing what had happened. I just wanted to cheer you up. I didn't know if you were going to stay or not...

120441122.content: And that's the thing I need to thank you for the most—for staying. I don't know what I would have done without you here.

120441123.content: You shouldn't thank me for that. Actually, I had to think about it long and hard when Shu asked if I wanted to stay.

120441124.content: I knew I could be of some use, but at the end of the day it's a dangerous job and I didn't know if I'd be up to it.

120441125.content: What was it that convinced you to stay?

120441128.content:
Right... I've only ever told Shu this...
When I first woke up, I had no memories and no thoughts.

120441129.content: And then I met you, heard your stories, found out your thoughts. You don't want to see anyone around you get hurt and you don't want to see your home destroyed by Visbanes, so you choose to fight.

120441130.content: When I heard you saying all that, I thought to myself: I don't know what I want to do, but her ideas can't be bad, can they?

120441132.content: No, what I mean is, was that the only reason you chose to stay?

120441133.content: Isn't that enough? For an ordinary person, even the wish to protect somebody else is already a luxury.

120441134.content: So I should be the one thanking you for giving me a purpose. That's been the greatest gift anyone has ever given me.

120441135.content: ...I would say you were the one who rescued me.

120441136.content: I'm a Modifier, it's not like I'd sit back and watch if someone fell in the Source Layer.

120441137.content: A lot has happened since then...

120441138.content: Yes, and the more I think about it, the more I feel like I was lied to. Our enemies are definitely growing stronger—I'd never heard of Cognizant Visbanes before I joined.

120441139.content: Luckily it's all taken care of now, and you've met lots of companions you can trust.

120441140.content: The CORG soldiers, everyone at Aether Gazer, the elders of Sasanami, Omorfies and Xu Heng...

120441141.content: Don't forget yourself on that list. Shu always talks you up to me. Says you never back down, no matter how powerful the enemy is, and that you're always getting stronger.

120441142.content: I remember how you hesitated in Spealght when you saw that talking Encroacher Type. And look at you now—taking on scary enemies like Ladon and Gremory.

120441143.content: That's just because I'm more used to it now. I don't feel like I'm making any progress...

120441144.content: The one who's changed the most is you, Admin. Do you know what people have started calling you?

120441145.content: Oh, I have a nickname and you didn't tell me? What is it?

120441148.content: Honestly. Poseidon was the one who told me, but she'd heard it from someone else.

120441149.content: I think people are just being polite. I'm just an ordinary person. I'm no ace.

120441150.content: But we're talking about every single Mod who's ever been instructed or helped by you. Lots of people don't know how you ended up in Division Nine, and think you're actually our secret weapon.

120441151.content: Oh come on, you can't actually believe that...

120441152.content: And haven't you always been there when I've instructed or helped other people? Do you also think the same as them?

120441153.content: Me? Um, I'm used to always having you with me so I don't know any different...

120441154.content: Ver and I stare blankly at each other. I realize how much we've grown used to always being in each other's company.

120441155.content: We joined together, trained together, studied together, went on our first missions together, are each other's default partner for daily missions...

120441156.content: Because our starting points coincided so naturally, it's easy to forget that it's actually amazing how our lives have run in parallel.

120441157.content: What would have happened to us if the paths of our lives had diverged? I don't know about Ver, but I for one don't even want to think about it.

120441158.content: ...Yeah, that's right. I should be the one thanking you.

120441159.content: You're always saying how I've always been there to help you, but I'm the lucky one to have you in my life.

120441160.content: You're the one who's helped me the most and has always been by my side.

120441163.content: Ver blinks as her cheeks turn a bright crimson. She quickly shifts to face away from me, and mumbles something in a quiet voice.

120441165.content: The night wind blowing down the streets makes me shiver, and I suddenly realize I have absolutely no recollection of what Ver and I talked about up on Dragonridge Hill.

120441166.content: I shrug it off. It's late, and almost time for a new day.

120441167.content: Shall we decide what we want to do tomorrow?

120441168.content: There are still lots of places worth visiting in Yu Jing. Or we could go to another island, like Shuofang Isle. Go and see that pond Gengchen said was good for fishing.

120441169.content: I contacted the photon rail and they said anytime after 5:30 tomorrow is fine, or any time the day after tomorrow. It just depends on how long we want to stay here...

120441171.content: Ver calls out to me on the deserted street, and I notice that she has fallen behind me.

120441173.content: Do you really want to go back to Ain Soph just like that?

120441174.content: Have you forgotten what Odin said? We're guests.

120441175.content: But, there must be something we can do here...

120441177.content: Because... All I've been thinking the entire day is, should we really just be hanging around like this?

120441178.content: The seniors at the Quad and Tian Lu Traders are extremely busy, no one knows where Gremory is, Jianbing said there might be even stronger Visbanes on the way...

120441179.content: Don't get me wrong, I've had a lovely day. It's been so nice having lunch with you, enjoying the scenery, lying on the grass... I loved every second of it.

120441180.content: But Gengchen isn't back to her full strength yet and Gremory still hasn't been found. I just think it would be good if we did something to help, even if only a little. Why don't we go and ask...

120441181.content: Have we ever sat around when things happened?

120441182.content: Watching Ver open and close her mouth like a fish while she struggles for the words, I can't keep a straight face for long and quickly crack into a smile. I clap her on the shoulder.

120441183.content: It's the same as when I pushed you out the way of that Visbane without thinking—we'll stay wherever we are needed, even if we can only help out a little bit.

120441184.content: Ver's shock at my little practical joke dissolves into a giggle of joy, and she skips off in front of me.

120441185.content: I knew you'd feel the same as me...

120441186.content: I laugh and catch up to her, and we walk together back to Tian Lu Traders.

120441187.content: I feel like Ver and I had a tacit understanding of what we should do ever since we saw those angry traders in Tian Lu Traders, or maybe even when Odin expressly told us not to get involved in anything...

120441189.content: It's night, and the responsibility we'd been evading all day suddenly hits us like a storm.

120451008.content: I slap myself to make sure I'm awake, and double check we're actually in Tian Lu Traders and that the thing I just killed was a Visbane.

120451010.content: What's going on down there? Where are Luliang and the others?

120451011.content: The building and the grounds are crawling with Visbanes. Luliang thinks Gremory might have set off a Source Layer rift before she disappeared. She's going to deal with it.

120451012.content: Lingguang took Linyu to Nanjiao Isle for a check-up, and Yingzhao doesn't seem to be around...

120451013.content: That seems a bit too convenient... We should go and help, there are civilians in this building too.

120451014.content: Tian Lu Traders' security team is efficient. Teams of Mods have already formed front lines inside and outside the building to split up the Visbane horde.

120451015.content: Ver and I rush downstairs, killing a few stray Visbanes on our way, until we see the person in charge—a Modifier wearing a Quad uniform.

120451016.content: Teams Alpha and Beta, you come with me to secure the main building! The rest of you, sweep the other nearby buildings, the parking lot, warehouse, generator room... I don't want a single one of those things getting out of here alive!

120451017.content: You two, please follow the emergency exit... Wait, are you the Aether Gazer guys?

120451019.content: Outside. Patrol the perimeter, and kill any Visbanes you find hiding out there.

120452001.content: Polaris, in the name of Nature!

120452002.content: I can't see what weapon Gengchen is holding, but I suddenly feel a surge of energy shoot out in all directions and freeze the Visbanes on the spot.

120452004.content: Ver leaps into the air and slashes down with her sword, unleashing a lightning wave that sweeps across the Visbanes before returning to her Access Key.

120452005.content: The Visbanes stiffen and drop their weapons, but begin emitting black smoke before they hit the floor.

120452008.content: Do you think that was the man's final thought before he was...

120452009.content: The Quad has secured the outside perimeter, thanks to you two.

120452010.content: It was nothing. What on earth is going on?

120452011.content: Gremory's hidden agenda. It was in the warehouse.

120452012.content: Luliang has taken a team to close the direct route to the Source Layer.

120452013.content: But it's been three days already, why would they wait till now?

120452014.content: I think she was getting ready to reveal her true identity to us before following us to Mount Jingdu.

120452015.content: If we don't find her, it doesn't really matter if we think this was just a distraction, or a way to destroy the evidence.

120452017.content: Someone comes running over to us from the main lobby. It's the Modifier who was giving orders before.

120452018.content: Are the civilians all safe, Hutao?

120452019.content: Everything is under control. CORG will be here soon.

120452021.content: It's fine. Anything you can say to me, you can say to these two.

120452022.content: I've just received a report from the Engine Monitoring Room that the engine field has taken a massive hit. The biggest one they've ever seen.

120452023.content: Okay. Tell everyone not to worry.

120452025.content: Oh yeah, and we got a message from CORG as well: Khnum has arrived. Would you like to see him?

120452026.content: Is this still about evacuating Xu Heng?

120452028.content: The Quad and CORG are jointly responsible for running the Photon Rail. We cannot and must not ignore this issue.

120452029.content: Tell him to come whenever he has time. I'll always be happy to discuss.

120452030.content: The capable-seeming Modifier obediently withdraws. Gengchen sighs, walks over to the window and looks out over the bustling Tian Lu Traders gardens.

120452031.content: Gengchen, CORG's proposal... will you agree to it?

120452032.content: That's not something I can decide on my own.

120452033.content: I saw a crowd of people confronting Luliang about it this morning... So nobody actually wants to leave?

120452034.content: I know I wouldn't like it if someone asked me to leave Ain Soph or Aether Gazer, and I'd try everything I could to stay.

120452035.content: Everyone should have the right to choose for themselves. I don't want to be the one who decides on behalf of everyone.

120452036.content: It doesn't matter how many people want to leave or how many people choose to stay, it won't change what the Quad and I have to do.

120452037.content: I hope tonight's incident hasn't spoiled your fun tomorrow.

120452038.content: I don't know what state the streets are in. Good thing it's dark, it'll make the clean-up easier.

120452039.content: The situation is well under control now. I'm going to ask CORG to help us with the repair work.

120452040.content: I actually have little farewell gifts for you two. I was going to give them to you tomorrow but, in light of tonight's events and all the extra work that has created, I think it's better to give them to you now.

120452041.content: Gengchen takes out two jade pendants, which can be fit together to make a whole.

120452042.content: These look expensive, we couldn't possibly...

120452043.content: It's nothing special—I carved them myself.

120452044.content: I was intending on carving two hoops, but I accidentally broke one of them so I thought it would be nice to give you one half each.

120452045.content: These... You actually made them yourself? They feel even more precious now.

120452046.content: And when you wear this type of jade, it helps you to focus.

120452047.content: Especially for you, Ver. It will help you control your Divine Power.

120452048.content: Oh wow, so it's useful as well as beautiful...

120452050.content: You are our guests, and yet you've helped us out on numerous occasions. We owe you far more than these trinkets.

120452051.content: Even though I wasted half the jade, in the end I quite like this matching pair. Think of it as a symbol that you are a part of Xu Heng now.

120452052.content: We couldn't have hoped for a better souvenir from Xu Heng. Thank you, Gengchen.

120452054.content: Wait, if you made these yourself then they surely have a name?

120452056.content: I remember that all the artists in Omorfies gave names to their statues and paintings, particularly if the artist was famous.

120452057.content: Hmm, I guess it would be easier to tell them apart from other jewelry.

120452059.content: Ver and I accept the pendants. Gengchen can't stay long, as she has much to do.

120452060.content: It's getting late. You two should get some rest.

120452062.content: You're right. I just need to speak to Khnum first.

120452063.content: We bid farewell to Gengchen and go our separate ways.

120452064.content: As the sound of her footsteps recede in the distance, I suddenly realize how deserted the corridor is.

120452065.content: What a night! I can't wait to get into bed.

120452067.content: A sudden tremor shakes us out of our sleepiness, and the Mimir device at my waist flashes a red warning light.

120452068.content:
Surface Layer structural anomaly detected.
Abnormal energy signal detected.

120452069.content: Signal source location: Directly up. Analyzing...

120452070.content: ...Signal source no longer detected. Structure has returned to normal. Alarm off.

120452072.content: The tremor lasts less than a minute, but Ver and I remain shaken.

120461002.content: That's it. It's not like I would have forgotten any details already.

120461003.content: Oh... I assumed Gengchen would have told you.

120461004.content: Did you know all along, Ms. Odin?

120461005.content: Of course. I wouldn't let anyone hide something like that from me.

120461006.content: But I didn't tell you because you didn't need to know, and it wasn't that interesting anyway.

120461008.content: If you're only starting to wonder about it now, I must say I'm a little disappointed in you, rookie.

120461009.content: The reason the Cloudsong Crisis occurred was because there was a problem with the gravitational coefficient of the Cloudsong Ore. This is an underlying flaw with Gaea, and not something that can be fixed with tools.

120461010.content: The streets are filled with people who are curious about what's inside the floating Astral Engine.

120461011.content: Did you ever wonder why the Quad didn't make the Astral Engine technology publicly available? Everyone understands the benefit of brainstorming—they chose to keep it secret because they had no other choice.

120461012.content: But... how could Modifiers do such a thing? I thought that wasn't permitted?

120461013.content: Permitted? Do you think we need to wait for Gaea's permission before doing something that makes logical sense?

120461014.content: It was the nadir of the Cloudsong Crisis. Heterocore were extremely difficult to forge, and even then they couldn't be used as Astral Engine cores due to computing limitations.

120461015.content: If you'd have been there, and were offered something that could save everyone's lives but which Gaea said was forbidden, what would you have done?

120461017.content: Don't worry. No matter how you answer, it won't affect my opinion of you.

120461018.content: Gengchen and I disagreed over what we should do, but I respect her decision. She wanted to save people, and I helped her save them.

120461019.content: Looking at how stable Xu Heng has been these past years, you'd think we'd made the right choice... It's just that we overestimated ourselves.

120461020.content: Let me guess: this "underlying flaw" of Gaea's comes at a price?

120461022.content: The Astral Engine has been stabilized, but the price is that Gengchen must exert her full power at all times to keep it running.

120461023.content: Fortunately she is extremely powerful, but at the end of the day she's just one person. We should have thought about that. After all, she's the one who sealed in the Astral Engine's core, but...

120461025.content: In the dead of night in a district far away from Tian Lu Traders, two shadowy figures with weapons run down the streets, their eyes constantly surveying their surroundings.

120461026.content: Is it this way? I can't see a thing.

120461027.content: It must be. The Bane Energy signal might be weak, but I can still feel it. I reckon it must be something Tian Lu Traders let slip through the net.

120461030.content: Just as the two Modifiers are about to duck into an unlit alley, a man wearing a top hat suddenly emerges.

120461031.content: Well well, if it isn't my friends from the Quad. What are you doing running around with weapons drawn at this time of night?

120461034.content: Seeing the gray-skinned man's odd reaction, the two Modifiers instantly leap into action, despite the fact he has absolutely no energy fluctuations. They charge at him from each side.

120461035.content: However, before they can even get close to him, they find themselves suddenly rooted to the spot. No matter how much they concentrate their Divine Power, they are unable to move an inch.

120461037.content: (Sigh) I'm sorry about this. I'm just so close now, I'd kick myself if I didn't make a move.

120461039.content: It's not Bane Energy that's binding them, nor does it appear to be Divine Power. The unknown energy scares them, but not enough to make them just give up.

120461040.content: A blade made from Divine Power suddenly coalesces in the gray-skinned man's blind spot and shoots toward him. Despite his surprise, a foul red mist emanates from his right hand and manages to deflect the blow just in time.

120461041.content: Woah, that was a close one. Was it worth it? You can't even touch a hair on my head.

120461042.content: The energy binding the two Modifiers begins to intensify to the point where they're struggling for breath.

120461043.content: Bane Energy... You're a Cognizant Visbane!

120461044.content: Ah, there's that word again—Cognizant. Always so condescending, you Modifiers.

120461045.content: You've been relentless in following me, and now you're making impertinent remarks. You both deserve to die here, but if I do that I'll raise the alarm.

120461047.content: Don't bother, no signal's getting out of here. Gengchen isn't coming to save you, and you won't even remember our little meeting.

120461048.content: This is just an advance greeting to the Quad. We still need to thank them properly...

120461050.content: The Mods' eyes bulge as their abdomens are crushed inwards, so they don't even see the blows coming. They lose consciousness from the pain, and their bodies thud to the ground.

120461052.content: I was just speaking for you...

120461053.content: The man adjusts his hat, and tilts his head to look up at the Astral Engine.

120461054.content: Can you feel it, Master? In there is...

120461056.content: So that's what the core of the Astral Engine is. Another mystery solved. I don't know why we didn't think of it before.

120461057.content: The thing that can mitigate Gaea's deficiency is...

120461058.content: The thing that Gengchen sealed away is...

121012002.content: The Old Town has been deserted for years. Right now, however, the sound of clashing weapons rings out, raising a dust storm that silences the playful chirping of birds and insects in the crumbling walls.

121012003.content: The outburst does not last long, and after a while two tall figures emerge from the dust cloud. The city, as though in awe of these two warriors, descends back into reverent silence.

121012004.content: I'm surprised the faint trace of human scent left in the ruins is still discernible to them, even after all these decades.

121012005.content: The greater the instinct, the greater the precision.

121012007.content: Our job would be a lot easier if our enemies simply acted on instinct alone.

121012008.content: Unfortunately, they're only the pawns, and their numbers are as never-ending as a swarm of locusts.

121012009.content: But they're not the problem. The problem is whatever's controlling them from the shadows.

121012010.content: At least all the known Cognizant Visbanes have been killed now.

121012011.content: I don't believe something is dead unless I've killed it myself.

121012012.content: You're more cautious than me, so you must know that when the same thing happens twice, it isn't a coincidence.

121012013.content: Xu Heng is a special case. I'm never surprised when a Cognizant Visbane turns up there.

121012014.content: The Quad will protect Xu Heng, don't you worry.

121012015.content: If the Cognizant Visbanes are linked to the Cinders, you'll probably encounter them on this trip.

121012016.content: If you could capture one alive, I know the Cryptics would find it a fascinating research specimen.

121012018.content: The two have walked into the middle of a clearing. Odin casually sticks her lance in the ground, and a black dot appears above it.

121012019.content: It's barely bigger than a sesame seed at first, but it quickly swells, consuming light and space like a black hole until it suddenly tears open a purple rift in the air in front.

121012020.content: This is the spot where Thor and I left last time. I hope it hasn't become a Visbane lair yet.

121012021.content: You kept a connection with the depths of the Source Layer? You shouldn't do that on the Surface Layer, it's too dangerous.

121012022.content: What, do you think the Visbanes can break through the barriers I put in place?

121012023.content: If only one of the things from the depths manages to make it through to the Surface Layer, it will wreak havoc. It's not worth the risk.

121012024.content: The Cinders is worth the risk.

121012025.content: What's not worth the risk is heading back down to the Primordial Layer and the trail going cold because we spend too much time removing the obstacles in our way.

121012026.content: Odin gazes at the unruffled Laguna for a second, then turns to look at what's left standing of the former city. She smiles, but there is no happiness in her expression.

121012027.content: There aren't many ruins like this one. Even though it was the Cloudsong Crisis that led to this... humanity still managed to escape.

121012028.content: We fled and left our cities to the Visbanes, to the very things that want to destroy us. What could be worse than that?

121012029.content: The world has never belonged to the Visbanes.

121012030.content: I'm only concerned with the final outcome. The world will belong to whatever survives.

121012031.content: There haven't been any Quakes in the sky islands for a very long time. You're becoming complacent.

121012032.content: I'll never be complacent while the Old Town lies in ruins.

121012033.content: So what? You want to bring the sky dwellers back down to live on the ground?

121012034.content: Being in touch with the ground has its own way of reassuring.

121012035.content: There's only so much the Astral Engine can do to stabilize the surface. Even with it, we still experience tremors and rifts, don't we? I thought that alone would be enough to discourage people from returning down here, but...

121012036.content: She flicks away a mound of gravel by her feet, revealing the decaying remains of a tattered merchant's banner.

121012037.content: Everybody remembers past events, past lives. Generation after generation...

121012038.content: Even among the Mods, who know this is all being caused by a Gaea anomaly, the desire to return to the ground is so strong. This is the homeland of the Xu Heng people, after all.

121012039.content: Don't you think it's a bit much to be talking about the concept of "homeland" in Gaea?

121012040.content: That's not how we should be thinking about it.

121012041.content: I'm sorry, but just because we're defending humanity doesn't mean we should agonize over every single decision like they do.

121012042.content: Humans are caught in an endless spiral between self-satisfaction and insatiable needs. You can try all you want, but they'll never be truly down-to-earth.

121012043.content: Gengchen, humanity might have no higher mission, but we do. Yes we are protecting them, but they should never become a burden to us.

121012044.content: I hope you haven't given this pep talk to any of the newer recruits.

121012045.content: This is just who I am. I've never wanted anyone else to understand me, let alone become me... Especially when one reboot is enough to wipe out everything about them.

121012046.content: If there ever comes a day the Visbanes are truly eliminated from this world, then I'll tell them what the previous era was like, what Gaea is supposed to be like, how many times I've failed, how many Modifiers I've sacrificed...

121012047.content: When they're able to hear these facts without being shaken to their core, then they'll be able to live the lives they choose.

121012048.content: But until then, I'll continue to fail and to sacrifice as long as it continues to be for the greater good.

121012049.content: Cycles are not for the greater good—death is death. Odin, we must respect that which we have not yet experienced for ourselves.

121012050.content: We haven't experienced it ourselves, but we've seen it enough times. Gengchen, are you still saddened when those around you die?

121012051.content: Zhiming in the last era, Zhu in this...

121012054.content: I've never denied anyone who's one of "us" before, and I'm not going to start today.

121012055.content: We have things that we must do.

121012056.content: Odin pulls out her lance, and waves to Gengchen as she walks toward the portal.

121021001.content: Modifiers are often told that the Source Layer is more dangerous the deeper you go. The depths are said to be swarming with powerful Visbanes that are rarely ever seen on the Surface Layer...

121021002.content: Therefore, Gengchen and Odin aren't surprised when a giant horde of Visbanes rushes to attack them the moment they step out of the portal. It's like sharks smelling blood in the ocean.

121021003.content: But there's no hunter and prey here... There are only the Mods, and the Visbanes standing in the way.

121021004.content: You shouldn't have brought Thor down this deep.

121021005.content: You think too little of her. She's capable of handling the Visbanes at this level.

121021006.content: This is already very close to the Primordial Layer.

121021007.content: Really? Then it's going to get tricky with limited Divine Power.

121021008.content: Seems you're quite familiar with Xu Heng's Source Layer.

121021009.content: I've investigated it quite a few times... for the cause of the Cloudsong Crisis, and for traces of the "Source."

121021010.content: You mean that girl you were talking about?

121021012.content: I'm assuming you found nothing of interest. Otherwise you'd have reported it to me, surely?

121021013.content: Something that completely changes its identity with each Cycle, something that can live among humankind without detection, something that doesn't leave a single trace...

121021014.content: If something really is the Source, would it even know?

121021015.content: There isn't enough evidence. I mean, we can't even be sure this Source exists...

121021016.content: It does. Everything in the universe springs from something. It's just that we haven't found it yet.

121021017.content: The Visbanes must have a Source. If we can find it and destroy it, we'll bring an end to all of this.

121021019.content: ...Going back to Thor, I must say it's a pity.

121021020.content: Did you want to bring her along for the experience?

121021021.content: Of course not. She already has enough that she can and should do. Besides, there are easier ways to train someone than to bring them here.

121021022.content: It's just that I've never seen her struggle or lack focus.

121021023.content: If you ever ask her what's wrong, she stomps off like a moody kitten. But in reality, what she actually wants is for you to go and comfort her.

121021025.content: Don't you think that's sweet? They're all formidable fighters, yet there's still something about them that's so pure.

121021026.content: They each have their own lives, people they cherish and people who cherish them.

121021027.content: They're also who I need to protect...

121022001.content: The Visbanes charge toward them and disintegrate on contact, like snowflakes falling on open flames.

121022002.content: The flame has burned for eternity, while the snowflakes' lives are fleeting. Where the two meet is a soft blur that masks the destruction taking place.

121022003.content: The final snowflake falls and is evaporated into red mist by Divine Power, then floats uncertainly in this directionless space.

121022005.content: Do you know where the Cinders are?

121022006.content: Don't worry, I have a plan.

121022007.content: Before we left, you said you'd found some snippets of information.

121022008.content: They were just rumors. I wouldn't put too much faith in them.

121022010.content: Odin strides up to Gengchen and cocks her head as she stares into her eyes.

121022011.content: Close enough that they can feel each other's breath, neither of their gazes betrays any flicker of emotion.

121022012.content: ....Gengchen, do you think I'm still the same person as before?

121022013.content: Nobody is ever the same person they were before.

121022015.content: Odin chuckles, then turns and continues walking with Gengchen into the depths of the Source Layer.

121022016.content: That's not what we said on the border of Neuhansa in those final months of the first era.

121022017.content: We didn't know the gravity of the situation back then.

121022018.content: Stop being so indirect all the time. Just say it—we were naive. Childish.

121022019.content: "We are the torch to banish the night."

121022020.content: "We are the dawn guarding humanity's light."

121022021.content: "We will not stop and we will not rest, until our powers are spent and our Access Keys rust..."

121022022.content: "I will be me long after I'm dust."

121022023.content: What made you remember all that again now?

121022024.content: So we can think about how much we've changed since we first wrote it.

121022025.content: Be honest—do you miss those times?

121022026.content: Everyone wishes they could go back in time to correct their past mistakes.

121022027.content: It's normal to feel regret the first few years after a reboot. Do you really feel now that we had a chance of winning in the first era?

121022028.content: The Surface Layer was already fragile back then. Our greatest foes were natural disasters, which we were completely unable to prevent. Even if we had killed every single Visbane, Gaea still would have been destroyed. By the time we were born, there was nothing that could have been done to change the situation...

121022029.content: I'm talking about how we were back then... We didn't know anything except how to kill Visbanes.

121022030.content: We were born to modify Gaea's "imperfections.” The more we have to think about, the more dangerous Gaea is.

121022031.content: You've got the past world, and the past us. One of the two isn't worth pining over.

121022032.content: "The world has never belonged to the Visbanes."

121022033.content: Did you mean to say, "The world has never belonged to us?"

121022034.content: The Visbanes still haven't been eradicated, and there's still a clear boundary between us and the humans. There isn't much to discuss here, Odin.

121022035.content: I didn't see this as a discussion, because I'm not looking for a definitive answer. I just wanted to hear your thoughts.

121022036.content: Lots of people changed their minds during the battle at the end of the last era. Me and you included. It's hard not to doubt yourself when you work as hard as you can but still fail.

121022037.content: So what I want to know from you, Gengchen, is how you feel now after having experienced that defeat?

121022038.content: My convictions haven't changed, and neither has my desire to eradicate all Visbanes.

121022039.content: If it were as simple as that, you wouldn't have spent all this era in Xu Heng. Just as I established Aether Gazer, you established the Quad to ensure there was always someone to protect all the places you could see...

121022040.content: ...Is that because of Zhiming and her team last era?

121022041.content: Yes... I had promised to protect them, and to protect Xu Heng.

121022042.content: And in the end, they died by my hand and Xu Heng burned before my eyes. So that's two promises I've already broken.

121022044.content: There was a reboot. All of that has been erased from history.

121022045.content: Either way, I'm not breaking my promise a third time. So yes, I'll still help you investigate the Visbane Source.

121022047.content: Quickly scanning Gengchen's face, Odin walks to the side of the path and peers down into the chasm below.

121022049.content: They both jump down without a second's hesitation.

121031001.content: The shattered roads and buildings rotate and twist like a Rubik's cube the deeper they penetrate the Source Layer, and the atmosphere becomes increasingly oppressive.

121031002.content: There is no difference between day and night in the Source Layer, and soon two weeks have gone by. Odin and Gengchen's tireless search is starting to bring them closer to the Cinders' signal.

121031003.content: Hearing the shrieks of Visbanes below them, they envelop themselves in Divine Power just as they come crashing down in the middle of the horde.

121031005.content: Odin looks around at the Visbanes they have scattered, and stops for what feels like the first time in weeks. An almost imperceptible change flitters across her face.

121031007.content: The signal is moving. I think some crafty fox has beaten us to it.

121031008.content: Odin picks up her lance and charges off in one direction. Gengchen chases close behind on her yin-yang ink blots.

121031009.content: It doesn't take long for them to locate their target. Not because of their superior speed, but because the target is pretty hard to miss.

121031010.content: A strange, deformed body cloaked in misty Bane Energy measuring a kilometer in diameter is flying through the void beneath the path. Things that look like tentacles, or maybe wings, occasionally emerge from the confines of the impenetrable fog.

121031014.content: The perpetual twilight of the Source Layer makes it impossible to see where the Cinders is from this height. They begin to descend towards the giant Visbane, but at some point it detects their presence and speeds up in an attempt to lose them.

121031015.content: It's agile despite its enormous size, and it shoots through the Source Layer like a shadow, seemingly unaffected by terrain or obstacles. Odin and Gengchen aren't sure how they'll be able to stop it.

121031016.content: We should be able to kill it from this distance. Step aside.

121031017.content: Not a chance. We can't even see where the Cinders is, and I wouldn't believe you even if you said there was a 100% chance you wouldn't damage it.

121031018.content: Think about it for a second—if the Cinders is the source of the Cognizant Visbanes, why would this one steal it?

121031019.content: We've lost our only clue and are surrounded by enemies, of course I know...

121031020.content: The Visbanes are even more powerful this deep in the Source Layer. We're the ones at a disadvantage here.

121031021.content: We're not going to be able to keep up with it at this rate.

121031022.content: Golden light begins to gather at the tip of Odin's lance, and holes begin to tear in the surrounding space. Odin points her lance at the distant Visbane.

121031024.content: I'm going to drag it to the Surface Layer.

121031025.content: Gengchen clenches her jaw and, with a flick of her sleeve, knocks Odin's Access Key off-target. She then speeds off after their adversary.

121031026.content: Odin frowns, but doesn't resume her plan and follows after Gengchen instead.

121031027.content: You must know how important the Cinders is to us.

121031028.content: And you must know how much damage a Visbane of that size will cause on the Surface Layer.

121031029.content: Do you think we wouldn't be able to stop it?

121031030.content: It's too risky. We don't actually know what's underneath that fog, and you can see how quickly it can fly. It could end up destroying the five isles.

121031031.content: There is no such thing as guaranteed success in this universe. Would you really give up just because of a one-in-a-hundred risk?

121031032.content: We have the power to choose, but we wouldn't be the ones in danger—it'd be humanity. I don't think that's right.

121031033.content: Sometimes there's a difference between what's right and what's necessary, Gengchen. You've made sacrifices before—there are some trade-offs you just know in your gut need to be made.

121031034.content: The Mods in this era are getting weaker, while the Visbanes are growing stronger. Gaea is on the precipice...

121031035.content: You know what's happening in Xu Heng. The dense forests of Jokurr have become a frozen wasteland. Which Sephirah Zone will suffer next?

121031036.content: This is between us and the Visbanes.

121031037.content: Do you believe the humans to be innocent in all of this? Who do you think started the war between us and the Visbanes in the first place?

121031038.content: In the past, it was the humans who had the power to choose. Now we are their proxies, and if we want to save them we must act decisively.

121031039.content: I want nothing to go wrong where it concerns the Source of the Visbanes.

121031040.content: You once said, "This era is running out of time." And we might not get a chance to reboot. You've "seen" situations we're unable to fix.

121031042.content: This is buying us more time.

121031043.content: The failure in the first era wasn't because of the Visbanes, but because civilization collapsed and caused Idealbild to deviate. This may be the outcome we can do nothing about.

121031044.content: Our mission statement is to wipe out the Visbanes, but the reason for that is to defend civilization and our connection to the human race. Like you said, we're just their proxies.

121031045.content: The stability of their civilization is the one thing we should never risk. Besides...

121031047.content: This is Xu Heng. What I say, goes.

121032001.content: The giant Visbane continues to go deeper into the Source Layer, as though it's aware that this will further sap the Modifiers' powers and force them to turn back.

121032002.content: Once the energy repression in the Primordial Layer gets strong enough, it stops distinguishing between targets.

121032003.content: It was brave to descend to the Primordial Layer, but how are you going to run away now?

121032004.content: Noticing the Visbane has slowed down significantly, Odin and Gengchen flank it and erupt in a blaze of Divine Power, like two shooting stars in the darkness of the Source Layer.

121032005.content: Drawing near enough to confirm a lethal strike, the two accelerated to their utmost speed. Each trailing black and white, and dark purple flames respectively, they silently traced two intersecting paths. In the blink of an eye, they pierced through the giant Visbane's kilometer-long body.

121032007.content: Odin and Gengchen sheathe their Access Keys, and watch as the giant Visbane slowly disintegrates into pale fragments until all that's left is an ethereal crystal floating in the air.

121032008.content: The crystal, about the size of a fist, slowly drops down and hovers just in front of Odin and Gengchen.

121032011.content: Except I think we need to call it something else now. I thought it was going to be some kind of powder or particle...

121032012.content: Odin looks around, and can already spot signs of data instability in the empty, silent space beyond the path. There is no Visbane activity to be seen.

121032013.content: It's a good thing this one didn't panic so much it went crashing through to the Primordial Layer with the Cinders, because there's no way we'd have been able to follow it down there.

121032014.content: This is about the depth we estimated the signal source when I was here with Thor last time... Was the Visbane attracted here by accident, and then couldn't cope staying down here with the Cinders so went back up?

121032015.content: If so, then we got lucky...

121032016.content: Odin walks in a circle around the floating Cinders, but her eyes stay locked on Gengchen. Seeing she's not going to say anything, Odin's smile fades a little and she absent-mindedly brushes aside her braid.

121032017.content: Please don't tell me you have bad news?

121032018.content: No, I was just thinking about how you're in a good mood now.

121032019.content: Of course. This is the only signal in the entire Source Layer. We seized a golden opportunity.

121032020.content: So, even though I know you only came with me because of your interest in the Cinders...

121032021.content: Unless you have a more convincing argument than the extermination of the entire Visbane race, the ownership of the Cinders is not up for discussion.

121032023.content: These single yeses of yours are the most difficult for others to understand...

121032024.content: Forget it, I'm not interested in hearing your reasons why you want the Cinders. I don't want to have to rethink my plan.

121032025.content: I'll take it back to Ain Soph for the Cryptics to study. I will let you know what they find.

121032026.content: If they figure out a way to overcome the Cognizant Visbanes, that's when we organize a little hunting party.

121032027.content: Odin weaves a cube the size of a room with Divine Power. With a clench of her fist, it gradually shrinks until it has swallowed the Cinders' crimson glow.

121041002.content: The purple Divine Power envelops the Cinders layer by layer. Once it's done, Odin doesn't make a move. Instead, she examines the Divine Power cage that has been compressed to less than one square meter.

121041003.content: Stop when you can't take it anymore.

121041004.content: Huh?! You know the Cinders can corrupt Divine Power?

121041005.content: Odin frowns, and watches as small cracks begin to form on the cage, crimson light emanating from beneath them.

121041006.content: As the connection to the Divine Power source is broken, the cage dissipates back into nothingness. Odin glances at her palm, and sees a fine crimson sliver penetrate her skin.

121041008.content: The erosion is more powerful than expected.

121041009.content: You could have told me that earlier.

121041010.content: There was too much vague information. Stop complaining—a lot of it was probably nonsense.

121041011.content: Well now it's turned out to be true, I hope you have an idea of what we can do about it.

121041013.content: Gengchen blinks, and it's as though the universe expands and there is a clear distinction between light and shadow. She rises into the air beside the Cinders.

121041014.content: Nine truths, come to the light; reverse the one, under the power of the Prime.

121041015.content: With no sign of Divine Power being used, a dense datastream begins to flow around Laguna, enveloping her and the Cinders in dazzling bands of light.

121041016.content: Unlike when Odin attempted to contain it with Divine Power, the data flows into the Cinders. On the surface it appears unchanged, but the signal it emits begins to weaken.

121041017.content: Prime Power, that's your solution? I said I didn't want you to get hurt.

121041018.content: You place too much importance on the Cinders. All things are equal to the seal, except for their size.

121041019.content: My Prime Power may be damaged, but the computing power needed to seal the Cinders is a minuscule fraction of that required for the Astral Engine.

121041020.content: I don't like to be told facts I can't verify.

121041023.content: Gengchen floats back down to the ground pulling the sealed Cinders. Odin goes to take it off her, but she pulls it away.

121041024.content: The seal will not hold in Ain Soph.

121041026.content: I must go to Yu Jing first. If my task there is successful, I'll go with you.

121041027.content: Task? Do you want that thing the Mimir system is searching for?

121041029.content: The Heterocore... If it's as useful as you claim, then yes it's worth a try.

121041030.content: ...I'll instruct the Cryptics to develop a container. But I cannot let you stay with them until they've built another Cinders to give you as a reward.

121041031.content: Build another? Can that be done?

121041032.content: What, you don't know a joke when you hear one? There are people who need you, Gengchen—I can't let you stay in Ain Soph researching the Cinders forever.

121041033.content: You've been with me for two weeks now. You need a break.

121041035.content: I know. You've never once been tired over all these years.

121041036.content: We're all Prime Modifiers. Why does it feel like there's such a difference in our capabilities?

121041037.content: If you're talking about Brahmā... she's not tired, just unwilling.

121041038.content: She never wants to do anything, and you never want to say anything. I've got a good mind to lock you two up together for a couple of years in the hope it'll improve both of your personalities...

121041039.content: You know it'd put everyone's mind at ease if you'd just admit you're tired every once and a while.

121041041.content: It would put my mind at ease.

121041042.content: Odin taps her watch as a sign she's done talking about this, then looks up as she hears strange and terrifying noises in the distance.

121041043.content: We're attracting them all right. Is the will to destroy stronger than the will to survive? Or they just want my stuff?

121041044.content: Don't lose the Cinders. Look after it.

121052001.content: A familiar path. Odin can already sense the passage in space she'd temporarily closed.

121052002.content: Clearing out the packs of Visbanes that had regrouped in their absence, the two retrace their steps from two weeks ago.

121052003.content: I thought we'd cleared this area last time we were here. Guess they knew we were coming.

121052004.content: It's very obvious when Mods enter the Source Layer.

121052005.content: But they've crawled all the way up here from the Primordial Layer to get the Cinders. Are you sure that's just because we're making too much noise?

121052006.content: Bringing the Cinders back to the Surface Layer isn't a good idea if it's just to give mice the ability to talk.

121052007.content: The Sephirah Core is much more appealing than the Cinders.

121052008.content: The Sephirah Core... That's the biggest thorn in our sides.

121052009.content: You brought the Sephirah Core out to resolve the Cloudsong Crisis. I didn't stop you at the time because I trusted you not to make matters worse.

121052010.content: But right now your powers are weakened. Worst case scenario, I lose both you and the Astral Engine. That would be devastating not just to me, but to thousands of ordinary people who've never even spoken to you before.

121052011.content: We need to think of a way to replace either the Astral Engine or the Sephirah Core as soon as possible.

121052012.content: Zhiming is still trying, and I believe she can do it. She just needs more time.

121052013.content: You need time too. Like I said, as soon as possible.

121052014.content: Odin stops and places her hands on Gengchen's shoulders.

121052015.content: Absolutely NOTHING can happen to you or the Sephirah Core.

121052016.content: Well, for the Astral Engine I was thinking... The Observators might know a way, if we ask them.

121052017.content: If there was a way of contacting the Observators, we never would have had any issues with the Cloudsong Ore's parameters—they could have just edited Xu Heng's physical settings and that would have been that.

121052018.content: Aren't there any leads in Ain Soph?

121052019.content: Forget it. Those guys haven't bothered showing their faces for an entire era. They may as well not exist.

121052020.content: It's true that the Observators did help us a lot in past eras, and acted as the Gaea senior managers that they are. Unfortunately, people aren't gods: they get tired, they get bored, and they get distracted by their earthly desires.

121052021.content: They believed that they as mortals could wield the power of the divine, dictate the laws of the world... They should have known that so much responsibility would eventually break them.

121052022.content: Anything we've thought of, they must have thought of as well. They would have put contingency measures in place.

121052023.content: That makes sense, except that the appearance of the Visbanes is a variable, as are the reboots. These are burdens on Gaea, and therefore also on the Observators themselves.

121052024.content: Are they dead? Dormant? Malfunctioning? Or are they simply tired? I'm not even convinced CORG knows what's going on with them.

121052025.content: All I know is that the Observators are nowhere to be seen, and therefore can offer us no help. I don't care about things that I cannot control.

121052026.content: In my heart of hearts, though, I'd like to see them return.

121052027.content: Who doesn't? They're not bound by Gaea's laws like we are—they could snap their fingers to make a lot of our biggest problems go away.

121052028.content: There's nothing wrong with a bit of hope, as long as you don't start to rely on it. Besides, it seems we always get stuck dealing with the worst-case scenarios anyway...

121052029.content: They both suddenly stop talking, and turn to look at another path to their side.

121052030.content: That was a strong Bane Energy reaction...

121052031.content: And two sets of Divine Power.

121052032.content: They run off in the direction of the powerful Bane Energy source, only to find it suddenly disappears before they get close.

121052034.content: The Divine Powers... Is it from Jianbing and Mengzhang?

121052035.content: If it is, they've landed themselves in big trouble.

121052036.content: You stay in Xu Heng. There's no need for you to go with me to Ain Soph.

121052037.content: But we haven't seen the enemy yet.

121052038.content: I can sense it. Or rather, I can smell it.

121052039.content: Two figures can be seen supporting each other in the distance. Gengchen breathes a sigh of relief when she sees Jianbing and Mengzhang.

121052040.content: However, Odin's gaze is fixed on the empty space in front of them, as though she can still see the ferocious Bane Energy that has just disappeared.

121052041.content: You were right. Everyone wishes they could go back in time to correct their past mistakes.

121052042.content: Since the second era, I've always gotten this feeling right before something appears that's beyond the realm of our understanding.

121052043.content: A feeling, before everything gets out of hand, before sacrifices are made, before all the things I don't want to happen...

121052044.content: I want to kill something... Right now, immediately, this very second.

221011001.content: Chief, your tea's gone cold. I'll make some fresh tea for you.

221011003.content: Lingguang is about to take away the teapot when she sees Gengchen lift her cup and take another sip of the lukewarm tea.

221011004.content: Chief...? Is something on your mind?

221011006.content: You usually stick to the boiling-hot tea because, as you say, that's the only way you can taste the aromas. But your tea's already cold and yet you just had some...

221011008.content: Gengchen lowers her eyes to look at her teacup. The cup is half-full, and the wisps of steam are long gone. Although her palate is moistened by the tea, she can not taste any traces of it at all.

221011009.content: ...You're always so perceptive about things like this.

221011010.content: I'm a physician after all, and I've been your physician too, for so many years. It'd be weird if I didn't notice.

221011011.content: For the sake of your health, I'm going to insist again that you don't take boiling-hot tea... I can't believe I have to say this every time I come back from Nanjiao Isle.

221011012.content: I do wait for the tea to cool down whenever I remember your advice.

221011013.content: You said that every time... Alright. I'll take you at your word...

221011014.content: Were you thinking about the news you just heard?

221011015.content: Yes... Let's have some of that hot tea first.

221011017.content: Greetings, everyone. Welcome to our broadcast for Monday, February 6th, 2300. We are now bringing you the latest news live from Tian Lu Traders.

221011018.content: The renowned business group Tian Lu Traders may be facing the biggest crisis since its inception.

221011019.content: Over the past five trading days, the company's stock price has plunged by some 48%, to almost half of the year's high.

221011020.content: We also understand that the president of Tian Lu Traders has resigned to take responsibility for her poor performance, and the management team of Tian Lu Traders is set for a major reshuffle...

221011021.content: I've already answered that question. Go talk to whomever asked me that just now...

221011022.content: The diminutive girl is obscured from view by a whole cluster of reporters. She looks at all of them calmly, though keeps making some kind of gesture with her hands behind her back.

221011024.content: President Luliang, what is your plan regarding to the issues that Tian Lu Traders has been facing lately?

221011025.content:
Well, um... This is all very much a work in progress, and our "head butler" is in the best position to answer your question.
The mic is yours, Yingzhao.

221011027.content: Hey! You're blocking Yingzhao from view! She's a key employee at Tian Lu Traders now, you know!!!

221011028.content: (Yup, yup, that's right... Let's just put her in the frame, and then I can scoot...)

221011029.content: So, Ms. Yingzhao, a number of business giants have indicated their interest in acquiring Tian Lu Traders. What is the company's position on this?

221011030.content: Also, is President Luliang really quitting?

221011031.content: My reply to your first question is: I'm sorry, I can't disclose more right now.

221011032.content: As for your second question, we shouldn't be taking any unsubstantiated rumors too seriously, should we?

221011033.content: Really? Are you saying that President Luliang is not quitting? On the record?

221011034.content: "Trust and kindness will earn you gold and diamonds." Since our founding, Tian Lu Traders has staunchly believed that we can create wealth through honesty and keep it by remaining trustworthy. This is also what my boss believes.

221011035.content: (Huh. I might have said something like that before... I must've picked that up from Mantou.)

221011036.content: (But I must say, Yingzhao... From the look of things, that's a whole lot of trust you're putting in me!)

221011037.content: (Whatever. I should just get out now while I can...)

221011038.content: Luliang nimbly makes her way through the media throng while they are occupied with Yingzhao.

221011039.content: That's the good thing about being pocket-sized, ha ha!

221011040.content: Alright, I've got everything packed, so I'm not gonna waste any more time with you people here. I'm counting on you, Yingzhao.

221011041.content: While none of the reporters notices Luliang slipping away, the same can not be said for Gengchen.

221011042.content: That was pretty smooth of her. Just like in the past.

221011043.content: "Like in the past"... How long has it been since the two of you last saw each other, chief?

221011044.content: Four or five years. Hmm... I haven't spoken to her much as I've been busy.

221011045.content: I don't think you have to feel bad about it. You're both in Xu Heng, just with different businesses.

221011046.content: You know what they say: True friendship between two noble persons is tasteless as water. I'm sure that's the case for you two.

221011047.content: ...Well, you're probably right. But once she starts yammering...

221011048.content:
Gengchen's visage remains devoid of expression. Though, judging by her eyes, she is somewhere else again.
Perhaps she has recalled something.

221011049.content: You know, chief, it's good for you to spend time with the energetic ones every once in a while. Who knows, your health may just improve.

221011050.content: That doesn't make any sense. You know what's going on with my powers.

221011051.content: But don't underestimate what a positive mood can do for your body. Sometimes, it can even achieve what medicine can't. Besides...

221011052.content: You're worried, aren't you, chief? About what's happening at Tian Lu Traders? Do you want to drop in on Ms. Luliang...?

221011053.content: She'll be fine. She may look like a child, but she's been around the block a few times. This little bit of pressure won't get to her.

221011054.content: What are you worried about then?

221011055.content: Those business giants. Back then, the mining titans suffered massive losses when Tian Lu Traders broke their chokehold on the market. The new trains this time round pose the same threat to them.

221011056.content: It's been over 30 years since economic reforms started, but they're still stuck in their old ways.

221011057.content: It's not easy to develop new industries, and if the giants gang up on Tian Lu Traders, the whole market will be intimidated... Even so, it's not wise for the Quad to intervene, and Luliang will have to tackle this all on her own...

221011058.content: So you ARE worried about Ms. Luliang after all! Why don't you take this opportunity to catch up with her?

221011059.content: And you shouldn't go empty-handed. Are there any snacks that Ms. Luliang likes?

221011060.content: This isn't about Luliang... (Sighs) Never mind.

221011061.content: Lingguang, do you know where I can get some top-quality alcohol? Tequila from Tikala, to be exact.

221011064.content: What do I want to buy when I'm rich? Hmm, good question... I want to buy me a truck full of Tikala Tequila!

221011065.content: Tequila? Is that booze? I thought you'd have loftier goals than this...

221011066.content: Heh heh. You don't know the deal here, Mantou.

221011067.content: You don't just drink the good liquor. They're also highly collectible. Just let the bottles sit in your cellar, and they'll keep going up in value!

221011068.content: That sounds more like you... But why from Tikala specifically?

221011071.content: What? But it's so well-known! Are you sure you've not had any before on your travels?

221011072.content: I was busy looking for ways to keep Xu Heng stable. How could I have the time?

221011074.content: "There she goes again" is written all over Luliang's face. She picks up her drink, and downs the liquid in one shot.

221011075.content: (Burps) Well, not that there's anything wrong with the drinks we have here in Xu Heng. But I'm telling you, the next time you come by Tikala, try it.

221011076.content: I get my hands on a bottle once in a while through the other merchants. I don't really have the words for it... Let's just say that a sip of the stuff sends you right to the heavens, where you can touch the fruits of wisdom...

221011078.content: Bah! Come on, it's just a drink! Well, I mean...

221011079.content: Seeing a strange expression develop on Gengchen's face, Luliang stops in her tracks.

221011080.content: Hey, Mantou. Don't you like spicy food?

221011081.content: That's a really hard tack you took there. I do hope you're a lot smoother when negotiating business deals.

221011082.content: I can't believe you just roasted me for my social skills...

221011084.content: Nothing. Where was I...? Oh, tequila. It's made from this native plant called agave. One tiny capful of the stuff, and you'll have smoke coming out of your ears!

221011085.content: It's true. I swear on my reputation as a trader!

221011086.content: Luliang decides to underline her oath with a spirited slap on the thigh—except that the thigh she slaps is not hers, but that of Gengchen who is sitting next to her.

221011087.content: And what has your reputation got to do with my thigh...

221011088.content: Heh heh. Well, you're the bigger shot here!

221011089.content:
And one day, you'll become the biggest shot for every one of Xu Heng to rely on.
Trust me, I'm never wrong.

221011090.content: Luliang pats on Gengchen's thigh once more as she continues talking, as if she wants to prove what she said.

221011092.content: It is my greatest happiness to be able to contribute whatever paltry power I have to the well-being of Xu Heng.

221011093.content: Ugh. Look around you. We're in this greasy little malatang restaurant. No one around here talks the way you do!

221011094.content: Have you forgotten how the common folk of Xu Heng speak? Is it because you've been mixing in those lofty circles for too long?

221011095.content: How could I forget? Both the Quad and I carry the trust of the people of Xu Heng on our shoulders.

221011096.content: Ha ha! Well said! Then... let's toast to Xu Heng!

221011097.content: East Banchuan Street is teeming with activity, despite the coat of light rain on everyone and everything.

221011098.content: From this nondescript little joint in this ordinary-looking corner of the street, the sound of laughter and glasses clinking continues.

221021001.content: Hey, are you really not going to stop me? Aren't you afraid that I'm just going to make for the exit?

221021003.content: By the time the reporters realized that they weren't going to get anything out of the polished and very tight-lipped Yingzhao, Luliang was long gone from the scene.

221021004.content: And so they disappeared in a second, as suddenly as they came in a swarm at the scent of hot news earlier.

221021005.content: If you're going on a break, Boss, you should leave soon, before you run into more reporters. They're like dogs on a hunt, you know.

221021006.content: Luliang has had her things packed already. It is a huge backpack about a foot or so taller than she is.

221021007.content: I've a lot of work to do. If those reporters get hold of you again, I won't be able to help again.

221021009.content: But looking at your performance, maybe we should make you our official spokesperson...

221021011.content: Relax! I promise you'll get a raise when I come back... Well, I wish I could say that, anyway.

221021012.content: Now, my dear head butler, listen to me. And this is for your ears only.

221021013.content: Those old geezers have long had their eyes on us since we went from "Tian Lu Groceries" to "Tian Lu Traders." And understandably so, since they've been losing money every year.

221021014.content: They've been waiting for this for a long time. Manipulating our stock price, spreading rumors in the market... They're using all their resources to bury us.

221021015.content: And honestly speaking, given our size, any war of attrition may not turn out well for us...

221021016.content: Hey, I've been wondering since you came in the door. What are you staring at???

221021017.content: Your backpack... It suits you very well, Boss. Now you look like someone in grade school who's going camping.

221021018.content: Yingzhao continued to stare at the camper's pack, not noticing the downturn of Luliang's mouth.

221021019.content: "Grade school"?! Oh, so you think it's funny because you're taller than me, huh?

221021020.content: You're just going home, aren't you? Why do you need such a big backpack?

221021021.content: You don't get it. There's stuff I have to keep handy at all times.

221021022.content: Besides... it's been a while for me to go home. What if I find some treasure there that I'd want to bring back, hmm?

221021023.content: And here I thought you were just going to ask me, "Whatever happened to the boss full of confidence that I knew?"

221021024.content: I don't think that confidence has gone anywhere.

221021025.content: Just like always, she looks nothing like a company president in the middle of a crisis. And she's going on a camping vacation with that backpack to boot.

221021026.content: I'm telling you, I'm not going camping...

221021027.content: (Forget it. It's not a bad thing to hide your vulnerable side from your employee, I guess.)

221021028.content: Luliang looks around the spacious Tian Lu Traders lobby, a far cry from the company's early days. But it feels like she is back to her hardscrabble roots.

221021029.content: (No, maybe I'm even more helpless now than I was then. At least back then I still dared to talk big...)

221021030.content: (To think I said that I'd help you fulfill your wish or whatever... I was so full of myself back then, Mantou.)

221021031.content: Mantou, why aren't you sweating from all that spicy food?

221021032.content: Well, a mantou, or in other words, a steamed bun, stays dry no matter how long you steam it.

221021033.content: I didn't know you were into dad jokes. Ha ha...

221021034.content: Was that a dad joke? You seem pretty tickled by it...

221021035.content: No, I was laughing at the fact that you just told a dad joke...

221021037.content: As Luliang bent over the table in laughter, Gengchen simply took another sip from her cup with her eyes closed.

221021038.content: ...You know, I've always wanted to ask. Why do you keep calling me "Mantou"? You're the only one who calls me that.

221021039.content: Huh? I thought you knew. Look at you, all fair like a steamed bun. Plus, you like to eat mantou too, don't you? It all fits together!

221021040.content: Mantou is a convenient and filling food for folks on the go. It was really good to have in the days immediately after the Cloudsong Crisis.

221021042.content: Luliang, slightly tipsy, had one cheek pressed against her arm as she slumped over the table. However, her gaze was firmly on Gengchen, as if she had her eye on some rare gemstone.

221021043.content: Hee hee. Nothing. It just sounded like you were talking about yourself.

221021045.content: Anyway, I've already told you what I want to buy when I'm rich. How about you?

221021048.content: Mantou goes best with chili sauce.

221021050.content:
This time, the smile on Luliang's face froze.
It seemed that even the many bubbling pots in the restaurant also grew cold.

221021051.content: Ugh, Mantou. You and your bad jokes——ACHOO!!!

221021052.content: All jokes aside, Mantou, while I know that you don't pursue normal things like the rest of us do... surely you have a wish or two that you want to fulfill?

221021053.content: For example, is there something you want? Or a task you'd like finished? Someone you want to spend more time with? Changes you'd like to see in the world...?

221021054.content: Oh my. Why do I sound so airy-fairy? I've been spending too much time with you, Mantou!!!

221021056.content: Gengchen stared at her reflection on the smooth, oil-splattered table, as if she was hoping to see the answer there.

221021057.content: Wisps of steam rose from the boiling pots of soup around them. They were surrounded, too, by the many wishes big and small of the restaurant patrons around them.

221021059.content:
Gengchen slowly closed her eyes.
As she listened to the sound of the boiling soup, it was as if she was listening in to countless wishes that had sprouted forth like mushrooms after the rain, or green buds in spring.

221021060.content: If someone were to draw this scene...

221021062.content: Huh? What did you just say, Mantou?

221021063.content: It doesn't matter if I tell you my wish or not.

221021064.content: Tsk. You don't need to tell me. I know what it is.

221021065.content: I can even summarize it for you...

221021066.content: "To create a Xu Heng where everyone can fulfill their own wishes and achieve their own happiness." Did I get that right, Mantou?

221021068.content: Though there was nary a stir in Gengchen's face, her silence told Luliang that she was indeed right.

221021069.content: Ugh. Just saying that gave me goose bumps. Don't make me say cringey stuff like this ever again...

221021071.content: But since this is your wish, Mantou, I'll definitely help you.

221021072.content: Just like how you helped me back then. I'm a loyal friend, aren't I?

221021073.content: Well, thank you. You can certainly join us at the Quad.

221021074.content: Nah, I won't be able to do what I do best there. I won't be helpful to you that way.

221021075.content: Gengchen did not seem surprised by Luliang's rejection of her offer. A resigned smile was all she had to offer in response.

221021076.content: Alright, alright. Let's have a toast! This time, not to Xu Heng but to our wish!!!

221031001.content: I never realized just how close my folks' home is to the office... Guess I've just been busy working all these years, hah.

221031002.content: But things sure have changed. Look at all these tall buildings and the crowd here...

221031003.content: It has been a long time since Luliang returned home, and now she finds herself surrounded by streets that are both familiar and new at the same time.

221031004.content: I always thought I'd come home to a welcome parade, not with my tail between my legs...

221031005.content: All along the shopping street, there are the great big posters put up by the shopkeepers, as well as the chatter and laughter of an endless stream of shoppers. It is as if there were a festival on.

221031006.content:
In the midst of this hustle and bustle is Luliang, all alone.
All she can think about is how distressed her employees must be, and the inflammatory reports about Tian Lu Traders on the news.

221031007.content: "It's been posited that what is happening is revenge by the mining titans, whose interests had been threatened by Tian Lu Traders's meteoric rise. I'm not seeing the truth to this theory, though."

221031008.content: "There's a saying that goes, 'To forge iron, one must be tough like iron.' In my opinion, Tian Lu Traders grew too quickly without building a strong foundation along the way. So it's no surprise that it's hardly a match for those big, established players that've been around for a long time."

221031009.content: "Tsk, these so-called 'experts.' I wonder how much they've pocketed. Maybe I should send them a message and ask to share in the spoils. Right, Yingzhao?"

221031010.content: "Hmm. If that's what you want, Boss, I can try to get in touch with them. But I suspect we have far more important tasks at the moment."

221031011.content: Ah, I can't help but think about the folks back at Tian Lu. After all, I'm the one who is responsible for their paychecks...

221031012.content: Gone was the little cheeky and eloquent bargainer who used to hassle the area's merchants day in and day out, it would seem...

221031014.content: Did you just say that you want a thousand bucks for this rock?! "Not a penny less"? I don't think it's worth a penny over a hundred!

221031015.content: What? You wanna bet? You'll pay me fifty thousand if I can buy a similar rock for a hundred? Hah! You said it!

221031016.content: Hey mister, do you have a rock that looks like this? Sell it to me for a hundred, and we'll split the fifty thousand down the middle!

221031017.content: ...What? You've changed your mind? So, do I get a discount or what?

221031018.content: Alright. Looks like I was worried for nothing.

221031019.content: Hey, young lady! Want some strawberries? They're really sweet!

221031021.content: Mmm, yeah, they're real sweet... May I take another one? Don't worry, I promise to buy a huge bag from you if the next one's good too!

221031022.content: Try our new Crispy Sticks! Hey miss, wanna give this a try? It's real popular among the young ones like you these days!

221031023.content: Home alone, miss? Want a kitty or puppy friend for company?

221031025.content: The shopping street is a lot busier than Luliang remembered. Were she to run around here like she did as a child, she'd certainly bump into someone within minutes.

221031026.content: But the voices of the hardworking vendors ringing out in the streets, beckoning potential buyers, are exactly as she remembered.

221031027.content: Hee hee, got myself something good again!

221031028.content: Gah, I'm never gonna fit all my stuff in this bag. Good thing that I didn't listen to Yingzhao.

221031029.content: I should just get myself a suitcase... Huh? Hang on, I see a game booth over there... and looks like I can win a suitcase there?

221031031.content: The energy of the shopping street has already infected Luliang in a way of which she herself isn't aware...

221031032.content: (Indeed, there's no real reason to worry about that child.)

221031033.content: Luliang goes about her shopping like any other girl out there. It's just that now she is bargaining for items at prices perhaps a mere thousandth of what she is used to in business negotiations.

221031034.content: She is slowly recovering the simple and purest joy of buying and selling, which has been suppressed and forgotten in her years of navigating the world of commerce.

221031035.content: But since I'm here, I should at least hand her the gift...

221031036.content: Gengchen mumbles to herself as she looks down at the bottle of Tikala Tequila in her hands. But when she looks up again, the little girl who has been busily weaving in and out of the street stalls has already disappeared into the crowd.

221031038.content: Like a traveler who has come from somewhere afar, Luliang drags her shiny new suitcase into an art gallery that has a real antique feel to it.
