221031040.content: The gallery is a world apart from the madding crowd outside on the street. An old-fashioned gramophone placed at the front counter is playing classical Xu Heng music. Looking at the paintings on the walls, which seems like they'd been painted some time ago, one'd almost feel like an intruder of sorts.

221031041.content: Mmm. Looks like no one's in here.

221031042.content: Doesn't matter. I can take a look around first.

221031043.content: Most of the paintings hanging on the walls are works in the realism style that depict the people and lifestyles of Xu Heng. Inside the gallery is a microcosm of Xu Heng through the ages, presented through the skillful representations of the artist.

221031044.content: Would you look at that! There's a plaque that says "Tian Lu Groceries" over here. The amount of detail in this...

221031045.content: Too bad we're never going back to the Xu Heng of the past again... It feels horrible to say that, knowing how much work Mantou has put in, though.

221031046.content: The Cloudsong Crisis. To be honest, it's not something I want to relive ever again.

221031047.content: But, the more people seek to forget the past, the more we need to have it on record.

221031049.content: Luliang soon becomes engrossed in looking at this massive scroll depicting Xu Heng's past and present. A while later, she comes to the end of it, a work that appeared to be the latest to be shown judged from the signature.

221031051.content:
Luliang murmurs the name of the painting and finds her eyes glued to it.
That is, until she sees the price marked beneath.

221031052.content: Wow. It's a beautiful painting, but the price is...

221031053.content: Good day, ma'am. We do not offer discounts on any artworks. Thank you for your understanding.

221031055.content: Luliang was busy rehearsing how she'd bargain for the painting when startled by a voice that suddenly rang out behind her.

221031056.content: Ahem. Well, I'm sorry. Are you the boss here at the gallery?

221031057.content: Boss? Haha. Not really. I'm just an artist who wanted to cut out the middleman in all this.

221031058.content: So... you must be the painter... Master Yunweng?

221031059.content: After taking a quick glance at the signature on the painting, Luliang started studying the man more closely with an "I smell another good deal" look on her face.

221031060.content: Yes, you can just call me Yunweng. Sad to say, I'm no master.

221031061.content: Oh no, don't say that. All you need is a good marketing and sales team. Trust me.

221031062.content: ...Yes, I had a "team" once. But having to act on their "campaign" meant that I became a mere tool for the needs and requirements of others. A puppet, so to speak.

221031063.content: I see... Sounds like it's hard to find someone who appreciates your work for what it is.

221031064.content: But you must be doing pretty well now, no? What with your own gallery and getting to paint whatever you want...

221031065.content: Yunweng does not say a word. He simply shrugs and gives Luliang a wan smile.

221031066.content: Looks like... you're dealing with some sort of problem?

221031067.content: Nothing can escape Luliang's keen senses.

221031068.content: It's nothing. I'll leave you to the paintings now, ma'am. I'll be in my studio upstairs, and you can call for me from here anytime.

221031070.content: Anything else I can help you with?

221031071.content: You're in no state to paint right now. I can see the frustration written all over your face.

221031072.content: You're missing something, and you're missing it bad. Yup. That's what's going on.

221031074.content: Heh, the ability to read our opponents is fundamental for us businesspeople. And I've lots of experience when it comes to the headaches of keeping a business going...

221031076.content: I'll be honest with you, then. I'm in desperate need of a pigment called Bamboo Green. But I can't seem to be able to buy it anywhere.

221031077.content: "Bamboo Green"... isn't that some sort of rare mineral pigment that can only be found on Shuofang Isle?

221031078.content:
Oh, so you know it? Remarkable.
It is a rather rare pigment... But before this, I've never seen it as scarce as it is today.

221031079.content: I can't even get hold of the ore nuggets to grind down into powder pigment myself.

221031080.content: Hmm... That does sound rather tricky.

221031081.content: The painter looks up at Luliang suddenly.

221031082.content: Ma'am, you said earlier that you're a businessperson. And since you seem to know about pigments... might you be able to source the Bamboo Green ore?

221031083.content: What? Well yeah, I'm in business, but there're limits to what we can do, too. How should I put it... I'm not exactly familiar with this market...?

221031084.content: (I can't exactly tell him that my company is this close to bankruptcy, can I...?)

221031085.content: I have this painting which must be delivered on time. Please. This is very important for me. If you're able to find the thing, ma'am, I'm willing to pay a premium for it.

221031086.content: The painter lowers his head to Luliang, his expression grave with only the pure desire for creation in his eyes.

221031088.content: (Bamboo Green's really pricey. Plus, there's the logistics problem thanks to those old geezers. But that look on his face... I guess this counts as a "wish" too?)

221031089.content: I see... How about I get you the mineral in exchange for this painting?

221031090.content: Luliang points at the painting that has earlier consumed her attention, "Along the Luo River." The painter frowns and hesitates for a moment.

221031091.content: ...I'll do that if you can bring me some Bamboo Green within three days.

221031093.content: Okay, I've made a promise, but how do I go about fulfilling it now...?

221031094.content: Luliang stops in the middle of the crowded street and takes a look around her.

221031095.content: I suppose I could make a call to Tian Lu Traders...

221031096.content: But Yingzhao must be really busy right now. It's probably not a good idea to ask her to take this on too. That might just push her over the edge.

221031097.content: Hmm, what should I do... This is...

221031099.content: "Heh heh. Time to show these folks the magic that only we merchants are capable of!"

221031100.content: Luliang heres a voice that she hasn't heard for a long time, a voice which comes from inside her.

221041001.content: Although Luliang has disappeared from sight for a short while, Gengchen isn't worried. After all, together her backpack and suitcase would easily make her stand out in the crowd.

221041002.content: When Gengchen spots Luliang for the second time, she plans to go up to her, but...

221041003.content: Wait... Is she looking for something?

221041004.content: After she comes out of an art gallery, Luliang stands at a busy intersection of the shopping street, rubbing her chin and seemingly in deep thought.

221041005.content: Before Gengchen can get to her, Luliang has sped off again, like the detectives in the movies who'd just found another clue at a crossroads.

221041007.content: Gengchen follows Luliang all the way to Port Carp, albeit at a safe distance. Let's find out what this girl is up to first, she thinks to herself.

221041008.content: On the subject of Port Carp: apart from the Photon Rail station and the tall buildings housing all the trading and logistics companies, it's also notable for the folks who come from the various Sephirah Zones.

221041009.content: Don't tell me she's trying to run away from it all... No, that's not her.

221041010.content: Luliang didn't enter Port Carp. Instead, like a part-timer distributing flyers at the amusement park entrance, she is stopping everyone she encounters to have a chat—no, not everyone. However, it is not clear to Gengchen what the pattern is, if any.

221041011.content: The one last possibility here is that Luliang is trying to solicit for business and investment in places where businesspeople congregate. But that means that Tian Lu Traders is in really bad shape...

221041012.content: As so... Gengchen does not get a chance to talk to Luliang at Port Carp either and has no choice but to keep on following her.

221041013.content: ...I really don't get what she's doing.

221041014.content: Trying to figure out Luliang's purpose, Gengchen suddenly realizes that she's already returned to the shopping street.

221041016.content: (Ha. Did you really think that I hadn't noticed you?)

221041017.content: (Guess Mantou's really concerned about me. Time to give her a surprise then!)

221041018.content: ...I'll have the Good Fortune Skewers, and the Happy Reunion Meatballs as well. Oh, and the Swan Lake Special over here...

221041019.content: I'm sorry, ma'am, but you've already ordered five dishes. And at our shop, we believe that we should avoid any kind of food wastage.

221041020.content: Heh, don't you worry. My friend is on the way.

221041021.content: I see. Will they be here soon? Should I bring over the tea now or later?

221041022.content: Maybe later. That friend of mine only drinks piping-hot tea.

221041025.content: MANTOU! How much longer are you gonna stand outside for, huh? Just come in already!

221041026.content: Luliang, sitting next to the restaurant entrance, yells right out the door. Having understood what is going on, Gengchen nods and walks inside the restaurant.

221041027.content: I thought you had an appointment with someone else here.

221041028.content: You and I do have an "appointment," no?

221041029.content: I mean, to fulfill our wishes, right?

221041030.content: ...You know that's not what I meant.

221041031.content: Alright, quit standing there. Come on, sit down.

221041032.content: Some tea over here, please! As hot as you can make it!

221041033.content: Why did you choose this place?

221041034.content: What? Oh, well, if I really have to give a reason, it's because I like my skewers. But once in a while, I do like coming to this sort of place that serves... how would you put it... "creative Xu Heng cuisine"?

221041035.content: Look at the menu, Mantou. Look at the names. They might've put in more work into the names than into the dishes!

221041036.content: The taste of the dish is what really matters, fancy name or not. But everyone here... seems to have come to take photos of the food rather than eating them.

221041037.content: Gengchen looks around at all the camera-wielding customers around her with a look of ambivalence on her face.

221041038.content: Bah, just ignore them. All that matters is that we have a good time! Huh? Hold on, Mantou—

221041039.content: All of a sudden, Luliang grabs Gengchen by the wrist and pulls it over to her for a closer look.

221041041.content: Is it just me, or have you become even paler since I last saw you?

221041042.content: ...Maybe that's what happens when mantou dough rises.

221041043.content: And you look thinner, too. But doesn't mantou dough swell when you leave it out?

221041045.content:
The lame joke that Gengchen uses to deflect Luliang's question about her physical condition is, unexpectedly, deflected by Luliang again.
She placidly changes the subject.

221041046.content: You know, you haven't changed a single bit. It's still so easy to talk to you.

221041047.content: Hee hee. Only with you, Mantou!

221041048.content: It is as if the two of them had last spoken and dined with each other just the day before.

221041049.content: But it kinda hurts to hear that I haven't changed a bit, you know... After all, it's true that I'm about to go back to square one here.

221041050.content: I see that you've been having fun, though.

221041051.content: Well, let's just say I finally have an excuse for a break. Yingzhao's holding the fort, anyway. Things are fine for now.

221041052.content:
Hey, let's not talk about all that.
Ooh, the food's here!

221041053.content: Come on, Mantou, eat. You must've been too busy at work to eat proper meals!

221041054.content: Gengchen finally heaves a sigh of relief inside as she hears Luliang's words.

221041055.content: Hi, looks like your order's complete. Enjoy your meal!

221041056.content: Let me know if you need anything!

221041057.content: Yeah, we do need something right now. Could you get us a bottle of the... Um... Hey, Mantou. What would you like to drink?

221041059.content: Gengchen brings out the bottle of Tikala Tequila she's been carrying.

221041060.content: Hmm? This is... Wow! A gift! Too sweet of you!!!

221041061.content: Surprised and excited at the same time, Luliang holds up the bottle to take a closer look at the liquor's vintage and place of origin. Clearly, she was trying to figure out the potential monetary value of the bottle.

221041062.content: Aw, look at me, I don't have anything for you... Oh, that's right. I did find something at the antiques store today. It's yours, Mantou.

221041064.content: From her pocket Luliang fishes out an old coin which has a bamboo leaf design on one side, and then she flips it over to the other side...

221041065.content: Did you know about this thing called the "radio"? A retro tool they used for broadcasting?

221041066.content: It's still in use in the other Sephirah Zones. So how could you call it "retro"?

221041067.content: Alright alright. Guess I'm just ignorant.

221041068.content: Gengchen gives a gentle smile in reply, but thanks Luliang and accepts the gift nevertheless.

221041069.content: Hey! Could we have a bottle opener, please?

221041070.content: Um... I'm sorry, but we don't do BYOB here.

221041071.content: Oh? Is that so? But you didn't disclose this material fact when we came in, did you? And now that our food's here... surely this is consumer fraud?

221041072.content: Oh no, how could you imply...

221041073.content: Well, isn't it? I can call my lawyer to find out if this can be considered an infringement of the consumer's right to know...

221041074.content: Um... I'm just telling you about the rule we have here...

221041076.content: Gengchen casts a look of commiseration at the waiter. Just as she is about to hint to him that he might just give up the struggle, she sees Luliang's eyes flicker, as if she just thought of something. Then Luliang places the bottle back into the bag.

221041077.content: Well, the rules are the rules, isn't that right? Let's just stick to tea today, then?

221041078.content: Please tell me the tea is free-flow at least.

221041079.content: Yes, yes... Just a moment, I'll get you your tea now.

221041080.content: What do you think, Mantou? I'll hold on to the bottle for now, and take my time with it. Shall we have something a little more sedate for now?

221041081.content: Works for me. But what made you change your mind?

221041082.content: I just remembered that there's something I've to take care of later. There's no way I can not over-indulge if I were to start drinking with you, heh. I'd better not start in that case.

221041084.content: It's easy for Gengchen to see that Luliang's hiding something from her, but she understands that businesspeople are always up to something anyway... Without further asking, Gengchen turns to the waiter and takes the pot of tea.

221041085.content: To our reunion. The tea's hot though, be careful...

221041086.content: Come on, bottoms up.... OW OW OW! That was hot! MANTOU! What do you think you are doing?!

221041087.content: Luliang has taken the cup of tea from Gengchen rather absentmindedly, then follows Gengchen's action and downs the tea in one go... or tried to, anyway.

221041089.content: I told you to be careful...

221041092.content: The server hurries to the table after hearing Luliang's cries of pain. It takes a while for Luliang, who is busy fanning her scalded tongue, to realize that... Wasn't she the one who'd asked him to bring boiling-hot tea?

221041093.content: Ow, ow, ow! Get me something cold, please!!! Now!

221041095.content: After glasses and glasses of iced tea, Luliang finds herself unable to move, for her belly is beyond full.

221041096.content: Ahhhh. I'm alive again. The oolong tea in Xu Heng is simply the best!

221041097.content: This is tea, not a soft drink. Look at you. All that food untouched, and you're already full.

221041098.content: And by the way, you ordered way too much food for two persons.

221041099.content: Don't tell me you've forgotten that frugality is a virtue after you became rich?

221041100.content: Relax. You worry about the bill, I'll take care of the food here. I'll take any leftovers I have to go and not wasting any of these...

221041101.content: Luliang smoothly reassures Gengchen, as if she already has a script all written out. But then comes a plot twist...

221041102.content: Why am I footing the bill?

221041103.content: Huh? Aren't you here to comfort me in my time of need? Shouldn't you show the appropriate gestures then?

221041105.content: Gengchen makes no reply and simply shuts her eyes while taking a mouthful of tea. The heat rising from the cup makes Luliang almost want to ask Gengchen to stick out her tongue to show her if she has any burns on it.

221041106.content: Now I'm quite sure that you don't need any comforting at all.

221041108.content: Might it not be that I'm just pretending to be chirpy and unbothered? That deep down inside, all I want to do is to escape and never be seen again?

221041109.content: That thought did cross my mind when you were at Port Carp.

221041110.content: Wow... Just when did you start following me, Mantou...?

221041111.content: ...Can't blame me. You do stick out like a sore thumb with that getup of yours.

221041112.content: Ugh, is that so??? But no one's recognized me the whole time!

221041113.content: I mean, otherwise this restaurant would've been surrounded by those pesky reporters by now...

221041114.content: I doubt it. We're more than forty blocks over from Tian Lu Traders...

221041115.content: Are you really going to give up on Tian Lu Traders just like that?

221041116.content: Gengchen brings the conversation back to the reason she came.

221041117.content: Don't worry. Yingzhao knows what she's doing. And if she's there... Although I can do the job a tad better, she's more than capable of holding the fort.

221041118.content: But she can only hold it for so long. They're still coming for you, and you don't have many good options.

221041119.content: Do you have any plans for the longer term?

221041120.content: Of course not. This is a resounding defeat for yours truly this time. Why do you think I've fled here?

221041123.content: Although Luliang talks like she's given up entirely, Gengchen is not convinced.

221041124.content: Do you know how awful those business giants are this time? Our stock price's been going down by the day, no, by the hour...

221041125.content: I know you, Luliang. And I know that you're not one to abandon your business and the ones who've been working alongside you all this time.

221041127.content: Mantou. You and Yingzhao, all of you think too highly of me.

221041128.content: I'd be worried less about you if everyone thinks the same of you as I do.

221041129.content: Hey, don't just say things like that so suddenly...

221041130.content: Fine, fine. I'll tell you. Actually...

221041131.content: I have intel that those old geezers aren't that chummy with each other after all. And that their beefs go way back too, much longer than any problem they have with me.

221041132.content: And these beefs have the potential to cause some serious conflict...

221041133.content: So, I'll try to weaken their already-frail alliance by negotiating with them one by one. It shouldn't be that hard. However, like you said, I need a plan for the longer term. It's only time before they resolve their issues and turn their sights on us again. Besides...

221041134.content: I can't stand the thought of having to play nice with people like them, or even be at the same dinner table with them. Ugh.

221041135.content: You know something, Mantou? I can have anything for dinner when I'm with you, and it'll all taste wonderful. And with those jerks, even the most expensive delicacies won't taste good.

221041137.content: You must be prudent and strike at the right time. And when you do, do not hesitate.

221041138.content: I know. The future of Tian Lu Traders is something I never take lightly even though I crack jokes all the time.

221041140.content: Gengchen takes another sip of her tea and produces the coin that Luliang gave her earlier. She flips it over to the side with the radio engraved on it and gazes at it.

221041141.content: The new does not appear overnight, but step by step through iterations. Just look at radios and radio stations: they may be invented based on old technology, but they still have value to us.

221041142.content: Things forcibly made obsolete will only hurt the people's lives and the market balance.

221041143.content: Therefore... I'm unable to help you. But I wish you every success.

221041144.content: Pfft. You know you can help me. You just won't.

221041145.content: You know that's not possible. So please don't joke about things like this.

221041146.content: Luliang, who was pouting and playing with her teacup, flashes Gengchen a cheeky smile after hearing these words.

221041147.content: I was talking about lending me your shoulders to lean on when I'm feeling low. What in the world were you thinking of, Mantou?

221041148.content: For example, this is a good time—

221041149.content: As she speaks, Luliang slowly "falls" onto Gengchen, as if she's drunk.

221041150.content: ...If we're done, I'll go pay the bills.

221041151.content: —Hey! Mantou! I'm not done here yet! I'm serious! Come back here!

221041152.content: Seeing that Gengchen is really getting ready to leave the table, Luliang hurriedly grabs her sleeve.

221041153.content: Actually, now that I'm back, I realized something...

221041155.content: Luliang gazes out the window. On the street outside, an endless stream of people is passing by.

221041156.content: Look at all these people outside. They're either here to find the products they want, or to find someone who wants their products.

221041157.content: After spending so many years in the so-called business world, I'd gradually forgotten the essence of what it means to "do business"... That's what I've realized and I'm not proud of that.

221041158.content: "Business" is something that only businesspersons can do. It is the most incredible form of magic in this world.

221041159.content: Mantou, I have to say, you are a lucky audience.

221041160.content: Get your popcorn ready. You're getting a front-row seat to a great show.

221051002.content: Gengchen swiftly rejected Luliang's offer of a "front-row seat".

221051003.content: I'm not going back to Tian Lu Traders with you. Tongues will wag.

221051004.content: Tian Lu Traders? Who says we're going back there?

221051005.content: You have a plan, don't you? Shouldn't you go back as soon as possible to get the ball rolling?

221051006.content: Yes, but I'm still on vacation. I'm not going back until I've had enough fun...

221051007.content: Luliang remains seated at the table, looking rather sorry for herself as she looks at Gengchen, who's already paid the bill.

221051008.content: (Heh heh. There's no way I'm gonna let her leave now!)

221051009.content: (Sighs loudly) A pity, what a pity...

221051011.content: Maybe I've become used to living life with a mask on after all these years as company president. I can't believe that I forgot to take that mask off even when I'm with you, Mantou.

221051012.content: Or maybe like this great writer or something once said, "Once you wear a mask for too long, it'll become a part of you." It's so hard to take it off, even if I wanted to.

221051014.content: Just what is she up to now....? Gengchen remains unmoved and looks on at Luliang in stony-faced silence.

221051015.content: We're talking about an existential crisis here, after all. Of course I'm upset. I'm just putting on a cheerful front, that's all...

221051016.content: If I lose this time, the old geezers will make sure that I stay down for good. My wish is that the wishes of all my employees at Tian Lu Traders can be... (Sighs) Damn. Who's cutting onions out here?

221051017.content: I should use this last chance to unwind before the inevitable happens. It'd be so wonderful to do the things I want to do with my good friend by my side, if only for a few hours...

221051019.content: Gengchen appears both unmoved and resigned at the same time. Luliang blinks in awkwardness.

221051020.content: ...Fine. I'll keep you company this afternoon.

221051022.content: It's been a while since I was here on this street. I do miss the bustle here.

221051023.content: It's not a bad thing to take time off every once in a while, too.

221051025.content: What's so funny about what I just said?

221051026.content: Luliang's pretense at being all morose cracks in a second.

221051027.content: Nothing. I was just thinking that you're finally wising up, Mantou.

221051028.content: ...I shouldn't have worried about you indeed.

221051029.content: Ah, whatever. Let's go, Mantou! Let's not bother ourselves with Tian Lu Traders and the Quad today. We'll take a good break!

221051031.content: Gengchen can't help but think that she's been walking in circles all day.

221051032.content: "Mmm, being out and about is good for you. Perhaps you can try taking a walk every day, chief?"

221051033.content: Looks like someone's gonna get some praise from Lingguang.

221051034.content: Look at this place. Can't get tired of this sight, am I right?

221051035.content: With her two hands on the bridge railing, Luliang looks out at the magnificent port, then looks back at Gengchen who is standing beside her.

221051036.content: Yes. The completion of Port Carp was instrumental in Xu Heng's recovery following the Cloudsong Crisis. The Quad was here almost every day at the time...

221051037.content: Alright, Mantou, I'm not asking you to play tour guide here.

221051038.content: You can sit back and watch my performance now.

221051039.content: And Luliang's "stage prop" is... a takeout bag from the restaurant the two of them were just at.

221051040.content: Hmm... Why isn't she here yet? It's almost time for the photon rail to depart.

221051041.content: A young male employee wearing the uniform of a major shipping company was pacing up and down outside the Photon Rail station.

221051042.content: I told you I was coming! Just took me a little while longer 'cos I was having a little argument with my friend here...

221051044.content: The "friend" Luliang mentioned just stands silently behind her.

221051045.content:
...Anyway, it's good that you made it.
I have the goods ready. What about you? Did you bring what I need?

221051047.content: ...What are the two of you doing?

221051048.content: Please don't tell me it's something shady.

221051049.content: Yikes, what in the world are you thinking? I just got him some munchies, that's all.

221051051.content: The young man's eyes gleam as soon he opens the takeout bag and takes a whiff of its contents.

221051052.content: I've to take this shipment of goods to Nanjiao Isle, and I'll stay there for unloading and dispatching. It'll be a long while before I can taste something from this restaurant again!

221051053.content: Hey, hey, hang on. We agreed that I bring the food, and you bring the goods.

221051054.content: You have your takeout. Now hold up your end of the deal.

221051055.content: While the two protagonists involved don't think anything of their conversation, Gengchen instinctively starts scanning their surroundings to see if the "deal" has drawn any unwelcome attention. And so...

221051056.content: Now it really seems like something shady is going down.

221051058.content: The young man pulls out an embroidered pouch from his waist bag.

221051060.content: Luliang opens up the pouch and takes out a green rock to examine it closer in the sun.

221051061.content: What? You think this is little? Do you know just how much this piece of rock costs on the market right now?

221051062.content: This may not be rare for us back home on Shuofang Isle, but getting it out seems to be a problem now. You can't buy this anywhere in Yu Jing now, can you?

221051063.content: Fine. I guess it's enough for one painting...

221051064.content: The young man leaves in a hurry.

221051065.content: So, you really came here just for this "deal"?

221051066.content: Mm-hmm! You got that right, Mantou!

221051067.content: I see now. No wonder you took two dishes to go.

221051068.content: So, you exchanged the bag of takeout for this pouch containing... Bamboo Green ore, am I right?

221051069.content: I've heard that those mining giants have messed with the shipping lines to drive up the prices of various Shuofang ore.

221051070.content: Drive up the prices? You can't get any even if you wanted to these days!

221051071.content: Had I tried to find a seller for this in the usual ways, I might not even be able to find a source for the stuff. And even if I did, who knows how much the asking price would be?

221051072.content: But doing business is basically the exchange of one thing for another, while prices reflect the relationship between supply and demand. And so, the sticker price does not indicate the true value of the good.

221051073.content: While that piece of rock is really valuable to us, it's not at all something rare for that young man from Shuofang Isle. On the other hand, getting takeout was easy for us, but near impossible for him because of how busy he is.

221051074.content: Trading what he wants for what I want: that's doing business for ya.

221051075.content: I remember that's how you made your first fortune. So, what do you plan to do with this rock of yours?

221051076.content: Heh heh, this was just the first act of my magic show. Keep watching!

221051077.content: The girl skips forward lightly on one foot, and lands on a pile of ginkgo leaves in front of her, making a crisp and sweet sound.

221051078.content: Master Ta, just how long were you in Tikala?

221051079.content: Four or five years. Time went by really fast when I was an apprentice. But if you want to call me by my Tikala name, it's Tak, not Ta.

221051081.content: Don't you miss your days in Tikala, Master Ta? Do you wanna go back there?

221051083.content:
It's been so many years. I wouldn't know anyone there now, probably.
Besides, I know what you're trying to do, but it won't work. I told you, you have to get in line.

221051084.content: They are at the famed stoneworking workshop on East Banchuan Street, "Master Tak's." Master Tak, who is always in his Tikala-style work clothes, is affectionately known by many here as "Master Ta."

221051085.content: Can't you put a rush on it? Please? I'll pay you more!

221051086.content: No. Can't do that no matter how much you pay me.

221051087.content: The master mason's face grows stern, although his hands remain busy.

221051088.content: But of course Luliang is ready with a counter...

221051089.content: Then... How about I give you this?

221051090.content: Luliang takes out a bottle of precious liquor. Master Tak, who at first raises his eyes with some reluctance, perks up as he spots the words on the label.

221051093.content: He stares at the bottle for only a couple of moments before he reaches for the precious bottle and gingerly took it into his care.

221051094.content: Looks like you really miss the place you were trained at, Master Ta.

221051095.content: ...I'll work on your order right now, but I'll need an hour or so. Come back in the evening for it.

221051096.content: Although Master Tak has ignored Luliang's teasing, it looks for a split second that his cold, hard eyes have softened with tears.

221051097.content: Thank you so much, Master Ta!

221051098.content: Let's go take a walk, Mantou... Hmm? Mantou?

221051100.content: Gengchen was a little slow to respond. Perhaps she was distracted, or perhaps she was tired.

221051101.content: Mantou, I always knew that you were not a chatty type but... Aren't you pushing it a little today?

221051103.content: Gengchen has not said a single word since the two of them left the workshop, no matter what Luliang said to her.

221051104.content: (That's odd. The Mantou I know would've started lecturing me at this point.)

221051105.content: (But it's been years since I last saw her. And people do change over time, so maybe she has become even more taciturn... No. That's not it.)

221051106.content: Something's bothering Mantou, Luliang's instinct tells her.

221051107.content: Luliang stops in her tracks and turns back to look at Gengchen, who lets out a helpless sigh.

221051108.content: It's not very nice to regift something you just received from someone, is it?

221051109.content: Oh, are you mad? Is that it? You're mad...

221051110.content: It's just that... You could've just told me if you didn't like my gift.

221051111.content: No, no, that's not it! I love your gift, Mantou! I swear!

221051112.content: What's more important than the gift itself is the fact that you remembered this throwaway line of mine about the wish... from all those years ago.

221051114.content: Ah, ha ha... That's not my point, Mantou.

221051115.content: Didn't you see the look on Master Ta's face just now?

221051116.content: Imagine, a man so strong and stoic, showing an expression like that...

221051117.content: Well, we all experience longing for home.

221051118.content: Mm-hmm! So although he was a no-nonsense sort of guy when it came to orders, the amount of joy that bottle of liquor brought him convinced him to help us.

221051119.content: You know, when you put something in the hands of the person who needs it most, you build a genuine relationship? Everyone says, "It's just business." But the truth is, the human touch is always there when we do deals...

221051121.content: I see. I misunderstood you, then. I'm sorry.

221051122.content: That's alright. I get it too if you're upset. Totally.

221051123.content: After all, I did use your gift to please someone else....

221051124.content: But honestly, I'm surprised that you were so peeved about that, Mantou. Or maybe I should say that I'm kinda happy...?

221051125.content: ...It's almost time. Let's go back and not keep Master Ta waiting.

221061001.content: Thank you, Master Ta!!! You have me as a forever customer now!

221061002.content: The man who's already closed up shop picks up a cup with a distinctively Tikala design from the table. It is said that he's had the cup locked away in a cabinet for many years. He then downs the liquid inside in a single gulp.

221061003.content: I'm happy to get more orders from you. But don't you ever ask to jump the line again.

221061005.content: It is unclear if the girl who is wearing that typical cheeky grin of hers really does "get it." She pats the man's muscular shoulder, then walks out of the workshop with her friend beside her, whose face totally says "that was so not sincere at all."

221061006.content: Ha! And now I have my Bamboo Green pigment!

221061007.content: I see what the deal is with it now. Imagine, Master Ta took such a long time to make this. And this green! Deep, elegant, and so true!

221061008.content: Are you going to paint something with this?

221061009.content: Hah! My talents do not lie in this direction. Besides, the pigment here is still a little coarse, and needs a little more refining before it can be used.

221061010.content: But your guess was a pretty good one.

221061011.content: Stick with me, Mantou. I promise you, it'll be worth it!

221061012.content:
Alright. Since I'd already decided to take half a day off, it doesn't matter if I while away the time.
Besides...

221061013.content: Besides, I've the chance to spend a few precious hours with an old friend I haven't seen in years.

221061015.content: Wow, Mantou... Heh heh, I finally understand why all those folks at the Quad regard you as their leader.

221061016.content: The Quad...? We've all come together because of a common vision.

221061017.content: I'm not talking about that... Gah. Forget it. Anyway...

221061018.content: You know, sometimes, you're even more troublesome than you think.

221061020.content: Mm-hmm. Hypothetically speaking, and I do mean hypothetically...

221061021.content: If anything bad happens to you, folks will grieve for you, a lot of them. Definitely more than you think.

221061022.content: But that's hypothetically speaking! Look at you, always so cautious, and powerful, too. Nothing bad can possibly happen to you! Ha ha...

221061024.content: Just forget all that stuff I said! What I meant to say was...

221061025.content: I don't think you realize, Mantou, just how important you are to so many people!

221061026.content: Gengchen appears slightly taken aback by this revelation. Luliang grabs her hand, then starts running along the bustling street, toward the crowd.

221061027.content: Yunweng shuts the pigment box in his hand, then breathes a sigh of relief and nods. The only thing keeping him from running upstairs to the studio is the fact that he still has guests in the room.

221061028.content: I can't believe that you actually managed to get this in such a short time... You've been such a great help.

221061029.content: I'm sorry if I have been rude to you before.

221061030.content: Please don't say that, Master Yunweng.

221061031.content: I made you a promise, so I had to deliver on it.

221061032.content: Having said that, the fact that I delivered within half a day when we agreed on three is pretty impressive indeed, heh heh.

221061033.content: Of course, you'll have to hold up your end of the deal, too.

221061034.content: The thing I wanted—Huh? Where's my painting?!

221061035.content: Luliang's eyes follow the line of paintings hanging on the wall to the very end, only to find that the spot is empty.

221061036.content: I put it away for you, miss. I thought it'd be better that way instead of having it hanging out on the wall.

221061037.content: Although I have no real skills other than painting, I do take my promises seriously.

221061038.content: With a big smile on his face, the painter takes out a box with a ribbon tied on it.

221061039.content: Master... that was very nice of you to do that.

221061040.content: I'm really sorry, but do you think you could hang it back just once for me?

221061041.content: Since it's yours, miss, it goes where you say it goes.

221061043.content: The painter simply takes out the painting, and carefully hangs it back on the wall per Luliang's request, without asking why.

221061044.content: I never thought that the bustling East Banchuan Street could look like this... I'm so fortunate to see this today.

221061045.content: While Luliang was talking to the painter, Gengchen was already looking around by herself in the gallery.

221061046.content: Heh heh. We came to the right place, didn't we?

221061048.content: Gengchen, so immersed in the long line of paintings, doesn't even register her friend's questions.

221061049.content: What I don't get is, Master Yunweng is so talented. But why isn't he famous already?

221061050.content: Look, Mantou. Look at the way he painted Tian Lu Groceries. It looks exactly like it did!

221061051.content: Something too realistic or close to the truth can open up old wounds again. This makes people want to avoid it, intentionally or unintentionally...

221061052.content: Hmm... I see what you're saying.

221061053.content: But history is here to stay. And even if there's a painful wound, one will have to face it at some point. It's good that we preserve the past in painting.

221061054.content: You know, when I first came here, this morning that is... you may not believe it, but I had a similar thought.

221061055.content: I guess this is what they mean by "great minds think alike"?

221061057.content: In those scenes that have Xu Heng's most unforgettable wound recorded, the Cloudsong Crisis, all the hurt and sorrow is on display, making the viewer feel as if they have stepped barefoot into the ruins and rubble themselves.

221061058.content: No... This one was indeed right there herself.

221061059.content: Seeing her friend unable to step away from the paintings, Luliang speaks up.

221061060.content: Hey, hey, Mantou. Stop staring at that painting over there.

221061061.content: Xu Heng has survived and risen again, and we've also recovered the prosperity that was taken away by that awful disaster. Just look at Tian Lu Traders and how it's done since then!

221061062.content: Um, although, admittedly, it's going through a bit of a rough patch right now...

221061063.content: Anyway, this line of paintings will grow longer every year, even every minute.

221061065.content: As she steps away from those visual records of disaster, something flickers in Gengchen's serene eyes.

221061067.content: Here's the Xu Heng we are in now!

221061069.content: You heard the master just now, Mantou. This painting's now ours.

221061070.content: Just like you still remember what I told you I wanted years ago, I remember your "wish" just as well!

221061071.content: This painting is for you. It depicts the blissful life in Xu Heng back then—and that's what you're wishing for, aren't you?

221061074.content: Gengchen was mumbling to herself, but Luliang only manages to catch the very tail end of it.

221061075.content: Indeed. This is the perfect show of magic.

221061076.content: Really? Wow... Actually, it's not that big a deal…! It's just a simple demonstration of what "doing business" means!

221061077.content: Uh, Master Yunweng, would you pack that painting for me again? Thank you.

221061078.content:
Luliang, who was feeling pretty pleased with herself for the deal she pulled off, suddenly becomes slightly embarrassed after receiving such high praise from Gengchen.
After asking the painter to re-pack the painting, she suddenly remembers something and turns toward her friend.

221061079.content: You know, in some ways... you're also a creator of this painting, Mantou.

221061080.content: ...Please don't say that. The real creator of the painting is right in front of us.

221061081.content: Heh heh. Creators of what's inside of the painting and what's outside of the painting are two different things. Come with me and you'll see.

221061082.content: Luliang simply takes the hand of her rather befuddled friend, grinning, and runs out of the gallery.

221061083.content:
It is almost evening, and the streetlights are already turned on. The street is full of people.
Reflected in the water of the Banchuan River are the colorful neon lights, like a flowing stream of stars.

221061084.content: Shoppers dressed in a variety of styles are walking at their individual paces. Some of them are standing in line at various stores.

221061085.content: Despite the crowd and the lines, children can still be seen chasing each other and running around. It seems that some of them are fighting over a rare illustrated book on insects.

221061086.content: There is a man wearing sunglasses and carrying a bucket, probably just returned from fishing on the Banchuan River.

221061087.content: A young lady wearing a pristine, elegant dress smells pleasantly of tea leaves as she walks by.

221061088.content: A group of girls in high school uniforms are sharing the different flavors of ice cream they've just bought.

221061089.content: A couple of tourists with a camera are asking passers-by to take a photo of them using bad, but inexplicably adorable local dialect.

221061092.content: There are people who are looking out at this intoxicating scene from a bridge, a pavilion, or stone steps, with relaxed smiles on their faces.

221061093.content: Without your hard work, without the Quad, without the Astral Engine which protects us all from up there...

221061094.content: Luliang raises her hand and points at the Astral Engine, a magnificent lighthouse that flickers in the night sky, a star that everyone believes will never go dark.

221061095.content: ...There wouldn't have been this East Banchuan Street that we know of today, the one that is so busy as if there is a never-ending festival going on.

221061096.content: So, Mantou, I'm telling you, I'm not wrong to say that you're also the creator of "Along the Luo River"

221061098.content: Even if it is as you said, the creator of this "painting" before our eyes should be everyone here in Xu Heng, not just me.

221061099.content: Fine, I'll just call you ONE of the CREATORS then, how about that? I just wanted to praise you, that's all...

221061100.content: Grr, really... why be so nitpicky with details? You're just ruining the mood...

221061101.content: Gengchen just smiles at Luliang's childlike complaining, and her gaze quietly falls on the gorgeous view which stretches far into the distance. She sighs softly.

221061102.content: (The world is always in motion, and there is an eventual balance to every phenomenon.... Change is the normal state of the world. But...)

221061103.content: What are you mumbling to yourself about?

221061104.content: ...I'd come to console you today. But instead, I'm the one who's being comforted.

221061106.content: Oh man, no need for such ceremony! I already told ya, that was just a simple demonstration of the magic a businessperson can wield...

221061107.content: A fireworks show somewhere lights up the side of Luliang's face, which she turns away shyly.

221061109.content: Luliang points to the night sky made bright by the fireworks, her other hand still subconsciously holding the hand of the person next to her. She can feel a coolness in that palm.

221061110.content: Hmm? Mantou? Is your hand sweating...? Looks like I'm right, your body has become weak from overwork!

221061111.content: You know, health is wealth. So, you must—

221061112.content: Luliang's voice becomes drowned out by the sound of the fireworks. She stops speaking and simply squeezes the slightly cold palm in her hand, and looks up at the colorful night sky.

221061113.content: (Never mind. I'm sure she's being well taken care of at the Quad...)

221061114.content: (The world is always in motion, and there is an eventual balance to every phenomenon.... Change is the normal state of the world. But...)

221061115.content: If this moment could be frozen in time like a painting. If the water of the Banchuan River could flow peacefully forever...

221061116.content: I'll be willing to do whatever it takes me.

221071003.content: A young man wearing the uniform of a certain courier company brings in a flowerpot from behind Luliang, then carefully places it on the ground.

221071004.content: Thank you, here's your pay. Come, have a drink and rest a bit before you go.

221071006.content: When I first saw this flowerpot at the market, I thought it'd be quite light since it looks so small and delicate. But I tell you, I almost hurt my back when I tried to pick it up!

221071007.content: Then I thought about it, and realized that its weight meant that it's solid and durable. Didn't that flowerpot you really liked break a few days ago? Remember, always buy things that is of good quality and which can last you a long time.

221071009.content: Thank you very much. I'll plant some brightly colored flowers in it and place it in our reception area. It's time to switch up the look of our lobby.

221071011.content: Linyu once told me that she thought that the "flowers as bright as fire" looked pretty.

221071013.content: "Flowers as bright as fire"... hmm, might she be talking about the hibiscus...?

221071014.content: In any case, it's all up to you.

221071016.content: Yingzhao nods as if she were a loyal courtier who'd just received her orders, then takes out the notepad she always carries around with her and opens it.

221071017.content: By the way, I hope there wasn't any trouble in the past few days while I was away?

221071018.content: Some of our business partners came to ask to terminate their contracts with Tian Lu Traders and sent in claims for compensation, even... But thankfully, Director Yingzhao was persuasive enough, and eventually they all went back.

221071019.content: Really? How did you do that???

221071020.content: I just asked the Legal Team to refute their claims of breach of contract one by one, as well as calculate the liquidated damages they'd be liable for in the event of unilateral contract termination.

221071021.content: Ah, so that's what you meant by "persuasive"...

221071022.content: Doesn't matter. Anyway, keeping them at bay for the time being is the best that we can hope for now. They'll see that they are lucky not to terminate their contracts with us, ha!

221071023.content: I'm guessing there's a whole mountain of documents I've to review now? Let's go take a look...

221071024.content: Um... Actually, no. Director Yingzhao has more or less dealt with everything.

221071026.content: My dear Yingzhao, do you know what your biggest problem is?

221071027.content: What is it? Please do tell me.

221071028.content: Luliang wags her index finger at a shocked Yingzhao, who has already hurriedly taken out her notepad again.

221071030.content: Now it looks like I, the boss, don't really need to be here!

221071032.content: Well, there was one more thing that is hard to handle, though. The day before yesterday, representatives from two companies came to negotiate with us... No, not so much negotiate with us, but provoke us.

221071033.content: They wanted to acquire a majority share in Tian Lu Traders, and said that if we don't agree now, our stock price would only continue to fall until it hits the bottom... But one of them—the representative from Tang Heavy Industries—answered a call halfway through.

221071034.content: Then, after the call, the two of them suddenly started arguing. Had security not brought them outside, they would've started fighting right here.

221071035.content: And that was the end of that acquisition offer. I wonder what was said on that phone call...

221071036.content: Heh heh. Just as I thought.

221071038.content: I was the one who made that call. As for what was said, it was all hearsay and speculation, but plausible-sounding hearsay and speculation.

221071039.content: And just as I thought, those old geezers don't trust each other.

221071040.content: I see... Incredible of you as always, Boss.

221071041.content: Heh heh. Well, I've got to keep up with you, you know.

221071042.content: But this will only buy us some time. I suggest that we hold a meeting as soon as possible to discuss countermeasures.

221071044.content: Everyone, I have an announcement to make!

221071045.content: Luliang takes out a microphone out of nowhere. Although standing in the courtyard, she raises her arms as if she were standing on a platform.

221071047.content: Luliang clears her throat and looks around at the employees who have gathered in Tian Lu Traders' courtyard. Then, she nods with satisfaction like a general looking on at her troops.

221071048.content: Let's get to the conclusion first. We'll double the shares held by the small and medium-sized enterprise owners in Xu Heng as an additional private placement.

221071049.content: I'll get straight to the point here. To survive this crisis, we need to work together with all the emerging enterprises that've been under the thumb of those old geezers. We must show that we're not afraid.

221071050.content: As soon as Luliang finishes speaking, no, even before that, a flurry of discussion arises.

221071051.content: Luliang looks calmly at the surprised crowd and even puffs out her chest as if to show that she has totally expected this scene.

221071052.content: Only one person seems completely unfazed by this announcement. Yingzhao, who is standing right by Luliang, simply keeps on writing in her notepad while glancing at her watch every now and then.

221071053.content: Please settle down, everyone. And hear me out.

221071054.content: (Ugh, it's so hard to learn to speak like Mantou. Forget it, I'm really not that type...)

221071055.content: (Coughs) I recently went back to my hometown for the first time in a long time. What I found was that the once-quiet suburban streets of my childhood are now bustling thoroughfares.

221071056.content: When I was a child, I'd run from one end of the street to the other. Now—and I promise I'm not exaggerating—you can't even walk against the flow of the crowds there.

221071057.content: Of course, the place has benefited from its proximity to Banchuan River and Port Carp. But if you ask me, it's the people there who've really made this prosperity possible.

221071058.content: The folks there are exactly as I remember from my childhood.

221071059.content: They'd chit-chat amiably with their customers even while haggling with them, and when they run into someone stubborn like me, they'd even pour them tea. They do all this as part of a protracted psychological battle with their customers. After all, every coin earned is precious.

221071060.content: So there're all these businesses, all next to each other. Although they were small businesses, they made up for their slim profit margins with volume, and were thus able to live well.

221071061.content: However, over time, some folks naturally became restless and wanted more. There were also folks who wanted to grow their businesses, even open a hundred stores all over Xu Heng... though most of them didn't really intend to act on these stated intentions.

221071062.content: It's not because they don't want to work hard. In the Xu Heng we have today, only those business giants can truly thrive. These giants have established a chokehold on the market and its profits, and even regard the growing market as a favor they'd extended to Xu Heng.

221071063.content: While it's easier than before for small businesses to survive, that's about it. If you want a bigger slice of the pie, well, you've seen what's happening to us.

221071064.content: At this point, a hush comes over the whispering crowd. All eyes are on Luliang now.

221071065.content: You know, we were so proud of ourselves for building this business empire after all these years of hard work. But in the eyes of those giants, we were just sheep finally ready for the slaughter. And as for those small and medium-sized traders, I'm afraid they don't even bother with them.

221071066.content: I'm not saying that we are powerless, and certainly I'm not admitting defeat to those so-called giants. In fact, I mean quite the opposite...

221071067.content: If one person cannot forge change, no matter how much money they make, then help more people make more money so that we can all change the situation together!

221071069.content: This last pronouncement makes even Yingzhao look up from her pious note-taking. Seeing this, Luliang gets even more excited.

221071070.content: What I can promise you is that here at Tian Lu Traders, we will stick by all our partners through thick and thin. Anyone with a business dream of their own can have the opportunity to advance together with us. No matter what obstacles we encounter, we'll never abandon our partners who share the same ideals as us.

221071071.content: While the walls the giants have put up may look tall and formidable, one day they'll be brought down by the tides! They may hold the wealth in their hands today, but prosperity will belong to all in the future!

221071072.content: If this day does not come due to those who ruthlessly and unscrupulously try to crush us, then let us gather more strength! Let us make the tide bigger and bigger. No overweening ambition can stand in the way of what is fair and right!

221071073.content: ...You know, I have this friend, and she has a wish that may be a little out of place in this world that we live in right now. Her wish is that everyone living in Xu Heng can see their own wishes come true.

221071074.content: Makes you want to laugh, doesn't it? I've laughed at her for years myself. But even so, I want to give her a hand anyway. To help shoulder her burden.

221071075.content: No one heard these last sentences, because everyone have already started cheering excitedly for Luliang, venting the tension everyone at Tian Lu Traders had been feeling for days.

221071076.content: (Stay well, Mantou. You'll get to see the day our wishes come true, I'm sure...)

121411001.content: "Well? What is it that you saw?"

121411003.content: "Not even dreams and illusions can escape reality."

121411009.content: Splintered fragments of words arrange themselves in Gremory's mind, and she selects one of them to describe the feeling in her body.

121411010.content: Then, she chooses an infinite number of words to describe all the information received by her senses, before merging them all into the only word capable of connecting her to everything.

121411012.content: Yes, she can see them. These broken, weightless things that are floating down with her, as though made of tiny particles, spell out the word "world."

121411013.content: The world. Where she exists. Where everything connected to her exists, and disintegrates before her.

121411015.content: Is this all that's left after the end...? I can't sense a thing.

121411016.content: The sky is hazy. All she can make out is the chaos of creation in the far distance, but she can't even tell if it's black or white.

121411017.content: The chaos seems to be sinking with her, little by little destroying space and matter at the junction between worlds, seemingly converting them into data streams and then devouring them. Implacably consuming this empty world.

121411018.content: Gremory reaches up to the sky, even though there's clearly nothing for her to hold on to.

121411019.content: Everything flawed will be destroyed in the end.

121411020.content:
Am I... flawed too?
Yes, yes, I am...

121411021.content: The last remaining piece of earth cracks silently and the debris flies out in all directions like dandelion seeds, infusing the air with sprinkles of muddy brown and stone gray.

121411022.content: Gremory feels something sticky on her back. She doesn't know if that's because she has fallen into the chaos, or if she too is being devoured along with this world.

121411023.content: Her vision blurs, as though she were sinking beneath oily water.

121411024.content: It's faint, but she thinks she spies something green, hovering just at the edges of her visual field.

121411025.content: A tree... In a place like this? How did you...

121411026.content: Staring numbly as the chaos envelopes the tree, Gremory feels an enormous and inexplicable sense of sadness. She sighs and relinquishes all efforts to resist the corrosion.

121411027.content: A bone-chilling cold seeps through her body from the empty void hidden deep below her beautiful appearance.

121411029.content: Just as her eyes begin to close, light gradually returns.

121411030.content: Above her, the lush greenery spreads out like a canopy, shielding her from the gnawing chaos.

121411031.content: The light grows dazzling as the tree extends its branches and burrows its roots deep into the void, as though in an attempt to protect this world.

121411034.content: Don't worry, Master. She's one of us, after all.

121411035.content: As her consciousness returns from the familiar dream world, Gremory feels something coarse and solid on her back. She opens her eyes, and discovers she is sitting back against a tree.

121411036.content: Two figures are standing guard nearby. She breathes a sigh of relief and picks herself up off the ground.

121411038.content: The impact from the space transfer knocked you out.

121411040.content: Just did what a partner should do.

121411041.content: The Prime Mod's back. I think we were too hasty in breaking your seal and transferring you straight away.

121411042.content: It's a shame we weren't able to keep any of those Mods in Mount Jingdu around. If you'd have intervened, they wouldn't have been able to escape.

121411043.content: That's a meaningless conjecture. It's not yet time to draw attention to ourselves.

121411044.content: I hope you have a clearer idea of what the Mods are capable of, after that last failure.

121411045.content: The man in the bowler hat gives an embarrassed laugh and steps to one side.

121411046.content: Gremory, you had that dream again.

121411048.content: It's written on your face. Dreams have the power to transform hesitation into determination, after all.

121411049.content: ...I thought I'd be used to it by now.

121411050.content: You were born from that dream. It will be with you for the rest of your life.

121411051.content: I can't see what you're seeing, but I trust the reason for your determination. "Flaws" are the cause of all destructions, and what the Modifiers seek to "modify" is too superficial.

121411052.content: The Modifiers are creations of Gaea. Do they really have no idea of the problem with it?

121411053.content: After seeing you need to think, after thinking you need to decide, after deciding you need to act... Yet how you act depends on who you are.

121411054.content: The Mods aren't free, Gremory. They force rationale onto everything they see, because that's what Gaea tells them to do.

121411055.content: They see us as deformed, and we see them as obstacles. That disconnect is why we want to kill each other.

121411056.content: So that's why that lunatic would rather swallow the Cinders fragment than give it to me...

121411057.content: The Modifier called "Zhu." Why do you mention her all of a sudden?

121411058.content: The Heterocore was in one of her workshops. I didn't get my hands on it, though. This Modifier from the Quad she knew, Mengzhang, laid a trap there.

121411059.content: Zhu was the one who designed the Astral Engine. She'd be so useful to us if she were still alive today.

121411060.content: ...You don't seem to care very much about this.

121411061.content: What's done is done. If you failed, it's experience. If you succeeded, there's no need to dwell on it.

121411062.content: You said you saw Zhu die with your own eyes.

121411063.content: Yes... Modifiers can't handle the power of the Cinders. Gengchen had to kill her when she spun out of control.

121411064.content: What? Gengchen killed one of her own people?

121411065.content: If such a thing can be called a Modifier...

121411066.content: Gengchen is not someone who wavers easily. Everyone in Xu Heng knows that.

121411067.content: Pfft, how can someone so callous still call themselves a leader?

121411068.content: This proves that she knows what needs to be done and that she's an opponent worthy of respect, not some mindless puppet. Similarly, those who follow her are not so simple.

121411069.content: The Quad doesn't understand us, just as we don't understand them. Mengzhang ruined Gremory's plan and Jianbing destroyed my trap. We weren't expecting either of these things to happen.

121411070.content: Nothing else must go wrong from now on. I want no more slip-ups, and I don't want any of you to underestimate a single Modifier.

121411071.content: Fear not, Master. I have already begun the preparations.

121411072.content:
Good.
Gremory, do you have any other information that might be of use to us?

121411073.content: Lingguang wants to use the Heterocore to cure Gengchen, but Mengzhang seems to have other ideas... Or maybe that was just part of his act.

121411074.content: I also injured a human from Aether Gazer, who somehow survived. Strange. That one doesn't seem to be affected by Bane Energy at all.

121411075.content: From Aether Gazer? That human called #{nickname}#?

121411077.content: More than that. I'm actually impressed.

121411078.content: Master, this seemingly ordinary human has ruined our plans more than once. Shouldn't we just...

121411079.content: No. We don't want to kick the hornet's nest until we're fully prepared.

121411080.content: Aether Gazer won't stay in Xu Heng for long. I'll keep an eye on them.

121411081.content: Now I can't go back to Yu Jing... I wonder what's going on up there...

121411082.content: Hehe, well isn't this interesting? Who would have thought that what we were looking for was right under our noses the entire time?

121411083.content: ...What happened last night was unexpected, but unsurprising.

121421002.content: There's a knock at the door as I'm lying in bed. I crack my eyes open, and try to gauge the time based on how bright the room is.

121421005.content: I yawn and press my hand against my head, then get up and open the door.

121421006.content: (Yawn) You're already awake? It's so early.

121421007.content: Aren't you tired after last night? What was it Gengchen did to you? (Yawn) I think I could use some of it, too...

121421008.content: Don't go back to bed, Admin! Look at the news.

121421009.content: Ver scurries into my room and turns on the TV. She catches me as I'm about to fall back onto the bed, and sits me up beside her.

121421010.content: ...The Quad have given no optimistic explanations for the fault with the Astral Engine. This is the first time it has been unstable since the Cloudsong Crisis.

121421011.content: According to reports, Photon Rail senior management is coming up with interim solutions for district transfers until the problem is fixed. The CORG Supreme Directorate and the Quad will be contributing supplies and personnel to the efforts.

121421012.content: The first batch of surveys have already been distributed, and no registration limits have been set. The priority will be to arrange the repatriation of residents from foreign Sephirah Zones, with the final quota allocated based on the survey results.

121421013.content: The upcoming district transfer is a preventive measure to mitigate the potential systematic risks of the Astral Engine. Citizens are being encouraged to go about their daily lives as normal, and to...

121421014.content: ...What's going on? The Xu Heng evacuation... I thought CORG was still preparing for it? How have we gone from preliminary surveys to a public announcement overnight?

121421015.content: That must be what CORG wanted to talk to Gengchen about last night...

121421016.content: I've only just seen this myself...

121421017.content: If Ms. Gengchen can recover her full power, the Astral Engine will stabilize and no one will have to leave Xu Heng.

121421018.content: I'm worried not everyone will see it that way.

121421019.content: "Systematic risks of the Astral Engine..." CORG never believed the Quad would be able to keep the engine going indefinitely.

121421020.content: But this is all so sudden. Do you think it's because of the Visbane attack last night?

121421021.content: It's hard to say... The situation might be more serious than we thought. Such a great explosion... All of Yu Jing must have felt it.

121421022.content: There's no point in us sitting here speculating. Let's go and ask.

121421023.content: I go downstairs with Ver, where we're greeted by a sea of people in the main lobby. Their impassioned and strident voices, and an overwhelming sense of déjà vu, dispel my remaining sleepiness.

121421024.content: Unlike the discussion in the break area two days prior, now the lobby is crowded. In the center of it all stands Luliang, and another group of people.

121421025.content: Captain Khnum, the surveys have already been sent out, so why have you brought all these people to Tian Lu Traders?

121421026.content: I am here on behalf of Photon Rail to handle the transfer and disposal of foreign-held assets. And you don't have to call me Captain here.

121421027.content: Everyone has seen or heard about last night's explosion and the Astral Engine's breakdown. We're just here to solve the problem.

121421028.content: I can't say I've ever turned up to a business negotiation brandishing a gun.

121421029.content: This isn't business. It's a suggestion, an opportunity. Given the Quad's apparent inability to maintain the engine's safety, we should prepare for the worst.

121421030.content: Carrying a gun is a field requirement where it may be necessary to maintain order.

121421031.content: I can guarantee you there won't be any trouble here. Tian Lu Traders will assist any of those who wish to leave Xu Heng...

121421032.content: But the quotas haven't even been calculated yet, so don't you think it's too early to be discussing all of this?

121421033.content: All residents and assets from other Sephirah Zones are in the list of first transfer batch, and those who don't want to leave must sign a consent form.

121421034.content: However, such a large-scale use of the Photon Rail is no simple task. I understand the people's safety and property are at stake, but we can't just open it up like that.

121421035.content: Now this hasn't been officially announced yet but... The first train will be departing in three nights' time. This is your best chance, so please consider it carefully.

121421037.content: You will be compensated for any belongings left behind based on their current total value. The operating losses of traders who have moved will also be paid for as soon as possible, including labor costs.

121421038.content: Of course, these policies are equally applicable to all Xu Heng residents, and we will also arrange for any subsequent resettlement and assistance in finding new work, starting new businesses or relocating existing ones.

121421039.content: I believe everyone has understood the situation by now. If anyone has any questions, now's the time to ask.

121421040.content: The crowd surrounding Khnum and Luliang grows quiet. Hesitation flashes in the eyes of the workers and traders present.

121421041.content: Eventually, all of these eyes turn to Luliang, who can also sense their reluctance. She sits down on a chair, looks over at me and Ver, and gives us a faint nod.

121421043.content: Hey, don't look at me like that. Free relocation, decent conditions. CORG isn't trying to trick you, so you can all relax.

121421044.content: I know all the chaos here is annoying, but we'll make sure everyone leaves in time...

121421045.content: But what about Tian Lu Traders? Are you coming with us?

121421046.content: Well, this is where we started the business, and the building's our asset, too... It would be such a shame to leave.

121421047.content: C'mon, why are you still caring about Tian Lu Traders at this point? You can all start a new life in anywhere else...

121421048.content: Tian Lu Traders is a brand. A brand can live on even after everyone has left.

121421050.content: Hey hey hey, me and my company are still perfectly fine here! Trust me, we've seen worse in all these years.

121421051.content: Now everyone get out of here, there's work to be done. Besides, it's not like anything I say will change your minds.

121421052.content: I'll spare you the leaving speech, but just remember this: Tian Lu Traders is a name you can trust, no matter where in the world you go!

121421053.content: The crowd slowly disperses. Some of them go with the CORG officers to fill out the paperwork, but most choose to make the decision later...

121421054.content: Ver and I watch Luliang as she sits silently in her chair. The first one to speak turns out to be the CORG Modifier called Khnum.

121421057.content: I extend my hand in greeting, but Khnum stares at it for so long that I begin to worry there's something dirty on it.

121421058.content: Hello. If you still have business to do here, I suggest you finish it ASAP and get back to Ain Soph.

121421059.content: He shakes my hand so quickly he might as well not have bothered, then withdraws his hand with a frown.

121421060.content: I don't waste too much time pondering the meaning behind his reluctance to shake hands, and instead flash him my Aether Gazer Division Nine badge.

121421062.content: Division Nine... We're all Mods here, I'm sure you don't need me to explain the situation to you.

121421063.content: The problem with the Cloudsong Ore is a problem for all of Gaea, and it's not something a mere Modifier can fix. I don't expect Gengchen and the Quad to be able to save Xu Heng a second time.

121421064.content: Please don't say something like that. Ms. Gengchen and her team haven't given up yet.

121421065.content: I know that Mods will never abandon the task they've been assigned, but we all have our own ways of approaching a problem. We don't all have to think alike.

121421066.content: It's CORG's recommendation to evacuate Xu Heng, and I agree with them. It's the best choice for everyone's benefit. I trust you can appreciate that.

121421067.content: How is that beneficial to anyone? Forcing everyone to leave their homes and uprooting their daily lives...

121421068.content: Daily lives? This has nothing to do with daily life, miss.

121421069.content: Humans have been blinded by the word "life" for too long, and forgotten that "survival" is what it truly is.

121421070.content: There are some old folks here in Xu Heng who lived through the Cloudsong Crisis. You can go and ask them if there's room for anything else besides survival then.

121421071.content: The more fragile a life is, the more severe its existence becomes. Many people simply do not know how to survive without the shelter of civilization and laws.

121421072.content: CORG's responsibility is to think about survival on their behalf, not to worry about their daily lives.

121421074.content: After three days at dusk, Port Carp Photon Rail station. You'll be able to board without a pass.

121421075.content: One more thing, Ms. Luliang. I would suggest you begin recalling your exploration and freight teams on the ground as soon as possible.

121421076.content: We are not well acquainted, so it's no surprise Khnum does not stay to talk more with us. He gives us the time and place and leaves.

121421077.content: Why did that guy seem like he didn't want to shake your hand? I thought everyone in CORG was businesslike and emotionless...

121421078.content: They just have to go through very strict military training. Don't talk about them as though they're robots...

121421079.content: But with that black combat gear... Another weird thing: doesn't he know that Division Nine can requisition photon trains at any time?

121421080.content: Maybe he's never worked with us before. It's not like we're overly familiar with CORG's privileges.

121421081.content: Anyway... Luliang, are you all right?

121421083.content: Luliang smiles at us, but it's obviously forced. She pouts and pushes her glasses up on her nose, as if to hide the tiredness in her eyes.

121421084.content: I wasn't being a good host. Sorry you've had such a terrible time here.

121421085.content: What are you talking about? Tian Lu Traders and the Quad have done a great job of looking after us these past few days.

121421086.content: I wasn't expecting last night's Visbane attack to have such severe consequences, though. It's like everyone's thinking about leaving Xu Heng overnight.

121421087.content: Nobody fears an enemy they can see. It's not the Visbanes, it's the Astral Engine that's got everyone worried...

121421088.content: You've only been in Xu Heng a couple of days, so you probably don't understand how important the Engine is to us. Its purpose is to stabilize the Cloudsong Ore, but its value lies in stabilizing people's lives and feelings.

121421089.content: It has brought an end to the suffering of the past, ensures the peace of the present, and promises prosperity in the future... All of our hopes lie within its forcefield.

121421090.content: It's like Xu Heng's second sun. Every day when people walk down the street, whether they're happy or sad, they just have to look up to the sky and they'll see it.

121421091.content: If the sun were to go dark one day, would we think rationally about what to do? No. Our instinct would be to panic.

121421092.content: But we've found the Heterocore! Lingguang will be able to heal Ms. Gengchen, and the Astral Engine will go back to normal...

121421094.content: Until yesterday, that's what I believed too. Even though Mantou never told me her powers could be restored...

121421095.content: However, Ver, you and #{nickname}# are both sharp. You don't need me to tell you what it means for CORG to openly act like this.

121421096.content: I'm sure Gengchen's efforts have not been in vain.

121421097.content: Yes, it's just like during the Cloudsong Crisis... She's betting on herself, but she won't let the residents help her shoulder the risk.

121421098.content: Nothing's ever guaranteed... She is trying every means, yes, but she will not let the residents face the risks with her.

121421099.content: Everyone has the right to make an informed decision. She has always been upfront with the people when it comes to safety.

121421100.content: So... What about you, Ms. Luliang? Are you going to stay in Xu Heng with Tian Lu Traders?

121421101.content: Have you forgotten I'm a Mod too? Don't lump me in with the folks you see me doing business with every day. Xu Heng's Modifiers are going to stay here until the very end.

121421102.content: As for Tian Lu Traders... Just think of it as me being selfish. If Xu Heng is gone, there'd be no point of keeping them anyway.

121421103.content: Most people don't have that courage.

121421104.content: Ha-ha, this isn't the first time I've built a company up from scratch. The rules for making money are the same everywhere. What's lost can always be made back.

121421105.content: No matter where we go and how much money we have, as long as we're willing to help others prosper, then Tian Lu Traders will continue to exist.

121421106.content: Anyway, you two should start making a move. I'll still cover your travel expenses for today, so don't worry yourselves about things you have no control over.

121421107.content: There are still plenty of interesting places to visit here, more than you could possibly squeeze into one day. There are some great spots hidden in the four islands, and stunning mountain vistas that people who live on the ground have never seen...

121421108.content: Have a walk around. You'll see why I love Xu Heng so much.

121421110.content: Ver and I look at each other. I know we're both thinking about the last thing Odin said to us last night.

121421111.content: Xu Heng is about to get very busy. I'd change my travel plans if I were you.

121421112.content: You should both come back to Ain Soph today.

121421113.content: It's a shame Odin wants us back today. It's all felt very rushed.

121421114.content: ...I see. I won't keep you any longer, then.

121421115.content: Luliang, we'd like to thank you for Tian Lu Traders' hospitality these past few days.

121421116.content: What's with all that sudden politeness? Just come back and visit some other time!

121421118.content: Let's go, Ver. We need to say goodbye to Gengchen as well.

121421121.content: Luliang has been resting in a rocking chair for over an hour since Tian Lu Traders restored its usual peace.

121421122.content: No one comes to disturb her, nor does she want anyone to. She's staring blankly at the streets outside. Everything appears to be normal, but she knows that some great changes are taking place.

121421125.content:
The message was short:
"Emergency at Mount Jingdu."
