121491027.content: Luliang takes another paper bag from behind her back, and hands the first spicy ones to Gengchen.

121491028.content: You're done with work for now, yeah? Shall we go find somewhere to sit?

121491029.content: Gengchen nods and follows Luliang out of the office.

121491030.content: There are more people in the Quad this morning than there have been these past few days. The breeze is gentle and the clouds are calm, a tranquil scene despite all the incidents happened.

121491031.content: The two women find an empty pavilion in the courtyard and sit down, relishing their skewers in the soft sunlight. Passersby smile as they see them, but do not venture to disturb their well-earned break.

121491032.content: Shall we go to Port Carp this afternoon?

121491033.content: It's better if I don't show.

121491034.content: Why not? You're not worrying that the sight of you at the port will scare people into not leaving?

121491036.content: Hmm... Even though you keep things to yourself all the time, and even though everyone's so reliant on the Quad that it deeply affects how they live their lives...

121491038.content: Lingguang's going. And the two from Aether Gazer.

121491039.content: Are they really going to stay?

121491040.content: Everyone in Aether Gazer is a bit like Odin in one way or another.

121491041.content: You mean, once they've set their mind to something, there's nothing you can say to stop them?

121491042.content: Sounds like you know Odin pretty well.

121491044.content: But I do know a lot of people from Aether Gazer. The management, like Shu and Tyr, and those who I've met before, Thor and Verthandi...

121491045.content: And if there's one thing they all share in common, it's the one I mentioned.

121491046.content: Gengchen says nothing and continues to eat, but doesn't look like she's about to change her mind. Despite these skewers being notoriously spicy, her expression remains unchanged as she slowly savors each bite. Someone who didn't know her would assume that the bright red chili powder is fake.

121491047.content: Luliang examines Gengchen for a moment, then turns to look at the Quad walls.

121491048.content: They're tall, blocking the view of the streets outside, but Luliang knows better than most exactly what's on the other side. People from all walks of life are all bustling along and getting on with their business.

121491049.content: If there's no more business to be done in Xu Heng, Tian Lu Traders will have to leave too.

121491050.content: It pains me. If I weren't around, who else could take charge of the company instead?

121491052.content: Of course not. I'd need a dozen Tian Lu Traders before I'd make enough money.

121491053.content: It's just that... It'd feel like our root in Xu Heng will be lost forever. And having to start again from scratch... would you be willing to do that with me again?

121491055.content: Hey! Was that hesitation I heard, Mantou?

121491056.content: It's too early to discuss these kinds of things.

121491058.content: Luliang pokes some holes in the paper bag with her empty skewer. Her fingers seem to be trembling a little.

121491059.content: You're right, there's no point worrying about this while Xu Heng is still standing.

121491060.content: Once Mengzhang succeeds and everything's back to normal, we'll need to think how we're going to explain all this to CORG and pick up the people who want to come back.

121491061.content: Oh, and the photon rail. You'll have to intervene personally on that... since it's under jurisdiction of both the Quad and CORG.

121491062.content: We have to find whatever it is that Mengzhang needs first.

121491063.content: Oh, that thingie... You know that'll be next to impossible. We'd need both time and luck.

121491064.content: Have you really got no better ideas for stabilizing the Astral Engine?

121491066.content: C'mon, you must have. I know you well enough.

121491067.content: If there really were no surefire way, you'd hardly be sitting out here taking a break, would you?

121491068.content: There really isn't. The loss of Prime Power was so sudden...

121491069.content: Okay okay. I was only asking. Alright then, so we have no other hope.

121491070.content: But you know, at this point, there's no need to be shy if you've got one or two little surprises to crack for us.

121491071.content: They're both on their last skewer each. Luliang jumps over to Gengchen and swaps their bags around, then takes out the last skewer of spicy meatballs and puts it in her mouth.

121491073.content: Luliang fans her tongue, tears springing in her eyes from just one bite. Luckily, the shop owner is considerate to his customers and has gifted a bottle of ice water along with the food. Luliang drinks half of it in one gulp.

121491074.content: She wipes the sweat off her forehead, looks at the rest of the skewer in her hand, and offers it back to Gengchen.

121491075.content: Curiosity killed the cat. That's true. My heart's racing.

121491076.content: I can't eat any more, shall we swap back?

121491077.content: Gengchen looks at the not-so-red skewer in her hand, and nods in agreement.

121491078.content: They finish eating, and Luliang gets up with a satisfied stretch. She picks up Gengchen's empty paper bag and walks out of the pavilion.

121491079.content: This afternoon I'm going to pay a visit to some old friends of Tian Lu Traders. After all, I'm hardly going to see them once they leave.

121491080.content: Let's part our ways here, then.

121491081.content: Ver and I reach Port Carp before the photon railway is activated. The scene is much less than we'd pictured for something called the "Xu Heng Evacuation." In fact, if anything, it seems quieter than normal.

121491082.content: The biggest difference from how Port Carp normally is, though, are the pair of two-story-tall turrets visible in the distance.

121491083.content: Despite their size, the pair of particle cannons are dwarfed by the majesty of Port Carp. The public are used to their existence already, although they hope that there will never be a need to use them.

121491084.content: Lingguang is standing outside the Photon Rail Center, staring at the temporary pathway that's just been created. Her fiery red dress is even brighter than the sunset.

121491087.content: It seems only a few people want to leave.

121491088.content: Leaving Xu Heng is no small matter, and CORG gave everyone six hours to decide. It's still quite early...

121491089.content: I guess people are hesitating. After all, once they leave, it may be hard to come back.

121491090.content: Sometimes you think you're sure about something, but when it comes to the crunch, you might feel differently.

121491094.content: Khnum appears from behind us like a phantom, although it's more likely he just walked out of the office building. He's alone without any escort.

121491095.content: Oh, nothing's wrong. It's just that you're the head of this operation, so I wanted to make sure you're present.

121491096.content: Captain Khnum, is the photon rail ready?

121491097.content:
Yes, we're set to depart in six hours.
If you want to go back to Ain Soph, feel free to board whenever you like.

121491101.content: A trader on his way to leave Xu Heng drives past in a luggage cart. Upon spotting Khnum, he excitedly adjusts his clothes and greets him warmly.

121491102.content: That's not important. I just wanted to stop and thank you.

121491103.content: The high-end clothing business has been pretty tough in Xu Heng these past few years. I've been wanting to try somewhere else for ages, but could never get the approvals.

121491104.content: This train has come at just the right time! Once I've settled in Neuhansa and made my millions, I'll be sure to make a sizable donation to CORG!

121491105.content: The man beams and produces some cards from his chest pocket, which he then stuffs into Khnum's hands.

121491106.content: Just some gift cards, you see—buy our clothes and I'll give you 80% off...

121491108.content: Khnum's voice turns cold, with no attempt at being polite.

121491109.content: The trader's face drops, and he looks at us for a reaction but receives none. His eyes dart to the gift cards Khnum is holding, but he decides against taking them back and scurries away with a sheepish smile.

121491110.content:
Idiot.
I'll leave the security problems outside the station to the Quad, then.

121491111.content: Khnum flings the gift cards at me, then wipes his hands before turning to walk into the photon rail station.

121491112.content: ...Looks like CORG's plan is not bad, huh? Some people were wanting to leave Xu Heng anyway, and now they've got their chance.

121491113.content: There's always someone who profits from changes. There's a bigger picture for us decision makers to see.

121491114.content: One man's meat is another man's poison. Look, that's someone who's definitely not pleased.

121491115.content: Lingguang and Ver follow my gaze to the station entrance.

121491116.content: A young girl with braids and glasses is sitting on a stool next to the entrance, swaying back and forth and staring blankly at the crowds of people passing her.

121491117.content: Her shadow is cast onto the temporary pathway, and she looks as lonely as the setting sun.

121501001.content: The train will stop there for six hours? What a patience. Alright then, after all, it's been long enough since there's been a new face in Ain Soph.

121501002.content: Closing the mission report signed by #{nickname}#, Odin reflects for a minute, then walks towards the Cryptics. The office area is considerably quieter compared to a few days ago.

121501003.content: Odin? What are you doing back here?

121501004.content: I told you the container's design has been validated in theory, but to build it we still need...

121501005.content: I'm not here for the container.

121501007.content: How much do you know about the Astral Engine? Or... is there anyone in the Cryptics who knows about it?

121501008.content: Xu Heng's Astral Engine? That technology is top secret. We haven't even seen blueprints for it, let alone the final design.

121501009.content: Why do you ask? Oh... the news coming out of Xu Heng.

121501010.content: Regardless of how much longer it can hang in there, or if there's really a problem, we should at least have a back-up to replace it with.

121501011.content: How about if I commission the Cryptics to build one?

121501012.content: Um... That's a hell of an ask. The creators, Zhu and Zhiming, are world-renowned academics, and two of the brightest minds in spatial and gravitational technology.

121501013.content: The Astral Engine's contradiction of the rules of physics is simply mind-blowing. It must use so much experimental tech I'm not even sure if we'd...

121501014.content: I know it won't be easy. But I don't need a guarantee, I just need a probability. If there's even the slightest chance, then I'd like you to get to work on it.

121501015.content: I've been studying the Cloudsong Ore for a while now, as it's an intriguing problem with Gaea itself. Gravity tech may have been around for many years, yes, but that doesn't mean we truly understand the underlying principles of it.

121501016.content: Even if you just need a probability... I'd put our chances of success at 10% max. Maybe higher, if the Quad agreed to provide us with technical support...

121501017.content: That's enough. When Zhiming returns to Xu Heng, I will ask Gengchen to set up a meeting between the Cryptics and the Quad so you can exchange ideas. I suggest you begin preparing for that right away.

121501018.content: Roger that. This kind of project would be perfect for Ookuninushi... I'll try and convince her to abandon her new inventions for the time being.

121501019.content: And that's the extent of Ain Soph's preparations for now.

121501020.content: If CORG intends on continuing with its plan, we're going to have to think of taking in Xu Heng refugees as a long-term issue. Aether Gazer needs to be prepared...

121501021.content: In Odin's office, Shu is wrapping up her overview of how the current situation in Xu Heng will impact Ain Soph. This has the potential to be the biggest human migration in the history of Gaea, and will involve an enormous amount of resources and regulations.

121501022.content: Shu's presentation is interrupted by the ring of Odin's communicator. Odin looks at the screen and raises an eyebrow.

121501024.content: It's the rookie's regular mission report. The second one today, but it's not been six hours yet... It's fine, I'll read it later. Please, continue.

121501025.content: That was pretty much it... If you have no objections, I'll get each department head to begin putting measures in place.

121501026.content: Objections? Of course not. I only wanted to know what the situation is, not to tell you how to do your job.

121501027.content: Well, you are the director, after all...

121501028.content: I don't have to be—I can easily stand down and make you director instead. Or what about Poseidon? It's a completely meaningless position.

121501029.content: A director isn't... Fine, forget it. Just get Division Nine's work done on time and that'll be enough for me.

121501030.content: I still haven't received the records of the joint operation between CORG and Aether Gazer. Have you?

121501032.content: You didn't know? Ver and the Administrator were there when the Visbanes attacked Tian Lu Traders three days ago. The Quad didn't have temporary jurisdiction over them.

121501033.content: So, in accordance with the partnership agreement, CORG was supposed to write it up in a report for both of us to sign off.

121501034.content: Oh, that... I haven't received anything either. I'm guessing someone forgot about it.

121501035.content: CORG, forgot the paperwork? That'll be the day. They're so regimented and process-driven, it would be very surprising for them to make a clerical error.

121501036.content: You think I'm just as reliable as CORG, right?

121501037.content: ...I wouldn't say that. But if that's what you believe, I'm not going to argue.

121501039.content: Come on, go and do your work. I've got to call CORG and see what they're playing at.

121501040.content: No need, I'll go and talk to those two. There's something else I need to ask them about anyway.

121501043.content: As she walks down a deserted street, Odin opens her communicator to read the mission report.

121501044.content: Besides the title, this mission report does not meet any of the required Aether Gazer standards, from the formatting to the content to the submission time. Despite that, Odin can't help but smile in admiration.

121501045.content: Just as her eyes fall upon the final "#{nickname}#" at the end, Odin hears the sound of approaching footsteps. She quickly moves the report into her Favorites folder.

121501047.content: Did I do something that annoyed you recently? If you want something, why can't you just call me?

121501048.content: I want to make sure what I hear is true.

121501049.content: Paracaesar eyes Odin warily, but doesn't dare let the sense of suspicion show on her face. She feels the tension stiffen her neck and quicken her heartbeat.

121501050.content: Is this about "her"? It's been a long time since we got any new clues. Have you found something?

121501051.content: I was hoping you could help... Unfortunately, it's got nothing to do with "her."

121501052.content: There are two things I want to discuss with you. First is the Observators...

121501053.content: Nothing about the Observators can be revealed.

121501056.content: I don't want to put you in a difficult position. I know you can't tell me anything about the Observators, and I wouldn't ask. All I know is that there are some things they're supposed to be taking care of, and they're not. Like the Cloudsong Ore, for instance.

121501057.content: I don't know if this is within your power, but I need you to convey my attitude to them. If they don't do anything to rectify the situation, I'm going to start believing that they don't exist.

121501059.content: Aether Gazer has two people in Xu Heng. And as far as I can gather, CORG are very active there at the moment.

121501060.content: You mean with the Xu Heng photon rail? You'll have to ask the president about that, I don't know much about their work with the trains.

121501061.content: Red Fox? So that old geezer is in on it too?

121501062.content: I'm not sure of the details, but something this big will have definitely been signed off at the top, by the president and by the Quad.

121501063.content: ...So what is it that you want? Are you going to start meddling in officially sanctioned projects now?

121501064.content: No need to get all tensed up. If something does go wrong, you're not the one to blame. Red Fox is hard to track down, and it's not like I'm asking for top secret information. You know that.

121501065.content: I have heard that CORG have dispatched a Modifier to oversee the Xu Heng evacuation plan. Someone by the name of Khnum.

121501066.content: Khnum? I know him... Gray hair, hates talking.

121501067.content: He would never act outside of his remit. Surely he's not causing trouble there?

121501068.content: Did you know he failed to submit a document?

121501069.content: What document? Do you mean that joint op report? I told you, I have nothing to do with that, and I have no idea what he may or may not have done.

121501070.content: I'm not trying to be difficult here. Tell you what, I'll look into this for you. And if that's all, I've got to be going now.

121501074.content: I know CORG keeps detailed HR records on all of its Mods. Don't tell me you of all people don't have access to them.

121501075.content: Are you joking? Those are top secret, I can't let you look at them.

121501076.content: I would never joke about the dead.

121501077.content: It takes a second or two for the significance of this to dawn on Paracaesar. She frowns, her suspicion giving way to fear.

121501078.content: He only forgot to submit one file. Is it really that serious?

121501079.content: If a Modifier's vital signs disappear, the Egregious Crimes Department would be alerted, and I would have known immediately.

121501080.content: Are you calling me a liar?

121501081.content: Paracaesar narrows her eyes and grits her teeth, but opens her communicator and searches for the file while also contacting CORG headquarters.

121501082.content: Khnum, of Quake Damage Control Department. Send me all of his movements during the last month. The clock's ticking. I'll give you five minutes.

121501083.content: I've been perfectly clear. I want all of his mission logs, reports, surveillance camera footage... anything of him. You've wasted 30 seconds already.

121501084.content: You're going to check this yourself?

121501085.content: Odin scrolls through the data, occasionally looking up at the gloomy looking redhead woman.

121501086.content: ...I know you're not the type of person who jokes about these kinds of things, so I believe you, even though you've given me zero proof.

121501087.content: Mods are a valuable resource for CORG. If something's really happened to Khnum, I want to know what it is.

121501088.content: I'll leave the paperwork to you then. I'm going to Kemet, but I want you to keep me apprised of everything Khnum did.

121501089.content: You're going to Kemet? What, now?

121501090.content: Why not? Do you really think your little spies are faster than me? If they were that efficient, I wouldn't have had to come to you in the first place.

121501091.content: Time is too precious to waste on trivial matters. Thanks for the help.

121501092.content: Odin waves and takes two steps into the alley, but suddenly stops and turns her head slightly.

121501093.content: I think you should prepare yourself to receive Khnum's death notification... If you still care about your precious "resources", that is.

121503001.content: I've sent you Khnum's activity log. Where are you? Why's the signal so bad?

121503003.content: Why does it sound like fighting in the background? Are you okay?

121503004.content: What, are you concerned for my safety? I'm touched.

121503005.content: I just thought we'd buried the hatchet for now... And I don't want to find myself in a sticky situation.

121503006.content: I've marked all of Khnum's movements that couldn't be verified. Whatever you're looking for, maybe you can start from there.

121503007.content: The Kemet office knows you're coming. Their special agents will come and greet you.

121503008.content: I don't want anyone slowing me down.

121503009.content: They know what to do. And I've dug up some clues, wanna hear them?

121511002.content: Yes. She's been through a lot, so she's resilient.

121511003.content: A lot of traders are leaving. Whether they're friends or rivals, she's going to lose a lot of people she knows. I think she might start feeling lonely... But she'll be alright with time.

121511004.content: We choose not to disturb Luliang at this time. Night falls, but the sun's rays had stopped reaching the port area a while ago already.

121511005.content: I'd assumed Luliang would be sitting in the entrance for a long time, but she receives a call and suddenly stands up, then grabs the stool angrily and leaves.

121511006.content: Of course a CEO wasn't going to be able to rest for long... Oh yeah, wait here for me for one second.

121511007.content: Is it report time to Odin already?

121511008.content: I shrug at her while opening my communicator.

121511009.content: Ver and I have been with Lingguang these past few days, and she's long gotten used to us sending our reports to Odin every six hours.

121511010.content: Huh? Admin, didn't you just send a mission report to Odin already?

121511011.content: Well, let's say that was a partial report. Some extra info, maybe?

121511012.content: There's something strange going on. It's just a hunch, but the more I think about it, the more I believe it's best to let Odin know. Just in case.

121511013.content: I copy and paste the last... no, the next-to-last report, delete the existing content and start filling in the template.

121511014.content: But before I can finish, the recipient comes to me first. The email, with an encrypted document attached, automatically opens upon verifying my identity.

121511015.content: A CORG file? Why is Odin sending me this?

121511016.content: Odin has added a message to the attached file. I read it without saying a word, then open the file.

121511017.content: Ver comes to look over my shoulder. Lingguang seems a little curious too, but her communicator buzzes at the same time—she's received the exact same email.

121511018.content: "Announcement of Change in Personnel... Khnum is being relieved of his duties, and the Quad shall temporarily assume all responsibility for the district transfer service... From the CORG Egregious Crimes Department Director..."

121511019.content: That's so weird. Why have they just fired Khnum like that? Wasn't he doing a good job?

121511020.content: Looking around at the calm and orderly port, I find myself asking the same question.

121511021.content: People are coming and going as usual. Nothing out of the ordinary.

121511022.content: They didn't give a reason? Just kicked him off the project like that?

121511023.content: You know what CORG are like. They just tell you what to do, never why...

121511024.content: Let's go and ask Captain Khnum himself! He seems to be a nice guy. I'm sure he'd tell us if he is having problems.

121511025.content: Good idea. If we are going to take over this operation, we're going to need a handover from him.

121511026.content: Full of questions, we enter the port and locate our target with ease (once we've asked a CORG soldier on guard duty).

121511027.content: Khnum is standing on an empty platform, and doesn't seem surprised to see us approaching.

121511028.content: I've been called back. It'll be up to you guys to arrange the rest of the trains.

121511029.content: It's so sudden... Has something urgent come up?

121511030.content: I don't know. They won't tell me anything until I get back to HQ.

121511032.content: Tonight, so there's not much time. Deputy Lingguang, are you ready for the handover?

121511033.content: Yes. The final step is to verify your identity.

121511034.content: Lingguang hands Khnum her terminal. He lines it up with the vital signs monitor on his wristguard. The verification is immediately completed with a simple beep.

121511035.content: The special agents and soldiers will be coming back with me. I hope you manage to keep the trains running on schedule until my successor arrives.

121511036.content: ... You seem to care a lot about this project.

121511037.content: It's a good plan. Please don't let all of my hard work go to waste.

121511038.content: If it's so important to you, why don't you put in a request with your superiors to allow you to stay until the first train leaves?

121511039.content: Or at least until the Quad team arrives? Things might start to fall apart if you take everyone with you now.

121511040.content: Orders are orders. I don't have the authority to question my superiors.

121511041.content: Even if those orders don't make any sense? Maybe your HQ doesn't have a clear understanding of the situation here, you could at least send a report...

121511042.content: There's no need. We've talked enough. I must be on my way now.

121511043.content: Wait, Captain Khnum, are you sure we don't have to...

121511044.content: Khnum ignores me, rounds up his people and leaves. Ver and Lingguang look at me strangely, as though questioning why I was so insistent.

121511045.content: I sigh as I watch Khnum turn and leave, then click my earpiece on.

121511047.content: Yes, I can see that... CORG have always had very strict rules, Admin, so I don't know why you were just... Admin?

121511048.content: Ver looks at me quizzically, having noticed that my attention is elsewhere, but she speaks no more.

121511049.content: What I just heard in my earpiece has stunned me.

121511050.content: The message Odin had written in her email was: "Contact me. If Khnum is nearby, don't let him see you. And don't speak."

121511053.content: When I contact Odin, she seems to assume that I'm doing whatever she asks. She just talks at me without caring if I'm actually able to hear her or follow what she's saying.

121511054.content: There's a problem with Khnum, and I'm currently investigating. You've noticed how he's been using those tissues. Impressive, this level of caution.

121511055.content: Paracaesar ordered him to leave immediately. I want you and Ver to see how he is reacting. Leave the line open, I want to hear everything.

121511056.content: After seeing no odd behavior from Khnum, I wait quietly for further instructions from Odin. She says nothing more until she hears the beep verifying his identity.

121511057.content: Just say something, try to stall him...

121511058.content: Not a difficult request, but Odin's next sentence throws me for such a loop that I'm amazed I'm able to speak at all.

121511059.content: I've found fragments of Khnum's Access Key and dog tag, as well as his team... They're all dead.

121511063.content: I've no idea what it is you're looking at, but it's certainly not Khnum. Shoot it.

121511065.content: Odin would never give an order like that unless she were absolutely sure, and Khnum is getting further and further away. I aim my gun at his back.

121511068.content: I'm not answering, but I'm not pulling the trigger either. Khnum turns around upon hearing my companions' cries, and I suddenly find myself staring down dozens of other guns pointed at me.

121511069.content: Do you know what you're doing?

121511072.content: I need more proof, or the best I can do is try and stop him from leaving.

121511073.content: Khnum comes to a halt behind the dozen or so guns that are now pointing at me. He slowly turns around as I reflexively draw my own gun, and looks at me with complete indifference.

121511074.content: You've been on a call this whole time, and whoever is on the other end has told you not to talk.

121511075.content: I'd guess a higher-up in Aether Gazer. Odin, perhaps?

121511076.content: The sound of guns being loaded was clear enough for Odin to hear. She'd understand the situation without me having to say anything.

121511077.content: Looks like we've got our proof now... The ones with it are all fake too.

121511078.content: I'll notify Gengchen. If it decides to attack now, we'll be able to take it down. Just buy us as much time as you can, I'm on my way.

121511079.content: There is a whooshing sound as the call ends. The words "I'm on my way" are my only hope of getting out of this alive.

121511080.content: Lingguang and Ver instinctively understand the severity of the situation and take out their Access Keys. My eyes remain calmly fixed on Khnum. I need to keep him talking until Odin arrives.

121511081.content: CORG have found evidence in Kemet that Khnum is dead.

121511084.content: No denial, no arguing. Khnum's reaction takes me by surprise. He stares at me brazenly, his eyes seeming to penetrate my body as though they're analyzing something else.

121511085.content: Even though the muzzle of my gun is less than five meters away from him, I can't perceive any emotion in him—not a tiny bit of hostility.

121511086.content: Maybe it's not a good idea to confront you like this... You might want to shut the mouth of anyone who's found your secret.

121511087.content: You knew the risks, but you didn't move. You're stalling for time.

121511088.content: Or I know that it's not in your best interests to attack us here... And that I have the courage to stand up for what's right.

121511089.content: Taking risks for a slight chance of success may be called an act of courage. But when there's zero chance, that's just stupidity. I've heard about you, and you're not a stupid person.

121511090.content: I sense you are different to ordinary humans. Such a special creature is worthy of further research... I hope we'll have a chance to talk again in the future.

121511091.content: Judging how things are going, I don't think you have much of a "future" left. If you've got something to say, then say it now.

121511092.content: You plotted to steal Khnum's identity, and continued to do all of the jobs he was assigned to. I don't believe for a second you went to all this trouble just to get some work experience at CORG.

121511093.content: It's not time for me to reveal the plan yet.

121511094.content: Okay, then let me ask you an easier question. If you refuse to answer that too, we'd have nothing more to discuss. Who are you, exactly?

121511096.content: Khnum frowns as though that question has never crossed his mind before, and he lowers his head slightly.

121511097.content: These creations "inside the box" have Divine Power and vital signs indeed, but how can they define something "outside the box"?

121511098.content: You believe you are you, when you're nothing more than a specific dataset. You believe you can think, but that's nothing more than Gaea's information processing, and your actions nothing more than Gaea's graphical calculations.

121511099.content: Knowing all this, do you still think you know who you are?

121511100.content: I'm sorry, I'm not usually so idle that I have time to question my existence.

121511101.content: Is that so? Fictions are easily believed to be reality when the belief is strong enough.

121511102.content: Khnum shakes his head in disappointment, then looks at the last of the dying light in the sky and turns to leave the port. The CORG soldiers keep their guns trained on me, however.

121511103.content: Ver, protect the Administrator. I've got a very bad feeling about this...

121511104.content: You too? I thought it was just me panicking...

121511105.content: I have hundreds of reasons to pull the trigger. I set my jaw, aim at Khnum's head and fire.

121511106.content: The bullet doesn't even make a sound after it leaves the barrel, let alone hurt Khnum. A power that we know only too well coalesces around him to form an invisible barrier, suspending the bullet harmlessly midair.

121511108.content: A Mod? Are you really so simplistic that you define a being's existence based on its power?

121511109.content: If possessing Divine Power is enough to call something a Mod, then... What'd you call me if I did this?

121511110.content: Khnum raises his hands and an ominous dark red light threads its way across the barrier. The floating bullet rotates, then suddenly disappears in a sonic explosion.

121511111.content: A lacerating pain instantly tears through my shoulder, and out the corner of my eye I see a spurt of blood. I groan in pain and stagger backwards, clutching my shoulder.

121511113.content: Huh, so it is only Bane Energy you're immune to.

121511114.content: Ver and Lingguang check that my life isn't in immediate danger, then without hesitation rush forward to attack Khnum.

121511115.content: Hey, watch out! He might be...

121511116.content: I watch as Lingguang's flames consume Khnum, and I hear the sound of armor shattering... but that's it.

121511117.content: Bane Energy... That's what you call it. And the second you see it, you assume I am an enemy. Don't worry, you don't need to answer me.

121511118.content: Superficial consciousness can only disappoint. I guess I do need to find the origin after all...

121511119.content: Khnum casually shakes the arm enveloped in crimson Bane Energy, and his armguard cracks into hundreds of pieces. The flames instantly lose their heat upon contact with his skin and quickly extinguish, leaving him completely unscathed.

121511120.content: He raises another hand, and Ver and Lingguang suddenly stop moving. They both sense that if they take one more step forward, they will be stabbed by something invisible.

121511121.content: I can understand what they're feeling, because I also feel myself unable to move. There is no force or pressure pushing down on my body, but I can't move my arms or legs.

121511122.content: I can't even pull the trigger. I can't even tell if it's because of Khnum's power or because my body has given up all hope of resistance.

121511123.content: Khnum surveys us calmly. There's still no trace of hostility on his face, and it doesn't even appear as though this demonstration of power is requiring any effort on his part.

121511124.content: My mind can hardly comprehend the gulf between us in terms of raw strength, but Khnum seems to have no intention of killing us. His CORG soldiers are still standing behind him, not making any move either.

121511125.content: Attacking someone who's so much stronger than you wasn't the wisest decision. And I don't remember there being any animosity between us before.

121511126.content: So you're the one who rescued Gremory from Mount Jingdu?

121511127.content: That's an interesting hypothesis. Why would you say that?

121511128.content: Few outsiders are able to grasp the trends occurring within the Quad and Tian Lu Traders. Very few CORG members would forget to submit a mandated report for a routine mission. And very few people would wipe their hands with tissues after shaking hands with someone even when they're wearing gauntlets...

121511129.content: But there are even fewer Visbanes who can withstand Lingguang's attacks without a scratch.

121511130.content: Visbanes? You choose to ignore the non-hostile power. Interesting.

121511131.content: If you'd derive some sort of meaning from fighting me, then I'd gladly accept. Unfortunately, it cannot be today.

121511132.content: We're not just going to let you leave like that.

121511133.content: I do believe I'm the one calling the shots in this scenario.

121511134.content: You can't just assume to know the outcome before the fight. Even if we could only delay you for a minute, we might keep even more people from getting hurt.

121511135.content: People getting hurt? Nonsense. I'm the one who's trying to save lives here, not you.

121511136.content: If you stop meddling from here, Xu Heng will be fully evacuated, and there won't be anyone left here except me doing what it is I need to do.

121511137.content: But you have disrupted the best-case scenario, and now many more lives will be erased in the ensuing chaos.

121511138.content: I do not like chaos. There are too many unknowns, and it requires too much guesswork and trial-and-error.

121511139.content: I'm not against your wish to seek the truth, but in this quest you have unwittingly created a situation none of us wanted to see.

121511140.content: I'll tell you a situation I don't want to see—you possessing someone else's body.

121511141.content: Possessing a body? What Gremory did must have scarred you badly... Anyway, I think the time for talking is over now.

121511142.content: Khnum appears to have sensed something, and he motions with his hand to open a space rift behind him.

121511143.content: Just as Ver and Lingguang are going to stop him, the bodies of the CORG soldiers begin to writhe and contort quickly, transforming into their true Visbane appearance. They stand between us and "Khnum."

121511144.content: Khnum and I are two different individuals. The only thing I borrowed was his identity.

121511145.content: If you don't know what to call me, I'll give you an option:

121521001.content: Thank god it's you. When the alarm went off, I thought Turing was coming back for us.

121521002.content: The photon rail station looks like a war zone, but at least it's settled down now. The Quad and CORG troops are on the ground for the clean-up operation, and my gunshot wound is already much better thanks to Lingguang's healing skills.

121521003.content: The sun is setting on the horizon, and the impending night lends an extra sense of desperation to the cries of the wounded.

121521004.content: However, the group of people who foiled the attack have more pressing issues on their mind...

121521006.content: That's Khnum... Well, I don't know if he's still Khnum or not, but just before he left he said we should call him "Turing."

121521007.content: Khnum is dead. I've just returned from Kemet, where all I could find were his and his team's dog tags.

121521008.content: Gengchen said she could still feel the power of this... Turing, right? She's gone off after him. Did you fight him?

121521009.content: We tried, but he didn't seem interested in us. He just said some weird stuff and left.

121521010.content: We couldn't stop him, we couldn't even get anywhere near him. Even Lingguang's fire seemed to freeze when it reached him.

121521011.content: Freeze? You mean it turned into ice?

121521012.content: No, not exactly... Look, I don't know the physics behind it, but the flames just seemed to die out as soon as they touched him.

121521013.content: It still looked like Lingguang's fire, but there was no heat to it. It was like he'd changed the very meaning of "burning."

121521014.content: And you felt it too Admin, right? Like you couldn't move anywhere near him, even though there was nothing there.

121521015.content: You just had this feeling that you'd be attacked by something if you dared take even one step toward him.

121521018.content: Then don't be scared at all next time. In battle, an enemy is always an enemy, no matter how weak or strong they are. Fear is the last thing you need before an enemy.

121521019.content: Even when there's something that can destroy Gaea with a single swipe, you draw your sword at it. Whether it's charging towards you or running away, you draw your sword at it.

121521020.content: Don't stop thinking and don't stop fighting, even if there's no chance of winning, even if there's no chance of survival. Otherwise what are we living for?

121521022.content: Since you've started thinking what you SHOULD do, I'm not going to mince my words with you.

121521023.content: Whenever Visbanes appear, it means life or death... So, what else do you know about this new foe?

121521024.content: Nothing really... But I did record everything he said to us before leaving.

121521025.content: I play the recording I'd started straight after Odin had hung up on me.

121521026.content: That's it. Sounded like a lot of puzzles to me...

121521027.content: The Origin... and this blankness, maybe Turing is...

121521029.content: In the darkness of the night, I'm sure I see Odin's eyes flash gold for a second. She frowns and turns silent.

121521030.content: It's nothing... Your journalist visas have expired too, so now it's definitely time for you to return to Ain Soph.

121521031.content: How can we do that? They need us here more than ever... And where are you going?

121521032.content: Odin walks away from us with a wave of the hand, dismissing further explanations. I've never seen her looking so serious before.

121521033.content: Lingguang, who had been supervising the clean-up operation, comes back just in time to see Odin leaving the station. She looks perplexed.

121521034.content: Where's she off to in such a hurry?

121521035.content: I think she's figured something out about Turing and is following up on that...

121521036.content: The Quad just sent a message. Chief is also out hunting for Turing. Maybe they've been contacting each other privately...

121521037.content: How is the train and the passengers, Lingguang?

121521038.content: Odin took out the Encroacher Types near the train, and thankfully the reinforcements arrived right on time. There haven't been any casualties.

121521039.content: However, the vertical rails took some damage during the battle, so the train is out of action for the time being.

121521040.content: So many people have already sold their apartments, quit their jobs, and now they have nowhere to go... I've notified Luliang. Tian Lu Traders is going to help the Quad provide temporary accommodation for them.

121521041.content: It's actually a good thing that the train can't depart now, right? Turing said that he wanted everyone out of Xu Heng.

121521042.content: But he also said many lives would be erased... What is he planning on doing?

121521044.content: I'm still thinking about the word Odin muttered to herself as she left. I don't know why that's the only thing Khnum said that she seemed to be dwelling on.

121521045.content: But Turing left so neatly, conjuring up a space rift out of nowhere and leaving behind not one single clue as to where he was going. For now, we can only hope that Odin and Gengchen have some other method of tracking him down.

121521046.content: Gremory set up a trap in Tian Lu Traders once. Do you think Khnum could have done the same thing?

121521047.content: Very likely. Khnum was very high up in the evacuation project, CORG would have given him a lot of authority and photon rail resources.

121521048.content: Mengzhang is still refining the Heterocore, so I was going to ask Jianbing to check the five isles for us. But I can't get hold of him.

121521049.content: Come to think of it, it's been a few days since I've seen him too.

121521050.content: I assumed he was off hunting for Gremory, who he'd be strong enough to handle. But if he runs into Turing instead...

121521051.content: Let's just hope he'll be able to save the day like he did on Mount Jingdu.

121521052.content: The fact that we've lost comms with Jianbing makes me even more anxious. I start to feel overwhelmed by our lack of information: we don't know who the enemy is, what he wants, where he is, the scale of his plans...

121521053.content: Revealing Khnum's identity was so easy it's almost as though he didn't care if he was found out... Unless he was already prepared for that to happen.

121521054.content: Ah, I should have thought of that earlier.

121521055.content: The lingering fear of the battle recedes. I look up into the night sky, and see more there than just the waning moon.

121521056.content: If I were Turing and I was exposed, would I still give them time to react and track me down?

121521058.content: It's been many years since Xu Heng has experienced a pitch-black night.

121521059.content: This is the first time the halo around the Astral Engine core has disappeared over Yu Jing, and the darkness throws the entire city into hushed silence.

121521061.content: Ver and I look into the sky in a daze. I become vaguely aware that a reassuring noise I've always heard has fallen silent. This sudden hole in our senses makes the slowly falling Astral Engine feel like a dream.

121521062.content: But this dream is simply a reality that my brain is refusing to accept. However, I snap out of it when I hear the terrible screech of metal as the Astral Engine continues to tilt, and a wave of pent-up panic rips through Yu Jing.

121521063.content: At times like these, someone needs to stay levelheaded.

121521064.content: The engine's power grid has been damaged. No need to panic, it has plenty of back-up power reserves.

121521066.content: Just as it looks like the Astral Engine is about to succumb entirely to gravity, the reassuring halo of light flickers back into life around the core.

121521067.content: Power is restored to the electromagnetic thrusters on the outer ring, and the cyan plasma jets roar into life as they push the hulking machine back into its original position.

121521068.content: Everyone's eyes remain fixed on the Astral Engine. I don't know whether to breathe a sigh of relief, or worry over how much the situation appears to be deteriorating.

121521069.content: Do we have enough back-up power...?

121521070.content: Leave it to the Quad. It looks steady enough for now...

121521071.content: What actually happened to the power grid?

121521072.content: The ground underneath some of the repeaters used to power the Astral Engine was destabilized. They're all set up in the outer zones with strict security measures around, but not under...

121521073.content: It wasn't hard to restart the repeaters, and the Astral Engine will regain power quickly enough. But this kind of underhand method... Sounds like Turing to me.

121521075.content: But if that was it, what is Turing's purpose?

121521076.content: I look up at the Astral Engine doubtfully, but before I can put my question into words, it's answered in a way nobody would have wanted to see.

121521077.content: This is the first time I've seen heavy particle cannons in action, except the targets they're firing at is what they're supposed to be protecting.

121521078.content: The high-energy ion beams can traverse the distance between the five isles in the blink of an eye. The glow of the fires and explosions adds to that of the city lights, making the night skies seem even darker.

121521080.content: Turn them off! Don't let them fire another salvo!

121521081.content: We run to the two cannons in Port Carp and shut them down as fast as we can.

121521082.content: But this is only possible because Lingguang and other Mods are already here. And particle cannons have been set up in other places outside of Port Carp, outside of Yu Jing even.

121521083.content: These two cannons have been turned off for now, and there are people on the way to take care of the others... Good thing that the cannons take a while to charge between shots. CORG is also sending its techs over.

121521084.content: There's no sign of data transmission. I'm guessing the cannons were fired by some program Turing hid inside the control system. It should be easy to root out.

121521085.content: But Turing didn't actually hurt Ver and Lingguang... Why would he attack ordinary people who are even less of a threat to him?

121521087.content: The base station, the server center, the energy hub, key transport axes, and the hospital... Vermilion Wellness wasn't spared as well, though thankfully there wasn't much damage. Do you need to go check on Nanjiao Isle?

121521088.content: No, as long as no one's hurt. We've got bigger problems here in Yu Jing.

121521089.content: The base station's been hit, no wonder why we couldn't call the chief... Maintaining law and order in all this chaos is our number one priority now, but...

121521090.content: Warning! Warning! High levels of Bane Energy detected! Approaching disturbance threshold...

121521091.content: Threshold exceeded! Quake imminent! Quake imminent!

121521093.content: I open my terminal and flip to the tactical map, which shows so many Bane Energy signals collecting together they're almost the same size as the entire city. My gun hand begins to shake.

121521094.content: ...but will Turing give us any more time at this stage?

121521095.content: The air itself seems to shake violently as the Bane Energy accumulates, and a freezing, terrifying aura descends on the city. The shrieks and howls of Visbanes can be heard from the cracks in the Source Layer that appear in the streets.

121522001.content: It seems clear that everything Turing has done was to try and curb Xu Heng's power. That's why he didn't kill us, and let us call for back-up... And we walked right into his trap.

121522002.content: The Quad, CORG, Tian Lu Traders... First he found a way to gather us all in the same place. Then he attacked our infrastructure while we were distracted, and triggered a Quake to divide and surround us.

121522003.content: It's just like that time in Omorfies, when a way to contain the main force was plotted in advance of the attack. Whatever his plan is, he's going to do it soon while we're unable to stop him.

121522004.content: He even had a plan for when his true identity was exposed. And he forced us to decide between ensuring Yu Jing's safety and tracking him down.

121522005.content: Turing and his unstoppable power, the near loss of the Astral Engine, the particle cannon bombardment and the fires in the city... It's been one catastrophe after another that I haven't had the power or ability to handle. But this battle against the Visbanes? That I can do.

121522006.content: I look at the tactical map until I can tell myself the usual "Yes I can do this." I take a deep breath in, then turn to look at Ver and Lingguang.

121522007.content: We have to deal with this Quake first. Hutao needs to take to the streets and kill the Visbanes before they hurt the civilians. We can't spare anyone to hunt down Turing anymore.

121522008.content: Then what do you need me to do here? What can be more important than dealing with the Quake?

121522010.content: Lingguang freezes for a second, then suddenly understands my meaning. She nods at me.

121522011.content: He might be doing all this to get into the Astral Engine, and steal the Sephirah Core.

121522012.content: We don't currently have anyone protecting these two. Lingguang, I'd feel much better if you were up there.

121522013.content: But the portal to enter the engine is in the hills behind the Quad, plus the engine is protected by a shield—if anyone broke through it, the chief would certainly be alerted...

121522014.content: Oh no. The back-up power source isn't charging the shield anymore, is it? It's charging the engine itself instead.

121522015.content: And we don't have time to fix the power supply at the moment. You almost have to admire his plan...

121522017.content: We look over at the port entrance and see a delicate, or should I say fragile, figure stagger over to us. Lingguang rushes to prop her up. It's a Quad Modifier, and she appears to be injured.

121522018.content: Xiwu?! What are you doing here? You're supposed to be recovering in the Quad!

121522019.content: I couldn't reach you as the base station's down... It's not safe at the Quad either. There's a whole swarm of Visbanes gathering in the hills behind the Quad. We may be looking at thousands of them.

121522020.content: Everyone's getting ready to defend the Quad, but there are just too many of them. I decided to look for you since the chief isn't back yet...

121522022.content: Yes. I wonder if she's found Turing. I hope the chief can come back and take charge of the situation soon. But before that happens, we'll have to hold on at the Quad the best we can.

121522023.content: The Visbanes are attacking the rear hills... How is the Astral Engine now?

121522024.content: There've been attacks on both the engine's monitoring station and the teleportation array. Hutao is leading some folks there. But I'm not sure how things are going over now.

121522025.content: Okay, keep calm, we'll go over there together now. #{nickname}#, Ver, what are you guys going to do?

121522026.content: Shall we go and help the Quad too, Admin?

121522027.content: No, there's something more important we've got to do... I'm sorry Lingguang, but Ver and I need to go find Odin.

121522028.content: Mimir has recorded Odin's Divine Grace signature. I don't know what could be holding her and Gengchen up, but we'll at least be able to check that they're okay.

121522029.content: You're right... I guess this is where we part ways then. Safe journey.

121522030.content: Take care of yourselves out there.

121522031.content: Lingguang and the Mod called Xiwu rush back to the Quad. I activate Mimir and start searching for Odin's location.

121522034.content: The light patterns representing Odin's Divine Grace wave flash on the screen. Ver comes over to look.

121522035.content: That's not Chang'an Bridge, is it?

121522036.content: Yeah. We should go. Make sure we don't get split up.

121531001.content: Standing proudly in the heart of the business district, the Tian Lu Traders building remains unscathed by the earlier cannon attacks, thanks to the ultra-thick force field protecting it.

121531002.content: Yingzhao is awoken by the commotion of the bombardment. She looks outside and sees people fleeing down the streets, and the orange glow of raging fires dotted across the Yu Jing skyline.

121531003.content:
What's going on? Sounds like there's a lot of noise coming from downstairs too.
News, news, news... That's weird, why isn't there any signal?

121531004.content: She shakes her comms device, but the display still reads no signal. She picks up her pass, planning to go downstairs and find out what's happening.

121531005.content: But just as she reaches out to turn the door handle, the building shakes violently again. She looks outside, and for once her impassive face shows signs of emotion.

121531007.content: It takes Yingzhao three seconds to process her emotions, from confusion to fear to anger to calm. Once done, she summons her Access Key and runs out into the corridor.

121531009.content: Yingzhao opens the door to Linyu's room and sees the little girl frantically stuffing a pile of bizarre items into an oversized bag.

121531010.content: Yingzhao, the Quake is coming, and it looks like a big one. I'm putting together some gear that should help against the Visbanes. I've got to get out there as quickly as possible...

121531011.content: You... There's no time for all that. Come with me.

121531012.content: Linyu stops packing, but doesn't say anything. She nods and shoulders the half-empty bag, then follows Yingzhao out of the room.

121531013.content: You're later than I expected, Yingzhao.

121531015.content: A Quake has hit Yu Jing and almost destroyed my place. It's time to come out of hiding.

121531016.content: All of our field Mods are here, and the supplies. Do you want to dispatch all of them?

121531017.content: Looking over at the Mods checking their equipment in the courtyard, and the small piles of emergency supplies, Luliang nods in determination. She unclenches her fists (how long had she been holding them like that?) and laughs as she pats Yingzhao on the arm.

121531018.content: Why so serious? The building is protected by the same type of shield as the one around the Astral Engine. We're currently pumping all of our reserve power into it. It's going to hold for a long time.

121531019.content: And even if a massive swarm of Visbanes did attack it, we'd be able to get back in time. Don't worry, Linyu will be safe here.

121531020.content: !!! Boss Luliang... do you want me to stay here at Tian Lu Traders?

121531021.content: Oh, I didn't see you there, Linyu. What are you hiding behind your sister with that big bag for?

121531022.content: I want to go out there with Yingzhao and fight...

121531023.content: Linyu... The environments have changed greatly after the Quake. You'll have to be watching your back every second.

121531024.content: Then let me watch your back! Why... Why is it that I don't seem to be of help to anyone...?

121531025.content: Ha-ha, Linyu, don't be upset. I want you to stay at Tian Lu Traders because I have an even more important mission for you.

121531027.content: Yes. All of the human staff are being transferred to the underground stronghold to take refuge, and we need someone to protect them.

121531028.content: She's right. You know your way around the building's defense systems better than any of us. You're our best choice to protect all the civilians.

121531029.content: Don't we have the shield anyway...?

121531030.content: Linyu stops midway through her sentence. She knows her wish to fight along with her sister has been expressed clearly enough.

121531031.content: I understand. I'll do my best to defend Tian Lu Traders.

121531032.content: Yingzhao pats her younger sister's head affectionately.

121531033.content: Luliang nods at them, then quickly counts up how many Mods she has in the courtyard, takes out a megaphone and clears her throat.

121531034.content: Now that everyone's here, I'll put it short. We weren't prepared for this Quake, and I know everybody's shocked. After all, Xu Heng hasn't faced such a big one since the Cloudsong Crisis.

121531035.content: But this Quake isn't a coincidence. It was planned by someone called Turing. Are we going to let him succeed? No! We're going to show him what Xu Heng is made of!

121531036.content: He wiped out an entire CORG team without anyone noticing, and took advantage of their evacuation plan to hide in plain sight. Not even Lingguang is a match for him. So if you come across Turing, don't try and be a hero. Just fire the flare and get out of there—someone else will come to take care of him.

121531037.content: I've been doing business for decades now, and this is the only day I don't care about costs! So don't be stingy, take whatever supplies and equipment you need!

121531038.content: I know y'all will do me proud. Head out as soon as you're ready—and make sure you come back alive!

121531039.content: The Modifier teams begin to disperse in different directions. Luliang snaps her fingers as a sign for Yingzhao to follow her. Yingzhao looks over at Linyu, who smiles and waves back.

121531040.content: Yingzhao forces a smile back at her and waves goodbye, then turns away from her sister so she doesn't have to see Linyu's facade slip.

121532001.content: (...Everything is gonna be okay, everything is gonna be okay...)

121532002.content: Upon seeing the scary monsters crawl down the alley, the frightened little girl hides by squeezing herself into a barrel. Once inside, she covers her ears, closes her eyes, and keeps repeating the same sentence to herself.

121532003.content: The monsters' roars send people fleeing in panic. After what feels like ages, it sounds like the alley is devoid of all life.

121532005.content: (Are the monsters all gone? Mommy, daddy, where are you?)

121532006.content: The girl opens the lid of the barrel a crack and peeks outside. The light from the streetlamp spills across the dark alley, but there are no people or monsters to be seen.

121532007.content:
The girl sighs in relief, pushes the lid all the way back and sticks her head out of the barrel.
However, just as she's standing up, she feels a bone-chilling coldness behind her.

121532008.content: She slowly turns her head to see a vaguely humanoid monster standing quietly behind her, its blood red eyes staring straight at her.

121532010.content: The girl ducks back into the barrel and closes her eyes shut, trembling with fright. She can't run away from here, so maybe the best she can do is to shout out for help.

121532011.content: But is there anybody nearby who'd rescue her?

121532012.content: One second, two seconds, three seconds... The terror seems to make time stand still. It's not until she takes a deep breath to calm down that she realizes she's somehow still safe.

121532013.content: She remembers now that her scream had masked some kind of weird noise... She opens her eyes and plucks up the courage to look out of the barrel again.

121532014.content: The next time you choose a hiding place, make sure it's one you can easily escape from, okay?

121532015.content: The girl stares numbly at the girl offering her a hand. She looks around, but can't see the monster anywhere.

121532017.content: I've chased it away, you don't need to be afraid anymore.

121532019.content: Oh, it's fine. Just the usual life-or-death peril.

121532020.content: We haven't checked the streets up ahead yet. I'll go first.

121532021.content: The little girl's eyes widen as she sees a group of people in uniform walk past the girl in glasses, all led by a young, composed-looking lady.

121532022.content: Behind them are people dressed in all kinds of clothes. They are civilians, staying in the areas that the security personnel have passed, refusing to hide.

121532023.content: They are rescuing those who are trapped, shoring up damaged buildings, setting up cordons... Although they're not professionals, they are gradually developing a tacit understanding of how to best work together.

121532025.content: Oh, yes... Um, I'm not quite sure how to explain it to you.

121532026.content: They're all kinds of people, from all walks of life. They didn't want to keep hiding, so they've ganged up to help each other. This "team" doesn't really have a name...

121532027.content: Who says we need a special name, Ms. Luliang? We're just people from Xu Heng!

121532028.content: A young man strides past the little girl and gives her a thumbs up. She smiles at him, then turns to Luliang.

121532030.content: Of course! There's strength in numbers, after all. You leave the monsters to us and help the others with their work!

121532031.content: Holding onto Luliang's hand, the little girl leaps out of the barrel and joins the courageous crowd of civilians.

121532033.content: What, Yingzhao? Why do you keep looking at me like that?

121532034.content: Boss, actually I've been wanting to ask you since before we set out. Your eyes... Have you been crying?

121532035.content: Luliang doesn't deny it immediately. She knows that Yingzhao will take this short silence as a yes, yet also a sign that now is not the time to ask such questions.

121532036.content: We need to focus on the battle, Yingzhao. You might be smart, but we really need your talent of perception elsewhere now.

121532037.content: This is only the start of the Quake... I have a horrible feeling Turing has gathered an entire army for us to face...

121541002.content: Luliang is frustrated at having been called back to Tian Lu Traders from Port Carp, but she's long used to this. Such a large company needs constant leadership from the top.

121541003.content: It's that time of year again when it gets dark really quickly.

121541004.content: She is leaning over the rail in the walkway outside her office, looking up at the reassuring glow of the Astral Engine in the night sky as the city below gradually falls asleep.

121541005.content: The pot of purple pansies she'd placed on the corner shelf a few days ago don't seem to be doing so well, but she can't think of anything else she could put there in their place.

121541006.content: Just as she's thinking this, a pale purple petal falls weightlessly to the floor. Luliang doesn't know why, but it makes her inexplicably sad.

121541007.content: Stop scaring yourself. Something good will happen.

121541008.content: The more she concentrates on her thoughts, the stronger her palpitations become. She looks back up at the Astral Engine, seeking solace in the warm glow of its halo.

121541009.content: But the sky suddenly seems darker, without any warning...

121541011.content: Luliang watches on, dumbfounded, as the Astral Engine begins to sink out of the sky. It's not until the plasma thrusters kick in that she snaps out of it, dialing Gengchen on her comms device while she runs into a nearby lounge.

121541012.content: Pick up... Come on, pick up...

121541013.content: Luliang tries a dozen of times, but Gengchen doesn't answer a single one of her calls.

121541014.content: At a loss, she paces the room until she accidentally bumps into a shelf in the corner. It wobbles, and shortly after there's a loud crashing sound.

121541015.content: She looks at the shelf and sees a pile of shattered fragments of the double dragon bottle Jianbing had accidentally knocked over that day. The dragon's head is lying dangerously at the edge.

121541016.content: She stares blankly at the fragments. Their sharp edges seem to cut through her confusion, suddenly sending her into a helpless panic. She hurriedly reaches over to try and rescue the dragon head, when her terminal suddenly starts ringing.

121541017.content: Seeing the name flashing on the screen, Luliang quickly sits down at a table and places the terminal so that it's perfectly upright opposite her. She answers the call.

121541019.content: I didn't find Turing, so I just got back to Yu Jing.

121541020.content: You scared me, I thought you'd been... Wait, who's Turing?

121541021.content: The Quad will fill you in. I've seen what's happening with the engine, don't worry.

121541022.content: What do you mean, don't worry? This is the first time the Astral Engine has ever died... It must be chaos out there.

121541023.content: What's happened to the engine? Has your power...

121541024.content: I'm fine. If we succeed, something like this will never happen again.

121541025.content: ...What are you going to do? Did you find the thing that Mengzhang needs?

121541027.content: Luliang freezes, a terrible feeling gathering in her chest. However, her mind fights against asking Gengchen to confirm it.

121541028.content: Don't you remember telling me this morning that there wasn't any other way?

121541030.content: It's time that the Quad gives everyone a solution. I have to be open to all possibilities.

121541031.content: Why do I have the feeling that you're not sure either... So what kind of solution do you have?

121541032.content: The Heterocore. I'm going to use it to replace the engine's Sephirah Core.

121541033.content: Wait, that's meant to cure... Never mind. I don't know much about the technology, but I do know about the Sephirah Core.

121541034.content: And it's the heart of an entire Sephirah Zone. Can it really be replaced by that Heterocore?

121541037.content: Luliang blurts out her question, then blushes apologetically. Why was she afraid to ask it? Because she's afraid of hearing Gengchen's answer?

121541038.content: Or is she afraid of this short silence coming from the other end?

121541040.content: That's too short for an answer.

121541042.content: Luliang smiles and waves her hand at Gengchen's response, as though Gengchen was actually standing in front of her... as though Gengchen had actually given her the answer she wanted to hear.

121541043.content: Ha-ha, why the hesitation? It's not like I'm worried about you, you don't need to come and prove yourself to me. Just take good care of yourself, okay?

121541044.content: I will. And we're going to need a lot of assistance from Tian Lu Traders.

121541045.content: Okay okay, whatever you want as long as it doesn't lose me money.

121541046.content: Oh! Sounds like the Quad messengers are here. Let me see...

121541048.content: Luliang hastily hangs up. Because Gengchen didn't answer that immediately, either.

121541049.content: No one is actually here to see her. The lounge is as silent as the moonlight outside the window.

121541050.content: Let's see... I should make Mantou a cup of tea now, it'll be just ready when she gets back.

121541051.content: Luliang smiles to herself as she stretches, then gets up to make the tea. She puts two cups on the table, one in front of her and one in front of the seat opposite.

121541052.content: The good ones take ages to make, but she must be too thirsty and tired to wait. I'll just put some loose tea in the water and...

121541053.content: Like a kite that's just had its string cut, Luliang's voice suddenly loses all of its energy. Her smile drops, and she puts the teapot down and sits back.

121541054.content: Staring blankly at the teacup in front of her, Luliang shrinks in on herself, her vision blurring. Just as it feels like she's about to completely crumble, she lifts her gaze and her vision clears.

121541055.content: The teacup and the seat opposite her remain empty.

121541057.content: The silence gradually infiltrates the loneliness of the room. Luliang trembles as she tries, yet fails to contain the sadness in her chest.

121541058.content: Bad Mantou! You're just a liar... A big, bad liar...

121541059.content: Why are you always unwilling to talk about the things I care about the most?

121541060.content: You know I've already guessed it, and I've even asked you about it...

121541061.content: This... is bad, so very bad...

121541063.content: So choked up with emotion that she can't even speak to herself, Luliang really wants to cry but is too conscious of all the footsteps she can hear outside the door. She bites her lip and clenches her fists to try and stop the tears from coming out.

121541064.content: A tear drops into her cup with a gentle splash, but the sound feels like a bang. Another falls, and then another, and with each tear, the gaping emptiness in her heart seems to grow.

121541065.content: I wish we could go back in time and find another way...

121541066.content: Slowly, the hole swallows the sadness. She sits there, refusing to wipe away her tears and refusing to unclench her fists.

121541067.content: You can be mad at me, or even hate me, it doesn't matter...

121541069.content: ...This might be a childish fantasy or a faded hope, either way it won't change what is happening right now.

121541070.content: Hurried footsteps stop outside the door. Luliang knows that the time for crying like a baby is over, even if she is unable to pull herself together enough to stand up.

121541071.content: Boss, we've received an urgent message from the Quad.

121541073.content: Wiping away her tears, Luliang puts her glasses back on and takes a deep breath to try and calm herself. If it doesn't work, then just takes another...

121541074.content: The tear drops in the teacup reflect the light of the waning moon. With a final look at the mess on the shelf, Luliang leaves the lounge trying to look as normal as possible. The only tell is that her right fist is still clenched tight...

121542002.content: Gengchen has spent twenty minutes battling through the Source Layer since the moment she sensed the unusual and powerful force in Port Carp that doesn't belong to any Modifier.

121542003.content: She can clearly feel the remaining traces of several spikes, but in the Source Layer they feel like mere drops in the ocean, barely perceptible once died down. She feels like she's chasing after intermittent fireflies.

121542004.content: Is it just the ability to distort space? Or something bigger?

121542005.content: But Gengchen doesn't give up. Even though she's chasing after the tiniest signs, she knows this is her biggest chance to catch Turing, even if it is just a war of attrition between them.

121542006.content: In terms of pure strength, Gengchen believes herself to be unbeatable. This isn't blind faith—keeping the Sephirah Core sealed may be sapping her power, but that's not to say it doesn't come with benefits.

121542007.content: The price paid for a forbidden power is meaningless if it isn't strong.

121542008.content: But Gengchen still eventually comes to a stop. She can feel distorted Divine Power surging inside her without warning. She looks deep into the Source Layer for a moment, then opens a pathway back to the Surface Layer.

121542010.content: She silently appears in an empty corner of Yu Jing. The clamoring of the crowd can be heard from the distance.

121542011.content: The Astral Engine has been driven back to its original place by the propellers. Gengchen takes a look and pulls out her comms device. There's a long list of unanswered calls.

121542012.content: She swipes the screen and sees they're all from the same person. She sighs and returns the call.

121542014.content: Hearing Luliang's somewhat abrupt question, Gengchen tries to formulate an answer, but ends up simply sighing a yes.

121542015.content: She just had the feeling that her position was being locked in place by something. It only lasted a short while, but she's sure it was real. As soon as she hangs up, she runs to the Quad while dialing another number.

121542016.content: Chief, I'm still on Yuyi Isle. I'm almost done with the Heterocore.

121542017.content: I see the Astral Engine. Looks like we don't have time to look for a substitute?

121542018.content: No, we don't. Everywhere is a mess right now, we must act quickly. Just make sure you know what you're doing.

121542019.content: Um, I'm about 70% confident... And there's a problem.

121542020.content: Your powers are the only thing that's keeping that thing safe. If we use it in the Astral Engine, doesn't it mean that...

121542021.content: We don't have time to worry about the details.

121542022.content: Guess we're out of options... What about Odin, then?

121542024.content: We can only hope for the best, then. I'll head over to the engine now.

121542025.content: The plan is set, and there's nothing else Mengzhang can say to change that. He sighs and hangs up.

121542026.content: It takes around half an hour to get from Yuyi Isle to Yu Jing—not a long time, but considering the Astral Engine has nearly crashed out of the sky just now, half an hour feels like an eternity.

121542027.content: While Mengzhang is in a rush, Gengchen is slowing down. She walks out onto the street and pauses near the sound of running water. She hears footsteps approaching from behind her.

121542028.content: ...I thought I'd meet you in the Quad.

121542029.content: A desolate bridge crosses the Luo River, far from the prosperous buildings and glittering lights of Yu Jing.

121542030.content: The person who locked her position makes no attempt to conceal their identity or, more precisely, has just caught up with her. Even though this person wasn't blocking her way to the Quad, Gengchen still stops in her tracks.

121542031.content: She turns and faces the friend with whom she's fought in countless battles together through the eras. They keep a certain distance between them, as though they're already prepared for what's about to happen next.

121542032.content: That night we had dinner together, Verthandi and I had a chat on this Chang'an Bridge.

121542033.content: So I've heard. What did you talk about?

121542034.content: She had still not chosen her path, and you had not imposed your own thoughts on her.

121542035.content: You know, I only established the Aether Gazer to give them two things: freedom and the chance to live.

121542036.content: Ver has a lot of potential, and so does #{nickname}#. They don't need any pressure from me... To be honest, if those two hadn't have come to Xu Heng, I would have been more open with them.

121542037.content: Like I would have asked you that night at dinner: why give the Cinders to Mengzhang?

121542038.content: I really worry you, don't I?

121542039.content: You don't worry me, but your methods do. Gengchen, tell me: What is it you're planning on doing now?

121542040.content: The Cinders can solve the overload problem of the Heterocore. I'll use the Heterocore to replace the Sephirah Core, which I'll then return to the Hall of the Heart.

121542041.content: Turing's plan is already in motion. This is the only way we can guarantee the safety of both the Astral Engine and the Sephirah Core.

121542044.content: Don't play dumb. I don't care about the Cinders right now, I'm asking about YOU.

121542045.content: Seeing the golden glow slowly dimming in Odin's eyes, Gengchen looks down at the water flowing under the bridge.

121542047.content: You know, the Prime Modifiers cannot use their powers to interfere with each other, so I spent a lot of time "seeing" different endings.

121542048.content: Just to make sure that none of them are the worst-case scenario that I fear... But the results are all the same.

121542049.content: Taking slow, deep breaths in an effort to calm herself down, Odin raises a hand, and a black hole swiftly expands from her fingertips. From it, she slowly pulls out her spear.

121542050.content: ...You are not in any one of them.

121551001.content: Odin grasps her spear, but directs neither its tip nor her gaze toward Gengchen.

121551002.content: The Astral Engine has returned to its original position, but the clamor of the city has not yet died down. The sound of people seems to drift down with the Luo River, clinging to it like a mist. Even though Chang'an Bridge is too far away to hear anything specific, it's easy to guess what is being said.

121551003.content: Do you really think I don't know? If you use the Cinders to balance out the computational power of the Heterocore, then you'll have to keep using your power to seal the Cinders.

121551004.content: We only got back to Yu Jing from the Source Layer a couple of days ago, but your power has already weakened. I don't like to be told facts I can't verify... And you know that.

121551005.content: Panic is spreading like fire, Odin. Now we're just wasting time.

121551006.content: If you have a better idea, tell me. If not, then I'll call the shots.

121551007.content: Isn't the better idea right in front of us?

121551008.content: Red Fox was right. While the photon rail is still operational, you should continue with CORG's plan.

121551010.content: What are you worried about? Once the evacuation is over, you, the Sephirah Core, humanity, all will be fine.

121551011.content: There's no precedent for that. If the changes in Xu Heng cause the Idealbild to deviate past the inflexion point, and if Gaea is unable to be rebooted like you said, we'll lose the last chance we have.

121551012.content: Speculation isn't going to convince me.

121551013.content: I've said time and time again—this era is much more of a mess than the last one. If we want to turn things around, we can't afford any more losses. Especially us...

121551014.content: But we're not irreplaceable. Odin, I don't deny the Visbanes are getting stronger by the day, but the world is balanced.

121551015.content: Unfortunately, the Visbanes are exactly created to shatter this balance. These specious justifications invented by humans don't apply here.

121551016.content: Gaea is sinking in quicksand, and the struggles of the past eras are pulling her down faster. We're the only ones who can save her from disasters, but all I see is our numbers shrinking. I've never seen an opportunity for us to change the tides.
