121551017.content: Have you ever watched a rope snap? It doesn't matter how long it takes to break the first strand: once that's gone, the others are bound to follow, each one quicker than the last.

121551018.content: We no longer have time to test our limits.

121551019.content: But it's not just us who have the power to save Gaea. New Mods appear in every era, as well as humans with special abilities like #{nickname}#...

121551020.content: That's not enough. It doesn't matter how much potential they have if the time is run out.

121551021.content: So it's our job to make time and create possibilities for them. I trust in them.

121551022.content: Are you serious? You want to shoulder all of the burden yourself, and now you're telling me you trust other people?

121551023.content: Because that "burden" is something only I can do.

121551025.content: I only value the results, and what I'm seeing is that your little friends have not gotten to the stage where they're strong enough to help us...

121551026.content: If you keep this up, you are going to die. I want you to understand how important you are, and that your life isn't worth risking.

121551027.content: You're taking this too seriously, and your visions are also just speculations. I have some theories to prove that my life won't be in danger.

121551028.content: There's no point in finding excuses now. I'd also like to question my powers, but reality doesn't allow us to take chances. If I don't intervene, my predictions will come true.

121551029.content: Don't you want to know what I've "seen"? I can tell you anyway, because it's pretty simple...

121551030.content: I saw civilization up in flames, with no chance for reboots or rebuilding.

121551031.content: Everyone I know died, one by one, and I mean really died, with no right to enter the Cycle.

121551032.content: The scale's fully tipped over. And all resistance, Mods, CORG, all torn asunder...

121551033.content: ...Hard to imagine, right? If we're still here, how does it end up getting to that point?

121551034.content: The two of them are silent for a while. Gengchen reflects on the scenario Odin has just described. Her expression is serious, but in the end she simply shakes her head.

121551035.content: My concerns are justified. Leaving Xu Heng to its fate is extremely dangerous, and its collapse may be the first step towards your prediction coming true.

121551036.content: Odin, you always walk ahead of the rest of us, preparing for the hardships to come. But you can't keep sacrificing present-day people for the future. Aether Gazer's existence is proof of that...

121551037.content: Are we really going to keep arguing over each other's belief?

121551038.content: ...It's true, having one determined person really is enough.

121551039.content: At least tell me you believe you're not dying...

121551040.content: They both look upwards at the same time, to see red particle beams arc across the sky like shooting stars and explosions blossom up out of the cities.

121551042.content: It's CORG's particle cannons. The next stage in Turing's plan.

121551043.content: This isn't the time for arguing, Odin.

121551044.content: Sure it isn't. Give me the Cinders, then we go to the photon rail...

121551045.content: There won't be a third time.

121551046.content: Gengchen raises her voice, which she doesn't usually do. She looks at Odin, then eventually lets out a sigh.

121551047.content:
There won't be a third time...
That's my promise to Xu Heng, and a promise to myself.

121551048.content: Neither of them speaks for a long time. Odin looks at Gengchen, then nods her head as though she knew this was inevitable but still doesn't like it.

121551049.content: ...The good thing about having had this talk is that, when the time comes to take action, I'll no longer have any doubts.

121551050.content: Since neither of us can convince the other, then I have to use other ways to make you give up.

121551051.content: Odin takes a deep breath in, then brings her gaze back from the burning buildings in the distance. She slowly brings her spear up, and points it at Gengchen.

121561001.content: Regardless of how terrible the preceding battle was, the Luo River flows on as it ever has done.

121561002.content: Its waters are not attached to any of the scenery they rush by, winding around mountains and filling valleys, endlessly hurrying towards its distant destination.

121561003.content: ...Tell me again, how are you feeling now after last era's failure?

121561004.content: People have many options, but very few they can actually choose from.

121561005.content: You're just... Are you still feeling sorry for your old self?

121561006.content: I just keep telling myself to forget about the ones I can't choose.

121561007.content: For example? "If only we'd done more in the beginning", "If only we'd tried this", "If only we hadn't done that"...

121561008.content: I don't want to hear it anymore. A victor who's still hung up on the "what ifs." If you don't actually take any of the options, you'll just end up losing.

121561009.content: A victor should give me a good vision of the future.

121561011.content: I've told you that I only care about the result. With the Sephirah Core's protection, you haven't got a single scratch on you... No one cares about what we do, they only care about the result.

121561012.content: "There won't be a third time"... I hope you'll like the ending this time. Otherwise we'd have utterly lost indeed.

121561013.content: ...Has anybody else ever changed the visions your power has granted you?

121561014.content: What an odd question... How would I know?

121561015.content: For me, the important thing is that I fight back, however hard the obstacles may be... I fight until it becomes my scar, or I get the result I want.

121561016.content: Because I am the person who "sees" and chooses what to change. It has nothing to do with anyone else.

121561017.content: But you're seeing the whole world. And there are always places where you cannot or do not want to intervene.

121561018.content: Then that has nothing to do with me. Visions are visions, and I can still distinguish between illusions and reality.

121561019.content: If something outside of my control hasn't happened yet, then it's an illusion. I've never confused one for what has happened.

121561020.content: Those who are pushed forward by reality and those who push reality forward live in their own destinies, not in my visions...

121561021.content: So you have a reason to believe in other people's possibilities.

121561022.content: Odin doesn't have an answer for this and can't believe Gengchen has caught her in this trap. She shakes her head with a chuckle, but has no rebuttal.

121561023.content: And YOU don't have to do everything on your own...

121561024.content: Let's go to the Astral Engine together. We'll fix the mechanical problems first and then go find Turing.

121561025.content: No... You're hardly ever here, and there's something else that only you can do.

121561026.content:
...Tell me, then.
You won, and this is Xu Heng. I shall do as you say.

121561027.content: When we replace the core, the engine is going to temporarily stop working. I need you down on the ground, and to use your Divine Power to stabilize the ley lines.

121561029.content: Yes. It's something only a Prime Mod can do.

121561031.content: The rookie helped at the dinner last time. You still owe me a meal.

121561032.content: What do you want to eat?

121561033.content: This time... I want... something spicy.

121561034.content: It's not like you could enjoy flavors other than that anyways.

121561035.content: ...Okay, that just so happens to be what I'm good at cooking.

121561036.content: I should be going. I'll leave this to you.

121561037.content: A square object inside Gengchen's sleeve shoots towards Odin. Odin catches it, but it's just a sandalwood token engraved with the Quad's logo.

121561038.content: What are you giving me this Quad thing for?

121561039.content: It's my personal warrant. Show this to anyone, and they will treat you as they treat me. If things turn out the way you've seen them... I want you to look after the Quad for me.

121561040.content: Odin frowns, but doesn't protest. She nods in a seemingly casual manner.

121561042.content: The night wind caresses the riverbank as it blows away the lingering Divine Grace fluctuations from the prior battle. Odin lands on the bridge, and silently looks up at the dark blot in the sky.

121561043.content: The glow of the fires lights the horizon, and the sounds of the city are so distant they are muffled by the time they reach Odin's ears. She's on Chang'an Bridge, but she might as well be a world away.

121561045.content: Waves of pain shoot through her body. It takes Odin a while to recognize what it is. She hasn't been wounded in such a long time.

121561046.content: She wipes her mouth, then stares blankly at the back of her hand. The moonlight has blended in with the dark red stain on her skin, and then with the darkness of the night.

121561047.content: I've failed to stop you again. How many times has that been?

121561049.content: Stroking the heavy sandalwood token in her hand, Odin can no longer see Gengchen when she looks back up again.

121561050.content: We've all changed since the first era, but not as much as I thought...

121561051.content: Putting the token away, she summons her spear and heads towards the outskirts of town. The small black hole in front of her quickly expands, and she steps forward into its purplish light and re-seals it.

121561053.content: What is it? Has Ms. Odin moved?

121561055.content: Ver gawks at me, and at the same time we both look over to the direction of Chang'an Bridge.

121561056.content: Hardly anyone lives out there, and there aren't any important buildings. It isn't until Mimir manages to pick up the fluctuations of Odin's Divine Grace that we rush over there, and discover that the area has been torn apart by two different Divine Grace.

121561057.content: When the sensor no longer detects Odin's Divine Grace signature, the flames that seemed to have been caused by a cannon attack slowly begin to fade away.

121561058.content: Disappeared, does that mean... she's left?!

121561059.content: Should we go over to Chang'an Bridge to look for her?

121561060.content: But we don't know who she was fighting against. And the battle's clearly over now... By the time we get there, whoever was there will be long gone.

121561061.content: There aren't any Visbanes around here. Let me analyze the Bane Energy distribution first. If it doesn't turn up anything, we'll just go to the Quad to help them...

121561062.content: Hmm! Oddity of oddities! What are you two doing here?

121561063.content: We suddenly hear a voice we haven't heard for quite a few days. Ver and I spin round to see Mengzhang jogging over to us.

121561064.content: We're looking for Odin... All of the comms devices are down and we can't get hold of her or Gengchen. Can you?

121561065.content: I was just about to ask you about it... I'd just returned from Yuyi Isle when I realized I could no longer contact the chief. And then there were these Visbanes everywhere. I've been fighting them non-stop since.

121561066.content: What's the situation on Yuyi Isle?

121561067.content: The island's taken a bit of fire, but no Quake so far. Looks like pretty much the same story on the other three islands... The Visbanes seem to all be descending on Yu Jing.

121561068.content: Weren't you with Lingguang? Where is she now?

121561069.content: Lingguang received a message that the Quad was surrounded by Visbanes, so she went back to help. The Admin and I were just about to go there too...

121561070.content: Why would they attack the Quad? Don't tell me... That's not good. There's no time.

121561071.content: Mengzhang mumbles to himself, then sprints off in the direction of the Astral Engine. Ver and I glance at each other, then take off after him.

121561073.content: This is about the core of the Astral Engine. I'm not worried about the Quad even if it gets overrun. But if the Visbanes are really targeting the engine, we're in trouble.

121561074.content: The chief summoned me here to switch out the Sephirah Core for the Heterocore. But if the Visbanes damage the engine itself....

121561075.content: Mengzhang fishes a wooden box out of his sleeve and holds it tightly in his hands.

121561076.content: And we don't know if the chief has the Cinders yet... The Astral Engine is at least ten minutes from here. And I may run into more Visbanes along the way...

121561077.content: Up ahead of us, Mengzhang turns back to look at us with a severe look on his face.

121561078.content: Could I ask the two of you to come with me to the Astral Engine? Now that the comms are down, I need all the help I can get.

121561079.content: Huh? I thought we were on our way there now anyway?

121561080.content: Well... Heh. Now that you mention it, yeah. Thanks.

121561081.content: If, when we get to the Quad, the situation isn't particularly—

121561082.content: Mengzhang stops talking, and my senses also seem to freeze over.

121561083.content: Something very close to us has exploded. The crushing shock wave sends me flying, and all I can feel is that my vision is swirling like feathers in a storm.

121561084.content: The bone-piercing pain is quickly smothered by numbness, and the force of the impact knocks the air out of my chest. My ears are ringing, and all I can see is a white haze.

121561085.content: Darkness encircles me. As I seem to fall forever, I realize I can no longer feel my breathing.

122011002.content: The Quake, Yu Jing, three people running... A dark night, a street, an arc of dazzling light... All those images from before I lost touch with reality recede, yet somehow remain clear. More than clear.

122011003.content: Perhaps the loss of my other senses makes the thoughts and images in my brain more vivid.

122011004.content: I want to make those strange scenes stop, but it seems they aren't under my control.

122011005.content: I try to recall the images I've just seen, but find they are lost amongst my memories.

122011006.content: (No, this isn't right. I can't worry about this now. Just then—)

122011007.content: It's as if whatever is blocking my thoughts is washed away. My survival instinct forces me to breathe in deep in search of oxygen.

122011008.content: Looks like Admin has woken up. I'm going to check.

122011009.content: What? Wow, great time to leave!

122011010.content: A familiar face suddenly looms up in front of me. I try to push myself upright on still-numb hands, and just as I'm about to speak, Ver reaches out to help.

122011011.content: Awesome, you're awake! Can you walk?

122011012.content:
I'm kind of dizzy.
Ver... you're hurt?

122011013.content: Nothing serious. Here, lean on me.

122011014.content: Hey! How you doing, #{nickname}#? Now that you're awake—run!

122011015.content: The dizziness fades and the ringing in my ears recedes—just in time for me to hear both Mengzhang telling me to flee and a whole load of Visbanes roaring.

122011017.content: I look back but all I can see is a blood-red wave rushing toward us. Even from the other end of the street the Bane Energy is oppressive, suffocating.

122011018.content: And between those Visbanes and me there is nothing but Mengzhang. He's unleashing a storm of blows with his sword, forming a barrier... But the numbers are against him. He won't be able to hold alone for long.

122011019.content: I break out in a cold sweat. How long they have held out while I was unconscious? I quickly draw my gun.

122011021.content: Are you joking? Don't be stupid!

122011022.content: Mengzhang sees what I'm planning to do and seems even a little amused. He launches a volley of bolts from his sword before jumping on his Access Key and flying our way.

122011024.content: I turn on the terminal and realize there are hundreds of Bane Energy signals surrounding us, tightening like a noose.

122011025.content:
Ver and I share bitter memories of Visbane encirclements.
We both keep close behind him, fleeing the battle as we search for a way out.

122013001.content: It turns out Mengzhang's little trick is something like a smoke grenade. I don't know how it works, but it does. The fog engulfs the street and forces the Visbanes to halt their attack.

122013002.content: We're finally able to catch our breath in the alley. But the Visbanes are still there, roaming back and forth outside. There's no chance of getting out of here easily.

122013003.content: There are so many of them, even considering there's a Quake going on.

122013004.content: It seems they're gathering here with a purpose. Perhaps under the direction of a Cognizant Visbane? But what do they want on such a remote street...

122013005.content: There's only one thing they could be here for. I glance at Mengzhang, vaguely recalling the box he had pulled out before I passed out. The Heterocore.

122013006.content: We should've known... The Astral Engine is too well defended. But if you want to stop it, destroying the Heterocore would work just as fine.

122013007.content: But nobody knows I have it, so how come the Visbanes are coming after me? You're the only ones I've been with since arriving in Yu Jing.

122013008.content: Hey, don't go suspecting us again!

122013009.content: I know this isn't the best time to pick a fight. Just exercising appropriate caution. Don't overthink it.

122013010.content: But Ver, perhaps you could help relieve my concerns? Don't you want to explain what just happened?

122013012.content: Ver's expression suddenly becomes hard to read. I have no idea what that means, let alone Mengzhang's question.

122013014.content: Oh, of course. An ordinary person wouldn't be able to withstand that shockwave. One hit and it's lights out.

122013015.content: Basically, we came under artillery fire.

122013017.content: That CORG particle cannon. You've been helping Lingguang at the photon rail station, so you probably have seen it... What I don't get is why they only fired one round and it was at us...

122013018.content: You can raze a small mountain to the ground with that thing. If Ver hadn't been here to help block the impact, I don't think you'd have ever woken up.

122013019.content: I look at Ver. She glances away and I can tell she doesn't want to talk about it.

122013022.content: Ahem. We're grateful, yes, but why don't we try letting me finish my question?

122013023.content: I know how powerful the particle cannon is. I'm plenty tough, but a direct hit would send me flying right into the Luo River. Yet here stands Ver, without even a scratch.

122013024.content: It makes sense, though. Her Access Key is strong on defense.

122013025.content: Sure. A strong shield. That's what I thought. But there's something else... It was only for a moment, but it was as if Ver was a different person. I don't scare easy, but...

122013028.content: It was like a hidden ultimate skill. Something she'd come up with under all the stress, but didn't know how to trigger again.

122013030.content: What do you mean, a hidden ultimate skill? Admin was right behind me, what was I supposed to do? Step aside?

122013032.content: Mengzhang forces a smile before looking out from the alley. We follow his gaze. The smoke is clearing—it won't last much longer, I guess.

122013033.content: I'd rather you tell me it was indeed some secret skill of yours now, Ver.

122013034.content: The chief might be waiting for me at the Astral Engine already, and I don't want to have to explain why I'm late. If you two are hiding any tricks up your sleeves, now's the time...

122013035.content: Nope. So if you don't either... it's time to stop hiding and start fighting.

122013036.content: Can't imagine it'll be that easy.

122013037.content: Mengzhang takes a deep breath and leaps out into the street, sword whirling, a moment before the Visbanes have the alley completely blocked.

122012001.content: I don't know if Mengzhang is the type to abandon friends, but I do know he's rational. That's what I learned from our "bonding" and from what others have said of him. Even Odin agrees.

122012002.content: But rational doesn't mean cold. Lives are at stake and the battle still rages... I can understand why he can't decide.

122012003.content: But understanding him doesn't mean agreeing. We don't have time for hesitation right now.

122012004.content: We've been running for ages and seen nobody... I didn't realize Yu Jing was so big.

122012005.content: The public transport here is so good, we've done very little walking. So I guess we didn't...

122012007.content: The shield springs up to head height behind me, as solid as a castle wall. I spin, ignoring the crash as the shield blocks an attack, and start firing at the corners Ver's sword slashes can't reach.

122012008.content: Instinctively, we fight together as one. But that doesn't mean it's an easy battle. And if anything, it seems like things are much easier for Mengzhang, though he's just a few steps away from us.

122012009.content: Admin, is it just me or are there more Visbanes chasing after us? I thought they wanted the Heterocore on Mr. Mengzhang!

122012010.content: Hey! I heard that! Isn't it obvious? They're just going where there are more people!

122012011.content: Oh yeah, because you're so far away!

122012012.content: (Could it be that "mark" I carry? The suppressant should still be effective. Or maybe it doesn't work when the Visbanes are too close?)

122012013.content: We fight a running battle through the streets. As we fight, my mind starts racing. There are explanations that seem reasonable, but I find fatal flaws in each and that just makes me more worried.

122012014.content: Who cares why it's happening? At this point, the Visbanes' purpose is not even our priority. I check my ammo—almost out—and shout to Mengzhang.

122012015.content: Mengzhang! If you can't decide, listen to me—

122012016.content: Go and do what you've got to do. Follow my instructions. We're breaking out.

122012019.content: Mengzhang acts as quickly as he answered. With a swipe of his sword, he takes down several Visbanes in front of him, then leaps onto the blade and zooms off into the distance. It's all so quick even the next wave of Visbanes is left confused.

122012020.content: Guess he'd been waiting for that for quite a while, Admin.

122012021.content:
I figured as much.
Okay, it's you and me now, Ver. Just fight like we do in those trainings... Huh?

122012023.content: Just as I'm figuring out what to do next, that azure flash is back. Mengzhang flies past the Visbane encirclement to land beside us.

122012024.content: His apparently long-planned escape was only a feint. Mengzhang is back, with a playful glint in his eye.

122012026.content: Wouldn't call it a plan. Just some old tricks...

122012027.content: But if you know of anything other than Divine Grace that can harm Visbanes, I'd love to hear about it.

122012028.content: If it was that easy, we wouldn't be stuck here, would we...

122012029.content: Mengzhang sighs before raising an eyebrow and inclining his head, as if listening to something. Then, with a long sigh of relief and a smile, he stands beside us, ready to fight.

122012030.content: Time to turn the table. Finally, some help!

122012033.content: With Mengzhang's arrival, the Visbane attack seems to have weakened. I look in the direction Ver is pointing and my breath catches for a second. Then, a long sigh, just like Mengzhang's.

122012034.content: From the other end of the street come battle cries and bursts of flame. Blasts of Divine Grace flood back and forth and in the blink of an eye, the Visbane lines collapse.

122012035.content: Hey, I was wondering where all these Visbanes were coming from. Should have guessed it'd be you guys.

122012037.content: Dozens of Mods clad in Tian Lu Traders uniforms pass us as they mop up the last of the fleeing Visbanes. I recognize some of the faces, probably from the accounts office and warehouse.

122012038.content: The young lady in charge is the one I know best. She adjusts her glasses—a gesture that makes her seem older than she is—and waves her team onwards. Then she jumps down from her abacus and gives us a satisfied smile.

122012039.content: Mengzhang, I'll need to add this to your list of debts.

122012040.content: If you'd been any later, you'd never receive that black glaze pottery you've been expecting.

122012041.content:
Regardless, I'm keeping accounts.
What are you doing all the way out here, anyway? Poking Visbane nests?

122012042.content: Lost comms, then lost our way. I figure the Visbanes were after the Heterocore.

122012043.content: The Heterocore? You've got the engine's core? I see...

122012044.content: Anyway, enough idle chat. Let's patch you all up first. You must be exhausted, judging from the way you're all puffing and panting.

122012045.content: Luliang instructs a Mod to treat us while we tell her about how the Visbanes chased us here.

122012046.content: So you want to go to the Quad?

122012047.content:
I do.
#{nickname}# and Ver, you stick with the boss here.

122012048.content: Aren't you coming with us, Mr. Mengzhang?

122012049.content: I'm used to working alone. A sword in my hand, the world at my feet. And if things get too much, running away's easier alone.

122012050.content: Don't sound so smug—you haven't made it to the Quad yet. If you go alone you won't get near the gate, much less past it.

122012051.content: Mantou's disappeared and the Visbanes have the Quad under siege. They've come running, flying, even swimming...

122012052.content: The Quad walls are holding, but what you dealt with here looks like child's play compared to the situation there.

122012053.content: Mengzhang pales at hearing this. Is it the news of Gengchen's disappearance, or the siege of the Quad? Both, perhaps.

122012054.content: Then, he seems to remember something and looks to the skies. Sure enough, there are aircraft navigation lights fanning out.

122012055.content:
The evacuation plan carried out by the Quad? At the request of the transportation bureau?
But if the Quad is surrounded, who's directing these aircraft?

122012056.content: You're not the only one who couldn't get back in time. Someone will be deputizing for you, deputy.

122012057.content: Relax. Yu Jing is picking itself up. Plus, we got some useful resources out and the evacuation went well.

122012058.content: That's good. If someone's in control, I can continue with my delivery. At the minimum, I need to reboot the shield as soon as I can. Who knows when that Turing guy is going to reappear...

122012059.content: Yeah, there's been no sign of him yet. Where could he be hiding? Or has he escaped already?

122012060.content: If he's trying to get away now, what was the point of impersonating Khnum? Always best to assume the worst, I think.

122012061.content: Which means I have to go to the Quad. If Zhiming's not there then the only one who understands the Astral Engine, apart from me, is...

122012062.content: Mengzhang seems to remember something important. He looks to Ver and I, both now patched up by the medic, and then to the army of Mods Luliang brought. Finally, he furrows his brow.

122012063.content: Boss, where are Linyu and Yingzhao?

122021001.content: What do you mean, good news and bad news?

122021002.content: The streets around the comms station are clean and the evacuation point is up and running. Officials with all the Quad departments have established an emergency response center, which will be managing the evacuation and allocation of resources.

122021003.content: The bad news is that the particle cannon has done major damage, and a lot of the engineers are injured. It's going to be at least half an hour before we have comms back.

122021004.content: That's good good news and bad bad news, sure enough. Half an hour is too long. I'm not sure we can even afford half a minute.

122021005.content:
Until we have comms back we'll have to rely on you passing messages, our dear head butler.
What does the emergency response center want us to do?

122021006.content: Luliang looks at the aircraft, laden with evacuees, taking off from near the comms station, and lifts a hand to Yingzhao's shoulder. Yingzhao opens a holographic map, covered with annotations, and shows it to Luliang.

122021007.content: Move in this direction across this zone, and deal with all the space rifts.

122021008.content: Hehe. I do love the way the Quad works. To deal with this quake, we need to deal with its root cause, not just its effects. Maybe we'll also be able to flush out the Cognizant Visbane behind all this.

122021009.content: Given our lack of intel on Turing, we don't know what he's capable of. We need to be careful... Should we set off now?

122021010.content: No rush. The scouts we sent out should be back soon, I think...

122021012.content: Luliang stands on tiptoe and looks off into the distance, spotting an agile-looking figure sprinting toward them.

122021013.content: Ah, speak of the devil. So? Figured out what's going on?

122021014.content: We've almost finished checking the city center. Lots of space rifts in random locations, some even underground. We'd never have found them without the detectors Deputy Zhiming left us.

122021015.content: Good work! Our mission will be much easier now we have a lead.

122021016.content: You've planned this from the beginning, boss?

122021017.content: Sure. Can't leave the planning until we need a plan, can I? Seems like all of Yu Jing has been hit by this Quake. It's unprecedented. We need to cut the Visbanes off fast.

122021018.content: I thought you'd be rushing off to help the Quad first.

122021019.content: There's no need to worry about that right now. Even if Mantou isn't back yet, the Quad can hold out. You know the Quad Signal?

122021020.content: The flare to summon all Quad forces? Indeed, they haven't used it.

122021021.content: We need to trust each other. We're aware of the Visbane forces surrounding the Quad, and the Quad knows what we're facing out here. For now, we should carry out our own duties first.

122021022.content: Yingzhao, I want everyone who's not patrolling or standing to assemble here, now.

122021023.content: Boss, Director, sorry. There's one more weird thing.

122021025.content: A lot of Visbanes are moving toward Chang'an Bridge. Not many people live there, and we got those that do out in good time. So there shouldn't be anything there to attract Visbanes...

122021027.content: We were too far off. Couldn't count 'em. Couldn't catch 'em, either. I'd say fifty or sixty, more or less.

122021028.content: Fifty or sixty sounds like a lot to me. Too many to be stragglers. Boss?

122021029.content: Yeah, something must be happening over there. Visbanes love to be where the action is. They could be planning something.

122021030.content: And Chang'an Bridge is in our assigned area, so we can't just ignore it. It's on our way. We'll check it out.

122021031.content: Okay. I'll put a squad together.

122021032.content: The agile scout leaves to gather more intel, while Yingzhao soon returns to Luliang with a squad in tow, all in their Tian Lu Traders uniforms. But for some reason, Luliang seems puzzled.

122021033.content: Yingzhao... have you got the math right?

122021034.content: I brought everyone we could spare, just as you said. Do we need more?

122021035.content: No, quite the opposite. There are too many here... Twenty at least. Have we left enough for patrols and guard duty?

122021036.content: Boss... You are the one who spends all day with the ledgers. Are you going to tell me you've forgotten how many Mods there are in Xu Heng?

122021037.content: We picked up a number of them on the way. The emergency response center has got them guarding key areas. There's no shortage.

122021038.content: Luliang, surprised, looks at Yingzhao's squad again. They're armed and ready to go. She watches as a second wave of aircraft leaves and gives a long sigh.

122021039.content: Is that so? Well, you found a lot more people than I expected. That means I can start to plan a little further ahead...

122022002.content: Luliang collapses onto a roadside bench, her abacus rattling as her hand shakes. But, looking at the firmly closed fissure, she finds the energy for a smile.

122022003.content: "Keep hitting the point where the Bane Energy is strongest."—That's the approach you shared with everyone.

122022004.content: It definitely sounds more like manual labor, not a tech issue. You'd know it even if you'd never tried yourself.

122022005.content: Yeah yeah, but I got the job done. And it's still easier than fighting.

122022006.content: I wonder how much progress the other teams are making. I'm the boss, I can't fall behind.

122022007.content: Is that what you're thinking? Boss, maybe you...

122022009.content:
Forget it. You told me to only worry about fighting.
You're the boss, so we don't have to talk about it if you don't want to.

122022010.content: Why do I feel like I'm told what to do by my own employee... It's not like I can do everything, you know... Haha.

122022011.content: I know. Maybe you could just take a break and catch up with us later.

122022012.content: We're almost at Chang'an Bridge, and I'm going to regroup and find those Visbanes now. The scout saw fifty or sixty, but there could be more. It could be dangerous.

122022013.content: Oh, so now you want to leave me behind after I've come all this way? That's not very friendly.

122022014.content: Just a suggestion. You're the boss.

122022015.content: Then stop telling me to put my feet up. If I stop, I'll start overthinking things, and make mistakes... Let's just keep moving.

122022016.content: As Luliang stands up from the bench, she notices Yingzhao is gazing at the direction they came from. Someone, too far off to identify, is approaching. The figure starts to shout.

122022018.content: It's the same scout from earlier, but without that confident, agile look anymore. He looks panicked and is gasping for breath.

122022019.content: What's so urgent? Have you found Turing?

122022020.content: No... HQ's shield has been shut down. The Visbanes are storming the compound.

122022021.content: Yingzhao, face grim, immediately looks to Luliang. Luliang nods, and she sprints toward the city center at her top speed. Seconds later, Yingzhao disappears in the darkness.

122022022.content: She's worried about Linyu. Nothing else would make her react like that. I hope she's worrying for nothing...

122022023.content: And the same hope for myself, too... Don't even think about it, Luliang. Don't think about it...

122022024.content: Luliang gazes into the darkness for a moment, and then turns to the scout, now serious.

122022025.content: Are you sure the shield was shut down? Not collapsed during an attack?

122022026.content: The scout pauses a moment to think back, then nods.

122022027.content: Yes. It was like the Astral Engine shield. It just disappeared. No sign of any problems, just... gone. I know it's five kilometers away, but you can't miss the shield. I know what I saw.

122022028.content: That's strange. Our shield is much smaller than the one at engine and uses much less Divine Grace. The two Access Key fragments we have can easily keep it running. There's no reason to turn it off now...

122022029.content: Maybe Linyu had to shrink the shield because the Visbane attacks were consuming too much energy? No, that can't be right... The Visbanes in the city center are all at the Quad. We haven't got anything the Visbanes want, do we?

122022030.content: Or maybe... Someone did turn it off, but not Linyu. An... an infiltrator. An Encroacher Type?

122022031.content: Luliang's face grows ever grimmer as she runs through the different possibilities.

122022032.content: (Gremory was first. Turing second. And bad luck comes in threes... Oh come on, Luliang, you're just scaring yourself.)

122022034.content: The scout frowns and interrupts Luliang's thoughts with an urgent whisper, then nimbly clambers up a wall to reach the roof, twenty meters or more above the ground. He looks off toward the outskirts of Yu Jing.

122022037.content: Boss, I can see those Visbanes! Two or three hundred of them. They've got someone cornered, but they're still fighting!

122022038.content: Shoot. Probably some stray Mods. Yingzhao, form... Oh... I guess I have to do it myself!

122022039.content: Form up! Everyone, form up! We've got friends to rescue!

122031001.content: Get... Get everyone into the bunker, quick.

122031002.content: Linyu, what's wrong? The aircraft are waiting. Shouldn't we get everyone to Shuofang Isle, away from the Quake?

122031003.content: We can't get out. Not now, at least.

122031004.content: The Tian Lu Traders hall is dimmer than usual, as the decorative lights have been turned off to avoid attracting Visbanes.

122031005.content: Linyu, her face white, runs from the control room to join the technician. She shakes her head, but before she can explain, the building is rocked by a huge thud.

122031008.content: You heard it. That was no Quake... The cameras caught dozens of Visbanes heading this way from the Quad, with two giving off very strong Bane Energy signals. We're surrounded.

122031009.content: If the shield is under constant attack, the Divine Grace provided by two Access Key fragments won't be enough.

122031010.content: Visbanes... But why now? The boss and the others are miles away...

122031011.content:
Why do we have to go back to the bunker? Is the shield failing?
There's no way out if the Visbanes reach us...

122031013.content: The aircraft does't have the necessary protection to take off now. A lot of Visbanes have ranged attacks... We can't put those lives in danger.

122031014.content: The two Access Key fragments can't provide enough Divine Grace to keep the shield up. If this continues, the Visbanes will get in, sooner or later.

122031015.content: You and the other Mods, get everyone into the bunker. I'll shrink the shield down to the bunker only. That'll cut power use by 80%. Even if the Visbanes find it, the shield should be able to hold out for a long time.

122031016.content: Shrink the shield? Can the generator do that? I don't know if it's going to be as easy as you make it sound.

122031017.content: Of course it is. Leave the shield to me. It's all part of the Astral Engine tech. Zhiming taught me all about it.

122031019.content: But wait! Linyu... When we're all in the bunker, you'll still have to stay in the control room to manage the shield. What if...

122031020.content: Don't worry. I can look after myself. That's why Luliang left us here at Tian Lu Traders. She knew we could protect everyone.

122031021.content: I might not know why the Visbanes are attacking us here. But they are, and we can't let them win.

122031022.content: You're a heck of a lot tougher than I am. Are you sure you'll be okay alone, though? I know Director Yingzhao wouldn't like it...

122031023.content: Well, just wait until she sees what I can... what WE can do.

122031024.content: Anyway, shrinking the shield is going to be noisy. If Yingzhao and the others are paying attention to what's going on, they'll know about it soon enough. Even if they're on the other side of the city.

122031025.content:
All we need to do is hold out until reinforcements arrive. Then we're safe.
Trust in yourself, and in all of us.

122031026.content: The noise of the Visbane attacks on the shield echoes throughout the building, which makes getting everyone into a bunker a surprisingly easy job.

122031027.content: As soon as she hears the bunker door clang shut, Linyu shuts down the shield. Then, as quick as she can, she starts it up again, only covering the two-story underground bunker.

122031028.content: Thirty... thirty-six seconds! Woah, if only I'd recorded it to show master Zhiming. I never managed to do it that fast in the sims...

122031029.content: Now, why is it so quiet outside?

122031030.content: Linyu realizes she got carried away with her success and didn't notice that everything has gone worryingly silent. She tiptoes to the window and cautiously peers out.

122031033.content: Just as she looks down at the two Polymerized Types, they look back at her. She jumps back in fright, but it's too late.

122031034.content: With the shield gone, the walls can't withstand even an ordinary Visbane attack. The sound of falling masonry is deafening and, as the floor shakes beneath her, Linyu realizes the Visbanes are already in the building.

122031035.content: (Now what? I'm confident the shield can hold out, but... but what if...)

122031036.content: Linyu clenches her fists as she imagines the Visbanes breaking into the bunker. She jumps down, using her Divine Power to activate the golden mechanical ball she always carries while reaching for her bag.

122031037.content: When her fingers reach that pile of familiar little objects within, her hands stop shaking and she feels calmer.

122031038.content: Don't panic. You have work to do, Linyu. You can't put anyone at risk.

122031039.content: Bane Energy Suppressor, Forcefield Generator, Divine Grace Bombs... The building's life force blocker is running, but the Visbanes are still coming. Isn't it working? Oh, never mind...

122031040.content: There's no time to worry about it now. Linyu can hear Visbane howls echoing through the corridors as she moves down through the building, setting a few crude traps on each floor.

122031041.content: She bursts out from the first-floor stairway to find ten or more pairs of blood-red eyes waiting for her. She summons up enough courage to yell at them before turning back up the stairs.

122031042.content: Come on then! Come and get me!

122031044.content: The Visbanes give chase, but Linyu is luring them toward her traps. Blasts of light and noise shake the building as trap after trap is triggered. Linyu gradually pulls away from the Visbanes until, finally, she feels safe enough to stop and take a breath.

122031045.content: But her work is not yet done. She can still hear Visbanes roaring, now angrier than ever. She checks her bag—already empty—and runs toward her room, a forced self-comforting smile on her face.

122031046.content: (I wonder if sister and the others noticed the shield shutting down?)

122031047.content: Lucky I kept some reserves in my room.

122031048.content: The larger bag she prepared when the Quake struck is still on her bed, full of all kinds of tricks and toys. Rearming gives Linyu a boost of confidence. She turns to leave, ready to set more traps...

122031050.content: But her plans change when she hears the door of the adjacent room being kicked in. She pulls something resembling a firecracker from her bag and crouches by the window, ready to give whatever comes through the door a nasty surprise before escaping.

122031051.content: Prototype Bane Dissolver Bomb... Looks like I get to do a field test for you, Zhiming.

122031052.content: Something slams into the door, leaving a dent. Her hand holding the bomb trembles, but Linyu grits her teeth, forcing herself not to cry out.

122031053.content: The door opens. Instantly, Linyu throws the bomb.

122031054.content: Took you long enough! Take this!

122031057.content: The bomb bursts in midair, directing its blast at the door. A wave of crystalline dust, glimmering with Divine Grace, flies outward, covering... Yingzhao?

122031058.content: You think Visbanes know how to open doors?

122031059.content: A Cognizant would! And I was nervous...

122031061.content: Yingzhao lifts a hand to pinch Linyu's cheek. Linyu tries to return the gesture, but she can't reach her sister's face.

122031062.content: Yingzhao lets Linyu recount her adventures and then, after a moment's thought, pats her on the head.

122031063.content: I promise I wasn't pushing myself this time.

122031064.content: Before you left, you said I knew the defense systems better than anyone, so I was the best person to stay and protect everyone. And I couldn't just hide. I wanted to help...

122031067.content: Don't "huh" me. Why are you assuming I'm going to scold you, when all you've done is complete the mission?

122031068.content: I-I didn't think that. Hehe. I knew you wouldn't be angry, Yingzhao!

122031069.content: Linyu embraces Yingzhao, her still-trembling body finally starting to relax. Yingzhao strokes her little sister's hair and gazes out the window. A murderous glint appears in her eyes.

122031070.content: Where are those two Visbanes you mentioned?

122031071.content: Still somewhere in the compound, I guess. I left the Bane Energy detector in the control room, so I don't know exactly where... Did you see them on your way in?

122031072.content: I didn't come through the compound. I jumped over the back wall.

122031073.content: Oh... So could we get out the same way?

122031074.content: Let's deal with those two first. We need to stop the Visbane attacks so we can get everyone out of the Quake zone.

122031075.content: You wait here. I'll go Visbane hunting.

122031077.content: Yingzhao looks at Linyu—she's anxious and hopeful—and sighs before turning to leave.

122031078.content: Yingzhao! This is a crisis. Shouldn't we throw everything we've got at it? I can help.

122031081.content: Yingzhao stops and turns to look at Linyu, now about ten meters behind her.

122031082.content: When the fighting starts, you stay this far away from me and the Visbanes. That'll keep you safe but close enough for me to help you.

122031083.content: After all, your fighting style isn't exactly up close and personal, is it?

122032001.content:
Despite never fighting together as Mods before...
Despite wildly different levels of experience and styles of fighting...

122032002.content: Despite all that, the two fight together as one from the first blow, working in perfect harmony. As Yingzhao is about to deal the final blow, she sees Linyu appear by her side.

122032003.content: Now I know why they say you're smart.

122032004.content: Hehe. Couldn't do it with anyone else. So what now?

122032005.content: Keep them down. We'll finish them together.

122032006.content: And stay frosty! It's not over yet.

122032007.content: Perhaps because Mods were created to fight Visbanes, they retain their combat instincts even after long periods without fighting.

122032008.content: Linyu, now more practiced, doesn't hesitate. She tosses several of her Divine Power devices all at once in the air, which create a forcefield and a Divine Grace storm to trap the Visbanes inside in a second.

122032011.content: The Access Key smashes into the Visbanes with the power of thousands of gusts of wind. Every ounce of Yingzhao's energy pours out into a tornado, ripping apart her defeated foes.

122032012.content: Even when they're beaten, you hit them with all you've got. Got that?

122032014.content: Linyu scratches her head as she looks at the crater Yingzhao's attacks left. The courtyard they are in was already battered by the Visbane assault. This latest battle has left it even more scarred.

122032015.content: Will we get in trouble for causing all this damage?

122032017.content: Under the circumstances, I think the boss will understand. Anyway, after all that mess you made inside...

122032019.content: A cry from the other side of the wall stops Yingzhao's words and she and Linyu go to see what's going on.

122032021.content: Just in time to stop you completely demolishing the place. This is expensive real estate! Where do you think this is, Mount Jingdu?

122032022.content: I know, I know. Anyway, we're done. The Visbanes are all dead.

122032023.content: How come it's just you two? Where's everyone else? And Linyu, did you turn the shield off?

122032024.content: Linyu is about to explain when she notices several people she didn't expect to see coming from behind Luliang.

122032025.content: Mengzhang? And the Aether Gazer visitors... This can't be a coincidence.

122041001.content: Hehe. It was all quite the coincidence.

122041002.content: That scout guy was magic. His intel meant Yingzhao came back here to rescue Linyu and Luliang came to rescue us three.

122041003.content: I'm not surprised to hear that. Tian Lu Traders has smart and competent people in every post. I can count on them with all my trust.

122041004.content: Weren't you just complaining about some minor property damage...

122041005.content: The one who pays gets to complain. Hehe.

122041006.content: And don't forget to tell the staff to stay on Shuofang Isle until we get things patched up.

122041007.content: After swapping intel updates with the others, Luliang waves toward the aircraft preparing for take-off nearby. Linyu, who was helping the technical department organize the evacuations, comes back to join the others.

122041008.content: So, #{nickname}#, Verthandi. Still planning to go to the Quad with Mengzhang?

122041009.content: You both need to think about it carefully. If Turing is coming for the Astral Engine, the Quad is in for a tough time.

122041010.content: If everyone is focused on the Quad and the engine, that's exactly where Ver and I should be.

122041011.content: Even putting aside our duty to deal with the Visbanes, the Astral Engine is our best chance of finding Odin. She'll be there, unless she's with some real emergency...

122041012.content: Yeah. Admin and I need to find Odin in the first instance.

122041013.content: Very well. The evacuation here is complete, so there's no need to stand guard anyway.

122041014.content: Yingzhao, go with them. There'll be lots of Visbanes there. You'll be of great help.

122041016.content: No. There are a million other things to be done in Yu Jing. I need to report in at the emergency response center, at least.

122041017.content: Anyway, you know I'm not great at all the fighty-fighty stuff. I wouldn't be much help. But... Mengzhang, are you really going to make me ask?

122041018.content: You've said this much. I thought you'd just keep going...

122041019.content: An uncomfortable smile twitches at the corners of Mengzhang's lips. He shifts his gaze from Luliang to Yingzhao, then to Linyu, who has been quietly listening.

122041021.content: Yeah... But first, Yingzhao, don't get mad at me. I need to ask you sisters a question.

122041022.content: Why did the Visbanes suddenly start attacking Tian Lu Traders?

122041023.content: It... it is strange. They broke in but they didn't seem to be looking for anything specific. As soon as they saw me, they started chasing me.

122041024.content: Linyu knows more about what happened than I do. If she doesn't know, I certainly don't.

122041025.content: Mengzhang is disappointed neither can answer his question. Disappointed, yet thoughtful.

122041026.content: Unfortunate. If Luliang had some secret treasure hidden away and Turing was just sending the Visbanes to steal it... that would be less concerning.

122041027.content: I've already asked the Administrator about this. #{nickname}#, your thoughts?

122041028.content: Turing's trying to buy time. The Visbanes attacked Linyu for a reason. Maybe they were attracted to the shield?

122041029.content: Distracting us by attacking here? Dividing our forces? It might give him time to work on whatever scheme he's cooking up.

122041030.content: But I'm more inclined to assume the worst. If you're pessimistic enough, reality won't hold any nasty surprises.

122041032.content: You think they moved toward signs of activity? Simple, but logical. Maybe it's all less complicated than we think.

122041033.content: But I'm more inclined to assume the worst. If you're pessimistic enough, reality won't hold any nasty surprises.

122041034.content: Remember, this Quake was different. The Quake itself was big, but there were fewer Visbanes roaming the streets. They formed up, like an army. Targeted. Disciplined.

122041035.content:
Okay, maybe not disciplined.
But they were following orders.

122041036.content: If Turing wants to stop us replacing the core of the engine, and ensure the Sephirah Core doesn't return to the Hall of the Heart... Then I was his target, and that particle cannon's, too. And Linyu, you're also in danger.

122041037.content: After all, you're the only person in Xu Heng able to complete the replacement.

122041038.content: If that's the case, why do you want to take Linyu to the Quad? Isn't that the most dangerous place for her?

122041039.content: Quite the opposite. If you're outside looking at it, it's besieged by Visbanes. It looks bad, I agree. But ask yourself why the Quad hasn't fallen.

122041040.content: That's the only way to keep the Quad busy, and pin its Mods in place.

122041041.content: In fact, it's the Visbanes outside that are putting themselves at risk, in order to keep the elite forces inside from acting...

122041042.content: Mengzhang is serious, attempting to convince us of his theory. Once we're all in agreement, he continues.

122041043.content: So, relax. Once comms are restored and the chief is back, the Quad will be the safest place to be.

122041044.content: It's okay, sister. And I do want to go. I can help Mengzhang replace the core. It's a complex procedure, so it'll be much quicker with an extra pair of hands.

122041045.content: Couldn't have said it better myself. Good thinking, Linyu.

122041046.content: Was this your intention all along, Mengzhang?

122041047.content: Why not? It's a win-win. You all know the Sephirah Core will be exposed during the replacement.

122041048.content: The chief has sealed it, but if it's in the open for too long, we can't guarantee something won't go wrong. The chief's powers, Surface Layer stability, Turing's plans... There's no shortage of potential issues.

122041049.content: So I need Linyu's help. The faster we work, the better. But she'll be working remotely, from the Engine Monitoring Room.

122041052.content: Linyu is shocked. Even Mengzhang is shocked. Ver and I look at each other, as surprised as they are. This is not how we expected the situation would play out.

122041053.content: You've been working out how to persuade me, haven't you?

122041054.content: Well... Everyone knows how protective you are of Linyu. Naturally, I analyzed the situation and considered the best way to approach it.

122041056.content: I know Linyu is no longer a kid. If she's the only one who can help, then it's her duty to do so. Her duty as a Mod and her duty as a technician.

122041057.content: So, Linyu, this is what you spent so much time training for with Zhiming. Know what to do?

122041058.content: Sure do. I won't let you down.

122041059.content: Then it's decided. My duty, meanwhile, is to protect you. No more, no less.

122041060.content: I don't know what's exactly happened between Yingzhao and Linyu, but I can tell that their relationship has somehow changed a bit. It's subtle, but it feels just right.

122041061.content: With the team decided, we're ready to set off for the Quad. But before we go, Mengzhang asks us to wait a moment and quickly casts a glance at me. Luliang seems to get this hint, and the two walk together into a nearby warehouse.

122041062.content: They're back soon, with Luliang grinning as if she's won the lottery. Mengzhang is holding a small box, gazing at it in admiration as he strokes its shiny surfaces.

122041064.content: Yeah, lethal weapons do make an impression.

122041065.content: #{nickname}#, look! Your favorite object in the whole world!

122041066.content: I check my ammo, take the box reluctantly, and open it with a flip just the way I did so many times before. Still having no idea how it works, I take the weapon out and hold it in my hand.

122041067.content: On seeing it, Linyu's eyes light up. She looks it over, evaluating this strange new object.

122041068.content: The Delusion Buster. You remember it pretty well, I'm sure. When we came back from Mount Jingdu I asked Luliang to have someone improve it. One shot will take out half a dozen now, easily.

122041069.content: Are you sure? Because last time, Admin shot you three times and you didn't even get scratched.

122041070.content: Ha. Weapons designed to kill Visbanes rely on Divine Grace. They won't work on us Mods. And anyway, those three shots left me half-dead...

122041071.content: I can't make sense of it... Mengzhang, how does it work? And why is it called Delusion Buster?

122041072.content: It uses some... unconventional tech. I'd tell you more about it, but Zhiming would complain I'm leading you astray. As for the name...

122041073.content: I started working on it after learning of the existence of Cognizant Visbanes. It shatters illusions and destroys delusions. In spiritual terms, it packs more of a punch than even Divine Grace. You can imagine its value against the Cognizants.

122041074.content: #{nickname}#, I'm giving it to you. You must accept it, if only as compensation for what happened at Mount Jingdu.

122041075.content: Thanks. I'm almost out of ammo, so a new weapon is just what I need right now.

122041076.content: I'm sure it's powerful enough... Just don't get in the way again, Mengzhang.

122042002.content: Fighting the tide of Visbanes is a bad idea. They are attacking from all angles, surrounding us. We're like a tiny boat, battered by a storm.

122042003.content: So Ver's words are, without doubt, an encouragement. We look forward through a gap in the waves of Visbanes. The wall that surrounds the Quad can be seen from a distance.

122042004.content: This last bit is going to be tough.

122042005.content: We can still retreat if we need to.

122042006.content: And waste all the work it took us to get here? Linyu, what have you got left in your bag of tricks?

122042007.content: Not much. I'm going to use them at some critical point.

122042008.content:
Then let's make our next move a critical one!
Admin, can you keep up?

122042009.content: I'm good. I mean, I don't want to damage morale or anything, but we're not moving very quickly.

122042010.content: At least things look quiet at our destination. A barrier of Divine Power protects the base of the wall around the Quad. It's solid as rock, and the Visbanes shatter against it like waves.

122042011.content: As Mengzhang expected, the elite forces of the Quad have stood firm against the Visbane horde. The Quad seems undamaged, from the main gate all the way back to the hills at its rear.

122042012.content: I've got a flare. Should we let the Quad know we're here?

122042013.content: Now? Aren't we too far away?

122042014.content: Ver's right. We can't call for help until comms are up. Someone might see the flare and send a rescue squad. But if they get separated under Visbane attack they'll never find each other again. It's not worth the risk.

122042015.content: Hold formation and save energy. We'll reconsider when we're closer.

122042016.content: I wonder how Luliang is getting on. The comms station should be fixed soon, right?

122042017.content: That will be a lifesaver. We can get in touch with Lingguang and set up a pincer movement... Huh?

122042018.content: WARNING! WARNING! Massive amount of Bane Energy detected in the air! WARNING! WARNING!

122042019.content: WARNING! WARNING! Bane Energy disturbance has exceeded acceptable threshold—

122042021.content: Mengzhang's expression changes in an instant. He and Yingzhao quickly guide us backward before Mimir's warning is even finished.

122042022.content: And where we were standing just a moment ago, something light red in color smashes into the ground like a falling star. Bane Energy manipulates the shattered pieces back into a whole and... it stands up.

122042024.content: That... That's a heck of a way to make an entrance.

122042025.content: When a raindrop splashes onto the ground, you'd somehow know a downpour is on the way.

122042026.content: A rain of Visbanes falls from the sky, and in seconds they're suffocatingly swarming into the whole place—but that's not the worst of it.

122042028.content: Mimir's warning is still sounding and we can hear increasingly intense fighting over our heads.

122042029.content: We all look up and are left speechless by what we see. Even the battle with the Visbanes is forgotten for a moment.

122042030.content: It's the biggest space rift I've ever seen, hanging in the sky. A vast tunnel leading to another spacetime... I'm not even sure the word "rift" is a proper name for that.

122042031.content: It's descending slowly toward the Astral Engine. It's so big it could swallow the engine whole.

122042032.content: Hey, hold on... This is going a bit far, no?

122042033.content: Now we know where all those Visbanes have been coming from—

122042034.content: An endless stream of Visbanes, some flying, some falling, pour from the rift. A blood-red downpour of Bane Energy monsters, so thick it blocks out the light.

122042035.content: And they're heading for the Astral Engine, temporarily without its shield, and the Quad, which—so far—has withstood Visbane attack.

122042036.content: Don't tell me you did this as well, Turing.

122051001.content: Now this is what you call a pincer movement.

122051002.content: It's not my fault they stole my plan!

122051003.content: But it is a pincer movement. And the Quad is trapped in the middle.

122051004.content: As the new waves of Visbanes land on the circular structure surrounding the Astral Engine and within the walls of the Quad, the Visbane forces outside the walls advance several meters.

122051005.content: There's fighting inside the Quad now. That's the last thing a defender wants—enemies inside the gates. Their defensive lines won't be able to hold for long.

122051006.content: No need to worry about the Quad. They can look after themselves. It's the Astral Engine that's the problem.

122051007.content: Attacking the engine with Visbanes while the shield is down... Turing has no end of tricks. How long has he been planning this? A century?

122051008.content: Is there anything at the engine that could be used to defend it?

122051009.content: What, you think we installed artillery in the generator room or something?

122051010.content: Wait. There is something. Mengzhang, that other mode...

122051011.content: THAT mode? I don't think it'd work with the engine in its current state.

122051012.content: The Divine Grace supply hasn't been restored yet, and the mode itself hasn't been activated for years. It'd need to be done manually and Zhu's the only one who knows the system well enough... Forget it.

122051013.content: I don't know what Mengzhang and Linyu are talking about, but it's clear it's nothing that can help us now.

122051014.content: And we all know that if the Astral Engine is damaged, there's nothing could be done to prevent another Cloudsong Crisis.

122051015.content: Thankfully, the fight continues above us. The Quad will not sit back and let the Visbanes destroy the engine and they've sent forces to defend it. But that has made the situation at the Quad even more grave.

122051016.content: We need to get the engine's shield up, using reserve power if we have to. We can't let any more Visbanes get near it...

122051017.content: Mengzhang's eyes flash as he mutters to himself. Then he leaps onto his Access Key—obviously intending to go to the Astral Engine and turn the shield on solo.

122051018.content: But someone grabs him before he can take off.

122051020.content: You'll never make it in time. Think before you act.

122051021.content: The rift is descending. Go to the engine now and all that'll happen is you get swallowed into the Source Layer with it. Unless you've got a plan for closing the rift too?

122051022.content: No. But I've got to try. Forgive me for being blunt, but right now the Astral Engine is worth more than our lives.

122051024.content: You're the one who made us believe the Quad wouldn't fall, but what's on your mind really? Or do you believe now's the time for you to sacrifice like a hero?

122051025.content: I believe that I'm the only one with a chance of saving the engine. Unless you have a better idea? With a rift that size, only the chief—

122051027.content: Mengzhang's tirade grinds to a halt and he stares upwards in disbelief—

122051028.content: From the hills behind the Quad, a beam of light of black and white, formed of endless Divine Power, shoots toward the rift. A dragon's roar echoes over the city and then, for a moment, everything falls silent.

122051029.content: From the top of that pillar a figure, as small as a grain of sand at this distance, leaps into the rift. My ordinary human eyes can barely make it out.

122051030.content: But within mere seconds of the figure disappearing into the rift, the Bane Energy forming its structure collapses. The rift stops descending, the Visbanes stop emerging. And as the rift recedes, peace returns to the sky.

122051031.content: What was that you were saying about the chief, Mengzhang?

122051032.content: I was just about to say that the chief will deal with it as soon as she sees it.

122051033.content: None of us really mind Mengzhang's constant flip-flopping in this moment. Though Gengchen's appearance hasn't made our situation any less perilous, it's a morale boost more valuable than a regiment of reinforcements.

122051034.content: We can even hear the cheers for Gengchen coming from inside the Quad—Surprised cheers. They didn't expect Gengchen to turn up, either.

122051035.content: Stop staring. Trust in your chief. And if we're going to charge, now's the time!

122052002.content: The ground underfoot trembles as the Astral Engine field shrinks. The miniature black holes around Odin turn the levitating Cloudsong Ore into dust. She walks in the ruins of the Old Town, her usual cool restored...

122052004.content: She raises a hand slightly. Behind her, a rank of Divine Power swords form. And, as she drops her hand, they fall.

122052005.content: Dozens of Visbanes emerging from the ruins are destroyed by the deadly accurate swords. Nothing is left of them but puffs of dark smoke.

122052006.content: Do you really not regret it?

122052007.content: Odin looks to the skies. She can just make out Yu Jing and above it, the Astral Engine. Beyond that, the flame-lit red of the sky and a vast space rift, like a great wound torn in the heavens.

122052008.content: But Odin gives all this a mere glance before lowering her head and moving on. Until, as if she's found some particular landmark, she stamps twice on the gravel-covered ground and then, with a twist of her hand, drives the Gungnir into the ground.

122052009.content: Is this how you stabilize a ley line?

122052010.content: Divine Power flows through the spear into the ground. A strange force hidden deep underground reaches out to Odin and disperses her perception far and wide, so quickly it almost ignores the limits of her own power.

122052011.content: In the span of a single breath, Odin's Divine Power flows through the invisible veins underneath and blooms across the entire Sephirah Zone.

122052012.content: And in that single breath, she senses her reserves of Divine Grace reaching their end. Her Divine Grace signal starts to flicker like a candle on the verge of guttering out.

122052013.content: I see it was true. Only a Prime could do this. Anyone else would be dead by now.

122052014.content: How did she come up with this? It's like literally putting a chain on herself and binding herself to this place...

122052015.content: Whatever you want to do, Gengchen, do it quick...

122052016.content: A flood of information enters Odin's mind and she senses Xu Heng running reliably under still-stable laws. But she also senses the Cloudsong Ore deep underground, on the brink of chaos.

122052017.content: The rest is up to you.

122052018.content: Across the land, Divine Power seems to fall silent. Something deep in Xu Heng's structure has locked in place. A peg has found its hole.

122052019.content: It's a subtle and delicate balance as if she has guided the Sephirah Zone itself toward a new and eternal state. And the price she has paid? Consuming her Divine Power at a terrifying rate.

122052020.content: Odin still stands, but her breaths come a little quicker now. Looking up, she sees the light beam and the rift disappear. Her brow furrows.

122052022.content: I don't know if I'll have a chance to see you today... But there's a question I'd like to ask you, as a fellow seeker of the Source—

122052023.content: I thought only Primes were absent from my visions. So why you are not in them, either?

122061001.content: The importance of morale during combat is easy to explain, if you think about it.

122061002.content: It's a kind of belief—Believing that giving all you've got will result in victory, that you are fighting to make the future a better place, and that your comrades-in-arms share those goals with you as well.

122061003.content: And that morale boost drives us onwards, until we're less than a hundred meters from the Quad walls. At last, we can see familiar faces in the Quad's defensive lines. And they can see us.

122061006.content: Guerrilla Team! Go assist the deputy! Now!

122061009.content: Linyu sends her signal flare arcing toward the Quad. The Quad responds by firing its own flare in our direction. The two trails of light cross in the sky, marking our rendezvous point.

122061010.content: I'll take the lead. Stay close!

122061011.content: Ver's shield shines with lightning bolts as she follows the signal flare's path forward. We are right behind her and together we pierce through the Visbane lines. We reach the Quad Mods who have come out to assist and make it back inside the walls.

122061013.content: Everyone, rest while we still have time.

122061014.content: Mengzhang, should I go to the Engine Monitoring Room now?

122061015.content: Yes. The sooner you get ready, the better. We have no time to waste. The shield control system, the hub defense system, the core container safeguards... Ah, I don't need to tell you. I've heard what Zhiming says about you. You know it all.

122061016.content: Yeah, I'm all over it. Rest easy.

122061018.content: Things are manageable. But things are a little tricky over at the monitoring station. Deputy Lingguang is leading the defense there. Be careful, Linyu.

122061019.content: Don't worry. I'm going with her. Take care, everyone.

122061020.content: Mengzhang, I'll leave the engine up to you, then.

122061021.content: Wait. I have something for you. Don't look at it until you're in place.

122061022.content: Mengzhang looks shifty as he slips Linyu a piece of paper. It's clear he doesn't want to be asked what it says.

122061023.content: He watches Yingzhao and Linyu head toward the Engine Monitoring Room, and lets out a sigh of relief. He glances toward the hills at the rear of the Quad.

122061024.content: What was the chief doing up there?

122061025.content: I've no idea. We lost contact with her when the comms were cut. Then the Quake happened, and we've been busy setting up our defense. We don't know when the chief will be back either.

122061026.content: I see... I guess she went to get the Cinders.

122061028.content: Nothing... Is the line to get up there still working?

122061029.content: Don't worry. Some of our most senior colleagues are on guard there.

122061030.content: Deputy Mengzhang, it's been a while since the chief entered that rift... Do you think she's alright?

122061031.content: That was Turing's plan all along—attack where we have no choice but to defend. But you know how tough the chief is. I'm sure she's all good.

122061032.content: Unfortunately deputy Zhiming isn't around, and we can't get in touch with deputy Jianbing either. If only everyone were here!

122061033.content:
There, there. Save your energy for the Visbanes.
Listen, you get on with your job here. I have to get to the Astral Engine now.

122061034.content:
Alright, alright.
Please come with me, the two of you.

122061035.content: Not so fast. Here, can I have a word with you?

122061037.content: Mengzhang has an uncharacteristically friendly smile on his face. It makes me shiver. But I can guess what he's about to say.

122061039.content: A useful little gadget it is. Calculation is power here in Gaea. One day I'll have to visit Ain Soph and see if they'll teach me how to make one for the Quad.

122061040.content: You heard what I told Linyu on our way over. The Sephirah Core will be exposed during the replacement process. You know better than I do how dangerous that is. The quicker it's done, the better.

122061041.content: It's a good thing I didn't bring Mimir here with me. You'd end up owing him a whole warehouse of coolant for a request like that.

122061043.content: Never mind. You'll find out when you visit Aether Gazer.

122061046.content: Ver and I answer almost in unison. We grin at each other as we set off toward the rear hills, close behind Mengzhang.

122061048.content: I'm not playing any tricks this time, honestly.

122061049.content: Once the Astral Engine shield is up again and the new core is in place, the engine's central tower will be the safest place in all of Xu Heng. You can enjoy a cup of tea and maybe even a nap...

122061050.content: Mengzhang, nobody suggested you were playing tricks.

122061051.content: Really? Well, huh... I must be hearing things, then.

122061052.content: I was wondering, too. I mean, we've fought life and death battles together. Why would anyone suspect me, right?

122061053.content: Hey, you were the one who started denying things for no reason! So if you're planning anything, now's the time to 'fess up.

122061054.content: But in the end, we still fail to dig up anything from Mengzhang. He keeps beating around the bush all the way to the hills, where we reach a room that looks much like a photon rail cabin.

122061055.content: Okay, enough chit-chat. Keep your eyes closed, it helps with the vomiting.

122061056.content: And it feels like taking the photon rail too. When we open our eyes it's the same cabin, but the view of the Quad has gone.

122061057.content: I was hoping to take a closer look at it, but according to our brief, the Astral Engine is the Quad's most tightly held secret. I wonder what's on it...

122061058.content: As I realize where I am, I can't help but think of what Ver had said when we arrived in Xu Heng.

122061059.content: We were sitting by the roadside then, eating noodles and planning how we'd enjoy ourselves in Xu Heng once our straightforward mission was over. We had no idea what lay in wait for us...

122061060.content: I never imagined we'd gone through so much. That seems so long ago...

122061062.content: Remember, Ver? You said you wanted to visit the Astral Engine. And here you are.

122061063.content: Hey! Admin, I thought we agreed it wasn't our secret to talk about.

122061064.content: Relax. Since I've already taken you here, it's not a secret anymore.

122061065.content: And everyone wants to see what's up here. Scientists and fortune-seekers. The grateful, the plotters, the curious... It's just that nobody is allowed to know about the Sephirah Core.

122061066.content: So if the Heterocore plan goes smoothly, we'll be able to make the engine tech public... That'll mean more brainpower working on it and developing new methods and applications.

122061067.content: I'm sure the tech department at Aether Gazer will be happy to help.

122061068.content: Hehe. I'll add it to my to-do list when I'm in Ain Soph.

122061069.content: Now let me see... If everything's going well at Luliang's end, she should have comms and energy repeaters fixed soon.

122061070.content: Let's go upstairs. I need to at least get the shield back up before the chief returns. Then if Turing does turn up, we can stop him.

122061071.content: Better stay alert while we're in there. Some of those falling Visbanes could have made it in.

122071001.content: Oh, and I have to give you these and upload your life signals.

122071002.content: While I'm trying to connect Mimir's processor port to the Astral Engine control systems, Mengzhang pulls out two brooch-like objects. He passes them to Ver and me, and then pins a third to his chest.

122071004.content: It's an identification device. Put them on, or when the power comes back up we'll trigger a major alert.

122071005.content: The engine's a restricted area, and this control room is at the heart of it. If any unauthorized personnel are detected, every siren in the Quad will start wailing.

122071006.content: Security's shut down now, to save power for the field generator, the range extender, and the anti-gravity equipment. Otherwise there would already be guards storming the place to throw you out.

122071007.content: Mengzhang shows us how to use the sensors in the devices to register our life signals, then powers up the control panel. He seems to be uploading our information onto a control room whitelist.

122071008.content: Carrying around three of these with you... Hmm. Was it your plan to take us up here in the first place?

122071009.content: I wish I was that forward-thinking... I've been shut up on Yuyi Isle with the Heterocore, and I haven't even seen you for three or four days since then.

122071010.content: Indeed, when you see someone do something brilliant, you'll think it must be a part of their plan. But nobody knows how much time they spent on regular preparatory work.

122071011.content: Anyway, what I'm saying is that I didn't plan this. Or better to say I just like to be ready for anything. That's all.

122071012.content:
And I can't see the future.
Life would be much easier if I could...

122071013.content: It sounds like there's something you regret.

122071014.content: Something? I've got a bunch of 'em. People I've met. Things I've done. Choices I've made... The longer you live, the more the regrets pile up.

122071015.content: Alright, your info's uploaded. Congratulations, you are now Quad's key employees.

122071016.content: The instructions to generate the shield are in place. We just need Linyu to restart the energy transfer protocol, then we hit the button and we're home and dry.

122071017.content: What about swapping the Heterocore for the Sephirah Core? Shouldn't we do that first?

122071018.content: Oh, I didn't tell you... Since we have to wait for Luliang to fix the energy repeaters now, I'll explain properly.

122071019.content: So, you already know the Heterocore was designed to run the Astral Engine. But it couldn't handle the computational load and there was no suitable neutralizer, so the idea got dropped.

122071020.content: In a remarkable coincidence, I found Zhu's Heterocore research materials when we were all at Mount Jingdu. It mentioned something that could possibly balance computational loads of this magnitude.

122071021.content: Now, and I don't know if Odin has told you this... That "something" is the Cinders she and the chief went looking for about two weeks ago.

122071022.content: I remember. Odin didn't tell us much about it.

122071023.content: It's exactly what Zhu needed as a computational neutralizer. So when the chief learned about the Cinders, she instantly realized the possibility of a core replacement... And that's why she sent Lingguang and you two to get the Heterocore.
