122071024.content: Wait, so you've known about this all along? I mean, what the Heterocore and the Cinders could do, things like that.

122071025.content: I did. But I couldn't tell you. And talking about it wouldn't have made any difference, so why bother?

122071026.content: Mengzhang takes out the wooden box again and checks its contents. Once he's sure the Heterocore inside is safe, he puts the box back.

122071027.content: The chief has sealed up the Cinders and most likely has it with her. I've got the Heterocore. But we need both to reboot the engine.

122071028.content: So, we wait for the chief. The Heterocore goes in, the Sephirah Core comes out. And, as I said, the quicker the better. If any part of the process goes wrong, it's a disaster.

122071029.content: I understand. If the Astral Engine is out of action for too long, the Cloudsong Ore goes out of control. If the Sephirah Core is exposed for too long, the Sephirah Zone collapses. Either is a catastrophe.

122071030.content: Exactly. It's the same problem the chief had back in the day, when she removed the Sephirah Core to bring it to the Astral Engine. If she hadn't connected herself to the ley lines for spatial stabilization, Xu Heng would have collapsed.

122071031.content: She stopped the entire zone from collapsing all by herself? Ms. Gengchen is incredible.

122071032.content: That's how she gains trust from her people. Sometimes, I worry we are too reliant on her. Then I watch her at work and all I can do is sigh in admiration.

122071033.content: As we're speaking, an alert tone sounds from the control panel. The lights go out for a moment before coming back on. The machinery surrounding the room seems to have speeded up.

122071034.content: Mengzhang leans over the panel, then pushes several buttons before looking outside.

122071035.content: A light blue boundary ripples outwards and a transparent energy layer forms around the engine. As if relieved of a burden, Mengzhang smiles and slowly stands upright.

122071036.content: Done. The energy is back on and the shield is up. Luliang and Linyu should get medals!

122071037.content: Awesome! So now the Visbanes can't get in? All we need to do is kick back and wait for Ms. Gengchen to get here.

122071038.content: Yeah. I don't want to jinx anything, but the shield has held for decades. Remote sensing, physical attacks... it blocks them all. We can trust it.

122071039.content: Even Turing attacking in person wouldn't be a cause for concern, unless he's more powerful than the chief... But that's impossible. I mean...

122071042.content:
Exactly.
The fact he's skulking somewhere working on new plans means he isn't fully confident in his powers.

122071043.content: That's what Odin said about Gremory. Seems the Cognizants all think the same way.

122071044.content: But it's still kind of strange. He was able to implement his scheme in Yu Jing without anyone noticing. How come he didn't take advantage of the shield being down?

122071045.content: I agree. It is suspicious. And he knows what we're doing better than we know what he's doing. All we can do is be fully prepared and see how it plays out... Ver, what are you looking at?

122071046.content: Oh. Um, Mr. Mengzhang, could you look at this? There's something odd on the screen here.

122071047.content: It says "radius". Radius of what? It's been shrinking, which doesn't seem good.

122071048.content: Mengzhang looks startled. He returns to the control panel and stares at the steadily decreasing indicator.

122071049.content: That's the field's effective radius. The field that stabilizes the Cloudsong Ore's gravitational coefficients... It's going to start bouncing around again.

122071050.content: At the rate it's decreasing, even Old Town, which is directly below us, will be destroyed in... five minutes? No, less than that...

122071051.content: But why? Is the field generator broken? No, it can't be, the diagnostic system would tell us. And if the system isn't complaining... There's only one thing that the system doesn't cover...

122071052.content: No no no. It has to be something else. PLEASE be something else.

122071054.content: Yeah, and I'm not sure what that is. I don't know why the field is shrinking. I don't know how much it's going to shrink. I don't know how long it's going to take.

122071055.content: The worst possible case is that there's a problem with the Sephirah Core. And if that's true, then I don't know what the consequences will be, even if we do get it back to the Hall of the Heart.

122071056.content: Relax. There's nothing wrong with the Sephirah Core.

122071058.content: A fourth voice suddenly echoes around the control room, accompanied by an oppressive feeling that almost leaves me paralyzed. I realize who it is.

122071059.content: The shield is working. No security alerts... But I don't recall you being on the whitelist.

122071063.content: I thought the particle cannon had taken care of you, human.

122071065.content: Human weapons really are scrap metal. As are those Visbanes. I sent hundreds of them, yet here you are. Alive.

122071066.content: (What? He was trying to kill me? We were wrong about their motives...?)

122071067.content: Well, forgive me for living. But who are you, exactly? I've met so many Visbanes who want to kill me today... It's hard to keep track.

122071068.content: Oh please. Aether Gazer is looking for me everywhere. And now I stand in front of you and you don't know who I am?

122071069.content: Or perhaps you believed Oceanus when he told you that Novich was dead already?

122081001.content: I don't believe something is dead unless I've killed it myself.

122081002.content: On the evening I took Odin to the photon rail station to return to Ain Soph, she told me of when she and Gengchen traveled to the Source Layer to find the Source of the Cognizant Visbanes. We were talking about the Cognizants we'd encountered when she told me that.

122081003.content: Looking back, I see maybe that wasn't just Odin's innate sense of caution speaking. Perhaps she had already sensed something then.

122081004.content: Tricking Oceanus is no mean feat.

122081005.content: I still have a score to settle with Oceanus. He played dirty. I'll make him pay for that, sooner or later.

122081006.content: And you too have caused me too much trouble. Now we meet again. I'll deal with you first!

122081008.content: It's okay, sir. I know how to handle—

122081010.content: Turing looks at Novich. The Bane Energy which just appeared in Novich's hand is extinguished quicker than a candle in a storm.

122081011.content:
But sir!
Gremory, surely you want revenge for what these people have done to you?

122081013.content: What? I thought you came looking for us. This gentleman just wants the first fight. Why stand in his way?

122081014.content: You're smart enough to know why I'm here. I'm going to take the Sephirah Core and leave. We can skip the fighting.

122081015.content: Oh, we're going to negotiate our way through this? Above my pay grade, sorry. We'll need to wait for the chief.

122081016.content: I'm demanding, not negotiating. Giving me what I want is the best choice for you.

122081017.content: Nobody is coming to help. All of your friends have their own trouble to deal with at this moment.

122081018.content: You think that little rift of yours will hold the chief?

122081019.content: Let me ask you something. This machine's stabilizing influence over Gaea is on the wane. What do you think is the reason?

122081021.content: Stop your wishful thinking. It's just a shame that maniac managed to interfere with our pincer movement plan for Gengchen.

122081022.content: Maniac? You mean Jianbing? Underestimating him is a dangerous game.

122081023.content: Really? I wonder if it's possible to underestimate... the dead.

122081025.content: A minute, Mengzhang. I will give you a minute to decide.

122081026.content: Think carefully. The Astral Engine cannot hold for long. None of us have much time.

122081028.content: (Whispers) Wait and see how things play out. Maybe Odin...

122081029.content: Odin and Gengchen are in conflict. She has left Yu Jing already.

122081030.content: What... What are you talking about?

122081031.content: I have no reason to make up a story. I just want you to understand the situation.

122081033.content: If you can get in here without anyone noticing, why are you waiting for my permission? If you want it, take it.

122081034.content: Very well. I appreciate that you do not want to betray the Quad.

122081035.content: Turing appears to ignore the sarcasm in Mengzhang's words and simply nods. He glances at the core processing unit up in the roof and then moves toward the control panel.

122081038.content: Physically breaking through the Sephirah Core's protections would be... troublesome. I noticed how you stood between me and the control panel since I came here. That tells me it holds the key to removing those protections.

122081039.content: I respect your principles. But you can do no more than delay me. The system may be complex, but all I need to do is give a few simple commands. It won't be difficult.

122081040.content: You know about the control systems? Is that how you got past the shield? Did you do something to it?

122081041.content: This shield system is extremely well designed. According to Gaea's laws of physics, it is impenetrable.

122081042.content: But those are Gaea's laws. Shackles for the ordinary—not for me.

122081043.content: Distance is relative. Space is not a continuum. Your understanding of reality is constrained by certain frameworks. You obey rules, while I create them. That is the difference between us.

122081044.content: Turing slows to a halt, waiting for Mengzhang to step aside and allow him to reach the control panel.

122081045.content: So now you're threatening me to back down?

122081046.content: If you are so strong, if you can rule over all Gaea... What do you even need the Sephirah Core for?

122081047.content: Strong? Perhaps we have differing understandings of the word. If you travel fast enough, you can control time. If you are powerful enough, you can manipulate space. I am not sure strong is a matter of what can be seen.

122081048.content: I can change the laws of physics, but I cannot achieve much of what I desire. There are things I cannot do. Unknowns I still wish to... know.

122081049.content: I don't want to be powerful, Mengzhang. True greatness has nothing to do with power, but with knowledge. I am in search of the answer to my own question. The Sephirah Core may hold it.

122081050.content: And is this answer that important to you?

122081051.content: It will determine how I exist. What I am to this world. What the world is to me. That answer is something I have to find.

122081052.content: Well, that's unfortunate. Because until the chief returns, the Sephirah Core is something I have to protect.

122081053.content: Mengzhang shrugs and drops a hand to the hilt of his sword. He inclines himself toward Turing, giving Ver and me a subtle shake of the head.

122081055.content: No. I know you can beat him, but we can't risk anything.

122081056.content: Deciding who gets to kill me? Please, I'm right here.

122081057.content: Mengzhang, if we fight... you'll probably die.

122081058.content: For all I know, you could be bluffing. I can't see any reason to give up so soon.

122081059.content: So, show me what you've got.

122082001.content: Just like at the photon rail station, Mengzhang's attacks have no effect on Turing. Turing, meanwhile, keeps pushing Mengzhang back, seemingly with no effort. Ver and I watch and wince.

122082002.content: Mengzhang has nowhere left to go. Turing lifts a hand, and he flies backward to smash into the wall.

122082004.content: I'm okay... Stay where you are.

122082005.content: Hehe. I'm counting this a narrow victory.

122082006.content: Turing, frowning, ignores Mengzhang and walks up to the control panel. He gazes at the complicated interface for a while, and then starts to work.

122082007.content: Less than ten seconds later, he's done. There's a mechanical whirring noise as the core processing unit descends from the dome.

122082008.content: The Sephirah Core is inside. Help yourself, if you want it.

122082009.content: Turing doesn't move. He looks at the container—about a meter on each side, metallic—and the almost-transparent energy wave that surrounds it. Then he looks outside. There is no sign of the engine's shield.

122082010.content: You adjusted the shield? Quick work.

122082011.content: If you can get past the shield to get in here, then I'm sure you can get past it again to reach the Sephirah Core. Right?

122082012.content: Or, you needed to use the control panel, rather than just taking the core, because there are limits to your ability to ignore physical laws, which means you can't take it from here. Such a shame.

122082014.content: Love to. Can't. I don't understand the shield tech. All I did was tap "Confirm" on someone else's code.

122082015.content: Oh, you might find someone to help at the Quad. Lots of people down there. I'm sure one or two know how this thingamabob works. Of course, it'd be their decision whether to tell you.

122082016.content: Ver and I glance at each other, both thinking of how Linyu protected the evacuees at Tian Lu Traders. And the note Mengzhang slipped her before they parted.

122082017.content: You fought me long enough to know this shield won't stand in my way, either.

122082018.content: Maybe. But what it contains is delicate. If you misjudge the power needed and go a little too far... Know what I mean?

122082019.content: If so... you're no use to me anyway.

122082020.content: I watch as Turing lifts a hand to attack Mengzhang, who is still recovering from the earlier blows. Instinctively, I pull the trigger. But with a flick of the hand, Turing creates a whirling wall of wind that deflects my bullet and then howls onwards, coming at me at full speed.

122082023.content: In a flash of lightning and sparks, Ver is in front of me. I know how strong Ver is, and I know she can't withstand that onrushing vortex, which is why it is so hard for me to understand what happens next.

122082024.content: It's like an unstoppable wave breaking on an immovable reef. Two forces of nature collide before my eyes. The next moment, I see Ver still standing in front of me, her back to me, her arms trembling as the storm disperses.

122082027.content: Hey! So you do have some secret ultimate skill?!

122082030.content: It's obvious to all that she isn't. I rush forward to catch her, but as my fingers touch her I feel something, some intense form of energy flowing into my body. My stomach churns. And there's a penetrating pain in my fingers, as if I've been electrocuted.

122082031.content: Thankfully, that pain fades as quickly as it appeared. Ver stops shaking and she looks back at me, a little color returning to those pallid cheeks. The blankness in her eyes disappears as she meets my gaze. She shakes her head.

122082032.content: I'm okay, Admin... It was just... It was like I used all my strength at once. But it worked.

122082034.content: I am. Want to try again?

122082036.content: Ver tightens her grip on her weapon, but Turing shows no interest in continuing the fight. He gives us a final glance, then opens up several windows on the control panel and starts coding.

122082037.content: Are you kidding? You're trying to hack into the main shield system?

122082038.content: Knowledge is born of trials and errors. It helps us find solutions and changes our understanding of the world, and of ourselves...

122082039.content: And when we discover the truth, we have to accept it. No matter how disruptive it might be, Verthandi.

122082040.content: What? Are you talking to me?

122082041.content: I was not expecting to meet someone of my own kind here. That explains why I've been sensing something unusual lately. Now I think about it, it started when you arrived in Xu Heng.

122082042.content: There's no need to hide your powers away. You are like me, and you know what that power is. As for those who cannot accept us... Enemies, every one.

122082043.content: What are you gibbering about? How could I possibly be the same as you? I'm a Mod, you're a Visbane...

122082044.content: You have spent too long at Aether Gazer, I fear. And it would take ever so long for me to explain it all to you now.

122082045.content: It is most unfortunate that we have to talk under these circumstances. But we can make up for that in the future. Once we are finished here, I will have the time to tell you some of what I have learned.

122082046.content: The world is not as you believe it to be. You are not as you believe yourself to be. I hope that once you have all the information, you will understand what it is we have to do.

122082047.content: Turing isn't even looking at us—he's tapping on the control panel's holographic keyboard—but something in the air seems to be holding us in place.

122082048.content: It's a feeling I seem to recognize. There's no sense of pressure or constraint, but I can't move an inch.

122082049.content: Given Turing's ability to manipulate the laws of physics, I can imagine some ways he might achieve this. Perhaps he's tricking my mind into misjudging distances, or something like that. Regardless, it's enough to leave me helpless.

122082051.content: Having noticed that Turing is busy with controlling Ver and I, Mengzhang suddenly leaps up. He throws the scabbard of his sword at Turing and then jumps toward the window, blade in hand.

122082054.content: As Turing turns to Mengzhang and lifts a hand to block his path, Mengzhang spins and laughs. He pulls something—a remote control?—from a pocket.

122082055.content: Turing steps forward. The gravity field around Mengzhang changes and he's slammed to the floor. But still he smiles, and presses a button on the device before his head hits the ground.

122082056.content: Before Ver and I have any idea what's going on, the brooches Mengzhang gave us give off a powerful glow. The scene in front of us suddenly flies backward and becomes an endless stream of data...

122082057.content: Just like on Mount Jingdu, when we were separated by the warp devices.

122082058.content: When the light fades, there are two fewer people in the control room. Novich stares in disbelief. If it wasn't for Turing's earlier warnings, he'd probably be screaming.

122082059.content: Mengzhang remains pinned to the floor, face down, his own brooch digging painfully into his chest. His finger lingers on one of the other buttons on the remote control, but he doesn't push it.

122082060.content: Turing continues trying to break into the shield system, as if nothing has happened. Then, as if sensing Mengzhang's attempts to move, he looks back.

122082062.content: If you could teach me to make a warp device that doesn't need a cooldown period, I'd be very grateful.

122082063.content: And anyway, you've graciously refrained from killing us all. People would think me unfair if I didn't stay and help you. Do you want me to teach you how to control the Astral Engine? I'm a good teacher, I promise...

122082064.content: Sir, do you want me to shut him up?

122082065.content:
Words can't hurt me.
Novich, I have a job for you.

122082068.content: Odin!? That's... Sir, even if I find her I won't live to report back.

122082069.content:
Oh, you always seem to survive somehow.
And hopefully she isn't even in Xu Heng, so you won't find her anyway.

122082072.content: If you would like, sir, I'll bring the girl back.

122082073.content: Yes. And I want her alive. Once this is over I'm going to talk with her.

122091001.content: The street is a bit more battle-scarred than usual, but it's the same old street.

122091002.content: The Visbane forces are now so sparse the street is empty. In the distance we can see that red tide still breaking against the Quad's walls, not noticing our sudden appearance.

122091003.content: This is the road we took to the Quad, right?

122091004.content: We were up on the Astral Engine. Mr. Mengzhang pressed a button on that remote control thing. And then...

122091005.content: You remember how Mengzhang ran off? Just after Gengchen went into the Source Layer rift?

122091006.content: I recall watching Mengzhang sprinting away in the midst of a chaotic battle. An impressive image for anyone to forget.

122091007.content: We retrace his route and end up at a noticeboard in front of a store. I bend down and, behind the board, find an oval device.

122091008.content: Hey, I remember that! It's a warp device. He used it on Mount Jingdu.

122091009.content: That guy... "I just like to be ready for anything," he said. He sure keeps a few cards up his sleeve.

122091010.content: So much for these "identification devices". They must be warp locators. He knew things might get hot at the Astral Engine, so he made sure he could get us out.

122091011.content: But why not get himself out too? He has one of these just like ours.

122091012.content: I guess Turing must have stopped him. Unless he stayed up there because he has other plans...

122091013.content: Turing must have cut off the cameras in the control room, or the Quad would have seen what's happening and sent help. We need to tell them what's going on.

122091014.content: But the comms are still down. And I don't think we can break back into the Quad alone.

122091016.content: The ground underfoot is trembling—not a strong movement, but definite. The sound of broken glass falling from nearby buildings to the ground confirms we aren't imagining things.

122091017.content: We hadn't noticed anything while we were up at the Astral Engine, but now we see it—the shield might be up and running again, but the glow of the Astral Engine field is fading.

122091018.content: Things are looking bad for Yu Jing. Everywhere rocks of various sizes are hovering in the air, drifting slowly about. And when they strike Yu Jing, the floating isle rocks like a boat battered by the waves.

122091019.content: Off in the distance, the CORG particle cannon is up and running again. But our heavy weaponry doesn't have the numbers or the firepower needed to deal with a disaster of this scale.

122091020.content: This is more of a threat than any Quake... Remember what Mengzhang said? The Astral Engine is losing its ability to control the Cloudsong Ore.

122091021.content: The floating rocks are getting closer and closer to Yu Jing. And the worst-case scenario—the loss of control over the Cloudsong Ore below the city itself—is only a matter of time.

122091022.content: We need to deal with the nearby rocks first, don't we? Otherwise Yu Jing will get smashed into ruins, just like Old Town did.

122091023.content: I wonder if Ms. Luliang and the others have noticed what's happening. Admin, do you have a drone?

122091024.content: A drone? Oh yes, the drone!

122091025.content: Communications in Gaea are so advanced you can normally get out of almost any problem with a comms terminal. But, after I went missing in the Omorfies Source Layer a couple of months ago, the Cryptics issued me with an extra miniature drone.

122091026.content: I rummage about in my bag and, with a bit of searching, finally find it—a drone, about the size of the palm of my hand. I'd tried to use it on Mount Jingdu, but the levels of electromagnetic interference were too high. And then, I'd forgotten about it.

122091027.content: Mimir, open an ultra-shortwave link between my terminal and the drone. Start a geometric space survey, maximum range, lowest resolution. Go.

122091029.content: Survey complete. Data has been exported to terminal.

122091030.content: I grab my terminal. The map the drone produced is crude, but what it tells me is shocking—the ground at Old Town's borders has slumped downwards, forming a vast valley.

122091031.content: And between Old Town and Yu Jing a huge shape—a mountain?—is slowly rising into the sky.

122091032.content: That... thing. Is it going to hit Yu Jing?

122091034.content: And it's not a balloon or something, is it?

122091035.content: Where have you ever seen a balloon that size?

122091036.content: What can we do!? We have to stop—

122091037.content: Divine Grace signal detected from target.

122091038.content: The Mimir module starts to vibrate. I almost have forgotten who the "target" is—Mimir has been constantly scanning for Odin's Divine Grace signal.

122091039.content: I switch to the Divine Grace map and again struggle to make sense of what I can see. Odin's Divine Grace signal is like a million little stars scattered across all Xu Heng.

122091040.content: The signal of each point is so feeble that is undetectable without Mimir's help. And there are so many of them. Uncountably so. The map looks like a galaxy.

122091042.content: But why is it spread out like that? What is she doing?

122091043.content: If you can't figure it out, Admin, I sure can't.

122091044.content: I think we should go and find her. If that is Odin, she'll know what to do. About that huge rock below us, about Turing... She'll fix things.

122091045.content: But she must be doing something utterly important. Otherwise, she'd be here already.

122091046.content: Huh? What could be more important than Yu Jing's safety?

122091047.content: She has her priorities. When you choose one option, you always abandon another.

122091048.content: The footsteps are sudden and close behind us. Ver and I spin, weapons drawn and aimed at the new arrival. Gremory's gaze is lowered and her steps slow, but she shows no sign of stopping.

122091051.content: (The bullet flew through her!? What's going on? A clone? An illusion?)

122091052.content: The sight of Gremory's image, fading away even as it moves forward, sends me into a cold sweat. I'm looking about, hoping to spot her, when countless Visbanes appear all around us.

122091053.content:
Admin, fall back!
Where did all these Visbanes come from?

122092001.content: Ver disappears in an onrush of shadows. It only takes a second. Gremory. Ver. A Source Layer rift. And then I'm left staring blankly at an empty street, waving my hand in front of my face in case it's all an illusion.

122092002.content: Ver... She was right there. Wasn't she? Am I seeing things?

122092004.content: On any ordinary day, calling her name brings an instant response. Now, nothing, no matter how loudly I call out. One minute she was fighting alongside me. The next, gone, conjured away by our foe.

122092007.content: Where is she? Did they kidnap her? I need to... I need to find out what happened.

122092008.content: Network connection restored. Connecting to Aether Gazer cloud server for support...

122092009.content: But how... There's no trace of her.

122092010.content: There is nothing to indicate where Ver might be. It's as if I've woken up and started searching for something I saw in a dream.

122092011.content: This demonstration of how much more powerful our enemies are than us leaves me terrified and helpless, then furious, and at last, amused at the ridiculousness of it all.

122092012.content: I take a couple of steps toward the Quad before realizing that the comms are back. I turn and run in the opposite direction, pulling out my terminal as I go.

122092014.content: #{nickname}#? They said Mengzhang took you to the Astral Engine. What's going on up there?

122092015.content: Turing's there. He wants the Sephirah Core.

122092016.content:
Turing! I knew it was him.
Are you okay?

122092017.content: We're not there. And I've lost Ver. Go help Mengzhang, he's alone.

122092018.content: How the... Do you need help?

122092019.content: I don't know... Let me know if you hear from Ver. But dealing with Turing is the priority.

122092021.content: I cut comms before Lingguang has a chance to reply. I know the Quad doesn't have resources to spare at this moment...

122092023.content: This really isn't a good time...

122092024.content: I roam through the maze of interconnected streets, aimless. I try and reach Ver on comms but—as expected—hear nothing back.

122092025.content: I stare down at the communicator clenched tight in my hand. Over and over, I send comms requests. I pay no attention to anything else. Not the enemies lying in wait in the dark. Not the sounds of the battle raging overhead.

122092026.content: Answer... Just answer, please. One word, just one word to tell me where you are.

122092027.content: I'm exhausted. I feel a heat at my chest and automatically lift a hand to rub at it. There's something there—something small and hard.

122092028.content: It's giving off a faint light in the darkness. I take it in my hand and somehow sense an attraction to some far-off place. It's a weak feeling, but it's there.

122092029.content: The jade pendant Gengchen gave me... And it's leading me toward... Port Carp?

122092030.content: Even though I wasted half the jade, in the end I quite like this matching pair. Think of it as a symbol that you are a part of Xu Heng now.

122092031.content: Crystal Cloud Dragons. And Ver has the other one. So, Gengchen must have embedded a Divine Grace connection in the pendants. And I know that when I find the other one, I'll find Ver.

122092032.content:
Will I be able to help her?
I don't know. And it doesn't matter.

122092033.content: If we ever got separated like this in training, we'd regard it as having failed in our mission.

122092034.content: I won't leave you alone out there.

122101002.content: The link Gengchen embedded in the pendant seems to weaken on arrival at Port Carp. I don't know what that means, but I have a feeling that Ver is close.

122101003.content: This is the transportation hub for the entire city. Once a hive of activity, it's now empty and silent after the evacuations.

122101004.content: I can hear faint footsteps from somewhere and try to track them down. The footsteps stop around the next corner. I crouch down instantly, and take a quick glance down the next street.

122101006.content: I think I saw Ver, standing in the middle of the road. But it was only a glimpse, and there was no sign of Gremory. I can't resist taking another look. This time there's no sign of Ver. Was I imagining things?

122101007.content: I'm staring at the spot where, a moment ago, I thought I saw Ver. Then I sense something isn't right. I spin, drawing my gun as I turn, to point it at—Gremory. Where did she come from?

122101010.content: She's safe and sound. Turing just wants to talk to her.

122101011.content: And why should I trust you?

122101012.content: What difference does it make if you don't? Besides, it's what you wanted to hear, isn't it? Why not just accept it as true?

122101013.content: Killing isn't our goal. It's just a means to an end, and sometimes it doesn't help. Turing's only looking for answers. He told me to fetch her, alive.

122101014.content: So why not put the gun down? You're just reminding me that we're enemies and I should kill you.

122101015.content:
I don't even know if this gun can hurt you—but I do know lowering it won't help me.
If Ver is safe, let me see her.

122101016.content: Go ask Turing. He's the one who's interested in her, not me.

122101017.content: Why? What did he mean by saying they're of the same kind?

122101018.content: Did nobody ever realize the truth about Verthandi? Even during all that time she spent at Aether Gazer?

122101019.content: You saw how she fought Turing. You know that's more power than she's meant to have.

122101020.content:
If you're trying to make me doubt Ver, save your breath.
She's an Aether Gazer Mod and my partner. That's all I need to know.

122101021.content: How stubborn. How arrogant. Avoiding the truth will only hurt you both.

122101022.content: The facts will never change, whether you accept them or not. Her nature, what she is, will determine her fate. All we want to do is help her see the truth of that.

122101023.content: Enough about Verthandi. Let's talk about you. You don't break as easily as an ordinary human. What secrets are you hiding?

122101025.content: Do you even believe that yourself? "Ordinary human"? Well, if that's what you want to believe, so be it. I hope you can keep up the pretense.

122101026.content: But such beliefs are fragile. Sometimes a mere word, a simple change somewhere in the world... and it all comes tumbling down.

122101027.content: You've chosen to side with the Mods, and that means all secrets will come to light, sooner or later. You may regret that, when you discover you're not who you think you are. Regret that you didn't learn the truth sooner.

122101028.content: Even if I can't be sure of who I am, I'm going to keep living my own life and making my own choices.

122101029.content: But what about you? What choices have you made? Taking the Sephirah Core will destroy the world, you included. So why work with Turing?

122101030.content: And what's wrong with destroying the world?

122101032.content: Just as I'm startled by Gremory's candor, the ground shakes again. I look off into the distance and see a huge rock smashing through an elevated rail line, leaving a gaping hole in its wake.

122101033.content: The particle cannon manages to destroy the rock moments before it hits the ground. But it's clear that things are getting worse.

122101034.content: See? This is Xu Heng's true appearance.

122101035.content: It's what it looks like now! These are the consequences of your actions. If you hadn't caused so much damage, it wouldn't look like this.

122101036.content: Human, how much do you really understand of this world? What do you know of Gaea's failings? And what is it that will destroy Gaea eventually?

122101037.content: Cloudsong Ore could destroy Xu Heng entirely. The icefields of Jokurr can do that to an entire Sephirah Zone, too. And those minor oddities—a change in the weather here, some odd geology there—are errors that should not exist in Gaea.

122101038.content: We know how to correct our own errors. Gaea does not. Gaea is not alive—it repeats its errors blindly, over and over. The problems accumulate, becoming harder, even impossible, to repair.

122101039.content: And it may already be too late. The powers Gaea uses to protect itself are weakening. More anomalies are allowed to exist. The world teeters on the brink of collapse, and all in it—you, me—continue unaware.

122101040.content: Are you one of those anomalies?

122101041.content: I am, at least, not what I hope to be.

122101042.content: It doesn't matter what kind of error it is. The longer you ignore it, the greater the damage it causes. And if the error cannot be corrected, it is better to start all over as soon as possible.

122101043.content: I don't care what Turing's plans are. But I know a world that cannot be made perfect has no value. So why not destroy it and build a new one?

122101044.content: You really call me arrogant when you're trying to be the star of your own creation myth? When you think you can do something even CORG couldn't achieve?

122101045.content: CORG lives under Gaea's rules. That makes them puppets, unable to resist Gaea. Why should I care what they can and can't do?

122101046.content: And surely you are not so naive as to think they would be honest with an outsider? They don't care how vulnerable humanity is, and they may not be able to save it. Otherwise, they would not have let Gaea come to this point.

122101047.content: And will you be any better? Is there something else you should tell me?

122101048.content: If I was still just a trade agent for Illusory Isle Industry, I might be able to tell you more. But in my current position... I think I've said enough.

122101049.content: If you like, I can take you with me. I'm quite curious about your secrets myself, you see.

122101050.content: And I'm sure I could learn a lot by coming with you... But maybe next time.

122101051.content: Do you think you have a choice?

122101052.content: I don't think I need one. Have you forgotten why I'm here?

122101053.content: Is that so... But if all you want is to find her—

122101054.content: Gremory sighs, shakes her head, and steps forward. And the next second she is in front of me. I have no time to react, no time to pull the trigger.

122101055.content: She places one hand on my chest and looks into my eyes. I see how she pities me. Instinctively I try to get away from her, but I'm unable to move.

122101056.content: Isn't the girl you are looking for right here?

122101057.content: Everything in my field of vision starts to drift steadily away, as if someone gave it a gentle push in zero gravity.

122101059.content: This is... the end of the road.

122101060.content: A wave of cold envelops me, as if I'm being submerged in ice-cold water. I still can't move and I start to lose consciousness...

122101061.content:
Where does this road lead?

Where does it start? Where does it end?

Who will you meet? What will your choices bring?

122101064.content: Up and down. Left and right. In and out. Truth and lies. Past and future.

122101065.content: Known and strange. Cruel and kind. Night and day. Loss and gain.

122101068.content: Just where does this road lead?

122101069.content: My consciousness hangs in space, gazing out into the darkness. A darkness that seems to flow like a river, inundating what little remains of my awareness.

122101070.content: (Have I doomed myself by trying to save her...?)

122101072.content: Something flashes across my field of vision. I reach out to try and catch it before I even know what it is. A spike of pain across my shoulders forces me to tense up and, in the same moment, brings me fully awake.

122101075.content: I come back to reality, after being unconscious for... I don't know how long. My chest aches as I breathe, as if I've taken a heavy blow.

122101076.content: My legs are swinging free. I look down and see an endless black abyss below me. I panic and grab the young girl's arms, then look back up at her. She seems too slender to pull me back up. What if I simply drag her down with me?

122101077.content: But her grip is firm. I look into her eyes and see something, something I struggle to name.

122101078.content: It's really you. I thought you were never coming back.

122101079.content: And you haven't changed, have you? Still taking the big risks...

122101081.content: What!? I haven't changed that much, have I?

122101082.content:
Have I met this girl before?
Wait... Maybe...

122101083.content:
What was before like?

What was I like, before?

122101085.content: I shake my head, trying to clear my thoughts. I don't know what "before" she's talking about. She looks at me, confused, but doesn't press the point.

122101086.content: It's okay. Don't be upset. I might've taken you for someone else. My bad.

122101087.content: I'm not upset. I just feel as if I've lost something important, which... okay, it is kind of upsetting.

122101088.content: The ground seems to be shaking. The girl is not alone on the platform. The atmosphere is terribly oppressive. It's hard to imagine I will find any safety here.

122101089.content: I think there's something behind you.

122101092.content: Wait, you've already forgotten? You saw it and...

122101093.content: Oh, never mind. Let me pull you up first, then I'll deal with it. Don't let go!

122101096.content: I hit the ground and gasp for breath. Pull me up? It felt like being swung overhead and slammed to the ground.

122101097.content: But, when I see that bizarre lifeform looming aggressively over the platform, I understand the rush.

122101098.content: What is that... And is that a sword you're holding?

122101099.content: I... It'll take ages to explain it all. Try not to think about it for now.

122101100.content: Relax. I'll protect you no matter what!

122102001.content: Phew... Got rid of them, at last. Fighting here in the Source Layer is completely different...

122102004.content: Yeah. I don't feel anything. Are you hurt?

122102005.content: The girl sheathes her sword and runs over to support me as I gasp for breath. She checks me over thoroughly, in search of injury.

122102007.content: I can't feel any pain anywhere. The girl seems to be giving off a strange energy, something that drives back that feeling of suffocation.

122102008.content: My breathing returns to normal, but soon I'm hit by a wave of fatigue, as if I haven't slept for days. It's as if my body is trying to fill the blanks in my mind with tiredness.

122102010.content: No need for that. You saved me first.

122102012.content: Her words help me dredge up a memory. A set of fragmentary images that gradually line up into a coherent story.

122102013.content: That's how I ended up here. Trying to save her... Yes, that is what happened.

122102014.content: Do you really not remember me?

122102016.content: Can... Can I sleep for a while now?

122102017.content: What? Here? Maybe we should get out first? And then we'll get you a nice—

122102018.content: Hey! Don't fall asleep now! Just hang in there a little longer, okay...

122102019.content: But I can only hold on for so long. My brain is an empty mess I can't make sense of. The girl's voice fades away, becoming part of the background...

122111001.content: It's New Year's Eve, but maintenance work on Init-Duskfall Line 7 continues at full pace.

122111002.content: Maintenance engineers are using probes to map out the line and identify areas that need work. This will ensure trains keep running between the Duskfall Area and Init over the New Year period...

122111003.content: Figures from the Transportation Bureau show inter-city traffic within Ain Soph is expected to be up 14% on a monthly basis, and commercial areas are busier than usual even earlier than last year...

122111004.content:
Ain Soph, Init, Duskfall Area... All seems normal.
I turn off the television and glance at the electronic calendar on the table—December 22nd, 2314.

122111007.content: No memories, no identity, but can clearly remember everything from when saved by Verthandi yesterday, and does not feel anything abnormal.

122111008.content: #{nickname}#, do you realize your description of your symptoms don't make any sense?

122111011.content: I suggest you stay here at Aether Gazer for closer observation. The medical center advises against erasing the memory of someone who's just suffered from a memory loss. Besides, Ver seems to know...

122111012.content: Of course, we cannot keep you here without your consent.

122111014.content: The tests show that you have a high level of intelligence, and there's no problem with the cognition, either. I think it's a good idea for you to stay here and work at Aether Gazer.

122111015.content: Send the profile to me. I'll keep a close eye on this patient. There will need to be a formal interview, though. You have two weeks to prepare.

122111016.content: And if you recall anything over that period, I hope you'll tell us. If you prefer not to, we will respect your decision as well.

122111018.content: The ceiling is unfamiliar. There's a calming scent in the air and the bedding is so soft I want to go back to sleep the minute I wake up.

122111019.content: The window is ajar, the curtain rippling in the fresh breeze that flows in. Looking out, I see clouds scud over a cityscape.

122111020.content: Up in the clouds, I can see a dozen hot air balloons drifting high. I imagine what it would be like to be up there, gazing down on the bustling city.

122111021.content: And that is where my memories start. The newly absorbed information begins to fill my mind, yet somehow familiar. Like a layer of ice on a lake, sealing off the water from the air. Leaving no cracks I can follow.

122111024.content: The young girl's voice interrupts my restless thoughts. I blink, moistening my dry eyes, and drag my attention back to the room.

122111026.content: That's me! Oh, I'm so glad you remember me.

122111028.content: My memory still hasn't come back, though.

122111029.content: Oh... But do you feel better? Does it hurt anywhere?

122111030.content: I'm a bit dizzy. Everything feels so surreal.

122111032.content: I came to see you, of course. The doc told me you were awake and I came right over.

122111033.content: I still haven't thanked you properly for saving me.

122111034.content: If you're still feeling a bit off, you must be hungry. I've got you some fruit. See? Strawberries, watermelon, apples...

122111036.content: Really? Oh, you're actually right! Maybe I just like the color red. Have some, it'll make you feel better.

122111037.content: I reach out a hand to take a box of strawberries. Unexpectedly, a small badge falls from my clasp. I was gripping it so tightly it has left an imprint of its shape in my palm. But I don't know what it is.

122111038.content: It's the shape of a shield, its silver-plated surface reflecting the dawn light. The girl stares at it, a bit surprised.

122111039.content: Is it yours? I don't know where I got it.

122111040.content: Maybe it's a lucky charm you carry around with you. And when you were in danger yesterday you held it like that so it would protect you...

122111042.content: Yes. Look, it's a shield. If you pinned it to your chest, it would be as if it's protecting you.

122111043.content: Oh. So it's mine... Sorry, I have no memory of it.

122111044.content: That's alright... The doctor told me you can't remember anything yet.

122111045.content: But don't let that weigh you down. I'm sure it's all still in there. You'll get your memories back, I know it.

122111046.content: She's trying to cheer me up and I have an urge to match her optimism. Her smile, like a touch of familiar warmth in a strange cold world, does help me relax.

122111047.content: I put the badge away and take the fruit. The vibrant color of them does make me start to feel hungry. I try a strawberry and feel the flavor burst on my tongue.

122111048.content: I'll have one too. They should be good, the guy in the store helped me pick the best ones...

122111050.content: Listen, I, um... What should I call you?

122111051.content: The brightness in her eyes dims for a moment at my question, but she soon recovers her smile.

122111052.content:
My name's Verthandi.
You can call me Ver.

122111054.content: We chat as we eat the fruit. Or Ver does, while I listen—I don't know anything to talk about yet. So I eat while Ver tells me about her everyday life.

122111055.content: And there are a lot of fun places and nice food outside the city too...

122111056.content: In about six months, there'll be a film festival on the west coast. They play movies outside, on seaside plazas, every evening. I haven't been since my parents took me once.

122111059.content: Why not? You've already been discharged, right? We'll go for a stroll. Maybe you'll see someone you know, or recognize something. And that'll help you remember!

122111060.content:
...And that's more or less all you need to know about Aether Gazer.
Let me get you some BBQ sauce!

122111061.content: I gaze at the meat sizzling over the glowing charcoal and think about everything Ver just told me.

122111062.content: Aether Gazer is Ain Soph's largest investment firm, with eight departments and operations in countless industries. Aether Gazer employees can turn up everywhere and anywhere without anybody being surprised to see them.

122111063.content: And all that money and all those resources fund a covert department: Division Nine. That division is tasked with fighting the Visbane threat—Visbanes being the monsters we saw yesterday—and ensuring that ordinary folk remain unaware of the dangers.

122111064.content: And this young lady—currently handing me some BBQ sauce—is part of its combat operations. Only "Mods" such as her can fight Visbanes.

122111065.content: Are you allowed to tell me all this?

122111066.content: Ms. Shu agreed to not wipe your memories for now. So it might be a good chance for you to learn something about this world.

122111067.content: Wait, are you trying to get me used to the idea of joining you against the Visbanes?

122111068.content: A human? No chance. Absolutely not. It's far too dangerous...

122111069.content: Ver shakes her head firmly. Was it such a ridiculous idea? But thinking back to yesterday, I realize that maybe those two Visbanes could have been the weakest ones. There might be countless tougher examples lurking around every corner.

122111070.content: What could an ordinary person do when faced with such a threat? I laugh at myself as I get a piece of meat into my bowl, somehow a little disappointed.

122111072.content: Sure. Though I still have a lot to learn. It takes time for us newcomers to master our powers. Even in training we can hold the more experienced fighters back. We don't often get sent on field missions.

122111073.content: Any more experienced fighter would have dealt with those Visbanes from yesterday in a few moves. I hope it doesn't take me too long to become one of them...

122111074.content: Hehe. It feels good to have a friend to talk with about these things.

122111076.content: If we eat barbecue together, we're friends. That's my rule. And the owner of this place gave me a little gift to say thanks for bringing in new customers.

122111077.content: Ver shows me a small pendant, which she attaches to her bag. It doesn't look like anything special, but she seems pleased with it.

122111078.content: Doing things with my friends, and particularly going for barbecue, always makes me happy.

122111079.content: And food tastes better when it's shared. Come on, fill your belly. It'll cheer you up.

122111080.content: Then... I guess that makes you my first friend.

122111081.content: Oh, I'm so glad you think so!

122111082.content: But talking about friends... Do you remember Kay?

122111083.content: A pen pal. Lunch. That alley I met Ver in... These are blanks, marking the end of my memories from before.

122111084.content: Ver and I go for a walk near a restaurant where I'd been seen on the security cameras, but it doesn't spark any recollections. So we keep strolling through the streets, hoping to happen upon something that jogs a memory.

122111085.content: From a park to a school, to another park and another school. We steer ourselves past libraries, stadiums, apartment buildings, anywhere I might have visited.

122111086.content: Walking around, I get to see how the ordinary people here live. Perhaps I used to be one of them. Perhaps these glances cast into other people's lives represent everything I used to know.

122111087.content: I can't imagine what it's like to be a Modifier and live to fight. But what I see here, in the city? That's easy to understand. This is human life.

122111088.content: We walk until my feet ache, but nothing comes back. Nevertheless, Ver and I agree to call it a day. We decide to take a ride to the seaside to relax and enjoy the scenery.

122111089.content: The vast ocean views seem to ease my gloom. We stroll along a wooden walkway, enjoying the rhythmic breaking of the waves, the gentle breeze, the peacefulness. Sure enough, I start to feel better.

122111090.content: When I'm tired, I like to gaze at some far-off point. The further the better. That always helps me relax.

122111091.content: The beach reminds me of the West Coast Film Festival. I wonder if it's in the same place this year...

122111092.content: By the sea? And outside? What if it's windy or raining?

122111093.content: Our tech can deal with minor problems like that. You'll see!

122111096.content: But I don't even have an identity now. Who knows where I'll be in six months?

122111097.content: Ver seems to see the problem here, too. She leans over the railing, rocking back and forth, looking off into the distance.

122111098.content: If I'm still in Core City then, we'll go together.

122111099.content: She stops moving, and grips the railing a little tighter. A smile slowly breaks out on her face.

122111101.content: It's starting to get dark when we arrive back in the city. There are only seven or eight hot air balloons up in the sky, more noticeable in the dark now.

122111102.content: We've been out for the whole afternoon already. Are you sure you don't have to go back to work?

122111103.content: It's almost New Year, so I've got some time off. Us rookies aren't as busy as the others. We have rather long vacations.

122111104.content: Are you getting bored of walking around like this?

122111105.content: How could I? Everything I see is new to me. New sights, new sounds.

122111106.content: Really? I was worried you'd get bored. You haven't done anything fun today. Just kept me company.

122111107.content: I've had a great time. I assure you. It's been ages since I've gone for a long walk around the city like that.

122111108.content: But it's getting dark and I'll need to leave soon... I've got an idea. Let's go to the mall now!

122111109.content: Twenty minutes later, I'm looking at an attractively designed box Ver has handed me. I pass it back to her.

122111110.content: Ver takes it, freezes for a moment, looks at the box, then at me, and finally tucks it back into my arms as if in a moment of realization.

122111111.content: It's not mine. I bought it for you.

122111112.content: Me? But why? When will I ever need it?

122111113.content: If you've got a terminal, we can keep in touch. And you'll definitely need that someday anyway.

122111114.content: You'll meet lots more people. You'll get busy. You'll need a terminal to keep in touch with all your friends.

122111115.content: I finally feel a definite twinge of sadness as I look at the empty contacts listing. It's as if it should be full, but somehow it isn't now.

122111116.content: I'll meet lots more people, is that so?

122111117.content: I jump as a call notification appears and the terminal starts to vibrate. I automatically accept the call.

122111119.content: Oh, you sound different over the terminal.

122111120.content: I turn around. Ver is looking at me, her eyes the blue of a cloudless summer sky.

122111123.content: You're standing right next to me. Of course I knew it was you.

122111124.content: True... Never mind. And anyway, that's the beauty of it. You talk to some far-away friend, and suddenly they don't seem so far away.

122111125.content: When I was little, a friend told me that friends should tell each other everything, happy or sad. It's better than keeping it all bottled up.

122111126.content: So from now on, you can tell me everything. No matter where you are. I'm right by your side, always.

122111128.content: I save my first contact and we take my first photo. I start to feel my new terminal might come in useful.

122111129.content: There's another place I'd like to show you in this mall. Shall we go? It's not far.

122111130.content: I follow Ver into a plain-looking store. The shelves are full of vinyl records. It feels like a place from another time. A place for nostalgia.

122111131.content: There's nobody else here—just a "gone for food" sign by the cash desk. We ask to see if anyone comes, but in the end we just decide to browse the shelves by ourselves.

122111132.content: Oh, this is a good one! Shall we listen to it together?

122111134.content: Yeah. It looks like it's been gathering dust here for ages.

122111135.content: But a friend of mine who loves books and music says that you should never judge a book from its cover. And they're right, it's a great song.

122111136.content: I'm sure your friend was talking about many things, not just records.

122111137.content: An electronic beat starts up in the headphones. I enjoy the rhythm and the melody, but it's clear that for Ver, this is more than just a song.

122111139.content: She's happily humming the melody, so I leave her to herself.

122111140.content: It's dark outside now, but the store is still bright. I feel more comfortable here, in this cozy little corner of the city, than out on the bustling streets.

122111141.content: Ver notices me watching her and looks back at me, still swaying to the beat of the song.

122111142.content: Are you staring at me? I don't have BBQ sauce on my face, do I?

122111143.content: No, I was just enjoying listening to you sing. And... this all seems quite familiar.

122111144.content: Really? Do you think you've been here before?

122111145.content: No, I don't mean this store.

122111146.content: Then what do you mean? The atmosphere? Is it like deja vu? Or...

122111147.content: I open my mouth but can't think how to describe this strange feeling. Ver looks up at me for a while, curious, before laughing.

122111148.content: It feels weird to me too... I know we've only just met, but you don't feel like a stranger to me.

122111149.content: Having dinner, touring the city, listening to music together... None of it feels awkward.

122111151.content: Oh, it's already quite late. Time flies when you're having fun, I guess.

122111152.content: So, did you have a good time?

122111154.content: With all the walking and sight-seeing, I completely forgot my amnesia.

122111155.content: He-he. And if you forget all the bad things, the good things will gradually come back to you.

122111156.content: Bad things... like those monsters yesterday?

122111157.content: Hmm... Yes. It'd be best for you to forget those completely.

122111158.content: But don't worry. You can leave the Visbanes to us Modifiers.

122111159.content: I recall Ver drawing her sword to fight the monsters. For a moment, I have an urge to insist on something, but I open my mouth and can not find a word for it.

122111160.content: Humans are weak. That's a fact. It would be delusional to ignore that. And who wants to live in a delusion?

122111162.content: Not bad, right? It's not bad, I guess.

122111163.content: The five hot air balloons drift up into the sky, but they never seem to get to where they want to go. They linger at that particular altitude, waiting for the day their fuel runs out, and the moment of falling down.

122111164.content: I should probably start to prepare for the interview when I get back.

122121001.content: So that's how this place works...

122121002.content: I close the staff transfer screen and slump back in my chair, massaging my forehead.

122121003.content: Aether Gazer is a very busy place. I seem to be trapped in a maze of resource allocations and organizational doublespeak. The path I'm on seems clearer now, even as the world outside even spins faster than I expected.

122121004.content: But now and then something pulls me from that path. There are moments where I can't tell if I'm breathing or suffocating.

122121005.content: Sasanami, cross-regional transfer request. Sasanami, cross-regional transfer request. Sasanami, cross-regional transfer request. Can't they at least change the title for a more interesting one!?

122121006.content: Ah! You gave me a fright...

122121007.content: I slam my fist down on the table, inadvertently frightening the girl who has just walked into my office.

122121008.content: Actually, she startled me just as much. My hand reaches for my hip reflexively, but there's nothing there. I don't know why, but I always do that when I get tense.

122121009.content: I look at her face. It's the same as it was four months ago, when we first met. I loosen up a bit, and take a deep breath.

122121011.content: He-he, good guess. I'm off on patrol tomorrow, so they gave me today off. And I thought I might come to see you.

122121012.content: Oh? Then we should celebrate. Rookie Verthandi is off on her first solo mission.

122121013.content: Hey, are you making fun of me? I'm starting to regret buying you your favorite food.

122121014.content: Ver puts a bag down on my desk. I open it up. It smells amazing.

122121015.content: Me? Make fun of you? Never. And I haven't eaten, so you'll forgive me if I dig in.

122121016.content: Ms. Shu's been busy lately, so I bet you've been too. Take your time. I knew you hadn't had a proper meal for days.

122121017.content: Is there some kind of problem? You gave the desk a fright as well.

122121018.content: No big deal. There's a problem with an investment in Neuhansa. Tyr's going to give me a talking to... What are you pouting for?

122121019.content: You know, I've learned to tell when you're hoodwinking me. You always make the same face.

122121021.content: Of course! I'm very observant. And that question of yours just told me you weren't telling the truth.

122121022.content: Ver sits in the chair opposite me, clearly annoyed, and starts playing with my electronic pet. Since I'm on my lunch break, I decide to let her do what she wants.

122121023.content: If you really don't want to tell me, fine. But it feels like we've been talking less lately. We're both so busy.

122121024.content: And listen. Even if I won't understand whatever's bothering you, you can still tell me. You can tell me how you're feeling. We've always been good friends, right?

122121025.content: She's not in my Division, and she's a Mod, but Ver and I have stayed in touch. My first friend here remains my best friend here.

122121026.content: She seems to have an endless stream of good news to share with me. Her enthusiasm and happiness helped me through those toughest days after I woke up.

122121027.content: This happened every day those two weeks I was preparing for my interview, remember that? I'd be sitting here studying and you'd bring snacks and help me do mock interviews.

122121028.content: And whenever I answered a question, you'd smile and I'd smile back at you. So, when I was doing the real thing with Tyr, I grinned the whole way through it.

122121029.content: Haha! I couldn't help smiling because that was just so funny. Those questions were all so stupid and you just sat there and answered them, so seriously, with a mouthful of food.

122121030.content: So, what about it? Why bring that up?

122121031.content: I was just thinking back to how you used to look after me. I feel like I should do something for you, to say thanks for being such a good friend.

122121032.content: And... Has something happened in Sasanami?

122121033.content: Sasanami? What makes you ask that?

122121034.content: I sigh and open the staff transfer screen again, projecting it so Ver can see.

122121035.content: There have been a number of these weird personnel changes. It might not mean anything to someone else, but... well, I can't help thinking.

122121036.content: And the accident at the Spealght Industrial Park in Neuhansa last month, that had something to do with Division Nine. Everyone who was sent there was lost...

122121037.content: Shh! I thought we agreed not to talk about this.

122121038.content: I know I can't change anything. And I wish I could stop thinking about it. But I can't.

122121040.content: Because one day I might see your name on one of these lists.

122121041.content: I place my fists on the desk and push myself up from my chair. I need to face some facts, and I can't do that hiding behind a desk.

122121042.content: We're friends. How am I meant to cope with this? One day something might happen somewhere I've never heard of and then... I never see you again.

122121043.content: But Ver just sits across from me, eyes looking at me earnestly, unapologetically, as if longing to convince me, shattering the shell of impulse, revealing the tepidness and hollowness within between the scattered fragments.
